Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Our fast paced client in Calgary is currently seeking a Master Data Analyst to join their task-oriented team for a contract opportunity. 

 As the Master Data Analyst your day to day responsibilities of this contract role may include, but not be limited to: 

 Working through AFE job buckets 
Maintaining master records 
Ensuring all accurate information is entered 
Maintaining list of approved requesters 
Maintaining and updating process manual 
Assisting with document workflows 
Ad hoc duties as required 

 Put your talents to the test as a Master Data Analyst with our client. The successful Master Data Analyst will possess the following: 

 1+ years of previous experience in a similar role 
Prior JDE experience 
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills 
Strong communication skills 
Ability to pick up quickly 
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment 
Excellent attention to detail 
Available to start immediately

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Get to Know Vault Credit Corporation
Vault is a non-bank private lending company offering a wide array of financial services such as mortgage, leasing and lending products. Vault has a devoted team of experts with years of experience in both financial services and real estate. We are dedicated to delivering products and services that meet the diverse needs of our borrowers, quicker and easier than traditional sources!
We have a fast-paced, fun, progressive, and friendly work environment. The company is currently experiencing growth (which comes with incredible opportunity) that can be attributed to the “work hard, play hard” and “have fun while you work” values of the organization. This is a company with no politics or red tape, you want to get something done, you will have the latitude and opportunity to run with it, giving you the chance to take ownership of your results with no ceiling of what you can accomplish.
Description
We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to help establish our Data & Analytics group. If you are passionate about learning, developing your technical skills and be part of a core transformational team, we want to talk. Your work will inform both strategic and operational decisions across the organization and you will be involved in projects from inception to delivery.
Responsibilities
The successful candidate will be responsible for building reports and dashboards, as well as designing automation processes to solve for efficiency.

Lead requirements gathering for reporting, dashboards, KPI definitions and automation needs with business units across the organization.
Manage the creation and the maintenance of dashboards in Salesforce, PowerBI and other similar tools.
Develop and launch configuration-based solutions on low-code to no-code platforms, such as Excel, SharePoint, PowerApps and more.
Draft documentation for requirements and processes and communicate them to the affected business units.
Assist in data science and predictive modeling initiatives, including data collection and cleansing, as well as modeling and insights derivation.

Qualifications

A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or other related areas is required.
Experience with Salesforce CRM, especially around object structure and reporting.
Experience with reporting tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI and Looker.
Experience with programming tools such as SQL and Python, as well as integrations via API, a plus.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Thank you for your interest in Vault Credit Corp. Please note that due to the volume of applications, only those under consideration will be contacted for an interview. We are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Should you require accommodation, we will partner with you to meet your needs.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $65,000.00-$75,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Title: Clinical Data Analyst - Blood Gas Specialist
Description:
Adecco is currently hiring for a temporary, full-time Clinical Data Analyst - Blood Gas Specialist in Ottawa, ON to work for our client. In this role, you will be responsible for most aspects of data management activities in support of assigned clinical studies and ensures that quality of services meets internal and external customer requirements. If you have a bachelors degree and previous experience in an engineering role and laboratory setting, this job is for you!
 
 Location: Ottawa, ON


Shifts: Monday to Friday | 8AM - 5PM


Job type: Temporary | Full time

 Responsibilities:

 Review, identification and presentation of clinical data outliers, trends, and patterns


Assist the study team with finding probable and assignable cause to unexpected data observations


Provide input on the design of case report forms for the collection of clinical trial data


Assist with the database validation checks based on an understanding of the therapeutic area of interest


Contribute to the creation of training materials in the area of expertiseProven decision-making skills and ability to prioritize


Ability to form and develop professional relationships; display socially and professionally appropriate behavior


Other duties as assigned

 Required Education and Experience:

 Bachelor's Degree in Health, Clinical, or Biological Sciences


3-5 years of experience in a clinical laboratory setting


Excellent Communications skills, both oral and written


Good computing skills (mainly MS office)


Experience in Medical Technology and/or as a Blood Gas Technician is preferred


Must be legally eligible to work in Canada

 Here's why you should apply: 

Hires fast, pays weekly


4% vacation pay paid out on each weekly pay cheque


Medical and dental benefits once qualified


Free training programs


New and quicker onboarding proces

Title: Senior Analyst
Description:
Delta School District acknowledges that we learn and work on the traditional territory of 

 the Tsawwassen and Musqueam First Nations and all of the hun’qumi’num speaking people 

 who have been stewards of this land since time immemorial 

 The Delta School District serves approximately 16,000 students, their 

 families, and the communities of North Delta, Ladner, and Tsawwassen. The 

 District has an excellent record of student success in scholastic achievement, 

 and support of students with special needs, strengths in our athletic programs 

 and exemplary fine arts programs. The District is also recognized for our 

 innovative practices and ability to initiate new programs to support 21st 

 century learning skills for our students. Inquiry mindedness, capacity building 

 and sharing our professional learning with one another is integral to our work. 

 Key to all of this is our talented staff, in particular our team of outstanding 

 educational leaders. Delta is seeking a highly motivated, accomplished individual 

 for the position of Senior Analyst to administer our CIMS/iSeries 

 administrative computer systems, to integrate CIMS with other systems, to 

 provide systems analysis, development, support, District reporting and data 

 analysis. 

 Reporting to the Information Technology Services Manager, the Senior Analyst’s responsibilities include: 

 Administering IBM iSeries daily operations, including updates, backups and software patches. 

 Building and maintaining automated data exchange processes between IBM iSeries and internal and external third party servers. 

 Building and maintaining Sequel 400 reporting and data analysis, client reports, and data extracts. 

 CIMS web server application support and updates. 

 CIMS Core and web based application support. 

 Managing annual start-up and year-end rollover of CIMS data for student, finance, and employee warehouse systems. 

 Developing and maintaining various CIMS system user and process documentation for various applications within the student, finance, purchasing, payroll, human resources and budgeting modules. 

 Training of various staff groups relating to specific CIMS web application modules. 

 Overseeing Ministry of Education student reporting and data submissions. 

 Participating in District working groups and committees as required. 

 Primary contact between the school District and our CIMS vendor. 

 Communicating District software requirements, enhancements and support for all CIMS products to vendor. 


Qualifications:
 University degree or College diploma in the field of Computer Science or Information Systems. 

 Minimum five years’ experience with IBM iSeries server, security, DB2 database administration, system and data backups. 

 Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. 

 Exemplary work ethic, interpersonal and organizational skills. 

 Self-motivated and self-directed. 

 An in depth knowledge of Microsoft Word/Excel. 

 Experience in an educational environment is preferred. 

 Experience and knowledge of CIMS software and Sequel 400 software is preferred. 

 Applications should be forwarded by 4:00 p.m., Friday, July 15, 2022 to: 

 Curtis Bromley, Manager Information Technology Services 


Email: cbromley@deltaschools.ca 

 (Only e-mail applications, in WORD or PDF file format, will be accepted) 

 Covering email must specify position applied for. Please ensure your entire application package is included in one attachment 

 Detailed information about the Delta School District can be obtained from our website at: 

 https://www.deltasd.bc.ca/

Title: Business Analyst - Data Specialist - Insurance Industry - 12 months - Montréal
Description:
Are you interested in the world of data? Do you know all there is to know about data? Are you a business analyst ready for a new challenge? You want to join a successful DATA team? You like to work in an environment with the latest technologies? Read on!
 
 The opportunity to join us as a Business Analyst specialized in data. Your role will be to support the Data Business Architecture Advisor and to support all Insurance, Savings and Retirement business lines in their data-related ambitions, taking into account targets, strategic directions and requirements related to data governance and privacy.
 
 For more information or to apply, please contact me: sebastian.csiki@randstad.ca
 

Advantages


Strategic position
Important challenge
Large company in Quebec City, leader in insurance
Offered in remote + material provided
Business oriented multidisciplinary project team 
Project management in lean/agile mode
Bilingual team (Quebec/Vancouver)

 ***
  Client specific:
  First 21 hours non billable (if INC at their expense and if term - ours)
  35 hours per week
  2 weeks closed for holidays + 2 weeks of mandatory vacation in the summer
  2 professional references to complete
  Credit AND criminal investigation done by client
  Criminal investigation (Mintz) done by us
  Equipment provided - computer, monitor, keyboard, mouse, headset,
  100% remote or face-to-face depending on candidate's interest
 

Responsibilities
 In a data-driven environment and as part of your position, you will:
 
 Fully understand the business need articulated by the partner, contribute to the optimization of business solutions and work closely with the IT teams
  Work closely with the business architecture designer, data analysts and data scientists from various sectors
  Be the accompanying data expert
  Participate in team grooming sessions
  Govern the project data
  Review certain data exploitation processes brought about by new infrastructures and technological tools
  Take part in testing
  Contribute significantly to the VP's digital transformation projects
 

Qualifications
 Required Skills:
 
 Have a developed analytical sense
  Work with a minimum of supervision, while making good use of the leeway given to him/her
  Ability to analyze and synthesize 
  Ability to influence, convince and initiate required changes 
  Listening skills and interpersonal skills
  Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing 
  Client-centered approach focused on action and results 
 
 Profile sought:
 
 Bachelor's degree in administration, OIS, computer science or equivalent
  Minimum of 5 years of experience in information technology, including significant experience as a business analyst and/or in the data world (Bi, analytics, data science) or any other relevant experience
  Knowledge of the insurance and individual savings industry (an asset)
  Advanced English (oral and written) (an asset)
  Strong interpersonal and communication skills
 

Summary
 For more information or to apply, please contact me: sebastian.csiki@randstad.ca

Title: Category Business Analyst, Electronics
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibly embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do 
The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians for the jobs and joys of life in Canada, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers. 
As a key member of our buying team you will be at the hub of our retail organization. You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment for our stores by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. 
Who you are 
We are looking for individuals who are: 
• Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment 
• Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business 
• Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business 
• Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward 
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be. 
What you bring 
• You have an undergraduate and/or post graduate degree in Business, Commerce, Retail Management or Data & Analytics with experience in retail in an analytical role, is an asset. New graduates are welcome to apply! 
• Demonstrated ability to collaborate, influence, and negotiate with colleagues or more senior business members 
• Strong presentation skills with demonstrated ability to adjust style and format as required to suit the audience 
Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. 
About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. To learn more follow us on LinkedIn. 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Merchandising 
 

  Ontario-Toronto 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Our client in the Insurance Industry is looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst with a strong background on Data Analysis/Migration/Integration/Mapping (Hybrid). 

 Responsibilities 


Lead, influence and engage with business representatives to scope, define and document insurance product reporting requirements
Participate in end-to-end requirements, design, implementation, testing and production data request initiatives in integration projects and reporting tool enhancements
Maintain and create new queries, SQL scripts and thorough understanding of current application DB structures and limitations.
Contributes and reviews technical specifications ensuring requirements are accurately translated for new data solutions or changes to existing solutions. Hands-on data mapping and defining transformational logic is required.
Hold vendors accountable for solution designs, analyzing design alignment and integration to existing workflows and systems
Work with IT, Infrastructure Team, External Technical Teams/Developers, and business colleagues to address queries on requirements, bugs, and resolutions. Investigate and present gap analysis findings to audiences of various backgrounds (both technical, non-technical and managerial)
Be a reliable point of contact for change management processes and initiatives assigned, and highlight escalate risks to appropriate team(s) (Senior BAU members, IT infrastructure, Product/Project Manager, Vendor, Steering Committee)
Breakdown business requirements to manageable pieces that can be delivered in increments, through various artefacts such as BRD, FRD, and User stories for Agile framework projects, reporting to Product/Project Manager(s) as appropriate.
Support and Guide users through UAT preparation, execution, and coordination for new enhancements where appropriate.
Provide Production user support, training, documentation, and troubleshooting, explaining highly technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders in a concise manner.
Provide secondary support to BAU team members on other initiatives that may require knowledge of application data – e.g. data migration, testing and deployment of system solutions.
 Technical skills/Knowledge/Experience 


8 years + experience in data analytics and reporting, SDLC/System implementation, and vendor relationship management
Advanced knowledge of SQL and database concepts . Must be able to write and modify complex SQL queries and scripts in SSMS.
Competent IT skills with a good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications.
Previous working experience in an Insurance sector.
Strong analytical skills with a structured approach to problem solving;
Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with various levels of management, staff and external clients.
Ability to document complex concepts in a clear and concise manner; strong technical understanding.

Title: Sr. Business Analyst - G20 Operations Control
Description:
Equivalent Experience 

 Our client is looking for a Business Analyst to support their G20 Regulatory Project! 
Candidate Value Proposition 
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to develop a well-balanced profile between business, technology, and regulatory knowledge. 
Typical Day in Role 


Soliciting and writing business requirements in response to the regulation
Executing and creating test cases
Defining business solutions for the requirements
Building controls around the solution (process, database solution)
Reading rules and defining business requirements, writing test cases
Interact with the following stakeholders: Technology group, compliance, legal and other business stakeholders (confirmations, settlements)
Working with groups (Operations, Technology and Compliance groups) to find solutions and solve complex challenges
Working with DTCC Spec and Data Mapping on a day-to-day basis

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:
 1. 5+ years of experience in G20 trade reporting to SDR such as DTCC 
2. Solid knowledge of DTCC trade reporting specs 
3. Excellent knowledge of cross jurisdictional G20 trade reporting rules – (ie. CFTC, OSC, SCC, ASAC, MAS) 
4. 7+ years of capital markets BA experience 
5. Well balanced understanding of regulations in business and technology 
6. CFTC trade experience or reconciliation experience 


Nice-To-Have Skills:
 1. Solid understanding of IR derivatives and trade life cycle 
2. Prior hands-on experience working with DTCC 


Soft Skills:


Excellent communication skills
Stakeholder management skills
Problem solving skills
Time management skills
Self starter
Ability to navigate complex challenges with little information

Title: Customer Support Analyst, Custom Delivery Operations
Description:
Position Purpose:
 Provides expertise and systems support in producing custom client deliverables. Ensures a high level of quality through quality assurance checks on a range of custom client deliveries.

 Principal Accountabilities:
 Under general direction, performs production and quality assurance tasks on an assigned workload of custom client deliveries. Highlights data and/or functionality issues, performs preliminary root cause analysis and initiates issue investigation process when required. Solves complex problems using analysis and troubleshooting skills to determine root cause where appropriate.
 When necessary, prepares documentation and provides training to an offshore team. Works closely with the offshore team to ensure that delivery commitments are met and that appropriate quality issues are identified through predetermined quality assurance checks. Reviews the work of the offshore team assigned to their deliveries, makes final provisioning decisions and recommends process changes when necessary.

 Minimum Education, Experience, & Specialized Knowledge Required:
 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Commerce or Information Systems or equivalent experience of 2-3 years in production and data analysis.

 Additional Requirements:
 Ability to communicate effectively with various levels in the organization (written and oral). Demonstrated problem solving, analytical and strong customer service skills. Proven troubleshooting skills and data mining skills. Demonstrated ability in Access, Excel, VBA, Oracle, SQL Server, PL/SQL, UNIX and Windows. The incumbent must be flexible, detail oriented, an independent worker, able to work under pressure in a multitasking environment, a team player, deadline-driven, committed to client quality and proficient at working cross-functionally to develop solutions and resolve issues.
 Experience in the pharma industry and/or knowledge of IQVIA datasets (TSA, CS, CDH, GPM, and Xponent), as well as BI tools (i.e. MicroStrategy, Qlik Sense, and Tableau) are an asset.

 IQVIA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of any applicable prohibited ground of discrimination, including but not limited to race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Accommodations for applicants with disabilities are available at all stages of the recruitment process upon request. If you have a physical impairment or a disability that requires an accommodation, we encourage you to disclose this during the recruiting process so that IQVIA can appropriately accommodate you.

 Objet du poste :
 Fournit une expertise et un soutien systémique dans la production de livrables personnalisés pour les clients. Assure un haut niveau de qualité grâce à des contrôles d’assurance qualité sur une gamme de livraisons personnalisées des clients.

 Principales responsabilités :
 Sous la direction générale, effectue des tâches de production et d’assurance de la qualité sur une charge de travail assignée de livraisons client personnalisées. Met en évidence les problèmes de données et/ou de fonctionnalité, effectue une analyse préliminaire des causes profondes et lance un processus d’enquête sur les problèmes au besoin. Résout des problèmes complexes en utilisant des compétences d’analyse et de dépannage pour déterminer la cause première, le cas échéant.
 Au besoin, préparer la documentation et fournir de la formation à l’équipe extracôtière. Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe extracôtière pour s’assurer que les engagements en matière d’exécution sont respectés et que les problèmes de qualité appropriés sont cernés au moyen de vérifications prédéterminées de l’assurance de la qualité. Examine le travail de l’équipe offshore affectée à ses livraisons, prend les décisions finales d’approvisionnement et recommande des changements de processus si nécessaire.

 Études minimales, expérience et connaissances spécialisées requises :
 Baccalauréat ou équivalent en commerce ou systèmes d’information ou expérience équivalente de 2-3 ans dans la production et l’analyse de données.

 Exigences supplémentaires :
 Capacité de communiquer efficacement avec les différents niveaux de l’organisation (écrit et oral). Démonstration de compétences démontrées en résolution de problèmes, en analyse et en service à la clientèle. Compétences éprouvées en matière de dépannage et d’exploration de données. Capacité démontrée dans Access, Excel, VBA, Oracle, SQL Server, PL / SQL, UNIX et Windows. Le titulaire doit être flexible, soucieux du détail, un travailleur indépendant, capable de travailler sous pression dans un environnement multitâche, un joueur d’équipe, axé sur les délais, engagé envers la qualité du client et compétent dans le travail interfonctionnel pour développer des solutions et résoudre les problèmes.
 Une expérience dans le secteur pharmaceutique et/ou une connaissance des ensembles de données IQVIA (TSA, CS, CDH, GPM et Xponent), ainsi que des outils de BI (c’est-à-dire MicroStrategy, Qlik Sense et Tableau) sont un atout.

 IQVIA est fière d'être un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances et nous nous engageons à créer un environnement diversifié et inclusif. Nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination fondée sur la base de tout motif de discrimination interdit applicable, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, la race, la religion, la couleur, l'origine nationale, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'âge, l'état civil ou le handicap. Des accommodements pour les candidats avec un handicap sont disponibles à toutes les étapes du processus de recrutement, sur demande. Si vous souffrez d'une déficience ou d’un handicap physique nécessitant un accommodement, nous vous encourageons à le divulguer lors du processus de recrutement afin qu'IQVIA puisse vous accommoder de manière appropriée.

 IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: SAP Business Systems Analyst for SAP S4 HANA Sales Distribution
Description:
Job Title:  SAP Business Systems Analyst for SAP S4 HANA Sales Distribution
Division:  Bailey Metal Products Limited – Concord
Department:  Information Systems
Reports to:  Director Information Systems
Revision Date: January 1st, 2022
Job Purpose Summary
The SAP Business Analyst is responsible for evaluating, designing, and implementing SAP (Systems Applications and Products) software programs for Bailey Metal Products to help manage such areas as sales, distribution, inventory, production, and marketing within a single program. The specific focus for this role will be on the SAP S4 SD (Sales & Distribution) and MM (Materials Management) modules and functionality. The first key function will be to lead and work, as a member of the project team, to upgrade the current SAP ECC system to S4 HANA. The primary responsibility of this role is to implement and develop core business processes in Order Fulfillment, Logistics with integration to Finance, and Materials Management. Provide analysis of enterprise resources planning, customer relationship, financial, and supply chain management practices and strategies to determine how to apply SAP software programs. The incumbent can make changes to or customize existing programs or add new programs to existing platforms. The SAP Business Analyst can also train associates in the use of the SAP software. The success of this role relies on a good mix of technical, business, and interpersonal skills and the ability to differentiate between business processes and the technologies that enable them.
Responsibilities and Accountabilities
The responsibilities and accountabilities of the position will be to lead as a technical and functional expert in analyzing, designing, and developing solutions for SAP enhancements and continuous process improvement, but not limited to:

Provide leadership and work with the project team to ensure the successful upgrade of the current SAP ECC system to S4 HANA.
Perform process impact analysis as well as related SAP functional/technical activities (blueprint, design, prototype, test, cut over and deploy) for continuous improvement enhancement requests, with a specific focus on SAP SD and MM.
Provide business systems support for SAP SD, SAP MM and other SAP modules and applications external to SAP, i.e., SharePoint etc., along with working knowledge to assist the Network Systems Analyst with Desktop configuration and support, when applicable.
Working with users to define user requirements, functional requirements, and technical specifications, as well, as provide user training when needed.
Lead Fit-Gap analysis and documenting AS-IS and TO-BE processes.
Reviewing and analyzing solution enhancement requests to determine complexity.
Developing user and technical specifications to support development of approved solutions.
Authoring and execution of test scripts, required to maintain a validated system state.
First point of contact for any SAP User related issues.
Recommend strategies that are both compliant and efficient in accordance with company compliance guidelines.
Hands on responsibility in developing and demonstrating SAP capabilities by preparing and delivering demos, authoring training materials and delivering training.
Must be client focused working in a team-oriented environment, as well as possess ability to work autonomously reporting priorities and progress to management.
Work on various interrelated projects consisting of end-to-end system architecture.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related study — or equivalent working experience.
Minimum of 5 - 7 years of experience in IS.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP ECC 6.0 and at least 1 year of experience with S4 HANA.
Minimum of 3 years of strong configuration and modifications experience in SAP SD and SAP MM.
In-depth experience in designing and implementing information solutions.
Ensures alignment of data architecture with data governance policies, guidelines, and standards.
Strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help support the requirements, design, documentation processes align to specification.
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to create marketing and messaging materials that meet stakeholder preferences.
Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.
Desire strong motivation to rapidly learn and implement new technologies.
Working knowledge and exposure to computer support and configuration.
Experience with SQL DB or HANA is a plus.
Experience in Microsoft SQL Server.
Experience with Reporting tools (SQL Reporter, Tableau) is a plus
Experience with Winshuttle is a plus.
Experience in Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) tools is an asset.
Experience in SAP FI, WM, TM, APO would be an asset.
Working knowledge of EDI would be an asset.
Familiarity with business process models is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Dental care
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:Masks required to be worn on company premises. High touch surfaces are sanitized regularly. Daily Covid-19 screening questions and temperature checks conducted. Physical distancing and other Covid-19 protocols in place.
Ability to commute/relocate:

Concord, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application question(s):

What is your salary expectation?

Title: Manager Master Data & Business Intelligence
Description:
West Fraser is a leading diversified forest products company listed on the TSX and NYSE. Recognized for the eighth time as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, we are a growing company looking for talented people to be part of our team. We have over 11,000 employees and operations in Canada, Southern United States, United Kingdom and Belgium.
 West Fraser continues to invest in our manufacturing facilities to ensure they are modern and competitive. We have a sustainable forestry practice and continue to innovate our processes and diversify our products, including investing in bioenergy.
 Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path? Our office, located in the heart of Vancouver, has an opening for a:
 Manager, Master Data and Business Intelligence
 The Manager, Master Data and Business Intelligence will manage the resources and develop the strategy for defining, collecting, consolidation, and distribution of data across applications and reporting platforms.
 Responsibilities:

 Formulate and deploy long-term strategic plans for acquiring and enabling efficient and cost-effective business intelligence and data warehousing technologies
 Create and execute plans to realize the data management and governance vision, which contains the following elements: data cleansing, data governance, data analytics, data refresh, acquisition of external data (structured and unstructured) and external data exposure
 Establish policy, procedures, and review the entry of new master data for completeness, accuracy and compliance with internal business processes
 Support the business in developing the long-term improvement plans, ensuring there are clear action plans in place which are being executed and delivered against, supporting in the execution of the plans where necessary, and measuring and tracking delivery
 Develop and adhere to business intelligence and master data budgets and forecasts
 Work with the customer to develop business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for business intelligence spending and initiatives
 Active participation in the IT leadership team, contributing to strategic and tactical shared goals, and contributing to the overall leadership goals of IT
 Manage quality of data on an ongoing basis and providing thought leadership on data governance
 Establish and ensure sustainment of data infrastructure, including interacting with vendors and internal infrastructure and application teams to complete the implementation and maintain a repository and reporting solution
 Facilitate adoption of a business intelligence solution through the organization
 Establish and enforce governance of data to ensure data is robust, complete, accurate and available, including identifying and supporting data stewardship across the business
 Support data analytics strategies (e.g. outcome prediction) by implementing machine learning techniques Supervise business intelligence and master data management staffing, including recruitment, supervision, scheduling, development, evaluation, and disciplinary actions
 Manage department operational day to day activities such as developing business requirements, project planning, development of team resources, allocation of resources, customer service level agreements, and other typical IT managerial issues

 Position Requirements:

 Experience participating in at least one business transformation through data and/or analytics
 Minimum 5 years of Data Management, delivering complex data management engagements including all phases of the project life cycle from scoping and planning, requirements gathering, design, development, testing, and go live
 Experience with standardized BI solutions such as Oracle OBIEE or Microsoft Power BI are required
 Five years of related experience in a managerial capacity, preferably in a data analytics and data warehousing department
 Demonstrated experience in data architecture design and development, database development and management, and cross-functional team experience is an asset
 Excellent interpersonal and communications skills with the ability to deliver powerful presentations and proposals and interact with senior clients
 Experience leading Agile development efforts; planning multiple large projects, managing time, resources, priorities and goal achievement

 West Fraser believes strongly in promoting from within and we are looking for individuals who are interested in a full-time, long-term career. The successful candidate should be interested in future growth opportunities within the company. We offer an excellent compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and an outstanding pension plan.
 If this position sounds like the career for you, submit your cover letter and resume at www.westfraser.com/jobs click "apply now" in green at the top of the page.

Title: Business Analyst Physician Compensation
Description:
Reporting to Director, Medical Affairs, the Business Analyst, Physician Compensation is responsible for:
   

supporting Medical Affairs planning, analysis, and decision support (related to physician contracts and funding, alternate payments, and MOCAP)
coordinating Physician compensation and accountability reporting to the Ministry of Health
leading planning, evaluation and utilization of funding allocations
supporting the provision of relevant information to other areas of Providence Health Care (PHC) to ensure transparency and clear decision making

Skills

Demonstrated ability to identify and link business issues, financial results and strategy to the overall goals and objectives of the department/program
Excellent computer skills in order to access and manipulate data from various systems to produce financial and other analysis and reports including advanced Excel and Tableau skills
Strong analytical ability to meaningfully interpret and present data
Demonstrated project management, analytical and report writing and design skills
Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain positive and cooperative relationships with internal and external stakeholders at all levels
Excellent communication skills both oral and written including the ability to translate technical information to non-technical audiences
Demonstrated ability to adapt and produce high quality results in a constantly changing and developing environment
Demonstrated time management skills and the ability to achieve stated outcomes
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and meet stated timelines
Physical ability to perform the duties of the job

Education Graduation from a university degree in Business Administration or related field plus three (3) to five (5) years’ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. 
   Duties

Provide timely, relevant, reliable and clear information with appropriate supporting data analyses and review of alternatives to inform planning and decision-making by Leader, Medical Affairs, Director, Medical Affairs, VP, Medical Affairs, and Physician Program Directors, as well as PHC Leadership Teams. 



Provide data analysis using key data sources (financial, fee for service revenue, population, clinical, organizational, and administrative) in response to Medical Affairs and senior executive level requests for information and analysis. This work may include revenue analysis, data linkage, descriptive information, statistical analyses, and statistical tests of significance. 



Lead implementation of physician billing and service volume reporting processes for new physician contracts to ensure reporting processes include appropriate and adequate financial controls. This will require working collaboratively with physicians, program managers, Accounts Receivable, Medical Affairs and Ministry of Health to ensure all stakeholders’ needs are met. 



Review program planning documents and plans for allocating resources to new physician contracts and provide appropriate information and feedback. Information and feedback will include providing assistance with revenue analysis and funding options as well as feedback on planning assumptions. 



Develop a strong working relationship with Program Directors, Physician Program Directors, senior executive, business support, and others who require information for planning, managing, and evaluating physician contracts and services. Project support may include planning project deliverables, identifying data sources and appropriate methods to support planning, data analyses, writing summary reports and preparing presentations. 



The Analyst will complete reconciliations, analyses and projects as requested by Director, Medical Affairs.

Title: Payroll Analyst
Description:
Location: 
    Kitchener, ON.
  

    Job Type: 
    Full-Time
  

    Posting Date: 
    06/10/2022
  

    Closing Date: 
    07/29/2022
  


 
Payroll Analyst
 We are currently looking for someone to join our team in the permanent role of Payroll Analyst. This position is based out of our corporate office located in Kitchener Ontario, with remote working options also available. 
Reporting to the Director of Finance, the Payroll Analyst, will be supporting the roll out and implementation of our new payroll system. This person will work closely with the payroll team and the Director of Finance to ensure a successful transition to the new system while using creative measures to troubleshoot and improve efficiencies. 
The ideal candidate will have solid experience implementing systems, has a thirst for knowledge, exceptional excel and report building skills, an enthusiastic go-getter attitude, with a strong focus on attention to detail and finding solutions.
 To apply, please email a copy of your resume to: Recruiter.Lindsay@CarePartners.ca


 WHY JOIN OUR TEAM?
 In addition to a competitive salary and access to group benefits and RRSP programs, your future colleagues want to tell you that you’ll enjoy… 

“working within a knowledgeable and collaborative team” 
“working within a learning environment and having an opportunity to gain skills” 
“work life balance and flexibility” 
“working for a company that provides essential health care and positively impacts the lives of so many Ontarians”



 WHAT THE ROLE ENTAILS:

Supporting the implementation and deployment of the new payroll system (PDS Vista)
Acting as the subject matter expert for PDS Vista and the payroll functions within
Being able to identify and map current and desired future state processes with the payroll team
Acting as the lead payroll implementation specialist to support configuration of the new system
Building and developing training materials for end-users and trainers
Guiding users to use the system to full potential while troubleshooting issues and challenges
Monitoring key indicators in the payroll processes and relaying information
Identifying areas for improvement and work collaboratively with the teams to enhance the system
In collaboration with the team, ensuring oversight on pieces that impact payroll such as government reporting, employee federal and provincial income taxes, employment insurance, workplace safety insurance, unions, benefit and pension payments
Implementing contract changes in payroll system
Assist in troubleshooting application issues, and perform enhanced trouble shooting with internal stakeholders and external partners, as required
Working with stakeholders to, document, test and monitor the system while keeping record of the changes 
Evaluate and recommend changes to applicable CarePartners’ policies and procedures
Performing other duties as assigned

WHAT YOU BRING:

1+ years related work experience in an analyst role with some background in payroll or finance
Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, technology or a related field.
You will be a Master at Excel! You'll be analyzing data.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail.
Comprehension and understanding of payroll legislation (PCP preferred). 
Strong HRIS, payroll or finance systems experience (Sage preferred).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Advanced Excel skills and demonstrated ability to produce high quality reports. 
Proficiency in MS Office software applications.
Comprehension and understanding of payroll legislation (PCP preferred). 
Strong HRIS, payroll or finance systems experience (Sage preferred).
Knowledge of government funded, community home health care industry considered an asset.
Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to build, establish and maintain collaborative relationships with the payroll team, internal and external stakeholders.



 CarePartners promotes and facilitates, as appropriate, the immunization of employees in order to provide a safe working environment for its employees, to deliver safe care to patients and to fulfill its commitment to evidence- based health promotion. In accordance with Public Health and Government directives CarePartners has implemented safety protocols to prevent the spread of infectious diseases such as COVID-19. All employees will be required to wear appropriate Personal Protective Equipment as directed by CarePartners and mandated by public health authorities. All new hires of CarePartners are required at this time to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19, in accordance with our policies and procedures.


 CAREPARTNERS IS IN YOUR COMMUNITY
 In addition to providing home-based personal support, rehabilitation and therapy, nursing and palliative care across Ontario, CarePartners also serves the community through clinics, transitional care units, and provides relief in nursing homes and shared care settings.
 Through our outreach program, we’ve been organizing medical care and clinics in countries with poor access to health care since 2009.
 CarePartners welcomes and encourages applicants from people with disabilities, accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the hiring process.

Title: Bilingual Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Title:
 Senior Data Analyst - Bilingual
 Reports to:
 Director of Strategy and Performance Analytics
 Summary
 Uniban is searching for an experienced and highly accurate Senior Data Analyst, highly motivated about all side of data analytics, adept at collecting, organizing, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets and eager to build data visualizations. Passionate to work in team environments to drive business excellence and supports decision making.


 Specific Responsibilities:

Interpreting data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely, accurate reports and dashboards that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
Gathering business requirements and perform quantitative analysis of complex business situations, such as strategies, performance, and solutions involving sales and customer performance
Work with Product Managers and Stakeholders to prioritize business data needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Enable business users to bring data-driven insights into their business decisions through reports and dashboards
Understand and communicate complex business concerns and solutions in clear and concise manner
Filter and clean data as part of each development initiative
Develop Qliksense semantic models, dashboards, and reports to drive awareness and understanding to provide actionable intelligence.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Build strong relationships with the Operations and Insurance team and other departments supporting their initiatives
Assist in preparations and delivery of any key business analysis
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
Other duties as reasonably assigned



 Qualifications:

Degree Qualifications in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or related field
Must have 5+ years of hands-on experience with Data Modeling, Power BI desktop or other BI tools (Qliksense is a plus)


Good understanding of Data Warehouse concepts
Must have experience building semantic data modeling and publish datasets accordingly
Demonstrated ability to use and develop data visualization and reporting technologies
Extensive experience using SQL Queries to extract data from relational database.
Practical knowledge of data in various forms (Data Warehouse, SSMS, SSRS)
Ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in an agile environment
Self-starter and highly motivated to make proactive changes.
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills including sourcing, structuring, manipulating, automating, and analyzing data of various types
Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively, simplifying complex & technical topics in a manner understandable to both technical & business stakeholders
Advanced software use of Excel, PowerPoint
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and French. Strong presentation skills
Ability to influence multifunctional teams to adopt and implement programs
A team player and motivated self-starter

Title: Revenue Operations Analyst / Analyste des opérations de revenus
Description:
**French to follow / français a suivre**

 About Wavo
 Wavo is a rapidly expanding global consulting and media planning agency with a modern approach to digital marketing. With roots in the music industry, Wavo navigates the continually evolving digital landscape to help artists, entertainers, and brands manage their digital presence, reach new audiences, and connect with fans through unique campaigns.  Wavo’s clients include over one hundred top music destinations and advertisers such as Universal Music Group, Sony, Warner Music Group, Live Nation, CAA, WME, and Apple Music.

 The Role
 We're looking for an Analyst to join our Revenue Operations (RevOps) team responsible for the efficiency, effectiveness, and mutual alignment of go-to-market (GTM) team operations. This role, focused on supporting the efficiency of our Managed Services teams and processes, reports directly to our Director, Revenue Operations. The role will support a variety of ongoing RevOps responsibilities and priority initiatives, including process improvement, workload distribution and analysis, workflow automation, and deal desk.

 You'll get to do the following

Collaborate with the broader RevOps team and stakeholders across sales, marketing, and customer success to develop processes & documentation to support efficient and effective operations of GTM teams, tools, and processes.
Take ownership of our Managed Services processes, identify opportunities for improvements, and manage their implementation.
Support effective workload distribution for media planning and buying teams through automation and improved reporting.
Implement controls and conduct audits to ensure compliance with internal policies and procedures.
Create and maintain documentation on processes, tools, and policies.
Perform ad hoc data analysis to help solve revenue challenges and support strategic decision-making.



 Who you are

Highly analytical and someone who enjoys solving problems
Interested in working with data and making it useful
Passionate about working on systems that are highly reliable, maintainable, and scalable



 Skills and experience

Bachelor degree in Information Systems, Business, Economics, or similar fields with a quantitative focus
1–3 years of professional experience in revenue operations, sales operations, marketing analytics and/or business analytics, preferably in a high-growth SaaS context
Experience using, writing, and optimizing SQL queries in a business environment
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills
Familiarity with Tableau, Google Data Studio, or other BI software
Familiarity with Salesforce is a plus



 Why should you reach out to us? Along with our great work culture and colleagues, you'll be working in one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Canada. You will also have the following:

Competitive salary and benefits
Flexible working hours
Group health and dental insurance plan
An open and dynamic work environment to share your ideas and opinion
Being part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, where you can collaborate with remote teams



 Equal Opportunity Employer
 Wavo hires, compensates, trains, and promotes employees regardless of race, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status. Wavo will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Wavo encourages applicants of all ages, backgrounds and identities; as we firmly believe in fostering a diverse and welcoming workspace.
 If you require an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Wavo at info@wavo.me for further assistance.

 *****

 À propos de Wavo

 Wavo est une société de marketing et de planification publicitaire internationale en pleine expansion avec une approche moderne avec le marketing digital. Enracinée dans l'industrie de la musique, Wavo navigue dans un contexte numérique en constante évolution pour aider les artistes et les maisons de disques à gérer leur présence numérique, à atteindre de nouveaux publics et à se rapprocher de leurs admirateurs grâce à des campagnes publicitaires sur mesure.  Les clients de Wavo comprennent plus d'une centaine de destinations musicales et d'annonceurs de premier plan tels que Universal Music Group, Sony, Warner Music Group, Live Nation, CAA, WME et Apple Music.

 Description du poste
 Nous recherchons un analyste pour rejoindre notre équipe des opérations de revenus (RevOps) responsable de l'efficience, de l'efficacité et de l'alignement mutuel des opérations des équipes de mise en marché (GTM). Ce rôle, axé sur le soutien de l'efficacité de nos équipes et processus GTM, relève directement auprès du Directeur, Opérations de Revenus. Le rôle consiste à soutenir une variété de responsabilités RevOps en cours et d'initiatives prioritaires, y compris l'amélioration des processus, la distribution et l'analyse de la charge de travail, l'automatisation du flux de travail et le bureau des transactions.

 Vous aurez à faire ce qui suit


Collaborer avec l'équipe RevOps au sens large et les parties prenantes dans les domaines des ventes, du marketing et du succès client pour développer des processus et de la documentation afin de soutenir des opérations efficaces et efficientes des équipes, outils et processus GTM.
Prendre en charge nos processus GTM, identifier les opportunités d'amélioration et gérer leur mise en œuvre.
Soutenir la distribution efficace de la charge de travail pour les équipes de planification et d'achat des médias par l'automatisation et l'amélioration des rapports.
Mettre en place des contrôles et mener des audits pour garantir la conformité aux politiques et procédures internes.
Créer et maintenir une documentation sur les processus, les outils et les politiques.
Effectuer des analyses de données ad hoc pour aider à résoudre les problèmes de revenus et soutenir la prise de décision stratégique.



 Votre profil:


Vous êtes très analytique et aimez résoudre des problèmes.
Vous souhaitez travailler avec des données et les rendre utiles.
Vous êtes passionné par le travail sur des systèmes hautement fiables, maintenables et évolutifs.



 Compétences et expérience


Baccalauréat en systèmes d'information, en commerce, en économie ou dans un domaine similaire, avec une orientation quantitative.
1 à 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans les opérations de revenus, les opérations de vente, l'analyse marketing et/ou l'analyse commerciale, de préférence dans un contexte SaaS à forte croissance.
Expérience dans l'utilisation, l'écriture et l'optimisation de requêtes SQL dans un environnement commercial.
Compétences avancées en Excel/Google Sheets
Familiarité avec Tableau, Google Data Studio ou tout autre logiciel de BI.
La connaissance de Salesforce est un atout



 Rémunération + environnement de travail
 Au-delà de notre culture d'entreprise et de nos collègues, vous travaillerez dans l'une des entreprises technologiques à la croissance la plus rapide au Canada. Vous bénéficierez également des avantages suivants :


Un salaire et des avantages sociaux concurrentiels
Heures de travail flexibles
Régime collectif d'assurance maladie et dentaire
Un environnement de travail ouvert et dynamique pour partager vos idées et votre opinion
Faire partie d'un lieu de travail diversifié et inclusif, où vous pourrez collaborer avec des équipes éloignées.



 Wavo promouvoit la diversité et l'inclusion La diversité et l'inclusion est très importante chez Wavo. Nous prônons l'égalité et ne tolérons aucune forme de discriminations, qu'elle soit liée à l'ethnie, la religion, la nationalité, l'identité de genre, l'orientation sexuelle, l'âge, l'état matrimonial, le statut d'ancien combattant ou l'invalidité.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst, Scotia Digital(Vancouver Hub)
Description:
Requisition ID: 131177  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 We are investing heavily in order to become the leader in digital banking space, and we are launching multiple initiatives to do so. You will have a unique chance to help one of the fastest-growing business units become a leader. You will help scale, enable, and drive online & mobile development excellence as our team continues to deliver innovative solutions to Scotia customers.

 In this role, you will:

 Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge
 Be the bridge between multiple parties including: our business, control functions, technology partners and our engineering teams, responsible for delivering exciting products in the Digital Banking Unit
 Help scale, enable, and drive online & mobile development excellence as our team continues to deliver innovative solutions to Scotia customers
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions
 Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?

 3+ years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst in a challenging IT system solution agile or lean environment
 Having an Engineering or Computer Science degree, and pride yourself on analysis, logical thinking and problem-solving skills
 Notice all the little details for every document / requirement / conversation that comes across you, and it drives you crazy that others cannot keep everything consistent
 Do good work, and lots of if; the drive to deliver quality work is just a part of you
 Able to simplify complex situations and navigate ambiguity

 Technical Skills:

 Excellent understanding and experience with microapps and Microservices architecture
 Understanding of JAVA/J2EE, PL/SQL, WebServices- RESTFUL / SOAP (XML & JSON)- OpenAPI and OAuth2.0
 Good Understanding of with JIRA, Confluence, JAMA, SVN Revision Control, Eclipse, TOAD, PL/SQL Developer, MS Office suite, MS Project, Postman, MySQL Workbench
 Familiarity of batch integration patterns, secure file transfer protocols, data security standards.


 What's in it for you?

 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and curiosity and celebrates success!
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create meaningful customer experiences
 You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
 We hire you for your talent — not just a job — so you can grow with us. We’ll equip you for success not only in your role, but also in your career as a whole
 Dress codes don't apply here: being comfortable does
 Our work from home social channel offers weekly virtual yoga, social events, learning opportunities, and contests to share current experiences & promote wellbeing in our new remote environment
 Access to thousands of online and in-person courses so you can hone your current skills, or learn new ones
 A competitive rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs on pension and profit sharing, paid vacation, personal & sick days, medical, vision, and dental benefits that start from day one and much more!
 Free shuttle service to and from Union Station, onsite subsidized cafeteria with a chef, and an onsite fitness center
 Some of our perks & onsite offerings will be offline as we continue to monitor federal and provincial regulations around COVID-19.

 #vancouverhub

 Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Vancouver  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets. Description:
