Title: Sr. Business Analyst - Liquidity Risk
Description:
Equivalent Experience 


Description:
 Our client is looking to bring on a team of Sr. Business Analysts to help with their Enterprise Liquidity Reporting Program (ELR) which is an extremely large program. The goal is to automation their current processes and streamline their data from all their various source systems. The project will run upwards of 18 to 24 months and will have major impacts on 6 other Lines of Business. 
As part of the GRT- Liquidity Risk and Stress Testing team, the incumbent will contribute to the success of the Risk Management/Group Treasury/Regulatory & Compliance groups by working with Business and technology teams to generate in-depth requirements for the Liquidity Risk Platform modernization project. The candidate will need to understand the business objectives required for each development stream and create proper solutions within the overall guidelines of the technology build. The incumbent will also be responsible for directly/indirectly automating existing manual processes in order to help streamline the existing process flow. The incumbent may need to perform production support duties as required. 


Key Job Accountabilities:


Be able to provide first level support for existing capital markets system(s).
Conduct periodic reviews of internal processes and controls to identify opportunities for process improvement and methodology enhancements.
Resolve complex problems to meet business needs, provide recommendations on the designs and methodologies, system solutions.
As part of the team, identify and lead strategic improvements to our systems and processes.
Document processes as part of the technology build

Skills:


Knowledge of LCR/NCCF and other Reports for Regulatory Reporting for multiple Lines of Business would be an asset.
Strong skills in Excel and other Microsoft productivity tools are required.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong team player with excellent communication skills and customer service oriented mindset.
Ability to work independently with minimum supervision.
Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, perform well under pressure, and change priorities as needed.

Technical qualifications:


Knowledge of Oracle and/or SQL Server databases is an asset.
Experience in reading and understanding application software code, such as Python, Java or C would be an asset.
Experience working with Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, Linux, Elastic Search is desirable

Top Skills Details:
 Business Analyst, Liquidity Risk, Liquidity Adequacy Requirement,Treasury,Risk Reporting 


Additional Skills & Qualifications:
 Must Have's 
1. Sr. Business Analyst - 10+ years 
2. Strong Product Knowledge (CFA/FRM) - Lending Specific i.e. Loans, Mortgages, etc 
3. Risk Data knowledge - ideally Liquidity Risk / Treasury 


Experience Level:
 Expert Level 


À propos d'Aston Carter:
 Aston Carter, une division d'Aerotek, est un fournisseur d'envergure mondiale de services de recrutement et de dotation de personnel pour les sociétés à la recherche de professionnels du milieu des affaires hautement spécialisés. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. 
Aston Carter s'engage fermement à offrir un service de premier ordre aux clients et aux professionnels du milieu des affaires dans un vaste éventail de disciplines, notamment la comptabilité, la finance, la gouvernance ainsi que la gestion du risque et de la conformité. Avec plus de 60 bureaux en Europe, Asie et Amérique du Nord, Aston Carter offre une expertise locale, régionale et mondiale pour répondre aux besoins uniques de ses clients. 
Reconnu "best of staffing" par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aston Carter s'engage à livrer un service hors pair a tous nos partenaires d'affaire. 


About Aston Carter:
 Aston Carter is a distinguished global provider of recruitment and staffing services to companies requiring highly specialized business professionals. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aston Carter has an unrivaled commitment to delivering first class service to clients and business professionals across a variety of disciplines, including Accounting and Finance as well as Governance, Risk and Compliance. With more than 60 offices across Europe, Asia Pacific and North America, Aston Carter provides local, regional and global expertise to drive value and meet our customers' unique needs. Aston Carter is a division of Aerotek. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, a global talent solutions provider. 

 The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Title: Analyste d'Affaire / Business Analyst
Description:
Titre du poste : Analyste d'Affaire 

Lieu : Longueil 

Durée du contrat : Contrat de 12 mois renouvelable 

Indicatif régional : 514, 450, 438 

Code postal : J4G 1A1 

Date de début provisoire : ASAP 
Mots-clés; #EmploisAnalysted'Affaire; #Emploisaerospatiale; #NousEmbauchons 

 **Hybrid** 

 Faisant partie de l'équipe de développement des affaires et relevant du directeur associé, expérience client numérique, l'analyste d"affaires omnicanal se concentrera sur : 


Rationalisation et optimisation des points de contact client (commerciaux et numériques) entre différentes équipes pour créer une expérience sans effort,
Définir le juste équilibre entre libre-service et interactions « clé en main » en fonction de la segmentation client,
Refonte des capacités commerciales des processus de support pour optimiser l'approche omnicanal (libre-service et clé en main combinés)
Élaboration du mandat de l'équipe afin qu'elle prenne en compte les cas réactifs et proactifs (vente incitative)
Positionnement de l'approche omnicanal comme un levier clé pour améliorer notre pratique de gestion des données clients.
 - 


À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien :


Organiser des ateliers et des séances de remue-méninges pour identifier les opportunités d'amélioration en s'appuyant sur des équipes multidisciplinaires
Travailler avec les ressources techniques et commerciales pour identifier l'approche ou la solution optimale pour chaque problème
Prioriser le déploiement des solutions en fonction du budget et des ressources disponibles
Interagir avec nos prestataires de services et partenaires, le cas échéant
Documenter les étapes tactiques des projets de transformation ainsi que les besoins en conduite du changement
Mener des exercices de benchmarking internes et externes pour valider les stratégies
Création de synergies entre les équipes en redéfinissant les structures organisationnelles et la présence mondiale.
Sensibiliser et communiquer le déploiement de la solution en interne et en externe pour augmenter l'adoption.
 Au cours du mandat, vous passerez par différentes étapes telles que : 


Mise en évidence de la situation actuelle, de la portée,
Revue et définition des questions et réponses à regarder,
Possibilités de déploiement,
Recommandations (avec avantages et inconvénients), budget et plan de niveau 2 détaillé.
 Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir 
Ce poste convient à un candidat(e) qui souhaite maximiser les opportunités d'apprentissage via le réseautage et une visibilité à grande échelle dans une approche de transformation et de numérisation de nos services d"après-vente. 
Formation académique 


Diplôme universitaire en Administration des Affaires, Gestion de Projet , Génie Industriel ou toute autre formation pertinente.
 Gestion 


5 ans ou plus d'expérience dans la gestion de projets de petite à moyenne taille (plusieurs intervenants dans divers groupes) et compréhension claire des cadres de gestion du changement
Solides compétences en leadership d"influence
 Stratégie 


Aptitude démontrée pour la pensée stratégique et une facilité à transposer ces stratégies en plan d"action concret
Habileté à voir les problématiques de façon globale en prenant en compte les perspectives de chacun
Curiosité au niveau des tendances technologiques et de leur influence sur les processus d"affaires
MS Office, Teams, Mural (or any other Brainstorming software), Visio
 Aptitudes de communication 


Style de communication concis et précis et facilité à influencer les contributeurs internes de tous niveaux hiérarchiques
Familier(ère) avec les compétences et meilleures pratiques d"affaires en support à la clientèle de première ligne.
Gestion et leadership efficaces d'ateliers de groupe moyen à grand
Capacité d'identifier, d'approfondir et de traiter des situations complexes pour élaborer un plan d'action
Capacité à comprendre, synthétiser et verbaliser l'état et les éléments clés pour les rapports exécutifs, y compris la génération de solutions et d'actions correctives
 Autres 


Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais (écrit et parlé) : obligatoire
Expérience dans une entreprise ayant une présente mondiale et des produits/services de haute technologie est un atout significatif.
 *************************************************************** 

Job Title: Business Analyst 

Location: Longueil 

Contract length: 12 month renewable contract 

Area Code: 514, 450, 438 

Postal Code: J4G 1A1 

Tentative Start date: ASAP 
Keywords; #BusinessAnalystjobs; #Nowhiring; #Aerospaceindustryjobs 

 **Hybrid** 


Function Description:
 Part of the Business Development team and reporting to Associate Director, Digital Customer Experience, the Business Analyst Omni-Channel will be focused on: 


Streamlining the customer touch points (commercial and digital) across various teams to create an effortless experience,
Defining the right balance between self-service and white glove interactions based on customer segmentation,
Redesigning back-office business capabilities to support the omni channel approach (self-serve and white glove combined)
Crafting the team's mandate so that it accounts for reactive and proactive (upsell) cases
Positioning the omni-channel approach as a key leverage towards enhancing our Customer Master Data practice

What your day to day will look like:


Organize workshops and brainstorming sessions to identify opportunities for improvement relying on multidisciplinary teams
Work with technical and business resources to identify the optimal approach or solution for each problem
Prioritize the deployment of solutions according to the budget and available resources
Interact with our service providers and partners, as appropriate
Document the tactical steps of transformation projects as well as change management needs
Conduct internal and external benchmarking exercises to validate strategies
Creation of synergies between teams by redefining organizational structures and global presence.
Raise awareness and communicate the deployment of the solution internally and externally to increase adoption.
 During the mandate, you will go through different stages such as: 


Highlighting the current situation, scope,
Review and definition of questions and answers to watch,
Possibilities of deployment,
Recommendations (with pros and cons), budget and detailed level 2 plan.

What you need to succeed:
 This position is suitable for a candidate who wants to maximize learning opportunities through networking and large-scale visibility in a transformation and digitization approach to our after-sales services. 
Academic training 


University degree in Business Administration, Project Management, Industrial Engineering or any other relevant training.
 Management 


5 or more years of experience in managing small to medium-sized projects (multiple stakeholders in various groups) and clear understanding of change management frameworks
Strong influencing leadership skills
 Strategy 


Demonstrated ability for strategic thinking and ease in translating these strategies into a concrete action plan
Ability to see issues holistically by taking into account everyone's perspectives
Curiosity about technological trends and their influence on business processes
MS Office, Teams, Mural (or any other Brainstorming software), Visio
 Communication skills 


Concise and precise communication style and ability to influence internal contributors at all hierarchical levels
Familiar with frontline customer support skills and best business practices.
Effective management and leadership of medium to large group workshops
Ability to identify, dig deeper and deal with complex situations to develop a plan of action
Ability to understand, synthesize and verbalize status and key elements for executive reporting, including generation of solutions and corrective actions
 Others 


Fluency in French and English (written and spoken): mandatory
Experience in a company with a global presence and high technology products/services is a significant asset.
 Belcan is a global supplier of engineering, technical recruiting, and IT services to customers in the aerospace, industrial, and government sectors. Belcan engineers better outcomes through adaptive and integrated services-from jet engines, airframe, and avionics to heavy vehicles, chemical processing, and cybersecurity. Belcan takes a partnering approach to provide customer-driven solutions that are flexible, scalable, and cost-effective. Our unique capabilities have led to continuous growth and success for nearly 60 years. We are a team-driven Equal Opportunity Employer committed to workforce diversity.

Title: Lead Security Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 Lead Security Analyst (Threat Hunting and Detection Engineering)
 ENABLING THE DIGITAL WORLD
 OpenText enables the digital world by simplifying, transforming, and accelerating enterprise information needs, on premises or in the cloud. We embrace all things digital and are committed to being the Best Place to Work for our Employees in over 140 locations around the world.  We obsess over our customers to ensure they are wildly successful in embracing the Digital World. Our customers entrust us with their most important information, we need to be their most trusted partner. What we do, we do well. What we create, we do purposefully to impact the world. If you believe in this and are passionate about enabling the Digital World then let OpenText turn your career vision into reality. 
 The Opportunity:
 The Threat Hunting Analyst is a key member of Open Text’s Cyber Security team and will posses strong operational and analytical experience in Threat Hunting and Detection Engineering. This position is also focused on maturing the Threat Hunting program. The successful candidate will develop threat detection and analysis techniques from Threat Intelligence, threat trends and security tools to drive improvements in security monitoring and alerting capabilities. This hands-on role requires deep technical knowledge of security monitoring, security operations, network and systems analysis, threat modeling and threat detection.

 You are great at:


 Researching and understanding Cybersecurity threats, threat actors, trends in adversary activities, attack vectors and Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTPs).
 Using threat modeling and attack frameworks to develop advanced detection mechanisms for a variety of security tools and technologies to identify, detect and respond to malicious activity.
 Leveraging intelligence derived from Threat Hunting to improve overall Security Operations, tool visibility, threat awareness, and detection and response.
 Driving the implementation and consistent operation of the Threat Hunting program. 
Leading security program improvements and efficiencies across security technologies, processes, and services.
 Optimizing security tools deployment and introducing scalable security services. 
Building and coordinating plans for transition and integration of an acquired company’s security operations, tools, services, and processes.
 Continually building automation and tooling capabilities for the deployment and management of our internal security services.
 Driving continuous improvement of the acquisition security integration playbook.
 Proactively search for Threats to prevent or minimize Cybersecurity attacks.
 Ability to communicate to technical and management levels.
 Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources, providing key analytics.
 Document findings in an easy-to-read format.
 Perform other duties and responsibilities necessary.


 What it takes:

 BS in Computer Science, Cyber Security, Information Assurance, or Information Security preferred.
 7+ years of experience and demonstrated success in technology leadership with emphasis on security and infrastructure and cloud.
 3+ years technical management experience, including experience leading large-scale, demanding, and information security projects.
 Technical skills with IT security components, including firewalls, UTM, ATP, TVM, IAM, security analytics, server operating systems, and other industry-standard techniques and practices.
 Hands-on experience in forensic science, data analysis, intelligence analysis, malware reversing, network and endpoint security, adversary tracking, and other security-related tasks.
 Demonstrated experience generating metrics to measure service and program effectiveness.
 Strong written and presentation skills with the ability to communicate effectively with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
 Must be able to work in a fast paced and changing environment while handling multiple tasks, priorities, and directives. Capable of working under pressure. 
CISSP, GCIH, CISA, CISM, or other industry certifications preferred.
 Experience with MITRE ATT&CK framework preferred.


 Work Location
 
The location for the position is in Canada, Alpharetta, GA, Brook Park, OH, other US locations.

 
OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com).

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Supply Chain Governance Senior Analyst
Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

 McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 12 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.
 
 At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
 

Job Summary

 Reporting to the Senior Director, Supply Chain Management and Governance, the Supply Chain Governance Senior Analyst, is responsible to:
 

 Support the end-to-end supply chain process stream aimed at ensuring flawless execution of service level performance targets.
 Implement a LEAN governance system to drive accountability and alignment of key performance indicators.
 Implement and lead multi-disciplinary planning reviews aimed at promoting effective communication flows to ensure optimal cross- collaboration.
 Orchestrate root cause analysis and problem-solving initiatives to pro-actively manage risk and reduce potential banner related penalties.
 Work in close collaboration with various cross-functional stakeholders to drive efficiency through continuous improvement initiatives and innovation.
 Be an advocate to communicate a clear vision and need for change within the organization that generates excitement, enthusiasm, and commitment to the process.
 Conduct benchmarks and instill best in class supply chain business.
 Consolidating relevant information and synthesizing it for executive level awareness, including, making good sense of data, and performing in depth analysis, socializing challenges with Procurement Operations stakeholders.

 Key focus areas include good service levels, healthy inventory, accurate forecasts, and timing of launches (ex: promotions, new modular/planogram events, etc...) that are all in-line with the company’s financial targets.
 

Section A – Specific Responsibilities

 Governance and Communication (40%)
 

 Prepare and support governance meetings to report on results, banner contractual and internal KPIs, risks and challenges with management team.
 Understands, values, and communicates enterprise interdependencies and leverages this insight to enable informed decision making.
 Works in collaboration with key internal stakeholders including but not limited to; Promotion Planning/Demand Planning/Planogram/Supply Planning/Operations/Sales and Customer Service to drive flawless execution of Supply Chain plans.
 Liaises with the key internal and external (banner) stakeholders to ensure flawless execution of supply chain plans, customer commitments and enhance collaboration on past and forthcoming inventory quantities.
 Prepare presentations to the senior management team.

 Data analytics (40%)
 

 Monitors and masters raw service level performance and engages with key stakeholders with the goal of collaboration and commitment to improvements.
 Based on banner contractual agreement regarding penalties, analyses penalties and provides inputs on areas to further discuss with the banners and the Account Management team.
 Anticipates challenges on service levels and establishes contingency plans to address issues before they impact performance.
 Enhances reporting capabilities, in collaboration with System & Analytics team, to illustrate a clear picture of fill rate performance as part of the governance.

 Process improvements and Strategy Setting (15%)
 

 With the help of analytics and various support teams, identifies risks in the supply chain and develops the appropriate contingency plans to overcome them
 Collaborates closely with the Supply Planning team to propose inventory parameter adjustments and placing and monitoring of Rush orders where required.
 Collaborates closely with the Demand Planning team for forecast development internally and externally (suppliers and customers).
 Considers the long-term impacts of decisions and actions; spots new trends, potential problems, and opportunities early and communicates to governance team.
 Constructively challenges the standard way of doing things and helps identify areas for process improvement; applies creative problem solving and resourcefulness when everyday issues arise.
 In collaboration with internal stakeholders, leads sessions to improve processes leading to higher service levels and healthier inventory.

 Change Management (5%)
 

 Effectively engages stakeholders, minimizing risk to efficient adoption and maximizing benefits through a focus on the organizational, cultural and people aspects of business transformations.
 Applies change management principles and methodologies for stakeholder adoption.
 Generates excitement with the team to create engagement and commitment to improving.

 Other (5%)
 

 Maintains relevant business knowledge of product categories and stays abreast of market and industry trends and conditions.
 Acts as a McKesson ambassador of corporate values.


 Section B – Position Requirements

 Working Experience
 

 7+ years of experience in Supply Chain Management, Sales & Operations planning and customer service, and / or procurement.
 Retail/Wholesale experience an asset.

 Education
 

 Bachelor’s Degree in Supply chain related field, Business Administration, Operations Management, or equivalent.
 MBA or MSc, CPIM or SCMP designations are assets.
 Lean Six Sigma Green Belt is an asset.
 PMP certification is an asset.

 Personal Development and Soft Skills
 

 Demonstrates the ability to solve complex problems and create effective and innovative solutions in order to develop solid strategies
 Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, focused, rigorous, and committed to meeting deadlines
 Strong business acumen.
 Demonstrated leadership.
 High proficiency in French and English (written and spoken).
 Strong communication skills; adapts to the audience, active listening
 Comfortable interacting/presenting to a large group of individuals.
 Good change management skills.

 Technical Skills
 

 Proficiency with ERP systems and Replenishment systems an asset.
 Extensive knowledge of MS Office products (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project and Visio).
 Knowledge of process and project management.

 Other Skills and Capabilities
 

 Attention to detail, whilst maintaining a strong sense of summary and ability to synthesize.
 Ability to identify operational and strategic issues and proactively drive solutions.
 Ability to work as part of multi-functional teams.
 Minimal travel might be required.
 #LI-JT2


 Worker Type
 Regular

Title: Analyst, Program Innovation and Reporting
Description:
LROGOV #LI-TB1
About the Opportunity 
On behalf of our client at a well-established company in Ottawa, we are seeking an Analyst, Program Innovation and Reporting, who will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and reporting on operational performance and related metrics. The Analyst shall perform other duties and responsibilities as required and as further described below.
Duties include but are not limited to:

Assist in the development of performance indicators to measure and report operational performance
Perform detailed analytical and evaluative review of operational data and metrics
Develop reporting and analysis methodologies and tools
Contribute to initiatives associated with the measurement, analysis and reporting of operational data and performance
Support the Service Excellence Program for Screening Contractors by developing program documentation, managing the payment process, recommending improvements to the program and assessing the impact of new performance indicators
Conduct research and maintain awareness of best practices and emerging trends related to performance measurement
Assist in the design and coordination of operational quantitative studies and trials
Analyze and interpret data and information collected during trials and studies and prepare reports and presentations to summarize findings
Participate in the development and dissemination of reports to Senior Management and other stakeholders
Provide statistical support to all branches, identifying trends and possible areas for improvement and areas of excellent performance to facilitate targeting resources to risk
Establish and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, internal and external

About You
The successful candidate will have the following:

Graduation from a recognized college or university with a specialization in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a specialty related to the duties of the position
A minimum of three years of experience with data analysis, performance measurement methods, statistical concepts and reporting techniques
Demonstrated experience with data quality evaluation and/or quality assurance verification
Experience analyzing business issues and providing recommendations to management
Experience writing clear and concise reports and briefing materials with a strong attention to detail
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office suite of applications including advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Superior skills in research, analysis and problem-solving accompanied by an ability to synthesize and interpret complex information
Strong quantitative analysis skills and a good understanding of the principles of statistics
Ability to perform well under pressure, work on multiple projects simultaneously, adapt to change, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to understand clients’ needs
Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to clearly communicate concepts and results to non-technical and business audiences
Ability to prioritize and plan work
Ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment
Excellent English communication skills
Valid Security clearance at a minimum level of Secret Level II

About the Job
Location: Ottawa, Ontario – Remote work not an option
Duration: 1 year

Title: Policy Analyst - Housing (Indigenous/First Nations)
Description:
Policy Analyst 
Are you have experience developing policy within an organization? Do you have a working knowledge of government organizational structures and legislative process? Do you have a firm understanding of Indigenous communities, issues, values, and traditions? If so, then our client wants to hear from you.
This exciting position is responsible for developing public policy, advocating, and building support for Indigenous issues / Housing. Our ideal candidate will have a solid background in policy development and analysis. To be our successful candidate, you must be organized, well-written, detail orientated and have previous experience in qualitative and quantitative research.
If this sounds like you, then this position might be your next dream job!
Responsibilities:
Working as part of a team in a fast paced environment where the main responsibilities are advancing supportive public policy, advocating and building support for urban Indigenous issues. This includes advocating on behalf of and providing support to the Centres.
Qualifications:

Post-secondary education in Public Policy, Political Science, Public Administration or another relevant discipline
2 – 3 years’ experience in policy analysis
Post-secondary education in area of specialization is considered an asset
Knowledge of government organizational structures and legislative processes
Excellent writing skills and ability to document clearly and succinctly for internal and external audiences
Extensive experience in research, both qualitative and quantitative
Ability to grasp political theory to be fair, balanced and unbiased in their recommendations
Exceptional ability to build and foster relationships with external policy stakeholders
Must have strong oral communication/public speaking skills

Supervision:
Responsible to the policies and directions as determined by the Board of Directors and under the direct supervision of the Chief Executive Officer, or designate. Daily supervision is designated to the Policy Director.
Primary Objective:
To advance supportive public policy aimed at addressing any file area related issues and the well-being of the Urban Indigenous communities in Ontario. This includes advocating on behalf of and providing support to the Centres.
KNOWLEDGE
Core Competencies:
Culture - Takes personal responsibility to increase sensitivity, awareness and implementation of foundational teachings and organizational practices in both professional conduct and work-related deliverables.
Accountability - Takes personal ownership and responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work commitments.
Critical Thinking - Applies systematic, logical reasoning when addressing problems or situations in order to arrive at an appropriate solution or outcome.
Building Relationships and Strategic Partnerships - Builds, develops and sustains business relationships / strategic partnerships that are mutually beneficial, reciprocal and grounded in trust and respect. It is recognizing we are all interdependent and working towards the common good of the organization.
Results Orientation - Accomplishes established goals, delivers the outcomes required and achieves the results. It includes the efficient and effective use of all resources (time, financial, people and technology).
Teamwork and Collaboration - Works collaboratively with others and addresses conflict in a win-win productive manner. This includes a mindset of sharing with others whether it is knowledge, recognition, information and skills. Working towards a common purpose for the good of the organization and the communities of people it serves.
Communication - Effectively delivers information in a transparent, honest and clear manner. It includes actively listening, comprehending and responding appropriately when interacting with people. It is about being respectful when expressing opinions and points of view.
Technical Competencies:

Knowledge of government organizational structures and legislative processes
Excellent writing skills and ability to document clearly and succinctly for internal and external audiences
Extensive experience in research, both qualitative and quantitative
Ability to grasp political theory to be fair, balanced and unbiased in their recommendations
Exceptional ability to build and foster relationships with external policy stakeholders
Must have strong oral communication/public speaking skills

Behavioural Competencies:

Strong Analytical Thinking
Creativity/Innovative
Collaborative Team Player
Planning and Organizing

Education/Work Experience:

Post-secondary education in Public Policy, Political Science, Public Administration or another relevant discipline
2 – 3 years’ experience in policy analysis
Post-secondary education in area of specialization is considered an asset

Key Responsibilities:
Policy Research, Analysis and Advocacy (65%):

Gathers, classifies and assesses data; including legislation, laws, policies, trends and government and stakeholder reports within area of specialization;
Compares data analysis with expressed opinions on proposed policies and develops papers identifying potential positions to such proposed policies;
Prepares letters, reports, submissions, briefs, research, position papers as policy responses are required;
Develops policies, frameworks, strategies and resources as they affect the relevant file area;
Promotes recognition of Indigenous culture based initiatives within area of specialization;
Develops alternate methodologies to improve policy frameworks as they affect the Centres and urban Indigenous people;
Prepares reports for submission to funding bodies as per requirements to ensure company is compliant with funding agreements relevant to area of specialization;
Supports the development of proposals in the relevant area of specialization;
Prepares and participates in the delivery of such training and workshops as relevant to area of specialization;
Participates on committees, government tables and working groups as required;

Relationships/Partnerships/Support (30%):

Maintains and develops relationships with government and agency policy advisors and other stakeholders to discuss implications of proposed polices and approaches on priority issues faced by the Centres;
Participates in Integrated Field Visits (IFV) and prepares IFV reports;
Participates in capacity support the Centres by identifying funding opportunities, promoting stakeholder relationships at local level, and collaborating and writing Centre project funding proposals;
Consults with member's of the Centres to examine the effectiveness of existing policies and conducting such studies and reviews as are necessary to identify improvements required;
Provides support to other workgroups on key projects or initiatives as requested;

Other (5%):

Acts as chairperson, technician, facilitator, spokesperson in the meetings convened to discuss relevant policy directions or responses;
Maintains and upgrades professional skills;
Promotes a healthy, safe work environment; and
Performs other duties, related to the position, as assigned by the Chief Executive Officer or designate.

Title: Senior Product Owner - Business Intelligence & Analytics 100% Remote
Description:
Our client is a global organization dedicated to putting information at the service of medicine. The companies and people aim to improve medical care by serving those who need it, those who provide it and those who seek to improve it. Organizations primary purpose is to help clients increase the effectiveness of activities pertaining to scientific communication, medical education and product/service marketing. To this end, we want our information services to contribute to the goals we share with our clients, namely: to accelerate the advancement of medicine and help people enjoy better, longer lives.
Position Summary 
As a Product Owner for the Business Intelligence and Analytics group, this resource will help coordinate and drive engagement with the products that deliver information to end users. This team member will work in close collaboration with business channel groups to establish business needs. These would be then delivered in the form of data integration or analytic products to drive innovation. This role will be the main point of contact for new and existing data analytic services leveraging our database and BI technologies. This team member will help define the product roadmap with the support of executive leadership.
Requirements & scope: 

Owner of data and reporting products at the enterprise level, focused on delivery of product innovation client facing analytics and 3rd party subscription service platforms.


Work with business users, business analysts and project managers to understand the the scope & clear set of requirements for the deliverables

Lead the activities like project kickoff, updates and closures by partnering with PMs

Participates in and provides recommendations for ongoing business planning and departmental prioritization activities.


Build strong relationships with business partners via regular meetings, collaboration and involving them in demos and regular updates


Outline the key metrics to assess the overall growth and engagement users of our analytic and data products.


Suggest and advise the business on improving, updating or adding new metrics to measure the goals & strategy Who you are


Bachelor’s or equivalent degree in IT/Math/Quantitative discipline/ Business management

Experience in stakeholder management and project delivery Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

8+ years of experience as business analyst, data analyst or technical consultant preferably in pharma or medical industry

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

A pioneer in out of the box thinking, supporting innovation by way of technology

Title: Business Analyst (x2)
Description:
BUSINESS ANALYST (ERP TRANSFORMATION PROJECT)
Location:  Remote
Engagement Type:  Contract
Number of Resources required:  2
Rate: Up to $72 per hour / Negotiable
Term:  2 years (July 4, 2022 to July 4, 2024) with 1 year extension
Hours per day:  7.25
Submit to Tri-global:  June 27, 2022 (on or before 10:00 AM MT)
Closing Date:  June 28, 2022 (10:00 AM Mountain Time)
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tri-global Solutions Group Inc. is seeking two (2) Business Analysts to join our team at Alberta Gaming, Liquor and Cannabis (AGLC) to support AGLC’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)Transformation Project.
The successful contractor(s) have an anticipated July 4, 2022 start date for a 2 years (July 4, 2022 to July 4, 2024) with 1 year extension available (total contract term up to 3 years).
NOTES ON LOCATION: The primary work location is remote/online with a requirement to work from the office if required (50 Corriveau Avenue, St. Albert, AB).
Please review the project overview and requirements below. If you meet the requirements and are interested in submitting on this role please reply to this job posting.
If you know other consultants who may be interested in this opportunity kindly share this job posting.
Thank you.
Warm regards,
Jesse Smith
Tri-global Solutions Group Inc.Melton Building - 3rd Floor300, 10310 Jasper Avenue NWEdmonton, AB T5J 2W4Office: 780.421.1944 ext. 106
------------------------------------------------------------------------
PROJECT OVERVIEW
Tri-global Solutions Group is hiring two (2) Business Analysts to join our ERP Transformation team at AGLC.
AGLC’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)Transformation Project is about reimagining the way we facilitate our core finance, supply chain, and human resources functions –providing increased opportunity to streamline, automate and align processes with leading practices through the use of modernized enterprise-class ERP technologies and enabling master data management and customer relationship management enterprise capabilities.
DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES
This role is responsible for identifying, gathering, analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of end-users in a particular area of the business, and for IT projects or initiatives. These include interviewing stakeholders, capturing the “to-be” state, process improvements, and identifying the associated business requirements. These results convey to the Architecture, Change Management and Quality Assurance teams the breadth and nature of the end users’ needs and environment, thereby driving their solution design, change management and testing efforts.

Facilitate requirements gathering and validation workshops.
Develop and document project visions and approach.
Analyze and define business requirements for determining roles relationships and data structures to meet business security privacy and operational requirements.
Analyze and define data and information requirements needed to address business requirements used by data modelers and architects responsible for developing logical and physical data models and/or analyzing and designing class models to meet business requirements.
Work with business clients and technical teams on the design development and implementation of business applications.
Document, analyze, and manage business requirements.
Develop business cases.
Produce deliverables within specified quality standards.
Escalate issues and risks as appropriate.
Prepare and execute tasks in accordance with a defined project plan.
Review and provide input on test strategies plans and test cases to ensure they adequately cover the defined business requirements.
Execute tasks in accordance with control processes, including schedule management, status-reporting issues, risk and change management at the project and or program level.
Attend necessary meetings to review schedule, status, issues, risk, and change management.
Support project team members in the analysis of issues.
Prepare status reports, meeting minutes, change requests, and other documents.
Undertake management detailing tasks and review the timelines associated with the execution of those tasks.
Obtain signoff on the deliverables from the appropriate program project sponsors.

MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS
M1 Experience gathering requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, cases scenarios, business analysis, and business process modeling (5+ years)
M2 Experience working closely with clients and performing at least four of the following activities - interviewing business clients; planning, executing and supporting requirements change management (5+ years)
M3 Experience working on concurrent projects spanning multiple technical environments (5+ years)
M4 Experience with triaging user requirement issues/problems and troubleshooting (5+ years)
M5 Experience in leading Business Analysis practice in IT projects (3+ years)
M6 Experience in planning and conducting User Acceptance Testing (5+ years)
M7 Experience in process map development (5+ years)
DESIRABLE REQUIREMENTS
D1 Plan and create business analysis activities including prioritization and approval process to execute throughout project (i.e. BA Plan, UAT Plan, etc.) (3+ years)
D2 Facilitate requirement gathering sessions to understand business and technology changes, to support change management and business readiness activities, to plan and execute change management activities (5+ years)
D3 Conduct interviews to gather user requirements through workshops, questionnaire, surveys, site visits, use cases and other methods (5+ years)
D4 Provide and develop Business Analysis support material (i.e. business requirements documentation, process mapping, gap analysis, use cases, test scripts) that is consumable to the targeted audience (5+ years)
D5 Organize business analysis activities and manage time effectively in order to consistently adhere to commitments and changing priorities (3+ years)
D6 Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers and project team (3+ years)
D7 Work with stakeholders, business units, and project team to prioritize business requirements (5+ years)
D8 Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards and governance (5+ years)
D9 Provide process models, specifications, diagrams and charts to clarify and validate processes with the business and guide development teams (5+ years)
D10 Evaluate alignment with solution scope to support the delivery value (5+ years)
D11 Define measurable evaluation criteria to assess the success of the change (i.e. User Stories, Use Cases, acceptance criteria) (3+ years)
D12 Experience in defect management in UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and providing support during SIT (System Integration Testing) (3+ years)
D13 Develop and document a traceability matrix to ensure requirements are complete and identify requirement relationships ensuring the solution meets business requirements (5+ years)
D14 Make decisions and recommendations on highly technical or complex issues and without formal guidelines or precedents. Exercise resourcefulness and ingenuity to interpret policy (5+ years)
D15 Participate in establishing methods and tools to support current and future business requirements (3+ years)
D16 Develop and document requirements for design system users, and training documentation (5+ years)
D17 Execute changes based on approved work requests, within a release framework, with approval from appropriate project team members (Project Sponsors) (5+ years)
WHY WORK WITH TRI-GLOBAL?
This role allows you to grow your professional work experience and skills in a dynamic environment. Tri-global is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Salary: Up to $72.00 per hour

Work from home

Monday to Friday

interview clients & plan/execute/support requirements change: 5 years (required)
concurrent projects spanning multiple technical environments: 5 years (required)
triaging user requirement issues/problems & troubleshooting: 5 years (required)
leading Business Analysis practice in IT projects: 3 years (required)

Title: Labour Market Analyst
Company: Health Care Human Resource Sector Council
Description:
STATEMENT OF INTENTION 
We encourage applications from Black, Indigenous, 2SLGBTQ+, and racialized peoples, newcomers to Canada, and people with disabilities. If you are a member of a group that has been historically excluded from opportunities, we encourage you to self-identify in your cover letter or resume and to share your pronouns. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and accommodating those with disabilities at any stage of the hiring process.
OUR MANDATE
The Health Care Human Resource Sector Council is committed to working with the health care and community care sectors to contribute to a quality, sustainable human resource.
OUR MISSION 
The Health Care Human Resource Sector Council promotes excellence in human resource innovation and builds capacity through collaboration with stakeholders.
OUR VISION
A diverse and sustainable health and community services workforce.
OUR CORE VALUES
The Health Care Human Resource Sector Council is proud to not only claim, but to practice, a commitment to: integrity, excellence, diversity, innovation, partnership and cultural competency. We specialize in using evidence-based decision-making so that Integrity is integral to all we do. Excellence is demonstrated in the quality of results we produce.
Whether it is Diversity of interests found in the health and community care sectors, or diversity of employee populations, our research and programs respond to their needs. While Innovation is the driver of our many research initiatives, Partnerships through proactive stakeholder alliances is a key cornerstone of our success. Finally, by maintaining informed responses to the cultural needs of the sector, we sustain a vibrant Cultural Competency.
THIS MOMENT. THIS POSITION
This role reports to the Executive Director and is instrumental to designing and conducting labour market research projects to produce Labour Market Information (LMI) for a Nova Scotia “State of the Labour Force” dashboard. Leading and collaborating with industry sector Analysts from AISC’s 14 member organizations, the Labour Market Analyst/Project Lead (“Analyst”) will collect and update labour market information for the dashboard, prepare visual reports, and develop and implement an evaluation framework for the Council.
The Labour Market Analyst will work in a highly collaborative and energetic environment and will carry out the day-to-day project leadership and research functions with direction from the Executive Director and project consultant. They will be required to perform at a high level of competency and independence. The key responsibilities of this role include but are not limited to: Project management; statistical design, collection and analysis; and the ability to work with a collective of broad stakeholders are of prime importance.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES
Analytics

Translate information requests into project plans and research methodologies.


Contribute to the creation of a concise, digestible dashboard for use by small and medium enterprises (SMEs) and other stakeholders to make labour force decisions, plan business growth and design policy.


Determine, through consensus with other members of a Peer Working Team (PWT) what data is relevant. With the PWT, determine how data is to be collected and analyzed.


Develop a repeatable research methodology.


Design, issue, collect and analyze surveys.


Update sector data on the dashboard as per established reporting deadlines.


Examine the data to assess the health of Nova Scotia’s labour market.


Maintain and monitor project plans, project schedules and project documentation.


Report on Project progress and identify barriers to success to ED.


Work with AISC staff and contracted consultant(s) to move the project toward completion.


Support the Executive Director as assigned on the LMI and other research projects.

Evaluation

Design and implement an evaluation framework to gather credible evidence related to program, policy, and initiative reach, efficiency, and effectiveness of the Health Care Human Resource Sector Council’s programs.


Provide consultation on evaluation plans to the Council Team.


Provide written reports with graphics and visuals to utilization of findings and sharing results to inform operational and program efficiencies.


Provide technical consultation.


Provide written reports and presentations to inform stakeholder (funder) reporting.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE
The ideal candidate will have demonstrated previous experience in project management, statistical research, and economic research projects, including a familiarity with workforce development.
Also:

Experience in data analytics with the ability to analyze and interpret data.


In-depth experience in statistical collection and analysis.


Experience collaborating on a diverse committee of peers.


Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation skills.


Experience with current data-gathering techniques and technology.


Excellent interpersonal skills and knowledge of interviewing techniques are also required.

Education:

Completion of a bachelor’s degree in economics, statistics, business administration or public administration.


Certified economic developer (Ec.D) designation and/or PMP certification considered an asset.

Computer Applications:

MS Office suite: Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, MS Outlook. Project Management software.


Remote collaboration tools such as videoconferencing and document sharing i.e., Dropbox, Google Docs

What are the ideal candidate’s skills?

Excellent organizational and time management skills, including attention to detail, and ability to set priorities, meet deadlines and deal with conflicting priorities and work demands.


Works independently and effectively with minimal supervision, prioritizing work schedule, and completing assigned duties within timelines.


A natural collaborator with a positive “Let’s Get it Done” attitude, using exceptional interpersonal skills to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.


Able to work within an organizational culture that emphasizes continuous learning, collaboration, transparency, accountability and trust while promoting a strong code of ethics, honesty, integrity, work ethic and diligence to support organizational excellence.


Resourceful, flexible, adaptable, and possesses a high degree of initiative.


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with proven ability to handle sensitive issues.


Highly inquisitive with a strong research orientation; solution-driven

EMPLOYMENT DETAILS
Salary: $66,000 per year ($44,000 pro-rated for the length of term)
Term length: 8 month term position
Location: Bedford, NS
Hours: 35 Hours per week
8:30-4:30 Mon-Fri
Hybrid Work Environment
WHAT TO EXPECT

We closely review all applications and read each cover letter (we promise).


If you are selected as a top candidate, expect a phone discovery call with a Lead Placemaker from P4G. This is someone who treats the recruitment process non-traditionally. We want to get to know what inspires you.


Selected candidates will proceed to a virtual interview with the Lead P4G Placemaker and 2-3 organization representatives.


Finalists may participate in a second round interview or skills activity (virtual or in person).


P4G will check employment references and assist in presenting an offer to the successful candidate.

APPLICATION DETAILS
Applications will be accepted until 12pm on Friday, June 24, 2022.
Please be sure to include a cover letter that speaks to your experience, but we also want to get a glimpse of your personality.
Don’t be generic, be yourself.
Job Type: Fixed term contract
Salary: $66,000.00 per year
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Application deadline: 2022-06-24

Title: HRIS Analyst - Workday
Description:
What makes SYNNEX extraordinary? We believe that success is achieved by bringing together unique points of view. Our team is comprised of innovative perspectives from a diverse group of bright minds who are inspired with a vision to imagine and the energy to make it happen. Whether you're just starting out in your career or a seasoned executive, we have a wide range of opportunities for those who have a passion for technology and a desire to bring their full self to work every day where you can grow and make a difference.

Our recruiting process allows you to tell your story in a stress-free way that is interactive and fun, so if you receive a link to Share your Story with us, we hope you have an awesome digital experience.
 

HRIS Analyst - Workday

This role supports the day-to-day administration of the system and contributes to the design and the implementation of new modules and system features. HRIS Admin/Analyst works closely with the entire HR team. This an exciting opportunity to join a fast-paced, growing team and company and to work with a system that is a recognized leader in Cloud HCM.
 
 As of September 2022 in our new hybrid work environment, we will be moving to our new office workspace located at 
 6911 Creditview Road in Mississauga, ON. 


Get Inspired by the Work You'll Do

 A deep understanding and experience with:

Working with internal HR Domain & other sub - workstreams.



Designing creative solutions and evaluating solutions provided by partners.



Reviewing and signing-off Requirements and Test Strategies, Scenarios and Results.



Reviewing, assessing, and reacting to Workday releases.

 A good understanding and experience with:
 


Workday Security, HCM (ideally with completed Workday training/certification), and reviewing solutions for impacts to security and access.



Managing initiatives, and supporting and delivering upon operational goals.

 Key skillsets that include:
 


Delivering timely, accurate, and efficient work, including exercising judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems.



Building effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.

 Additionally, the successful applicant will serve as an advisor and partner between the business/group and Technology teams to define & document technology requirements. This may include:
 


Acting as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.



Assisting in the development, recommendation, support, and implementation of strategic plans.



Helping to determine business priorities and the best sequence for executing business/group strategy.



Breaking down strategic problems, and analyzing data and information to provide insights and recommendations.



Identifying emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.



Supporting the business in production support, system enhancements, product upgrades and development.



Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.


 Your passion is sparked by:


 3+ years of hands-on Workday Experience - Preferably Recruiting and Onboarding experience
 Expertise in Workday modules, including the ability to complete functional configuration;
 Experience supporting a medium-to-large global organization
 Excellent project management skills and solid ability to prioritize
 Broad knowledge of human resource business processes and cross-functional impacts
 Self-motivated, creative, and adaptable with excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with leadership and our partners across the company
 Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and balance multiple initiatives
 Ability to focus on the essential issues and simplify complexity


 We have Great Perks • Flexible Time Away (flex vacation) • Every day is Casual Day • Comprehensive Group Health Insurance plan • Discretionary Profit Sharing • Employee Referral Award program • Employee Purchase Plan/ Company Discounts • Out of Country travel assistance • Health/ Wellness initiatives • Paid Personal Days • Employee Assistance Program • Education Reimbursement • Milestone Service Awards • Community Involvement activities in partnership with Kids Help Phone • Employee of the Quarter awards • Group RRSP with Company Matching • Training Opportunities • Huang Leadership Development Scholarship • Bi-annual President's Club • Annual Founders Award
 

Be Inspired In Your Career.

Title: SAP Business Systems Analyst for SAP S4 HANA Materials Management
Description:
Job Title:  SAP Business Systems Analyst for SAP S4 HANA Materials Management
Division:  Bailey Metal Products Limited – Concord
Department:  Information Systems
Reports to:  Director Information Systems
Revision Date: January 1st, 2022
Job Purpose Summary
The SAP Business Analyst is responsible for evaluating, designing, and implementing SAP (Systems Applications and Products) software programs for Bailey Metal Products to help manage such areas as sales, distribution, inventory, production, and marketing within a single program. The specific focus for this role will be on the SAP S4 MM (Materials Management) and SD (Sales & Distribution) modules and functionality. The first key function will be to lead and work, as a member of the project team, to upgrade the current SAP ECC system to S4 HANA. The primary responsibility of this role is to implement and develop core business processes in Order Fulfillment, Logistics with integration to Finance, and Materials Management. Provide analysis of enterprise resources planning, customer relationship, financial, and supply chain management practices and strategies to determine how to apply SAP software programs. The incumbent can make changes to or customize existing programs or add new programs to existing platforms. The SAP Business Analyst can also train associates in the use of the SAP software. The success of this role relies on a good mix of technical, business, and interpersonal skills and the ability to differentiate between business processes and the technologies that enable them.
Responsibilities and Accountabilities
The responsibilities and accountabilities of the position will be to lead as a technical and functional expert in analyzing, designing, and developing solutions for SAP enhancements and continuous process improvement, but not limited to:

Provide leadership and work with the project team to ensure the successful upgrade of the current SAP ECC system to S4 HANA.
Perform process impact analysis as well as related SAP functional/technical activities (blueprint, design, prototype, test, cut over and deploy) for continuous improvement enhancement requests, with a specific focus on SAP MM and SD.
Provide business systems support for SAP MM, SAP SD and other SAP modules and applications external to SAP, i.e., SharePoint etc., along with working knowledge to assist the Network Systems Analyst with Desktop configuration and support, when applicable.
Working with users to define user requirements, functional requirements, and technical specifications, as well, as provide user training when needed.
Lead Fit-Gap analysis and documenting AS-IS and TO-BE processes.
Reviewing and analyzing solution enhancement requests to determine complexity.
Developing user and technical specifications to support development of approved solutions.
Authoring and execution of test scripts, required to maintain a validated system state.
First point of contact for any SAP User related issues.
Recommend strategies that are both compliant and efficient in accordance with company compliance guidelines.
Hands on responsibility in developing and demonstrating SAP capabilities by preparing and delivering demos, authoring training materials and delivering training.
Must be client focused working in a team-oriented environment, as well as possess ability to work autonomously reporting priorities and progress to management.
Work on various interrelated projects consisting of end-to-end system architecture.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related study — or equivalent working experience.
Minimum of 5 - 7 years of experience in IS.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP ECC 6.0 and at least 1 year of experience with S4 HANA.
Minimum of 3 years of strong configuration and modifications experience in SAP MM and SAP SD.
In-depth experience in designing and implementing information solutions.
Ensures alignment of data architecture with data governance policies, guidelines, and standards.
Strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help support the requirements, design, documentation processes align to specification.
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to create marketing and messaging materials that meet stakeholder preferences.
Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.
Desire strong motivation to rapidly learn and implement new technologies.
Working knowledge and exposure to computer support and configuration.
Experience with SQL DB or HANA is a plus.
Experience in Microsoft SQL Server.
Experience with Reporting tools (SQL Reporter, Tableau) is a plus
Experience with Winshuttle is a plus.
Experience in Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) tools is an asset.
Experience in SAP FI, WM, TM, APO would be an asset.
Working knowledge of EDI would be an asset.
Familiarity with business process models is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Dental care
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:Masks required to be worn on company premises. High touch surfaces are sanitized regularly. Daily Covid-19 screening questions and temperature checks conducted. Physical distancing and other Covid-19 protocols in place.

Concord, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

What is your salary expectation?

Title: Analyst in Immunochemistry
Description:
For 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.


IMPORTANT: In order to be considered for this position, a resume/CV must be uploaded and submitted during the application process. Please make sure work history and education are added correctly.
 




We are currently seeking to hire an Analyst for our Immunochemistry team located in Ville St-Laurent. 
 How will you create an impact?  The Immunochemistry department mainly analyzes serum, plasma, and tissue samples to verify the concentration, toxicity, and stability of assay substances (large molecules) in order to determine the safety and efficacy of drugs.


Why Charles River?  We offer an excellent integration program for our new employees as well as opportunities for internal growth and career development. Our other perks include:


As of Day 1:

Competitive benefits & we pay 90% of premiums (health and dental coverage).
Access to a savings and retirement program with employer contribution.
Vacation and Personal Day Policy.
Free telemedicine app for you and your family.


 
Transportation:

Shuttle service from the Sainte-Anne-de Bellevue train station and from John Abbott College to the Senneville location.
Free parking.


 
Work Schedule & Salary:

Starting salary rate of $19.50/HR.
Permanent, full-time position from Monday to Friday.
Please note that training will be conducted at our Senneville location (West of Montreal).





What will you work on?




Working in our newly renovated laboratories, you will perform sample analysis work using various assays and techniques such as ELISA, Electrochemiluminescence, hybridization, and extractions. You will also perform data analysis to determine if results are within expectations; all in accordance with Good Laboratory Practices (GLP). 
 Who are we looking for?  We are seeking a motivated individual with either a DEC in Science (Biotechnology, Medical Laboratory, or equivalent) or a BAC in Science (Immunology, Biology, Biochemistry) who works with precision and strives for quality work. A self-starter with a collaborative and positive attitude. Must be comfortable working under English conditions, bilingualism is an asset. 
 If you are interested in contributing to the well-being of our communities, not only across the country but around the world, please join us and BE THE DIFFERENCE!

 



IMPORTANT: A resume is required to be considered for this position. If you have not uploaded your resume in your candidate profile, please return to upload field and attach your resume/CV. 
About Safety Assessment Charles River is committed to helping our partners expedite their preclinical drug development with exceptional safety assessment services, state-of-the-art facilities and expert regulatory guidance. From individual specialty toxicology and IND enabling studies to tailored packages and total laboratory support, our deeply experienced team can design and execute programs that anticipate challenges and avoid roadblocks for a smooth, efficient journey to market. Each year approximately 120 investigational new drug (IND) programs are conducted in our Safety Assessment facilities.

Title: Business Systems Analyst - Product Management
Description:
Business Systems Analyst - Product Management
-
(
221704190
)


 Description

 Business Systems Analyst – Web Applications
Who We Are: Just Energy is a consumer company focused on essential needs, including electricity and natural gas; health and well-being, such as water quality and filtration devices; and utility conservation, bringing energy efficient solutions and renewable energy options to consumers. Currently operating in the United States and Canada, Just Energy serves both residential and commercial customers. Just Energy is the parent company of Amigo Energy, Filter Group Inc., Hudson Energy, Interactive Energy Group, Tara Energy, and terrapass.
About this Opportunity: Business Systems Analysts within the Information Technology team are the catalysts for transformation and strategic advantage in Just Energy. As part of a resource pool for all functional areas of the company, the analyst gains exposure to varied aspects of this cutting-edge energy retail business, opening doors to an array of growth-oriented roles in the company. Strong analytical skills, initiative, and teamwork are rewarded with opportunities for advancement, and increased impact.
The Business Systems Analyst acts as a consultant, providing IT solutions to solve business challenges, and acts as a bridge between IT and various business units requiring IT services. This position requires strong leadership, analytical and problem-solving skills. The chosen candidate must be a mature individual who is able to work with minimal supervision, contribute to a positive work environment and manage multiple assignments simultaneously. 

Your key accountabilities:


Partner with operational groups to design (or redesign), optimize processes, and implement new business processes and systems to improve Just Energy’s operations.
Work with business stakeholders and external partners to analyze business challenges, design practical and attainable solutions.
Document business, functional, and technical requirements for implementing solutions to support business strategies.
Develop, maintain, and strengthen effective relationships with business stakeholders. Engage with business and IT stakeholders to prioritize changes and projects to align IT priorities with business objectives.
Remain flexible with multiple shifting priorities and effectively function under deadlines with minimal supervision.
Manage projects and changes as assigned throughout the SDLC; from inception to roll-out. Remove obstacles, Inform and enable project teams for successful implementation.
Work with IT implementation teams to ensure that tools or software packages are implemented according to specification and function correctly before they are released to production. Follow up on delivery, review and report results after roll-out.
Review and complete initial troubleshooting for any support requests and production issues.
Provide input and take actions to resolve escalated production issues. Take steps to minimize future issues.
Create tools in various platforms (SQL, Excel, SharePoint, etc.) to help manage the day-to-day responsibilities or create reports for various functional areas.
Manage Product Updates and Creation through Product Admin System.
Create, Sign-off, and assist with Test Cases for enhancements and new Projects.
Develop, maintain, and strengthen the documentation around API suite, application components, and backend processes required to ensure smooth functioning of all web assets.


Your background includes:


Undergraduate degree preferably of a technical or engineering orientation.
Minimum 4 years of experience in business analysis or a similar technical role.
Minimum 2 years of experience working with web portals (online enrolment carts, self-service portals, Angular, Wordpress, etc.).
Experience in designing complex, multi-tier, web-based, database-driven software applications.
Experience working with Google analytics, email management solutions, and Customer engagement solutions is a must.
Experience with mobile applications (multi-tier data driven app with backend integration to cloud platforms) development projects desired.
Experience working with Product Management Tool is a must (ex: Azure DevOps, Flosum, etc.).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with experience writing business requirements, user stories and use cases, process flows, and functional specifications.
Knowledge of Project Management principles and software development life cycle is a must.
Self-starter, results-oriented and motivated with excellent analytical and technical skills.
Experience as part of an Agile Team (in a distributed setting in multiple geographic locations) with demonstrated understanding of the Agile mindset would be a desired skill.


Benefits:
Just Energy offers a robust benefits plan for staff members, as well as Employee Assistance Programs that offer a wealth of tools and resources to enrich the employee experience. The company also provides a number of cost-free, self-development courses for those that wish to build on their skills and competencies. In addition, a variety of awards offer another opportunity to recognize and reward employees.

We offer:


Competitive compensation
Performance based bonuses
Comprehensive benefits package from day 1 of employment
Employee Deferred Profit Sharing Plan (DPSP)
Work from home (WFH) Model *During pandemic
Health and wellbeing tools and resources and more…


Just Energy and its subsidiaries are an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace. We invite all interested individuals to apply. #LI-SS1
