Title: Business Intelligence Manager
Company: The Great Western Brewing Co. Ltd.
Description:
About Us‘Brewers with Heart’ is what we are known for. We thrive on the legendary passion and leadership that 16 front-line employees, ‘The Original 16’, demonstrated when they saved the brewery from closure in 1990 and founded the Great Western Brewing Company. We win brewing awards and have learned to reinvent ourselves. We are proud, independent and determined!
Why Work Here

Your work will be noticed, what you do matters.
We are the perfect sized organization to work for, big enough to do interesting work yet small enough that our CEO knows each of us.
Culture of bold ambition, delivering on our commitments
Leadership with passion and a great sense of humour.
You don’t need to just stay in your lane, in fact, initiative is what created the company we are today.

OverviewThe Business Intelligence Manager is responsible for overseeing the Business Intelligence department to ensure the streamlined operation of the department in alignment with the business objectives of the organization. Primarily supporting the needs of the Commercial Team, the BI Manager will work closely with decision makers in other departments to provide insight into internal and industry trends, identify challenges and opportunities, and recommend data-driven solutions, ultimately supporting these groups in making informed business decisions and executing against the long-term strategy.
ResponsibilitiesData Strategy and Governance

Operationalize and evolve the existing data strategy to ensure that data is valued as a strategic asset and is an integral element of decision making at Great Western Brewing
Be a thought leader on how data and analytics can be leveraged within Great Western Brewing
Work closely with different business functions and identify new analytics opportunities to help move the business forward
Prioritize and coordinate data or information requests
Drive Data Governance activities within the organization to ensure that data is available and reliable to support Business objectives

Business Intelligence

Build, improve and maintain the business intelligence (BI) environment that includes a suite of Power BI reports
Lead and execute Annual Volume Planning exercise
Ensure accurate, regular & timely completion and clarification of core internal reporting exercises that support
Prepare, manipulate and analyze data from internal and external data sources to help support fact-based decision making and identify key issues and opportunities across all markets
Leverage external or publicly available data sources alongside internal datasets to develop complete understanding of GWBC’s position within the competitive industry
Educate and train business users with adopting the appropriate report or data product in meeting their needs

Share & Present

Lead regular meetings to effectively communicate insights gleaned from reporting and analysis and work with key stakeholders to determine actionable take-aways. This includes:


Quarterly Business Review
Quarterly Competitive Industry Review
Annual Business Review
Support Commercial Leadership team in annual Top to Top meetings with key customers and Liquor Boards by providing and presenting relevant data and insights

Management

Coach and grow the BI Coordinator with clear direction and proactive leadership, strategic assignment of responsibilities, and other training opportunities.
Work closely with Commercial Leadership team, other departments, and external partners
Oversee and ensure effective management and completion of a variety of administrative tasks related to Sales and Marketing functions:


Maintain internal programming and promotional activity calendars for all sales regions
Complete and submit marketing program applications across all markets and channels; track and communicate results to relevant stakeholders
Update and maintain provincial price lists and communicate changes to relevant stakeholders
Execute price changes with provincial liquor boards on a regular schedule
Execute new product set ups with provincial liquor boards

Key Requirements and CapabilitiesEducation & Experience: 

Degree, diploma or certificate in data analysis, business administration or related field
3-5 years in Business Analyst role or data-related role, and/or consumer-packaged goods, beverage alcohol or beer
Certificate or course work in Project Management
Microsoft Excel expert (experience with pivot tables an asset)
Experience with Microsoft Power BI
Experience with CRM
A combination of education and experience will be considered

Skills and Capabilities

Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize a multitude of projects, track and manage multiple deadlines, and meet them consistently
Superior attention to detail and a desire to produce accurate work – you take pride in ensuring your work is accurate, complete and well-formatted
Strong analytic capabilities and business acumen; reviews data, see what's relevant, draws meaningful conclusions, and finds actionable takeaways.
Proficient in use of Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
Strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to influence decisions
Agile and adaptable with the ability to quickly adapt to changes and learn how to work with new/changing data sources and platforms
Collaborative worker who can work across departments with different stakeholders and interests

Culture Fit

A high sense of responsibility where your word is your bond. Taking full ownership for anything you commit to, large or small, you feel compelled to follow it through.
Remarkably rally resources, configuring all the pieces to their best fit. Confidently and calmly orchestrate people, plans and tactics especially when things don’t go according to plan.
Quick to see alternatives and chart multiple paths to get to the destination
A drive for action and results, in fact, action is the only thing you know is real
Loves beer – you can wake up and want more Western Canadian consumers to have a better beer experience

Title: Business Analyst/Consultant
Description:
Who we are: 
Quad Infotech Inc is the leading provider of cutting edge, world-class, integrated MES software solutions for steel industry. We are the No. 1 provider of MES systems in the long steel industry and our products are the new best in class standard in the North American steel manufacturing industry.
We are currently hiring for Business Analysts to participate as a part of SCRUM teams to help with design, development, commissioning and support of our advanced production management and analytics suite of software. Your main tasks will include performing detailed business and technical requirements gathering and analysis, documenting processes, performing user acceptance testing, conduct training, and support commissioning and roll outs. You will be a part of an Agile team of engineers, developers and designers.
To succeed in this role, you must be logic driven, analytical and a quick learner. You should be able to think outside the box and be able to prioritize tasks and deliver time-sensitive items.
Responsibilities: 

Working closely with external and internal stakeholders to evaluate business processes, technical and functional requirements, areas of improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Translates conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.
Provide post-project implementation support
Providing front-end and back-end support to clients and analyzing, investigating, resolving client issues
Establishing root cause of application errors and escalating appropriately to the development teams
Performing analyses on software application functionality and suggesting improvements

Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Software Development or appropriate technical field
1 – 2 years of experience with data mapping, data conversion or data integration projects
1 – 2 years of experience with business and technical requirements analysis, modeling, verification and methodology development
1 year of experience with relational databases and SQL
Ability to work independently and display creativity, exercise sound judgement, demonstrate initiative, and possess excellent written and oral communication skills
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Understanding of project management concepts
A track record of following through on commitments.
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.

Bonus pay

Monday to Friday

Title: Real Estate Advisory Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Job Category: 
Commercial Property Valuation 
 
Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group! 

Altus Group is currently looking for a Real Estate Advisory Analyst to join our US Investment Managed Service team based out of Toronto. We are comfortable with this individual working remotely. 

In this position, you will gain knowledge and experience in the business of investment managed services, appraisal, appraisal review, appraisal management, and financial due diligence for all property types. Learn the basic sub-property type attributes and how location and market trends impact rent and expenses. Learn how to setup and manage the client workflow process, data requests from appraisers and clients. Learn how to analyze an Income and Expense statement; research sale and lease comparables and apply adjustments to the subject property; read leases to understand tenant recovery structures; and build cash flows. 

Key Responsibilities: 

Investment Managed Services: Learn and work with the team to support institutional client’s acquisitions, asset management and lending needs for their commercial real estate portfolios. Analysts will assist with ARGUS Enterprise model audits and maintenance, lease reviews and abstracting, preparation of acquisition memorandum, financial due diligence, market analysis, hold / sell analysis, variance to budget analysis, valuation analysis, loan stress testing and reviews, loan covenants reviews and abstracting. 
Appraisal Process: Get familiarized with the process of and why we are doing what are doing at Altus. Conduct market analysis for the subject property, which includes gathering and analyzing data about the subject’s market and submarket and determining market rent based on recent leases at comparable properties and the subject’s recent leasing. Gather data and apply judgement to determine reasonable valuation assumptions such as market rent and market rent growth. 
Appraisal: Learn to prepare cash flow models using ARGUS Enterprise. Analysts use factual data provided by Clients (rent rolls, operating statements, tenant sales, and various other financial information) on the subject property to assist with the preparation of cash flow models., Learn the Sales Comparison and Cost approaches and compile the appraisal reports. 
Appraisal Review: Support the reviews of third party appraisal reports as part of the valuation management process, which includes reviewing the ARGUS Enterprise cash flow model for factual and market assumptions, reviewing the appraisal reports, and comparing the valuation metrics to the benchmark data. Learn to use (of) best judgement and knowledge to determine the reasonableness of the valuation and ensure that the appraisal reports are in compliance with USPAP and State regulations. 
Financial Due Diligence: Learn to audit and underwrite cash flow models of all commercial real estate asset classes for transactions. Analysts will advise clients, including Private Equity firms, Investment Banks and REITS, on buyside acquisitions by providing cash flow modeling and a better understanding of critical deal issues. Audit financial models in Excel and AE. Build financial models for CMBS loan underwriting. Analyze tenant health ratios for buyside retail acquisition underwriting. Audit expense recovery models. Review historical income and expenses for pro forma forecasting. Abstract tenant leases and summarize key tenant clauses with potential cash flow impacts. 


Position Requirements: 

University or college degree in Real Estate, Finance, Economics or related field 
Previous experience or internship within the CRE industry is preferred 
Working knowledge of Excel (v-lookups, pivot tables) 
Exposure to business writing 
Ability to pro-actively communicate (i.e. when behind on deliverables or seeking assistance) 
Experience working independently or within a team environment setting in a professional or academic setting 

Come realize your potential at Altus Group! 

Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Title: Data & Systems Analyst
Description:
Data & Systems Analyst
We are looking for an experienced individual to join our Information Systems Team
If you have a unique ability to analyze and interpret business requirements, are customer focused and interested in working collaboratively with a strong team to assess business needs and turn those into cost effective technology solutions, then Grenville Mutual Insurance is looking for you to join our Information Services and Development Department in the role of Data & Systems Analyst.
Grenville Mutual Insurance is an innovator in Canada’s Mutual insurance sector. We understand that having forward-looking insurance solutions for people is an essential driver for success, but not the only one. We are a company that believes in the strength of relationships in all aspects of business and internal operations. Working in a specialized, yet competitive and dynamic environment, our team continuously looks to improve the products for our Policyholder members and enhance the vital service experience with our distribution network.
Your primary responsibility will be to work with internal and external stakeholders to understand the business needs and translate those into enhancements to applications or systems that will support the delivery of business requirements. You will also be responsible for supporting the business through the analysis and development of reports to identify trends, patterns and predictions. Using your well-honed communication skills, you will translate technical specifications into clear non-technical requirements delivering effective technology solutions that align with the company’s values and strategic direction. You will have the ability to manage your work in a collaborative team environment.
The successful candidate comes with post-secondary education in a relevant field and has demonstrated experience performing data and systems analysis. Of significant value will be proven experience assessing business needs and translating them into relevant solutions. Advanced analytical and problem solving skills are a must in order to effectively deliver on the expectations of the role.
Grenville Mutual welcomes applications from all individuals. If you require special accommodation during the application process, please contact Gisele Gareau at 613.258.9988.
Find out more at grenvillemutual.com/who-we-are/careers/

Apply in strict confidence by email to Gisele Gareau, Human Resources Partner.

Title: FUNCTIONAL ANALYST, IT BUSINESS SOLUTIONS
Market Intelligence Analyst – Analytics - Contract
Description:
Temporary – Full Time – Mobile
 18 - Month Contract
Let’s impact lives for the better! 
Alberta Blue Cross® is Alberta based, not-for-profit and dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting the wellness of all Albertans. We believe in what we do—and place trust in our employees to deliver our vision.
Working at Alberta Blue Cross® means having a career where you’ll be recognized for your contributions. We value diversity, encourage our employees to maintain a healthy work-life balance and provide opportunities for training and career growth.
OVERVIEW:
Alberta Blue Cross® is seeking a Market Intelligence Analyst for the Analytics department. This position will be part of a transforming team whose vision is to continuously sense and monitor external trends impacting our business, translating environmental data into relevant insights to drive strategic decision-making, enabling the right information to be shared with the right people at the right time. The Market Intelligence Analyst will provide support to the organization by informing the product development, product management, marketing, and sales processes. Using a data-driven approach, the team is tasked to explain the drivers of performance within product segments and recommend plan features, and pricing. 
WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Responsible for data research and analytics in support of marketing, pricing, risk selection, and other operational areas of group and individual health, dental, life and disability insurance products
 Assist in the continuous monitoring of our competitive space
 Use both internal and external resources to gather information required for customer, competitor, market, and pricing analysis
 Analyzes data and reports to prepare presentation(s) to team and/or project team members
 Collaborate on industry-wide reporting and analysis by sourcing and contributing information
 Complete marketplace and competitive reviews to support product development and management

WHAT YOU WILL HAVE:

A self-starter with a minimum of one to two years’ experience in a business environment
 Demonstrated working knowledge of research methodology, data analysis and project management
 A creative problem-solver who is tenacious in their pursuit of information
 Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office products, as well as various reporting and business intelligence tools
 Strong written communication skills
 Demonstrated planning and organizational skills, including the ability to work autonomously
 Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
 Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization
 Knowledge of data analysis software tools (eg. R, Python or SQL) and data visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau is an asset, but not required

Title: Senior Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Customer Data Analyst to join our team. This individual will play a critical role within the Decision Support - Customer Insights team, reporting into the manager of this function. This team works on strategic projects to drive customer engagement across the organization. This is a high-profile role that often supports the Senior Executive team and works with other cross-unfunctional teams in the organization. 
What you will do 
You will provide proactive insights on customer behaviour to support key stakeholders across the organization. You have the curiosity, skills, and abilities to formulate actionable insights for business stakeholders and to synthesize information across a broad ecosystem to enable data-driven decision making. You will identify opportunities to drive customer engagement that will lead to increased revenue or reduced expense. You are a team player with strong communication skills and with a collaborative spirit. You can network at all levels and have a genuine curiosity that improves your understanding of projects. 
In this role, you will: 

Derive Customer Insights : Perform customer analytics, including developing models and advanced analytical processes. This includes understanding how our customers are shopping in our stores and what products they are purchasing. 
Interpret Data: Extract, manipulate and interpret data to isolate on key trends. Summarize the results into concise and informative reports that business partners across the organization can easily interpret. 
Improve Customer Profitability : Establish a strong understanding of customer profitability and financial performance to find creative ways to maximize profitability and customer engagement within our portfolio. 
Influence through data driven storytelling: Influence executives and cross-functional teams by creating presentations using data story-telling and sound insights. 
Innovate : Challenge the status quo through innovation of existing tools and processes. 
Build Models : Develop customer models which provide Marketing and Loyalty teams with alternative approaches to increase engagement and entanglement within retail banners. 

What you bring 

B.S. in Business, Engineering, Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science 
2+ years of professional work experience in data domain 
Able to turn insights into actionable opportunities through strong storytelling and visualizations 
Advance knowledge of SQL to perform complex data analysis 
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and Power Point 
Excellent written and oral communication skills 
Curiosity and strong problem-solving skills 
Balance of technical and business acumen, including modeling and strategic business case development 

Nice to have: 

SAS, Python, or another language to transform and process data 
Big Query: experience with cloud databases such as Google Cloud or Snowflake 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It is more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibly embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Title: Business Analyst - Business and Operations - Education Centre
Description:
Business Analyst 

 Business and Operations – Education Centre 

 Company Overview 

 Rocky View Schools (RVS) serves the educational needs of over 25,000 students within 54 diverse schools. As the fifth largest school jurisdiction in Alberta, RVS balances the development of learner competencies with an ongoing emphasis on literacy and numeracy. We believe all learners deserve to have their needs met through learning communities that value inclusion, diversity, compassion and fairness. In RVS, the best interest of students is at the center of every decision. 

 The Opportunity 

 RVS invites applications for a continuing, full-time (35 hrs/wk) Business Analyst position starting immediately. As a member of the Business and Operations team, the Business Analyst will will provide analytical and technical expertise to support the effective use of risk management through loss and exposure data and other information necessary to identify, evaluate and monitor the division’s risk exposures. The incumbent will monitor, review, and recommend improvements to business process including assisting the Finance department with process documentation for internal controls. The incumbent is an effective communicator and collaborator with excellent organization, time-management, teamwork, leadership, and analytical skills. The location of this position will be at the Education Centre in Airdrie, Alberta. 

 Responsibilities Include; 

 Manages all facets of the insurance and claims function (i.e. coordination with insurers, brokers, legal counsel, etc.) and notifies insurance agencies of investigations and behaviour which may put the Division at risk 

 Participates as a member of various USIC committees (USIC is a licensed insurance reciprocal that operates under the provincial Superintendent of Insurance in the province of Alberta and the reciprocal consists of 14 school divisions) 

 Reviews contracts (including RFP/Q’s) for indemnification, hold harmless clauses, insurance provisions and other risk transfer provisions to ensure contracting parties can meet their legal contractual risk obligations through financial assets or insurance 

 Coordinate and assist with FOIP Requests and Breaches, including risk assessments and recommendations 

 Supervises administrative support staff in the department as required 

 Performs risk assessment of proposed new activities where there is an elevated risk of student injury and makes recommendations to mitigate risk 

 Reviews all student and staff accidents reports to access potential liability 

 Collaborates with all departments to review and assess business process and ensures processes are properly documented and recommends improvements as required 

 Initiates and maintains key working relationships with School and Education Center personnel, external auditors, and government agencies to promote efficient, consistent, and collaborative practices 

 Understands and complies with all legal requirements for safety and health, as they pertain to the workplace 


Education/Experience:
 Post-secondary degree in Business Administration or a related field 

 Canadian Risk Management (CRM) designation 

 2 - 5 years of experience working with insurance, risk management, or business processes 

 A combination of relevant education and experience will be considered 

 Working knowledge of contracts, policies, and claim management 

 Proficient in Microsoft Suite of products (Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint) 


Rocky View Schools Benefits:
 3 Weeks Vacation 

 11 Earned Days pro-rated based on start day 

 Hybrid (one day a week, working remotely) 

 Flex Benefits Plan (Extended health, Dental Benefits, Wellness/Health Care Spending Account(s), Tax Free Savings Account and Registered Retirement Savings Plan) 

 Defined Benefit Pension Plan 

 Professional development and training opportunities 

 Free Parking 

 Pre-employment Requirements 

 The successful candidate must submit a current Criminal Record with Vulnerable Sector Check within 30 days of the start of your employment 

 Proof of qualifications/education as required by the position 


Open to: Internal and External applicants 


Salary: $37.04 - $44.99 per hour 

 How to Apply 

 We request all applications be placed through http://rockyview.simplication.com/. Applications must include your cover letter, resume, proof of qualifications and contact information of three professional references. Interviews will take place June 27, 2022. 


Quote Job Code#: 3273626 


Closing Date: On or before June 23, 2022 by 4:30 pm 

 Rocky View Schools 

 Human Resources 

 https://www.rockyview.ab.ca/careers/current_opportunities 

 We appreciate and consider all applications; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be contacted via email or by phone for an interview. Please ensure your online profile information is up to date so there is no delay in contacting you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Ottawa Hub location)
Description:
Requisition ID: 152051  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team Oversees Finance Data Management & Data Services within Global Finance & Risk Technology (GFRT) provides analytics and support services for Global Finance Initiatives. The Finance Data Management Data Services team supports Financial Close Processes and provide Financial Data Management, Data Analysis, Data Quality and Data Governance services for Toronto/Canada. The team is heavily involved in business transformation projects and equivalency testing during migrations.

 The Role As a Data Engineer you are required to participate in multiple finance transformation projects, liaise with stakeholders on new business initiatives, delivering solutions to meet the needs of multiple lines of business, and interfaces extensively with business clients. The incumbent will have a minimum of 2 to 3 years of strong expertise querying data from ledgers, data models, database design and an understanding of the Bank's financial data. The individual must thrive on challenge, be proactive, and demonstrate initiative, coaching the data engineers and eagerness to learn.
 Some of the key accountabilities include:

Work with senior team members (architects, developers, testers) to develop and implement data solutions for finance reporting systems
Analyze data in both Financial Systems and Big Data environments
Support senior team members through research assignments and proof of concepts
Demonstrate a passion for problem solving and data presentation technologies
Facilitate UAT testing for system migration and new initiatives
Report development and support for internal customers; including executives analytical minded skillset
Provide analytical support to company leadership by providing ad-hoc analysis and data trouble shooting support
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Builds a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment and using a coaching mindset and behaviors; communicating vison/values/business strategy; and managing succession and development planning for the team.



 What You Will Bring to Succeed


Advanced level SQL design / reporting / data mining experience or familiar with using ACL
CPA/CA or Accounting/finance knowledge with computer science/data sciences certification is preferred.
Data Modeling experience with Agile methodology and familiar with scrum meetings and sprint planning.
Analytical and Detail-oriented
Report development and support for internal and external customers; including executives analytical minded skillset.

We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Job ID: 159490 Required Travel :Minimal Managerial - No Location: :Canada- From Home (Working from Home)



 Who are we?


 Amdocs helps those who build the future to make it amazing. With our market-leading portfolio of software products and services, we unlock our customers’ innovative potential, empowering them to provide next-generation communication and media experiences for both the individual end user and enterprise customers. Our 30,000 employees around the globe are here to accelerate service providers’ migration to the cloud, enable them to differentiate in the 5G era, and digitalize and automate their operations. Listed on the NASDAQ Global Select Market, Amdocs had revenue of $4.3 billion in fiscal 2021. For more information, visit Amdocs at www.amdocs.com




 In one sentence


 Lead and design the solution which meets customer business and technical needs by leveraging Amdocs assets and best practices while integrating with customer IT environment.




 What will your job look like?



You will lead the solution design throughout the project lifecycle and be accountable for solution integrity.
You will gain insight into customer's environment, challenges, and opportunities in order to propose areas where Amdocs products and solutions can add value. You will ensure proposed solution reflects Amdocs value proposition and competitive advantage.
You will maintain deep knowledge of industry and technology trends, standards, and competition in order to identify business opportunities based on domain market dynamics.
You will share and communicate end-to-end solutions (orally and in writing) to executives, business sponsors, and technical resources.
You will design cost effective solution that maximizes value to the customer and considers constraints such as budget, timelines, local market, and meeting customer requirements
You will create and support proof of concept (POC)/demos and present solutions to client.
You will provide ongoing feedback to product management for delivery of best practices.





All you need is...



Bachelor's degree in Science/IT/Computing or equivalent.
7+ years' experience as a Software Engineer - designing and developing enterprise applications.
Must have solution and development experience in Amdocs Ensemble – Billing module.
Must have experience developing, troubleshooting and testing against relational databases like Oracle and/or MySQL.
Experience with Agile Management tools – Jira, Jira Align, qTest
Must be well versed with Design patterns, Data Structures and Algorithms.
Must have experience working as a part of Agile / DevOps teams.
Excellent interpersonal skills, a servant leadership mentality, and an ability to work with diverse teams and personalities during high pressure situations.
Nice to have experience developing robust applications with NO SQL databases.
Nice to have experience using cloud native messaging frameworks like KAFKA, RMQ.
Nice to have experience developing high throughput APIs on cloud native frameworks.





Why you will love this job:



Develop positive relationships with diverse customer groups - Customer Representatives, technical and non-technical teams, including sales, commercial accounting, marketing, legal, go-to-market and finance.
You will serve as an expert for Digital transformation of mission-critical enterprise level customer experience systems for Tier 1 Communications Services Provider.
You will have the opportunity to work in a growing organization, with ever growing opportunities for personal growth.
We are a dynamic, multi-cultural organization that constantly innovates and empowers our employees to grow. Our people our passionate, daring, and phenomenal teammates that stand by each other with a dedication to creating a diverse, inclusive workplace!
We offer a wide range of stellar benefits including health, dental, vision, and life insurance as well as paid time off, sick time, and parental leave!
Amdocs is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to encouraging a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Title: HR Data Analyst/BI Developer
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 
Working as part of the Workforce Insights team the HR Data Analyst/Bi Developer will be responsible for creating reports, visualizations, dashboards, and applications to support global people analytics aligned with Manulife’s strategic initiatives. This role will support data management, data classification, data optimization, deployment of advanced insights solutions, enhancing HR data and reporting processes, and the development of consumer grade people data solutions. 

Duties/Responsibilities: 

Collects, connects, and models core people data from a variety of sources such as the human resource information system, voice of the employee platforms, labour market intelligence, and learning and development systems. 
Leverages existing technology to provide solutions in the space of operational and advanced people analytics. 
Leverages Microsoft Power BI to build and develop a consumer grade analytics interaction layer. 
Responsible for quality assurance and enhancements for new and existing dashboards and analytics solutions. 
Collaborates with teams to develop data governance and security models to support privacy, and data utilization. 
Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns on topics such as talent acquisition, talent management, attrition & retention, and learning. 
Support requirements building and implementation of new data technology and subsequent data solutions. 
Supports training on Microsoft Power BI built solutions and platforms 
Performs other duties as assigned. 


Required Skills/Abilities: 

Post-secondary education in Data Analytics, Data Engineering, or Computer Science 
Core knowledge of report development, data storage, and data modelling concepts 
Experience working with large and complex data sets 
3-5 years of applied Business Intelligence experience, preferably Microsoft PowerBi 
HCD/DesignThink background or certification considered an asset 
Knowledge of Azure or Amazon technologies such as Databricks, Synapse, or Redshift considered an asset 
Basic knowledge/understanding of product management considered an asset 
Experience leveraging SQL, DAX, Python, R language, and BI tools to develop meaning 
Experience implementing complex analysis and machine learning 
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software. 
Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn the organizations HRIS, payroll, and similar employee management data sources. 


Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com . 

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

Title: Software Business Analyst
Description:
Software Business Analyst
DataFix is a small company, but as a team we have played major roles in the successful delivery of many large projects and have had a huge impact on voting in Canada. Our customers appreciate our ability to move quickly and to deliver superior solutions and customer service. We are a close-knit group, and we take great pride in our flexible and adaptable working environment.
Located at the corner of University and Wellington in Toronto, DataFix is within walking distance for people living in the downtown core. Our office is just steps from the St. Andrew subway station and is a short walk from Union Station.
What we are looking for
DataFix is a leader in elections software and data management solutions. In business for over 25 years, our customers include some of the largest private and government organizations in Canada. With our VoterView product, DataFix offers one of the most sophisticated elector list management and electronic poll book solutions in North America. DataFix has a proven track record delivering high quality services under tight time constraints.
DataFix is looking for a talented, Software Business Analyst to join the team in our downtown Toronto location. The successful candidate must demonstrate the ability to grasp new situations quickly, working in a fast- paced, deadline-driven work environment.
The primary responsibility of the successful candidate will be bridging the gap between IT and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to management and business partners. The successful candidate willbe expected to work independently, with multiple priorities but will have supervisory assistance and guidance.
Who you are: 
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written) to interact with various project team members including test & development team, project management and business partners
Able to multitask
Able to work collaboratively and independently
What you will be doing: 
Help scale, enable, and drive online & mobile development excellence as our team continues to deliver innovative solutions to customers
Work with peers on project intake activities, requirements gathering, user story creation, defect triage and analysis, backlog management - among other BSA-related duties.
Qualifications: 
At least 3 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role
Strong written and oral communication
Ability to translate customer requirements into technical solutions
Solution focused, takes initiative to work effectively within established guidelines
Ability to multi-task and flourish in a fast- paced, deadline-driven work environment
Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment
Assets: 
You are comfortable speaking with a wide range of stakeholders in different business departments
You have strong documentation skills for reporting, tracking and resolving user issues with the software applications
You have experience testing software applications, bug tracking, regression testing, and documenting defects
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $45,000.00-$80,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Casual dress
Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision care
Work from home

Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
We will work with the potential candidate to discuss working remotely and or a hybrid model of coming into the office occasionally for meetings etc.

Title: Data Quality Analyst (Full-Time Contract)
Description:
Status: Full-time, 12 Month Contract role with possible extension up to 6 months
Schedule: Monday - Friday, Standard 38.75 hour work week
Location: Primary Care Network Wellness Centre at #4000, 1800 194 Avenue SE; Calgary, AB
Reporting Structure: Reports to the Information Management Manger

 Position Summary 
The Data Quality Analyst is responsible for proactively reviewing the corporate data warehouse content to identify data quality issues and implement strategies to resolve them. In addition, the post holder will be responsible for testing new data feeds into the corporate data warehouse and developing business logic to optimize the data infrastructure. The incumbent will have great attention to detail, able to produce high quality documentation, brings strong SQL scripting skills, and has knowledge of MS Excel and data warehousing concepts.

 What Does the Role Do? 

Data Quality

 Identification of data quality issues within the corporate SQL Server based data warehouse
 Formulate tactics and strategies to resolve data quality issues through front-end process changes or backend data cleansing processes
 Work closely with the DW & BI Lead, DW & BI Developer, Clinical systems (EMR) Analyst, Evaluators, and Practice Facilitators in identifying and finding solutions to data quality issues to optimize use of the corporate data infrastructure and meet business requirements
 Develop and manage the data quality issues log to ensure registration and resolution of all identified data quality issues

 Information System Testing


 Responsible for the testing of new information system developments to support the expansion of the corporate data warehouse
 Lead on the development and technical testing of business logic to optimize data use capabilities to support business requirements
 Work closely with clinical data entry teams and the Clinical systems (EMR) Analyst to coordinate changes to front end data entry

 Documentation



     Deliver high quality documentation for data sources, data warehousing, and BI applications.
   
 Mapping data sets and developing data dictionaries for tables and field
 Produce regular data quality reports to operational teams


 Who Should Apply?

 University degree or college diploma in Computer Science/Computer programming/Software Engineering or related field
 1+ years of experience in SQL Server, designing, developing, scripting queries in a medium complex data warehouse environment
 Experience with leading Business Intelligence tools (eg. Qlik Sense or QlikView) is an asset
 Experience of primary health care data and/or health care EMR (e.g., Wolf, MedAccess, Practice Solutions) is an asset
 Experience with application development is an asset


 What Will Help You Succeed?

 Experience with data warehouse structures and relational databases
 Strong experience with MS Excel
 Strong attention to detail
 Work independently as well as in a team-oriented environment
 Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal with an emphasis on client satisfaction and clearly communicating solutions to both technical and non-technical team members
 Strong analytical skills to solve and model complex business requirements with the ability for creativity and innovative problem solving Knowledge of project management methodologies


 Working Conditions

 Onsite and Remote Workforce
 Long periods of concentration and working on a computer required
 Two supervisory references required
 Criminal background check required
 Proof of COVID vaccination required


 Why Work At SCPCN?
 It takes an outstanding team to deliver exceptional care.
 Hello, we’re the South Calgary Primary Care Network. We are change makers, innovators and community builders. We are a uniquely Alberta approach to primary care delivery. We are a group of interprofessional teams and need you to be part of the movement to bring innovative primary health care programs and services to the residents of south Calgary.
 Established in February 2006, the South Calgary Primary Care Network (SCPCN) includes the areas south of Anderson Road to the southern, western, and eastern city limits.
 
Employees of the SCPCN enjoy a comprehensive total compensation package that includes:

 Health, vision, and dental benefits
 Health spending/wellness account
 Personal development account
 Flexible work options
 Generous vacation, sick and flex days
 Professional development opportunities
 Parking available at site
 The SCPCN culture is defined by 5 core values: Innovation, accountability, integrity, collaboration and wellness. They provide a foundation on which we perform work and conduct ourselves. Our mission is to build healthier communities in south Calgary through the evolution and transformation of primary care in collaboration with our wellness partners.
 

 Are you ready to join us lead optimal personal and community wellness now and into the future?
If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply online with your resume and cover letter. 
We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Title: Data Analyst, Financial Crime Risk
Description:
Overview: 
 
   At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions.
 


 Risk Analytics @ Neo



 Neo’s Credit Risk team works hard to enable a high growth portfolio with sound risk management principles while optimizing credit decisioning across the customer lifecycle. This team of high-performers leads the development and implementation of key credit risk strategies to effectively manage the lending portfolio inline with our business objectives.
 


 The Role



 Neo is looking for a data driven individual with strong knowledge of advanced analytical techniques to join our team in our Calgary headquarters. Leveraging your knack for data and a strong statistical foundation, you’ll make an immediate impact via development and deployment of advanced analytical techniques across our credit and fraud decisioning projects. You’ll be contributing to our innovative, strategic, and high-performance team with a mission to improve the financial experience for all Canadians.
  What you'll be doing:: 
 
Develop reporting capabilities to actively monitor performance, and identify trends to enable strategic business decisions
 Analyze risk profiles across the financial crimes vectors, leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning to best identify exposure/opportunities
 Analyze key business metrics including true positive rates, false positive rates, portfolio fraud rates
 Collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to integrate foundational risk practices
 Who we're looking for:: 
 
1-3 years experience in data analytics; experience in risk management,fraud analytics, AML analytics considered an asset
 Strong knowledge of SQL, R and Python
 Data-driven, eager to understand the numbers and provide meaningful insights
 Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to adapt communication to different audiences
 Self-starter, highly focused; driven to achieve business objectives
 Self-organized, ability to prioritize effectively
 Able to collaborate with others, engage stakeholders purposefully


 About applying with us:: 
 
   At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future.
 


 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: IT- Reporting Analyst
Description:
About Northland Recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, and sports & entertainment. Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, the Dallas Stars, Grouse Mountain, Revelstoke Mountain Resort, and Northland Asset Management Company. 
Business Challenge As Northland continues to rapidly expand its business across Canada, the US, and the UK, the company invests in cutting-edge technology to build a more customized and localized experience for its target markets. Technology and Marketing teams are spearheading initiatives such as a new eCommerce platform, Data Lake, CRM & ERP, and other future-focused Hotel and Restaurant technologies. 
Opportunity Northland is looking for a Reporting Analyst who will be a part of our Data & Analytics team and play a key role in executing the overall data visualization strategy. They will be responsible for designing, developing, managing, and supporting the dashboards/reports using Power BI, emphasizing data quality and visualization principles/standards.
 They will be required to collaborate with our business and technical teams in understanding the business problem and compile essential data into interactive visualizations that are easy to understand and interpret. They will also contribute directly to developing and enhancing data & analytics-related processes and procedures.
 This position is based in Vancouver, Canada and will report to the Director, Project Delivery. They will work closely with the IT, Finance, Marketing, and other internal departments to power insight and provide immersive dashboards to make impactful data-driven decisions.
 Responsibilities:

 Understand, translate and present business data through informative Power BI visuals and reports while designing efficient data models to transform the data into meaningful insights.
 Performs data analysis for verifying and evaluating data requirements, profiling for data quality, cleansing, modelling and prepping the data for visualizations.
 Analyze, design, deploy, troubleshoot and support all aspects of refreshing data sources, scheduling, data, reports and access for Power BI dashboards/reports.
 Works closely with the business and technical teams from the requirements phase by building initial sketches/prototypes to deploying the visualization reports in production systems and participating in the enhancements over time for performance improvements and suggestions.
 Continually monitors and verifies the data quality of visualization reports and develops KPI's/alerts.
 Create plans for testing dashboards & reports, from unit to integration and user acceptance testing.
 Create technical and other supporting documentation, such as metadata, data modelling and data lineage information concerning the dashboards/reports.
 Performs administrative activities as required, including monitoring the platform, data and dashboards security, roles, access and authentications.
 Proactively researches, consults, and recommends best practices, new functionalities and capabilities in Power BI, always seeking continuous improvement.
 Partners with the Project delivery team to establish enterprise-level reporting standards, processes and support models.


 Skills & Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or related field, or equivalent work experience
 Minimum three years of hands-on experience in designing, modelling and building interactive dashboards with Power BI, including writing complex DAX and SQL queries and implementing row-level securities.
 In-depth understanding of Microsoft Power BI ecosystem, Microsoft BI stack (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS) and dimensional data modelling.
 Strong Knowledge of visualization principles, including applying colour hierarchy, visual charts and design-oriented thinking focusing on end-users.
 Expertise working with Excel, SQL Server and Microsoft Azure Data services
 Advanced understanding of Data Management, Business Intelligence and Analytics concepts, including ETL, Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, Data Marts, Data Stores and cubes; Data Profiling, Data Quality, Data Governance, Master Data Management & Metadata Management.
 Creative thinker with excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail
 Able to multi-task and prioritize workload
 Deep passion for data visualization and user experience design
 Strong communication skills with the ability to present information to technical and non-technical stakeholders
 Experience in the hospitality and travel industry preferred

 SUMMATION:
 Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.
 You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.
 **Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.
 **We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**
 **ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Title: Manager Data Analyst (Adobe Implementation)
Description:
Company Description
  Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.



 Job Description
  Your Impact:  You will function as part of a world class Data Analytics team working directly with retail clients in NA & Canada. The role will focus on supporting data collection, reporting and experimentation practices of the client to drive incremental project initiatives through thought leadership.
 Must Have Skills:

Leads initiatives focused on analytics implementation, customization, automation of data collection processes. Develops cohesive measurement strategies and planning that ensures data collection aligns to client’s priorities. Recommends processes for integrating platforms ensuring free flow marketing data between systems.
Have solid analytics implementation experience across the life cycle and digital platforms (including web, responsive and native apps) using Adobe/Google Analytics especially for big retail client’s having complex eco-systems (multiple sites/apps, 100s of custom tags, multiple implementation techniques for main site/syndicate sites etc.)
Works as part of technical analytics team for data framework implementations using (Adobe/Google Analytics, Adobe Target, Google Optimize, Adobe DTM (Adobe Launch), Adobe Mobile SDK)
Design, develop and implement technical tagging requirements for company web, mobile and app platforms. Be able to convert SDR to exact JS code to be added on page or user actions on page.
Develop and perform code modifications, testing and deployment when appropriate
Enhance requirements for digital data layers (event based) within company Tag Management solution (Ensighten, Signal Adobe Dynamic Tag Manager)
Ability to write custom scripting, JavaScript, jquery or other coding languages in web environments and tag management tools to accommodate custom tracking requirements
Create and maintain Adobe Analytics JavaScript tags and plugins. Ability to troubleshoot scripting issues on the digital platforms using browser’s console and other tools is a must
Participate in clients' QA and deployment processes (Agile methodology, etc.). Hands-on experience with one or more web analytics tools such as Omniture SiteCatalyst and debugging tools like Charles, HTTPWatch or WASP
Thorough knowledge of Analytics Workspace, reporting and admin console in Adobe Analytics. Must be comfortable with advanced segmentation capabilities within Adobe/Google Analytics.

 Good to Have Skills:

Experience with implementing AEP (Adobe Experience Platform)
Experience with implementing GA4 (Google Analytics 4)
Develop, design, and implement scripting for A/B multivariate testing technology (Adobe Target, Monetate, Optimizely
Configuring and setting up BI dashboards (Tableau / Looker / Power BI)
Experience with Google Big Query and creating data ingestion pipelines from multiple online and offline sources
Experience working with Adobe IO (using APIs to connect to Adobe suite of products programmatically like Adobe Analytics 2.0) through Web UI’s (like Swagger) or API clients like Postman


 Requirements


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related course of study required or equivalent work experience. Related Master's Degree a plus



5+ years working in analytics, including experience working with tag management systems implementing advertising and tracking pixels, 3+ years digital analytics development experience, 1+ year managing a team of analysts / developers
Excellent understanding of JavaScript, HTML, jQuery, JSON, and DOM manipulation, strong tag management skills, excellent understanding of cloud-based information systems, solid debugging and troubleshooting skills, strong understanding of marketing technology (Martech) landscape, experience leveraging APIs for reporting automation. Foundational Knowledge of Google Big Query, Node.js, CSS, Python, Domo, machine learning concepts.





 Additional Information
  Pay Range: $90,000 - $1,75,000
 The range shown represents a grouping of relevant ranges currently in use at Publicis Sapient. Actual range for this position may differ, depending on location and specific skillset required for the work itself.
 As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hiring@publicissapient.com or you may call us at +1-617-621-0200.

Title: Analyst, Supply Chain
Description:
Les candidats référés ne doivent pas postuler directement pour ce poste.
 

   Toutes les références de candidats doivent d’abord être soumises dans Workday par un collègue de Loblaw actuel.
 

   Lieu:
  1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
 

   Chez Loblaw, nous sommes là pour aider tous les jours des millions de Canadiens, qu’ils vivent leur meilleure ou leur pire journée ou une journée de célébrations. Grâce à nos innovations et à nos produits de qualité, nous sommes présents pour nos amis, nos voisins, nos membres de la famille et nos collègues.
  
 Nous réussissons grâce à la collaboration et l’engagement, et nous avons des attentes élevées envers nous-mêmes et ceux qui nous entourent.
  
 Nous sommes à la recherche de personnes flexibles qui seraient ravies de se joindre à nous dans le but d’aider les Canadiens à « Vivre bien, vivre pleinement »MD. Que vous commenciez tout juste votre carrière, que vous recommenciez à travailler ou que vous cherchiez un nouvel emploi, vous aurez votre place ici. Nous promouvons le leadership à tous les niveaux et soutenons nos collègues dans la poursuite de leur passion.
 


   Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
 


   Job Title: Supply Chain Compliance Analyst
 

   Location: Loblaw Head Office: 1 President’s Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario.
 

   Key Responsibilities:
 

 Provide support to Replenishment, Transportation and Category teams in the form of Vendor Compliance summaries, Service Level impact analyses, metrics on effectiveness of Compliance Programs and vendor performance as well as guidance on Compliance related issues internally and to the vendors.
 Maintain accurate Compliance data of vendor and carrier lists to ensure the accuracy of reporting.
 Review vendor and carrier compliance penalty claims, involve key stakeholders to reach resolution.
 Assist with Carrier pricing compliance data entry into various data bases enabling weekly metric reporting
 Assist with preparation of the Fill Rate Compliance report: update the list of vendors on Fill Rate Compliance for a particular period; and distribute to SCM’s and Category Managers for review and validation; facilitate timely response across all categories, review and consolidate completed reports to identify valid penalties
 Assist with the weekly No Show Report: pull and consolidate DC schedules; consolidate the PO’s recapped as “No Show/Refusal” by DC’s; distribute the report to Replenishment teams for review and validation; facilitate timely response across all categories; review and consolidate completed reports to identify valid penalties
 Assist with vendor setup by tracking and ensuring completeness of submitted Vendor Buying Agreements (Supplier Terms and Conditions). Execute appropriate follow up with vendors, Category and Central Data Management team to facilitate vendor setup.
 Assist with the ongoing VBA data entry and tracking utilizing Sales Force
 Support the operational administration of the LCL Factory Audit and Post Audit Procedure for Audit findings of LCL factories globally. LCL factories are continually audited for Workplace Conditions and Fire and Structural Safety. The resulting audit findings need to be reviewed, assessed and implemented in line with the LCL Corporate Procedure and Risk Ranking Matrix.
 Assist with the ongoing Vendor Factory Compliance data entry and tracking utilizing Sales Force
 Maintain accurate master files for the transportation rates, SAP ship locations for reporting, Operations, Finance and Program Measurement teams.
 Facilitate internal understanding and appropriate application of Compliance Programs. Support the timely updates of the Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and update/development of Compliance policies as required.



   Qualifications:
 

 College or University Degree/Diploma with relevant fields of study in Supply Chain Logistics, Global Business, Industrial Engineer, Economics, Corporate Social Responsibility and/or Compliance or related discipline
 Minimum of 1-3 years professional experience working in related field
 Experience with SQL, MS Access, SAP, SAS
 Ability to work under pressure in a very fast-paced environment
 Strong communication skills are required, as well as attention to detail and creative problem solving



   Loblaw est engagée envers la durabilité, en assurant un approvisionnement intègre et en faisant une différence positive dans la communauté. Nos valeurs ÊTRE – Engagement, Tenir à cœur, Respect et Excellence – guident toutes nos décisions et prennent tout leur sens au sein de notre culture bleue. Nous offrons à nos collègues des carrières progressives, une formation complète, de la flexibilité et d’autres avantages concurrentiels; voilà quelques-unes des nombreuses raisons pour lesquelles nous sommes l’un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada, tant de manière générale que pour la diversité et les jeunes canadiens, ainsi que l’un des employeurs les plus verts.
 


   Type d'emploi:
  Temps plein
 

   Role:
  Poste régulier
 

   Nous nous concentrons depuis longtemps sur la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion, car nous savons que ces valeurs feront de notre entreprise un meilleur endroit où travailler et magasiner. Nous nous engageons à créer un environnement accessible pour nos collègues, nos candidats et nos clients. Les demandes d’accommodement en raison d’un handicap (pouvant être visible ou non; temporaire ou permanent) peuvent être formulées à n’importe quel moment dans l’emploi et dans le processus de candidature. Nous encourageons les candidats à nous faire part de leurs besoins en matière d’accommodement afin qu’ils puissent bénéficier d’occasions équitables.
 


   Remarque
   Les candidat(e)s âgé(e)s de 18 ans ou plus doivent effectuer une vérification des antécédents criminels. Les détails seront fournis dans le cadre du processus de demande.

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
Summary:
 **PLEASE NOTE - This is NOT a technical role for a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or someone with an IT background. Candidates MUST have experience in the Market Data realm and be able to administer Market Data contracts. Please read the description before you apply**
 The Market Data Analyst at S4 Market Data will oversee client projects and be responsible for the overall service delivery of our managed services with respective clients. This position will manage market data service inquiries and projects from clients as well as manage a market data administrator within the projects to ensure administrative tasks are being completed in an accurate and timely manner. The ideal candidate will have market data vendor management and administrative experience; sourcing and negotiating contracts, managing procurement/sourcing requests throughout the spend life cycle, speaking with internal business units and stakeholders (legal, finance, IT, etc.) to procure goods/services for our clients. The candidate needs to be located in the US, this is a fully remote position.
 Responsibilities: 

Handle day-to-day demand management or vendor management and administrative inquiries from internal business units, including but not limited to; data/sourcing requests, contract negotiation, entitlement administration, exchange reporting, moves/adds/changes requests, inventory management, procurement/legal approval, expense allocation, invoices reconciliation, and spend reporting. 
Interact with the client’s various internal stakeholders and business units; technology, legal, accounting/finance, human resources, and investment managers. 
Oversee the inventory management process of leavers/joiners, ensure current inventory is accurate and up-to-date. Oversee the reconciliation invoices and validation of monthly allocations/expenses.
 Conduct monthly/quarterly exchange reporting and ensure exchange policies and data compliance across the client’s end-users and applications. Administer their datafeeds (EMRS, DACS, Etc.)
 Review spend and enact cost savings and avoidance initiatives. Provide respective business units with an overview for their costs; understand their products/services and respond to any inquires as needed. Maintain reports on costs and identify ways to consolidate spend.
 Conducts regular internal team meetings to report on client SLA’s and to ensure all client service deliverables are being met and completed.

 Qualifications: 

Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Business, or related degree and 3-5 years of relevant experience in financial services or market data. Relevant work experience in consulting is preferred.
 Experience working with Market Data vendors such as Bloomberg, FactSet, Exchanges (NYSE, ICE, etc.). 
Knowledge of FITS and MDSL inventory systems is preferred.
 Excellent communication and project management skills and experience in working closely with internal client business units and senior stakeholders.
 An entrepreneurial and self-regulating mind-set. Display a high level of time management skills to manage multiple and elaborate requests simultaneously.
 Have high energy and be a self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

 
GCOmVLUNQE

Title: Technical Data Analyst
Description:
Contract Technical Data Analyst – 6 months
 


   Who We Are
 


   Teranet is an international leader and pioneer in electronic land registration systems and commerce. As the exclusive provider of Ontario’s online property search and registration, we developed, own and operate the Ontario Electronic Land Registration System – one of the most advanced, secure and sophisticated land registration systems in the world. In Manitoba, Teranet owns and operates The Property Registry, providing certification of titles to land, maintains land records and offers reliable information of financial interests in personal property to the public. Teranet also offers a complementary suite of innovative solutions for a number of key industries, including real estate, financial services, law, and government and utilities.
 


   To learn more about who we are visit our website: 
  
   www.teranet.ca
  



   About the Role
 


   Teranet is currently looking for a Contract Seasoned Technical Data Analyst. You will analyze client data to assist in the transformation of data to fit the Catalyst software underlying data structures. You will support our Data Migration Specialists to design scripts to perform data migration between the client legacy system and the Catalyst data structures. You will document the data mappings between the two systems for client review and sign-off.
 


   What will you be doing
 




     Responsible for profiling data across various systems and identify and analyze potential data conflicts.
   


     Work with the technology teams, business and product teams to gather all required information to ensure the right data is being analyzed.
   


     Validate Data Cleansing rules and ensure consistency in instances where across multiple systems are consolidated.
   


     Analyze client’s legacy system data structures, data items and reference data.
   


     Analyze client’s legacy system existing data validation rules.
   


     Create documentation that describes the mappings of customer’s existing data items onto Catalyst data structures.
   


     Create detailed design documentation describing data migration processes including collection of source data, data transfer mechanism and data upload mechanism.
   


     Support the execution of data migrations incrementally and provide resulting data to the business and consultants.
   


     Maintain appropriate levels of data security and privacy relating to customer data including adherence to any specified standards as required by the client.
   


     Draft and maintain documentation for data migration per the prescribed data migration framework
   



   About You
 




     You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline
   


     You have experience with SQL, data migration scripts and libraries
   


     Strong client facing experience and communication skills
   


     Experience with Oracle is an asset
   



   Why Teranet
 


   We are a Canadian company and a global Innovator in electronic services and solutions. We operate one of the most advanced and secure registration systems in the world. We are the market leader in registry, with best-in-class solutions for real estate, financial services, law, and government. We have a fun and collaborative culture, and are one of Canada’s top companies for employee engagement. We are a talent-driven organization and invest in our people and their career growth. We improve the lives and businesses of our clients.
 


   What We Offer
 




     A competitive and comprehensive Total Rewards Package
   


     A company with stability and strong government partnerships
   


     An Opportunity to be part of an organization that is in growth mode through numerous acquisitions
   


     An Opportunity to contribute to our teams and grow the Teranet brand
   


     An environment where you will be challenged and supported on a daily basis
   



   What’s It Like At Teranet
 




     We operate through our core values:
   


     We have received numerous awards for our technologies and our successful partnership with the Government of Ontario.
   


     We have been recognized as one of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 4 consecutive years.
   


     We have a rich history, and we are pleased to make you a part of our exciting future
   



 At Teranet, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.



   Come As You Are. We Like You that Way!
