Title: Developer, Data Visualization
Description:
At Chartwell, we’re all about Making People’s Lives Better for our residents, their families, and our employees. Join an exceptional group of diverse, caring, and passionate people who are inspired to make a difference in their own lives and are dedicated to delivering an experience that is personalized, memorable and feels like home for more than 30,000 residents across the country.
The Developer, Data Visualization will focus on development, maintenance and support of current and future Data Visualization & Business Intelligence applications as well as various other data collection and reporting tools. This includes maintenance of all platforms managed to support said tools. In partnership with third party services providers the Developer, Data Visualization will build Data Visualization tools to replace existing MS Excel reporting tools where Chartwell has reached the technology limits and requires stronger decision-making capabilities. In partnership with internal resources, the Developer, Data Visualization will optimize technologies to meet challenging and changing business requirements in the areas of ad-hoc data collection, report design and ad-hoc querying/dataset provisioning. The Developer will also work closely with business stakeholders in other departments to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support solutions to deliver essential information and analytics tools.


Key Accountabilities
Development & Quality Assurance

Work with business stakeholders, subject matter experts and business analysts to define requirements and development specifications
Work within a pre-defined development lifecycle to produce technologies meeting requirements and following all documentation and approval workflows, ensuring change management practices conform to organization-wide standards.
Collaborate with similarly disciplined roles in other departments to share skills and determine optimal solutions to cross functional problems
Where necessary conduct quality assurance testing of all developed technologies
Work with business stakeholders, subject matter experts and business analysts to ensure user acceptance testing meets requirements.
Develop and database, business intelligence and data visualization tools designed to improve data democratization
Develop and maintain data repositories including reports, dashboards, and information artifacts.
Maintenance and migration of existing MS Excel, Google Sheet and MS Access applications, data repositories and reporting tools.
Facilitate system feasibility studies, proof of concepts, pilot project, and testing.
Ensure the efficient utilization of data resources across different business units
Ensure best practices are established for effective problem resolution for a high availability, 24/7 environment.
Establish and maintain regular written and in-person communications with the organization’s executives, department heads, and end users regarding information-based decision making.

Support & Continuous Improvement

Provide Tier 2 support of all tools maintained and developed
Manage the deployment, monitoring, maintenance, development, upgrade, and support of automation and customization systems
Develop maintenance schedules for automation and customization systems
Analyze existing operations and make recommendations for the improvement and growth of the automation and customization architecture.
Conduct research and remain current with the latest data technologies and solutions in support of future automation and customization procurement efforts.

Qualifications
Education:

Post-Secondary Diploma or University Degree in computer science, finance, business administration, or a related discipline.
Professional training and/or certification in a robotic process automation stream is an asset.
Professional training and/or certification in a development stream is an asset

Experience:

3+ years related work experience.
Strong technical knowledge of current business intelligence and data visualization tools
At minimum proven experience in MS Power BI is required.
Hands on experience in SQL and data manipulation languages
Extensive experience in MS Excel and its data connection and presentation capabilities
Extensive experience in MS Excel application development and security
Strong technical knowledge of other custom application development environments such as MS Power Query, MS Forms, MS Power Apps, etc
Working knowledge of Microsoft 365 and SharePoint Online.

Skills & Abilities:

Ability to understand the interfaces between source systems (ERP, HCM, ITSM, EPM, etc.)
Ability to utilize monitoring tools to evaluate general health of applications from end to end.
Broad understanding of VBA and/or PowerShell and/or other shell scripting is highly desirable.
The ability to work independently, be proactive and self-sufficient is key
Strong team player
Aptitude towards systems and process improvements and re-engineering
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
Process improvement and/or automation experience in the planning area is an asset
Good verbal and written communicator
Ability to communicate effectively with the end-users
Excellent interpersonal communications and the ability to present ideas in a user-friendly format

Title: Senior Data Management Analyst (2)
Description: Senior Data Management Analyst at Top Financial Services Employer  24 Month Contract  Rate: $38 -$40 per hour  (Please note this is not an IT role)  Our client requires a Senior Data Management Analyst providing first line client support, product support as well as data, project & process integrity support. You will liaise and work jointly with team members in global locations to provide 6x24 support coverage; including leading research and analysis of non-standard GPS related data concerns (e.g. security master, new instruments implementation, reconciliation, portfolio position / cash) and act as an escalated point of contact on data reconciliation issue resolution; oversees data reconciliation resolution to a satisfactory and timely completion. Act as a subject matter expert within the team (e.g. Complex Financial Instruments and Investment Strategies, Fund of Fund Process, Cash Management Process, Canadian Lapping, Industry Regulatory Changes, etc.)  An undergraduate degree in Commerce, Accounting, Math or Finance is required. CSC and IFIC is a strong asset. Minimum 5 years' experience working with data management systems and working knowledge of fund accounting is a must as is dealing with custodians. Must have a good understanding of the end-to-end investment services processes including but not limiting to trade entry, trade process, settlement, security master set up/maintenance, valuation, corporate action processing, fund accounting and reconciliation resolution. Must have in-depth and strong understanding of the company' s data flow and the impact of different characteristics of GPS owned data (e.g. positions, cash, security master, prices etc.) have on downstream data consumers and business functions (e.g. compliance, risk, performance, portfolio management, etc.)  This position will hybrid with onsite work in downtown Toronto.    Please submit resumes to: lmilligan@deangroup.ca and/or ssarroca@deangroup.ca  #DGT2

Title: Analyst, Human Resources Organization and Classification
Business Analyst
Description:
Req Id: 378109

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

 Bell Mobility Supply Chain is the entity responsible for the efficient flow-through of product from vendor to customer. As a result of trying to achieve effective product turnover, key supply metrics are required to shed light on the overall performance of sales and distribution. As the SAP/SAS/Oracle Super User, writing code to pull out pertinent information will be required. Duties are to develop and capture raw data from the system and manipulate it into tangible information for making business decisions relevant to supply chain.
 
They must be familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices and procedures. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Will perform a variety of complicated tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. This position requires autonomy and a high degree of initiative and decision-making.
 
Job Duties / Accountabilities

 Own the relationship with the channel primes to determine requirements and support with desired reporting
 Create and maintain reports and tables to allow the business to make the best decisions for their portfolios
 Produce exception dashboards to highlight key metrics
 Create methodology to support the key sales period inventory replenishment model
 Work closely with the Senior Managers of corporately owned channels to identify gaps and provide reporting to support
 Support Inventory Planners with metric reporting to support teams goals and objectives
 Any other duties as required


 SAP & SAS reporting

 SAP & Oracle Super User
 Gather weekly raw data and manipulate it into meaningful reports
 Transfers report findings into meaningful power point decks and presents to senior executives
 Continually looking for ways to improve reporting processes and communicate back to the Sr. Leadership
 Report daily / weekly / monthly KPI’s
 Development of SAS reports that can be utilized by Inventory teams on a daily basis
 Organize business requirements into final reporting solutions
 Manage database and maintain relationship with BI Team to ensure continued upkeep 
In conjunction with BI Team, create data cubes as required

 
System Improvements 

Point person for any system related changes that impact inventory and replenishment for corporately owned stores (Corp & The Source)
 IBP – Integrated Business Planning
 Perform testing with IT, internal and external teams as required


 Essential qualifications and requirements

 Bachelor Degree (Computer Science, Business Systems) or equivalence
 High degree of accuracy and detail for communications both verbal and written
 3 years previous working experience in Reporting / Logistics Management
 3 years practical experience working with ERP systems
 Advanced knowledge of SQL, SAS, Python, SAP and Microsoft Office Tools
 Advanced knowledge in VB Script, VBA
 Medium to Advanced knowledge of SFTP / FTP / SSH / PGP protocols and processes
 Previous systems development experience
 Ability to take business requirements and build database reporting solutions


 Work conditions

 Availability to work some evenings and weekends as required


 #EmployeeReferralProgram

 Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

 Additional Information:

Title: Business Process Automation Analyst
Description:
About connectFirst Credit Union
 As a credit union, we're different than a bank - and we like it that way.
 At connectFirst, we spend our days helping our members achieve their financial aspirations through a community-focused approach to banking that’s true to our co-operative principles. You’re our member, not a number. We’re your neighbours and your partner. Over 80 years ago we started from humble beginnings. Through the years, we’ve grown to become one of Alberta’s leading financial institutions through a desire to connect the dots between your dreams, your goals, your community, and your financial wellness and we echo these desires through our new, consolidated connectFirst brand.
 We believe that banking is about more than money - it’s a cornerstone of every vibrant community and that our members should expect us to positively impact the financial success and viability of the communities that we call home. We invest meaningfully in the potential and well-being of our employees, and what matters most to our members. We have honest conversations about real things, as real people. Our members are owners, they have a say in how we operate, they earn dividends on common shares and investment shares, and they have access to an extensive array of financial products and services.

Our mission: Make money make a difference.
Our vision: Do what's right for every member.
Our values: Think big, act local, take charge, and make it easy.

We’re committed to providing remarkable experiences to our members, our communities, and our employees, and we’re proud to be regarded as one of the best:

Named among Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures™ by Waterstone Human Capital
Recipient of Canada’s Best Managed Companies award for 21 consecutive years
$12.3 billion book of business (Deposits=45%, Loans=43%, Wealth Management=10%, Syndicated Loans=2%)
750 employees

The Opportunity:
 Are your truly excited about the idea of removing the drudergy of old clunky business processes? Do you love to help business teams do their best work by allowing them to focus on building relationships with members? Do you love working with new technologies in the process automation space and leverage RESTful APIs to streamline processes? Do you love translating business needs into technical solutions – what we at one time call business system analysis? If so, they you may well be our next Business Process Automation (BPA) Analyst!
 As a BPA Analyst you will be responsible for developing tactical solutions that automate time-consuming processes, reducing paper-based activities and supporting applications used within our organization. The BPA Analsyt contributes to the research and design of BPA and other automation solutions. This role is responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining automation solutions and solution integrations.
 What You’ll Be Doing:

Collaborating with business teams by actively listening to existing processes, helping to document those existing processes all while thinking about the steps needed to automate time-consuming steps in those processes.
Translating business processes into discrete steps, or collection of steps, to build automation plans and execute on them.
Analyzing data to identify opportunities to increase volume of work automated, as well as improve performance of automation.
Developing proof of concepts for moderately complex opportunities to help the business recognize the feasibility of an automation solution.
Collaborating with various business and technical teams to help develop and ensure delivery of the BPA roadmap.
Translating business requirements to technical specifications – including how RESTful APIs can be orchestrated and leveraged to aid in automation.
Contributing to the design, build and maintainance of BPA solutions including RPA (Robotic Process Automation) Solutions, Scripts, Applications, and Automated Workflows.
Contributing to the design, build and maintainance of data stores supporting automation processes.
Creating, managing and monitoring automated processes and performance through detailed process observability techniques.
Quantifying the impact of current and future automation initiatives.
Working collaboratively with operational and technical teams to deliver projects by assigned deadlines.
Implementing measures to analyze the performance of automated solutions.
Extending the automation platform and user experience.
Conducting unit testing, troubleshooting and remedy defects.
Evaluating and improves existing automation systems and solutions.
Collaborating with teams to integrate systems.
Developing and updating technical documentation.
Analyzing, revising, and documenting work procedures and processes, as well as suggesting methods to increase efficiency and accuracy.
Supporting the implementation of the established annual business plan for the department.
Remaining current on best practices, legislations, regulations, policies and procedures.
Establishing collaborative working relationships with staff in the department and external networks within area of specialization.

What You’ll Bring to the Role:

8+ years experience in information technology with focus in business systems analysis and/or systems development. Alternatively extensive business experience with a keen interest and aptitude in using technology.
2+ years experience in BPA analysis and development is preferred.
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, Management Information Systems or other relevant field.
Ability to understand a business process from a Process Definition Document (PDD) and to conceptualize it as an automated solution.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may also be considered.

Additional Skills and Knowledge That’ll Support Your Success:

Development expertise in Intelligent Process Automation Platforms (for example UI Path, MS Power Platform).
Exposure and / or previous development expertise in Azure Logic Apps.
Experience with interacting with APIs (application programming interfaces) (e.g. RESTful JSON), Scripting (javascript, powershell), and data schemas.
Familiarity with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence concepts.
Excellent computer skills; able to pick up new and existing programs related to the job quickly.
Excellent communication skills; both written and verbal.
Excellent customer service orientation.
Excellent critical thinking and analytical skills.
Excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills.
Excellent attention to detail.

Qualified applicants are invited to apply online.
 We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note applications will only be accepted online and only those applicants under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Planning Data Analyst (Planner Specialist)
Description:
Posting NumberCK52305P
Position TitlePlanning Data Analyst (Planner Specialist)
Job ClassificationPlanner Specialist
No. of Staff Required1
Job TypeFull Time
DivisionPlanning & Development Services
DepartmentPolicy and Planning
Job Summary/Basic FunctionThe City of Kelowna is seeking a Planning Data Analyst with a specialization in GIS and data analytics. This role will conduct research and analysis of housing market trends, economic factors, growth strategy forecasting, housing affordability, and other factors influencing Kelowna’s long-range policies. We are looking for a candidate who will use innovative data science approaches and methodologies/techniques to build workflows and/or models for advanced Geo-spatial analysis. This position will analyze statistics and generates projections in support of specific aspects of planning such as land use, housing, labour force and population; identifies data trends; interprets and explains data and presents in a suitable format.
We are looking for someone who has strong experience in dealing with big data using multiple data sources and regression analysis, spatial/non-spatial econometric modeling, and GIS. Someone who understands municipal planning, data analytics and future social, environmental, and economic trends and enjoys working in a sophisticated technical environment utilizing various modeling and programming tools.
We are looking for positive team players with related experience, great communication skills and a proactive and innovative attitude. A university degree in Planning, Urban Geography, Architecture, or other related discipline and holds professional credibility or is eligible for CIP membership with AIBC.
Duties
Qualifications

University Degree in Planning, Urban Geography, Architecture or other related discipline
Professional Credibility (Eligible for CIP membership of AIBC)
Experience
Communication Excellence
Teamwork

Computer Literacy

Title: Data Analyst - Geophysics
Description:
Sander Geophysics (SGL) specializes in high-resolution airborne geophysical surveys for petroleum and mineral exploration, as well as environmental applications. The company carries out airborne gravity, magnetic, electromagnetic, and radiometric surveys, using fixed-wing aircraft and helicopters.
Sander Geophysics is currently seeking early career Geophysicists to join the growing team. You will be working at the head office location in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, and also at our global field project locations which occur on all continents.
Responsibilities of the Position 

Airborne survey design


Field data acquisition and quality control


Assistance with field operations logistics


GPS and altimeter data processing


Processing of airborne magnetometer, gamma-ray spectrometer, frequency domain electromagnetic, gravimeter and/or methane data


Preparation of data deliveries and technical reports

Required Qualifications: 

University Degree in Earth Sciences, Geophysics or Physics


Experience/Familiarity with geophysical instrument operations


Extensive Computer experience


Willing to travel globally for extended periods


Must have a valid passport or the ability to obtain a valid passport for the purpose of traveling globally


Valid driver’s license


Legally entitled to work in Canada

​Benefits SGL is committed to promoting employee wellness and successful work-life balance. Employee benefits include (but are not limited to):

Comprehensive benefits coverage including health, dental, vision, and paramedical;


Life insurance;


Employee and family assistance program;


Paid vacation, personal leave, and medical leave;


On-site gym; and


On-site parking.

For more information about Sander Geophysics, visit our website www.sgl.com. Please submit your transcripts along with your application (unofficial is fine at this time).
Sander Geophysics is an equal opportunity employer. Please note that only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. We thank all applicants for their interest.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site gym
On-site parking
Vision care

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a strong Data Analysts to become part of our initial core team. You will get to actively work with our customers and help them with any Descriptive Analysis. If you have the necessary proclivity we are happy to give you more ownership and let you own and drive a product area as well. As a Data Analyst, you’ll be an integral part of the Client Consulting and Analytical Team providing thought leadership and best practice approaches to support client projects in the area of advanced statistical and mathematical modeling. The person will be accessing/extracting, analyzing and interpreting customer and POS transactional data with clients to build dashboards, leveraging statistics and mathematics to support business objectives such as price elasticity, price model measurement, marketing mix modeling, price optimization, assortment optimization and ad hoc strategic and tactical client issues.
Requirements:

With 3 or more years of data analytics related experience
With a Masters or PhD degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics with a strong foundation in modeling, statistics, analytics, engineering or math

Must to have skills:

SQL - A pre-requisite for any data job2. Python – Main language to be used in the team to code in our environments.
Azure: Environment we work in. The language used in Azure is mostly Python or SQL, and we can always train how to leverage the tools within Azure, but best if we can benefit from experience
Communication skills - be able to interact with business partner and capture efficiently requirementsGreat-to-have
SQL, MySQL, Oracle, Python


Cloud platform experience: Microsoft, Amazon, Google


Data visualization using Tableau, Qlikview, or Domo


Must be able to work alongside other analytical experts as well as meet with senior level managers to determine requirements for intuitive, creative, analytical solutions.
Gather and analyze business requirements and user specifications * Independently design, develop and document dashboards, reports and analytical tools
Research source data and design queries that bring data into Tableau Interact with and present to clients throughout the development process
Contribute to and help define team best practices around report development, testing, access management, and report refresh scheduling

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Fixed term contractContract length: 24 months

8 hour shift

Remote: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Title: Data Support Analyst
Data Analyst, Technical Operations
Jr. CRM Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Publicis is an omni-channel communications agency with over 600 employees across our Canadian operations. The office is the largest in our industry in Canada and boasts talent across various disciplines of marketing and advertising expertise. Publicis carries a balanced split of Canadian, U.S. and Global clients for which we are Agency of Record. Publicis supports a range of D&I actions through our Driving Change team as well as giving back to the community through a long-standing participation in the Out of the Cold Program. With a strong, active and familial culture, Pub United is the agency’s social club, hosting events as wide reaching as Curling, Trivia Nights and more.



 Job Description
  The Junior CRM Data Analyst is an active member of the Publicis Data & Insights Team. The Junior CRM Data Analyst will be responsible for aggregating, analyzing and providing insights that help monitor, optimize and deliver data driven recommendations to our clients on a regular (weekly, monthly, and quarterly) and ad-hoc basis. This candidate must strive to ensure that the data used in the analytics process is accurate and robust. Candidates must also think strategically to identify issues that need to be optimized or resolved. The Junior CRM Data Analyst will always work proactively to prioritize resources in order to deliver on the tasks.
 As CRM Analyst, you will:

Contribute to analytics projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis
Create and/or maintain dashboards within Data Studio, PowerBI and Adobe Analytics
Contribute and complete to regular reporting, scorecards, and dashboards (weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc requests)
Drive industry leading insights and recommendation on email, SMS, and push campaigns
Assist with efforts to optimize the client’s CRM business.




 Qualifications
  You are an ideal candidate for this role if you:

Think strategically in everything you do
Are intrinsically-driven and celebrate every success
Enjoy a variety of work
Are a logical thinker with creative problem-solving skills
Set high quality standards for yourself and aim to get every detail right
Do what it takes to deliver on your commitments
Enjoy working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment
Welcome and volunteer constructive feedback
Are able to work within both traditional and agile methodologies/processes
Thrive in a collaborative work environment that has an “open door” policy since we literally have no doors in our office.
Are able to maintain constant and effective communication within multidisciplinary project teams
Believe in continuous learning and improvement

 Desired Skills & Experience
 Candidate Experience:

1 year experience in CRM analytics, ideally within an agency setting
1 year experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud and/or Braze
1 year experience Data Studio, PowerBI, Adobe or similar data visualization tools.
Knowledge A/B or multivariate testing and analysis for CRM campaigns
Big plus if you have experience wrangling data using SQL, or Python, creating error free joins

 Candidate Education:

Undergraduate Degree (Marketing, Business, Statistics, Analysis, or other related degrees considered an asset)

 Additional Information
  Publicis Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of our community. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply. If you require a specific accommodation please contact Human Resources at 416-925-7733 or by email at inquiries@publicisna.com

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.
 


   At AXIS, we believe that we are only as strong as our people. We strive to create an inclusive and welcoming culture where employees of all backgrounds and from all walks of life feel comfortable and empowered to be themselves. This means that we bring our whole selves to work.
 


   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for candidates taking part in the selection process.
 


   JOB DESCRIPTION
 

   The Company:
 

   AXIS is a global insurer and reinsurer focused on specialty lines and treaty reinsurance. AXIS is headquartered in Bermuda and operates in North America, EMEA, Asia, and Global Markets (including Lloyd’s).
 

   To support these operations, AXIS is establishing a Finance Center of Excellence in Halifax focused on providing multi-function finance services while developing a key talent pipeline for other finance locations. This provides successful candidates with ample opportunities to add value while defining their own career path. Opportunities exist in multiple areas including Financial Reporting, Risk, Tax, Treasury, and Data Support.
 

   AXIS is currently looking for someone to join our Finance Team as a Business Intelligence Analyst. The successful candidate will be responsible for a variety of analytical and data focus tasks within Shared Services, and be a key liaison between Finance, Corporate IT, Application Development, and Infrastructure functions.
 


   KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 

 Lead data quality efforts, including issue tracking, issue resolution, and management consultation
 Perform reconciliations of multiple data transformation processes
 Support User Acceptance Testing as part of a wider team
 Assist with developing and maintaining control frameworks for multiple business areas
 Analyze business and data transformation processes, identifying opportunities for increased efficiency



   KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
 

 Educated to degree level in Business Administration, Commerce, or related field
 Experience analyzing both Finance and Technology processes, effectively communicating within both areas of business
 Experience in regulatory reporting and compliance, SOX, etc will be an advantage
 Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of products applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
 Experience with Financial systems i.e. Oracle, HFM, Smartview
 Experience with data visualization tools i.e. Power BI, Tableau
 SQL experience would be beneficial



   KEY PERSONAL SKILLS REQUIRED:
 

 Highly motivated and organized to drive company initiatives, showing a strong level of accountability, integrity and professionalism
 Proven ability to meet tight deadlines, work under pressure and respond to changing priorities
 Team player with ability to collaborate with internal and external customers, understand the needs and goals of a customer and actively look for ways to meet them
 Excellent oral and written communication skills, which will include report writing skills and the ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships.
 Highly numerate with strong analytical and problem solvency abilities

Title: Retail Operations Analyst
Description:
What are we looking for?
 This position participates in many cross-functional team initiatives involving the Retail Leadership Team, District Sales Managers, Retail Representatives, Account Managers and Customer Marketing Coordinators. It is essential that this role establishes and maintains effective working relationships with all internal and external stakeholders. This role is a key enabler for delivering on Retail Reporting requests and requirements from the retail business and should seek opportunities to provide Actionable Insights into the sales organization. They are further responsible for taking the initiative to resolve business problems, identify solutions, and challenge the status quo.

 What will be your key responsibilities?
 Our Retail Operations Analyst are responsible for delivering executional excellence in the below ways:

 Responsible for organizing and analyzing data from available data sources to support retail reporting, projects, and initiatives
 Responsible for creating analysis, recommendations, and presentations to support retail initiatives and projects
 Responsible for the development of standard templates, scorecards, and benchmarking capability across teams and regions
 Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized data systems integration, and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations


 What can you expect from Mars?

 Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
 Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
 Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
 An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
We currently have a full time position available for a Business Analyst in our Information Technology department. The position formally reports to the Software Development Manager and will work closely with the . If you are passionate about the ability for technology to drive business performance and you love working various stakeholders to define requirements, this role is for you.
Peace Hills Insurance has a strong history of leveraging technology to enable our business partners to delivery world-class service to our customers. The priority for this role will be to lead business analysis activities within a transformational project focusing on data related projects and minor initiatives. Near term activities include identifying and documenting current data structures, reporting reviews, enterprise data warehouse/data lake development and participation in the project scoping and implementation process.
The successful candidate in this role will have these characteristics:
· High Say-Do Ratio: You do what you say you will do and follow through with commitments. We measure our success not on our plans but on our ability to successfully execute and deliver value to the business.
· Masterful Multi-Tasker: You balance competing priorities and can meet your commitments across multiple projects.
· Active Problem Solver: When you see an issue that has an ability to impact your projects you jump in to resolve the issue to keep the projects on track.
· Innately Inquisitive: You love to tackle a new challenge and learn all about it from every perspective.
· Technology Aficionado: The application of technology to solve business problems is one of your passions. You can look at a business problem and understand how technology can be used to deliver amazing staff, partner, and customer benefits.
· Natural Communicator: You distill complex concepts and problems into clear and easy to understand communications for individuals at all levels of the organization.
· Team Player: You recognize that large transformations are only successful when a team is working together effectively.
· Proven Performer: You have a history of success in large technology-based transformations. You have a history of successfully leading business analysis for complex technology driven transformations.
Your time will be spent:
· Working with the business to gather requirements within a transformational project for data related projects
· Collaborating with the development team to ensure requirements are understood and testable
· Collaborating with the business to ensure that final requirements are tested and signed off
· Working with project managers to identify change management requirements (e.g., communication, training, etc.) and ensure that they are executed successfully
· Collaborating with other internal teams and external vendors to ensure reciprocal business needs or limitations are considered throughout all stages of the project
Prior experience and qualifications of interest include:
· Post-secondary degree in business, information technology, or related field
· 7 years of experience as a Business Analyst
· Experience within system implementation projects
· Experience with business process mapping
· Experience in data mapping, reconciliation
· Exceptional communication skills across a range of forums and channels and stakeholders
· Experience with Atlassian JIRA system or similar
· Experience within enterprise data warehouse/data lake projects would be an asset
· Exceptional documentation and presentation skills
· BABOK/CBAP, or equivalent certification is an asset
· Experience in insurance, financial services, or other highly regulated industries would be considered an asset
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates shortlisted will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Financial & Program Data Analyst Financial Officer 21

It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here.

 Contribute your valued expertise and join this exciting new team!  The Primary Care Division is responsible for setting provincial direction to support achieving a high functioning primary health care system that meets the needs of all British Columbians. This includes developing strategies and policies using a population-based methodology and health sector performance management framework, supporting implementation activities at the provincial, regional and local levels, and measuring and monitoring progress in alignment with the quadruple aim of achieving better health outcomes and experiences for both providers and patients, at sustainable system costs. Further, the Primary Care Division leads reforms that support primary care as the foundation of an integrated system of person and family-centred, full-service, community-based care with a focus on improving attachment and access to quality evidence based primary care services. These reforms are built around team-based care provided through a mix of full-service family practices, Urgent and Primary Care Centres, and Community Health Centres, linked together with one another and with other primary and community care services as part of local Primary Care Networks.  This role will conduct proactive reporting and analysis of financial and other quantitative information pertaining to the Primary Care Division strategic initiatives; participate in the development and maintenance of a framework for setting, measuring, analyzing and reporting on financial and other quantitative performance; and assess and make recommendations on the financial implications of new initiatives.  The capital of British Columbia, Victoria is a beautiful city, with beautiful beaches and harbours, and a variety of provincial parks to explore. Located on Vancouver Island, Victoria offers a bustling downtown scene and has a wide range of restaurants and entertainment venues to choose from. Title: Business Analyst Work Experience Student (Open City & Technology)
Description:
Business Analyst Work Experience Student (Open City & Technology) 4 months 
      

       Job Number : 43797 
      

1 temporary full-time position for 4 months intended specifically for students currently enrolled in a computer science, business technology management or management information systems related co-op or equivalent post-secondary work experience degree program, commencing in September 2022
The Open City & Technology Branch enables information technology required by the City of Edmonton to deliver services. Within this Branch, the Service Management Office section manages operational incidents, problems and changes within ITSM, providing customer interfaces and workflow management systems to monitor service performance and ticket resolution. We are looking for a Business Analyst Student to assist the Service Management Office with operations activities. This position will report to the Team Lead of the Service Management Office.
The successful candidate will gain valuable experience assisting the SMO with:

Support data entry as we migrate TPSS documents and knowledge articles into Remedy
Assist with Data analysis and BI development for reports within Remedy SmartReporting
Assist the Remedy development team with feature testing by rolling out planned enhancements
Participate in governance activities through the Change Advisory Board and assist with Standard Change audits
Review Remedy’s current self-serve environment to document opportunities and recommendations

Responsibilities include:

Produce technical and procedural documents specific to Technical Infrastructure Operations
Assist other Technical Infrastructure Operations team members in day-to-day support duties
Assist with the maintenance and tuning of operational monitoring and performance analysis tools
Assist with the design and development of operational dashboards
Look for opportunities to improve service reliability or performance through monitoring or automation
Contribute to IT Operations projects as required
Other related duties as required

Note: This position will be a combination of working from home and on-site working conditions


       Qualifications : 
       
Currently enrolled in a computer science, business technology management or management information systems related co-op or equivalent post-secondary work experience degree program
Access to reliable internet while working from home
Demonstrated ability using Google Workspace applications
Effective verbal and written communication skills and the ability to maintain strong working relationships
Demonstrated ability to conduct requirement analysis with proven attention to detail
Ability to work independently and make decisions in the absence of a supervisor
Ability to work independently and as a collaborative member of a team
Ability and experience on database and analytics programming (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle SQL) is considered as an asset


Please note, as part of your application, we ask that you attach an unofficial transcript, and an enrollment verification letter (indicating you are enrolled in a co-op or related post-secondary work experience degree program).

The City of Edmonton's Cultural Commitments highlight where we are going as a corporation and define how we do our best work. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/3bH2Ztv
The City of Edmonton is committed to inclusive, respectful and equitable workplaces that represent the communities we serve. Title: Customer Support Analyst
Description:
JONAS SOFTWARE – CONSTRUCTION DIVISION
﻿*What is the opportunity?*
As a Customer Support Analyst you will be a part of the Jonas Construction support team. You will be responsible for providing support for Jonas Construction ERP Software by monitoring ticket, responding to customer calls and resolving cases using troubleshooting skills and product knowledge to train clients on software functionality. A successful candidate requires excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills with the ability to learn quickly in a fast-paced team environment. Previous customer service experience is required.
What will you do?

Provide application support for an integrated ERP accounting construction software by investigating process, accounting and operational cases
Analyze data and user process to find deficiencies in process, reports or software functionality
Have the ability to keep composure under stressful situations
Harness time management skills to effectively and efficiently resolve multiple client issues
Be driven by results to achieve team goals, establishing integrity and trust with the team and clients while remaining customer focused
Serve as primary support liaison between clients and Jonas
Keep clients informed of progression with issues and provide follow up as necessary
Collaborate with other departments or offices as necessary to expedite resolutions
Promote and maintain a high quality, professional, service-oriented company image among clients
Report to the Procedural Support Manager for daily direction and other tasks and the Director of Support for administration

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

Previous experience working in a Contact/Call Centre or in a fast paced financial and/or service industry
Must be able to troubleshoot, multi-task in a fast-paced environment and set priorities within time constraints
Excellent organizational, time management, punctuality and customer service skills
Courteous and professional phone manner, demeanor and attitude are essential
Good team player, yet willing to take personal responsibility for resolution of issues
Proven ability to meet deadlines
Proven ability to problem solve and teach others
Excellent command of the English language (spoken and written)

Nice-to-have

Experience in accounting based applications preferably in Construction and/or related industries a definite asset
Previous application support experience with proven ability to troubleshoot

What makes this a great place to work?
There are many things, but here are the highlights:

Competitive compensation
Extensive in-class and hands on training (Remote)
Comprehensive benefits package
Excellent learning and development opportunities
Rewarding career development and merit based growth plan with access to a variety of job opportunities across the business
Energetic and simulating work environment with annual employee awards and regular department and company events and outings

The Jonas workplace is dynamic, empowering and comprised of motivated self-starters who enjoy the thrill of working in a fast-paced environment. Due to recent growth we are seeking an ambitious person who will learn both our business as well as our clients’ businesses by starting out as a Customer Support Analyst for our Software Support Team in the Construction Division.
You may use the link to apply here too: https://talentmanagementsolution.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/JonasConstruction-Careers/job/Canada---Markham---Ontario/Customer-Solution-Analyst_R29977-2
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Dental care
Employee assistance program
Employee stock purchase plan
Extended health care
Life insurance
Paid time off
Stock options
Tuition reimbursement
Vision care

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
About Us:



   Teleperformance is a worldwide leader in customer experience management and contact center business process outsourcing. Our company employs around 300.000 people working in over 265 dialects and languages, in 80 countries, operating across all business sectors and all continents on behalf of major international companies.
  


   Teleperformance Canada, with more than 1200+ employees, part of the fortune 25 and certified with Great Place to Work, is looking for a group of highly-skilled professionals.
  


 Our Work Culture:



   At Teleperformance, we remain true to our core values of integrity, respect, professionalism, innovation and commitment.
  


 Autonomous - We encourage and trust your decision making skills.
 Progressive work environment- If you have skills to prove we have all ladders for you to grow

 Innovative - All ideas matters
 Inclusive - Everyone is Included and everyone wins
 We work hard and party even harder.

Title: Business Systems Analyst (D365 ERP)
Description:
Position:  Dynamics 365 Functional Analyst / Business Systems AnalystLocation:  Concord, OntarioJob Type:  Permanent, full-time
Our client, a leading player in the real estate industry, is looking for a Dynamics 365 F&O Functional Analyst. They are a small team and will be relying on your expertise to optimize the D365 platform post go-live and acting as the first point of contact for all D365 related issues.
Your new role: 
- Facilitate the successful implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365, and integrated solutions, to enhance business functionality and overall performance- Document the organization’s business or processes or systems, assessing its integration with technology to help in guiding businesses in improving processes, products, services and software through data analysis- Collaborate with the ERP team as required to identify needs and optimize requirements definition and deliverables- Maintain comprehensive end to end, integrated business and systems knowledge, documentation of company processes and changes- Facilitate workshops and discussions with stakeholders and technical teams as required- Provide quality assurance of documentation, testing, configuration and development completed- Train users on D365 and system functionality and create and provide knowledge transfer documentation- Recommend/develop solutions to meet ongoing requirements and paths for improvement- Work with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies- Help identify and gathers enhancement requirements and translate those to the ERP implementation vendor and/or other 3rd party programmers and developers- Help identify and gather requirements for 3rd party applications and helps to develop strategies for implementing them into our environment- Assist with the ongoing design, configuration support and testing of the ERP system- Help support and maintain the company's Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP system and is the company’s first point of contact for user requests and system errors- Work with the ERP team to facilitate all data inquiry, import and export requests, including ad-hoc and data analytic reports via Microsoft Excel, SQL, Power BI or similar tools as appropriate- Manage ad-hoc requests and supporting the team as needed
Key Requirements: 
- 3+ years of related Business Systems Analyst experience within an MS Dynamics environment or in a D365 Enterprise Application Support role- 3+ years of progressively responsible experience in applications and systems support, documenting requirements, as well as business process mapping and analysis- Proven business process analysis and deconstruction skills, including workflow translation and documentation- Knowledge of SQL and experience with system integration are an asset- Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Business Intelligence reporting tools- Strong interpersonal skills along with attention to detail, including the ability to prepare and deliver process documentation, specifications, etc.- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and facilitation skills, including the ability to produce knowledge transfer documents
A great role with full benefits. Their offices are located in Concord – nearest intersections are 407 and Keele and the other 407 and Dufferin. Please note that the selected candidate must be fully vaccinated and available to work on site 4-5 days per week.
Interested? Please send your updated resume at Zhanna Zajac.
OUR VIRTUAL DOORS ARE OPEN! We’re also bringing the interviews to you by various web applications, virtually! Contact us today for your next opportunity.

Title: Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 378792

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

 Are you ready to grow your career by taking on a new role at Bell? We always look for qualified internal applicants within our own team to support their development.

 Bell Residential provides the most innovative, industry-leading Internet, TV and Smart Home products and services to Canadians. Whether we are tackling a new challenge, implementing a big idea, or selling an innovative new feature our team puts in the effort to be Canada’s #1 communications company. The Consumer Business Intelligence team collaborates with partners across the organization and provides strategic guidance supported with data. We work with the latest and greatest BI technologies like Teradata, SAS and MicroStrategy. We enable better results through an integrated market view of customers.
 
Reporting to the Senior Manager of Business Intelligence, the Specialist Business Intelligence will be responsible for the management and optimization of data flows to support Revenue Reporting and Self-serve. In an ever-changing and dynamic environment, the candidate should be flexible, have strong time management skills and be capable of balancing many project simultaneously with short deadlines for completion. The Specialist Business Intelligence will work in a cross-functional team environment.

 Primary Responsibilities:

 Communicate with Business and Marketing stakeholders to gather and assess requirements.
 Design and propose suitable solutions to the Business needs in collaboration with the rest of the team.
 Ensure the validity and integrity of Revenue reporting data and processes.
 Respond in a timely manner to ad-hoc requests from team members from the Bell Residential Services, Mobility and across Bell.
 Participate in the overall project life cycle with the larger team to ensure timely and successful project completion.
 Investigate data/process anomalies; propose and implement solutions.
 Take ownership and accountability for deliverables, communicate proactively and escalate when required.
 Act as a subject matter expert on reporting revenue data to support business primes with a deep understanding of data, tools capabilities and technology infrastructure


 Competencies / Skills:

 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or other Bachelor’s Degree equivalent from a recognized educational institution
 Solid experience with SAS and PL/SQL programming tools.
 A minimum of 3 years of experience with Oracle, Unix, NCR-Teradata.
 A minimum of 3 years of experience with EDW environment.
 Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and web programming (HTML, Java, ASP, .NET).
 Knowledge of the telecommunications business is an asset.
 Demonstrable history of cross-team collaboration.
 Extremely rigorous with regards to the data and information provided.
 Ability to work on their own, with a minimum of supervision within a dynamic environment.
 Ability to work and manage multiple projects simultaneously and to meet deadlines.
 Well organized and Customer driven.
 Ability to engage and persuade business users.
 Team player with excellent organization and people skills

Title: Systems Analyst - Scripting, SQL - Charles River Development
Description:
Who we are looking for
 

   Charles River provides an end-to-end solution to automate investment management functions across asset classes on a single platform. Delivered as a hosted service, the solution improves data quality and investment professional productivity, controls risk and lowers technology costs. The Systems Analyst will manage and support all aspects of production Charles River IMS systems for multiple clients as part of Charles River Saas Operations and SaaS strategy. Working closely with clients, provide application administration and support for client production.
 


   Why this role is important to us
 

   The team you will be joining is a part of Charles River Development (or CRD), that became a part of State Street in 2018. CRD helps create enterprise investment management software solutions for large institutions in the areas of institutional investment, wealth management and hedge funds. Together we have created first open front-to-back platform - State Street Alpha, that was launched in 2019.
 

   Join us if delivering next generation infrastructure, using emerging technologies like AI and Blockchain sounds like a challenge you are up for.
 


   What you will be responsible for
 

   As a Systems Analyst you will
 


   What we value
 

 User administration/privileges
 Configuration and testing of software changes and operational processes
 Interface/integration configuration, testing, and support
 Assistance resolving escalated problems
 Migration of changes and problem resolutions to production environments
 System availability
 Performance troubleshooting
 Charles River IMS and database software patches
 Charles River IMS version upgrades
 Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery assistance
 Working with CRD colleagues to smoothly transition new clients to production operation.
 Working with vendors as partners to deliver a tightly integrated, seamless service to Charles River Clients.
 Participation in the development and on-going refinement, enhancement and continuous process improvement for the services.
 Participation in the investigation, implementation, and operation of 3rd party tools to enhance/improve, automate, and streamline the delivery of the services.



   Education & Preferred Qualifications
 

 A BS degree in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a BA in Finance or Business with an IT concentration.
 A minimum of 4+ years of progressively responsible experience.
 Experience in managing and supporting mission critical production software applications is required.
 Experience with SQL, MS SQL Server
 Proven ability to work in a mission-critical operations and production support environment.
 Experience or familiarity with servers and networks is preferred.
 Proven ability to partner with various internal departments to deliver superior customer service.
 Break down moderately complex processes into simple and reliable components.
 Experience with automation using scripting languages such as Python/ Perl and PowerShell.
 Excellent customer service skills, technical troubleshooting skills, and interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
 Database software or IT technical experience.
 Charles River IMS or securities trading software experience is preferred.
 A background in portfolio management and trading system applications is preferred.
 Any experience with the following is preferred: databases, server operating systems, servers, networks, job scheduling software, system monitoring software, clusters/high availability systems, Disaster Recovery/Business Continuity, FIX.
 Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 Ability to manage multiple, simultaneous priorities.
 Proven organizational skills with attention to detail.
 Ability to achieve results without close supervision.
 Self-motivated with the ability to operate independently and also has the strong desire to work as a member of a team.
 Demonstrated practical, hands-on, “can-do” approach, and the ability to work efficiently and creatively.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Flexibility with schedule and ability to work beyond regular business hours for period off hours support.



   Additional requirements
 


   About State Street
 

   What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.
 

   Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary in locations, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Program to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.
 

   Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspective are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome the candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift program and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.
 

   State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
 

   Discover more at StateStreet.com/careers

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (BI)
Description:
Overview: 
 
   KPMG is an industry leading firm that serves clients on a variety of specialized projects that help them to work smarter, grow faster and compete better.
 




  Why join our contract workforce? 
 

Interesting work: Deliver work that matters to you. We provide the opportunity to get involved in highly technical, complex and interesting projects where you can leverage your specific skillset and expertise to add value.
 Enrich your skills: Access to best-in-class technology, market intelligence and resources to advance your unique technical skills and expertise. Work alongside diverse, passionate and highly skilled professionals working together to drive innovation. 
Flexible opportunities: Find projects that match when and where you want to work.



 The opportunity




     We are looking for skilled Intermediate to Senior BI Analysts to fill current and future contract engagements. Candidates will be placed in the Contract Talent Network and will be the first to be notified of, and considered for, upcoming contract positions. These roles will address guiding our clients in data collection, data processing and the choice of visualizations, dashboards and KPIs. You will be working with a team to mine data, transform data and develop business intelligence tools. Ultimately, you’ll help us turn data into knowledge using business intelligence and analytic solutions.
   
 What you will do: 
 
Overseeing BI projects under your control from start to finish
 Producing insightful reporting outputs to assist our clients
 Utilizing data analytics tools and visualization platforms
 Identifying trends and areas for BI analysis.
 Educating clients and internal partners on the role of business intelligence
 Expanding the BI capabilities and outputs across KPMG
 Using data visualization techniques to present information
 Collaborate with business stakeholders and data engineers to document business requirements for BI solutions, including reports, dashboards, and analytical deliverables.
 Your qualifications: 
 
5+ years’ experience with a Bachelor’s degree in data analytics, computer science, economics, finance, or related field is preferred
 Have knowledge and work experience:
   
 For the development of dashboards using various technological tools, such as: Power BI, Excel, SAS or others;
 In data stewardship and its tools (mapping, standardization and harmonization of data);
 With multidimensional or tabular data models, warehouses, data lakes, and visualization tools such as Power BI in the context of projects with large volumes of data;
 On complex data integration projects such as ETL/ELT and analytics and development platforms such as Azure DevOps.

 Have knowledge of Python programming
 Bilingual (French and English) is an asset
 Our Values, The KPMG Way: 
 
 Integrity, we do what is right | 
  Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | 
  Courage, we think and act boldly | 
  Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | 
  For Better, we do what matters
 


 KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice. For more information about Inclusion, Diversity & Equity in Recruitment, please click here.
 


 For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.
 


 If you have a question about accessible employment at KPMG, or to begin a confidential conversation about your individual accessibility or accommodation needs through the recruitment process, we encourage you to contact us at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or phone: 
  416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778.

Title: Business Customer Analyst – Digital Personalization & Analytics
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
We are seeking an experienced Business Customer Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst will play a critical role on the Loyalty Customer Personalization, reporting into the Manager of this function. Working across several business lines, the Business Customer Analyst will have both technical and business expertise to help CTC reach its 11 million active loyalty customers across web, mobile apps, email, and social media channels to build awareness, grow loyalty and increase conversion. 
What you’ll do 
In this role, you will help create loyalty and reward program experiments that are effective, data-driven and omnichannel in nature. Aggregating data from various sources, you’ll help design, test, launch and report on experiments and programs that inspire growth among our key customer bases: 

Translate business requirements into technical specifications and identify areas of operational improvements 
Leverage loyalty customer data to analyze, design and evaluate business initiatives, measure effectiveness and deliver key insights 
Build propensity and A/B tests to drive customer responsiveness in campaigns and experiments 
Oversee reporting for campaigns and experiments to translate into actionable insights and future opportunities 
Execute the channel marketing strategy, focused on increasing performance, loyalty customer experience, and improving discoverability 
Activate highly engaging organic and paid media campaigns that support sales, brand, and demand generation objectives. 
Track daily, weekly & monthly KPIs to identify opportunities for improvement. 

What you bring 

B.A. in Marketing or Business preferred 
1+ years of experience (preferably retail experience) in an analytical role 
Strong foundation in SQL for complex data analysis 
Strong acumen to navigate through Google Analytics and Quantum Metric analytical tools 
Excellent communicator 
Proficient in all Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel and Access 

Bonus points if you have experience in: 

Working knowledge on data analytics platforms such as Google Cloud platform, Hadoop and automation workflows such as KNIME. 
Working knowledge of email marketing programs and digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook, and Instagram. 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
#LI-GM1 



  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. CTR Marketing 
 

  Ontario-Toronto 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time

Title: Junior Market Analyst - Intern
Description:
Husky Technologies TM a company with a strong foundation built on innovation, close customer relationships, a strong sense of community and a unique culture and values. We are looking for people with the inspiration and talent to develop with us as we pursue our ambitious growth strategy.
 Husky Technologies TM offers a wealth of opportunity for personal growth and development. Most importantly, Husky Technologies TM offers an opportunity to work with – and be challenged by – a team of great people. Our success is possible because of the creativity, intelligence and passion of our people around the world and their desire to lead change. At the same time, we are not afraid to expect a lot and strive for leadership in all of our key markets. We are a company taking on new challenges and for the right people this means exceptional career development opportunities, the chance to be part of a team that is the best in the world at what we do and the experience that comes from working in an environment that demands constant transformation and innovation.
 Husky Technologies TM Canadian manufacturing facilities and global headquarters are located in Bolton, Ontario on a large, beautiful campus located just 20 minutes north of Toronto’s Pearson International Airport. Features include a fitness and wellness center, intramural sports activities, on-site cafeteria, and clean, state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities with outstanding safety records. We offer a great work environment and competitive total compensation package, including above market retirement savings plan and market competitive group benefits.
 Husky Technologies TM is an exciting company with tremendous potential. We have a great team and great expectations. If you are attracted to bold goals, believe in uncompromising honesty, support mutual respect, care about environmental responsibility, have a passion for excellence and a desire to make a positive contribution – then we want you to join the Husky Technologies TM team!










This role will be part of the Global Marketing intelligence team and will be responsible for gathering quantitative and qualitative data to support with prospecting and lead generation initiatives. The successful analyst will extract, analyze and translate raw market data into effective visualizations, reports and presentations, which will be used to drive and support new business development initiatives
 RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate with Market Research Leads to execute intelligence activities to keep internal stakeholders informed about the latest economic, consumer, industry and customer/competitor trends
Data Acquisition: Extract, clean-up and compile datasets, news, and trends from primary and secondary data sources
Data Analysis: Interpret data and translate into visualizations and summaries that support proactive insights and recommendations
Insights & Reporting: Routine presentations of data summaries and insights to Market Research Leads. Support compilation of Global & Regional Market Reports.
Support continuous improvement initiatives to review, enhance, streamline the team’s data management processes, leveraging the latest tools, technology, and best practices. 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Currently enrolled in an undergraduate program such as Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics, Engineering or related. 
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills; ability to quickly interpret large amounts of data
Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience creating and working with pivot tables. 
Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadline constraints; positive, can-do attitude.
Strong communication and presentation skills; Highly creative and innovative
Self-starter with an ability to work independently and in collaborative team settings as needed
Knowledge/ Experience within the Injection Molding and the Packaging industry would be considered as asset. 
Knowledge of statistical packages is an asset












Husky Technologies TM offers a competitive compensation and benefits package and excellent opportunities for growth and advancement. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and respect, value and welcome diversity in our workplace. Husky Technologies TM also values being a great place to work and strives to maintain a safe workplace. Accordingly, Husky Technologies TM conditions all offers of employment on satisfactory completion of background checks.

 Husky Technologies TM is committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the member of the Talent Acquisition team in a timely fashion of any disabilities that requires accommodation measures in order to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.
 Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
 No agency or telephone inquiries please.

Title: AI/ML, Analyst
Description:
Req Id: 378093

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.

 The Bell Speech Technologies team is an industry leader with deep expertise in automatic speech recognition and speech analytics. You will be working with an excellent team of peers to build products and services that deliver on the promise of AI by solving complex, high-value business problems. You will work in a highly collaborative environment, and use Agile methodologies to understand, develop, and iterate on solutions that meet customer needs. Access to innovative speech to text and natural language tools, all within a cloud environment.
 As a Data Analyst in Customer Operations Data Science, you will work on projects that take on some of the most cutting-edge business solutions in the Telecommunications industry. Reporting to the Senior Manager - Advanced Analytics, your knowledge of strategy and operations combined with your communication skills and analytical rigour will shape the way that we do business.

 Job Duties/ Accountabilities:

 Work cross-functionally with customer operation’s teams to build and maintain automated and ad hoc reporting assets
 Leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations
 Analyze ML model results to showcase added business value and create actionable insights for stakeholders
 Help the business “connect the dots” and understand “the big picture” – and to never loose sight of this.
 Work with and present to various management levels


 Critical Qualifications/ Competencies:

 An undergraduate degree in business/commerce, applied math, applied science / engineering, economics/econometrics, management science / operations research, or related area
 2+ years of SQL experience using enterprise production level data.
 Experience with SQL (Teradata), SAS and visualization software (MicroStrategy/Tableau).
 Experience creating BI reports/dashboards and conducting deep-dive data analysis.
 Ability to break down complex problems into smaller actionable pieces.
 Effective process/project management skills and the ability to navigate and influence stakeholders.
 Self Motivation and drive to deliver high-quality solutions
 Excellent communication skills with the ability to comfortably interact with team members, partners and executive management.
 Experience in telecommunications, retail or consulting industries.
