Title: Senior Data Research Analyst
Description:
The Role:
 

   DBRS Morningstar is seeking an Senior Data Research Analyst to join the Credit Data team within Credit Operations, located in Toronto. The Senior Data Research Analyst is part of the team responsible for maintaining critical credit ratings and origination data. In this role, you will be asked to gather and interpret data requirements, perform research and analysis, and data mappings from multiple sources. The Senior Data Research Analyst will partner with our technology team to assist in the development and testing of new requirements when necessary. This position would also be expected to lead key data projects within DBRS Morningstar, such as partnering with Credit Practices with work on performance metrics and analytics around our rating actions. This position will report into the Data Director, Data Analytics located in Toronto.
 


   Responsibilities:
 

   Hands-on development will be an integral part of the responsibilities
 

 Conceptualizing, building and maintaining pre-aggregated datasets, reports and other analytical products (data feeds)
 Developing insights on large scale data, performing ad-hoc data cleaning and statistical analysis as needed
 Communicating results to rating analysts, senior management and other key stakeholders
 Developing and automating reports for regulators and other external parties
 Mentor and guide junior members of the team



   Qualifications
 

 A minimum of 2 years’ experience working as a senior data analyst using Python and SQL, with a total experience of 4+ years
 Skilled in Tableau or Power BI (data visualization experience a must)
 Exposure to database management
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 A bachelor’s degree in engineering or finance field



   Nice to have
 

 Knowledge of Fixed Income and Capital Markets
 Experience with Bloomberg and/or Thomson Reuters terminal
 Experience developing using Git or other workflow systems
 Experience with AWS & Cloud Applications



 Morningstar employees are required to be fully vaccinated or submit to regular testing to work in any office. Morningstar’s vaccine policy may be modified to comply with evolving legal requirements and other changing circumstances.



   About Us
 

   DBRS Morningstar is a global credit ratings business, currently with 700 employees in eight offices globally. Formed through the July 2019 acquisition of DBRS by Morningstar, Inc., the ratings business is the fourth-largest provider of credit ratings in the world.
 


   DBRS Morningstar is committed to empowering investor success, serving the market through leading-edge technology and raising the bar for the industry. DBRS Morningstar is a market leader in Canada, the U.S. and Europe in multiple asset classes.
 


   DBRS Morningstar rates more than 2,600 issuers and 54,000 securities worldwide and is driven to bringing more clarity, diversity of opinion, and responsiveness to the ratings process. DBRS Morningstar’s approach and size provide the agility to respond to customers’ needs, while being large enough to provide the necessary expertise and resources.
 


 If you received and accept an offer from us, we require that personal and any related investments be disclosed confidentiality to our Compliance team (days vary by region). These investments will be reviewed to ensure they meet Code of Ethics requirements. If any conflicts of interest are identified, then you will be required to liquidate those holdings immediately. In addition, dependent on your department and location of work certain employee accounts must be held with an approved broker (for example all, U.S. employee accounts). If this applies and your account(s) are not with an approved broker, you will be required to move your holdings to an approved broker.

MJB Technology Solutions is looking for a ServiceNow Business System Analyst (BSA) with following skills as part of our team: 
The ServiceNow Business System Analyst provides strategic business analysis services to business partners.
The focus of this position is to work closely with the business stakeholders to gain in-depth understanding of business strategy, requirement, processes, services, roadmap, and the context in which the business operates.
This role is a key to understanding the documenting capabilities needed to address business challenges.
The ServiceNow BSA must be able to deliver first rate analysis in complex cross functional/multi-platform situations with the absolute minimum of supervision.

Working in partnership with business teams to:
Understand and map current state end-to-end customer journeys and business processes in the corporate repository
Facilitate/drive the design of target state journeys/processes and map them in the corporate repository
Working in partnership with business and technology delivery teams to capture, analyze, define, and document deliverable business change requirements and non-functional requirements

Ability to adapt and learn quickly and execute seamlessly.
Ability to status report, monitor progress and quality effectively, remain detail oriented at the same time understand the big picture.
Self-motivated.
Ability to negotiate and manage expectations across the board.

Title: Business Analyst IAM
Description:
Company Description
  Talan Canada is growing and looking to strengthen its team with a Business Analyst IAM for the Montreal office, who will be interested in working with clients from multiple industries.



 Job Description
  The main tasks are:

 Support / Onboarding:
   
 Be Single Point of Contact to onboard application on IAM solutions (SSO + IAM)
 Capture the requirements of users that ease the adoption and push it to the Product Owner
 Ensure of the stability and availability of the services/tools for IAM
 Ensure to operate the services in compliance with the security rules
 Communicate on incidents

 Participate to reduce the online support activity by:
   
 Promoting the Self service
 Enhance the existing documentation
 Identify automation of recurrent tasks

 Spread the knowledge
   
 Liaise with teams in Bangalore and Paris
 Contribute to the documentation and spread the good usage of the tools
 Promote the SSO solution of the group by holding presentation session
 Animate Hands-on session with applications.





 Qualifications
  Technical Skills:

 Desired: IAM, AD/LDAP, OIDC, SAML2, basic network, API, Git, Unix
 Plus: Python or any language, ELK stack, SQL
 A curiosity on security field is mandatory.

 Soft Skills:

 Practical sense: the candidate must suggest pragmatical solutions to fit the need of the user while respecting the quality standards.
 Analysis and synthesis: be able to understand complex problems involving multiple IT teams or users.
 Organisation and planning: be able to manage his working time autonomously and have a strong sense of priority
 Perseverance and result oriented: Demonstrate self-exigence. Perseverance to find a solution, despite the difficulty. Stay positive. Focus on the outcome.
 Oral and written communication: adapt your message to capture the attention of your audience. The candidate should able to communicate with developer, business analyst or manager.
 Client centric and sense of service: To identify needs, the candidate must understand the reasons and motivations of the users of the platforms. He must direct his tasks according to their work habits, while helping them to evolve.
 Cooperation and Team Spirit: He must work in good agreement with the members of the IAM teams all around the world and other teams like security and infrastructure team.

 Languages: English (mandatory), French (nice to have)
 Experience needed:

 3 years experience in support, business or developer analyst and be knowledgeable on Identity Access Management domain.

 Educational Requirements:

 Bachelor of computer science or other related university degree

 You must live in Montreal or be willing to relocate rapidly from anywhere in Canada and possess a valid work permit.
 Additional Information
  Talan is a consulting firm specializing in digital innovation and transformation. For over 20 years, Talan has been advising, supporting, and implementing transformation projects for businesses and public authorities, in France and abroad. With operations on five continents and nearly 5,000 consultants, the group anticipates a revenue of 600 million euros in 2022 and expects a turnover of 1 billion euros by 2024. The group places innovation at the heart of its development strategy and is involved in areas of technological change affecting major corporations, such as Big Data, the Internet of Things, Cryptocurrencies, and Artificial Intelligence.
 Joining Talan also means:

 Joining a Canadian group with more than 500 consultants, working in an agile and pragmatic way with large companies (Finance, Insurance, Telecommunications, Services, Distribution, Public sector) by combining consulting services / technological expertise / innovation / ability to deliver and deploy projects
 Joining dynamic teams, where the role of the employee is at the center of attention, with the desire to create spaces allowing everyone to flourish
 Participating in different communities to contribute to development and to innovate, all with a strong team and entrepreneurship spirit

 Talan is a great playground, it's up to you!

Title: Business Analyst Postgraduate Student (12 months)

The scope of this role includes: reporting & analysis, data visualization, end-user tool development, process mapping & process improvement.The candidate will be involved in all phases of the development of business solutions, from the identification and analysis of opportunities, through to implementation and ongoing support. Exceptional communication skills with the confidence and passion to share knowledge

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mennonite Economic Development Associates (MEDA) invites applications for Data Analyst to join our dedicated and talented Monitoring & Impact Measurement team in our mission to create business solutions to poverty!

 MEDA’s work is built on a foundation of Mennonite business roots and faith-based values, within the global context of the UN Sustainable Development Goals. We believe business solutions are effective interventions to address poverty. Through a market-systems approach and strategic partnerships, MEDA enables access to finance and provides business and technical expertise to build transformative agri-food market systems that create decent jobs, allowing traditionally excluded groups to become active participants in a sustainable economy. MEDA welcomes all who share our values and want to join us in our mission. To find out more about MEDA, please visit our website at www.meda.org.

 Position Summary

 The Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Reporting to the Director, Monitoring and Impact Measurement (MIM), the Data Analyst is responsible for providing support to the MIM team by working closely with the other MEDA staff members. The Data Analyst will contribute to planning and implementing leading edge support services with a focus on the introduction of innovative data approaches and providing excellent client service. International travel is a requirement for approximately 20-30 days per year.


 Job Status: Full Time 
Start Date: August 2022
Location: Waterloo, Ontario (Hybrid work arrangement available)



 RESPONSIBILITIES

 Monitoring and Impact Measurement (MIM) (50%)


 Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytic systems
Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets
Create effective reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization
Proactively retrieve and analyze data to answer key questions from different MEDA teams 
Create and maintain interactive visualizations dashboards and reports by analyzing and integrating multiple data sources
Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources and maintain databases
Develop data gathering and reporting mechanism for corporate level strategic data
Provide technical expertise in integrating information technology into data collection and evaluation efforts 
Support the MIM Director to develop and/or maintain a technical strategy which outlines core data gathering and analysis approaches, learning and measurement mechanisms, training plans, networking and thought leadership
Support the MIM Director in providing technical leadership to the development of proposals, in close collaboration with Regional Directors and other stakeholders to ensure full integration of data system innovations and lessons learned as applicable
Participate in relevant internal and external meetings and events
Identify opportunities to showcase MEDA’s MIM practices



 Knowledge Management (KM) (50%)


 Support MIM/KM Director in implementing KM strategy, standards and processes
Develop and promote KM standards and guidelines, best practices, and state-of-the-art approaches among MEDA staff.
Collaborate with other Global Programs, Technical Specialists, Digital team and other internal stakeholders to ensure that data is accessible to relevant MEDA staff 
Support the MIM/KM Director in designing and disseminating dashboard (s) that tracks and presents KM metrics.
Continuously review MEDA’s internal knowledge management systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data
Participate in relevant internal and external meetings and events
Identify opportunities to showcase MEDA’s KM practice



 REQUIREMENTS

 Education: University degree in data science related (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science) or an equivalency acquired through formal education, work experience and self-learning.

 Experience: Minimum three years’ experience in data analytics and database management related to international economic development.


 Technical: Strong computer skills and familiarity with MS Office (e.g. Excel, Access)/Power BI/CRM. Demonstrated knowledge and experience to conduct quantitative/statistical data analysis.

 Additional Qualifications:

Appreciation and support of MEDA’s mission, vision and values.
Understanding and appreciation of business principles, international development and MEDA’s approach of creating business solutions to poverty.
Written and verbal presentation as well as interpersonal communication skills.
Demonstrated written and analytical skills in program design.
Efficiency in organizing and prioritizing several tasks at once. Strong attention to detail and quality. 
Proficiency in a foreign language is an asset.
Excellent computer skills.
Ability and willingness to travel internationally up to 20-30 days per year



 APPLICATION DEADLINE: Thursday, July 7, 2022 @ 4:00 pm EDT

 MEDA is an equal opportunity employer and accommodations are available during all phases of the recruitment process. We ask that any applicants requiring accommodation make their needs known in advance.

Title: Sales Operations Analyst
Description:
Our team is expanding...Join us at Citron as a Sales Operations Analyst!
At Citron Hygiene, we know that great companies start with great people.
Citron Hygiene has spent the last 45 years earning the trust of the world’s most prestigious clients, one customer at a time.We provide solutions that encompass washroom and workplace hygiene
products and services to ensure building owners and managers can address their facility’s needs. Our global reach, expanding network of world-class partners, product and service breadth, training, and experience make us a valued partner for companies of all shapes and sizes. Join us and be part of our vision to help create an elevated washroom experience that enhances and preserves business' brand!
Position Overview: 
Reporting to the Head of Sales Enablement, this role is primarily responsible for gathering and analyzing data to improve the effectiveness of the sales organization and communicating the results to management. The incumbent manages large data sets from multiple sources to provide analytical insight into sales performance. This role will develop key performance analytics for the management team, develop new reporting methods and continuously improve existing tools and models which provide additional visibility on sales performance.
Responsibilities: 

Develop and reconcile Salesforce CRM report with the system generated reports.
Measures individual sales rep results and provides insight into performance such as the impact of tenure and performance by country.
Conducts sales performance reporting and analysis at the branch/region/country level and monitors trends highlighting areas for sales focus.
Provides customer contract penetration analysis and contract renewal activity reports,
Conducts profitability analysis at a customer level to ensure desired targets are achieved
Assists with the calculation and processing of the Sales commission process (monthly and quarterly)
Administers and maintains sales data accuracy within the Salesforce (CRM) tool
Updates both sales territory information and account manager books of business in Salesforce Creates ad-hoc reports as required

Qualifications: 

Experience extracting information from Salesforce and building customer Dashboards
Strong analytical combined with innovative problem-solving skillset
Good knowledge transferring skills with an ability to present findings in a logical & relevant format (verbal & written)
Good understanding of object-oriented databases and logical relationships
Strong mathematical and statistical skills (data sets , variance, hypothesis testing)
Expert attention to details and accuracy, able to conduct root-cause investigations
Strong business modelling and information management skills
Hands on and detail oriented and able to work well with multiple priorities
Strong time management and ability to meet deadlines
Results oriented with a sense of urgency
Customer oriented – strives to exceed internal customer expectations
Clear consistent and reliable communicator
Comfortable in a fast-paced dynamic environment

Requirements: 

1- 2 years experience with data analysis and reporting (including sales data, sales performance, commission calculations, pricing etc.)
Good understanding of compensation plans and programs
Pricing analysis experience is a plus
Experience or knowledge in using Salesforce
Advanced level of knowledge in MS Excel, VBA and Access and experience of MS Office Suit, Excel, and Access, PowerPoint
An in-depth understanding of data reporting tools and methods
Education equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in commerce and/or business studies preferred, or the equivalent in related work experience.
Must be legally entitled to work at the specified location/region without requiring any sponsorship
Fully vaccinated

Citron Hygiene welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
To be considered in the final step, successful Citron applicants will be asked to present their proof of full- vaccination status unless there’s an approved religious or medical exemption.
We move fast here at Citron and we aim to give our candidates a pleasant and expedited hiring process!

Do you have experience with the calculation and processing of the sales commission (monthly and quarterly)

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst, your curiosity never ends. The next question is always on your mind, helping you to understand how data science fits in the big picture of a project. Of the five sub-disciplines of Marketing Science—tracking and measurement, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration, and statistical modeling—you're a rock star in at least two. Most importantly, you've got a solid understanding of how they all fit into a project, and you're looking to hone your craft in areas you're unfamiliar with. Also, gaining some leadership experience by providing guidance to junior analysts on daily project deliverables is definitely something you're up for.

You will:

Understand what the data means and where it fits into the clients' business.
Create data transformation procedures and calculations to prepare data for analysis.
Design & build data-driven dashboards that empower business decisions.
Ensure proper communication between the Marketing Science team and other disciplines.
Approach analysis process logically to demonstrate how data lead to conclusions.
Drive collaboration within teams to provide support, share skills, and gain insight.
Confidently manage project delivery expectations and communications to project team.

You have:

Advanced experience in building data-driven dashboards. (Experience with Tableau a plus)
A thorough understanding of end-to-end data pipelines and transformation processes.
A detail-oriented mindset with exceptional organization skills.
Strong time management skills to ensure accurate delivery.
Confidence in your communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to efficiently communicate deliveries and delays of project with follow-ups as needed.
Well-organized approach to working on multiple projects at once.
Passion to always improve your team's craft through ongoing learning and support.

If you are an individual with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please reach out to accommodations@criticalmass.com.

Title: Sr. Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
Description:
Job Summary: 
 
   Working with clients from other departments and with other Information Technology team members, the Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst provides tools to support good business decisions. The tools are typically reports, dashboards, KPI Scorecards etc, used to analyse/summarize data sets from multiple sources and are intended to give business users access to useful/actionable information to improve the business.
 


 Reporting to the Manager of Business Systems, the successful Sr BI Analyst candidate must be detail oriented, a self starter, and have excellent communication and time management skills. A positive attitude and a collaborative approach to the work will also be essential.
  Specific Responsibilities and Accountabilities: 
 
Provide design support for the development of business intelligence solutions
   
 Be on the look out for duplication in the regions and encourage standards to combat it
 Participate in code/solution reviews with stakeholders in IT and in the other business units

 Train clients in how to efficiently use PowerBI to analyze their data
 Conduct analysis of functional business processes and functional business requirements
   
 Participate in the development of business cases in the support of process changes and potential new IT projects

 Design and document dashboards, alerts, scorecards and reports as needed
 Work on medium to complex cross-functional IT and business intelligence solutions
 Perform analysis for a wide range of requests using data in different formats and from various platforms
 Research business problems and create models that help analyze these business problems
 Over time, build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables the identification and addressing of business critical issues
 Technical Competencies:

 standards for secure access for end users to all Ensign reports/dashboards/scorecards can be enforced in a consistent manner

Title: Senior Analyst, Treasury Data Operations (12 mths)
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   What You'll Be Doing
 

   As a Senior Analyst, you will support the Director of Treasury Data Operations to ensure the integrity of captured data in Treasury owned applications (e.g. MST, QRM). This support will ensure that systems are executed on a daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly basis. You will be responsible to ensure seamless end-to-end production as it relates to reporting, reconciliation and load statistics. Additionally, you will conduct quality testing to identify improvement opportunities and system issues, and will suggest changes / improvements accordingly. You will also ensure all activities are properly documented and in accordance with the enterprise change management guidelines and SLAs.
 


 At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.



   How You’ll Succeed
 



     End-to-End production support - conduct daily review of the operations/exception reports, ensure that operations and systems are performing accurately and on time in accordance with established standards and SLAs. Provide daily and monthly load statistics/variance reports for downstream users' review. Also work with stakeholders to resolve daily/monthly data loading issues, investigate and resolve various system/data issues, and will initiate projects/processes to resolve recurring operational issues.
   


     Participate in enhancements/development - conduct user acceptance testing/quality assurance activities and recommend and assist in the development of new/enhanced reporting systems, policies, procedures and controls to meet user requirements, changing circumstances, and deficiencies underlying the current processes. Modify established procedures and approaches to suit specific situations, assist with updating and keeping directories in line with the Record Retention Policy and provide value-added data analysis services to technology and business partners.
   


     Handle Internal control environment – maintain adequate documentation, work with internal and/or external auditors when required, help identify and implement areas of improvement within the department, develop and implement sound business processes, practices and technical solutions to address business issues/challenges where applicable under the SOX404 guidelines
   



   Who You Are
 



     Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
   


     You're passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
   


     You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
   


     You're driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
   


     You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
   


     You can demonstrate experience in areas of data warehousing, relational databases, and end user (BI) reporting. Possess proficiency in SQL, excel and power point. It’s an asset if you are an expert in VBScript and Phyton.
   


     You have a degree/diploma in Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
   



   What CIBC Offers
 

   At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
 



     We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
   


     Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
   


     We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development
   



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-81 Bay, 27th Floor
 
   Employment Type
  Temporary (Fixed Term)
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Business, End-to-End Testing, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, User Requirements

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Payments
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our PRESTO, Payment Processing Office is seeing a Senior Business Analyst to represent business requirements to internal and external stakeholders and stay involved during deployment to identify 
efficient and cost-effective changes to optimize functionality of systems solution by tracking performance and mitigating implementation risks on significant projects. 
What will I be doing? 

Develops a thorough understanding of the business goals, practices and processes to translate into system functionality requirements and user stories that define project scope and specifications 
Work closely with the Product Owner to champion the product vision, develop roadmap, and manage product backlog 
Support the Product Owner from product development to launch that includes design/testing, client/business enablement, go-to-market activities, and on-going performance 
In partnership with business leaders, develops strategies for the application of technology; leads or participates in the development of business cases 
Facilitates dialogue and discussion between the business and internal and external providers to assist with prioritizing between competing objectives 
Assists the business to prepare business cases, understand scope limitations, and manage expectations during project implementation 
Proactively identifies opportunities for new technology/automation or streamlining of business processes and workflows 

What skills & qualifications do I need? 

Minimum six (6) years’ experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in the transit, payment technology, and/or banking industry 
Passionate about digital space, technology innovation, and customer centric design thinking 
Post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business Process Improvement, or a related discipline – or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent 
Experience leading teams to successfully deploy technology solutions in transport, payment, banking, or Telecommunications industry is an asset 
Experience with computerized quantitative and analytical tools (e.g. data modeling, workflows, and business process analysis) and with MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Project, etc.) 
Interpersonal, oral/written/presentation communications skills to document and present business needs, specifications, reports, project documents, and implementation plans 

Accommodation: 
Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance. 
Application Process:  All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application. 
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. 
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Title: Senior Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Description 





Given the current circumstances, employee will be working from home, 100% of time. As working conditions return to normal, they will shift to a hybrid working arrangement. 

Role Overview: 




As part of the Planning Analysis Team, you will be responsible for working with the Client Services Division to provide all reporting needs as it pertains to employee and department performance. 

What You Will Do: 
You will build on existing relationships in Client Services to provide insights on department and employee performance. Working closely with managers, you will assist them in achieving business goals by using your analytical skills to identify trends. 

Build and run new reports and queries and enhance existing ones 
Provide accurate and timely performance reports for departments within the Client Services division 
Meet with department managers to assess and discuss reporting needs 
Present trending reports to leadership 
Ensure Planning Analysis Team uses “best in class” reporting processes and standards 
Evolve forecasting model 
Work with data warehouse team to automate all manual reports 


What We’re Looking For: 

2 years of reporting analysis experience, preferably in the financial services industry 
3 years of call centre or back office processing operations experience 
Completion of post-secondary degree (preferably in Computer Science, MIS, Business Administration or Finance) 


The Expertise You Bring: 

Experience with Data Mining techniques, modeling & reporting 
Proficient with Business Objects, OBI, Tableau 
General Knowledge of SQL 
Strong understanding of telephony systems (Avaya or ACD Systems) 
Strong experience with Microsoft Excel, Access and PowerPoint 
Excellent oral and written communication skills 
Excellent presentation skills 
Proven experience in conducting complex data analysis

Title: Analyst, Customer Experience
Description:
Address: 55 Bloor Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Data Analytics & Reporting 
 
The Analyst, Customer Loyalty will maintain, develop, and implement customer experience/loyalty programs for the organization across multiple lines of business and delivery channels. Working with both the Customer Loyalty and cross functional teams, the incumbent will apply technical, business, and analytical knowledge together with a deep understanding of customer loyalty to assess and help improve customer loyalty programs across the organization. The role also requires that a strategic plan be maintained for setting priorities and effectively executing program deliverables. 

SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES 

Program Development and Management: 


Build and enhance procedures and processes aimed at optimizing customer contact execution for loyalty programs across the organization - ensure all work is fully tested and vetted prior to implementation. 
Create business and technical requirements and supporting documentation to facilitate loyalty program builds and knowledge retention. 
Write, test, and manage the successful implementation of computer coding changes applied when fixing, updating, and/or creating net new programs. 
Develop and maintain data quality procedures and processes aimed at ensuring the quality and currency of data and procedures used in loyalty programs is maintained and enhanced. Propose improvements as needed to ensure the most reliable and current information is utilized. 
Perform complex manipulation of data to restructure data for analysis, create and maintain database tables, and create output files for vendors. 
Ensure the ongoing successful execution of loyalty programs is maintained including the timely production and loading of all sample files and vendor response files. 
Ensure governance and controls are in place to securely transmit and receive customer information to/from external vendors. 
Cultivate strong working relationships with business and technical teams and leaders to ensure loyalty programs are maintained and developed successfully and are aligned with current and future business and technical needs. 


Business Analytics and Insights: 


Conduct data and business analysis of loyalty and customer data in order to generate insights and recommend potential improvements across programs. 
Monitor and assess loyalty program data and performance to proactively identify trends, potential enhancements, and resolve any issues that may occur. 
Provide thought and applied leadership on loyalty analysis and insights. Work with cross-functional teams to develop analysis of loyalty programs; work with these teams to leverage business knowledge and insights aimed at driving loyalty improvement for the organization. 
Monitor and communicate loyalty program performance to business and technical stakeholders on a regular basis. 


Strategy and Planning: 


Maintain a strategic roadmap for loyalty/NPS program technical builds and analytical projects. 
Work with data, technical, and business teams to develop data infrastructure and processes that support effective loyalty program execution, automation, and analytics. 
Assess and prioritize the development and execution of loyalty programs while recognizing the integrated environment programs operate within. Ensure priorities align to organizational priorities. 
Maintain a plan for migrating loyalty programs to email and SMS survey methodologies where necessary. 


SUMMARY QUALIFICATIONS 


Strong leadership, technical, functional and business skills to discuss, negotiate and influence at all levels in the organization. 
Excellent relationship building skills at all levels within the organization. 
Demonstrated expert in developing and managing programs, preferably in a complex organization with multiple lines of business. 
Extensive experience in SAS program development and maintenance. 
Experience with large transactional and customer-oriented relational databases. Familiarity across a broad range of data analysis, statistical analysis and programming tools, environments and techniques including SAS, SQL, Sybase, and Linux/Unix. 
Ability to relate analytical expertise to business problems, formulate business recommendations and communicate effectively to a non-analytical audience. 
Excellent time and resource management skills, flexibility and resourcefulness to interface and collaborate with internal and external groups. 


EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE 


Minimum Bachelor’s degree required in business, statistics, research, computer science or equivalent combination of education and experience. 
3+ years of experience in analysis of loyalty and/or customer information. 
3+ years of experience using SAS, SAS Macros, DBMS. 
3+ years of hands-on technical and functional experience as a practitioner of analytics and statistical methodologies including regression analysis and customer segmentation. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Data Analyst BCEHS
Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.




 Job Summary

 In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of BC Emergency Health Services, patient and employee safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at BC Emergency Health Services, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all patient and employee safety aspects of this position. 
   The Data Analyst conducts systems and business analysis and writes extracts, analyses and Business Intelligence reports. The Data Analyst writes new reports and maintains existing reports and data extraction routines for application systems. The reports are for the business areas to allow them to understand and monitor their areas performance. The Data Analyst works with other staff, including the Senior Developer/Architect, Senior Business Analysts, Systems Analysts and Database Administrators, to ensure reports and data extracts are built according to user requirements and departmental standards.
 



 What you'll do


Develop specifications for reports and data extracts which impact several functional areas throughout the BCEHS/PHSA by performing duties such as conducting systems analysis to gather detailed information from user departments, developing and documenting reporting and extracting procedures.
Extract analyzes and reports on data from various database sources such as SQL Server, Oracle, Access, using tools such as MicroStrategy, MS Excel, PL/SQL and data models and data dictionaries. Analyze data from multiple data sources, developing/improving performance indicators and preparing/publishing reports for various audience groups.
Provide support for reports and data extraction routines by performing tasks such as monitoring, maintenance, modification and enhancement tasks according to departmental standards and using tools such as Visual Studio, MicroStrategy, Oracle Developer, and Crystal Reports and other query tools.
Maintain contact with the Senior Developer/Architect and/or Senior Business Analysts and/or Systems Analysts and/or Database Administrators with regard to items such as progress issues, and suggestions for data reporting and extraction improvement by performing tasks such as preparing progress reports, and documenting any immediate or potential problems.
Identify issues with data and takes initiative in working out optimal solutions with appropriate stakeholders to improve accuracy, timeliness, connectivity and other data issues.
Conduct multi-layer data analysis independently by linking data from multiple health information data sources
Ensure work steps/processes are documented so work can be successfully repeated when required.
Ensure that appropriate protections are used in handling data and appropriate authorizations are obtained for releasing data/reports.
Ensure that Quality Assurance (QA) best practices are maintained by performing tasks such as unit testing, user acceptance testing, code reviews, post implementation analysis and other QA activities to departmental standards.
Ensure that deployed data reporting and extraction solutions are sustainable by performing tasks such as change management, documenting programming changes, participating in system implementation, and writing and maintaining system documentation to departmental standards.
Perform other related duties as required.


What you bring


Graduation from a recognized degree or diploma program in Computer Science, two years of recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Ability to deal with others effectively.
Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
Ability to organize work.
Ability to operate related equipment.




 What we bring




   Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
 

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.


Job Type: Temporary Full-Time until July 17th 2023
  
Wage: $35.99 per hour
  
Location: Block C 2261 Keating Cross Road, Saanichton V8M 2A5
  
Hours of Work: 0800-1600 Monday to Friday
  
Requisition #119290
 



 What we do




   The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.
 



   Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
 



   PHSA is committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Title: Analyst, Sales and Revenue
Description:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Perkins + Will, our Instagram, and our Blog.
                                 








We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.
 Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.
 Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable. We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!
                            



Organizational Announcement about our new Analyst of Go-to-Market and Revenue:
 They've finally arrived! Our newest analyst (perhaps you!) comes with a fresh data-driven perspective to help our Sales and revenue generating teams hit and exceed our growth ambitions. Given previous experiences in analytics, sales or revenue operations, and generally driving revenue insights, they're here to lend critical data and strategic thinking to the conversion of our leads into clients, accounts into upsells, and our value into revenue.
 Since our new analyst joined, Bench's sales and revenue leaders have thanked their lucky stars to have someone with deep systematic thinking, exciting data skills, and experience prioritizing insights into high-return-on-time Salesforce functionality and decision. In their last role they launched the most effective sales optimization ever - and here at Bench they've set their sights on doubling our lead-to-client conversion and other revenue sources through systematic performance management support and helping us more clearly market the tremendous value Bench brings to entrepreneurs.
 They're playing a role in working with our marketing analysts, service delivery analysts, and all GTM leaders to align our new product launches and events with the next waves of revenue maximizing promotions and conversations.
 But what we're most excited to highlight is that while our new analyst is both a strategic thinker and data analyst, they're also a team player and have already started tucking into their experiences and system knowledge, including Salesforce -hooray!, to optimize for all revenue and service value-related activities across Bench.
 What you'll get up to:

Be a deeply trusted partner, leader and advisor to teams selling and leading revenue generation at Bench

Identifying step-change performance management opportunities backed by tested hypotheses and data insights
Provide data-driven opinions and recommendations on strategic prioritization
Creating business cases and roadmaps with stakeholders and project managers for systems investments that improve the state of the go-to-market data ecosystem
Participate in financial modeling exercises to make recommendations on future staffing, quota & sales compensation, and revenue
Communicate key findings and presentations to wider senior leadership

Create and optimize our revenue analytics assets (datasets, dashboards & reports)

Highlight opportunities to improve Go-To-Market insights by deeply understanding revenue volumes, sales rep performance, and other revenue related decision making
Ensuring that the definitions of metrics related to our lead and client generation are consistent across our current and new reporting


Guide and support strategies that capture revenue dataSupport in transforming our reporting landscape into a more automated and robust environment



Collaborate with business unit leaders to identify, validate, and build systems and tools to support decision making

Be an active contributor to the development and improvement of our data infrastructure

Analyze and support revenue strategies related to business critical problems, including working with team members on process improvements


Mentor and support emerging analysts with their understanding of the data environment and the analyst tech stack

What you'll need:

3+ years of experience in analytics, finance, consulting, strategy, business intelligence or a related quantitative field, education, or training 
                               
Experience leading cross-functional data analysis
More advanced ability to prioritize work for business impact and mentor more junior team members to prioritize effectively



Experience translating complex business problems into clear drivers and structured models 
                               
Experience with current data trends and best practices
Ability to lead data source identification for larger problems and data models
Extensive knowledge of a wide-range of best-practice statistical modeling techniques



Excellent Excel / Google Sheets skills; Strong SQL skills and understanding 
                               
Expert SQL skills and contributes to code reviews
Ability to debug and troubleshoot within visualizations



Exceptional business acumen, analytical skills and revenue intuition 
                               
Experience in Sales, Partnership sales, and lead conversion processes and systems

Comfort working with quantitative and qualitative data
Experience communicating recommendations effectively to senior leadership 

It could be an even better fit if you have:

System experience: Salesforce knowledge or familiarity with BI tools like Tableau and CRM Analytics
A nose for value: You can take a big-picture perspective to identify and stay focused on what's most important
Appreciation for wider-systems: You can connect the dots and figure out the best solution for Bench, not just the stakeholders you're working with
Intellectual curiosity: It's not enough for you to know the what - you want to know the why. You are energized by challenging problems, and are persistent/ resourceful in your efforts to solve them
Startup hustle: You are highly motivated, proactive, comfortable with change and ambiguity. You have a humble, team-player attitude and are ready to pitch in wherever you are needed most

What you'll get:

At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is below: 
                               
Intermediate Analyst: $58,160 - $72,700 per year, depending on experience.
Senior Analyst: $72,720 - $90,900 per year, depending on experience.

In addition, we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, unlimited paid flex days, stock options and full health, dental, and vision.
You'll get unlimited access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
Bench is moving towards being a fully remote organization and we're in the process of closing our Vancouver HQ. We are looking at alternative solutions to bring teams together for collaboration and connection.
We currently focus our hiring efforts in the following provinces: British Columbia, Alberta, Ontario, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia.
You'll have access to our Home Office Setup Fund, to ensure that you have everything you need to work comfortably from home, from day one.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.












We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

Title: Procurement Analyst
Description:
Procurement Analyst  Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customized services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst, Market Data Solutions
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   What You’ll Be Doing
 

   As a Market Data Analyst, you’ll work in a fast-paced environment to ensure Capital Markets Risk Management models continue to perform at the highest standards. You’ll work on applying and enhancing methods of assessing market data integrity, automating regular procedures and promoting timely data analysis. You’ll also work with the wider Capital Markets team to enhance and document the model risk control framework and help define key requirements for a strategic market data platform.
 


   How You’ll Succeed
 

 Daily Market Data Integrity – proactively ensure that market data time series and risk factor models effectively capture market conditions, satisfying both regulatory, and market and credit risk model requirements. Where gaps or errors exist, you’ll apply data cleansing and filling methodologies, comparing the data with other sources. You’ll ensure that data received from internal and external sources are properly captured, processed and delivered to downstream systems.
 Ad-hoc Market Data reviews –perform analysis on available historical data using a variety of techniques, and clean or enhance the data available where required. When new risk factors are introduced, you’ll assist in the research and introduction of these factors, including the process of introducing new vendors where required.
 Communication – work to identify impactful data movements and adjustments, record these clearly, and to communicate these changes, and the impact on risk calculations, to the risk managers. As data issues are identified and resolved, you’ll help track, agree resolution and acquire related approvals.
 Documentation and Governance – write concise and specific procedure instructions, as well as preparing detailed governance documents to describe decisions that control critical day to day operations. You’ll assist in providing daily summaries of production data issues, and help provide ad-hoc data reports as requested. You’ll support analysis of new and alternative sources of data.
 Automation and Projects - help to improve the automation of regular processes and controls, with a focus on enhancement of existing methodologies. You’ll develop improvements that reduce operational risk and increase efficiency while retaining critical human decision making and expertise. You’ll help define the requirements for changes to our Market Data systems, and perform UAT testing on enhancements prior to production.



   Who You Are
 

 You can demonstrate experience with key areas and facets of market/credit data and Capital Market’s products (Money Market, FX, Commodities, Equities, Credit, Derivatives, Futures, OTC). You have knowledge of key risk concept including Value at Risk, Monte-Carlo simulation, basis etc. You have a good understanding of statistics, time series analysis, and financial derivatives and be adept at both Excel and Word. You know about data vendors and their offerings, and have experience in the area of relational databases (such as SQL). Experience in scripting languages is encouraged, for instance Python.
 You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
 You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
 You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
 You have a degree in a quantitative discipline, such as mathematics, physics, statistics, computer science, or mathematical finance / financial engineering.
 Values matter to you - You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.



   What CIBC Offers
 

   At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
 

 Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
 Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
 Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
 Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-161 Bay St., 10th
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Communication, Complex Issues, Critical Thinking, C Sharp (Programming Language), Data Analysis, Data Solutions, Microsoft PowerShell, Python, Researching, Statistics, Structured Query Language (SQL), Teamwork

Title: Business Intelligence Coordinator (Remote)
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies. 
Sports Experts – Business Intelligence Coordinator 
Part of the Canadian Tire family is Sports Experts. Your Sports Experts! Built on more than 50 years tradition on customer focus, Sports Experts is headquartered in Laval, Quebec. Sports Experts is proud to promote a wide selection of sports equipment, clothing and footwear of renowned and exclusive brands. We are the destination to Stay fit. Live well. 
FGL Sports is looking for a Coordinator – Business Intelligence, in order to meet the requirements and priorities of the Business Intelligence department. Your role will be to support the analysts using different data tools. You will have to organize, evaluate and update several data sources needed for the Business Intelligence department. 

What you’ll do 

Define the data structure to meet the visualization needs 
Set up the data model and the necessary data transformation layers to optimize the company's KPIs 
Ensure the quality, integrity and truthfulness of the data used in the BI tools and perform data validation tests with the help of different departments 
Maintain and/or update the different dashboards and other necessary reference tools of the company and manage access to the different tools 
Support the BI team with the different departments of the company and the franchisee network regarding the technological issues of the data tools (Cubes, Power BI, etc.) 
Participate in the maintenance of the DevOps of the different tools (daily uploads, improvements and training documents) 
Perform all other related duties necessary for the proper functioning of the Business Intelligence department 


What you bring 

College or university degree, preferably in computer science, business intelligence, analytics or another related field 
2 to 3 years of experience in data/analysis, a business intelligence tools integration team, e-commerce or any other relevant experience 
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (advanced formulas, VBA, Power Query) 
Excellent French required, excellent English an asset 
Retail experience an asset 
Experience with an ERP, Power BI (an asset) 
Good research and learning skills 
Analytical mind with problem-solving ability 
Important sense of precision and meticulousness 
Autonomous, rigorous and excellent at managing priorities 
Ability to work as part of a team 


About Canadian Tire Corporation 
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . #LI-MM2 


  FGL Corporate 
 

  Quebec-Laval 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time
