Title: Senior Performance Analyst
Description:
1 Full Time Contract Position 
INTERNAL/EXTERNAL POSTING  
 DATE: June 15th, 2022  LOCATION: Toronto, ON 
COMPENSATION: $65,986 – $88,016 (Prorated) 
CONTRACT DURATION: 1 Year  
LOFT Community Services is a unique and dynamic charitable organization that supports  people living with complicated issues such as mental and physical health challenges,  substance abuse, poverty and homelessness. Serving over 9,500 people and providing 
1,733 units of supportive housing last year, LOFT is one of Ontario’s largest mental health  service providers of its kind. 
 LOFT is recognized as a Nonprofit Employer of Choice™ Award (NEOC) recipient. 
  To help fulfill its mission, LOFT is hiring a Senior Performance Analyst 

JOB SUMMARY: 
The Senior Performance Analyst will work with the other members of the Administration  and System Management team to meet the business and reporting needs of LOFT staff, 
program directors, and senior management. The individual will lead the development and  maintenance of all reporting, analytics and quality improvement initiatives. 
 *Note: All LOFT employees are required to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of 
hire in accordance with LOFT’s Vaccination Policy. A satisfactory vulnerable sector check 
(VSC) is also required.* 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Reporting and Analysis  Deliver and maintain weekly, monthly, quarterly reporting products to various 
stakeholders.  Support decision-making, through the development and ongoing maintenance of 
strategic and operational reports, key performance indicators, dashboards, and  executive summaries. 
Work with program directors to identify performance gaps and establish and follow-
 up on action plans. 




Design blueprint and provide recommendations for new reports to turn data into  actionable insights for key stakeholders. 
Manage, prioritize and deliver ad-hoc reporting requests using internal and external  datasets. 
Support the organization in operationalizing the strategic plan, including identifying  and defining KPIs, and building the appropriate scorecards for ongoing performance  management. 
 Business Requirements 
Bridge the gap between the technical and program functions by translating 
requirements both ways 
Support reporting and technology projects by leading the requirements gathering  process; create and manage appropriate documentation e.g. functional 
specifications, use cases, user stories, workflow diagrams  Develop and lead the QA and UAT process as related to data warehouse and 
business intelligence report development.  Conduct feasibility analysis; work with stakeholders to identify alternative solutions 
to meet end-user needs. 
 Quality Improvement 
Support the Manager in building a culture of quality and continuous improvement.  With the focus on continuous improvement, conduct ongoing 
quantitative/qualitative analysis with program directors and senior staff (e.g. key 
metrics); proactively assess results and identify and explain unanticipated  variations from targets/budgets and provide improvement recommendations. 
Use quantitative and qualitative methods to define the problem, measure the  current state, identify root cause, and implement and sustain solutions. 
Support quality improvement projects by leading exercises e.g. process mapping 
(value stream mapping, fishbone, SIPOC), root cause analysis, etc.  Support the knowledge base by creating and delivering articles, user training 
sessions and other documentation.  
Project Management 
Work closely with project leads and sponsors to define project business and  technical requirements, scope and objectives. 
Use PMBOK guide and principles to plan, execute and deliver IT, reporting and  quality improvement projects within the Administration and System Management  team. 
Support and maintain projects and work plans to ensure completion of deliverables  on time, and escalate project risks as appropriate. 
Support department with development of presentation material where required  Perform other duties as necessary. 








QUALIFICATIONS:  Undergraduate degree in a related field (analytics, statistics, epidemiology, health 
informatics, or equivalent) required.  A minimum of 5 years relevant work experience. 
Understanding of Ontario healthcare system, organization, policies, and data  structures. 
Experience in data analysis, reporting, and the ability to translate information into a 
convincing written argument or business case.  Experience in translating business requirements into technical and reporting 
requirements.  Understanding of data modelling concepts as they relate to data warehousing and 
business intelligence. 
Ability to manipulate and work with large data sets.  Experience in leading QA and UAT process. 
Experience with Microsoft Office tools including Excel, Word and PowerPoint required.  Skilled in creating products (e.g. Reports, presentations) for multiple audiences. 
Experience with MS SQL and/or Microstrategy is an asset 
Demonstrated experience with process mapping tools and techniques.  Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks in parallel; strong 
problem-solving skills and demonstrated ability to think critically and strategically.  Detail-oriented and process-driven with a demonstrated ability to consistently and 
effectively produce high quality work.  Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to explain complex concepts in 
a manner that is simple and easy to understand. 
Proven team player with strong interpersonal skills including ability to resolve conflicts,  diplomacy, achieve consensus and able to work comfortably with staff and external 
stakeholders, including clinicians.  Innovative thinker with the ability to develop creative solutions to complex problems.  Demonstrated ability to work in matrix structure, but with minimal supervision as a 
self-starter.  Familiar with Quality Improvement/Lean principles and methodologies. 
Lean/Quality Improvement certification is an asset.  PMP certification is an asset, MS Project experience is an asset.  Experience in healthcare is an asset. 
Experience in writing business case / proposals is an asset.  Understanding of cultural competency and anti-oppression framework. 
Reflective of a multi-barriered group, as serviced by the program, a strong asset.  
TO APPLY: Send resume with cover letter to Human Resources, Email: hr@loftcs.org 

Note: LOFT Employees can apply internally at hrteam@loftcs.org 

LOFT Community Services is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible  environment and dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the  community in which we live and serve. LOFT is committed to making employment 
opportunities accessible in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities 




Act, 2005. Requested accommodation will be provided in all parts of the application and  hiring process by contacting hr@loftcs.org or (416) 979-1994.  
We welcome and encourage people from equity-deserving communities and intersecting 
identities to apply for this position. 
PLEASE INCLUDE: “SR. PERFORMANCE ANALYST” IN THE SUBJECT LINE OF ANY 
EMAILS. 
CLOSING DATE: June 29th, 2022

Title: Sr. Digital Analyst, Media Analytics
Description:
At Acronym Canada Inc, we're committed to fostering an environment of growth and innovation. We're looking for people who want to think strategically, operate efficiently and drive success for our clients. Our culture of collaboration, ideation, Integrity, and inclusion has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled and highly dedicated individuals for 25+ years and we believe the best is yet to come.


 Acronym is seeking a Senior Digital Analyst to join our Analytics & Optimization team. This team member will work closely with a team of Marketers, Analytics Architects, Analysts, and Engineers to produce and present insightful & articulate analyses and performance reporting. This role will be focused on media analytics to provide front-line support to internal and external stakeholders with questions on web performance, tool implementation, and deliverable schedules. A successful candidate will utilize business & marketing knowledge, problem solving, and analytical skills to understand how complex things work – and make them work better!
 This is the job…

Performing strategic analyses of website and marketing activity data to solve challenges and identify opportunities relating to website performance, customer intent, and marketing campaign performance. You will be spotting meaningful trends, identifying drivers and root-causes, and conducting gap analyses while providing actionable recommendations based on this data.
Communicating results of data analysis and reporting clearly to non-technical stakeholders by providing actionable recommendations (marketing and technical) based on this data. Additionally, you will be condensing large (and sometimes disparate) data sets and analyses into memorable takeaways.
Helping Clients and internal stakeholders utilize their web analytics toolsets better. This will include answering data & reporting-related questions, assisting in the configuration of Adobe Analytics, and providing strategic recommendations to clients on tools.

This is you…

Has 3+ years of experience in Digital Analytics, using Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or other similar tools. The Adobe Analytics Business Practitioner Certification is preferred, or ability to receive within three months from start date.
Is a problem solver; has analytical, quantitative, and critical thinking skills.
Enjoys the challenge of simplifying complex data, processes, and concepts to highlight key insights and guide decision making.
Has strong written, verbal, data visualization and presentation skills. Your presentations are cohesive, visually compelling, and should tell a story.
Has experience managing work: account management and project management skills are strongly preferred. Your task-oriented discipline lends towards your ability to manage concurrent, competing priorities across clients.
Understands how to effectively build reports and extract data from Adobe Analytics, whether from Analysis Workspace, Data Warehouse, or by building Excel reports with Report Builder.
Have a strong desire to learn new skills and keep up with the latest industry trends.
Paid media and/or hospitality industry experience – this is highly preferred.
Previous media agency experience or have worked in an environment similar to an agency where they are reporting to multiple stakeholders on a regular basis.
Analytics Debugging experience (leveraging tools like Omnibug and Adobe Experience Cloud Debugger) to inspect on-page data collection.
Ideally experience with data visualization tools such as Data Studio, PowerBI, and/or Tableau.

#LI-SG1
 #PDN

 Benefits/Perks:

Unlimited PTO - Sick Days - Generous Company Closed Holiday Schedule
Great benefit plans: Medical, Dental, Vision, STD
AcronymCares Matching Gifts program for employee donations
Diversity and Inclusion Employee Resource Groups

This is us…
 Acronym Canada Inc is an award-winning performance marketing agency headquartered in downtown Toronto with presence around the world. Our expertise is in managing highly complex search and multi-channel marketing challenges powered by our own patented technology to improve performance aligned with business goals. Our employees are industry experts who are diverse, energetic, intelligent, motivated, and fun individuals.
 Become part of an organization whose team members are diverse, energetic intelligent motivated people who love what they do - come join us at Acronym today!
 We strongly encourage individuals from traditionally underrepresented groups to apply for employment at Acronym.

Title: Business Analyst - Order Management System (OMS)
Description:
Company Description
  SSENSE, pronounced [es-uhns], is a Montreal-based fashion platform with global reach. Founded in 2003, SSENSE is pacing the vanguard of directional retail with a mix of luxury, streetwear, and avant-garde labels. We produce industry-leading original content and take pride in building our own technology solutions and systems from scratch. Our field of focus has grown beyond that of a typical e-commerce entity as we explore the nexus of content, commerce, and culture.
 Currently serving 150 countries, generating an average of 88 million monthly page views, and achieving high double digit annual growth since inception, SSENSE is becoming a cultural protagonist in its own right.



 Job Description
  Reporting to the Senior Product/Program Manager, the Business Analyst OMS is responsible for supporting the product management team in evaluating requirements for new features and enhancements. Working cross-functionally, he/she will support gathering requirements, plan, execute, measure product initiatives, and own documentation of evaluation and delivery; helping to ensure that SSENSE delivers a world-class shopping experience to its customers. As a Business Analyst, you will get visibility into the executive team at SSENSE and be exposed to growth opportunities through a blend of on-the-job experience, training, mentorship, and support from the entire Product team.
 RESPONSIBILITIES
 Product Development and Delivery(80%)

 Lead requirement gathering and analyse stakeholder pain and passion points
 Document requirements, test cases and project related artefacts in centralised tools like JIRA, Confluence, Lucidcharts etc
 Work with developers, QA within and across other teams to align on scope and delivery
 Document problem statements, business opportunity, feature releases and their all rounded impact
 Provide support for the end-to-end product management and development
 Lead change management for new feature introductions and enhancements with stakeholders


 Product Strategy (20%)

 Conduct cost-benefit and other financial analysis for potential projects and business cases
 Research and drive 360 degree feature & enhancement impact analysis
 Provide detailed insights to support product management decisions




 Qualifications
 
 Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
 Master's degree, an asset
 A minimum of 1-2 years relevant work experience in a business analysis, consultancy, software development, or product management role
 Exposure to digital products, software development lifecycle and prior retail or e-commerce experience preferred.

 SKILLS

 Highly analytical and detail oriented
 Solid data crunching and modelling skills
 Creative thinker with excellent problem solving skills
 Solid time management and organizational skills
 Entrepreneurial and initiative driven
 Ability to thrive in a fast-paced performance-driven environment, dealing with ambiguity and change
 Knowledge of Google Analytics, SQL and other analysis tools, an asset
 Experience working within an Agile environment, using jira, an asset

 Additional Information
  WORLD CLASS TECHNOLOGY
 Technology is at the core of everything we do at SSENSE. Driven by an engineering mindset and a problem-solving attitude, we blend fashion with technology to deliver an unparalleled experience to our customers as we build seamless, custom solutions to deliver the SSENSE offering.
 WORLD CLASS TEAM The SSENSE tech team is responsible for an international headless commerce platform. Working in an agile environment, our squads are made up of experienced innovators in Product Management, QA, Design, DevOps, Software Development, Machine Learning, Data Engineering, and Security. Headquartered in Montreal, our technology organization has been growing at a rate of 2X year-over-year and is doubling once again in 2021 as we expand across Canada, US, and Europe.
 WORLD CLASS PLATFORM
 The SSENSE platform runs on Amazon Web Services making use of serverless microservices across web, mobile and app. Our event-source architecture already achieves over 10,000 requests / second and growing at an unmatched pace, currently unseen across the industry. Our data-driven culture of innovation empowers every product team across the tech organization to explore building, testing and learning with the latest in Machine Learning techniques. Our automated continuous improvement DevOps model (making use of both blue / green and canary deployments) results in an average of 50 production releases every day.
 Read more about us on our SSENSE Tech Blog.

Title: Spend Analyst
Description:
Our client, a retail giant in the Toronto area has an immediate permanent requirement for a Non-Merchandise Spend Analyst.
Ideally we are looking for 3-5 years experience in a similar position.
Requirements: 
The Non-Merchandise Spend Analyst is responsible for providing leadership and execution with respect to data compilation, classification, analysis, modeling and performance reporting to support a wide assortment of non-merchandise procurement initiatives across the corporation.
Responsibilities
- Analyze and understand category activity and spend in collaboration with Sourcing Managers and internal category stakeholders
· Compile, classify and align data from multiple sources in order to make it suitable for drawing insights
· Identify and/or support business unit initiatives that will result in cost savings, goods/service standardization, and best value for the category being managed
· Analyze bids from multiple vendors; formulate and contrast scenarios based on multiple dimensions of bid data
· Develop appropriate models to estimate baseline spend and savings in the absence of perfect / complete data or time to process it
· Present results of analysis to stakeholders of all levels
· Perform research and benchmarking to analyze potential benefits from sourcing
· Liaise and collaborate with
o Software vendors on functionality in course of routine or issue-related use of their tools
o Finance and business stakeholders to determine the best source of data for analysis, compile that data, understand how it is used and assess its reliability for drawing insights
o Finance on projects that have accounts payable workflow / data implications
· Formulate and produce communications and reports on results achieved relative to metrics plans and key performance indicators, related to the procurement function as a whole or individual initiatives or vendors
· Identify potential supply risks as determined from data analysis
· Formulate, document, execute and communicate standards related to procurement-related master data
· Support rest of team with Excel and Access, both basic and complex analysis, review of analysis, data structuring and cleansing, creation of tools for sustained/repeat use, presentation of results
· Support the team with procurement responsibilities as needed (vendor liaison, supply market research, master data cleansing and maintenance, procurement tool and database administration)
Qualifications
· University degree in Engineering, Finance, IT, Mathematics or any analytically demanding discipline
· 3 to 5 years of experience in an analytical capacity, preferably involving financial data
· Superior written and verbal communication skills to grasp and convey complex analytical tasks
· Strong financial, conceptual, research, and analytical skills
· Proven ability to associate analytical tasks with business objectives
· Proven ability to build effective relationships, collaborate with, and maintain a service orientation towards a diverse group of professional, technical, and clerical personnel
· Excellent presenter with the ability to lead various conversations and meeting types to elicit support to drive ongoing cost reductions
· Mastery of Microsoft Excel and Access is required. High degree of proficiency with PowerPoint would be an asset.
· Aptitude to master new software, tools and analytical techniques, and to become a superuser on which the rest of the team relies
· Experience with Coupa would be an asset (indicate experience with any Procure-to-pay / P2P platform)
· An interest in a longer term role working in a procurement and dynamic, unstructured problem solving environment would be an asset
Salary: 50-65K
Job Type: Permanent
Salary: $50,000.00-$65,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care

Schedule:

Day shift

Experience:

Buying/Spend Analyst: 3 years (preferred)
Excel: 5 years (preferred)

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Position Description:

   We offer the opportunity to work with Canada’s largest Information Technology Outsourcing and Management Consulting Company with a true global presence in a fast-paced and energetic atmosphere where your personal and professional growth is accelerated by your desire and sense of commitment. CGI’s continuous growth is a testament to the confidence clients place in them and to the dedication of their professionals. At CGI, all employees are called members because they feel a powerful sense of ownership and accountability. Members at CGI are building their own company – in 100+ offices worldwide. CGI has the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for clients – and for members; that’s why an astounding 90 percent of them are CGI shareholders.
   
 We're expanding in Atlantic Canada and we need your skills, enthusiasm, and dedication as part of our team and are looking for a Sr Business Analyst in the Global Wealth business domain.
   
 Your future duties and responsibilities:
   


Identify and analyze clients’ business needs and requirements
Participate in analysis and definition of product business requirements
Identify and analyze non functional requirements both from a client’s business needs and product system needs
Lead/participate in requirements workshops both internally and if required, with client’s to identify business needs and requirements
Act as proxy product owner on the development team and work with technical lead to define clear business solutions
Document current business processes, business flows, rules and artifacts, and propose business processes, business flows, rules and artifacts
Produce detailed requirements documents and requirements traceability matrices utilizing traditional documentation methods (business requirements, functional and non functional specifications) and current documentation processes of User Stories, Business and System Use Cases, Business Flows, etc.
Prepare solution requirements by translating business requirements into functional and system requirements
Review and analyze existing product effectiveness and efficiency
Ensure new software integration meets functional requirements, systems compliance and interface requirements
Lead requirements walkthrough sessions with technical and QA resources ensuring that business and system requirements are understood, information is adequate to facilitate design, development and testing of the business requirement
Participate in quality reviews of deliverables including test cases and results
Participate in design reviews to ensure requirements are being addressed
Partner with project managers, technical resources, QA resources, vendors, and Management to ensure accurate execution of project requirements on time with exceptional quality

 Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
   


5 to 10 or more years of progressive experience as a Business Systems Analyst in related Information Technology / Information Systems environments
Wealth Management or Portfolio Management Business Knowledge
Hands on expertise in Agile Requirement analysis techniques used in SCRUM methodology
Experience documenting business rules, data models, business cases and business case summaries
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Detailed oriented with ability to appropriately summarize to address a variety of audience needs
Relationship management- ability to establish and build working relations and partnerships with clients, vendors, and peers
Experience in facilitating workshops
Decision making and critical thinking- knowledge of tools and techniques for effective use of a broad range of factors, assumptions, frameworks and perspectives when solving business problems

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
IO’s Finance, Technology, and Lending Enterprise Team ensures that IO is a financially efficient and effectively managed organization and that the agency’s finances are monitored, reported, and managed appropriately. The team also manages the infrastructure lending program, which has supported more than $18 billion in local infrastructure development, and IO’s Information Technology and Business Services, providing tools and systems to ensure secure, effective, and efficient operations.
  


 The role acts as a liaison between business teams and the Information Technology team for a wide range of technology projects. The role will collaborate with business stakeholders at all levels to facilitate, gather and document business requirements. This includes ensuring successful delivery of solutions, collaborating with developers on implementation of requirements, ensuring thorough IT and business testing, and developing required documentation and resolving issues as they arise.
  



What You Will Do: 


Solution identification, assessment, and recommendation: 
Work cross-functionally with stakeholders to identify and critically evaluate optimal technology design solutions.
 Develop use cases defining interactions between roles and systems as well as the steps to achieve stakeholder goals.
 Support the engagement with vendors for product capability assessments, demonstrations, and design specification evaluations.
 Develop and present business cases summarizing projects needs or problems, potential solutions and recommended options, benefits, cost analysis including the return on investment.
 Support in the planning and execution of procurement activities.

 Understand business problems and translate into requirements: 
Act as liaison between business stakeholders (partners and end-users) and the information technology team to identify business process and system improvement opportunities. 
Collaborate with the Business to gather and document detailed requirements for new, or enhancements to, existing technology.
 Facilitate problem-solving meetings to discover business needs, understand business problems, and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders to establish improvement priorities.
 Identify, create, and facilitate business process changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design. Focus on meeting short and long-term business strategies, quality improvement, data and records management, and integration of systems and business processes (existing and new). 
Analyze and communicate stakeholder needs by translating business requirements into system requirements and technical specifications.

 Understand business problems and translate into requirements: 
Act as liaison between business stakeholders (partners and end-users) and the information technology team to identify business process and system improvement opportunities. 
Collaborate with the Business to gather and document detailed requirements for new, or enhancements to, existing technology.
 Facilitate problem-solving meetings to discover business needs, understand business problems, and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders to establish improvement priorities.
 Identify, create, and facilitate business process changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design. Focus on meeting short and long-term business strategies, quality improvement, data and records management, and integration of systems and business processes (existing and new). 
Analyze and communicate stakeholder needs by translating business requirements into system requirements and technical specifications.

 Support technology implementations: 
Assist business teams and the Information Technology team in the execution of technology solutions.
 Collaborate closely with developers to implement system requirements.
 Ensure the effective use of the end application and evaluate integration with other new modules or applications. 
As technology constraints are discovered, facilitate problem-solving meetings to identify alternate solutions to meet business requirements.
 Support the project management team to develop and deliver user documentation and change management activities.

 Manage stakeholder relationships, support the use of business analysis best practices and help mentor others on Business Analysis practices:
 Forge effective and trusted working relationship with key stakeholders to stay current with business partner needs and strategies and communicate updates and findings through presentations and reports.
 Support the management of business analysis best practices and knowledge base through contributing to the introduction and maintenance of standardized tools, methodologies, templates, and training. Recommend continuous improvements and lead changes. Mentor others on business analysis to help grow the practice.






What We’re Looking For:


 Several years experience in a Business Analyst role handling multiple projects concurrently.
 Certified Business Analysis Professional certification is preferred.
 Experience partnering with the Business and Technology teams. 
Experience with business case development, requirements/ use-case creation, testing plan and test case development.
 Proven experience with Agile and Waterfall delivery methodologies.








 This posting will close on Thursday, July 7 @ 11:59 pm


 Please note that interviews will occur on a rolling basis until the role is filled.


 


 The salary range for this position is $77,145 – $115,725 with a corresponding job level of P4

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
Company
At Avanquest, we cut through the red tape of online software by creating feature-rich and consumer-centric products that are designed with the end-user in mind.
To achieve this, we foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and personal development: Our employees are encouraged to constantly learn, grow, and challenge themselves with new projects and responsibilities.
At Avanquest, we are trying to reinvent the way users interact with their documents: we want to shake up the status quo. We are always looking for team players who think outside the box and have an entrepreneurial spirit. Join us to make a difference and have fun in the process!
We are always looking for team players who think outside the box and have an entrepreneurial spirit. Join us to make a difference and have fun in the process!
Role
We are looking for a highly enthusiastic Business Intelligence Analyst to develop, deploy and maintain BI reports. We need someone with a passion for data visualizations, and modelling, who is also good at telling the right story with data - clear, concise, and actionable.
The role requires close collaboration between the Business Intelligence team and key stakeholders in Sales, Development and Marketing, and eventually the ability to demonstrate expert level knowledge of our products and services. We are a small closely-knit team, and the Business Intelligence Analyst will have the opportunity to wear many hats and contribute to many areas of the data organization. If you do not want to fall into a routine and be an isolated BI person, you have come to the right place.
This position works within the Business Intelligence and Governance group, and reports to the Director of BI & Data Governance.
Responsibilities

Collaborate with business stakeholders and data engineers to document business requirements for BI solutions, including reports, dashboards, and analytical deliverables.
Build and manage BI solutions in PowerBI, Python and SQL.
Participating in data engineering and architecture conversations.
Data modeling for various BI workstreams.
Ensuring data and report integrity by implementing and adhering to industry best practices, and quality control processes.

Requirements

A minimum of a bachelor’s degree, in mathematics, business intelligence, statistics, engineering, computer science, economics, physics or other quantitative disciplines.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in enterprise reporting in a BI environment (must have).
Expertise in building custom BI reports and analytical solutions with PowerBI (must have).
Ability to work with independently with Python and SQL, for data extraction from various sources, applying transformations, and data wrangling (must have).
Ability to generate visualizations from complex datasets, draw business-relevant conclusions and present them in a manner comprehensible to non-technical stakeholders.
Solid understanding of modern database technologies, data modeling techniques and underlying infrastructure. Experience with MSBI stack and Azure will be preferred.

Location
This position is in hybrid mode in Montreal at Avanquest office, located 7075 Place Robert-Joncas, Suite 142, Montreal, H4M 2Z2.
Company benefits
What we offer?
At Avanquest, we pride ourselves on doing right by our employees, and have a benefits package that makes being a part of the Avanquest team a dream job.

Annual Bonus: before Christmas Holidays
Plan your perfect schedule: Flexible hours & summer hours.
For your pension: RRSP contribution match program.
Stay Healthy: Health, dental, vision & life insurance.
Get Moving: Public transportation card.
Save Up: RRSP contribution match program.
Eat Up: Catered meals for lunch, bagels and cream cheese & barbecues all summertime.
Buff Up: Gym and exercise reimbursements to keep you active.
Hang Out: Happy hours with your colleagues, bingo, 5 to 7, etc.
Stay Cool: A comfortable work environment.
Get informed: Lunch & learn bi-monthly, webinars, etc.
Personalized support: Coaching program.
Stay healthy: Dialogue & tap medical: Free Medical assistance programs.
Work life balance: Employees Assistance program Morneau Shepell.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Bonus pay

Title: Health Promotion & Research Analyst (Public Health) - Temporary Full Time
Description:
Leads and develops projects, including research, planning, and evaluation activities in a multi-stakeholder environment; prepares recommendations using evidence-based research and qualitative and quantitative evaluation mechanisms to further develop and enhance programs and policies, subject to management approval where appropriate.
 


  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Required:
 


Knowledge of research, planning, and evaluation; health promotion strategies; policy development approaches; risk assessment; and community development/capacity building, acquired through a Masters level degree in a related field plus 1 year of accumulated experience in program evaluation, policy analysis, and planning, -OR- equivalent combination of related education and work experience.


Knowledge of the Department’s mandate, issues, programs and services, and relevant acts/ legislation (e.g., Health Protection & Promotion Act, Ontario Public Health Standards, privacy). Understanding of public administration, government processes, municipal government structure, and stakeholder needs and interests.


Ability to apply public health sciences to practice and use evidence and research to inform health policies and programs. Knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods, research ethics, theories, and principles of public health (health promotion, community health planning, and program evaluation). Skill in statistical analysis.


Ability to analyse health, political, socioeconomic, and financial factors when planning programs, and exercise sensitivity and diplomacy to balance various factors, including community process, departmental considerations, and research best practices. Ability to disseminate research findings in an accurate, timely, and meaningful manner.


Project management skills (principles, procedures, and practices) to plan and organize multi-stakeholder projects. Analytical and problem solving skills to determine, plan, and develop project objectives. Research skills and ability to critically appraise and use evidence.


Communication, human relations, group facilitation, and team building skills to work effectively with stakeholders and support project teams; build community capacity; promote public health initiatives; facilitate meetings; present and disseminate information of a scientific nature to lay and professional audiences; exchange information with other public health professionals; and participate as an effective team member.


Ability to read and critically appraise research and reports. Ability to write and compile reports and documents which involve project plans and research finding, and content used in fact sheets and information for public and staff, for manager approval. Ability to develop policies and procedures for manager approval.


Computer skills with ability to use software such as Microsoft Office; information and document management systems; internet-based searching; and qualitative/quantitative data analysis software to use and interpret data.


Ability to meet deadlines and work on multiple projects simultaneously.


Ability to occasionally alter work day to conduct meetings outside regular working hours.


Ability to travel to various locations within and outside Waterloo Region.


Ability to support and project the Region’s values.

Title: Data Analyst/Software Developer
Description:
Role Summary:
 Advances in data analytics and visualization are revolutionizing the way businesses operate. Tangam Systems is a leader in driving that transformation in the gaming industry.
 As the newest member of our Scalability and Data Engineering team, you will help the company grow comfortably as our client-base increases. You will become familiar with our upstream (TYM software) and our downstream (our network of tooling and automation infrastructure) to respond to the evolving challenges of the business in a timely and effective manner. You will constantly look for inefficiencies in company operations (long-running, manual, or error-prone processes) and invent creative ways to remove them. Our goal is to handle 5 times the volume of data without requiring 5 times the people.
 The ideal candidate should possess a solid understanding of data analysis, strong critical thinking skills and an ability to produce performant, maintainable software applications from scratch. You thrive in a small-team environment with fast-paced agile iterations, where every developer contributes code that delivers a meaningful impact to our company. You have a keen eye for identifying bottlenecks as they arise and an ability to create immediate solutions.
 Responsibilities:
 As a Data Analyst/Software Developer, you will:

Use efficient algorithms and data pipelines that scale up with client growth.
Build dashboards that transform operational data into visualizations that are intuitive and actionable.
Advance your knowledge of new software tools, infrastructure, agile programming methods, and business intelligence technologies and share your knowledge with the development team, thus catalyzing process / technology changes to help us be more efficient.
Work with cloud infrastructure to offload costs and get processes running faster and more reliably.



 Your playground / what you’ll learn:
 At Tangam you’ll get a chance to play, learn, and build with the following tools and technologies as part of a cross-functional team that is the world’s foremost innovator in gaming analytics and visualization software.

Languages: C#, JavaScript, TypeScript
Frameworks: .NET Core, Nodejs, Angular
Databases: MS SQL, MySQL
Infrastructure: Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, RabbitMQ
Operating Systems: Windows, Linux
Development Processes: Agile, CI/CD



 Qualifications and Experience:
 Required:

2+ years of experience with scripting languages (javascript, python, etc.), preferably involving some amount of data wrangling or analysis.
A solid understanding of databases and ETL processes
A desire to work on both back-ends and front-ends to serve the needs of everyone at the company.
A degree or diploma in Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related technical discipline.

Preferred:

1-3 years experience in Software Development, preferably with data intensive applications
Familiarity with statistical analysis and machine learning

Who we are:
 http://www.tangamsystems.com
 Tangam Systems is a small, profitable, and growing company that is at the cutting edge of developing data analytics and visualization software. Our clients range from Fortune 500 businesses to some of the best-known brands in the resort industry. Our software product helps casino resorts optimize their operations and logistics in order to increase profitability and enhance the patron experience. Our software takes the complexity out of data analytics and makes data understandable and actionable to ordinary users. Our global client base includes operators in China, United States, Australia, New Zealand, United Kingdom, and Canada. Our patented products have won numerous industry awards and recognitions. We continue to push the envelope on what is possible in the area of data analytics software, and we are always seeking new talent to join us on our exciting journey.


 Compensation and Benefits:

Base salary of $60K - $90K + performance-based bonuses
Work-Life Balance: Flex time, work from home days and travel incentives.
Set-up: Standing / adjustable desks, massage chair & quiet rooms, employee lounge with Xbox, Switch & PS4.
Benefits Plan: Fitness allowance, dental/prescription/vision, massage & physio, and healthcare spending account.
Food & Fun: Fully stocked kitchen, fancy coffee machine, team lunches, long weekend bottle draws and monthly employee events.



 We are committed to providing an inclusive work environment that welcomes diversity and supports accessibility across the organization. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting us at Tangam-Tngm0097@applications.recruiterbox.com.

Title: Sr. Pricing Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY:  As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

 THE OPPORTUNITY:


 Lead the Pricing Process & business case construction for new models, new products, promotions & structures, working with product management to ensure pricing supports product strategy
 Constantly evaluate & refine price points, pricing models & policies
 Devise simplification strategies and build roadmaps to reduce portfolio pricing complexities
 Become the “trusted advisor” to product management team on all aspects of product licensing and pricing and become knowledgeable in both product solutions and market dynamics 
Work directly with operations team to ensure appropriate packaging and setup of new products reflects business intent & simplicity for Sales
 Determine and conduct business analysis to (1) support strategic model/market shifts, (2) model financial impacts of pricing actions, (3) estimate street prices, (4) monitor progress of initiatives, (5) understand buying & selling behaviors (6) model financial impact of pricing actions, (7) derive customer ROI analysis as part of a value-based pricing approach.
 Create instructional/training material to educate stakeholders, ie Sales teams, PM, PMK, etc
 Support Deal Desk on deals, helping with deal configuration and discount requests/assessments as needed.


 YOU ARE GREAT AT:


 A sharp, analytical well-rounded person who wants to employ finance, marketing, and operations knowledge and skills to excel as a Pricing Analyst in a large, multi-billion software company?
 A curious problem solver?
 A self-directed, motivated person who wants to work to be the expert on all things pricing for the assigned portfolios
 A personable, collaborative person to work with Product Managers, Sales and other stakeholders to achieve outstanding outcomes that drive revenue and efficiencies?
 Willing to learn the enterprise software business from a unique perspective, with exposure to Operations, Product Management, Engineering, Product Pricing, Pricing Strategy and Sales?


 WHAT IT TAKES:


 Bachelors degree required
 MBA and/or equivalent work experience
 Knowledge of Product Mgmt, Product Mktg, Sales, Operations, Finance and/or Pricing processes a plus
 Knowledge of the software or IT industry
 Strong problem solving and communication skills
 Ability to understand and conduct business analysis & data analysis to support projects and/or problem hypotheses
 Strong team player with excellent interpersonal skills
 Ability to anticipate issues and challenges, and prioritize effectively with little supervision
 Ability to adapt and function effectively in a fast-paced, changing environment
 Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills
 Required: 3+ years in related role in a Product Mgmt, Product Mktg, Operations, Analytics and/or Pricing capacity
 Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills

 #LI-REMOTE

 OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com.

 Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Regulatory Analyst
Description:
Overview: 
 
   At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions.
 


 Finance @ Neo



 Neo Financial is looking for a full-time Regulatory Analyst to join our team in Calgary, AB. Our finance team is more than just your average group of number crunchers with their heads down in data. They see the big picture and are all about growth opportunities, knocking down business barriers, and building a future in the fintech world. Make your mark with transformative products and technologies, alongside some of Canada’s most successful business leaders and tech minds.
  What you'll be doing:: 
 
Responsible for completing and analyzing data accurately from various sources to prepare regulatory returns and reports, including:

 OSFI, ASC, CDIC and other authorities on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis

 Complete daily/weekly capital reporting
 Identify and implement reporting process improvements
 Develop an in-depth knowledge/expertise of Canadian regulatory rules and interpretations
 Participate/assist with regulator queries
 Participate in various audits – external, regulatory, and compliance
 Assist with monthly financial reporting packages, including variance analysis
 Preparation of monthly reconciliation of assigned balance sheet accounts and investigate/remediate issues
 Complete ad-hoc reporting/analysis or projects
 Who we're looking for:: 
 
3-4 years progressive experience in a relevant finance role, preferably within a financial institution
 Strong knowledge of ASPE and IFRS
 Ability to develop and maintain strong internal and external working relationships
 Strong analytical, decision making, planning, and organizational skills
 Comfortable working with autonomy and ownership in a fast paced environment, taking initiative to resolve issues
 A professional accounting designation or a CFA is considered an asset
 About applying with us:: 
  At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future.

 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Senior Customer Data Analyst
Description:
Reference Number: 10102 Department: Customer Solutions Location: Halifax, NS Type of Employment: Regular, Full-Time


 Nova Scotia Power’s greatest source of energy is our people. In a culture focused on safety and our customers, we’re committed to providing exceptional electricity service to Nova Scotians and rewarding careers for our employees. We’re hiring solution-minded people excited to help us grow into the future. We are currently looking to fill the position of Senior Customer Data Analyst within our Customer Solutions team.
 Key Responsibilities:

Source, maintain, and manage suitable multiple dimension data relating to customer electricity usage, marketing research, electrification product and services including operational data.
Utilize big data relating to energy consumption, demographic and interaction data to create deeply accurate and actionable business insights.
Collaborate in the development of an internal data warehouse, KPI reporting and dashboards using a variety of data visualization software, trend analysis and other ad-hoc reporting
Develop tests to validate data sources and support new data set integration.
Follow data collection requirements in order to optimize data analysis for customer solutions development,
Identify availability and suitability of data to solve business questions
You may also be required to engage with partner organizations, customers and coordinate market research activities

You will be responsible for your personal safety and that of your co-workers by observing all Occupational Health and Safety Rules and Regulations. You will be accountable for environmental performance as it relates to the environmental management system processes and initiatives.
 Skills, Capabilities and Experience:

Education: undergraduate degree in business, statistics, engineering or computer science
5 years in a data analytics role focusing on the principle of data-informed decision making in a fast-paced environment
Experience using data analysis to drive business growth is required
Data visualization experience with strong knowledge of Tableau Desktop, Tableau Prep and/or other visual analytics tools is required
Experience with SQL, R, Python or similar
Sound knowledge of relational database structure
Knowledge of data modelling concepts
Ease with the concepts of quantitative business, statistical modelling and machine learning
Experience with large and complex structured and unstructured datasets
Experience in data transformation and cleansing through data profiling and root cause analysis
Strong communication, presentation and business and technical writing skills
A mind-set of continuous learning and professional growth
Knowledge of the industry sector is also considered an asset

Reports to: Manager, Customer Experience
 Form of Application: Click the APPLY button at the end of the online job posting. Complete all required information fields, and copy and paste your covering letter and resume into the online form.
 Salary: Commensurate with qualifications and experience.
 Must Be Received By: All interested candidates should apply no later than June 29th, 2022. Late applications may not receive consideration.
 Recruitment and Promotion Policy: When filling vacant positions, we are determined to hire the best candidates available. We are committed to providing employees with a fair and equal opportunity to compete for jobs. Hiring and promotion of employees is based on skills, capabilities, knowledge and demonstrated abilities.
 In accordance with Emera’s occupational health and safety program and the Emera Vaccine Program, subject to any approved accommodation, all employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. For clarity, “fully vaccinated” means 14 days since having the number of doses or combination of doses of a vaccine approved by Health Canada or local public health agencies in the jurisdiction in which they will be employed.
 At Emera we value diversity, equity, and inclusion. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including persons who identify as racially visible, Indigenous, persons with disabilities, women in underrepresented roles and members of the LGBTQ+ community. Applicants from these equity groups may self-identify through the on-line application process. Emera supports candidates and employees with access and accommodation needs.
 If you are selected for an interview and require a specific accommodation, please advise our Talent Acquisition team and we will support you with the recruitment process

Title: Business Analyst (Internal Operations)
Description:
Acumatica is a company on a mission. We are a leading innovator in cloud ERP with customers located around the world. But don’t take our word for it—read what analysts like Gartner and Nucleus Research have to say about us.
 Acumatica is a leading provider of cloud business management software that empowers small and mid-size businesses to unlock their potential and drive growth. Built on the world’s best cloud and mobile technology and a unique customer-centric licensing model, Acumatica delivers a suite of fully integrated business management applications, such as Financials, Distribution, CRM, and Project Accounting, on a robust and flexible platform. In an interconnected world, Acumatica enables customers to take full control of their businesses, play to their organizations’ unique strengths, and support their clients by following them anywhere on any device.
 Acumatica’s culture is casual and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world. Acumatica offers exceptional professional and financial growth potential.
 To learn more about Acumatica’s mission, please visit: http://www.acumatica.com.
 Acumatica is looking for a Business Analyst – Internal Operations to join our team in Montreal, Canada!
 Responsibilities: 

Analyze business issues, define requirements, design computer programs, and recommend automated system controls and protocols to solve organizational information issues.
 Determine operational objectives, gather information, and evaluate output requirements and formats.
 Work closely with end users to analyze, define, model, and document systems requirements. Identify project milestones, phases, and elements, and keep team within timeline and budget.
 Construct workflow charts and diagrams, study system capabilities, and write specifications.
 Implement system configuration changes, business events, custom reports and dashboards, data export/imports, etc.
 Develop organizational change management framework and conduct user acceptance testing.
 Create end-user documentation (e.g., user guides, process flow charts, training materials) and deliver training.
 Partner with business and technical teams in establishing project teams and providing overall direction for the technology development components of projects from initiation through to delivery.
 Gather required data from end-users to evaluate objectives, goals, and scope to create technical specifications.
 Keep leadership informed of key issues that may impact project completion, budget, or other results.

 Requirements:

 5+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst primarily in software development environments. Experience creating Business Requirement Documents, Functional Specification Documents, mockups, UML diagrams and detailed test plans and cases.
 4+ years of relevant experience with ERP and CRM.
 Software Design experience is required, as is experience with Microsoft SQL server and database management tools.
 Experience configuring and maintaining systems, as well as providing user support.
 Ability to analyze and categorize issues in the context of organizational and functional objectives.
 Ability to perform and document detailed analyses of the end-user’s business processes and routine.
 Solid understanding of current market trends from the solution, vendor and end-user perspective.
 Ability to demonstrate strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
 Ability to act as a primary point of contact for external stakeholders such as Customers, Partners, ISVs and Internal stakeholders like developers, testers, and product managers.
 Ability to take ownership and be autonomous.
 Ability to focus and pay close attention to details while keeping sight of the larger issues.
 Ability to learn, absorb and dispense new information, both technical and procedural.
 Ability to present software products and technical solutions for internal stakeholders, partners and customers.
 Solid understanding of software algorithms and development process.
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering (or equivalent experience).
 Great communications and customer service skills.

 About Us:
 We are passionate about quality, and enjoy optimizing our systems for speed, reliability and scale. We strive to build easy-to-use, beautiful, well-structured products that delight our customers. Our team is built from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and we are seasoned veterans of working with a distributed team, across multiple time zones. English is the glue that holds us together, but multiple languages are spoken throughout our offices in Seattle, Columbus, Washington, Montreal, Moscow, Myanmar, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam, Philippines and Singapore.
 Acumatica Cloud ERP products are used by thousands of organizations on all continents (USA, Canada, Southeast Asia, Australia, New Zealand, Western Europe) every day.
 Acumatica is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

Title: Marketing Technology Analyst
Description:
The Marketing Technology Analyst will play a key role at StackPros Inc., where we design, create, deploy, maintain and grow industry-leading Cloud Infrastructure, Big Data Analytics and Cloud For Marketing products, solutions and services.
Reporting to the MarTech Lead, the primary responsibility of the Marketing Technology Analyst is to collaborate with fellow Digital Ecosystems Specialists, Technical Account Managers and Digital Project Managers while they guide the advancement of StackPros’ clients’ digital ecosystems and data management solutions. As a senior team member bridging the worlds of both Data Systems and Marketing Platforms, StackPros will rely on the successful candidate to take a leading role in designing marketing technology architectures tailored to the variety of needs and limitations of complex enterprises. Once architecture has been designed, StackPros will also rely on this person to play an active role within the process of guiding the deployment of applicable solutions.
The Marketing Technology Analyst will be expected to effectively represent, convey and communicate the core competencies, values and expertise of the broader StackPros team. Supported by peers spanning the many aspects of modern marketing technology, data analytics and cloud computing practice areas, the Marketing Technology Analyst will play a central/unifying role in guiding collaborative efforts toward successful client outcomes and advancements.
Key Responsibilities:

Participate in analysis of client data and formulate well-defined problem statements and recommendations for advanced analytical workflows that are usually provided as very open-ended problems
Lead thorough audits of Media, Measurement, DMP, Owned Channels (email, SMS, site, app, etc.) and other Activation Technologies, as a component of delivering enterprise-level Digital Transformation services
Provide proactive recommendations, identifying areas of opportunity and/or improvement for clients based on their underlying business objectives and goals
Design testing process, create and execute test cases for advanced analytical and personalized communication workflows at scale
Lead, execute and support both internal and client team members as it relates to the evaluation and solutioning surrounding:
Data collection through tracking system design (GTM, GA, Salesforce, Adobe, custom scripts, etc.)
Data collection, setting and leveraging DMP-based infrastructures, attribution modeling, A/B/N & multivariate testing, and dynamic creative
Paid media best practices, evaluation, implementation and optimization with a strong understanding of omni-channel attribution
Customer, transaction and related database, data warehouse and data analytics environments
In-store/in-branch, call center and event/webinar sales and marketing systems
Map business objectives to architecture requirements
Provide visual documentation detailing solutions from different layers, adapted to varying levels of technical knowledge held by client stakeholders
Work with the data systems team to define cloud Infrastructure development & deployment best practices
Contribute to Data Architecture design for integration, and API and data warehouse schema design for enablement and activation
Act as one of StackPros’ lead client-facing solution architecture SMEs with respect to Marketing and Customer Communication-type projects
Support internal solution/product initiatives from an architecture perspective
Understand data “clean room” environments such as Google’s Ads Data Hub architecture and queries
Work with multiple teams both technical and business facing to be collaborative

Internal Workflow:

Oversee and own the delivery of client projects efficiently in collaboration with internal stakeholders
Collaborate with team members on new/speculative initiatives and deliverables as they arise
Work closely within all StackPros’ cross functional teams and collaborate in execution, planning and post delivery

*

Provide leadership, guidance and support to junior team members, including performance reviews
Maintain a dedication toward achieving excellence in StackPros’ delivery against client needs while maintaining strong internal relationships with internal partners

External Communication:

Act as a primary point of client contact for the data platform tech needs of StackPros’clients, presenting to senior internal/external stakeholders
Stay involved in the majority of client communications, prioritizing your time based on urgency and importance
Maintain and exceed client satisfaction with deliverables, day-to-day work and overall value as a partner
Aim to involve other StackPros resources as appropriate, while ensuring the Accounts team directly resolves issues when feasible to maximize organizational efficiency
Cultivate opportunities for company growth, always considering areas where StackPros’ role could be expanded upon
Adapt to ever-changing client needs and expectations
Uphold StackPros’ highest standards for project delivery, client satisfaction and reputation

Qualifications:

5+ years of experience working with Cloud-Based Marketing Technology, and/or relevant Data Analytics platforms/systems
5+ years of experience in data and performance-oriented Digital Marketing/Media
3+ years of applied experience of SaaS preferably on Google Marketing Platforms, Facebook, and Adobe
1-3+ years of solution architecture experience of PaaS preferably on Google, Microsoft, and Amazon
Strong technical understanding of a range of marketing concepts such as cookie-based data collection, setting and leveraging audience segments, attribution modeling, A/B testing, knowledge of marketing KPIs and their calculations
Superior understanding of digital measurement and analytics workflows and systems, including online data collection, cloud platforms and analytics tools (Google stack, Facebook, Salesforce, Adobe Suite etc.)
Excellent written & verbal communication skills are essential; candidate should be comfortable presenting and participating in group discussions of concepts with internal and external stakeholders
A good understanding of architectural solution builds for cloud and on premise data solutions
Familiarity data warehouse environments working with API's, ETL jobs, database administration
Experience building and/or manipulating interactive dashboards in tools such as Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI or Looker is an asset

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
