Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Who we areUniveris has been successfully building and modernizing wealth management software for over 30 years. We are the go-to solution for many financial services firms (e.g., mutual fund dealers, securities dealers, wealth management firms and insurance companies) that want to stay competitive in an intriguingly digital world. To date, more than 12,000 financial advisors and 1.5 million investors have converted to our money-managed platform. Why? Because we have the technology to streamline portfolio management, drive efficiencies and improve productivity.
At Univeris, we value talent and ideas. This means our employees have the freedom to do things they know would be great and meaningful for our clients and for the company. We’re looking for people who are creative, get excited by new opportunities to learn and grow and feel at home by an organization that supports them. Ready to start your career?
*The Opportunity*Univeris is in the midst of an exciting transformation of our industry-leading enterprise wealth management portfolio, focusing on product growth and market expansion. To help achieve our objectives, Univeris is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to research and analyze industry and client data analysis to help define new products and capabilities to bring to market.
*The Role*The Business Analyst supports Product Management and works closely with cross-functional product development teams to fulfill the following responsibilities:

Analyzing market and client data, trends, and behaviours in the wealth management industry in support of product development initiatives
Conducting multi-channel research and analysis to establish requirements for new products and capabilities and demonstrate the business value of the proposed work
Sharing research findings, market information and business insights with the product teams to give context to the requirements to help ensure that the team is solving the correct problems
Reviewing existing product capabilities to identify gaps and technical debt
Preparing, refining and validating user stories and relevant acceptance criteria in collaboration with agile product development teams, Product Management and other stakeholders
Defining and monitoring product performance metrics and sharing trends and insights with product teams and leadership
Continuously developing and documenting relevant industry and product domain and expertise and sharing that knowledge with the product team
Aid in prioritization of the team's work backlogs in collaboration with the team and product management

The Successful CandidateYour Formal Qualifications

4-7 years of industry experience as a Product or Business Analyst, preferably working with an Independent Software Vendor (ISV) selling B2B software products
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a technology or business-related field
Understanding of Agile software development principles and using Scrum for software development

Your Proven Qualities

Collaboration - proven ability to work in a high-performance team and deliver in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Communication - able to clearly and concisely communicate in verbal and written form to both internal and customer stakeholders, with emphasis on understanding the customer's perspective
Organization - being very consistent and structured in managing information, documentation, Agile boards and other artifacts produced
Learning agility - ability to learn new business and technical concepts quickly and apply them in delivering value
Critical thinking - demonstrates advanced problem-solving abilities
Time management - ability to manage multiple tasks effectively and operate successfully in a matrix environment
Technical competency - familiarity with software development and analytical tools and processes, such as Google Analytics, GIT, SQL, Jira, Confluence, Microsoft Office or Google G-Suite

Extras You Might Offer As Tiebreakers

Working knowledge of regulatory agencies and frameworks, ideally in the Wealth Management, Investments or Finance domains, such as the CSA, MFDA, IIROC and CRA
Experience working in the Wealth Management industry
Experience trading stocks or making personal investment decisions
Understanding of software development processes and techniques, such as J2EE, SQL, Spring, API

The Work Environment

Our location is in downtown Toronto in a small office environment
Work may be in-office, remote or hybrid, collaborating with other team members in-personal and digitally during regular business hours

Univeris embraces diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process may e-mail a request to careers@univeris.com.We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Univeris will only contact those selected for an interview.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: HR Analyst, HR Services, Human Resources
Description:
Position Overview 
HR Services within Human Resources is currently seeking a Full-time Regular HR Analyst.
 Reporting to the Director, HR Services (HRS), the HR Analyst supports the HRS team with reporting, data and research requests. The role requires familiarity and understanding with all HR processes and workflows, as well as, working with large amounts of HR data and collaborating with leadership to help them make informed decisions.
 This position is responsible for:

compiling, structuring, and analyzing HR data to make conclusions that help streamline processes.
working with data and gathering insights that drive decisions.
preparing and delivering reports, solutions and presentations in a meaningful way that includes detailed analysis of data and statistics for trends and patterns.
designing custom, adhoc, and/or running configured, reports in PeopleSoft.
ensuring data integrity and proactively validating data.
conducting research on a variety of topics, as required and compiling findings.
ensuring team is updated on the status or queries, issues, and concerns by collecting relevant information as necessary.
recognize and suggest milestones and benchmarks for key performance metrics.

 The HRS team provides guidance and support on all HR-related matters to Faculty/Unit stakeholders while adhering to and promoting the University's policies, practices and programs, and ensuring compliance with relevant collective agreements and legislation.The HR Analyst will work in the background to support HR programs/initiatives, goals and multiple Partner portfolios that include all employee/staffing groups. 
The HR Analyst provides data analytic support on a wide range of HR programs/functions which may include HRS, Employee and Labour Relations, Workplace Wellness (Disability Management), Talent Management (Attraction and Retention, Organizational Effectiveness, Learning and Development) and Total Rewards (Compensation and Recognition, Workforce Planning and Analytics) for all employee groups.
 This position makes recommendations regarding the development of policies, processes and systems that would realize efficiencies and increase the level of the support HR Services is able to provide.
 Position Description 
Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):

Gather requirements to identify appropriate data and design reports/dashboards to meet HR Services specific business needs to support clients
Collect, analyze, and integrate HR data from a variety of internal and external data sources, to develop reports which support the requirements of the HR Services team
Develop ad hoc reports (e.g. absenteeism, turnover rates, etc.), and provide recommendations on actions and next steps to the HR Services team based on the analysis
Summarize, analyze, and translate report data into organized and useable content to support the development of solutions to client problems
Design and develop reports, dashboards, presentations, and other visual management tools which provides trends and insights
Play a key role in supporting HR initiatives, such as reorganizations, by retrieving and formatting essential employee data from Oracle HR etc. 
Communicates proactively with HRS leadership and team to ensure they are informed of key and emerging issues identified
Supports the HRS team by preparing materials/documents in response to client needs and assisting with formulating responses in all HR areas
Provide advisory support to clients, ensuring a consistent approach is used within the portfolio
Supports the customer service focus by ensuring all clients and/or inquiries are seamlessly relayed to the appropriate and correct HR staff
Builds strong relationships with HR and COE colleagues
Supports HRS with collecting, compiling and interpreting data needed for responding to client inquiries while ensuring timely and accurate responses
Participates in project work as assigned. Identifies opportunities for project

 Qualifications / Requirements:

University degree in a related field
Minimum of two (2) years related experience in a human resources data analytics role. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered
Experience with computer systems and software (e.g., MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.) and internal HR system (e.g., Oracle HR) to produce correspondence, statistical reports, and data
Advanced Excel skills (data presentation, VLOOKUPS, index and match formulas)
Experience with HR reporting and analysis and presenting findings in meaningful and actionable format
Familiarity using various HRIS systems to navigate extract data, writes report queries etc.; knowledge of Power BI is an asset
Understanding of common human resource concepts, practices, procedures, and related employment legislation
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret and communicate data
Ability to handle multiple priorities, work independently, with good organizational skills
Detail oriented with high degree of accuracy when working with data and reports
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
CHRP designation or willingness to obtain designation, considered an asset
Commitment to continuous learning and improvement

 Application Deadline: July 6, 2022
 We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.
 Additional Information 
This position is classified in the Professional Career Band, Level 2 of the Management and Professional Staff Career Framework.
 To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Management and Staff Careers website.
 The University strongly recommends all faculty and staff are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
 About the University of Calgary
 The University of Calgary is Canada's leading next-generation university - a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation's most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada's top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.
 The University of Calgary has launched an institution-wide Indigenous Strategy in line with the foundational goals of Eyes High, committing to creating a rich, vibrant, and culturally competent campus that welcomes and supports Indigenous Peoples, encourages Indigenous community partnerships, is inclusive of Indigenous perspectives in all that we do.
 As an equitable and inclusive employer, the University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. In particular, we encourage members of the designated groups (women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible/racialized minorities, and diverse sexual orientation and gender identities) to apply. To ensure a fair and equitable assessment, we offer accommodation at any stage during the recruitment process to applicants with disabilities. Questions regarding [diversity] EDI at UCalgary can be sent to the Office of Equity, Diversity and Inclusion (equity@ucalgary.ca) and requests for accommodations can be sent to Human Resources (hrhire@ucalgary.ca).
 We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.

Title: Business Analyst - MESH
Description:
The Business Analyst - MESH is responsible for the quality and integrity of the work order management system and process. The creation of the modules, process mapping, implementation of the modules, training of staff, and to provide report management support to management. Liaise with other staff to integrate the data systems for the applications such as, GIS, weather services, financial applications.
Qualifications: To be considered for this position, applicants must possess the following minimum qualifications:

Technical Diploma in the field of Computer Science or GIS from a recognized community college or equivalent experience.
Minimum 3 years related experience in a Public Works environment.
Previous knowledge of an application (app) based MESH Work Order Management System and the ability to create modules, link systems with data sources including Capital Planning software, Weather Services and GIS database architectures, and mapping technologies; create and maintain access level for users, audit data to ensure the data integrity is maintained and act a support resource to management and staff when required.
Previous knowledge to be able to determine the logic flow of a process and map it out in a flow chart is preferred.
Must have knowledge of GIS software such as ESRI ArcGIS products.
Must be familiar with GPS equipment and related software.
Familiarity with SQL or other database technologies.
Must have excellent computer skills with products such as Microsoft Office and high proficiency with database architecture and API integration.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Effective project planning and problem-solving skills.
Understands data integrity.
Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines.
Valid Class G driver’s license.
Good physical health.

Duties and Responsibilities: Background Process Collection

Facilitate meetings with user groups to determine logic process flow mapping to document, support and develop business processes each area (ie. valve turning maintenance).
Work with the individual business areas to develop and maintain schedules, routes, and work processes to support the business processes and maintenance outputs.
Within the modules created use APIs to link and synchronizing work orders with other applications or data sets such as GIS, weather services, service requests, financial applications, etc. to bring in real time data accessible to the operators.
Developing and maintaining modules to support the operational work.

Implementation Support

Setting up users with appropriate level of access.
Work in concert with IT to ensure account creation and development.
Within MESH create user setup on a per module basis, having regard to the business process, decision making and accountability or authority.

General Support to Users

Perform acceptable user testing on all supporting applications and modify as required.
Training and support for Assistant Supervisors/ Supervisors with using the work order management system to:

o Create tasks to use with work orderso Handle work assignmentso Monitor support staff activity involved in implementing the work ordero Plan work orders, which includes identifying, creating, and sequencing the tasks that must be performed to accomplish the work ordero Schedule people and resources to implement each tasko Track work orders and tasks

Leverage the platform functionality to develop work flows for asset management to maximize the efficiencies of the program including:

o Develop and maintain accuracy of work order related data (KPIs, data integrity)o Add resources to PM plans, schedules, and work order processeso Define scheduled due dates or initial meter points of system generated work ordersTech Support

Supporting users in the use of the program to scheduling and assign work, manage work orders in the system, ensure proper creation, planning, update status and closure of work orders.
Develop and maintain Standard Operating Procedures.
Support management in the review for accuracy for business intelligence reporting.
Audit the work orders for compliance with the developed process and providing feedback to the Assistant Supervisor/ Supervisor/ Director as required.

Other

Other related duties as assigned

Rate of pay Grade 13 - $35.40 - $41.61 as per hour per Schedule “A” of the Inside/Part-time Collective Agreement.Resumes and cover letters will be received online at http://careers.cityofwoodstock.ca no later than 4:00 p.m on June 26, 2022.The City of Woodstock is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We have a fulltime position available for a Business Intelligence Analyst in our Edmonton head office. Reporting to the Strategic Business Intelligence Manager, the successful individual will apply strong business acumen and analytical skills to explore and examine information, question existing assumptions and processes, and communicate informed conclusions and recommendations in a comprehensive format to a wide audience.
As the successful candidate, you will be a champion story teller that has the ability to communicate in both technical and business terms. The terms detail oriented, an i_ndependent thinker_ and an ‘out of the box’ problem solver describe you well. You are passionate about turning data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions.
In order to be successful, the candidate must be able to: 
· Design and develop complex datasets, reports and dashboards to support recurring business needs
· Provide data visualization expertise that facilitates business understanding of outcomes and recommendations
· Apply a variety of data science techniques and algorithms to build out complex models and data driven solutions
· Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple data sources, reconcile conflicts or data quality issues and present them within the correct business context
· Support information requests from inception to delivery, translating client requirements into self-service data products
· Partner with business leaders to understand their information needs and deliver results that meet and exceed their requirements
· Lead or coordinate small, informal team(s) to expedite completion of various projects
· Contribute to developing business intelligence and data modelling standards and guidelines
· Educate and train the business users with adopting the appropriate report or data product in meeting their needs
Required Qualifications: 
· Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in business, mathematics, statistics, IT, economics, or related field with a focus on data analytics
· 2+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting combined with strong statistical and analytical skills
· Knowledge of data warehouse, data mart and database technologies, standards, and methodologies
· Strong technical knowledge and experience with Power BI, SQL Server and Microsoft Excel
· Experience with gathering and documenting business requirements
· Demonstrated communication and presentation skills for an Executive audience
· Technical knowledge and experience with Python, R, GIS software and the knowledge and experience to implement machine learning algorithms are an asset
· Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIP) certification is an asset
· Experience working in the insurance industry would also be an asset
Working at Peace Hills
Peace Hills understands that by reducing work-life struggles, individuals can enjoy a healthier lifestyle while improving productivity at work. Offering a collegial work environment and a work-life balance are just two of the ways we do this.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates shortlisted will be contacted.

Title: Procurement analyst
Description:
Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide 

 The purpose of this position is also to manage the overall procurement goals and objectives in regard to quality, on time delivery, cost and customer requirements. 

 Manages and Coordinates needs, change requests and associated activities in Coordination with all stakeholders in the Project. 

 Ensures that project needs are properly communicated to the buyers, the suppliers and supports internal stakeholders to get optimized functional requirements. 

 Track Procurement performance in project and issue action plan in case of deviation 

 Perform review of Purchase requisitions for Procurement and secure Purchase Orders placed on time 

 Manage Suppliers QCD performances with the Buyers and ensure particularly On Time Delivery 

 Analyses risks and sets appropriate mitigation plan 

 Applies & supports Alstom sourcing rules, process & tools 

 Periodically sessions to present analysis of data to the Project and auditor if required 

 Provide necessary support to Project Controllers on financial topics 

 Provide audit support to project controllers 

 Qualifications 

 Interest in Procurement project management, cost and data analysis 


Knowledge of Tools: Microsoft Office (Excel, Power Point) is mandatory 

 Knowledge of ERP tools (SAP) will be an asset. 

 Team player 

 Good organizational skills and attention to details 

 Ability to interact with all stake holders on a daily basis 

 Strong communication skills and conflict resolution 

 Communication and negotiation skills 

 Be able to manage and to present well the results and issues in front of the Project 

 Education 

 0-2 years’ experience in Procurement / Sourcing / financial analysis, or audit and/or accreditation fields 

 Graduated or about to graduate from Finance, Business or Management related 

 Fluent in English - Bilingual will be an asset (English & French) 

 Alstom is the leading company in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose? 


Equal opportunity statement:
 Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.

Title: Operation Support Services Analyst
Description:
WORK ILLUSTRATION:
The Operation Support Services Analyst provides support in the effective business operations within the Fleet & Equipment Services department. Responsibilities include; data gathering and clean-up, data analysis, identifying gap/variance/trend, conducting research and preparing reports, leading or supporting department projects and programs and providing recommendations against findings to support departmental performance objectives. Additionally, the role provides support to leaders in the day-to-day operations of the group.


The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.


Toronto Hydro has implemented a mandatory vaccination requirement for all its employees. Proof of full vaccination will be required upon receiving a conditional offer of employment. Toronto Hydro will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code.

 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Analyzes operational data and functional problems to identify opportunities and implement or recommend process improvements, system rules, and validations
Lead and/or support assigned departmental projects and programs, including conducting research on best practices, performing quantitative and qualitative analysis, provide recommendations, and managing projects through to implementation and post-evaluation
Ensures a high degree of data integrity through control and audit of processes and procedures used to capture, validate, and estimate data
Assist in the identification, creation, development and maintenance of business process flows; develop governing performance standards as well as training material relevant to the process
Identify gaps and provide sustainable options for continuous business improvement associated with the department; continuously seek process and business improvements and provide recommendations
Support testing and implementation of various system enhancements in CC&B, CRM, SAP
Provides business analysis, project definition and scope, feasibility studies and cost benefits analysis
Assist in the preparation of operational budgets, accruals, forecasts, and reporting and tracking of Engineering Services departmental metrics and scorecards
Support Grid Emergency Management as it relates to Engineering Services
Support day-to-day operations of the Engineering Services team
Performs additional duties as assigned

 

COMPETENCIES:

Post-secondary education in Business, Engineering, or related discipline
Three (3) plus years professional experience in fleet service, project coordination, business case development and/or technology piloting and implementation
Three (3) to five (5) years of experience in one or more areas of Fleet Management, Asset Management
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is an asset
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools including but not limited to Excel, Alteryx, Power Pivot, BI Cubes, SAP
Knowledge and experience with managing and analyzing complex data as it relates to Customer Connections
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills, including ability to determine root causes and develop recommended solutions
Good understanding of business issues and challenges, specifically in a customer service and operations environment
Knowledge of Alteryx, Tableau, CC&B, CRM is an asset
Six Sigma or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is an asset
Excellent computer skills with proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Visio & PowerPoint); ability to build and automate reports and use statistical methodologies for tracking performance or building models
Demonstrated experience in compiling and presenting reports with acute attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Demonstrates customer focus: models a customer focussed approach in all decisions and actions
Drives results & accountability: has a clear sense of corporate/department direction
Builds strong relationships: able to influence, gain support and commitment from others
Champions change, productivity, & innovation: invests in innovation, continuous improvement and productivity
Develops culture & people: actively engages in continual learning and personal development
Commitment to environment, health & safety

 
 Job Segment: Six Sigma, Project Manager, Data Analyst, Engineer, ERP, Management, Data, Technology, Engineering

Title: Business Analyst - BI & Reporting
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

If you love data and have a good analytical mind this position represents an exciting challenge for you! You will thrive in a dynamic team whose mandate is to deploy and implement Business Intelligence projects for TD Insurance. You will be asked to produce the requirements related to reports and/or change requests, using company data. These elements will allow you to work with a team of dynamic professionals who understand and define different business needs in line with strategic initiatives within TD Insurance. Finally, this position offers excellent career opportunities within the TD Bank Group.



Job Description

The incumbent is responsible for initiating and managing Large and Medium-sized business change requests and ensuring they are successfully conducted in line with the company's priorities.

 Document Business Intelligence requirements for our Business partners;
 Document business rules and validate data mappings;
 Perform impact analysis.

 Communicate business needs to the teams responsible to define the business rules and development, so that they can design and propose solutions.

 Support related teams in the investigation and design of business solutions;
 Collaborate in the selection of the best solutions;
 Present and validate with the business partners the alternative(s) of proposed solution(s).

 Must be able to understand different operational systems: systems functioning (engineering concept), what they contain (understanding available data, investigating data, etc ...).  Must show strong adaptability to discuss with different stakeholders in terms of expertise, training and hierarchy.



Job Requirements


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant discipline.
 At least 2 years of relevant experience in Business Intelligence projects/Reporting.
 Knowledge in data extraction and manipulation (Impala/Hue/DBeaver/SAS/SQL)
 Excellent communication: Bilingual (English and French).
 Know how to manage time and multiple projects simultaneously.
 Demonstrate highly developed analytical skills.
 Be rigorous and quality conscious.
 Work efficiently in a team setting.

 Assets

 Knowledge of property and casualty insurance business in Canada
 Jira/Confluence, Agile methodology.




Inclusiveness

Title: Data Analyst, Billing and Invoicing
Description:
Address: 250 Yonge Street 
 







Job Family Group: 






Technology 
 
This opportunity is in a high profile area within the Technology & Operations (T&O) business management organization. Your work will focus on the Bill of Service of T&O Services in the front line business areas. 

The Bill of Service model is a software application from Apptio (3rd party application). The product that you will be using is called ApptioOne Billing. You will provide data insights , analyze/review solutions to better understand costs, understand service value, and strengthen consumer-provider relationships across our organization. Other key duties are reviewing preparatory work on plan data, support the current year plan charges/invoices, and work on following year plan construction. 

Your role is the cornerstone to make the stories, explain the picture for the clients, the business, our T&O management to understand their costs, the drivers, and how to better manage their costs. You will be part of a larger team that supports you and the Apptio application. 

Duties: Liaises with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities and, recommends solutions to enable the achievement of organizational goals. Builds exceptional relationships with business partners and internal stakeholders. Analyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholders. Ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meet essential quality standards. Participates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products. 

Understands and can explain to others the core processes, risks & mitigation techniques for designated areas. 
Anticipates and reduces complexity for others. 
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues. 
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues. 
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives. 
Assists in the preparation of end-user materials. 
Plans and conducts third-party software analysis as needed for inclusion in the project solution. 
Gathers requirements and documents these requirements for use in various audits, reports, & projects. 
Participates in the creation of use cases and user expected results to ensure that software is delivered to end users with zero Severity 1 or Severity 2 defects. 
Works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs. 
Ensures system specifications meet expectations/requirements, and negotiates solutions. 
Creates documentation to ensure the supportability of analyses. 
Maintains existing requirements to ensure that current-state needs are known. 
Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality. 
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets. 
Filters and “cleans” data, and reviews computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems. 
Remains alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and devises new ways of applying them. 
Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. 
Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency. 
Facilitates discussions and follows a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage requirements with stakeholders. 
Provides analytical support and insights. 
Identifies opportunities to strengthen business analysis capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across BMO. 
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning. 
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. 


Qualifications: 

3 years of Data Analysis and data manipulation using MS Excel or MS Access or SQL or BI Tools. ( Must be willing to learn/train Apptio) 
Must understand invoicing , billing, charges, and costs . 
MS Office (Excel/PowerPoint/word) – Min of 3 years experience with MS Office 
Experience in Business Management/Finance 
Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
Demonstrates applied knowledge of one or more analysis and problem decomposition technique. 
Understands complete Software Development Life Cycle and can apply the applicable portions of the ‘Feasibility,’ ‘Requirements,” and ‘Analysis’ phases. 
Demonstrates writing and documentation skills. 
Understands and can explain to others the core processes involved in their area of support. 
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 
Flexible, adaptable and highly motivated 
Effectively cope with complex and ambiguous situations 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Business Systems Analyst Student
Description:
The future you want is within reach.

 At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We're a community of builders committed to building better communities. That's why we're always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what's next in our industry.

 We're also looking at what's next for you and how we can help you build a career you're proud of. As a student at PCL, you will get the opportunity for challenging work assignments in a supportive work environment which promotes personal and professional growth.

 We are seeking a Business Systems Analyst Student for our North American Headquarters (Edmonton, AB) who is available for 8 months starting in September 2022.
 Here's how an Business Systems Analyst Student for our Edmonton NAHQ office contributes to our team:



 Responsibilities



 Assisting with producing, formatting, organizing learning resources
 Develop and maintain reports and dashboards based on business needs
 Acquire data from a variety of structured and unstructured data sources
 Provide technical support and assistance to report and dashboard consumers
 Create, format, and organize document templates
 Create and maintain process and system documentation
 Liaise with business, technology, and support teams to ensure business requirements are met
 Identify and suggest improvements to existing solutions and processes
 Quality assurance / system testing





 Qualifications



 Currently enrolled in a business analysis, computing science, computer engineering, data analysis or information management related program
 Keen interest in data management as it applies to business intelligence and analytics
 Interest and proficiency in producing well formatted and clearly written documentation
 Ability to quickly gain proficiency in new software
 Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI is preferred
 Proficiency with MS Office suite is preferred
 Experience with relational databases and SQL is preferred but not required

 In addition to the technical skills listed above, the ideal candidate will possess the following qualities:

 Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
 Excellent problem-solving skills
 Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, be flexible, stay organized, and maintain attention to detail and accuracy




 Next Step:

 Please note that candidates who have been selected to move forward to the next stage of the recruitment process will receive an email to complete a short online video interview.

 PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. We are committed to creating equitable opportunities and an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We make employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status. Title: Business Analyst (distribution)
Description:
Acumatica is a company on a mission. We are a leading innovator in cloud ERP with customers located around the world. But don’t take our word for it—read what analysts like Gartner and Nucleus Research have to say about us.
 Acumatica is a leading provider of cloud business management software that empowers small and mid-size businesses to unlock their potential and drive growth. Built on the world’s best cloud and mobile technology and a unique customer-centric licensing model, Acumatica delivers a suite of fully integrated business management applications, such as Financials, Distribution, CRM, and Project Accounting, on a robust and flexible platform. In an interconnected world, Acumatica enables customers to take full control of their businesses, play to their organizations’ unique strengths, and support their clients by following them anywhere on any device.
 Acumatica’s culture is casual and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world. Acumatica offers exceptional professional and financial growth potential.
 To learn more about Acumatica’s mission, please visit: http://www.acumatica.com.
 Acumatica is looking for a Business Analyst to join our distribution team in Montreal, Canada! 
Responsibilities:

 Analysis of business scenarios and product requirements, communication with foreign partners and customers
 Design new features and create functional specifications, analyze backward compatibility of product changes, negotiate specifications with all stakeholders
 Decomposition of changes in the product and setting the task for developers, coordination of implementation details and possible changes to the original requirements
 Interaction with automated testing engineers, technical writers and support engineers within the project under development
 Comparison of functional specifications with actual changes in the product, acceptance testing and verification of corrected errors
 Creation of test plans and test scenarios that check the compliance of the product functionality with the requirements set, as well as check the performance of the system in special conditions (data migration, incorrect data, high load, etc.)

 Requirements:

 Higher technical education in: computer systems, systems and networks; information systems and technologies, system analysis and management, computational mathematics and Informatics
 Experience in system analysis, development of functional specifications, test scenarios - for 3+ years
 Acceptance testing
 Experience in implementation/support of ERP systems
 Experience in writing documentation in English
 Analytical mindset and ability to learn quickly
 Ability to clearly express thoughts, structure big amounts of information, decompose objects and processes
 Ability to adhere to the designated priorities and focus on results
 Desire to learn new things and improve professional skills
 Perfectionism, ability to model user behavior and see flaws in the running application
 Ability to build constructive communication with colleagues, share information and experience
 Highly desirable:
   
 Experience in support/development of Supply Chain, Warehousing, Sales or Purchasing modules in other ERP systems
 Experience in e-commerce or credit card processing solutions.



 Us:
 We are passionate about quality, and enjoy optimizing our systems for speed, reliability and scale. We strive to build easy to use, beautiful, well-structured products that delight our customers. Our team is built from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and we are seasoned veterans of working with a distributed team, across multiple time zones. English is the glue that holds us together, but multiple languages are spoken throughout our offices in Seattle, Columbus, Washington, Montreal, Moscow Myanmar, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam and Philippines and Singapore.
 Acumatica Cloud ERP products are used by thousands of organizations on all continents (USA, Canada, Southeast Asia, Australia, New Zealand, Western Europe) every day.
 Acumatica is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

Title: Evidence Management Analyst (10-month contract)
Description:
Our organization:

  The Alberta Securities Commission is the industry-funded regulator responsible for administering the province's securities laws. It is entrusted with fostering a fair and efficient capital market in Alberta and with protecting investors. As a member of the Canadian Securities Administrators, the ASC works to improve, coordinate and harmonize the regulation of Canada's capital markets.
  
 The Enforcement division enforces Alberta securities laws by investigating and prosecuting breaches of those laws to prevent and stop current and future misconduct. The Evidence Management team helps ensure that information and evidence are properly managed throughout the investigation and litigation process.
 
The opportunity:

  Reporting to the Manager, Evidence & Legal Technology, this position will provide expertise in tracking, processing, digital analysis, categorizing and disclosure of evidence through the course of investigations and litigation.
 
Key responsibilities include:

  Managing the processing of investigative information (digital, paper-based and other physical format) throughout the case lifecycle.
   Meeting with investigators and litigators to discuss, strategize, train and assist with:
   Secure and defensible evidence collection
   Appropriate evidence handling and tracking processes
   Early case assessment, culling, evidence categorization and quarantining
   Data analytics and technology assisted review
   Database management
   Disclosure and hearing documentation
   Training and assisting with the categorizing and tagging of documents for disclosure (and non-disclosure).
   Preparing documents for disclosure in a context-appropriate format and in accordance with governing rules or panel directions.
   Organizing and preparing documents for hearings and/or trials as appropriate for the type of case, hearing forum and format needed (digital or physical).
   Establishing and documenting work flows to support efficient document reviews.
   Tracking and overseeing the movement of original evidence (paper and electronic) in and out of the Evidence Room.
   Liaising with law firms and others in regard to database and document issues.
   Providing technical and functional support and training on evidence tracking, document management, database searching, review, tagging and disclosure.
   Assisting with document scanning, electronic discovery processing and software.
   Assisting the Office of the General Counsel and Records and Information Management staff as necessary to prepare documentary responses to Enforcement-related FOIP requests and criminal or court production orders. 
   In collaboration with colleagues, reviewing and enhancing procedures, systems and software.
 
The ideal candidate will possess:

  A Legal Assistant certificate or diploma, or equivalent education or experience. 
   Five or more years of litigation support or records management experience, preferably working in a legal or regulatory environment. 
   Five or more years of experience working with electronic litigation support databases, e-discovery software, or comparable information management systems.
   Strong problem-solving, time-management, task prioritization and communication skills.
   Strength in documenting and providing training on processes and best practices.
   The ability to work well as part of a team.
   Excellent attention to detail and the ability to follow precise written and verbal instructions.
   Working knowledge of e-discovery and other search software and databases.
   Experience using Technology Assisted Review and/or other automated document analysis tools.
   Experience in privilege and relevance review is preferred.
 
To apply:

  Click the Apply For This Job button to submit your resume, cover letter and salary expectations by July 8, 2022.

Title: Science Coordinator: Data Searcher and Analyst
Description:
Overview
Flogen Star Outreach is looking for a Data Researcher to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity to help search data for sustainable research and technologies Flogen Stars Outreach goal to reach sustainability through science and technology..
www.Flogen.org
FLOGEN Star Outreach is a non-profit organization dedicated to sustainable development through science, technology, and engineering. Each year, we organize an international conference (Sustainable Industrial Processing Summit) that covers three sustainability pillars: (1) Science, Technology & Industry, (2) Governance & Management and (3) Education & Civil Society. The summit simultaneously incorporates numerous International Symposia covering the fields of: iron and steel making; electrochemistry; molten salt and ionic liquids; advanced materials; advanced manufacturing; advanced technologies; aluminum; batteries; bio-extraction; cement; coal; coatings; composites; ceramics; ecosystems; education; energy production; environment; ferro-alloys; mathematics; metallic systems; metals and alloys; minerals; mining; multiscale materials; nanomaterials; non-ferrous smelting and hydro/electrochemical processing; quasi-crystals; rare earth and platinum group metals; recycling; and rotary kiln operations. The topics within each symposia span across scientific, technological, environmental, health, legal, management, financial, policy, taxation, social, and pedagogy issues.
This year's edition, SIPS 2022 will take place in Phuket. Thailand, during There are several paid summer positions open for a student or non-student aged below 30 interested in assisting in the organization of this conference.
This is a Canada summer job program and the eligibility criteria for this job as determined by Government of Canada are: 

Is between 15 and 30 years of age (inclusive) at the start of employment;


Is a Canadian Citizen, permanent resident, or person on whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act*; and


Is legally entitled to work according to the relevant provincial / territorial legislation and regulations.

*International students are not eligible. Recent immigrants are eligible if they are Canadian Citizens or permanent residents.
FLOGEN Stars Outreach preferred qualifications: 

Excellent English, written and spoken


A strong interest for working in a non-profit environment, for subjects related to STEM and sustainability, and for event management and coordination


Familiarity with journal platforms, academic publishing tools, and/or SEO an asset


The ideal candidate will have excellent teamwork skills, and be highly organized and detail oriented

Job Type: SeasonalContract length: 8 weeks
Salary: $15.00 per hour
Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Montreal, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

Graphic design: 1 year (preferred)

Language:

English (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-07-01

Title: Workforce Reporting Analyst
Description:
Overview: 
  At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions.
 Workforce Operations @ Neo
 Our Workforce Operations team plays a significant part in enabling our business areas to be at their most efficient through the sourcing, planning and reporting of our resources. Workforce Operations focuses on ensuring we have the right people, in the right place, at the right times so we continue to deliver exceptional experiences to new and existing customers. By planning ahead and leveraging data to make decisions, this team helps to drive forward the continued long-term success of our business.
 The Role

   As our next 
  Workforce Reporting Analyst, you’ll be responsible for historical reporting, trend analysis and KPI tracking to ensure our customer support and customer acquisition channels are being optimized and resourced effectively. We’re looking for someone who loves to analyze & synthesize data and can turn that data into a story for various lines of business. 
 What you'll be doing:: 
 
Provide forecasting and staffing recommendations to the business by sharing insight on historical data, current trending and future state
 Alongside the Workforce Management team, create and share daily reporting on Key Performance Indicators from across the business (this will include KPI’s such as Call Volumes, Abandon Rate and Service Levels achieved)
 Respond to leaders questions, concerns, or requests around reporting and key trends
 Collaborate with the WFM team to design, create, and maintain reports including onboarding new hires, schedule changes, and managing time off
 Understand when concerns need to be escalated to department leadership
 Work with our leadership teams to improve our processes and tools


 Who we're looking for:: 
 
You bring 2-3 years of experience in reporting and data analysis
 You have strong expertise with reporting tools including spreadsheets, Data Studio, Talkdesk and Zendesk
 You bring an understanding of Workforce management systems or scheduling/resourcing tools
 You have database experience and ability to dig into any problem, and troubleshoot any kind of technical issue


 What will help you succeed:: 
 
You bring strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, grit, perseverance, organization and a thirst for learning
 You are intellectually curious, and won’t stop investigating a problem until you have identified the root causes


 You are a structured and logical thinker, capable of taking a problem and breaking it down into its component parts


 About applying with us:: 
 
   At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future.
 


 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Logistics Analyst
Description:
SPECIAL NOTE* The teams at NewAge Products Inc. are taking every precaution to ensure the health and safety of our employees and those that we interact with. Until further notice, all interviews will be held virtually, with arrangements made to accommodate your schedule and technology preference. Our teams continue to work under a Hybrid model, with the ease of having our North York office accessible for collaboration and/or quiet workspace. Successful candidates will complete virtual training and perform work remotely.Headquartered in North York, ON, with employees in Canada, the US, China and India, NewAge is an industry-leading manufacturer and distributor of premium home improvement solutions.Our products are sold through major online retailers such as Lowes, The Home Depot, Costco, Amazon, and Wayfair as well as our own e-commerce site. But what makes us unique is that we provide a truly cohesive customer experience, from free expert assistance designing and planning new spaces to delivery and professional installation.Our collaborative, inclusive team atmosphere nurtures personal growth, career advancement and job satisfaction, as evidenced by our certification as a Great Place to Work in Canada and our 4.4 out of 5 rating on Glassdoor.With tremendous pride, we continue to receive a growing number of industry accolades including over 75 unique product patents, awards for our team of expert designers, prominent ranking on the Profit 500 list of Canada’s fastest growing companies, and the naming of our founders to the Top 40 under 40 in Canada by BNN Bloomberg.As our journey to becoming the preferred choice for premium home improvement solutions continues, we’re adding ambitious, driven, passionate members to our team who are inspired to be their best and ready to make a difference.NewAge Products is presently seeking a Logistics Analyst to join our Logistics Team.Position Responsibilities: 

Develop and implement policies, procedures, and tools to improve warehousing efficiencies across the supply-chain operation and DC network
Analyze warehousing financial data to identify opportunities for cost savings, create forecast models, and improve KPI metrics
Responsible for warehousing budget of 10 million annually and preparation of monthly financial reports for executive teams
Define and manage multiple projects of varying size and complexity including problem definition, data gathering, complex modeling and scenario building, presentation and implementation.
Research and evaluate new North American warehouse partners, through online research, networking, and calling potential partners
Negotiate contracts with new and existing partners.
Work in collaboration with cross functional teams to continually monitor 3pl warehouse partners and ensure performance SLAs, financial metrics, and contractual obligations are met
Evaluate the success of continuous improvement initiatives.
Audit monthly warehousing bills and dispute discrepancies
Maintaining and updating the Shipping and Warehousing SOP
Liaise with support personal at NewAge’s DC in California to improve processes and warehouse operations
Act as a project manager for complex projects involving building/land purchases, long term financial analysis and NPV
Preparation of an annual budget, monitors the budget on a monthly basis, and identifies variances in actual costs vs budgeted costs explains variances
Collaborate with key stakeholders in Finance on large projects requiring long year financial analyses
Provide oversight and direction to the employees at the NewAge DC’s
Long range planning of staffing levels and space utilization to account for growth and the changing profile of the business

Experience & Education: 

Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain logistics, data analytics, or similar experience required. Preference to BBA with specialization in Supply Chain Solutions.
Minimum 4 years’ experience in analysis of transportation, warehousing or manufacturing required.
Demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to prioritize & effectively participate in a team environment
Familiarity with the Occupational Health and Safety Act and regulations
Experience in problem solving and utilizing financial concepts to forecast costs, create budgets, and account for the financial impact of decisions, Request for Proposals (RFPs)
Excellent negotiation skills
Advanced data analytical skills are required including proficiency in Excel, VBA macros, Access, PowerPoint
Experience with visual dash boarding, database query design in SQL, Tableau or Crystal Reports software is highly desirable
Familiarity with SAP Business One or equivalent ERP systems
Experience with Six Sigma or other Process Improvement Methodology valued
Strong written and verbal communication skills are required.
Experience working within a distribution environment highly valued

NewAge Offers: 

Salary and bonus is based on experience and highly competitive for the right candidate
Benefits package
An opportunity within a growing, fast-paced company, well established in its industry
Fun! We celebrate successes, and hold special events to build strong teams.

How to Apply: If you’re intrigued by job profile described above, we invite you to apply with your resume and cover letter illustrating how you would be an ideal fit with our team. We thank all interested candidates for applying, and will contact those who qualify for an interview. No phone calls please. Offers of employment are contingent on the successful completion of a thorough background check.Headquartered in North York, Ontario, with employees in the US, China and India, NewAge is committed to being a trusted brand in the home improvement industry by offering unique products, exceptional value and a best-in-class customer experience.As a company, our core values are to simplify the complex, respect the dignity of all people, operate with integrity and openness, recognize our responsibility to the team and take a customer centric approach to everything we do.If you identify with these values, you could be a great fit and valued member of our team!NewAge Products is an equal opportunity employer, committed to inclusion and diversity. We provide employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require any accommodation.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Asset Investment Analyst
Description:
WORK ILLUSTRATION:


Reporting to the Manager, Engineering, the Asset Investment Analyst (Data Analyst) will provide a wide range of engineering support services that will ensure technical soundness, reliability, safety and cost effectiveness of the utility and its Electrical Distribution Power System. The Asset Investment Analyst will support a number of initiatives in relation to data governance, analytics used to address various engineering initiatives, as well as the strategy to continue to evolve analytical capabilities within the division.


The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.


Toronto Hydro has implemented a mandatory vaccination requirement for all its employees. Proof of full vaccination will be required upon receiving a conditional offer of employment. Toronto Hydro will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



Supports Asset Management analytics across Engineering
Works on standardizing data usage and analytics across Engineering
Maintains the engineering data dictionary and entity relationship diagrams
Participates in the strategic development of the analytics portfolio within the division and drives implementation activities
Communicates with a wide range of cross-departmental stakeholders to advance the role of analytics in day to day activities
Works with stakeholders to identify and provide access to data sources via the Engineering Data Warehouse for various analytics initiatives
Supports the development of descriptive, predictive and prescriptive models to enhance AM decision making and analytics
Works with stakeholders to develop, deploy and enhance existing models to support AM decision making and analytics
Evaluates use cases for applicability for advanced analytical implementation (i.e. Machine Learning applications)
Collaborates with stakeholders to support data analytics related with short and long-range planning processes
Prepares engineering, technical or business reports and studies; performs analysis, testing and evaluations
Participates in implementing corporate goals/objectives


 
REQUIREMENTS:



Undergraduate degree in Engineering, Electrical Engineering preferred
Four (4) - Five (5) years of analytics experience with Python/R, Alteryx, SQL and Tableau (preferably in a utility environment)
Four (4) - Five (5) years of experience with data preparation and wrangling with SQL, Alteryx or Python is required
3 years of experience with Supervised and Unsupervised Machine Learning models with demonstrated project or prior work experience is required
Experience in Operations Research (Engineering Asset Management, Survival Analysis, Mathematical Programming/Optimization) is desired
Experience with data analysis and data mining techniques to address and resolve gaps in data
Fully proficient with Microsoft Excel including Data Solver and VBA
Effective skills in project management operations, budgeting, business process and productivity improvements
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge/training in asset management practices is an asset
Specific Knowledge in power systems, electrical distribution, and computer applications is an asset
Demonstrated versatile leadership; encourage organizational teamwork, collaboration and educated risk taking to develop innovative solutions and support the corporate goal
Self-motivated, operates with a high degree of independence and can visualize opportunities for change in support of continuous process improvement
Aptitude and experience in adapting to, managing, and facilitating change, willing to challenge the status quo
Strong negotiating/relationship building ability
Proven effective problem-solving and analytical ability
Customer focused
Demonstrated knowledge of relevant safety and environmental legislation and regulations


 
Toronto Hydro has introduced a Hybrid Work Arrangement. This position allows for remote work up to three days per week, based on business needs. Employees will be required to come onsite on those days when they are involved in activities that they or their leader feel are better conducted in person. You are expected to live in Ontario and within reasonable commuting distance of the office.


 Job Segment: Data Analyst, Power Systems, Research Engineer, Business Process, Electrical Engineering, Energy, Data, Engineering, Management

Title: SAP Success Factors Business Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 36431

 Company
Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world’s most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, decolonization, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


 Main Purpose and Function
The primary purpose of this position is to investigate IT and business requirements; design, develop, document, support and apply knowledge of the best-of-breed processes and procedures in the SAP SuccessFactors application and to recommend appropriate system solutions as well as changes to business processes. This position is to be a leader of SAP SuccessFactors projects through the preliminary investigation, analysis of requirements, business case and feasibility analysis, design, implementation, quality control, documentation, and post-implementation phases. This position provides ongoing application support and responsibilities include performing changes to the following SAP SuccessFactors modules: Learning Management System, and Performance and Goals.


Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships
Reports to the Manager SAP HR/Payroll within Technology Services Applications Development, works closely with Program and Project team members, external Vendors, Help Centre staff, business customers, and other IT partners. May supervise external consultants, and evaluate developers for project deliverables.


Specific Duties/Responsibilities

Develops, maintains and support LMS and Performance and Goals Management configuration.
Consults with customers to understand their requirements.
Develops technical specifications including diagrams and charts.
Develops detailed project plans to track progress.
Manages small to medium projects through all phases from planning through to maintenance and support.
Researches, evaluates and recommends new tools and methodologies for development of business applications.
Reviews or develops test scripts and scenarios to ensure adequate testing of system configuration and integration.
Performs testing of problem fixes, configuration changes, enhancements and new functionality.
Remains current with SF modules and related technologies, including releases and enhancements/new functionality.
Identifies opportunities to improve operational effectiveness and makes recommendations where appropriate (make changes to use of system, business process and/or add additional functionality).
Delivers presentations to customers (users, departments) and technical staff on Sf related solutions and specific technologies.


Provides on-going training, support and guidance to related parties in relevant area(s) of expertise.
Provides problem resolution for calls referred by Help Desk.
Investigates and follows up on SuccessFactors system errors/problems, and liaises with SAP, IT staff and others as required to resolve these issues.
Develops and maintains system configuration documentation.
Provides technical assistance with upgrades and the implementation of other modules, including integration to other applications.
Monitors applications performance, trouble shoots problems with technical specialists.
Participates in the development of new standards, and might lead technical committees.
Has access to highly sensitive and business critical data from all City departments (e.g. employee and payroll records)
Other duties/responsibilities as assigned


 
Minimum Qualification Requirements
Education and Experience:

Related Post-secondary degree, with preference for graduate degree in Computer Science or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum 5 years of SAP SuccessFactors implementation experience with emphasis on at least one of the following modules: Learning Management System (LMS) and Performance and Goals.
Proven experience with the design, development, configuration and implementation of key HR business processes within SuccessFactors based on SAP best practices and aligned with business requirements.
Hands on configuration of relevant SuccessFactors modules such as RCM (Requisition Templates, Requisition Route/Approval Workflows, Picklists), ONB (Forms, Notifications, Picklists, Process Flows, New Employee Portal, EC (Foundation Object, Rules, Transactions – Event Reasons, Alerts, Notifications, Workflows), etc.
Knowledge and understanding of SuccessFactors, able to make recommendations aligned with the future direction of SAP’s technology roadmap and industry trends
Understanding and experience with SuccessFactors across modules integrations will be an asset
Understanding and experience with SuccessFactors to SAP on-premise integration will be an asset
Proven experience in providing project and/or sustainment support as required (for example, planning, change management, communications, testing, training, go-live and post go-live support activities)
Experience in completing SuccessFactors’ documentation and materials such as Configuration Workbooks, Solution Design Documents and Functional Specifications
SAP SuccessFactors certification is a definite asset
SAP SuccessFactors provisioning experience will be an asset
Thorough working knowledge of office productivity tools (e.g. Windows, MS Office, MS Project, Visio, etc.)
Experience with Agile development and the use of tools such as VSTS would be an asset.
Combination of strong technical and business skills is required.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a member of a team.
Excellent oral, written and presentation skills with ability to communicate to all levels of the organization.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships both internally and externally with technical and non-technical staff.
Ability to handle business critical and sensitive information.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure, manage multiple priorities and respond to requests in a timely manner.
Continuous improvement and continuous learning mindset.


 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

This position requires an Enhanced Police Record check.



Where operationally appropriate and subject to change, the City of Vancouver has a Flexible Work Program. This program allows staff to work remotely 1 – 4 days a week from locations that are a daily commutable distance from their work at a City worksite. At this time this position is eligible to be part of the Flexible Work Program.


The City of Vancouver has a COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination Policy. All external applicants applying to the City of Vancouver are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire and subject to this policy as a condition of ongoing employment. Candidates may only be exempted from this requirement if they request and are approved for an accommodation based on a reason related to a Human Rights Code ground (such as disability). Such a request must be made during, not after, the recruitment process.
