Title: Enterprise Business Data Analyst
Description:
Posting closes: June 29, 2022

 Servus is growing! We are looking for an Enterprise Business Data Analyst in our Information Services Department.
Reporting to the Leader of Data Governance, your primary objective is to understand the needs and objectives of your stakeholders through data analysis and develop meaningful data visualizations and narratives to help stakeholders better comprehend and act on that data. As a Business Data Analyst, you are a business data expert with a deep understanding of the information needs of the organization and act as a champion for data literacy at Servus. 
More specifically, the scope of your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: 

Leading facilitation of workshops for the Data & Analytics Community of Practice (COP) to share data domain knowledge, standards, learnings, and expertise of Business Intelligence tools
Providing input into the Data & Analytics strategy, plans and roadmaps to align Data & Analytics needs of the business stakeholders
Lead, design, document and implement all aspects of information provisioning, including data analysis, data munging, data profiling, data cleansing, data modeling, data provisioning, data sharing and research and development services
Working closely with Business Intelligence Analysts for data translation and storage; set and enforce policies and standards related to BI and data sharing 
Communicating in a timely and professional manner, escalating own issues and potential team issues appropriately to Leader or Project Manager as appropriate
Persuade diverse business areas to adopt a data-driven point of view

Requirements
 To qualify, you will need at least the following:

4+ years’ hands-on demonstrated experience in a Data Analysis or Business Intelligence roles
Agile/ Scrum experience


Hands-on design and development experience using SQL, SQL Server, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, Power BI or equivalent and ETL applications.
Experience using Data Analysis techniques and developing visualization to present findings·
Hands-on experience of unit testing, product compliance testing, system integration testing, volume/stress testing, and user acceptance testing
Bachelor's degree or diploma in Computer Science, Statistics, Management Information Systems or equivalent
Knowledge or experience with banking or financial organization/s is preferred
Experienced in developing, documenting, communicating, and enforcing coding standards
Business Data Analytics or Data Analytics Certification

Most importantly, we are looking for candidates with demonstrated troubleshooting and problem solving skills who can analyze data and communicate it to the business in meaningful ways. If you are an experienced data analyst looking for long-term career growth, then we encourage you to apply!
 Benefits
 Where we work?
 Servus has introduced a new flexible hybrid work model which consists of a combination of working in the office and working remotely. The hybrid approach provides employees with more flexibility, while still allowing employees to connect in person and remotely and building upon the culture that makes Servus such a great place to work.
 Why choose Servus?  
By creating a healthy and inclusive work environment and providing employees with the tools and supports they need, we help our employees achieve their potential. Servus is committed to providing a great place to work, and we invest in our employees by ensuring they have:

A supportive and engaging working environment
Benefits that lead the field
A total rewards strategy that includes recognition for a job well done
Learning options that support lifelong learning and career-building opportunities
Opportunities and support for volunteering in local communities and abroad
Support for employee fundraising through our annual corporate fundraising events and through several less formal initiatives led by our employees

Here are some of the benefits that our employees love:

Financial product benefits available immediately
Group retirement program available after only 3 months
Employee financial services team available to help you reach your financial goals
Disability programs
Group benefit coverage including extended health care coverage, travel insurance, dental plans, and specialized medical coverage
Flexible spending account to purchase additional health or personal wellness items
Wellness initiatives
Employee and family assistance plan
Minimum 3 weeks' vacation and vacation purchase program
Other leaves including parental, emergency days, and critical care days
Reward programs
Incentive pay program
Recognition for years of service

At Servus, our employees are also members. This means you'll have all the benefits of being a member of the credit union including profit sharing, voting for the board of directors, and all of the services we provide … with a few additional perks!
Imagine working for an organization that values diversity and inclusivity, and where everyone collaborates for your success. If you want to join a team of community leaders passionate about making an impact, apply now!
Next Steps
Click on the link below to apply for this amazing opportunity. If you're shortlisted, you'll hear from us after the posting closes. Should you require an accommodation during the application and selection process, send us a quick email at careers@servus.ca with the position and location you're interested in. Thanks for applying with Servus Credit Union; we look forward to learning about you and your experience!
Servus Credit Union is an equal opportunity employer and employs personnel without regard to race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, religious beliefs, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, physical disability, mental disability, marital status, family status, source of income, and sexual orientation.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
About Klick HealthMeet a different kind of workplace. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we’re still growing fast, even after two decades. What does that mean for you? As Klick experiences exponential growth year-over-year, so do the people who help make it happen. Because we’re constantly evolving and changing, we invest in talent early and often, to develop future leaders at all levels. We’re one of the country’s Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Best Managed, and Fastest Growing. We know that career paths are seldom simple and straightforward. And that's an asset. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!
We are very excited to be building out our Business Solutions team to deliver cross-functional initiatives to meet our clients’ needs in the Life Sciences industry. We have built a strong practice at Klick, with significant client engagements and have experienced instrumental growth in a short time period. We are looking to elevate our practice by building out a strong Business Analysis team that will support a wide array of projects related to Direct Marketing Strategy and Digital Marketing (i.e. Campaign Operations, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Technology, Media, Analytics, User Experience and reactive) solutions to contribute to the success of our clients.
Are you looking to feel invigorated professionally on a daily basis? You have come to the right place! The Business Analysis team is an exciting opportunity focused on taking our clients’ dream and bringing it to reality. We are leaders in helping our clients articulate their business needs and work with internal teams to deliver better yet exceed all stakeholders expectations.
We bring clarity to the project teams by defining scope, by asking the right questions, eliciting and documenting requirements, solution planning, validating solutions and assessing business readiness activities. We don’t stop there! We continue to think outside the box, look to improve existing processes and do what is right for our clients. The Lead/Manager Business Analyst reports to the VP, Business Solutions, and acts as a liaison between BA teams and other stakeholders.
Key Accountabilities: 

Team members in this role are expected to be able to perform all of the following duties and responsibilities to a consistently high standard
Develop an overarching awareness of client needs, programs, campaigns and products in market and work with internal teams to understand client expectations and help establish solution roadmaps that align to overall vision
Lead and facilitate client-facing/internal stakeholder engagements through interviews, workshops, meetings, or other professional aspects
Assume ownership for creating BRD documents and any other functional documentation required during projects execution
Provide project support for further clarification and issue resolution at all phases of the project
Provide strategic oversight and guidance all assigned projects and business analysis activities and deliverables
Work with a team of business analysts, providing guidance and mentoring for jr. resources
Assess and triage all incoming account project requests
Develop and optimize existing team processes, including cross-functional ways of working, process documentation, onboarding, and stakeholder partnerships
Participate in account planning activities and provide strategic guidance to Senior Leadership for upcoming projects
Develop deep relationships and instill confidence with core senior stakeholders and act as their trusted advisor as plans transition into full project implementations Working with Directors and Sr. Directors within the Consulting practice on future planning activities
Have a solid understanding of cross-functional projects to act in the capacity of a customer relationship manager
Develop, propose and create sales opportunities by engaging with the clients as a trusted advisor
Participate and contribute in pre-sales activities to support RFP development and subsequently SOW creation

Required Experience and Skills

 Team members in this role are expected to be able to demonstrate all of the following experience and skills:  A university degree in business, marketing, and/or information technology 4-7 years of relevant experience
Experience leading a variety of complex projects at various phases of the project lifecycle to meet tight deadlines
Strong understanding of one or more of the following: database, data warehousing and data management, data analysis and list generation, loyalty program management, solution design, campaign management/testing, reporting and business intelligence Experience and understanding of 3rd party marketing automation, CRM platforms, Content Man agement Systems (CMS) and web design
Experience with a variety of project types, software and process methodologies (i.e. Waterfall, Agile, Iterative, etc.) Ability to apply technical knowledge to business concerns
Great research and problem solving skills
Excellent presentation capabilities to both internal and external audiences
Excellent written and verbal communication skills catering messages to both technical and non-technical audiences Strong analytical, problem solving, planning skills and experience applying these skills in both business and technical environments Self-driven and someone who takes ownership with the ability to motivate others Demonstrated ability to build relationships, work collaboratively, and resolve problems with people at all levels in the organization, across lines of business and with third party vendors

Nice to Haves: 

Pursuing or achieved a certification in a leadership role (i.e. Certified Business Analysis Professional [CBAP], PMP) Familiarity with multiple software development methodologies
Experience in highly regulated industries (e.g. Pharma, Financial, Insurance, etc.)
Continuously explores new techniques, tools and programs in an effort to innovate the field of data management and marketing communication in the Healthcare industry

Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.
_We’re also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience._
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Supply Chain Planning Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
The Operations Planning Center (OPC) is CTC’s Supply Chain planning hub. The OPC works with our integrated partners - CTC Associate Stores, Suppliers, Forecasting and Replenishment, Execution Teams (DCs, Trans), Third Party Providers and Carriers to plan efficient product flow across our network. 
Capacity and Production Planning’s vision is to be recognized leaders in the planning of supply chain operations, to facilitate growth, reliability and cost effectiveness. 
The Supply Chain Planning Analyst will: 

Provide awareness, context and guidance to internal and external supply chain partners with regards to capacity objectives, requirements and events that span annual, seasonal and weekly time horizons. 
Create capacity and production plans, and coordinate their execution with the operational teams to balance the use of supply chain assets with the flow of goods to positively impact service levels and the financial bottom line. 
Proactively apply continuous improvement methodologies to internal processes as well as cross functional processes and services to improve supply chain productivity, reduce costs, and foster strong partnerships. 

At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do 

Participate in the development of both long and short term capacity plans and take a leadership role in the weekly communication, coordination, and achievement of these goals within a specialized business discipline 
Provide business intelligence, investigate options and make recommendations to Supply Chain partners across the corporation, using skills and subject matter expertise to achieve organizational goals (i.e capacity relief, OMSL targets, DC productivity) 
Utilize continuous improvement methods to enhance accuracy and reliability of Supply Chain Planning processes, tools, and reporting to support organizational goals (i.e capacity relief, OMSL targets, DC productivity) 
Leverage and further develop technical and business expertise in order to enhance processes, queries, reports and information streams within the Capacity/Production Planning environment, affecting cross functional teams such as DCs, Transportation, F&R, and Ordering Operations 
Continue to strengthen and build relationships with Supply Chain partners to ensure smooth and consistent communications, and to gain consensus on capacity goals and methods recommended. Influence critical decision-making, utilizing influential authority with all teams and resources. 
Lead large-scale process improvement initiatives from induction through to implementation. Coordinate all required activities including both system and process investigation, design, build, documentation, testing, rollout, and organizational change management 
Initiate, develop, coordinate and execute work plans with cross functional supply chain teams that deliver positive results. This includes facilitating formal and informal communications across all levels of the organization 
Prioritize and cope with competing and changing objectives in support of both short and long term goals while maintaining stakeholder expectations. This includes various ad hoc analytical work, assessing options, presenting findings, and influencing solution designs with cross functional teams. 
Mitigate operational risks to meeting CTC enterprise level goals and targets by pro-actively anticipating issues and barriers to change, as well as communicating recommendations to management to overcome these barriers 
Develop expertise in JDA Transport software (MTM), IMS, PAL, IMIO, JDA F&R, PPA, and other OPC Applications 

 What you bring 

An undergraduate degree in Engineering, Applied Science, Business or similar discipline is preferred 
Two or more years in logistics or supply chain related capacity is preferred 
Thorough understanding of the principles of Logistics, Distribution and Forecasting & Replenishment 
Strong PC skills with a knowledge of MS Access, Power Point, Word or similar packages required 
Excellent interpersonal, presentation and communication skills; strong business acumen 
Exceptional analytical planning and organizational skills, proven track record managing to strict deadlines 
Experience in managing multiple task and deadlines; strong project management skills 
Results oriented with a proven track record of accomplishments 
Ability and confidence to identify and cultivate relationships with key stakeholders of varied levels 
Ability to work with detailed data to create business information 
Knowledge of JDA Transport software, IMS, PAL, AOM, JDA F&R, PPA, and other OPC Applications is an asset 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
#LI-RF1 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Canadian Tire Supply Chain

Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better – great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.


A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawton’s Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.


All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.



 Overview




Reporting to the Manager Transportation Strategy & Innovation, the Analyst Fleet Services is responsible for supporting project execution and post audit. The candidate will own the project management for projects assigned by the manger. The role will be also heavily responsible for deep analysis on the project initiation and results.




 Job Description


 The role will apply the knowledge, skills, tools and techniques to project activities to meet or exceed stakeholder needs and expectations from each project.
A snap of some of the exciting things the candidate will lead and do:


Accountability Part 1 – Deep data analysis




Execute projects from transportation roadmap (both technology and process)
Analyze to streamline processes and improve efficiency
Prepare data in business case for formulating projects
Work closely with Warehouse, Sourcing and Finance on evaluating cost/benefit, ROI and
 NPVs for projects.
     

Work closely with RSC leads on project pilot (incl. technology and process),
 implementation and post audit (required)
     

Support training team on incorporating KPIs from technology and findings from
 Reporting to the Manager Transportation Strategy & Innovation, the Analyst Fleet Services is
      responsible for supporting project execution and post audit. The candidate will own
      the project management for projects assigned by the manger. The role will be also heavily
      responsible for deep analysis on the project initiation and results.
    
The role will apply the knowledge, skills, tools and techniques to project activities to meet or exceed stakeholder needs and expectations from each project.

 Accountability Part 2 - Provide leadership and guidance to ensure the delivery of projects:




Manage end to end project plus post audit
Develop project schedules, resource plans, cost estimates and milestones
Assess project risks including the determination and execution of risk mitigation strategies
Assure project deliverables are of high quality
Manage, monitor, and report project progress including schedule, functionality, quality, and cost (comparisons to budgets and forecasts).
Manage and troubleshoot project issues
Solve and/or facilitate solutions to technical, functional, process, and business problems
Coordinate Team activities between various Business and Supply Chain resources
Coordinate efforts between all project members and other project dependencies
Provide feedback on project staff
Coordinate resources as required with the project team and applicable Managers







 Job Requirements







An undergraduate degree in Engineer or Business
PMP designation or enrollment in PMP is recommended
3 years plus experience in retail logistics (a combination of warehouse and transportation)
Advanced skill sets in SAP, EXE, Microsoft Office, Word, PowerPoint, Alteryx, Tableau and other platforms
Experience in large scale transportation projects/RFPs
Experience in developing and delivering project presentations / reports, and identifying and evaluating alternatives
Advanced analytics skills
A People person with excellent communication skills

Title: Master Data Governance Analyst
Description:
GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITY AND SUMMARY
The Master Data Governance Analyst is a key member of the Supply Chain Team within the Shared Services Organization. This role will work in close collaboration with the Warehouse, Procurement, Finance, and I&T teams to provide master data governance services for Materials and Business Partners in the new SAP system to all Centerra’s North American sites and offices. This role will participate in the user acceptance testing cycle of the SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) implementation, assist with the transition to steady state, definition of Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and then assume a sustainment role to provide on-going services and serve as the business SME in North America for SAP MDG.


REPORTING STRUCTURE

This role reports directly to the Director, Supply Chain
There are no direct reports to this role


 
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Support the Supply Chain and Finance Teams with the testing of the SAP MDG Tool.
Support and assist with training content development, training delivery to meet specifications of the project.
Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) across the business to define and agreed on SLAs for the creation and maintenance of Materials and Business Partners master data records in SAP.
Act as a global SME for the processes in SAP MDG.
Manage daily requests for new Materials and Business Partners data creation or maintenance and ensure requests are resolved as per the agreed upon SLAs.
Actively work with cross functional business units to ensure data taxonomy/naming convention standards are followed and assist with inquiries.
Perform mass maintenance to cleanse data in the material master.
Work with I&T and SAP functional experts to review findings of new enhancement requirements.
Effectively communicate status update, risk, and issues to management team.
Provide user training for new functionality as needed.
Maintain strong relationships based on trust, transparency, and results with primary business stakeholders.


 
SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Familiarity with master data governance and services organizations processes and procedures.
Project management skills including organization, prioritization, and time management; ability to juggle short-term and longer-term initiatives; ability to re-prioritize accordingly to meet immediate needs.
Fundamental knowledge of Material and Vendor Master Data Management.
Passion for technology and implementing technology for process improvement.
Ability to work with multiple stakeholders in different time zones.
Ability to identify improvements opportunities through processes analysis and action them trough continuous improvement project/initiatives.
Strong communication and customer service skills.


 
EXPERIENCE, QUALIFICATIONS & EDUCATION

Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Business, Technical, or a related field.
+1 year experience with SAP MDG or similar master data governance system.
+1 year of experience working in Shared Services/Support roles.
Experience in the mining, oil and gas or other asset intensive industry preferred but not required.
Experience defining and monitoring SLAs.
Experience mapping out business requirements and capturing them in a functional specification.
Experience in data analysis and drawing conclusions based on data, including a demonstrated ability to present recommendations and to assist in decision making.


 
APPLICATION DEADLINE: 2022-06-28

Title: Sr. Analyst, Business Improvement
Description:
Job Description: 
  Sr. Analyst, Business Improvement - (Calgary, Alberta, Canada)
 At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.
 Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With approximately 23,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers.
 We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion. 
Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.
 Reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Improvement & Development, Nitrogen, this role will have primary responsibility for catalyzing a range of Business Improvement initiatives to enhance business value across the Nitrogen business unit. The Senior Analyst will play a key role in initiatives from identifying opportunities to formulating concepts potentially right through to effective implementation. The Senior Analyst will play a key role in transforming the corporate Nitrogen strategy into an executable plan. A successful candidate will be a self-starter, creative thinker who feels passionate about encouraging improvements across a wide area of the business. The person will be a team player with collaborative skills and the ability to coordinate multi-functional groups around one plan/vision. 
The person will gain exposure to the broader Nitrogen business, many corporate teams, and senior leaders in the organization. The Senior Analyst will have the opportunity to guide where the organization centers time and effort and where it derives value.
 This position is located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada and is available for remote work. This is an eighteen (18) Month Assignment.
 What you will do: 

Lead in the development of a range of business improvement initiatives across the Nitrogen business
 Work with the business to take the high-level strategy and create actionable items to deliver the strategic goals of the business
 Coordinate the business unit’s yearly plan refresh process along with stewardship and reporting on the business unit strategic action plans
 Work with the Business Insights group to build meaningful reporting and analytics to drive improvement and ensure consistent measurement
 Develop strong relationships with key business partners including the Nitrogen Operations Sites, Commercial team, TD&L, and Engineering, Technology, and Capital group
 Facilitate the sharing of best practices, create relationships, and develop processes and tools to further the journey in becoming a learning organization
 Complete ad hoc data analysis, projects and initiatives as assigned
 Represent the business unit’s interests in corporate initiatives (sustainability, government relations, investor relations, etc.)
 Create presentations for senior leadership
 Provide change management support, including development and deployment of methodologies, tools, processes, and training to support the change

 What you will bring: 

A university degree in engineering, accounting, finance, marketing, commerce or an MBA
 Minimum of 6 – 8 years related and progressive work experience in an engineering, business or financial analysis role
 Demonstrated sense of urgency and a strong commitment to achieving deadlines
 Excellent interpersonal, problem-solving and organizational skills
 Thorough verbal and written communication skills
 Excellent presentation skills
 Ability to perform in an ambiguous environment; can quickly adapt to changes in schedule and direction
 Ability to think strategically, demonstrated attention to detail and process-oriented thinking
 Curious, proactive and enjoy working in a collaborative, supportive team environment
 Brings a positive attitude and contributes to team spirit
 Experience in operations is considered an asset
 Experience with culture change is considered an asset
 Experience with Microsoft Word and PowerPoint, with strong skills in Microsoft Excel


 Are you a good match? Apply today!
 Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
 This job will remain posted until filled. In accordance with Nutrien policies, you will be required to undergo a background check and may be required to undergo a substance test. While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
 To stay connected to us and for the latest job postings and news, follow us on: LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter

 **EOE race/color/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/disability/veteran

Title: Reporting Analyst - Environment Health and Safety
Description:
Job Title
  Reporting Analyst - Environment Health and Safety
 

   Who are we?
 

   Founded in 1924, Irving Oil is a family-owned international refining and marketing company with a history of long-term partnerships and relationships. With operations throughout Eastern Canada, New England and Ireland we focus on delivering quality products and exceptional service to our customers and our communities. Every day, we strive to put our good energy in action to bring families together, support the environment and local wildlife, and to create learning opportunities that empower the next generation.
 


   Here's what you can expect from us:
 

   When you're a part of our team, you'll see how we bring good energy to all that we do. At Irving Oil, we strive for a work environment where each of us feels we belong, can bring our whole selves to work, and where we treat our fellow employees with kindness and respect. Together, we will support our corporate strategy, high standards and the communities where we live and work. Our collaborative approach, safety-first culture and commitment to building resilient teams helps reinforce our internal brand position where People Matter. That's why we're dedicated to investing in our employees’ potential, so that they can reach their career goals.
 


   Job Description
 

   What you can expect in a typical day
 

   We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Reporting Analyst within our Environment Health & Safety Team. This position provides support on the day-to-day knowledge, reporting, analysis and data collection for the Environment Health and Safety (EHS) Business Line and Sales and Marketing Groups in safety effectiveness, investigations, regulatory compliance, processes and procedures. This position operates in a key role by providing support on data analysis and reporting as needed to the EHS Director, Lead Investigator, EHS Managers and the Directors of the SMO Business Units. This position supports the EHS team to ensure that safety and investigation information is reported to senior management in an efficient and timely manner.
 


   What we offer:
 

 Competitive salary, bonus, and pension plan
 Flexible benefits, including a Health Spending Account
 Hybrid Work Opportunity – flexible work model that supports a blend of in-office and remote
 Wellness support, including annual wellness allowance and paid personal care days
 Paid vacation and vacation purchasing
 Personal and professional development opportunities
 Named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for six consecutive years



   Your roles and responsibilities:
 

 Ensure the EHS Director, Investigator and Managers have proper, valid, reliable and accurate information to make business decisions and assist them with analysis/recommendations through providing day-to-day knowledge, support, and analysis for EHS/SMO Business Lines/Resource Groups by gathering information/data from various departments/systems, researching benchmarks (internal and external), conducting business analysis, and consulting with management in complex decisions.
 Ensure appropriate reporting timelines are achieved on safety related initiatives and incidents through contributing to projects and project work related to the EHS/SMO departments by gathering data, preparing reports to ensure we meet or exceed our targets.
 Ensure EHS Director, Manager and Investigator, have accurate information and analysis through ensuring appropriate information is reported by developing and analyzing weekly and monthly reports on safety and investigation results, checking validity in key areas and identify and investigate areas of concern, and making recommendations for appropriate actions.
 Perform other duties as required to maintain and enhance departmental productivity.



   Professional skills
 

 Must possess strong verbal and written communication skills.
 Must have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to motivate differing personalities.
 Organizational skills and the ability to multi- task in a fast-paced environment.
 Must be adaptable to change.
 Moderate to advanced computer skills.
 Effective decision making and problem-solving abilities.



   Travel
 

 Travel is a requirement for this position.



   Education and experience
 

 3+ years' relevant experience related to Environmental, Health, Safety and Compliance and 3-5+ years of petroleum and transportation industry experience desired
 Post-secondary education, or equivalent experience.
 Professional Safety designation is an asset



   Irving Oil supports a diverse and inclusive work environment and welcomes applications from all qualified applicants.
 


   #LI-Hybrid
 


   Job Requirements - Work Experience
  Data Analysis
 

   Job Requirements - Education
  Bachelors
 

   Location
  Saint John, NB

Title: Power BI Developer
Description:
Caary is a financial technology company with a mission to transform and streamline credit and banking for businesses by reimagining products, processes and the client experience. We are looking for a dynamic Power BI Developer to work closely with Data team members in analyzing requirements and designing/building end-to-end reporting solutions.


 What will you do?


 Working closely with Data team members in analyzing requirements and designing/building end-to-end reporting solutions.
Liaise with business users to understand and document reporting/analytics requirements.
Communicate the requirements in a clear and lucid way to the offshore team.
Analyze data based on business requirements and identify any gaps.
Write complex sql to extract data for data analysis and to support POC development.
Develop reports and dashboards for business users.
Recommend best approach for required business requirements.
Develop and maintain the Power BI framework (semantic model) based on the underlying data mart.
Develop and maintain multiple datasets, dashboards and reporting solutions.
Lead and mentor offshore team members and help them develop their technical expertise.



 Qualifications include: 



3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence and data analysis.
College diploma or university degree in a technology related discipline.
Expert knowledge in Power BI solution including integration, data visualization, reports and dashboards.
Working experience of Data warehousing end-to-end including ETL & Datamart.
Expertise in SQL/TSQL programming and best practices.
Expertise in Data modelling and core BI concepts.
Expertise in OLAP models, Analysis Services, Tabular models, and best practices.
3+ years experience in Power BI – Power Query, Modelling, DAX Scripting, Dashboard Information Design & Data visualizations, Row Level Security, Datasets.
Expertise in Power BI best practices, trouble shooting, performance tuning, building solutions on large data sets.
Experience of building Azure based reporting and analytics solutions using SQL Server, ETL, Analysis Services, Power BI.
Ability to prioritize requirements, change requests for Business and work with Project learn/Scrum Master in determining how best to address them.

Title: Senior Analyst - Technical
Description:
Why WestJet:


Every WestJet journey has the potential to enrich lives; a career with us is no exception.


WestJet arrived on the Canadian airline scene in 1996 and changed the industry for the better. We made air travel more affordable for Canadians and now we're going global.


Join us and love where you’re going.


Remote Work:
This position is eligible for remote work, within Canada, under our mobile workforce program.


WestJet is currently seeking a Senior Technical Analyst to support our loyalty technology. The Senior Technical Analyst is a critical member of the commercial technology team, responsible for the technology strategy, development, and operations of our loyalty technology portfolio. The role assists the business function of loyalty with analysis, planning and implementation of efficient business, and operations solutions in support of core organizational functions and business processes.


Key Deliverables Include:

Lead the planning, design, development of new features and enhancements to existing applications and with project work;
Lead sessions in identifying process and systems solutions to meet business needs or to resolve business issues;
Lead business process and technology walk-through and design sessions for the purpose of effectively scoping and assessing the impact of desired enhancements or changes to business processes, operations, and information process flow;
Coordinate with other IT and business groups to meet project deliverables;
Ensure compatibility and interoperability of planned and existing application systems;
Create application and interface specifications, diagrams and charts to provide guidance and direction to developers and support staff;
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in operating systems across the organization;
Interact with application end users to maintain active involvement and understanding of the business priorities for application support;
Provide on-going application maintenance and monitoring;
Working closely with the QA team to ensure development is thoroughly tested;
Conduct research on software and hardware products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts;
Delegate and collaborate with the management of workload of other analysts


 
Experience and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in a related field and or equivalent years’ of experience
8+ years of experience as a technical resource in Information Technology
5+ years of experience as a Technical Lead working with internal and external resources
Must have experience with dealing with complex integrations
Experience designing, planning, and leading the implementation of high level design and low level architecture of complexed system integrations
Experience of creating sequence diagrams, system processes and data flows
Experience with Middleware Tools such as: Datapower, Kafka, ETL, batch file transfer and/or IIB
Experience with Data Analysis, including complexed SQL data retrieval, migration and integration of data
Familiarity with coding and scripting development
Proven experience in overseeing the planning, design, development and/or implementation of application software and hardware solutions, systems, or products
Working knowledge of Windows Operating Systems, Unix/Linux Operating Systems, SQL and Oracle Databases, Web and Citrix based applications
Working knowledge of current network, protocols, real-time web services and standards
Must have the ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Possess proven analytical and creative problem-solving abilities
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent listening and interpersonal skills along with a strong customer service orientation focus
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment, as well as highly self-motivated
Experience working with offshore
Experience with Siebel 7.x/8.x Application including knowledge on Siebel Tools 7.x/8.x and Siebel architecture, application integration considered to be an asset
Knowledgeable with hands-on product experience with Oracle’s OBIEE toolset including DAC for Siebel preferred
Loyalty industry experience considered an asset


 
Other Nice to Haves:

Experience with Loyalty and CRM platforms considered to be an asset
Cloud API integration experience (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
Knowledgeable with hands-on product experience with Data Analytic tool sets (PowerBI, Snowflake, Redshift)
Understanding of ITSM/ITIL processes and documentation standards
Strong understanding of Agile methodology (Scrum or DevOps framework)
CICD pipeline



The benefits of being a WestJetter:
WestJet provides all WestJetters with a competitive total rewards package. On top of that, we offer:

A fun and friendly culture with colleagues who work together to win
Travel privileges for you and your family, effective from your start date
Savings and Benefit programs that are flexible to meet your specific needs




Think we are a fit? Apply now!


About WestJet Group of Companies
Together with WestJet's regional airline, WestJet Encore, we offer scheduled service to more than 100 destinations in North America, Central America, the Caribbean and Europe and to more than 175 destinations in over 20 countries through our airline partnerships.


Our Safety Promise
At WestJet, the safety and security of our people and our guests is a core value and at the heart of what we do. As safety and security is a shared responsibility, it is expected that you will use safe work practices to ensure your well-being and the safety of others.
WestJet recognizes that the use of Alcohol and Drugs can adversely impact a safe work environment and the well-being of others including guests, suppliers and the public, as well as place WestJet's operations at risk. All roles that are identified as safety sensitive are required to pass a Pre-Employment Alcohol and Drug Test as per WestJet's Alcohol and Drug Policy.
As a federally regulated company, the WestJet group of companies is required to comply with all federal mandates. In order to be compliant with the recently-announced vaccination mandate, and to keep our guests/employees safe, all employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a condition of employment.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
We embrace what makes us each unique, and what makes us uniquely WestJet. WestJet is committed to inclusiveness, equity, and accessibility and if you require accommodation during the selection process, please let our Talent Acquisition team know. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest in WestJet; however, only those candidates who are selected will be contacted.


For more information about everything WestJet, please visit WestJet.com.

Title: Corporate Logistics Analyst
Description:
Price Industries Limited, North America’s leading manufacturer and distributor of air distribution products (www.priceindustries.com) is a dynamic, progressive and innovative organization looking for new talent in our growing Winnipeg office and manufacturing facility. If you thrive on new challenges, pushing yourself to new heights and working in a team-driven environment, you should consider the following opportunity.
   


 What We Offer:


     Health and Dental - Employees and their families enjoy flexible benefits options covering an extensive list of medical and dental expenses and services.
   

     Life and Disability - You will be provided with life insurance in a multiple of your salary with an option to purchase additional coverage.
   

     Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP) - You and your family will have free access to consultation and support for your mental, emotional and financial well-being.
   

     Pension Matching Program - Invest in your future with each pay cheque through our Defined Contribution Pension Plan and we will match your contribution (up to 3% of your salary).
   

     EQ Care® - You and your family will have free access to speak with a doctor by phone or app from wherever you are.
   

     Pocketpills – You and your family will have free access to Canada’s first Digital Pharmacy, PocketPills enables you to call, text or email the pharmacy care team from wherever you are. You will enjoy free delivery of your prescriptions and vitamins straight to your home.
   

     Gym Subsidy Program- Employees are eligible for a gym membership reimbursement of up to $240 per year, this includes Fitness related App’s.
   


 Corporate Logistics Analyst



 The Corporate Logistics Analyst is primarily responsible for utilizing analytical methods and a variety of tools to understand, predict, and/or control logistics operations and processes. Logistics analysts perform various functions utilizing statistical analyses and strategies to devise optimal logistics solutions in creating a more productive, cost-effective, and profitable enterprise. They will also aid the organization in implementing the solutions. The individual is also responsible for providing comprehensive report and statistical information to support logistics functions and programs while developing complex analytical reports based on statistical data and future forecasts.
   


 The successful candidate's responsibilities will include:


 Responsible for managing route activities such as invoicing, electronic bills, and shipment tracing.
 Support vendor/business partner relationships as needed.
 Responsible for developing and maintaining cost estimates, forecasts, and cost models.
 Execute day to day processes and perform data management applying a combination of data mining, data modeling, and data analysis; cost/benefit analysis and/or problem analysis.
 Undertake ad-hoc queries and maintain reports from a variety of resources as specific to department or organizational needs to support the business.
 Responsible for conducting analysis and creating reports of weekly, monthly, quarterly KPIs and forecasts.
 Actively participate in transportation alignment and tracking performance to awards and cost.
 Responsible for auditing transportation accessorial charges by carrier and customer.
 Correct freight settlement documents to ensure the proper accruing of freight monthly.
 Estimate distribution costs for new business opportunities-indirect/direct freight, DC Costs, etc.
 Responsible for performing cost comparisons of distribution center shipments versus plant direct opportunities.
 Clearly communicate to senior leaders (both internal and external), vendors and customers.
 Demonstrate accountability and knowledge on logistics topics.
 Analyze current supply chain and business systems to identify opportunities for improvement.
 Utilize Price problem solving tools/processes such as process mapping and root cause analysis.
 Maintain regular communication with purchasing, manufacturing leadership and product managers to ensure alignment with business direction.


 The ideal candidate for this position will have:


 Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Management, or in a related field and 2+ years of experience in transportation, logistics or customer service; or equivalent combination of education and experience. However, Bachelor’s degree is preferred.
 Strong financial expertise – the ability to utilize fundamental concepts of finance to manage logistics budgets, forecast costs, and provide relevant information for decision-making.
 Experience in Six-Sigma or other process improvement methodology preferred.
 Working knowledge of Incoterms.
 Experience in Transportation Management System (TMS) preferred.
 Strong PC application skills including complement of Microsoft Office software.
 Excellent planning, project management, interpersonal, and communication skills.
 Strength in training and presentation skills.
 High ethical standards.
 Self-starter who is a creative out of the box thinker.
 Possess high sense of urgency and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
 Must be able to travel internationally.


     Should this excellent opportunity interest you, please submit your resume, including salary expectations.
   


 Price Industries Limited hires on the basis of merit and is strongly committed to equity and diversity. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, including all genders, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, individuals of diverse gender and sexual orientation and all groups protected by the Human Rights Code. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations throughout the selection process and while working at Price. If you require support applying online because you are a person with a disability, please contact us at HR@priceindustries.com .
   


 We appreciate the interest shown by all applicants, however only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst, Senior/Lead
Description:
What's Bench? Check us out in Fintech Impact, Perkins + Will, Daily Hive, BC Business, and our Instagram.
 Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.
 Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable.
 We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!
 What does the Senior/Lead Marketing Data Analyst look like?
 Dear Future Benchmate,
 Bench is at one of the most exciting confluences in tech today - combining an entrepreneur's financial data for their business (aka. bookkeeping) with the insights and guidance to unlock their business growth. It's a massive opportunity and we're on our way to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. We're already the biggest bookkeeper in North America—currently over 11,000 clients, and in 2020 alone, we processed $21B in transactions!
 As the Senior/Lead Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be a key part of the Go-to-Market pod at the center of raising brand awareness, message-building, and education aimed at new clients who have yet to experience Bench's value. Leveraging your previous experience with marketing data and your range of analytical skills and thinking, you'll be supporting our most senior GTM leaders. You're ready to deliver full-funnel data insights, helping us spot what's working and where people drop-out and lose momentum - so we can do something about it! You'll also help us improve and crystalize the sources of truth in our reporting and visualizations - #trust!
 You'll know more about our marketing data than anyone else and we'll look to you as a thought leader for marketing Bench as we become one of the most loved and trusted advisors for small business bookkeeping and entrepreneurs.  Thank you for taking the time to apply. I cannot wait to meet you!  Sincerely, Michelle Yee, Business Operations Team Lead
 What you'll get up to:

Being a deeply trusted partner, leader and advisor to the Marketing department

Having a strong understanding of our business metrics and how they relate to our top of funnel teams, while providing an informed opinion in strategic decision making
Ensuring that the definitions of metrics related to our lead and client generation are consistent across our current and new reporting
Creating business cases and roadmaps in partnership with stakeholders and project managers that improve the state of the go-to-market data ecosystem



Creating and maintaining sources of truth that support "self-serve" analytics for our go-to-market business unit owners



Transforming data through SQL queries to blend meaningful insights from Heap, Salesforce, Marketo and Bench App data stored in our Redshift data warehouse
Blending narratives from our in-house metrics with Google Analytics and in-platform to tell a clear and actionable story



Assisting in the adoption of a new attribution framework



Clarifying, documenting and enforcing the parameters of our in-house attribution model
Acting as a steward for attribution data across the organization



Delivering ad-hoc analysis, recommendations and insights that stakeholders can action


Identifying, tackling and reconciling reporting issues in a timely manner
Highlighting opportunities to accelerate our go-to-market performance and strategy
Supporting fundamental improvements to the website with data backed recommendations

Cross functional support and development


Work closely with our Data Analytics team, Bizops system specialists and GTM stakeholders to develop a strong understanding of the necessary inputs and impacts within the marketing analytics space
Provide a "marketing analytics" lens to various projects and strategic discussions
Informing the data strategy, including supporting the decisions about collection across multiple "listening posts" (ex. websites, surveys, sign up forms, market research etc.)
 

What you'll need:

4+ years of analytics experience or equivalent: You should have years of analytics experience to draw upon. It is preferred that you've worked with go-to-market teams in the past, and understand the general processes that are needed to engage our potential customers.
3-4 years of experience with standard web analysis, Google Analytics (GA) and tracking tools such as Heap: You use your knowledge of web strategy, UTM implementation and GA reporting to run continuous and consistent experimentation/reporting
Strong proficiency in sheets/Excel: You should have a full understanding of all major Google sheets (or Excel) functionalities. You have the ability to build and maintain streamlined and well-structured dashboards, using multiple live data sources. You will spend a significant portion of time digesting our Google sheets forecasting environment, connecting it to other data sources, and aligning reporting across multiple teams.
Intermediate experience in SQL & BI tools: You should be comfortable running queries to surface business insights and creating sustainable datasets in our Redshift environment. You are also skilled at creating and maintaining effective dashboards in BI tools like Tableau.
Deep analytical thinking skills: You have an analytical mind and are capable of breaking down large problems into smaller ones. You demonstrate a strong handle on logic and structured problem solving. You'll be responsible for taking high-level broad questions and distilling them into actionable projects.
Strong project management skills: You'll be tackling multiple complex problems at one time; you should have impeccable time management and ruthless prioritization!
Communication: A high degree of communication skills is necessary. You'll be responsible for using multiple methods to communicate results, insights, and future opportunities. Having experience creating decks, project plans, progress updates, and live presentations to stakeholders is required. Stakeholders will represent a diverse group of skills and experience, so you'll need to be highly skilled at crafting communications that 'fit' the audience.

It could be an even better fit if you have:

Startup hustle: You are highly motivated, proactive, comfortable with change and ambiguity. You have a humble, team-player attitude and are ready to pitch in wherever you are needed most.
Experience in a CRM environment: It is preferred that you have some experience with a CRM environment (we use Salesforce). You can generate/consume Salesforce reports to automate data-distribution to different analytical environments; which will allow you to go above and beyond.
Basic data-warehousing experience using Redshift: Some experience building relational data sources in Redshift & table materialization will allow you to go above and beyond.
Not just a data-consumer, rather an active member of the full pipeline: You have experience in being an active member of the full data pipeline. In this role, you will not only consume and analyze data to surface insights but will play an active role in data-collection, overall data strategy, and architecture.

What you'll get:

At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is as follows:  Lead Analyst: $90,880- $113,600 per year, depending on experience  Senior Analyst: $72,720 - $90,900 per year, depending on experience 
In addition, we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, unlimited paid flex days, stock options and full health, dental, and vision.
You'll get unlimited access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
Our HQ is in Vancouver BC, where we offer hybrid and remote working opportunities. This full-time position also has the flexibility to work remotely from anywhere else in BC, as well as Alberta, Ontario, and New Brunswick.
Whether working remote or hybrid, we'll set you up with everything you need to work from home, from day one.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.
 We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

Title: Senior Business Process Analyst (iGO)
Description:
Position Term: 1 Permanent Full-Time and 1 Fixed Term Contract (up to 2 years) 


Location: Toronto, ON 


Application Deadline: June 29, 2022 


Level: 10 


Salary Range: Min: $90,169 ($47.84 hourly) Max: $112,708 ($59.79 hourly) 

 The Government of Ontario is committed to establishing a new online market for internet gaming (iGaming) that is both competitive and protects consumers. iGaming Ontario TM (iGO) was established in July 2021 as an agency of the Government of Ontario to conduct and manage internet gaming in the province when provided by private gaming operators. 

 Are you all about innovation? Do you often find yourself challenging status quo to develop new and efficient ways of working? Do you enjoy brainstorming ideas with your fellow team members to improve productivity and eliminate duplication? If you answered yes to these questions, we want to hear from you! 

 iGaming Ontario has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Business Process Analyst . Reporting to the Program Manager, the successful candidate will lead the development of streamlined and standardized processes, define process improvements by identifying redundancies and recommending automations. The Senior Business Process Analyst will support iGO’s core business functions in driving organizational efficiency and effectiveness. 


In this role, the successful candidate will:
 Elicits business requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, user stories, and task and workflow analysis 

 Works closely with the System Owner/Business Solutions Architect in ensuring the recommended solutions/systems align with iGO’s enterprise system architecture while also meeting expected business outcomes 

 Analyzes and critically evaluates current systems, processes, policies, procedures and Acts and Regulations, based on relevance, efficiency and effectiveness, gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts and converts high-level information into details 

 Recommends changes to processes or business requirements to provide more streamlined, efficient ways of conducting business, improved access to information or services 

 In collaboration with the business unit(s) creates/revises the business requirement documentation as required to align with business objectives 

 Lead the development and implementation of optimizations to business processes, procedures and policies 
Provide critical analysis and reporting to support the continuous improvement of iGO’s operations and to support the design/provision of new or modified processes 


The successful candidate will have:

University degree in one of the following fields: Business Analysis, Analytics, Economics, Business Administration, and/or relevant experience that develops critical and strategic thinking 

 Advanced knowledge and experience in information analysis and reporting to support evidence-based decision-making 

 Solid experience in quantitative and qualitative research and evaluation, including research design, data capture, data analysis and data interpretation 

 Excellent communication (both written and verbal), collaboration and interpersonal skills to prepare and present complex, authoritative analyses 

 Excellent ability to conceptualize, evaluate, and problem-solve. Strategic thinker. Sound judgement and sensitivity to issues and ability to work with a diverse client group and staff at all levels of the Agency 

 Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize work in order to meet time sensitive deadlines 

 Advanced knowledge and experience with analyzing business processes 

 Advanced issue resolution, facilitation and diplomacy skills 

 Strong stakeholder engagement skills to develop and manage relationships 

 Advanced computer literacy and continual personal development in new software solutions 

 Superior knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of products, with demonstrated mastery of Excel to deliver timely analysis and reporting 

 The ability to backfill for direct manager in his/her absence 

 Experienced in developing and implementing complex plans 
Knowledge and application of business intelligence solutions (i.e. MS Power BI), SQL, Adobe and internet search applications is an asset 
The successful candidate must be eligible to work in Canada and will be subject to a criminal background check. 

 iGaming Ontario has a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy that requires all staff, including prospective new employees, be fully vaccinated by a Health Canada approved COVID-19 vaccine. Individuals with valid medical or other human rights-based exemptions will be considered for appropriate accommodation within the policy. 

 iGaming Ontario is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. 

 iGaming Ontario has the responsibility to lead by example in advancing racial equity and to build a diverse, inclusive, accessible and respectful workplace where every employee has a voice and the opportunity to fully contribute. To this effect, you are encouraged to reflect upon the diversity you would bring to the role within your application including, but not limited to, individuals identifying with one or more of the under-represented groups identified within Ontario’s Human Rights Code. 

 Disability related accommodation during the recruitment process is available upon request.

Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

With a broad spectrum of technology talent and a keen focus on small, non-critical, non-external facing, low risk applications. CRD provides high-quality, low-cost, time-effective System Development Lifecycle (SDLC) services, including Business Analysis, Project Management, Solutions Design, Development, Support and Application Hosting capabilities. CRD work closely with TD Businesses to ensure applications are developed and hosted in a cost-effective and timely manner. Working with technology and business partners, CRD delivers and maintains 50+ internal (employee facing) applications and technology solutions that support the bank. 



Job Description

About This Role 
The CRD Team is seeking Business System Analyst (BSA) with Planning, Requirement Elicitation, Analysis, Documentation, and Communication skills to join our group. This role mandates that includes (but not limited to) proposing technical system to accomplish business requirements enterprise wide and accountability for quality assurance. The primary accountabilities for this position are:

 Respect TD's technology delivery practices and standards, project management disciplines.
 Strong customer orientation and a professional approach with the ability to interact with all levels within the organization.
 Stay on top of state-of-health during software development life cycle.
 Access client needs and recommend the right technology, offer right technology, and process related analysis and support.
 Work with technology partners (e.g., Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
 Define, document, and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, considering non-functional requirements.
 Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
 Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks, and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
 Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
 Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
 Incident Management, Triaging, and provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
 Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
 Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
 Work with vendors to support business case development (consistent with technology requirements and guidelines) including benefits identification, RFI/RFP, and service level agreements.
 Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle.




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:

 Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
 5-7 years relevant experience.
 Experience with MS Project and MS Office Suits.
 Basic knowledge in MS SQL Server to triage the incidents.
 Commitment to applying advanced to expert knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards and related expertise, including design, development, testing and project management.
 Advanced to expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
 Ability to work independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coach or guide team.
 Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant.




Additional Information

Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:

 Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
 Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking.




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
