Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
Ozz Group Inc. is looking for a Financial Data Analyst to join the team in our head office location in Concord. The role will be a 6-month contract, with the possibility of extension.
 




 ROLE



 The Financial Data Analyst is responsible for developing and maintaining the financial reports and dashboards that will be used to review budget, actual and forecasts by leadership



 RESPONSIBILITIES



 Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:





 Work with the finance team to understand the data requirements and create automated data reports for monthly financial statements, budget, and forecasts
 Develop dashboard for KPI and key financial metrics that will be driven from our Jonas ERP platform and shared with leadership team
 Experience in building out full scale financial packages (P&L Balance Sheet and Cash flow) for a multi-currency, consolidated company with multiple subsidiaries and divisions using DAX/SQL to link various databases
 Ability to understand and navigate a changing and complex business environment in building out financial models to develop what if scenarios as part of the analysis
 Work collaboratively with other Finance team members, specifically to meet reporting deadlines and improve existing processes
 Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and Excel dashboards
 Resolve outstanding issues and troubleshoot unbalanced transactions
 Frequent liaison with all levels of the Senior Management Team






 CORE COMPETENCIES


 Quality Orientation
 Research and Analysis
 Mediating & Negotiating
 Time Management
 Decision making and Judgement
 Providing Consultation
 Development and Continual Learning
 Operating Equipment
 Ethics and Integrity
 Creative & Innovative Thinking
 Accountability and Dependability
 Mathematical Reasoning




 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE




 Bachelor's Degree in Finance or Accounting
 High level of proficiency in Excel is a requirement CPA designation (or enrollment) is an asset
 Strong knowledge of SQL, DAX, Excel & Power BI Reporting
 Experience using Jonas software is an asset 2-5 years' experience building out financial statements, models and dashboards
 Foreign Exchange/multi-currency exposure is an asset






 REQUIREMENTS




 CPA designation is preferred
 Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in a similar position doing similar functions leading up to and including the duties defined in this job description
 Complete knowledge and practical experience of full accounting cycle
 Sound knowledge and experience of IFRS accounting, financial planning, budgeting & forecasting and financial reporting
 Strong analytical skills with an ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers
 Good working knowledge of accounting software, preferably Jonas (an asset) along with a strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office, specifically excel
 Thorough knowledge of all relevant Federal, Provincial, and local requirements regarding financial recording and record retention, and the like is essential
 Professional written and verbal communication skills
 High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and/or reasoning to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts
 Able to work well under pressure, multitask and meet set deadlines
 Good organizational, time management and prioritizing skills
 Self-starter with proactive approach and exceptional problem-solving skills
 Strong desire to achieve results; an emphasis on getting important issues resolved
 Proven commitment; a team player
 Proven ability to handle and/or lead multiple projects with minimal oversight
 Able to contribute as a strong team player in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, diverse, and high-growth business environment
 Strong attention to detail, organizational & time management skills
 Exceptional communication skills
 Uphold the highest level of confidentiality and discretion on transactions/responsibilities





 WORKING CONDITIONS




 Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals
 Overtime as required
 Lifting or moving up to 10lbs may be required






 OZZ Electric Inc. has created policies and procedures to meet the required Accessibility Standards under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. 2005.


 Our Accessibility policies are available for your review in a number of formats. Should you wish access to these documents, please email: aoda@ozzelectric.com

Title: Client Support Services Program Analyst
Description:
Position vacancy 
Closing date: July 01, 2022
 





      Employment Type
      Full Time





      Job ID
      1825





      Pay
      $45,500/year





      Effective
      Immediately





      Reports to
      Manager - Client Support Services Program





      Location / Region
       Due to Covid-19, this is currently a remote work position, eventually transitioning to working at 2200 Yonge Street YMCA, Toronto, ON





      Application Deadline
      July 01, 2022





Why Work for the Y?
 The YMCA of Greater Toronto aspires to be a great work place committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, where different backgrounds, experiences, and identities are appreciated and celebrated. Guided by our shared values — kindness, well-being, integrity, inclusiveness, respect, and optimism — the YMCA provides thousands of employees with meaningful jobs and the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of individuals and the health of our communities. We recognize the contributions of our staff through innovative practices, great benefits, and growth opportunities.


Nature and scope
 The YMCA of Greater Toronto, a leader in coordination of national and provincial programs, acts as the National Coordinator for the National GAR Case Management - Client Support Services Program (CSS). The objectives of the CSS program are to provide resettlement services to more than 5,200 Government-assisted refugees (GARs) through an empowerment-oriented case management and community capacity building model of service delivery, while engaged in continuous quality improvement initiatives. The YMCA as the National Coordinator provides both indirect/direct services to GAR clients through a collaborative network. The key coordination activities include: National administration, database management and reporting, communication and information sharing and program delivery, support and training.


 The Client Support Services Program Analyst reports to the CSS Manager and partners with YMCA IT Support in ensuring the nation-wide program database is efficiently and effectively evaluated and developed to track program outcomes. The position is responsible for providing technical support and training to program sites and as well, contributes to the National reporting requirements through systematic gathering, analyzing and reporting of data. The Applications Support Analyst promotes the YMCA programs to the community and organizations in order to market the programs to those in position to assist the Association in achieving Strategic Outcomes. Additional program administrative tasks are also the responsibility of this position.
Responsibilities

Provide advanced management, support and analysis for nation-wide customized database system (Effort to Outcomes- ETO) with local sites.
Coordinates with National Programs Manager (CSS) and YMCA IT Support team to implement/update the database/reporting plan in consultation with the CSS program sites in order to identify national program requirements, key settlement performance indicators/outcomes and successfully translate them into an efficient software model.
Identifies software application adjustments and develops new customized tracking and reporting Systems.
Identify reports in regards to the program outputs as requested by various stakeholders.
Monitors and collects ETO user requests for further customization.
Prepares monthly/quarterly and annual statistical reports of each program site and comparative analysis nationally; identifying and analyzing trends and progress of the CSS program.
Coordinates with National Programs Manager (CSS) and YMCA IT Support team to implement new data system features and evaluation tools that can be used to measure program impact at the individual, community and national level.
Ensures quality standards of data integrity are in place; provides monthly data integrity reports to senior managers in each program delivery site.
Provides first level technical support to the program sites; tracking relevant system issues and required actions/follow-ups.
Coordinates both online and in-person ETO software training with CSS program staff /managers as required/ iCARE upload training; provides expert advice and support to all sites; ensuring updates are made to ETO User’s Manual and FAQs.
Participates in advanced ETO software training and workshops; liaises with YMCA IT support team as required.
Effectivelytrouble-shootsandproblem-solvesissuesastheyariseandkeepstheCSSManager informed.
Demonstrates appropriate behaviours in line with our Mission, Vision and Values as reflected in our YMCA competencies; takes a member focused approach to increase their understanding of programs offered across the Association.Represents the YMCA and the Association in a professional manner.
Understands the legal responsibilities and moral imperative to report suspected child abuse to Child Protection Services.
Understands the importance of the volunteer staff partnership and integrates the value of philanthropy and volunteerism in dealings with members, volunteers, donors and staff.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

University Degree preferred or completion of Community College Diploma in Information Technology, Research, Statistics, Community Development or related field
Minimum two - three years of related work experience
Solid experience and understanding of data systems and reporting application software
Demonstrated knowledge with evaluation/research design, data collection and both qualitative and quantitative data analysis
Knowledge of webi, API, SQL would be considered an asset
Knowledge and/experience of Salesforce is an asset
Must possess advanced computer skills (Excel & Access)
Experience with webinar/tele-conferencing tools, html and other web-based applications
Excellent time management skills, attention to detail, capacity to prioritize by assessing situations to determine urgency, ability to develop a work schedule, set goals, implement action plans and monitor progress
Able to facilitate groups and function in a diverse team environment
Well-developed interpersonal, and relationship building skills; ability to establish rapport and excellent communication with members, staff and volunteers
Excellent written communication skills
Commitment to respecting diversity and demonstrating inclusive behaviour, responding with sensitivity and self-awareness to the unique needs of colleagues and members, including visible and non-visible dimensions of diversity
Communicates in a thorough, clear and timely manner and supports information sharing and goal achievement across the Association
The position requires the following Core Association Competencies: advanced competence in: Effective Interpersonal Communications; Ethics and Self-management; Being Results Focused; Teamwork and Collaboration; Valuing Diversity and Social Inclusion; fundamental competence in: Being Member Focused and Relationship Building and Partnering;

Job offers are contingent upon the successful completion of a Police Records Check. Within the first four months and every three years thereafter, a Vulnerable Police Records Check is required. 
If you are hired, prior to your start date and as a condition of your employment, you will be required to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have a valid medical or other Human Rights Code-related exemption.

The YMCA of Greater Toronto values the diversity of people and communities and is committed to excellence and inclusion in our Association. We are committed to an environment that is barrier free. If you require accommodation at any stage during the hiring process, please inform us in advance to arrange reasonable and appropriate accommodation.

Title: Business Analyst, HRIS
Business Systems Analyst II (Connected Platforms)
Description:
Location: Toronto, ON, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Calgary, AB, CA 
    







     Req ID: 27090 
    







     Jobs by Category: Operations 
    







     Job Function: Planning and Analysis 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.   Join our team  The Connected Platforms team is a highly engaged group of individuals focused on enabling capabilities which will set the foundation for how TELUS Industry Solutions will build and deliver a connected platform ecosystem. The strategy is focused on earning scaling market share leadership and global industry recognition by enabling best-of-breed capabilities through cohesive integration of horizontal platforms and applications into a unified value chain.


If you are looking to grow and develop your talent and experience, then as a driven, passionate individual accountable for moving our system and product launches forward, you will lead and support a broad variety of tasks related to system and product design. You will be accountable and responsible for analysis and management of requirements specific to new product launches and maintenance of our existing products. If you are excited to be part of this foundational strategic exercise which will determine elements of our next generation industry 4.0 capabilities then please read on.  To be considered for this role, provide demonstration in your application of your direct (or related) experience and results generated for the following capabilities.



Planning and analysis activities 
      
Requirements Management
Work closely with Business Analyst to ensure continuity from Business/Product Requirements to System/Product Functional Requirements
Expertise in creating clear and detailed Use Cases and System Functional Requirement documents
Create user stories based on requirements (Business/Product Requirements)
Collaborate with product teams to validate Functional/Technical requirements and design specifications, including user stories
Understand the customer journey, pain points and work closely with cross-functional teams to continuously provide enhancements to the product/system
Defining the integration to other Products and/or systems with respective and data flow (data sources)
Own and manage the product support backlog, balancing dependencies across multiple platforms

Technical development activities 
      
Drive and implement an automation-first model using best-in-breed technologies using data, AI and ML
Drive collaboration across multi-disciplined teams towards implementing on our product roadmap and our technical solutions
Interpret and manage product requirements to produce quality design and system documentation
Use ‘hack-a-thon’-like effort to prove out ideas
Collaborate with testing teams to create, run and coordinate test plans, conformance plans & test strategies

Support the implementation and transformation of systems, products and tools to ensure smooth enablement 
      
Develop material for and host demos with different stakeholder groups
Support system and product launch activities such as developing and documenting operational processes
Support identification of key success metrics, analyze the results of product changes, and communicate results and next steps to cross functional team members
Consult with internal and external customers in a highly complex technical environment, often translating technical issues to non-technical audiences
 






Qualifications




You're the missing piece of the puzzle



Bachelors level in relevant field
5+ years as a Business Systems Analyst
Multi-year experience in a technology heavy space with a strong understanding of cellular technology
Knowledge/skills with common programming languages/technologies
Experience working in an Agile environment
Strong team player and lot of interest in taking on new challenges
Desire to work in a dynamic, fast-moving and highly engaged environment
High level of engagement, initiative and critical thinking/problem solving
Strong presentation skills
Excellent interpersonal and client relationship skills
Demonstrated ability to interact developer team and a variety of stakeholders
Enjoys focusing on finding solutions rather than listing problems
Ability to communicate complex concepts in a clear and synthetic way


 
Great-to-haves



You are bilingual (English & French) #LI-Remote and MBIOT22 and #LI-Hybrid

Title: Senior Risk Analyst
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   What You’ll Be Doing
 

 Ensure the integrity of credit risk measures of capital markets products by carrying out daily quality assurance procedures and controls, and analyzing the drivers of the exposure changes.
 Partner with Risk Management and Technology stakeholders to plan system enhancements in support of rising business and regulatory requirements related to the accuracy of credit risk data and credit risk measurements in the Trading Credit System.
 Assist in the maintenance of controls related to the integrity of risk data. Conduct ongoing data quality reviews and ensure that new initiatives meet the standards required to support the business unit’s objectives and overall controls.
 Cross train extensively with other trading credit risk quality assurance group members in order to extend their product knowledge, understand the trading credit system, and provide seamless backup support.



   How You’ll Succeed
 

 Experienced - Solid knowledge of financial markets, derivative products and their valuation, and trading room activities and systems gained through related experience.
 Knowledgeable - Strong knowledge of risk management terminology and principles. Knowledge of the associated credit risk management processes and risk measures is an asset. CFA/FRM designation is an asset.
 Analytical - Experience with data analysis tools (incl. data analyst skill-level using SQL, VBA programming)



   Who You Are
 

 You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
 You're driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
 You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
 You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
 You’re a certified professional. Hold the certification or working towards CFA / FRM
 Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.



   What CIBC Offers
 


   At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
 

 Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
 Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
 Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
 Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-81 Bay, 31st Floor
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Analysis Tools, Data Aggregation, Data Analysis Tools, Data Integration, Data Management, Data Quality, Quality Assurance (QA), Regulatory Requirements, Risk Management

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Samsung Ads is looking to add a BI Analyst to our DevOps team.


 About the team
 In this role, you will join a small team of analysts and developers responsible for defining KPIs, building dashboards and analyzing data in order to better understand online advertising campaign performance, operational workload and tracking the health of several lines of business. With this data in hand, you will have the opportunity to drive process improvement projects for a global team. We are looking for someone self-driven who wants to contribute to the growth of our BI team.
 This role reports directly to the BI Manager and will be hybrid-based requiring a mix of working from our Montreal office, QC and teleworking.


 What you will do

Monitor KPIs to:

Generate and submit reports to relevant department heads / management teams
Identify patterns and trends
Work with key stakeholders to define business goals and needs based on data analysis

Implement operational initiatives including change management for both processes and people of specific teams
Generate executive summary of data findings and business impact in a clear and compelling way while adapting style and depth to match stakeholder audience (senior management, clients, internal etc.)
Support the design new analytical tools / processes within Domo, databases and other tools that enable teams to monitor their work and efficiency and combine data sets from various sources to augment our analytical literacy.
Define, plan and monitor the execution and deliverables for projects, adhering to project objectives, timelines and standards



 What you will need

2+ years of professional experience in business intelligence and analytics
Bachelor's Degree with a business and quantitative focus or equivalent experience
Communication expert; verbal and written.
Data presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with both the business side and technical team
Experience with BI tools (Domo), SQL, Python, Stata or Matlab
Exposure and understanding of ETL, data frames and structures
Problem solving skills & the ability to oversee analytical projects end-to-end

Nice to Haves (assets):

Knowledge of Lean, Six Sigma, or other continuous improvement frameworks
Experience in online advertising technologies, AdTech and revenue flow within industry

Benefits

100% company-paid comprehensive health & dental coverage (including massage and therapeutic care) as of Day 1. Access to an employee assistance program and a virtual care platform (wellness, medical & nutrition).
Personal spending account & Healthcare spending account with Sun Life Life that can offer you personalized perks like home office equipment, spa treatments, green living, fitness equipment, music streaming services and more!
Up to 2000$ reimbursed for Mental Health Care
Generous RRSP Matching Program up to 5%
Competitive compensation package, including performance incentive bonus plan based on company, team and personal objectives
Minimum 21 days of paid time off

Perks

Virtual social committee-lead activities such as monthly wine club night, games night as well as wellness initiatives like virtual yoga and meditation, art therapy, aromatherapy classes
Access to learning and development opportunities (your own LinkedIn Learning license, Pluralsight, professional development program, continuing education and more)
Officevibe - anonymous feedback from our teams to know how you're really doing and keep you engaged
Onboarding framework which ensures you're set up for success from Day 1 to Year 1. This also includes a buddy program (someone who will be there for you) from Day 1
Amazing discounts through Samsung Employee Discounts website and access to Perkopolis website with great rebates, coupons and promotions
Summer Fridays
Generous Employee Referral Program
Giving Back Program which includes donation matching & volunteering initiatives including one paid volunteer day


certain benefits & perks apply to only full time permanent roles. Please ask TA for additional details.

 Life at Samsung Ads
 Samsung Ads is an advanced Advertising Technology Company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry's most comprehensive data to build the world's smartest connected audience platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.
 We are proud to have built a world-class organization, grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.
 Are you hesitant to submit an application because you're not sure if you check every box? Apply anyway! We would love to hear from you and figure out what you can add to the culture here at Samsung Ads.
 ***
 Samsung Ads est à la recherche d'un/e Analyste BI pour se joindre à son équipe DevOps.


 À propos de l'équipe
 Dans ce rôle, vous joindrez une équipe d'analystes et de développeurs responsables de la définition des IRC, de la construction de tableaux de bord et de l'analyse des données afin de mieux comprendre les performances des campagnes publicitaires en ligne, la charge de travail opérationnelle et le suivi de la santé de plusieurs secteurs d'activité. Avec ces données en main, vous aurez également la possibilité de piloter des améliorations de processus pour une équipe mondiale. Nous sommes à la recherche d'une personne motivée et indépendante qui souhaite contribuer à la croissance de notre équipe de BI.
 Ce rôle relève directement du Gestionnaire BI et est un poste hybride nécessitant une combinaison de travail à partir de notre bureau de Montréal, QC et de travail à distance.
 Ce que vous ferez

Monitorer les Indicateurs de Performance (KPIs) pour:
Générer et soumettre des rapports aux responsables de départements / aux équipes de gestion
Identifier des tendances et modèles
Collaborer avec les parties prenantes clés afin de définir les objectifs et besoins d'affaires en s'appuyant sur l'analyse de données
Implanter des initiatives opérationnelles, incluant la gestion du changement de processus ou pour certains individus d'équipes spécifiques
Générer des résumés exécutifs de conclusions d'analyse de données et d'impact d'affaire, dans un style clair et convaincant tout en adaptant le style et la complexité selon les parties prenantes à qui ils sont présentés (gestionnaires seniors, clients, employés, etc)
Soutenir la conception de nouveaux outils/processus analytiques dans Domo, des bases de données et d'autres outils qui permettent aux équipes de monitorer leur travail et efficacité et de combiner des ensembles de données provenant de diverses sources afin de rehausser nos conclusions analytiques.
Définir, planifier et monitorer l'exécution et les livrables des projets, en respectant les objectifs, délais et normes de ceux-ci.



 Ce dont vous avez besoin

Plus de 2 ans d'expérience en Intelligence d'Affaires et analytique
Baccalauréat en administration des affaires avec une spécialisation axée sur les analyses quantitatives ou une expérience équivalente
Expert en communication écrite et orale
Compétences en présentation de données, incluant l'habileté de communiquer efficacement des concepts techniques et d'affaires
Expérience avec des outils d'Intelligence d'Affaire (Domo), SQL, Python, Stata ou Matlab
Familiarité et compréhension des ETL et structures et cadrages de données
Compétences en résolution de problèmes et habilité à superviser du début à la fin des projets d'analytiques

Encore mieux si vous avez (atouts) :

Connaissances des concepts Lean, Six Sigma, ou autre méthodes d'amélioration continue
Expérience avec les technologies lies à la publicité ou en AdTech



 Bénéfices

Couverture santé et dentaire complète payée à 100% par l'entreprise (incluant massages et soins thérapeutiques) dès le jour 1. Accès à un programme d'aide aux employés et à une plateforme de soins virtuels (bien-être, soins médicaux et nutrition)
 Compte de dépenses santé et compte de dépenses personnel avec SunLife offrant des avantages personnalisés tels que des fournitures pour votre bureau à la maison, des accès au spa, des produits écolos, des équipements d'entraînement, des services de musique et bien plus encore!
Des remboursements jusqu'à 2000$ pour soutenir la santé
Contribution de l'employeur au REER collectif allant jusqu'à 5 %
Rémunération totale concurrentielle, y compris un bonus basé sur la performance de la compagnie, de l'équipe et l'atteinte d'objectifs personnels
Minimum de 21 jours de congé payés par année

Avantages

Activités mensuelles virtuelles dirigées par un comité social (soirées jeux de société, happy hours, défis santé, etc.).
Accès à plusieurs opportunités de développement et de formation: votre propre licence LinkedIn Learning, Pluralsight, un programme de développement et de formation continue, et bien plus encore.
Officevibe - rétroaction anonyme pour prendre le pouls de nos équipes et stimuler l'engagement.
Programme d'Onboarding structuré pour s'assurer le succès de nos employés dès leur premier jour, et ce, jusqu'à la fin de votre première année chez Samsung Ads. Ceci inclut un programme de jumelage avec un buddy (un collègue qui est là pour vous) dès le jour 1.
Rabais incroyables sur les produits Samsung via programme d'achat employé de Samsung et accès à Perkopolis proposant des rabais, des coupons et des promotions.
Horaires d'été.
Programme généreux de référencement d'employés.
Programme Redonner qui offre la chance de voir ses dons caritatifs égalés par Samsung Ads, diverses opportunités de bénévolat incluant une journée de bénévolat payée.


certains avantages ne s'appliquent qu'aux rôles permanents. Demandez plus de détails à votre spécialiste en acquisition de talents.

 La vie chez Samsung Ads
 Samsung Ads est une entreprise de technologie publicitaire de pointe en forte croissance connectant les marques aux audiences de télévisions Samsung, en utilisant les données les plus avancées du secteur pour créer la plateforme d'audience connectée la plus intelligente au monde. Faire partie d'une entreprise internationale telle que Samsung signifie que nous travaillons sur des projets d'envergure avec des équipes passionnées partout dans le monde.
 Nous sommes fiers d'avoir bâti une organisation de renommée mondiale, fondée sur un esprit entrepreneurial et collaboratif. Travailler chez Samsung Ads offre l'un des meilleurs environnements de l'industrie pour apprendre à quelle vitesse vous pouvez grandir, ce que vous pouvez réaliser et à quel point vous pouvez être bon. Nous nous épanouissons dans la résolution de problèmes, en innovant et en profitant de chaque étape du voyage.
 Vous hésitez à soumettre votre candidature parce que vous n'êtes pas certain de cocher toutes les boîtes? On veut entendre parler de vous ! Nous aimerions prendre le temps ensemble de discuter comment vous pouvez contribuer à la culture chez Samsung Ads!

Title: Project Analyst
Description:
Canadian Bank Note Company is a global leader in the development of customized solutions for identification, border security, excise control, currency, and lottery operations. Our customers are domestic and foreign governments, and together we work to design, launch and support the technologically advanced secure documents and information systems that protect borders, safeguard national currencies, and generate revenue for government social initiatives.

 What’s In It For You?

 If you love all things data and enjoy the hustle and bustle of a fast-paced Analyst role, this position could be for you! You would be an integral part of our support team, which works tirelessly to ensure that the identification systems we have deployed to customers worldwide are managed and supported as efficiently as possible. In this role, you will help us track how well we are doing and identify areas where we can improve. If you like to roll up your sleeves and jump into metrics and reports, read on to find out more.

 What Will You Do?

 As a Project Analyst, you will work closely with our Directors and other managers in the Support department to ensure that they have the information they need to be successful in their roles.

 Reporting to the Head of Service Delivery your responsibilities will include:

 Gathering and reviewing financial data to assess and report on the performance of our projects and service level agreements. 
Interacting with support team members on a regular basis to ensure the information required to manage our reporting is submitted on a timely manner.
 Generating and publishing our monthly Service Management Reports and performing a trend analysis of this data to illustrate how our service management team is performing.
 Reviewing the trend analysis reports to identify areas for improvement, providing these suggestions the Director for consideration.
 Maintain contracts with sub-contractors, and vendors in North America
 Providing administrative support to the Director and other managers in the department.


 What Will Help You Succeed?

 This role will blend the talents of data management and team interaction skills. You will be the focal point for the department’s data, metrics and reports, so a knack for numbers (and Excel!) will help. Coordinating with various teams and departments to gather this data is a vital part of the role, so you will need to be a people person’ happy to engage with a variety of people on a daily basis.

 Knowledge/Experience

 Reporting and Data analysis/mining
 Experience with Budgetary information
 Experience in Office 365 with high level of proficiency with MS Excel and other MS office tools
 Administrative experience


 Soft Skills

 Team-oriented
 Love for numbers and data
 High degree of tenacity and persistence with a deadline-driven mindset
 Extremely motivated, possessing strong analytical skills.
 Detail-oriented with the ability to produce quality work under tight timelines.


 Mandatory Requirements

 The ability to obtain and maintain Government of Canada Secret (Level II) clearance.


 People who enjoy variety and think beyond their job descriptions succeed here. As part of the team at CBN, your job is to take your career in new directions and be part of our customer’s success stories. So, if you’re looking for the chance to work for a global technology company, explore new opportunities, and deliver exceptional work to your customers, we want to hear from you!

 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Canadian Bank Note Company, Limited is committed to achieving a skilled and diversified workforce that reflects the diversity of the Canadian population. We encourage applications from women, visible minorities, people with disabilities and Aboriginal people. Canadian Bank Note Company Limited is committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted regarding this competition, please advise the interview coordinator of any accommodation measures you may require.

Title: Senior Research Data Analyst
Description:
About Ipsos
 Ipsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions.
 Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD). ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS:FP www.ipsos.com


 Senior Research Data Analyst, Toronto
 (May be open to considering other major US and Canadian cities for the right candidate)


 Position Summary
 As a Senior Research Data Analyst you will be responsible to support the Client Service teams by providing in-depth data/statistical analysis to help clients evaluate their advertising and brand performance relative to competition. The Senior Research Analyst will be expected to independently process and deliver analytic deliverables, advise Client Service in study design and interpretation of results, and be able to communicate analytic results with clarity.


 Ideal Candidate has the following Skills and Experience

2-3 years experience in an analytics role
MS degree in math/stats/research/social sciences preferred (advanced degree completion may be considered for job experience).
Experience with multivariate statistics (e.g. regression, factor analysis, correspondent analysis, discriminant analysis, drivers analysis) is required.
Experience with SPSS, SAS and/or R;
Experience with Text analysis, working with different data sources/types (e.g. social data, qual survey data) is desirable.
Would be a plus



Programming experience in Python, VB,
Data visualization
Experience with SPSS Modeler.



 
Additionally, you have a reputation for creativity, attention to detail, excellent communication skills both oral and written and strategic insight in the delivery of research services. Above all, you are self-motivated with high energy, can work on multiple projects simultaneously and thrive in a fast paced, and deadline driven environment.
 We offer a team environment that recognizes and rewards individual achievements. A full-service team of professionals including leading-edge methodological consultants and sector and industry experts will support your work.


 Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Title: Senior Analyst, Case Mix
Description:
Category


    Data Analysis
   




City


    Ottawa, Toronto, Ontario, Canada
   







Job Description


    Senior Analyst, Case Mix 
    
 Who we are
    
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
 CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
 At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include

 HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Benefits Pension)
 Retirement Planning Program
 Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
 Work-life balance
 Career Planning Program
 Learning and Professional Development Program
 Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts



 Why is this role important?
     Working as a part of the Case Mix team, the Senior Analyst will carry out a range of activities that contribute to the development, maintenance and enhancement of methodologies and products that support health system and population health decision-making. Major responsibilities include leading data analyses, incorporating new data sources, conducting quality assurance activities, and communicating analyses to internal and external audiences. In addition, the Senior Analyst will coordinate projects, prepare and contribute to reports and documentations, and assist with other project activities such as supporting the use of the CIHI products. The Senior Analyst will be working with a range of data sets from the hospital, primary care, mental health, residential care, and home care sectors. 
    
 What you'll do
     1. Performs qualitative and quantitative analyses using data across multiple healthcare settings to understand population health and analyze the patient journey
    
 2. Leads analytical activities related to the ongoing development and evolution of case mix grouping methodologies 
    
 3. 
     4.
    


 5. Provides analytical support to additional ad-hoc requests and special studies as required. 
    
 6. Develops and maintains detailed knowledge of the case mix methodologies and CIHI data holdings used to produce outputs.
    
 7. Prepares related documentations as required; presents work progress, findings, summaries to internal and external audiences.
    
 8. Develops and maintains relationships by working in collaboration with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
    
 9. Respects privacy and confidentiality of information by following policies in privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information at CIHI and related procedures and directives. 
    
 What you'll bring to the table
    
Undergraduate degree in epidemiology, statistics, mathematics, economics, health services research, health administration or other relevant field. Masters degree is considered an asset.

3-5 years experience working in a health care research/information environment involved in the analysis, design and dissemination of research studies and related information products.

Advanced SAS programming skills. Experience with R or Python is considered an asset.

Strong analytical skills, with experience using predictive modeling to manipulate and draw insights from large datasets.

Strong interpersonal, presentation, verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology.

Project planning, time management and organizational skills.

Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Existing knowledge of CIHI clinical databases is an asset. 

Fluency in both official languages is an asset. 

Ability to meet minimal travel requirements. 

 Closing Statement
    
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
 We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


 Employment Equity
    
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.





Analyste principal, Groupes clients 
    
 Notre organisation
    
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
 Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
 L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants : 

une structure salariale concurrentielle
 un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
 l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
 un programme de planification de la retraite
 un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
 un programme de planification de carrière
 des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel



 Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
     Au sein de l’équipe des Groupes clients, l’analyste principal effectue un éventail d’activités contribuant à l’élaboration, à la mise à jour et à l’amélioration de méthodologies et de produits qui orientent la prise de décisions relatives aux systèmes de santé et à la santé de la population. Il est principalement appelé à diriger des analyses de données, à intégrer de nouvelles sources de données, à mener des activités d’assurance de la qualité et à diffuser les résultats des analyses à des publics internes et externes. L’analyste principal coordonne des projets, participe à la préparation de rapports et d’autres documents, et prend part à d’autres activités de projet comme le soutien à l’utilisation des produits de l’ICIS. Il travaille avec une variété d’ensembles de données provenant des hôpitaux et des secteurs des soins primaires, de la santé mentale, des soins en hébergement et des services à domicile. 
    
 Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
     1. Effectuer des analyses qualitatives et quantitatives à l’aide de données provenant de divers milieux de soins afin de mieux comprendre la santé de la population et d’analyser le cheminement des patients.
    
 2. Diriger les activités d’analyse liées à l’élaboration et l’évolution continues des méthodologies des groupes clients
    
 3. Offrir au besoin un soutien analytique dans le cadre d’autres demandes et études spéciales. 
    
 4. Acquérir et maintenir une connaissance approfondie des méthodologies des groupes clients et des banques de données de l’ICIS utilisées dans la production des rapports.
    
 5. Préparer des documents connexes au besoin; présenter des rapports d’avancement des travaux, des résultats et des résumés à des publics internes et externes.
    
 6. Cultiver des relations de collaboration avec divers intervenants internes et externes.
    
 7. Respecter le droit à la vie privée et protéger la confidentialité de l’information en suivant les politiques sur le respect de la vie privée et la confidentialité de l’information sur la santé de l’ICIS ainsi que les procédures et directives connexes. 
    
 Que mettriez-vous à profit ? 
    
Diplôme universitaire de premier cycle en épidémiologie, en statistique, en mathématiques, en économie, en recherche sur les services de santé, en administration de la santé ou dans un domaine connexe. Maîtrise, un atout.

3 à 5 ans d’expérience de l’analyse, de l’élaboration et de la diffusion d’études de recherche et de produits d’information connexes dans le domaine de l’information ou de la recherche sur les soins de santé.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la programmation SAS. Expérience des langages de programmation R ou Python, un atout.

Excellentes aptitudes pour l’analyse et expérience de l’utilisation des techniques de modélisation prédictive afin de manipuler des données et de tirer des enseignements à partir de grands ensembles de données.

Entregent, excellentes aptitudes pour la présentation et la communication verbale et écrite, dont la capacité de vulgariser des concepts complexes.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la planification de projets, la gestion du temps et l’organisation.

Capacité manifeste à travailler seul ou en équipe.

Connaissance des bases de données cliniques de l’ICIS, un atout. 

Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle; maîtrise du français, un atout. 

Capacité à répondre aux exigences minimales de déplacement. 

 Declaration
    
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
 Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.
 La vaccination reste l’outil le plus efficace pour réduire le risque de COVID-19. L’ICIS s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de ses employés au lieu de travail. Par conséquent, l’ICIS exige une preuve de vaccination pour tous ses employés, à moins qu’une mesure d’adaptation ne s’applique en vertu de la loi.
 L’utilisation dans le présent document de la forme masculine ou féminine, selon le contexte, a pour seul but d’alléger le texte.


 Équité en emploi
    
L'ICIS s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, sans obstacle et accessible. Il s'engage entre autres à prendre les mesures d'adaptation nécessaires en vue de favoriser une participation équitable aux processus de recrutement et de sélection. Par conséquent, si vous avez des besoins spéciaux, nous nous efforcerons d'y répondre.

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Company: Royal College of Phys. & Surgeons of Can
Description:
12 Month Temporary Assignment
 As a national, non-profit organization, the Royal College speaks for more than 50,000 medical and surgical specialists and resident affiliates. The mission of the Royal College is to serve patients, diverse populations and our Fellows by setting the standards in specialty medical education and lifelong learning, and by advancing professional practice and health care. Royal College offers a stimulating and professional work environment.
 With an extensive knowledge of data processing and enterprise software applications and understanding of technology and business systems, the System Analyst works directly with client groups to proactively identify and address the system requirements and implications of current and future needs with the goal of increasing technological efficiency, capacity and adoption. Working closely with Business Analysts, Project Managers, development and architecture teams, the System Analyst provides a bridge between the business requirements and the technical definition of the system to ensure proper translation of business requirements to technical solution requirements. The System Analyst is responsible for gathering system requirements and developing use cases, for both functional and non-functional requirements, and assisting in turning user requirements into the functional specifications that are the blueprint for the system.
 The System Analyst identifies and models the system scope, identifies system users and use cases and develops the glossary. Troubleshoots recurring technical issues, identifies modifications required and makes recommendations for solutions.
 The Systems Analyst works directly with internal and external client groups to proactively identify and address the system requirements and implications of current and future needs for cloud-based applications, with the goal of increasing technological efficiency, capacity and adoption.

   Here’s an insight into your typical day to day: 
  

Serve as a liaison and facilitator between the business units and the development and architecture teams to assist in addressing and resolving application issues.
Perform application management, release management, ticket management, data management and issue management for on-premises and cloud-based applications.
Identify and coordinate application development and enhancements, including the management of application releases and frequent interactions with external service provider.
Analyze data in corporate database, identify data integrity issues, write technical procedures and documentation to implement solutions.
Troubleshoot and provide application-specific support to the user community while liaising with third party support provider.
Develop and execute test plans and scripts for manual and/or automated platforms and manage test results accordingly.
Identify, document, validate and compile detailed specifications for systems development. 
Ensure that use cases are complete and consistent to address all requirements. 
Define application-specific training requirements, prepare training plans, and produce training material to ensure high adoption of the system. 
Collaborate with the client groups to develop and deliver the necessary project team and user training.
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency of business processes and increase adoption of applications
Write technical procedures and documentation for application-related activities, such as requirements documents, functional specifications, test plans and scripts, release management procedures, etc. 
Participate in the Royal College Change Advisory Board meetings


 Does this sound like you?

Level of education, training and experience equivalent to a degree in business, computer science or related field 
Minimum of 5 years of application experience with at least 3 years of hands-on functional analysis. 
Experience in the development and implementation of standards, procedures and guidelines to support operational processes. 
Extensive knowledge of data processing and enterprise software applications
Demonstrated strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operation requirements.
Strong project management and resource management skills.
Ability to develop and complete automation of tasks, such as testing and recording training material, using corporate software.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills, with an ease for facilitating group discussions/training
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, work on different initiatives simultaneously while managing changing priorities.
Ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
Willingness to work occasionally outside of normal business hours (e.g deployment of releases & testing). 
Excellent English verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with staff and management at all levels. 
A results-oriented individual who thrives working in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent time management and organizational skill with the ability to work on different initiatives simultaneously. 
Proficient in using SQL Developer would be an asset.
Bilingualism would be an asset.

 How to get noticed? Please apply through our UKG recruitment platform with your résumé, covering letter and salary expectations by June 19, 2022.
 Annual Salary Band 6 - Starting salary ranges from $68,458.00 to $77,016.00
 We sincerely thank all applicants for their interest; however, we will only contact those under consideration. An eligibility list may be established for similar positions of various tenures. The list will be retained for a maximum period of 18 months.
 We are dedicated as an organization to adhere to public health guidelines for our employees and their families. Remote work arrangements for most of our teams is currently in place until further notice. Flexibility is key in our new world.
 In order to maintain a healthy and safe workplace, all persons entering the Royal College premises must provide the organization with evidence, acceptable to the Royal College, that they are fully vaccinated.  Acceptable evidence of vaccination will include a physical or digital vaccination receipt or passport issued by a province or territory, presented with government issued photo ID, on request. Vaccination status will be confirmed at reception, or as set out in the procedures.
 Royal College is committed to the principles of equity, diversity, and inclusion in its learning, work environments and in its operations. We encourage applications from traditionally marginalized groups. We believe in and promote the rights of all persons with disabilities as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA 2005) and its related Accessibility Standards Regulations. To meet this obligation, the Royal College will make appropriate accommodations available. As required, please inform People Services of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require to ensure your equal participation.

 12 mois d'intérim
 Faites-vous preuve d'un intérêt marqué pour la conception de nouveaux systèmes et cadres de TI avec des partenaires d’affaires? La nécessité d'appliquer des techniques d'analyse et de conception fiables pour résoudre des problèmes opérationnels à l'aide de technologies de pointe est-elle pour vous une source de motivation? Alors, l'un de ces postes est l'occasion rêvée pour vous!
 Le Collège royal des médecins et chirurgiens du Canada est une organisation nationale sans but lucratif qui s’exprime au nom de plus de 50 000 médecins et chirurgiens spécialistes et résidents affiliés. Il s’est donné pour mission d’être au service des patients, des diverses populations et de ses Associés en établissant les normes de la formation médicale spécialisée et de l’apprentissage à vie, et en assurant l’avancement de la pratique professionnelle et des soins de santé. Le Collège royal offre un milieu de travail stimulant et professionnel.
 En tant qu'analyste de systèmes, vous mettrez à profit votre connaissance approfondie du traitement des données, des applications logicielles d’entreprise et votre compréhension des technologies et des systèmes opérationnels auprès de groupes de clients afin de cerner et de remplir de façon proactive les exigences des systèmes en tenant compte des incidences des besoins actuels et futurs pour accroître l'efficience, la capacité et l'adoption des technologies. De concert avec les analystes des activités, les gestionnaires de projet et les équipes chargées du développement et de l'architecture, vous ferez le pont entre les exigences opérationnelles et la définition technique du système afin de proposer des solutions techniques appropriées. Vous recueillerez les exigences des systèmes et élaborerez des cas d'utilisation pour les exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles, et contribuerez à l'intégration des besoins des utilisateurs aux spécifications fonctionnelles qui constituent la structure du système.
 Vous déterminerez la portée des systèmes, en établirez le modèle, identifierez les utilisateurs, élaborerez les cas d'utilisation et le glossaire. Vous résoudrez des problèmes techniques récurrents, déterminerez les modifications requises et recommanderez des solutions.
 Vous travaillerez avec des groupes de clients internes et externes afin de connaître et de remplir les exigences des systèmes en tenant compte des incidences des besoins actuels et futurs en matière d'applications en nuage, pour accroître l'efficience, la capacité et l'adoption des technologies.

   Aperçu de vos tâches quotidiennes 
  

Tenir lieu d’agent de liaison et de facilitateur entre les unités opérationnelles et les équipes chargées du développement et de l'architecture pour les aider à résoudre les problèmes liés aux applications.
Assurer la gestion des applications, des révisions/versions, des tickets, des données et des problèmes pour les applications locales et en nuage.
Coordonner le développement et les améliorations des applications, y compris la gestion des versions des applications et les fréquentes interactions avec le fournisseur de service externe.
Analyser les données dans la base de données organisationnelle, signaler les problèmes d'intégrité des données, rédiger des procédures et documents techniques pour apporter les solutions.
Assurer le dépannage et fournir aux utilisateurs un soutien des applications en collaborant avec les ressources de soutien externes.
Élaborer et exécuter des plans de test et des scripts pour des plateformes manuelles ou automatisées, et gérer les résultats qui en découlent.
Définir, documenter, valider et compiler des spécifications détaillées pour développer les systèmes. 
S’assurer que les cas d’utilisation sont complets, cohérents et respectent toutes les exigences. 
Définir les exigences de formation propres aux applications, préparer les plans de formation et créer des ressources didactiques pour favoriser l’adoption des systèmes à grande échelle. 
Collaborer avec les groupes de clients afin de préparer et d'offrir la formation requise à l'équipe de projet et aux utilisateurs.
Saisir les occasions d’accroître l’efficacité des processus opérationnels et l'adoption des applications.
Rédiger des procédures techniques et de la documentation pour les activités liées aux applications (documents sur les exigences, spécifications fonctionnelles, scripts et plans de test, procédures de gestion des versions, etc. 
Participer aux réunions du comité consultatif du Collège royal sur le changement.


 Ce profil vous correspond?

Niveau de formation et d’expérience équivalent à un diplôme en administration, en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe. 
Au moins cinq ans d’expérience pertinente et au moins trois ans d’expérience pratique en analyse fonctionnelle. 
Expérience de l'élaboration et de la mise en œuvre de normes, de procédures et de lignes directrices à l'appui de processus opérationnels. 
Connaissance approfondie du traitement des données et des applications logicielles d’entreprise.
Compétences manifestes en matière d’analyse et de gestion de produits et savoir interpréter les besoins des clients et les traduire en applications et en exigences opérationnelles.
Solides compétences en gestion de projet et en gestion des ressources.
Aptitude à développer et à compléter l'automatisation des tâches; p. ex., tests et enregistrement du matériel de formation, à l'aide de logiciels d'entreprise. 
Connaissance approfondie des logiciels Microsoft Office (Word, Excel et PowerPoint). 
Grandes compétences en analyse et en résolution de problèmes; 
Beaucoup d'entregent et de doigté, et savoir animer avec aisance des discussions de groupe/séances de formation. 
Motivation personnelle, capacité à établir des priorités, à respecter des échéances, à mener plusieurs initiatives à la fois en tenant compte des priorités changeantes.
Capacité de travailler seul et en équipe.
Disposition à travailler parfois après les heures normales (p. ex. déploiement de versions et tests). 
Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite (anglais), et entregent afin de collaborer avec les employés et les équipes de gestion à tous les niveaux de l’organisation. 
Personne axée sur les résultats et stimulée par un milieu de travail en évolution rapide.
Sens aigu de la gestion du temps, compétences organisationnelles et capacité à mener plusieurs initiatives à la fois. 
Maîtrise de SQL Developer (un atout).
Bilinguisme (un atout).

 Pour postuler Veuillez poser votre candidature dans la plateforme de recrutement UKG, et joindre votre curriculum vitæ, une lettre de motivation et vos attentes salariales d’ici le 19 juin 2022.
 Salaire annuel Échelon 6 – Salaire de départ : 68 458 $ à 77 016 $
 Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt. Toutefois, nous communiquerons seulement avec les personnes retenues. Une liste d’admissibilité pourra être établie afin de pourvoir des postes similaires de durées variées. Elle sera conservée pendant 18 mois.
 Notre organisation s’engage à respecter les lignes directrices de santé publique afin d’appuyer ses employés et leur famille. Elle a donc prolongé le télétravail pour la plupart de ses équipes jusqu’à nouvel ordre. Nous jugeons essentiel de faire preuve de souplesse compte tenu de cette nouvelle réalité.
 Afin de maintenir un milieu de travail sain et sécuritaire, toutes les personnes qui entrent dans les locaux du Collège royal doivent fournir à l’organisation une preuve de vaccination complète jugée acceptable par le Collège royal.  Sont acceptés comme preuve de vaccination contre la COVID les documents de vaccination papier ou numériques et les passeports délivrés par une province ou un territoire, accompagnés sur demande d’une pièce d’identité avec photo délivrée par le gouvernement. Le statut vaccinal sera confirmé à la réception ou conformément aux procédures établies.
 Le Collège royal s’engage à respecter les principes d’équité, de diversité et d’inclusion dans ses milieux d’apprentissage et de travail ainsi que dans ses activités. Nous encourageons les membres de groupes traditionnellement marginalisés à poser leur candidature. Nous croyons aux droits des personnes handicapées et nous en faisons la promotion, conformément au Code des droits de la personne de l’Ontario, à la Loi sur l’accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l’Ontario (LAPHO, 2005) et aux Normes d’accessibilité intégrées qui en découlent. Dans cette optique, le Collège royal fera tout en son pouvoir pour répondre aux besoins spéciaux des candidats. Ainsi, veuillez en informer le Service des ressources humaines pour vous assurer la pleine participation au processus de recrutement.

Title: Senior IT Business Analyst, Intact Lab
Description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.
At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.
Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day
Here, innovation is everyone's job. Ready to make your mark?











     About the role
     










As a Senior Business Analyst, you play a vital role of translator and facilitator between Business, IT and Quality Assurance. You will be part of a small squad with the sole purpose of creating and enhancing a digital product to the point where that product is the best product, not just in the insurance field, but the best product out there, period.
Reporting to the Manager, Digital Products your main responsibilities are :

Analyze business needs to define IT solutions
Lead / prepare / participate in business requirements specification workshops to specify IT solutions
Make impact analysis and effort estimates to advocate, get approval, then document the IT solution using effective methods and interacting with both business users and the IT project team
Support Product Owners in handling their backlogs and prioritize work to be done
Collaborate to write effective User Stories that can be used by Front End, Back End developers and Quality Assurance
Handle change management process via train the trainer documents and procedures
Build a solid, reusable and thorough system documentation to be used by any stakeholders
Support the development of solutions and monitor performance












     Qualifications
     










What you bring to the table :

Bachelor's degree in a related field
3 to 8 years of experience in analysis (Business, Functional, Information)

Specific experiences - Assets strongly considered

Project experiences in Agile SAFe mode
Mastery of JIRA & Confluence
Knowledge of Figma, Adobe Analytics & Swagger
Experience and knowledge in the insurance field

Required qualities

Be customer oriented
Rigor in the quality of deliverables and in the follow-up of the files entrusted
Ability to learn environments and systems to be up and running quickly
Know how to plan and organize
Good problem-solving skills
Dynamism
Autonomy
Open minded and opened to changes
Communication: summarize in a clear and concise manner, know how to adapt the level of language (verbal and written) and the content of the message according to the type of business or technical worker, demonstrate skills to work with people from different backgrounds, locally or remotely, in both French and English

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements
We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.
#hybrid











     Closing Statement
     










We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.
Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

This role is eligible for employee referral bonus. #myReferrals3000
