Title: Business Analyst-Digital
Description:
Scope of Position
 At Alterna, we are reimagining everyday banking while supporting the financial futures of our members. The Business Analyst-Digital translates insights into actionable plans within the Digital Channels Applications team. This role will involve translating the needs of our members into user stories and business requirements. You will develop a deep understanding of the digital channel product stack (online banking, mobile, ESB integration) from multiple perspectives- member, technical, operations, business and more.
 You will be an integral part of the Digital Channels team supporting the evolution of the digital platform, while ensuring the platform is running through on-call support.

 Major Responsibilities
 Business and Data Analysis

 Performs in-depth system analysis to interpret business rules and requirements for technical systems
 Translates conceptual design into thorough business specifications or into functional solutions (e.g. BRD, User stories)
 Develops or coordinates and makes recommendations on test scripts to participate in testing sign off or business user sign off
 Responsible to document procedures, technical requirements and release notes that are appropriate for a technical or a non-technical audience
 Participates in the implementation and delivery, and provides post-implementation support
 Works closely with developers, system analysts and other business analysts to ensure that the full effects of any system changes are complete
 Creates actionable analysis using a diverse set of data and analytical capabilities and tools (excel, SQL, statistical analysis, etc.)
 Provides on call production support for the digital applications


 Service design

 You will understand complex systems and help reorganize longstanding operating models to remove barriers to great experiences
 Become a subject matter expert for the digital applications from a technical and member perspective
 Coordinate, schedule and facilitate process improvement and design sessions and apply root cause analysis techniques
 Perform needs assessments and defines functional requirements of perspective business systems as required
 You will work with multiple employee groups to help design member-centric solutions.
 Use various tools to uncover ways to help make our members financial lives easier including journey maps, service patterns and service blueprints to effectively institutionalize customer-centric practices.
 Act in an advisory/mentoring capacity for other stakeholders, developers and all those involved in the project at hand
 Support the implementation of process improvements and general maintenance
 Responsible for creating and maintaining a close working relationship with subject matter experts from the business and IT to ensure understanding of business needs


 Qualifications

 University degree in a computer science or related field and equivalent working experience (or working toward a business analysis certification) with business analysis, methods and procedures
 A minimum 5 years’ experience at this level
 Excellent data analysis skills and desire to support data driven decision making.
 Experience following the iterative and agile SDLC and working in a DevOps/Agile environment (we use Azure DevOps)
 Solid background in team facilitation, business process analysis and experience in co-coordinating user testing and an ability to translate conceptual design into business specifications or into functional solutions


 About Alterna Savings
 Alterna Savings and Credit Union Limited (Alterna) has been the good in banking™ for over 110 years, and based on assets under management, is one of Canada's Top 10 credit unions (CCUA, 2021). Alterna is made up of Alterna Savings and Credit Union Limited and its wholly owned subsidiary, Alterna Bank. Together, we have $10 billion in assets under management.
 As the first full-service, member-owned co-operative financial institution outside Quebec, Alterna Savings shares its expertise with more than 185,000 members through a network of over 30 branches across Ontario, that includes partner Peterborough Community Savings; as well as call centre and digital channels. Members and customers also benefit from an industry-leading online brokerage, investment management services, and have access to over 43,000 surcharge-free ATMs in North America with THE EXCHANGE Network in Canada and the All point Network in the US.

 Working at Alterna
 Alterna offers a fast-paced, impactful work experience in an organization that cares about doing good. For over 100 years, Alterna has been creating financial services that transform lives for the better, all while giving back to our community.
 We are incredibly proud of our corporate culture, where everyone works together towards a common goal, the financial wellbeing of our members and customers. This commitment has earned us several prestigious employer awards, including the National Capital Region's Top Employers award for six years running. * Although we appreciate all applicants, preference will be given to candidates who most closely meet the qualifications, key skills, and competencies outlined above.

Alterna is compliant with the Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you have a disability, please contact the recruiter to let us know how we can accommodate you.

Title: Business Unit Analyst
Description:
Posting Period
From June 17, 2022 to July 08, 2022


Country or region
Canada


Location

Montréal, Québec 



Business Unit
Plant Care


Department
Accounting / Finance


Entry date
As soon as possible 


Job Status
Permanent - Full time 


Minimal required work experience
1 to 3 years 


Minimal education level required
Bachelor's Degree 


Salary
Based on experience 


Benefits
Competitive social benefits 






Business Unit Analyst
Main Functions
 Reporting to the Business Unit Controller, your main responsibilities will include operations, accounting and reporting. You will assist the Business Unit Controller in the day-to-day accounting & operations activities, results analysis, budgets and preparation of ad-hoc documents / ad-hoc projects. With many innovative new product launches and strong business unit growth expected over the next few years; this will truly be an exciting and rewarding opportunity for a finance professional who is passionate and wants to learn in an international environment!
 At Lallemand Plant Care, we encourage autonomy, innovation, collaboration; routine is not part of our vocabulary! As we grow, we offer career and professional development opportunities locally and internationally. If you are looking for a challenging job where your opinion is valued and you feel you can make a difference, both in your work and to the environment and society, you have come to the right place.
 Tasks associated with this position also include, but may not be limited to:

Developing and automating standardized reports (Example, P&L report by sales representative, cost reports, production variances).
Analysis of trends and results pertaining to sales, operations, SG&A expenses, customers, products, financial ratios;
Preparing regular and ad-hoc reports & dashboards.
Inventory and Plant variances reconciliation and analysis.
Assisting accounting tasks and support for the different entities within the business unit, accounting questions, audit process and governance file.
Special assignments and projects as the business grows and evolves.

Technical skills
 Required

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, finance or other related field.
1-2 years of experience with Data Analysis/Finance/Accounting.
Experience with cost accounting, standard costs and production variances analysis.
Advanced MS Excel knowledge.

An asset

Knowledge of IBM Cognos BI & Power BI.
Experience in project accounting.
Experience with a multi-currency and inter-company/inter-division transactions.

Personal abilities

Good team player.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Knowledge of French, Spanish, Portuguese, German is an asset.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and have good problem-solving skills.
Strong analytical skills, organized and reliable; able to juggle multiple streams of work, keep things on track and consistently meet deadlines for processing work, with a strong attention to detail.
Self-aware, reflective, and able to learn from mistakes. Shows an ability to learn quickly while on the job.
Not afraid to speak up and make suggestions for areas for improvement.
Desire to learn continuously.

General criteria
 Required

Valid passport.

Other

Travel: Occasionally (10% of the time per year).
Excellent work ethic.
Honest.

Organization
 Lallemand is a privately held Canadian company founded in the late 19th century, which develops, produces, and markets microorganisms for various markets. The administrative offices of the parent company are in Montreal, Canada. Today, Lallemand employs more than 4,500 people working in more than 45 countries on 5 continents.
 Yeasts, bacteria, fungi: microorganisms have always lived in harmony with plants since their origin and are now recognized for their multiple agronomic benefits. As a world specialist in microorganisms, Lallemand Plant Care carefully selects strains for agricultural use, to improve the nutrition, health, and productivity of plants.
 Lallemand Plant Care is a growing business unit and offers many opportunities for career development and professional development on a local and international scale. Joining the Lallemand Plant Care team means collaborating with people who work passionately to develop sustainable, efficient, and clean solutions for agriculture professionals, horticulture, green spaces, and the forestry sector. We regularly recruit new talent from around the world to support our growth and our sales, logistics, marketing, production and research and development efforts.
 Please take note that accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

Title: Analyste, Gestion de la Configuration & Données / Configuration & Data Management Analyst
Description:
Role and Responsibilities
 


 (English will follow)
 


   Role et responsabilités:
 

 Cueillette et compiler une variété de métriques en utilisant PowerBI
 Créer et maintenir les rapports de métrique pour l'analyse d'amélioration continue
 Supporter l’équipe de la Gestion de Configuration (GC) dans la revue et des processus, procédures et plans de GC
 Exécuter des tâches de GC avec compétence comme dirigé par le chef de groupe QA/CI.
 Supporter les systèmes de GC utilisés par les projets en suivant les procédures de base et de résoudre les questions et des problèmes des utilisateurs associés à l'utilisation du système.
 Enregistrer et identifier les artéfacts des projets tels que COTS logiciels, matériels et documents, qui comprendront des éléments qui sont achetés pour le projet ainsi que ceux fournis par les clients (Customer Équipement Meublé).
 Participer aux réunions pour la gestion de configuration (CCB) et de gestion du changement : examiner et approuver les modifications touchant les éléments de la configuration ; Veiller à ce que l'intégrité des baselines existantes n’est pas affectée ; Faire le suivi sur les questions et les actions attribuées aux membres du projet au cours de la (CCB) jusqu'à la fermeture.
 Supporter les procédures nécessaires de sauvegarde du système de rétention pour assurer le stockage approprié des supports de sauvegarde et la livraison des projets médias et documents livrables.
 Fournir un soutien aux gestionnaires et aux équipes de projet dans le suivi et le contrôle des données de configuration nécessaires à des projets de gestion et de garder les clients informés.
 Maintenir la voûte pour les éléments de configuration physiques créés / utilisées par les projets. (Par exemple, les médias, les lits, les licences documents, dessins, etc.).
 Soutenir et promouvoir les objectifs, les principes et les actions nécessaires pour faire que la GC soit partie prenante dans la culture de l'entreprise.
 Effectuer des audits sur la gestion de configuration et de faire les rapports sur les résultats.
 Identifier et communiquer les lacunes/problèmes, créer les demandes d'action corrective, et faire le suivi sur celles-ci.
 Effectuer les rapports de projet sur le statut des baselines et les demandes de changement.
 Vérifier les baseline sets des projets selon la réglementation des produits contractuels.
 Améliorer de façon continue les processus et les procédures CM et superviser l'automatisation des procédures CM, le cas échéant, à répondre aux besoins du projet.
 Supporter le rôle de gestion lors de la construction des versions des logiciels qui comprennent : Aider à l'élaboration, l'analyse et la maintenance des outils qui soutiennent et automatisent les processus pour le matériel ou les versions du logiciel produit. Aider à l’écriture des scripts et programmes d'installation pour l'installation des produits. Compiler et assembler des logiciels à partir du code source. Valider les journaux (logs) et travailler avec les ingénieurs de développement pour dépanner et les corriger les erreurs de construction.
 Exécuter les activités de GC conformément au plan de GC approuvé.
 Interpréter la documentation contractuelle relative aux exigences de GC.
 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les clients et l’équipe de projet concernant les questions de CM.



   Profil recherché:
 

 Bilinguisme (français et anglais).
 Diplôme universitaire en informatique, ou toute combinaison équivalente d'études et d'expérience, ainsi qu'au moins deux années d'expérience en développement de logiciels ou en gestion de la configuration.
 Connaissance du cycle de vie du développement de logiciels et de systèmes ainsi que des méthodes associées.
 Connaissance des procédures et des processus liés à la gestion de la configuration.
 Connaissance des procédures relatives à l'assurance de la qualité.
 Maîtrise des outils Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.).



   ******
 


   Here is the essential duties and responsibilities:
 


 Gathering and compiling metrics on a variety of business fonction using PowerBI.
 Creating and maintaining metric reports for Continuous Improvement Analysis
 Support the CM team in the review and establishment of CM processes, procedures and plans.
 Execute CM tasks competently as directed by the CM Lead as described in Configuration Management documentation.
 Support configuration control systems used by Projects by following basic procedures and resolve simple user questions and problems associated with system usage.

Log, tag and track project assets such as COTS Software, Hardware and documentation, which will include items that are procured for the project as well as those provided by customers (Customer Furnished Equipment).

 Participate in Configuration Management and Change Management boards to: Review and approve Engineering changes affecting configuration items; Ensure that the integrity of existing baselines is not affected;; Follow-up on issues and actions assigned to project members during CCB through to closure. Support system backup and retention procedures necessary to ensure proper storage of backup media and packaging of project deliverable media and documentation.

Provide support to Project Managers and teams in tracking and control of configuration data needed to management projects and to keep customers informed.
Maintain vault for physical configuration items created/used by projects. (E.g., media, COTS, licenses documentation, drawings, etc.).

 Support and promote the goals, principles and actions required to make CM part of the company's culture.
 Perform configuration audits and report on findings.
 Produce CM work products including baseline reports, audit reports, monthly CM activity reports, and Configuration Control Board (CCB) reports.
 Identify and communicate baseline deficiencies, raise corrective action request, and follow-up.
 Perform project reporting on the status of baselines and changes requests.
 Verify product baselines for compliance to contractual product regulations.
 Continuously improve CM processes and procedures and oversee the automation of CM procedures, when appropriate, to meet project needs.
 Support the Build and Release Management role on projects which include: assisting with developing, analyzing and maintaining tools that support and automate processes for hardware or software product release. Writes installation scripts and programs for installation of products. Compiles and assembles software from source code. Validates build logs and works with development engineers to conduct trouble-shooting and correct build errors.
 Execute CM activities in accordance with the approved CM plan.
 Interpret contractual documentation pertaining to CM requirements.
 Work closely with customers and the project team regarding CM matters.



   Qualifications:
 

 Bilingualism in both French and English is required.
 University degree in computer sciences, or equivalent combination of college education and experience, and at least two years of experience in software development or configuration management.
 Knowledge of systems/software development life cycle and development methodologies.
 Knowledge of Configuration Management processes and procedures.
 Knowledge of Quality Assurance procedures.
 Proficiency in MS Office productivity tools (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio).



   Position Type
 

 Regular
 

   CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
 


   Equal Employment Opportunity
 

   At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
 


   As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
 


   At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.
 


   The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

Title: Senior Policy Analyst (Program Admin Officer 4)
Description:
Department: Environment and Climate Change
Location: HALIFAX
Type of Employment: Permanent
Union Status: NSGEU - NSPG
Closing Date: 6/29/2022 (Applications are accepted until 11:59 PM Atlantic Time)



 About Us




Nova Scotia Environment and Climate Change’s role is to protect the environment, human health and farm animal through regulatory excellence, conservation, partnership and promotion. To achieve this, we strive to develop legislation, regulations and policies, process notifications, applications, and approvals for regulated activities based on sound scientific knowledge and expertise.


Our goal is to educate, inspect and enforce to ensure compliance with legislation and regulations. We proactively respond to environmental, conservation, farm animal welfare, and human health risks and work to develop programs and deliver services to enhance protection in these areas.
Nova Scotia Environment - Department




 About Our Opportunity




The Senior Policy Analyst works with a team of professionals to implement provincial commitments, policies and programs related to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions in the province. Reporting to the Manager of the Climate Change Mitigation team, the Senior Policy Analyst is responsible for developing and implementing programs, policies and regulations related to Nova Scotia's carbon pricing program and climate change mitigation goals. You will take meaningful action on climate change which will involve collaborating and building partnerships to coordinate and advance initiatives across government departments. You will develop and grow relationships with many diverse communities and stakeholders while also collaborating at the provincial, national, and international level and focusing on shared objectives while representing the province.




 Primary Accountabilities




In this role, you will create an environment that promotes continuous learning and improvement by seeking feedback from your colleagues and being open to critiques that improve outcomes. Within this ever-evolving field, you will lead through change and be willing to adjust quickly, as needed. This work requires innovative approaches to capacity building, community engagement, education and information sharing to ensure that engagement is inclusive, and that the information is trusted.


This position will support the operation of the province’s carbon pricing program. In this role, you will monitor trends of related provincial, territorial, and federal climate change mitigation policies and associated funding programs to identify interrelationships, opportunities, and challenges. You will work to maximize the benefits to Nova Scotians by seeking out partnerships, leveraging contributions and ensuring lasting impact. You will make recommendations while considering the wide scope of issues including environmental, social, and economic impacts; innovative opportunities; and national and international trends.


You will build collaborative networks with stakeholders to advance provincial climate change mitigation goals. You will provide support for interdepartmental, divisional, and regional projects and may be asked to represent the Province and Department on intra- and inter-provincial committees and at regional, national, and international meetings. You may be called upon to apply for external funding and will be regularly called upon to advise senior executives, provincial, municipal, and federal government departments, communities, and industry.


You will work creatively with partners to effectively monitor and respond to climate change mitigation trends and work to ensure that the policies and programs continue to meet the needs of Nova Scotians. 




Qualifications and Experience




A Bachelor's Degree in Environmental Sciences, Economics, Business, Climatology, Public Policy or other relevant post-secondary concentration plus 6 years related experience is required. An MPA, MBA or law degree will be considered an asset.



Demonstrated knowledge and experience in research, planning, project management, critical thinking and analysis are required. This includes:
Demonstrated experience in climate change mitigation and/or energy policy.
A strong understanding of how regulations, policies, and programs may affect industry, businesses, NGO's, and communities;
Demonstrated experience in economic analysis and/or data analysis;
Demonstrated experience working on complex/high-profile programs and projects;
Demonstrated experience in program development and evaluation;
Demonstrated experience with stakeholder engagement and partnership building; and
Demonstrated experience negotiating agreements and approaches with government and non-government partners.


 
In addition to the above requirements, the following experience will be considered an asset:



Knowledge of current provincial, national, and international climate change mitigation policies, programs and plans as well as a strong understanding of how the initiatives impact the people, communities, and businesses of the province.
Demonstrated experience developing legislation and regulations.
Demonstrated experience in the field of carbon pricing.
The ability to apply theory and best practice to identify creative, practical, and defensible approaches to overcoming challenges
The willingness and ability to share data, ideas and experiences with colleagues that may assist with policy planning or partnership building.


 
Excellent verbal and written communication and persuasion skills are required. As the successful candidate, you must be committed to promotion of diversity and equity in workplace.
We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.




 Equivalency




An equivalent combination of training, education and experience will be considered. Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.


Equivalencies include, but are not limited to:

Master's degree in Environmental Sciences, Economics, Business, Climatology, Public Policy or other related field plus 4 years related experience is required.





Benefits




Based on the employment status and union agreement, the Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offerings and eligibility criteria.




 Working Conditions




Some travel may be required but most of the work can be completed remotely.




 Additional Information




This competition may be used to fill additional potential vacancies.




 What We Offer





Career Development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.
Engaging workplace. Our Employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in. We have forward-thinking policies and strategies.
Countless Career Paths.
Department Specific Flexible working schedules.






Pay Grade: PR 17
Salary Range: $2,913.59 - $3,421.98 Bi-Weekly

Title: Business Analyst, Solutions Design
Description:
Address: 55 Bloor Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Technology 
 

very strong verbal communication skills on top of superb written skills 


focused on the gathering of functional business requirements that will support the technical development 


high documentation focus ie. keeping notes for all the sessions, leading conversations, go into depth for analyzing current states and demonstrating future state with flow charts, graphs, and other visuals 


critical thinking and quick learner 


fast paced environment 


strong networking skills and relationship management 


strong influential skills 


Serves as an advisor and partner on behalf of Procurement Center of Excellence, Solution Design and Strategy team when engaging with the line of business/group to define and document technology requirements. Provides subject matter expertise for all IT systems related initiatives. Manages initiatives, supports and delivers on operational goals. 

As a Business Analyst, elicits and documents business requirement and functional requirements which will support technical development. 
Takes clear notes and summaries of discussions and is able to relay back information in a clear and concise manner. 
Recommends design elements for projects and programs based on analysis of issues and implications for the business with a long term sustainable view in mind. 
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. 
Provides support for analysis, forecasting and/or data visualization, ensuring adherence with data governance standards 
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives. 
Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs. 
Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder technology needs. 
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of technology solutions. 
Supports team in business, technical and/or training documentation as required for production support and maintenance/release activities. 
Provides expertise to establish key business initiatives/priorities to support & sustain the strategic direction. 
Supports the IT transformation agenda and ensures business & technology needs align. 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. 
Tracks metrics and milestones, makes recommendations for resolution and escalates as appropriate when issues arise. 
Supports team in tracking major deployment dates and calendar of activities. 
May network with industry contacts to gather and identify competitive insights and best practices. 
Executes work to with a high level of accuracy to deliver timely, and efficient service while managing multiple initiatives 
Focus is primarily on business/groups within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given parameters. 
Uses various visualization tools including Visio & PowerPoint to support business and technical requirements. 
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unprecedented situations. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. 

Qualifications: 

Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant BA and documentation experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. 
Documentation and process & workflow design skills – in depth. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 
Previous experience in implementing SaaS solutions 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Data Protection Analyst – COO – York (FTC 12-18months)
Description:
Data Protection Analyst – COO – York
 


   The Role
 


   We are looking for a Data Protection Analyst who can provide critical support for our central Data Privacy Office in the operation and oversight of the Data Privacy framework, standards, processes, and controls. As Data Protection Analyst you will directly support the DPO and all business areas with their obligations to comply with Data Protection regulation, including the GDPR.
 


   Your main responsibility will be day to day monitoring of Data Loss alerts triggered by our security controls. You will also support training and awareness activities which helps to maintain a culture of Data Protection awareness for all employees. In addition to this you will be responsible for monthly reporting and MI, to support decision making and track compliance with all aspects of applicable data protection regulation.
 


   Responsibilities
 



     Support the Data Privacy Manager on Data Protection matters across all of our UK/Non-UK business areas.
   


     Maintain central logs and mailbox to ensure effective tracking and management of queries, issues, rights requests, and Privacy Impact Assessments.
   


     Monitor daily ‘alerts’ triggered by the Data Loss Prevention tool.
   


     Act as secretary for the Data Privacy Working Group and other meetings as needed, booking meetings, preparing packs, and managing minutes and actions as necessary.
   


     Collect, analyse, and report on information required for effective oversight and monitoring of data protection metrics.
   


     Support the development and delivery of DP training and awareness activities.
   


     Maintain an effective SharePoint site for sharing and communicating important information.
   



   The Team
 

   You will be part of a small team that reports directly into the Data Protection Officer. The team works closely with our Data Governance team and Data Privacy Champions in each business area. The team is in London and York, and you will occasionally need to travel between our York, Norwich and London offices.
 


   Requirements
 



     Experience in regulatory, operational and conduct risk, preferably in a financial services environment
   


     Facilitation of committees/meetings and experience of production of MI Packs and dashboards.
   


     Experience in working in an analytical or risk-based role is desirable
   


     Interest in, or demonstrable understanding of, relevant data protection regulations (GDPR)
   


     Proactive and able to work independently, with guidance where needed, to deadlines
   


     Strong working knowledge of MS Office Word, Excel, Power Point.
   


     Strong communication skills, written and verbal
   


     Good relationship management
   



   Working at Aviva Investors
 

   Aviva Investors is a global asset manager with broad and deep expertise across all major asset classes. As part of the Aviva Group – the UK’s largest insurance company – we are uniquely positioned to combine our insurance heritage with our investment capabilities to deliver the outcomes that matter most to today’s investor.
 


   More than 1,500 people work across the globe, bringing it all together for today’s investor. When everyone feels part of a unified team, in an environment of fairness, inclusion and positivity, we all achieve more. We care deeply about this, which is why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
 


   At Aviva, we’re people with a purpose. To be with you today, for a better tomorrow. We bring this to life by ensuring managing risk is at the heart of how we all work. We love people who do the right thing for our customers, and our colleagues. We want people who speak up, who take responsibility, and who make good decisions.
 


   The way we do this is important too. We’re all about our people – that’s you – so we can be flexible. In fact, we don’t advertise roles as either part or full time, because we know each person has different needs, just as each business area's needs vary. So, it’s up to you to discuss working hours during your interview.
 


   We interview every disabled applicant* that meets the minimum criteria for the job. Just send us an email once you’ve applied stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we’ll make sure we interview you.
 


   You will be assessed against the Aviva values: care more, kill complexity, never rest and create legacy.
 


   We’d love it if you could submit your application online. If you require an alternative method of applying, please send an email to 
  
   GlobalRecruitment@avivainvestors.com
  



 *As defined in The Equality Act 2010*. By ‘minimum criteria’ we mean you should provide us with evidence which demonstrates that you generally meet the level of competence required and have the qualifications, skills or experience defined as essential to perform the role.

Title: Pharmacy Supply Analyst
Description:
Our high profile client from the pharmaceutical sector is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to support them with a number of key initiatives. This role will start out on a 3-months contract with potential extension. 
Reporting directly to the National Director for Innovation, your responsibilities will include: 



Maintaining provincial pricing changes in multiple locations and distribution systems
Work with National Accounting staff to maintain cost database, and national distribution reports
Prepare reports on revenue and revenue potential

Preparing quarterly and annual program performance reports and KPI’s
There is some data entry

In addition to the above, the following skills are also desired: 



Advanced Excel skills,
SQL and Access experience are highly beneficial
Detail-oriented
You are proficient at analysis and reverse engineering analysis
Prior work experience from working in large, complex retail environment

Title: Sr. BI Performance Analyst (Sr. Reporting Specialist)
Description:
Our Performance Management Office is seeking a Senior Reporting Specialist (Senior BI Performance Analyst). In this role, you will be responsible for the end-to-end process for performance reporting, including gathering business requirements, determining KPIs for various business units, data collection, data cleansing, data integration, and preparing performance dashboards. Reporting to the Manager, Business Performance and Reporting, you will leverage business intelligence tools to measure operational and business performance and to enable data-driven decision making for the Operations (Rapid Transit) Division. 
What will I be doing? 

Establish and maintain KPIs and supporting metrics to be used across Operations (RT) to track performance 
Develop reporting requirements with business unit subject matter experts and utilize a standardized approach to performance reporting 
Communicate with Operations (RT) service providers and internal stakeholders to gather performance reporting data and share updates relevant to performance reporting and its processes. 
Support the use of Enterprise Asset Management Information Systems, financial and other operational systems; develop reporting dashboards to inform performance of the Division; and enable fast, easy, meaningful operational and business insights 
Support the implementation and continuous improvement various business unit systems 
Develop and maintain a comprehensive Performance Management Framework for the Operations (RT) Division, including development of dashboards to monitor and analyze performance trends 
Maintain quality control across all reporting and contribute to the continuous improvement of service quality and standard operating procedures 
Analyze, measure, and report on Operations (RT) goals and objectives, engineering and asset management performance, financial performance, and other essential KPIs and metrics. 
Develop periodic and ad hoc performance reporting packages, including scorecards and dashboards to provide insights into Operations (RT) performance. 
Develop an overall performance package for the Chief Operating Officer (COO) to provide Metrolinx executives with an overview of the Operations (RT) Division’s performance. 
Contribute to evidence-based decision-making to maximize the performance of Operations (RT). 
Contribute to the annual fiscal planning process, and track and evaluate the effectiveness of portfolio/asset management strategic plans. 
Analyze data from different sources (including external agencies/organizations and environmental/industry scans) to identify our challenges and opportunities. 
Use portfolio performance measurement results and operational system data (including ARM, Infor EAM, Oracle, Hyperion and P6) to support Operations (RT) decision making and to identify potential risks and opportunities.

Title: Senior HR Forecaster/Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We acknowledge that Providence Health Care & the new St. Paul’s Hospital site is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.
The Opportunity: Providence Health Care’s HR Systems & Reporting team is currently looking for a Senior HR Forecaster/Business Intelligence Analyst.
What does the HR Systems & Reporting team do?
This team oversees the analysis of Human Resource data in order to identify trends in the workforce and opportunities for the organization to improve our processes. This team also ensures integrity of the HR Systems data, and supports accurate reporting for analysis and presentation.
What you will do: Working alongside Juveth Loresco (Manager, Workforce Planning & Data Analytics) you will be responsible for leading planning, design, and optimization of People Services (HR) and Workforce Scheduling business application solutions including data warehouse development and/or enhancement of the data warehouse architecture to support departmental business needs in a sustainable and scalable manner. Some specifics include:

Working closely with Clinical and Operational Leaders, People Services teams such as Workforce Scheduling and other organizational stakeholders to determine business requirements and analyze their metrics.
Conducting statistical analysis, produces business models and forecasts, and develops and maintains performance indicators, comprehensive reports and tools using current business analytical methods and software.
Recommending and participating in the implementation of interventions to optimize workforce utilization and talent acquisition planning both on a short-term and long-term basis to ensure Providence Health Care has the right staff, in the right place and the right time.
Providing input into the development and implementation of policies and procedures for data stewardship and data governance.

About you: 

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field.
Five (5) years of recent, related experience in data warehousing, significant experience using Microsoft BI Suite (SSMS, SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS), forecasting and analytics
Ability to understand business requirements and translate requirements into technical specifications.
Ability to foster collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

The following skills/experience would be considered an asset:

Experience with HR and health care data.
Software development experience.
Experience working with Tableau or other data visualization software.

About us: 
Driven by compassion and social justice, we are at the forefront of exceptional care and innovation. Our organization, Providence Health Care, is a proud winner of three prestigious awards:

2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employers
2021 BC’s Top Employers
2021 Canada’s Top Employers for Young People

What we offer: 

The salary range for this role is $77,822 - $111,869 per year, depending on experience.
A comprehensive health benefit package, including dental, vision, and life coverage.
An orientation session and comprehensive onboarding to all new hires.
A chance to grow professionally and personally, as part of a supportive team driven by innovation and the desire to address the future health needs of patients, families and our communities.

We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent. If your experience is close to the qualifications listed here, please still consider applying.
Providence Health Care is committed to creating an equitable and inclusive workplace for all employees. We strongly believe in an environment where everyone feels valued and respected, which is reflected in our motto “how you want to be treated.” We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, and encourage applications from underrepresented communities, including (but not limited to) BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+, immigrants, and people with disabilities.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $77,822.00-$111,869.00 per year
Benefits:

Company pension
Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision care
Wellness program
Work from home

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Title: Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy & Analytics
Description:
Requisition ID: 143018  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We have redefined what digital banking is and we continue to evolve on what it can be, using technology to create innovative, forward thinking banking solutions with our clients’ needs in mind.
 We are made up of high performing, curious, energetic and collaborative individuals who thrive in our high trust agile environment to deliver best in class solutions for our customers. We believe in giving people hands-on challenges and the responsibilities that come with them, allowing them to grow, evolve and create opportunities to build their career.
 Are you ready to make the change and become part of an established disruptor with the backing of a highly engaged team? If so come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 Department Summary:

 The Tangerine FIU (“FIU”) is responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining the Tangerine Anti-Money Laundering/ Anti-Terrorist Financing Program. Tangerine Bank is subject to, and must comply with many Regulations promulgated by governments, regulators and self-regulating bodies. The Department is responsible for ensuring that Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations as well as head office minimum standards. The Department is also responsible for ensuring adherence to sanctions regulations.

 Role Purpose:

 The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy and Analytics reports to the Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics. The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy & Analytics is responsible for defining, investigating, and developing solutions to support the systems used in the Tangerine FIU (including but not limited to the Transaction Monitoring, Name Screening and Case Management systems). Additionally, the role will be leading and participating in initiatives to identify and action opportunities for local improvements to productivity, decision effectiveness, and the user experience.
 The Senior Business Analyst will work closely with IT, Business Intelligence, AML Operations/FIU, and the Tangerine AML to ensure successful delivery of objectives.

 Role Accountabilities:
 Responsibilities to support strategic and tactical deliverables


 Support the ongoing and periodic evaluation of existing and new FIU Systems tools and solutions to address changing business needs and emerging threats.
 Perform ongoing development and management of FIU systems, rules and deployed solutions.
 Perform the monitoring and maintenance of FIU strategies to address evolving trends.
 Institute and manage a disciplined change process for regular testing and deployment of FIU rules.
 Perform analytics and reporting to generate an accurate and insightful perspective on rule effectiveness, detection rates, false positive rates and volume.
 Drive robust processes to enhance FIU Systems performance.
 Maintain thorough understanding of FIU Systems capabilities, gaps and opportunities.
 Provide analytic support in the development and implementation of FIU strategic plans.
 Ensure accuracy and effectiveness of FIU systems and drive periodic enhancements as needed.
 Execute a variety of technical testing including Business Acceptance Testing and User Acceptance Testing
 Assist the team in proposing, creating and presenting communications to management, stakeholders, and other departments on changes introduced as a result of new initiatives
 Maintain a thorough understanding of AML/ATF and sanctions system capabilities, gaps and opportunities
 Other duties as assigned


 Tangerine FIU Project Responsibilities:


 Support the Manager, FIU Strategy and Analytics to manage requirements-related activities and deliverables throughout the project life cycle (e.g. change requests, issues, risks, schedules, status reporting etc.)
 Conduct data mining and analyses to generate insights and intelligence to support initiatives and commitments
 Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, use cases, scenarios, business analysis and workflow analysis
 Write requirements / specifications using standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely
 Assist in the development of Test Plans and documentation to support testing
 Identify, anticipate, assess, manage and resolve issues and risks related to requirements' activities and deliverables
 Assess project issues and identify solutions to meet productivity, quality and goals
 Participate in regular status meetings with all stakeholders, to review project deliverables and deadlines, keeping the stakeholder’s needs and requirements continuously in view
 Produce high quality artifacts through effective business analysis, process mapping, and requirements generation


 Minimum Qualifications:

 Education/Experience

 University or College Degree or equivalent work experience
 Minimum 3-5 years of work-related experience within the Financial Services industry
 Minimum 2-year experience in Compliance and AML/ATF
 Experience in consumer banking products (credit, deposit and cards)

 Professional Certification

 ACAMs certification is considered an asset
 International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) certification is considered an asset

 Specialized Knowledge

 Knowledge of Compliance and AML/ATF systems and troubleshooting experience


 Technical Skills

 Strong and proven analytical skills
 Strong working knowledge of data mining tools
 Strong working knowledge of programing languages (Visual Basic, SQL)
 Strong technical solution management experience and skills
 Demonstrated experience using the MS Office Suite, in particular MS- Excel, MS- Word and MS-Visio
 Strong business analysis skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
 Experience with statistical modeling and data science methods
 Experience in business intelligence and analytics platforms 

Abilities

 Ability to work autonomously under tight timelines
 Ability to work in a dynamic environment where processes and procedures are consistently refined
 Strong presentation, facilitation, analysis and problem solving skills
 Strong capability to work with senior business leaders
 Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously 

Attributes

 Strong verbal, written and communication skills
 Strong attention to detail and organizational skills


 Working Conditions:
 The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy and Analytics will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from regular evening and weekend work, overtime, shift work, working outdoors and/or working with challenging clients.

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Food Industry IT BI Manager-Oracle,T-SQL,MySQL,PowerBI,Tableau,Snowflake
Description:
Manager - Business Intelligence
Location: Markham, ON (Hybrid)
Salary: CAD $140K + 10% Bonus + 3 weeks vacation plan
2-3 rounds of virtual interview (Teams meeting)
30-45 minutes of interview each round
Pet Food Retail and Ecommerce background mandatory
Mandatory Skills: Retail Background, Oracle, T-SQL, MySQL, PowerBI, Tableau, Snowflake, leadership experience, development experience
Job Description: 
What is the role?
· A hands-on Manager, Business Intelligence who thrives in a dynamic work environment. This role involves working across the entire BI lifecycle, from source data analysis, Extract Transform Load (ETL) development, through to Analysis and Reporting implementation.
· This role is accountable for the build out of Data Lakes and the implementation of tools needed to enable data discovery, predictive analytics and other features. This role will design, develop, implement and support solutions that empowers the business with timely, actionable information. The BI Manager needs to be a self-starter, thorough in their work, and able to build a high competency team. Additionally, the BI Manager acts as mentor on best practices both for the development team and for the business in their acceptance of the new BI solution, helping them become more mature in terms of the understanding and correct utilization of their own data assets.
What will you do?
· Provide Business Intelligence solutions including analytics, dashboards and reports to support PRB in making informed decisions that increase the bottom line through improved quality and services
· Design, develop, deploy and tune deploy Tableau Extracts, Workbooks SQL Server, Oracle and Snowflake based ETL processes as required. Create appropriate processes and procedures to ensure proactive data quality monitoring
· Perform system design and specification development, program logic and flow-charting, application security, testing and debugging with full awareness of cost/benefit, risk and performance.
· Participates in client interactions, possibly with more senior team members, to develop BI solutions to business needs 24/7 Application support
· Mentoring and pairing with other development team members
What will you need to succeed?
Education and Experience
· At least 10 years of professional software development experience
· 6 years in team leading
· Bachelors or masters in computer science or equivalent preferred
· Ability to lead, direct and manage team members
· Experience building and maintaining continuous delivery environments
· Experience with Agile software development methodologies, source control, and automated testing and deployment
· Experience deploying and managing in-house/cloud-hosted application services
· Experience with large scale systems involving reporting, transactional systems and integration with other enterprise systems (i.e. Mainframe).
· Experience with multiple Source/Version control systems and understanding of code merging concepts.
· Have in-depth knowledge of management goals and visions and work in line with team members to achieve them
· Working with high performing technology teams
· Experience with retail point-of-sale applications is a plus
· Collaborate with the Business Analysts in requirements gathering, prototyping and requirements validation. Analyze and verify technical requirements for completeness, consistency, feasibility, and testability.
· Experience with ITIL framework and application of best industry practices

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Armour Group Inc. 
Armour Group Inc., established in 1996 and headquartered in London, Ontario, markets and administers multiple lines of products in the automobile, recreational, heating and cooling and lending marketplaces. We focus on building relationships not only with our clients but also with the customers our clients serve.
The Armour Group Inc. is looking for a full-time Business Data Analyst to join their team in the London, ON office. Remuneration commensurate with experience.
Position Overview
With the Armour Group’s commitment to create and manage innovative products and processes, the Business Data Analyst will be responsible for managing and developing all our data analyses, data collecting systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The successful candidate will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.
Here’s what you will deliver
· Interpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing reports on product and program performances
· Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets
· Work closely with the senior management to understand and maintain focus on analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs
· Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity
· Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources
· Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible and scalable across data sets
· Analyze local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry
· Remove corrupted data and identify errors and related problems
· Work with management on adhoc projects to prioritize business and information needs
Here’s what you bring to the table
· 2 - 3 years’ experience in mining data as a data analyst
· Bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics an asset
· Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization
· Proficient in Microsoft Office products, databases and working knowledge in SQL
· Experience working in data visualization software like Power BI or Tableau
· Highly organized, detail oriented, and able to thrive in a fast paced, changing environment
· Demonstrate effective verbal, listening, and written communication skills
· Attention to detail and ability to maintain a high level of accuracy
· Excellent time management skills, ability to multitask and work well under pressure
What’s in it for you
· Excellent management support and guidance
· Access to health, dental and vision insurance
· Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for you and your family’s wellness

Title: Data & System Analyst, Bus Safety
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our Bus Operations Office is seeking a Data & System Analyst on a minimum of 12-month contract to coordinate the planning and analytical functions as well as assist in the overall recommendations and directions to improve the safety performance of the Bus Operations Group. 
What will I be doing? 

Identification of repetitive data trends and bringing forward proposals to improve areas. 
Support in the development of the monthly and annual KPI’s and provide progress reports. 
Tracking Customer Complaints based on service changes and driver performance behavior, identifying trends and possible mitigations to improve customer satisfaction 
Based on trends in data, providing supporting information and evidence to the Safety & Training Department to help reduce common accidents and trends. 
Review CVOR score and identify accident trends and violations. Provide corrective actions based on trends and perform regular follow-ups to ensure actions are being achieved and appropriate mitigations were proposed. 
Participating in Incident/accident Investigation and providing recommendations to prevent future occurrences. 
Conducting and/or directing various data analysis and cost/benefit studies of Bus Operations, including interpreting results and outlining trends, as well as developing and recommending alternatives to improve deficiencies and enhance operational efficiencies. 
Developing, documenting, recommending, implementing, monitoring and evaluating new and/or revised operating and administrative rules, standards and procedures for the department; ensuring that such rules and procedures do not negatively impact safety. 
Preparing and monitoring performance measures for various aspects of the business to ensure safety, efficiency and quality of services provided. 
Regular contact with all levels of employees and management staff to provide information, support and recommendations regarding operational and administrative issues, rules, procedures, standards, budgets, etc. 
Delegate tasks and responsibilities to stakeholders to provide directional guidance and actively leads and participates in various meetings, and represents Metrolinx at committees, presentations. 
Interfaces with external public agencies, associations and affiliated groups, to stay apprised of industry trends, regulations, and technologies. 
Coordinates with the Safety Department to ensure the KPI’s are aligned with Corporate Goals and brings forward solutions to negative trends. 
Investigates all new CVOR points identified on the CVOR Record on a monthly basis. 
Coordinates with a variety of internal stakeholders and software developers to establish objectives and performance indicators and develop safety goals, objectives, CVOR safety initiatives, action plans, and archiving needs. 
Work closely with the Safety Department to ensure alignment in all safe practices are adhered and also create recommendations in areas that may require improvements related to safety performance. 
Investigates or provides close-out of investigations performed by external contractors, coordination or facilitates higher level investigations. 
Maintaining quality control and engaging in the continuous improvement of service quality and standard operating procedures. 
Develops and tracks monthly and yearly KPI’s bringing attention to areas that need immediate corrective actions and works with team members to implement and manage actions. 
Manages the oversight of all Bus Operations KPI’s directly related to driver, supervisors, CVOR and Safety related stats, amongst others. 
Performs audits against KPI’s and attends actual visits to locations that have been identified as high risk areas to ensure compliance of safety procedures and assists with the implementation of recommended changes. 
Presents completed KPI reports to various levels of Staffs and serves as the subject matter expert relating to various trends in injuries, collisions, CVOR direction, and provided remedial actions based on findings. 
Provides feedback of findings to Mangers with recommendations to address driving performance issues. 
Implement initiatives to drive operational efficiency and reduce costs.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
You found us. Awesome. Something led you here, maybe a glimpse of potential and something amazing? Well that’s how we feel about Klue.
 


 Everyone has competitors, yet few know them well. Cue Klue. We are a team relentlessly focused on creating industry leading software to enable every department of every business to leverage the best of the web’s knowledge and the collective insights of their own people.
 


 We are a high-growth company with:
 

An experienced leadership team at the helm
Risk-takers and builders who own it and get IT done
Combined group, who love the fact that not everything is defined, so we can innovate, create, ignite



 Joining Klue, you’ll have the opportunity to own your zone, experiment and find what works. Then execute with the support of a team propelling you forward. We’re all creating this industry leading product. It's an experience that will no doubt change your career forever.
 


 We’re growing and currently looking to add a Data Analyst Intern to our team. This internship will span several functions of the Insights department and will give you a broad view of what it takes to run an innovative SaaS company. Klue is a very collaborative company where we believe in the value that can be unlocked by sharing data insights across departments and clients - you'll be getting a full picture of how a SaaS company on a rocketship trajectory operates. You’ll have many opportunities to listen in on strategic conversations and will be encouraged to ask questions along the way. As the company grows, we will have many roles to fill within the Insights department and would hope the right candidate would consider returning one day.
 


 As a data analyst intern, you will be focused on helping our insights team ensure our data providers and outsourced content creators are delivering accurate data to their end-users.
 


 The Insights' team scope covers data validation for existing sources, outsourced content, and new potential data sources. As the data marketplace is always evolving, you will also be involved in broader projects across the team.
 
 This is You:

 Highly analytical and critical thinker
 Ability to digest and communicate complex data
 You like ambiguity and thrive in fast-paced environments
 You have experience with Excel and/or Python
 You like to learn new things and are keen to become an expert

 Bonus points for...

 Experience with analytics platforms, data cleaning initiatives, data gathering.

 What you'll be measured on:

 Ability to identify trends in data sets and develop unique solutions.
 Efficiency in data gathering and data cleaning.


   If you’re hooked and feeling more curious about us, or the role - reach out. Let’s see if there is a great home here with you, now or in the future.
  




  We’re an award winning company, recently named one of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone HC, included on Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 list, and winning Tech Culture of the Year at the Technology Impact Awards. We think there is something pretty special going on here. Don’t miss your chance to have a seat on the rocketship before it takes off.
 


 As #kluecrew grows, we’ve made a commitment to support and contribute to a diverse environment; on our teams and in our community. While we’ll admit we haven’t figured it all out and realize this is a long journey for us all. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have dedicated that commitment to our current and future #kluecrew. During the interview process, please let us know if there is anything we need to make more accessible or accommodate to support you to be successful.
 


 All interviews will be conducted via video calls. We will continue, while safe to work in a hybrid model of WFH (remote) and in-office. We are excited to work together again in a space, but just as excited to have great people across timezones help us strive for that high quality asynchronous team communication.
 


 We’re excited to meet you and in the meantime, get to know us:
 

   ED&I Initiatives & Commitments - Pay Up For Progress & 50 - 30 Challenge & Klue Blog
 

   ️ Series A (2020)
 

   Series B (2021)
 

   Culture, culture, culture! 
 

  Glassdoor
 

   About Us
 

   Twitter
 

   Instagram
 

️ LinkedIn


   Angel.co

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing & Publishing Analytics
Description:
Company Description
  Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.



 Job Description
  Marketing & Publishing Analytics is a global team based in San Francisco, Montreal, and Paris. Our goal is to deliver strategic analytics and insights to our stakeholders and support them with key decisions across the lifecycle of our games. Our stakeholders include Executive Publishing (Brand Management, Game Development), Marketing (CRM, Media, Social, Influencer Marketing, PR, Customer Experience & Support), and Finance & Strategic Planning.
 We are seeking a Data Analyst who will lead strategic analytics projects to support optimization of our marketing and publishing initiatives. This role will require you to innovate and develop new ways of analyzing the many dimensions of our games, our players, and our prospects. This includes the design and management of analytics solutions, analysis of performance, and development of insights.
 What you’ll do

 Collaborate closely with the stakeholder teams to understand their brand and marketing objectives and plans
 Lead deep-dive analysis projects to answer specific business questions and inform decisions for each stage in game lifecycles (pre-launch, launch, live game, promotions, etc.)
 Create measurement plans, identify success metrics, establish benchmarking methodologies, and set targets
 Measure impact and ROI of publishing and marketing initiatives on brand health, player engagement, and revenue using A/B testing, brand lift, and causal inference models
 Analyze historical trends and develop strategic insights to inform planning of future campaigns and marketing initiatives
 Analyze in-game player behavior and use cohort analysis to monitor segment level performance trends over time
 Work with stakeholders and partners to establish best practices based on your findings
 Create, manage, and distribute data and insights utilizing analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Python, R, Excel, PowerPoint)
 Write complex SQL queries or Python scripts to extract data from Snowflake to support ad-hoc and recurring analyses
 Build Tableau dashboards to support analytics and deep dive projects
 Lead or participate in presentations, gather feedback, and follow up with changes




 Qualifications
  What you’ll bring

 Technical or quantitative background in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering
 Entry level professional experience in marketing/business/customer analytics
 Proven track record working with SQL, Excel, and either Python or R
 Proven track record working with Tableau, Datorama or comparable visualization tools
 Proven quantitative and analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop and present actionable recommendations; experience with statistics and modelling techniques
 Knowledge of digital marketing, including one or more of the following: o Multi-channel attribution analyses or Media Mix Modeling o Digital marketing platforms – Salesforce, DV360, DCM o Ad platforms such as Facebook, YouTube AdWords, etc. o Web Analytics platforms (Adobe Analytics)

 Additional Information
  What to send our way

 Your CV, your expertise and/or related experience and skills.

 Just a heads up: If you require a work permit, your eligibility may depend on your education and years of relevant work experience, as required by the government.
 Additional information Skills and competencies show up in different forms and can be based on different experiences, that's why we strongly encourage you to apply even though you may not have all the requirements listed above.  At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Description:
