(This position is initially open to full time, bargaining unit employees of the college)  Centennial College recognizes and affirms Diversity, Equity and Inclusion and Indigenous ways of knowing as central to the vibrancy and uniqueness of its learning and working academic mission. We strongly encourage applications from members of Indigenous communities and all equity-deserving groups including Women, Racialized, Persons with Disabilities, and LGBTQ+ communities.
We also recognize that Centennial is situated on the Treaty Lands of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and pay tribute to their legacy as well as that of all First Peoples that have been and remain present here in Toronto. We recognize that First Peoples come from sovereign Nations and that part of understanding our responsibilities of residing on this territory are understanding the true history, circumstances and legacy of the Treaties signed here (such as the Toronto Purchase, Robinson-Huron Treaty and Williams Treaties) and including pre-contact Treaties and Agreements between sovereign Nations and that all peoples in this area are therefore Treaty people with obligations and responsibilities to all our relations.
Position Summary Bring your advanced data analytics, qualitative and quantitative research skills to Centennial College’s Institutional Effectiveness team. You will play an integral role in various institutional research projects across the institution. In this role, you will work independently to perform data analysis and use applied research methodologies to support stakeholders with institutional planning, operational enhancements, ad-hoc evaluations and other key decision-making processes.
You will collaborate on a diverse team of staff, students, faculty and stakeholders to better understand the needs across the college, using market research and data collection to study trends and identify challenges and areas of opportunities.

Responsibilities


Work on covering a range of qualitative and quantitative research methods including empathy interviews, concept tests, surveys and other research techniques.
Work cross-functionally with various other departments to prioritize, plan, and deliver on research initiatives.
Design and execute research projects, including development of appropriate research designs, strategies for data collection, analysis and interpretation
Coordinate with Senior Analyst(s) and Data Scientist(s) in the field of Machine learning, Artificial Intelligence, statistical and simulation modelling, design, development and enhancement as it is applied to complex use cases in higher education
Implement a variety of mathematical or algorithmic models and other analytical products, including the vetting of underlying data to ensure integrity
Develop analytical solutions and make recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs
Advise and guide assigned business/groups on implementation of analytical solutions
Develop agreed analytical solution by applying suitable statistical & machine learning techniques (e.g., A/B testing, prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to test, verify, refine hypotheses
Work with stakeholders to identify the business requirements, understand distinct problems and expected outcomes, and models and frames business scenarios which impact critical business processes and/or decisions
Performs comprehensive analysis and projections for forecasting and trend review
Summarize statistical findings and draws conclusions, presents actionable business recommendations
Drive innovation through the development of Data & AI products that can be leveraged across the organization and establish best practices in in alignment with Data & AI governance frameworks of Centennial
Develop and manage raw data from paper-based and online surveys/questionnaires to ensures data accuracy and integrity
Performs other related duties as assigned



Qualifications/Experience


Post-graduate Master’s degree or equivalent in disciplines such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Social Sciences, or Business Administration and/or a Post-Graduate certificate in Research Analysis combined with formalized work and study
Five (5) years proven technical expertise in research methods, questionnaire development and inferential statistical analysis
Demonstrated ability to manipulate and manage large datasets and databases using Microsoft Access, Excel or Oracle
Experience in an educational institution or non-profit organization an asset
Advanced skill with statistical software applications such as Python, R, SPSS, SAS and/or STATA; quantitative and qualitative survey design training
Superior communication (oral, written and presentation) and relationship management skills
Proficient with word processing software including: Microsoft Word, networked computer systems (e.g., Banner/AIS, Windows, Microsoft Office, Crystal, Oracle, Cognos, Internet, College Websites)
Strong understanding and commitment to working within a highly diverse and inclusive work environment
High attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work under pressure managing and capable of leading multiple projects in a highly diverse, agile and deadline-oriented environment
Self-directed with high initiative and ability to work independently


Apply online: www.centennialcollege.ca/careers
Proof of credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post secondary institutions and/or their foreign equivalents will be required at the time of job offer.
When applying, your cover letter and résumé must include examples that reflect all of the requested skills and qualifications and must be submitted online by June 28, 2022 at 11:59 PM EST. Please quote Job ID J0622-0609. Misrepresentation of applicant information will be grounds for your exclusion from the competition or for dismissal should you subsequently be hired for the position. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
We are committed to providing persons with disabilities equal opportunities regarding all employment activities, including access to jobs and accommodations during employment as required, in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC) and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst
 Location: Vancouver, BC or Remote


 About Us
 Exact Payments is a leading provider of high-performance payment services to bank partners, software platforms, and omnichannel merchants. Exact delivers a highly scaled payments platform integrated with leading processors in the US and Canada including Fiserv/First Data, Elavon, TSYS, Chase Canada, and Moneris.


 Founded in 1999, Exact is a proven player in the eCommerce payments market with deep expertise in building and supporting payment platforms for large banks, ISVs, and its own direct client portfolio. Our cloud-based technology is fully redundant and offers comprehensive integration options including Rest APIs, PCI-compliant hosted payment pages, and virtual terminal interfaces. The technology stack is built for scale delivering the highest level of performance and reliability at transaction volumes exceeding 1 billion annually.
 Exact is a private equity-backed company headquartered in Scottsdale, Arizona, and Vancouver, British Columbia.

 Your Role
 We are recruiting a Data Analyst to join our Product Support team. Reporting to our Vice President, Product Support, this person will be responsible for developing data analysis tools designed to identify issues across our infrastructure of high-volume transaction processing servers and applications. The Data Analyst will leverage Kibana and Elastic Stack to build a suite of log queries and data visualizations which will be used by our Support team to rapidly identify processing or integration issues and advise clients on resolution strategies.
 This position will be located in our Vancouver, British Columbia office.


 What You Will Be Doing

Develop expert technical knowledge of our payments infrastructure including gateway processing engines, application services, MySQL and Amazon Aurora databases, and Elastic Stack.
Design and build a suite of data analysis tools using Elastic Stack and Kibana
Build Product Support dashboards using Kibana and data visualizations using Telemetry TV
Take lead on database and transaction log query responsibilities for the Product Support team as well as other groups performing system research and resolution including: DevOps, QA, and Software Development.
Collaborate with Software Development on level 3 technical issues or client integration problems using log queries and transactional data to isolate the root cause
Train Product Support team on Query tools, Dashboards, and Data Visualization services
Participate in Product design sessions leveraging data insights to inform bug fixes, enhancements, and feature prioritizations
Collaborate with DevOps to leverage tooling and data set to inform infrastructure upgrades and enhancement strategies
Developing trusted relationships with technical counterparts across the team as well as with key customers



 About You



3+ years experience in a Data Analyst role for a technology company. SaaS software, Payments, or eCommerce experience is highly desirable.
Experience and working knowledge of Elastic Stack and/or Kibana
Prior experience supporting payment processing systems and/or eCommerce technologies is desirable
Excellent problem solving and communication skills



Development experience including: PHP, Ruby on Rails, .Net, Python, SOAP Web Services, Linux, Node.JS


Fast learner interested in developing strong command of leading-edge tools including Telemetry TV (data visualization)




Works well in a collaborative environment and loves learning from a group of highly technical peers



Exhibits a technical, logical thought process plus a strong commitment to learning and growing in the Financial Technologies (Fintech) field


Interested in growing and moving within a Company always looking for people to take on the next challenge


Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or relevant field preferred



 What We Offer
 We are a team of passionate professionals working together to ‘propel high-performance digital commerce for our clients and partners’. We value diversity, creativity, innovation, collaboration, integrity, and respect and are looking for people who share these same values to join our growing team. We offer a comprehensive benefits program for our Canadian employees including Extended Healthcare benefits and a Retirement Savings Plan with a company match.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Brandt has a position available for a Data Analyst in our Regina, SK location. The ideal candidate will obtain advanced knowledge in all areas of the Distributed and Manufactured Products Divisions working closely with vendors, developers and business users. Ensure all Software products deployed have appropriate training materials developed. Ensure all business processes conducted using the deployed software are documented including all associated reports, data inputs and outputs. Work with the business and the supplier of the software to ensure that any proposed business process changes are not detrimental to the overall system or other areas of the user community. Be instrumental in testing with business end users and new features and functions as well as any changes prior to deploying in a production environment.
 Duties & Responsibilities

Work with the business end users and business process owners to ensure the systems are performing their intended role at Brandt.
Create, implement, and maintain master data management solutions.
Coordinate master data management efforts across the organization.
Ensure all changes to the systems deployed are documented.
Ensure all business processes are properly documented.
Ensures end user training materials are current and available.
Work collaboratively with all other IT disciplines at Brandt.
Ensure that all work artifacts are properly documented, and documentation is maintained.
Other duties as required.


 Required Skills
 
 Required Experience
 

Minimum of 5 years experience with deployed software or 5 years experience supporting software applications
Experience with Master Data Management tools & techniques
Experience with Business Systems such as CRM, ERP, or SCM
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics CRM is an asset
Working knowledge of requirements gathering, facilitation, testing of software processes
Working knowledge of Microsoft Azure Analytics is an asset
Understanding of relational databases, ELT/ETL tools is an asset
Be able to provide exceptional customer service to the end user community
Previous experience working on or participating in an IT Systems Project is an asset

Title: Data Analyst – Remote
Description:
Help Us Shape the Future of Healthcare



   At League, we’re big on building connections - both through our product and with each other. Our platform is consumer centric, personalized and always on. We’re reimagining the health benefits experience to give people a more consumer-centric way to manage their health: immediate, seamless, and tailored to their unique needs. It’s a front door to healthcare that empowers people to live healthier, happier lives. Every day. 
  


In this role, you will:


Be seen as an expert in measurement and ensure that our marketing efforts are being evaluated holistically across all channels
Collaborate with Engagement and Marketing Leaderships and Marketing Managers to review and interpret data to uncover strategic opportunities and improve efficiency and effectiveness for driving KPIs
Build out various Looker dashboards to understand the impact of different segments / campaigns / channels on various metrics including engagement, retention, and conversion on value-driving actions throughout the funnel and automate recurring views
Own and deliver insights to the B2C marketing organization
Use SQL, Looker, and Segment/Amplitude to conduct ad hoc deep dive analysis on engagement segments and marketing campaigns to deliver performance improvements
Create and iterate on a framework for measuring success of campaigns and experiments that scales for growth
Contribute to monthly performance reviews, quarterly business reviews and other larger analytical projects. Collate and present findings.
Leverage business knowledge, performance data and marketing scenario planning to recommend budget allocations to achieve goals and maximize ROI
Owns the relationship between marketing team and data team including working with the data team to understand the various data assets required to support marketing data requests
Modifies or builds Looker Explores as needed or works with the data team to update the data models that Looker depends on, including translating the marketing team's needs into technical requirements for the data team
Partner with the marketing team to design and evaluate A/B tests and experiments


About you:


4+ years as a hands-on data analyst, with experience in the marketing landscape or supporting marketing requests from an analytics perspective
A strong understanding of marketing and app KPIs, channel metrics, campaign strategy, attribution, engagement, and retention
Experience working with large datasets and extracting insights using SQL
Experience in advanced analytic and statistical techniques related multivariate and A/B testing, performance attribution, customer segmentation, and marketing effectiveness
Experience building dashboards in BI tools such as Looker and Amplitude
Exceptional organizational, problem solving and analytical skills combined with the ability to communicate findings in an insightful and concise manner
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders is a must
Curious about business results and proactive to analyze data and communicate drivers of performance
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapid growth start-up environment



   At League, everyone is welcome. We believe individuals should not be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you are an individual in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at recruitinginfo@league.com.

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Information




Job Requisition ID: 29437
Ministry: Justice & Solicitor Genrl
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-Time: Full Time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Permanent
Scope: Open Competition
Closing Date: June 27, 2022
Classification: Program Services 3 and Program Services 4




 About Us




The Ministry of Alberta Justice and Solicitor General helps ensure that all Albertans can live in safe and resilient communities while having access to a fair and innovative justice system. Working alongside its partners in law enforcement, family justice, health, the judiciary, criminal justice system and other stakeholders, the ministry has a direct or shared responsibility in all elements of the justice system in Alberta. Follow this link find out more about our department


JSG Strategy, Support & Integrated Initiatives (SSII) division provides strategic & integrated support for cross-divisional services and ministry's priority initiatives. Business Intelligence (BI) branch of the SSII is mandated with reporting of operational data, providing evaluation of business transformation initiatives and commitments, and performing complex research and analysis to gather and appraise evidence for strategic decision-making.




 Role




Reporting to the Manager, Courts and Prosecution Reporting within the BI branch, the Data & Reporting Analyst and the Data & Reporting Specialist will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and supporting data products and solutions to meet the requirements for essential decision making by the Court and Justice Services (CJS), the Alberta Crown Prosecution Services (ACPS) operations and the department.


Focusing on report design and visualization coupled with extensive experience in statistics and data analysis, you will show your expertise in transforming data into information. You will also support IT in developing business intelligence systems to store reporting data through your familiarity with business analysis and data warehousing concepts and tools.


These positions also include a research component with ability to dig the right information through effective engagement with business, knowledge of legacy databases and great attention to detail being necessary for success. Innovation is welcomed in these roles, as a keen sense of curiosity is beneficial to try new methods and tools to solve problems using data driven methodology.



     Core accountabilities of the positions include:
     

Developing and updating interactive data products such as dashboards and static reports on a monthly and quarterly basis that support court operations, policy development and evidence-based decision-making.
Conducting in depth statistical analysis responding to divisional and department needs and issues at hand.
Provisioning data, expertise to research, and evaluation units within the branch.
Acting as a liaison between business and IT to support the development and maintenance of reporting systems including data marts and the data warehouse.
Leading documentation of business rules and requirements critical to the development of such systems in collaboration with the business.
Building and executing comprehensive test plans to ensure data in the systems is accurate, reliable and consistent with defined business rules and definitions.
Querying data, aggregating results and developing reports to respond to ad hoc requests.





     Including the above description of the roles, additional responsibilities for the 
     Data & Report Specialist are:
     

Coordinating business analysis and testing related to development of the data warehouse.
Enhancing access to justice through assistance to the platform commitments, including Public Right to Know Act and transformative digitization initiatives, including Justice Digital.






 Qualifications




A cover letter outlining how your experience relates to the qualifications of this role is required. Applications without cover letters will not be considered.


Data & Reporting Analyst – Program Services 3
University degree in a related field (Social Sciences, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics etc.) plus 2 years progressively responsible related experience in analyzing and reporting data producing high-quality data-driven deliverables.



     Equivalency: Directly related education or experience considered on a one for one basis:
     

Related certificate and minimum of 5 years related experience
Related diploma and minimum of 4 years related experience





 Requirements:


Extensive Microsoft Excel experience
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, SAS Visual Analytics, and Tableau etc.
Knowledge of statistical concepts, methodologies and techniques





Assets:


Experience in supporting business analysis and related activities
Proficiency in VBA, R and/or Python




 Data & Reporting Specialist – Program Services 4
University degree in a related field (Social Sciences, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics etc.) plus 4 years progressively responsible related experience in analyzing and reporting data producing high-quality data-driven deliverables.



     Equivalency: Directly related education or experience considered on a one for one basis
     

Related certificate and minimum of 7 years related experience
Related diploma and minimum of 6 years related experience





 Requirements:


Extensive Microsoft Excel experience
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, SAS Visual Analytics, and Tableau etc.
Knowledge of statistical concepts, methodologies and techniques
Proficiency in R, Python, VBA etc.





Assets:


Master’s degree in a relevant field or certifications in business and data analytics courses
Experience leading high value, sophisticated data projects or initiatives.






 APS Competencies




Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.


This link will assist you with understanding competencies:

 AGILITY: You are able to anticipate, assess, and readily adapt to changing priorities, maintain resilience in times of uncertainty and effectively work in a changing environment.
SYSTEMS THINKING: You consistently take a holistic and long-term view of challenges and opportunities at multiple levels across related areas.
DEVELOP NETWORKS: You proactively build networks, connecting and building trust in relationships with different stakeholders.
BUILD COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENTS: You lead and contribute to the conditions and environments that allow people to work collaboratively and productively to achieve outcomes.




 Salary




Program Services 3 $2,556.10 to $3,355.81 bi-weekly ($66,714 to $87,586 annually)

 Program Services 4 $2,683.10 to $3,507.06 bi-weekly ($70,028 to $91,534 annually)




 Notes




There are two full-time, permanent positions available in Edmonton. Flexible work arrangements will be available to both positions.


Hours of Work 36.25 hours a week, Monday to Friday

 Location John E. Brownlee Building, 9th Floor 10365-97 Street

 Final candidates will be required to undergo a security screening.

Title: Data Engineer (Business Analyst)
Description:
POSITION LOCATION: London, ON  


POSITION TITLE: Data Engineer  


POSITION REPORTS TO: Practice Director, Enterprise Analyses

 DEPARTMENT/UNIT NAME: Enterprise Analyses

 JOB SUMMARY:

 The Data Engineer will build and operationalize data necessary for enterprise data and analytics initiatives. This role will build, manage and optimize data architecture and pipelines in accordance with industry standard practices and using industry standard tools, and will move these data pipelines effectively into production for data and analytics use cases across the organization. The incumbent will ensure compliance with data governance and data security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing these integrated and reusable data pipelines and analytical models that will support and promote self-service analytics. Will occasionally provide support to end users on the use of data visualization solutions. Responsible for maintaining and making recommendations to enhance technology as the needs of our client’s change.

 ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:


 Data and Analytics


 Design, build and maintain data pipelines (i.e. data flow from data sources to integration to consumption for specific use cases).
Develop data models (conceptual, logical and/or physical) as required.
Manage metadata using data preparation, integration and AI-enabled tools and techniques.
Drive automation in data integration. Recommend and lead the implementation techniques and architectures to automate the most-common, repeatable and tedious data preparation and integration tasks partially or completely to minimize manual and error-prone processes.
In collaboration with functional leaders, identify the company’s inefficiencies, inaccuracies, missed opportunities, other issues and report on the recommended improvements to the executive team.
Provide technical leadership for Athena (analytics platform) by directing and prioritizing the work of others on the team related to Athena.
Act as a subject matter expert for the Athena platform.



Business Analysis 



Assist cross-functional groups, other Business/Process analysts, and other stakeholders to gather, define and refine their data requirements for various initiatives.
Propose appropriate (and innovative) data ingestion, preparation, integration and operationalization techniques in optimally addressing these data requirements.
Assess ways to further leverage existing systems and recommend methods for streamlining data flow and data integration.
While identifying and evaluating new projects or requests for enhancements, work with the functional leader to determine the project cost, timeline, goals and feasibility and then support the project through completion.



 Data Compliance and Governance


 Work with corporate leadership to manage and promote compliance with the corporate data strategy
Collaborate with data stewards or appropriate stakeholders to develop policies to ensure the responsible use of data by data users and consumers. 
Lead the development and maintenance of documentation and the data catalog for Alimentiv data assets.
Promote the available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to business unit leaders and educate them in leveraging these capabilities in achieving their business goals.
Ensure data or software solutions continue to meet customer needs by capturing changes in requirements and making corresponding updates to existing software or data analytics.



 QUALIFICATIONS:

 Applicants should have a minimum of an undergraduate degree in relevant field of study (preferably in Computer Science, Information System) and 4-6 years of relevant experience + strong analytical training . The successful candidate should be well experienced with Data Management architectures such as Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Data Catalogue and the supporting processes such as Data Integration, Governance, Metadata Management. Strong experience with Microsoft Azure, and popular database programming languages including SQL. Proficient in PowerBI. Demonstrated success in working with both IT and business while integrating analytics and data science output into business processes and workflows. Experience in data management disciplines including data integration, modeling, optimization and data quality. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team and meet important deadlines. Understanding of enterprise and company systems. Facilitation skills and business process mapping and analysis experience preferred. Statistical analysis skills are an asset.

 WORKING CONDITIONS:

 Office/Home-based


 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Opening up a world of opportunity.


We're a financial services organization serving more than 40 million customers across the globe through our Wealth & Personal Banking, Commercial Banking and Global Banking & Markets businesses.
We’re here to use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up a world of new opportunities for our customers, our people and our communities.


HSBC Global Services Canada Limited (HGCA), is a subsidiary of HSBC Global Services Limited, owned by HSBC Holdings plc. HGCA provides operational services to countries across the HSBC Group which is the largest and leading international bank in the Canada.
We help companies and individuals across Canada to manage their finances through three global business lines: Commercial Banking, Global Banking and Markets, and Wealth and Personal Banking. 
It’s this global connectivity that you will find yourself inspired and collaborating with colleagues not just locally but also across continents and cultures.


About Asset Management
HSBC Asset Management, is the asset management division of the HSBC Group. HSBC Asset Management develops and manages investment management products and services for clients around the world, from individual retail customers to major multinational corporate clients, sovereign wealth funds and financial institution clients.


Our vision is to be the leading asset manager for HSBC clients with a clear long-term commitment to be focusing on understanding and meeting the needs of the personal, commercial, corporate and institutional clients of HSBC's global businesses.


About the role:
Data and Analytics Professionals at HSBC have responsibility for executing our HSBC Data Strategy. Their responsibilities are threefold:

Recognising data as an asset to HSBC by managing Data Risk and ensuring we are compliant with our Data standards and policies;
Using analytics and data science to unlock the value of our data; and
Implementing and maintaining our Data Technologies.

Data and Analytics Professionals are geographically dispersed and aligned to the Global Businesses / Global Functions or regions.


Responsibilities:

Manage and deliver Data Management services to the Global Business of Asset Management and local business in Canada (“the business”)
Manage and support the business with technical capabilities to analyze, edit and report on the management of data
Manage and support master and meta-data used by the business to ensure that data is used consistently
Support the business in the design and delivery of technical solutions compliant with data management requirements
Good team player and capable of working with global and local functional team members in different time zones
Establish and maintain good working relationships with other business units and teams locally and globally
Good knowledge of data analytics, data visualization and good data literacy



  Requirements 
 


Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience managing data in investment management or other related industries.
Undergraduate degree in finance, statistics, computing science or other related qualitative disciplines.
Completion of CSC or other equivalent courses on investment industry.
Good team player who can work with global and local functional team members in different time zones and who can foster and maintaining good relationships.
Detail oriented and able to prioritise multiple projects and/or tasks.
Good analytical skills with advanced MS suite and SQL. Data analytics, data visualization or other equivalent training would be beneficial



HSBC Proud
HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment.
We encourage all Black people, Indigenous People of Canada and people with disabilities to self-identify in their applications. Please contact our Canada Careers mailbox (careers@hsbc.ca) with any additional inquiries or for support and reasonable accommodations during the selection process.
If this is not the ideal role for you, we invite you to sign up here to our Talent Community so we can update you about job opportunities and career events in your area of interest. We are always looking for people with purpose and ambition who can help build the bank for the future.

Title: Bus Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Information




Job Requisition ID: 28641
Ministry: Service Alberta
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-Time: Full Time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Temporary (Up to 12 months)
Scope: Open
Closing Date: June 28, 2022
Classification: Program Services 2




 About Us


 The Government of Alberta is committed to a diverse and inclusive public service that reflects the population we serve to best meet the needs of Albertans. Consider joining a team where diversity, inclusion and innovation are valued and supported.  Every Service Albertan strives to enable the success of our Ministry partners and Albertans through providing exceptional client focused services that meet and exceed our clients’ expectations. We are looking for collaborative, agile, solutions focused individuals with strong communication skills and a strong service orientation. If that describes you, please read on!





 Role


 Consumer Services is responsible for keeping the marketplace safe and consumers and businesses informed of their rights and responsibilities. To achieve this, Consumer Services develops, administers and enforces fair trading and consumer protection legislation, condominium legislation, licenses businesses, and registers charitable organizations, and cemeteries. Are you ready to join a hard working team of policy professionals to sustain a fair, strong and safe marketplace in Alberta?  As the Business Intelligence/Project and Legislation Support Analyst, you will conduct jurisdictional scans, policy research and information analysis supporting the work of policy and project advisors and statute administrators. You will also provide policy development project support, ensuring accepted project management standards and practices are used in Consumer Services. In this position, you will organize, facilitate and report on stakeholder consultation activities.  Reporting to the Director of Strategic Policy, Education and Innovation, you will be responsible for:

Research and identifying online data analysis and reporting tools, including visual representation of internal and external consumer protection data through dashboards and scorecards.
Working with industry and GoA partners to evaluate, develop, document and implement online data analysis and business intelligence tools.
Recommending the adoption and implementation of advanced data analysis and business intelligence solutions.
Identifying and evaluating potential new sources of available data.
Developing policy documents and conducting research activities
Promoting sound project management principles and standards across all legislative and operational projects led by the branch.
Identifying, assessing, analyzing and reporting information and data relevant to project teams.
Responding to queries concerning legislative and operational projects by finding and reporting required information in cooperation with respective project leads.
Identifying, evaluating, testing, recommending and implementing stakeholder relationship management solutions.
Researching and recommending engagement and consultation methods and solutions tailored to specific policy and legislative goals.
Recording, analyzing and reporting on stakeholder and public engagement activities, and synthesizing the data gathered with existing data and information to form conclusions and outcomes for policy project teams.
Training and engaging Consumer Services employees so they can effectively access and use information and data to inform consumer protection policy development.


 The successful incumbent will demonstrate:

Excellent time-management skills and an ability to successfully handle competing priorities.
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills to ensure there is a clear understanding and to facilitate consultations.
A strong ability to work independently and in group situations to facilitate successful team outcomes.





Qualifications


 University graduation in a related field; no experience required; or equivalent as described below.  Equivalency: Directly related education or experience considered on the basis of:

1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or
1 year of experience for 1 year of education.


 A good understanding of Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy (FOIP) legislation is required.  The following will be considered as Assets:

High proficiency with all Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, Visio, Excel, Google Chrome/Internet Explorer, SharePoint, and PowerPoint is an asset.
Knowledge of Alberta’s consumer protection statutes and the legislative process, and an ability to read and understand legislation would be an asset.





APS Competencies


 Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.  The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:  Agility: you will need to provide results in a complex, diverse and changing environment.  Drive for Results: you will work with your team to set goals and priorities and to deliver outcomes that are consistent with the direction of the department.  Develop Self and Others: you will drive by example a team culture that is focused on continuous learning and growth and encourage self-development through experience sharing.  Build Collaborative Environments: liaises with the business unit, client ministries and contracted services ensuring business goals and client requirements are fulfilled.  Develop Networks: you will seek out input from a wide range of internal and external stakeholders to solve complex problems and provide the best solutions.  Systems Thinking: you will consider the whole system when developing, evaluating and implementing process and technology change.




 Salary


 $2,281.95 to $2,993.39 bi-weekly: ($ 59,558- $78,127/per year)




 Notes


 This position is located at Commerce Place, 10155 102 St NW, Edmonton  There is one (1) temporary, up to 12 months position available  Links and information on what the GoA has to offer to prospective employees.

Title: Data Analyst & Report Specialist (Remote)
Description:
Over the last two years, we’ve seen a massive increase in global demand for our services. As a team, we are working to set new standards on how to build and run solar energy sites at peak efficiency. As we continue to scale in 2022, we’re looking for more entry-level 
  Data Analyst & Report Specialist’s to join our diverse remote-first team. This is a unique opportunity to start your career as an Analyst in the renewable energy industry.
 


 What We're Building:



 Roughly 70% of global power still comes from non-renewable polluting energy sources. As a climate-friendly and cost-effective energy solution, solar has the potential to drastically reduce our global CO2 emissions, helping to meet the World’s climate obligations for a clean energy transition. However, getting sites up and running is only the beginning. Once solar projects are built, many factors can interfere with performance. What we know from a recent industry report is that solar projects are underperforming by up to 6.3% on average. This number may seem inconsequential, but if these facilities continually perform shy of targets, this could interfere with private investment causing a ripple effect. Aligning financial risk and reward with low-carbon energy investments is critical for shifting the economy in the direction of reduced emissions. Without substantial private sector investment in clean energy, it will be more difficult, more costly, and more time-consuming to address climate change on a global scale.
 


 At Heliolytics, we’re working with our client partners to close that performance gap in order to enable a sustainable transition to clean energy and secure the future of our industry. We’re building a suite of industry-leading tools and services to enable our clients, which include some of the largest solar energy producers in the world, to maximize their energy output each year. Every marginal increase in efficiency is a huge win for our team, our client partners, and the environment. To date, our optimizations have resulted in increased energy production equivalent to 130,500 car-years of CO2 reductions.
 


 Our Analysis & Reporting Team:



 We manage our entire workflow in-house, from gathering imagery data using industry-leading tools and techniques to providing clear, actionable insights for clients to make the best decisions for their renewable energy assets. Our Analysis & Reporting Team plays an instrumental role in ensuring that the collected solar field data is processed correctly, and turned into clear, consistent deliverables for our clients.
 
 As an Analyst, You Will:

 Onboard client assets into our internal systems
 Analyze collected field imagery and resulting anomaly distribution, suggest potential issues and remediation for client assets
 Identify trends across client portfolios and ensure that these are communicated through our reports
 Review data with our technical experts and write client reports
 Create other client deliverables using specialized software tools
 Complete tasks related to our analysis workflow, such as database management, troubleshooting and consulting projects

 Additionally, you’ll gain insight into:

 The North American and global renewable energy industries
 Solar (PV) system components, layouts, and maintenance
 Processing and presenting spatial datasets

 What You Bring:

 An interest in aerial imagery interpretation
 A keen eye for detail and a commitment to high quality standards
 Experience working on analysis-related projects (Internship & Academic experience considered)
 Experience working on projects with tight timelines, multiple stakeholders, or other complexities (Internship & Academic experience considered)
 Demonstrated ability to learn and adapt to new software technologies, and experience with broadly-used software packages (Adobe suite, Excel, Google suite, etc)
 A resourceful approach to problem solving 
A collaborative approach to communication and a genuine interest in the success and growth of the people you work with
 A passion for sustainability and an interest in renewable energy

 Bonus Points: 

Imagery interpretation experience (satellite-based imagery analysis, or aerial photo interpretation)
 GIS software or packages or geospatial analysis (note: this is not a GIS technician position)
 Some experience with Python or programming languages (Analysts regularly interact with our Development team)
 Experience with scientific classification schemes


 Working at Heliolytics



 Heliolytics is a mosaic of talented people with different interests and goals united by our mission to build a sustainable transition to clean energy. As a remote-first organization, we work hard to optimize all of our systems and processes to operate remotely whenever possible, however, we do like to meet in person on occasion.
 

   We value employee life outside of work and provide many ways to accommodate and support our staff in achieving their goals. You'll find a few ways we enact this below:
 


 Remote-First Environment
 

   Extended Health Benefits
 

   Health Spending Account
 

   Paid Vacation Policy
 

   Team Socials
 

   Education Budget
 


 Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If the job description gets you pumped but your background isn’t exactly what we’ve described above, or if you strongly believe you bring qualifications beyond what we’ve outlined that would help you excel in this position, please consider applying.
 


 Heliolytics is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
 


 #LI-REMOTE

Title: Policy and Procurement Analyst
Description:
Policy and Procurement Analyst
-

 The Procurement Management Division of Ministry of SaskBuilds and Procurement has an exciting and challenging opportunity for an energetic, well-organized, and self-directed individual with excellent interpersonal and communication skills to fill the position of Policy and Procurement Analyst. You will be a part of a team where our priority is the development, implementation, and evaluation of procurement strategy and policies in support of best value procurement and improved outcomes for Saskatchewan people.


You will provide research, analysis, options development, implementation, and evaluation of procurement approaches and policies. You will proactively research sector needs and trends to anticipate and identify potential opportunities or issues and develop solutions through strategies or policies. In addition, you will track and monitor financial and operational information related to procurement award and government spending.


The position requires a high level of proficiency in research methods and data analysis, including detailed use of Excel spreadsheets. Effective communication and engagement skills are also important, as interaction with counterparts in other governments, branches of the Ministry, and external stakeholders and clients is a requirement of this position.
The candidate for this position will have a university degree in an area related to business or public administration or economics, knowledge of procurement, and several years of experience in a related field.


The Ministry’s deep-rooted values system of innovation, teamwork, integrity, service excellence, and leadership at all levels serve as the foundation to ensure results are achieved. The successful candidate must be a team player, able to both lead and collaborate, have a reputation for integrity, and have a focus on service excellence and innovation in their work.

Title: EDI Data Analyst
Description:
Classification & Regular Hours





Hours per Week: 35
 Salary Grade: 13
 Please note, this is a 1 year temporary full time contract opportunity with comprehensive benefits package included. Secondments are welcome.






 About Western





Since 1878, Western University has been committed to serving our communities through the pursuit of academic excellence and by providing students, faculty, and community members with life-long opportunities for intellectual, social, and cultural growth. We seek excellent students, faculty, and staff to join us in what has become known as the "Western Experience" - an opportunity to contribute to a better world through the development of new knowledge, new abilities, new connections, and new ways to make a difference.






 About Us





Through critical reflection and the expansion of justice-seeking initiatives meant to eradicate systemic and structural disadvantages faced by marginalized communities, this unit will develop and deliver programs and strategies to strengthen equity, diversity, and inclusion throughout the campus. Members of underrepresented or equity-seeking groups include, but may not be limited to, women, Indigenous peoples (First Nations, Inuit, and Métis), persons with disabilities, members of racialized groups, black and persons of colour and members of LGBTQ2+ communities. In recognition that all individuals have multiple aspects of identity, an intersectional lens is used when assessing EDI efforts and/or developing policies/programs at the University.






 Responsibilities





The EDI Data Analyst will be responsible for coordinating ongoing campus-wide surveys of the diversity and inclusion of the University student, faculty and staff populations. The role will organize in-person and online team meetings, consultation meetings, draft project materials, manage expenditures, organize and align work to project timelines, coordinate ethics, technology and legal reviews, prepare period reporting, contribute to analysis and interpretation of survey data, and work with Communications Specialist to update information on EDI website. The EDI Data Analyst will also coordinate and collaborate with the data collection working group, student groups, enterprise systems functional specialists, Faculty and Support Unit leaders and their respective designates, Western Communications professionals, Student Experience staff and other key stakeholders and experts to ensure accurate, robust and informative data collection and reporting to support assessment of EDI efforts at Western.






 Qualifications






      Education:
      

Undergraduate degree
Project Management Professional certification is preferred
Master’s degree in a related field would be an asset
Undergraduate/Graduate coursework and/or internship developing research methodology preferred



       Experience:
      

2 years of experience supporting moderately complex projects to gather and analyze quantitative research
Experience with communications and operational service to underrepresented or equity-seeking groups

 Preferred:


Experience working in community-based research
Experience working with Western University, gaining an understanding of the organizational structure and the integrations between student, staff and faculty populations
Training in facilitation, conflict resolution, or other skills for group process
Some experience with database management, data cleaning and statistical analysis, and quantitative mixed methods analysis



       Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
      

Knowledge of various project management methods and tools include specialized software to support the planning and monitoring of projects and issues
General knowledge of survey design and measurement, statistics, basic analysis and census data
Excellent planning and time management skills, with ability to multi-task, produce and coordinate projects within tight deadlines
Ability to use tact and diplomacy with all sensitive issues and special situations.
Demonstrated ability to take initiative, work independently and with a strong sense of accountability
Leadership and problem-solving skills, with the ability to provide guidance and resolve issues when the Project Leader is unavailable
Self-driven, independent critical thinker who is highly motivated and skilled at anticipating and resolving stakeholder relation issues








 Western Values Diversity





The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Western is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.  Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwo.ca or phone 519-661-2194.






 Please Note:





Effective September 7, 2021, all employees and visitors to campus are required to comply with Western's COVID-19 Vaccination Policy.
 We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

PROJECT OVERVIEW
Tri-global Solutions Group is hiring two (2) Business Analysts to join our ERP Transformation team at AGLC.
AGLC’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)Transformation Project is about reimagining the way we facilitate our core finance, supply chain, and human resources functions –providing increased opportunity to streamline, automate and align processes with leading practices through the use of modernized enterprise-class ERP technologies and enabling master data management and customer relationship management enterprise capabilities.
DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES
This role is responsible for identifying, gathering, analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of end-users in a particular area of the business, and for IT projects or initiatives. These include interviewing stakeholders, capturing the “to-be” state, process improvements, and identifying the associated business requirements. These results convey to the Architecture, Change Management and Quality Assurance teams the breadth and nature of the end users’ needs and environment, thereby driving their solution design, change management and testing efforts.

Facilitate requirements gathering and validation workshops.
Develop and document project visions and approach.
Analyze and define business requirements for determining roles relationships and data structures to meet business security privacy and operational requirements.
Analyze and define data and information requirements needed to address business requirements used by data modelers and architects responsible for developing logical and physical data models and/or analyzing and designing class models to meet business requirements.
Work with business clients and technical teams on the design development and implementation of business applications.
Document, analyze, and manage business requirements.
Develop business cases.
Produce deliverables within specified quality standards.
Escalate issues and risks as appropriate.
Prepare and execute tasks in accordance with a defined project plan.
Review and provide input on test strategies plans and test cases to ensure they adequately cover the defined business requirements.
Execute tasks in accordance with control processes, including schedule management, status-reporting issues, risk and change management at the project and or program level.
Attend necessary meetings to review schedule, status, issues, risk, and change management.
Support project team members in the analysis of issues.
Prepare status reports, meeting minutes, change requests, and other documents.
Undertake management detailing tasks and review the timelines associated with the execution of those tasks.
Obtain signoff on the deliverables from the appropriate program project sponsors.

MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS
M1 Experience gathering requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, cases scenarios, business analysis, and business process modeling (5+ years)
M2 Experience working closely with clients and performing at least four of the following activities - interviewing business clients; planning, executing and supporting requirements change management (5+ years)
M3 Experience working on concurrent projects spanning multiple technical environments (5+ years)
M4 Experience with triaging user requirement issues/problems and troubleshooting (5+ years)
M5 Experience in leading Business Analysis practice in IT projects (3+ years)
M6 Experience in planning and conducting User Acceptance Testing (5+ years)
M7 Experience in process map development (5+ years)
DESIRABLE REQUIREMENTS
D1 Plan and create business analysis activities including prioritization and approval process to execute throughout project (i.e. BA Plan, UAT Plan, etc.) (3+ years)
D2 Facilitate requirement gathering sessions to understand business and technology changes, to support change management and business readiness activities, to plan and execute change management activities (5+ years)
D3 Conduct interviews to gather user requirements through workshops, questionnaire, surveys, site visits, use cases and other methods (5+ years)
D4 Provide and develop Business Analysis support material (i.e. business requirements documentation, process mapping, gap analysis, use cases, test scripts) that is consumable to the targeted audience (5+ years)
D5 Organize business analysis activities and manage time effectively in order to consistently adhere to commitments and changing priorities (3+ years)
D6 Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers and project team (3+ years)
D7 Work with stakeholders, business units, and project team to prioritize business requirements (5+ years)
D8 Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards and governance (5+ years)
D9 Provide process models, specifications, diagrams and charts to clarify and validate processes with the business and guide development teams (5+ years)
D10 Evaluate alignment with solution scope to support the delivery value (5+ years)
D11 Define measurable evaluation criteria to assess the success of the change (i.e. User Stories, Use Cases, acceptance criteria) (3+ years)
D12 Experience in defect management in UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and providing support during SIT (System Integration Testing) (3+ years)
D13 Develop and document a traceability matrix to ensure requirements are complete and identify requirement relationships ensuring the solution meets business requirements (5+ years)
D14 Make decisions and recommendations on highly technical or complex issues and without formal guidelines or precedents. Exercise resourcefulness and ingenuity to interpret policy (5+ years)
D15 Participate in establishing methods and tools to support current and future business requirements (3+ years)
D16 Develop and document requirements for design system users, and training documentation (5+ years)
D17 Execute changes based on approved work requests, within a release framework, with approval from appropriate project team members (Project Sponsors) (5+ years)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Type: Full-Time  The Gateway to Your Future  This role provides data and analytical support to corporate and site marketing leaders. They will retrieve data from public sources or internal databases, and manipulate and analyze them to support planning and implementation of company-wide and site-specific initiatives.  Key Responsibilities

 Assists the corporate marketing team, develop and execute direct marketing projects / data extraction to achieve the company’s objectives regarding revenue, profitability, market share, and customer base.
 Supports business, corporate and property leaders by providing reporting and analysis. Collects, analyzes, and interprets data to provide sound basis for strategic business decisions.
 Examines marketing promotions and programs to identify opportunities to improve ROI, customer engagement and retention.
 Analyzes customers behavior and recommends changes to marketing offers, promotions and programs in collaboration with the marketing team
 Regularly distill large amounts of data into actionable recommendations and presentations for management.
 Use exploratory data analysis techniques to identify meaningful relationships, patterns, or trends from complex data sets
 Drives innovative approaches to marketing analysis and data-driven decision making
 Performs other duties as required.

 What You Bring

 Strong analytical and programming skills, including (but not limited to) data manipulation, statistical analytics and marketing studies.
 Demonstrated proficiency in working with large datasets, and proven track record of producing data-driven insights to support business initiatives.
 Proficient in SQL programming and data warehousing concepts
 Proficient in statistical language R, with experience in packages including tidyverse, dplyr, ggplot and lubridate. Experience with DBI, rmarkdown, plotly, gt, devtools/usethis etc is optional but preferred.
 Advanced knowledge of Excel, including pivot tables and lookups
 Preference for knowledge with project-oriented workflow in RStudio and modern software collaboration tools (Git and Github)
 Excellent interpersonal, communication, organizational and multi-tasking skills
 Willingness to learn, capable of understanding new concepts and mastering new skills quickly
 Understanding of casino and/or hospitality environments is optional
 Willingness to learn with a superior capacity of understanding new concepts and mastering new skills quickly
 2+ years of analytical experience or equivalent combination of education and experience
 Undergraduate degree in either Statistics, Business Analysis, Data Science, Mathematics, Business Administration or an equivalent combination of education and experience Master degree preferred

 We Provide

 Full benefits package for full-time employees
 Retirement savings plan
 Exciting, supportive and fun work environment
 Family and friends discounts on travel, tech, food, beverage, and fitness
 Development and training opportunities Office environment
 Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals

 Why Work for Us?  Gateway celebrates and empowers our team members, who make it all possible. A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what it's like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.   Get to Know Gateway  Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (Gateway) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.  What Is Next Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!   Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Posting

Halifax Regional Municipality (HRM) is inviting applications for for the temporary, full time (up to 12 months) position of Data Analyst in Information Technology. Halifax Regional Municipality (HRM) is committed to reflecting the community it serves and recognizing Diversity and Inclusion as one of the Municipality’s core values. We have an Employment Equity Policy and we welcome applications from African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Women in occupations or positions where they are underrepresented in the workforce, Indigenous/Aboriginal People, Persons with Disabilities and 2SLGBTQ+ Persons. Applicants are encouraged to self-identify on their electronic application.  Reporting to the Manager, GIS, the Data Analyst is responsible for the development, analysis, management and coordination of HRM data assets (spatial and non-spatial) established through corporate initiatives and operations. The Data Analyst leads in all technical practices encompassing the rationalization, collection, processing, distribution, analysis, archiving and governance of HRM data assets. The Data Analyst works closely with other data professionals within IT to ensure data policies, standards compliances and defined corporate data management targets are met. The incumbent also acts as a liaison with external agencies to address their needs relative to HRM data assets.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Data Management

 Identify and/or profile the potential or existing internal and external data resources.
 Develop and/or manage data maintenance plans to maintain and support the existing data assets. This would include, but not be limited to, procedures for: data integrity; data auditing; data security; data archiving; and data retention.
 Develop an understanding of business and corporate needs. This would include the ability to develop logical data models to meet those business needs, and to develop physical data models to properly implement those needs in a physical operating environment.
 Maintain the existing logical and physical data models.
 Collaborate with other stakeholders to coordinate workflow.
 Perform advanced non-spatial and spatial data analysis.
 Identify and escalate data management standards compliance issues.
 Act as the technical liaison between HRM data asset management and external agencies.

 Data Governance

 Endeavour to become the subject matter expert on the data and processes related to their assigned data portfolio.
 Exhibit strong relationship building and relationship management skills to become a trusted source to the Strategic Data Steward and other key business positions.
 Provide expert guidance and recommendations on resolving disputes regarding data definitions, data quality, data boundaries and access rights.
 Under the guidance of the Enterprise Data Architect, establish and maintain corporate data models.
 Facilitate meeting sessions for a diverse audience of HRM employees.
 provide input with regard to resource and solution implementation cost into data governance related budget development.
 Define, maintain and publish, in collaboration with Data Custodians, data definitions.
 Assist in designing and/or optimize business processes related to data management lifecycle.
 Identify data quality issues and root causes and elevate findings to Strategic Data Stewards.
 Define, in collaboration with Strategic Data Stewards, data quality targets (metrics) and data quality reporting requirements.
 Design and implement, in collaboration with Enterprise Data Architect and Manager, BIDS, metadata capture processes, data quality measurement baselines and data quality monitoring solutions.
 Provide scheduled and ad-hoc reporting on all aspects of data governance to the Strategic Data Stewards.
 Maintain the integrity of the metadata repository.
 Identify and escalate data access violation incidents.
 Assist in reviewing and approving the data access requests.
 Engage business units for identifying, evaluating and prioritizing data releases for Open Data.

 Business Intelligence

 Identify authoritative source for each data subject area.
 Perform system level data analysis; table and column level data analysis.
 Capture source metadata.
 Develop and maintain data mart models.
 Performs other related duties, as assigned.

 QUALIFICATIONS Education and Experience:

 Post-secondary degree relevant to information management, analytics, GIS, or statistics.
 A minimum of three years of relevant experience with data management & analysis, Business Intelligence or GIS, preferably within public sector.
 Demonstrated experience in GIS tools, database management systems and/or development tools.
 Familiarity with Master Data Management practices; Data Governance practices; Business Intelligence related data analysis; Business Process Management; and ITIL Concepts.
 Experience in Customer Relationship Management is preferred.
 Experience working in a municipal environment is preferred.

 Technical / Job Specific Knowledge and Abilities:

 Ability to combine data from multiple sources when needed for the analysis.
 Effective communication, relationship management, tact, and negotiating and interpersonal skills.
 Effective knowledge of data management practices and techniques.
 Effective knowledge of GIS data practices, procedures, guidelines and standards; GIS concepts and trends, GIS analysis techniques.
 Effective knowledge of Data Warehousing technologies; BI and analytics.
 Effective statistical analysis techniques.
 Familiarity with the use case analysis, business process re-engineering in related to data quality improvement.
 Familiarity with data initiatives within the provincial government as well as other external agencies.
