Title: Data Analyst (GIS Systems)
Description:
PSD Citywide develops meaningful, data-rich business intelligence and insight for public sector organizations. Our technical and consulting capabilities in infrastructure and capital asset management, long-term financial planning and policy research enable not only the design of rational and flexible organizational strategies but also their execution and ongoing assessment. PSD's service areas are configured to meet the three essential needs for governments: policy research and analysis, high-performance technology, and credible data. Through our infrastructure consulting and advisory practice, we work with decision-makers to refine organizational systems, programs and processes for better corporate outcomes.

 Currently, we are in the process of expanding our team and are searching for a Data Analyst (GIS Systems) to join our Implementation team. This is a remote based position.

 Role Description

 The successful candidate will implement client data to PSD's various software modules in a timely and accurate manner by analyzing, formatting and uploading data. A background in accounting is beneficial with experience in amortization, customer service and data analysis.

 Job Duties:


 Collecting, integrating and manipulating client supplied infrastructure data in Excel and our proprietary software program
Advising clients on industry best practices related to municipal asset management
Setting expectations with clients throughout the data implementation process
Providing support and training to clients
Managing multiple implementation projects simultaneously; prioritizing effectively to ensure on-time and accurate implementation
Providing outstanding customer service to PSD clients
Other duties assigned



 Qualifications:


 Post-secondary education in math, data sciences and/or geography.
1 year working experience or applicable co-op experience.
Previous experience analyzing data, preference given to those with GIS data analysis experience
Analytical skills backed by high proficiency dealing with data - including Microsoft Excel, Access, etc.
Strong organizational skills, comfortable with multi-tasking and project management abilities
Previous experience working with PowerBI would be considered an asset
Previous experience working in a customer-facing position



 Recruitment Process

 All resumes will be reviewed for experience working with key technologies. Only those who qualify will be contacted for an initial screening interview. We strive to provide a quick recruitment process, but to find the right candidate for the job the process may take up to a month to complete. We make every effort to follow up with every candidate regarding the next step in the process.

 Phone Interview

 If you are invited to a screening interview you will discuss your experience with one of our HR team members. This interview is an opportunity to get to know a little more about the company, the type of work we do and impact we have.

 Virtual Interview

 Candidates invited to an in-person virtual interview will meet with the department Manager and a member of the HR team. This will allow the candidate to get to know the team as well as learn more about our processes, culture and growth opportunities we have at PSD.

 Why work with us?

 Employee personal and career growth is important to us and we will encourage you to pursue the things you care about. We have a mentoring program that matches you with a peer in your department for your first three months to ensure you get fully acquainted with your position. We also encourage continuous learning through a Training & Development program allowing our employees to fully explore their interests and contribute to different product and service development teams at PSD.

 Employee Benefits


 Competitive Salaries
Full Benefits Package
Relocation Assistance Program
Company Matched RRSP Contributions
Flex Hours & Paid Time off
Social and Charity events and initiatives



 PSD is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. Should you require any accommodations, please indicate this when you apply and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in Vancouver, Canada in 2003, Plenty of Fish is one of the early pioneers in the online dating industry, with one of the largest and most diverse communities of singles. We're one of the top revenue-driving brands in the Match Group (comprised of Tinder, OkCupid, Hinge and Match.com).
 


 We love what we do, and have the ability to profoundly impact millions of people's lives every single day! Named one of BC’s Top Employers, Plenty of Fish is a great place to build friendships, grow your career and collaborate with top talent.
 


 We are looking for someone to be a part of our outstanding Analytics team, who will be working cross-functionally with the rest of the organization to help identify, understand, and improve business and product challenges facing Plenty of Fish. The Data Analyst will deliver high-quality strategic and tactical analysis; collaborating with the product, engineering, data science, business intelligence, customer service, and marketing teams.
 



   This role will suit those with strong quantitative training, deep knowledge of what makes a business successful, a passion for telling stories with insights gleaned from data. The ability to communicate results clearly to non-technical colleagues is essential in this role.
 


 Please Note: This role is 
Remote First.
 


 Remote First: You will have the option to work remotely from the Lower Mainland area, but we will require attendance at our downtown Vancouver office for quarterly planning, important meetings, team get togethers or whenever you want to "crew together" IRL!
 
 So, what will you do? 

Provide a variety of stakeholders from Executives, Product Managers, Engineering Managers, or other Data Analysts, with deep-dive quantitative analyses and present them in an immediately usable format, extracting key insights from extensive, complex data sets
 Find opportunities to take analytics framework into the next level and lead stakeholders to adopt new frameworks and methodologies
 Quantitatively analyze user behavior to help determine product strategy and drive business decisions, including driving learning from A/B tests
 Take ownership of ambiguous and complex analytical assignments


 You'll be a match for this role if you have..

 3-5 years of progressive experience using quantitative analysis to make business-focused recommendations
 Strong communication skills at different levels of organizational hierarchy
 Strong understanding of incrementality and sizing business problems and opportunities
 Proven technical data analytics skills in working with large amounts of data at different levels of aggregation, from raw telemetry to metric stores.
 Experience with raw clickstream data (telemetry event data) and datasets of 100 million+ records
 Experience with web/digital analytics metrics (Daily Active Users, Retention, Churn)
 Understanding of basic statistical concepts such as confidence, normal distribution, correlation, linear regression, and linear programming
 Proficiency with SQL or other query languages
 In depth experience with data visualization and analytical tools (E.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker)
 A skillset that encompasses problem identification, analysis, solution definition, results, and communication


 It's a bonus if you have..

 Experience with Python, R, or other programming languages
 Experience in an internal or external management consulting/advisory role
 Have held a similar position at an online dating, social networking, gaming or subscription-based business
 You're a user of Plenty of Fish or other online dating service or familiar with the product!



 Why Plenty of Fish?



 We're recognized as one of BC's Top Employers 2022! 
 

  We have remote options available
 

   Generous vacation, flex days, professional development days
 

   RRSP matching, and employee stock purchase plan
 

   Professional development budget and unlimited access to Udemy from the day one
 

   Match Group mentorship program
 

   Maternity & parental leave top up and fertility preservation benefits
 

   Extended health & dental benefits from day one
 

   Corporate ClassPass membership and other wellness benefits
 

   And many more on our careers page
 


 Our Values


   Be Proud - 
  It's OUR sh*p. Own it! We see challenges as opportunities and take action. 


  Make Waves - 
  We profoundly impact millions of peoples' lives, every day.


   Dive Deep - 
  We empathize with our members and use data to surface smart decisions.


   Crew Together - 
  We love what we do, have fun, and are free to be ourselves.



 Want To Dive Deeper?


   LinkedIn
 

   Glassdoor
 


 We’re committed to creating an equal and inclusive environment; we welcome all crew (and prospective crew) members regardless of race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, political belief, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, conviction unrelated to employment, or any other prohibited ground of discrimination recognized by applicable law. Plenty of Fish is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst
Date: June 2022
Location: Markham Office
Reports to: Director, Business Development
ROLE SUMMARY: 
The Data Analyst position for the EDAC, Inc. Business Development department is responsible for providing data analytics and market data analysis. This role serves to support EDAC, Inc’s sales operations.
RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Data Analytics
· Utilize programmatic and quantitative methods to identify patterns and relationships in large data sets, as well as apply mathematical, statistical, and other data-driven analysis to address intelligent questions.
· Create and maintain the data integrity of the master database.
· Development and implementation of employee portal to access complete product information.
· Coordinating and analyze data scrapping reports for competitive benchmarking and distribution compliance to MSRPs.
· Propose and recommend market analysis data to improve market competitiveness.
· Monitoring and evaluating sales performance utilizing POS data.
· Provide innovative analytical insights within the Data Products Program – POS, ERP system, CRM tool and Power Bi.
· Responsible for Internal ERP system (MS NAV), sales reporting, and analytical tools/application.
· Facilitate and coordinate between Engineering and Marketing (SEO) teams to ensure product content data is aligned.
Market Data Analysis
· Exploring and analyzing competitive activity, customer, and market trends.
· Providing actionable insights to guide the sales and marketing teams.
· Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams.
Sales Operations
· Identify gaps internally, prepare alternate solutions to improve workflow efficiency, provide training for staff based on changes made.
· Integrate Business Analysis skills within the organization's processes and procedures.
· Ensure standard operational procedures are implemented and followed.
· Conduct detailed analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new features.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS: 
Education:
Community College Diploma in computer engineering, or a related Data Analytics field. University degree in the same disciplines preferred but not required.
A. Experience: 3-5 years of business experience in an operational environment
B. Excellent Computer skills in Office applications and data visualization tools
C. Good verbal and written communication skills
D. Advanced knowledge of MS Power BI, Excel, DBMS and SQL
E. Experienced presentation skills
F. Excellent planning and organizational skills
G. Project Management experience
H. Technical aptitude and experience in building Power BI’s and integrating multiple datasets
Experience in analyzing data to isolate trends and other pertinent information to draw attention to Senior Management
EDAC, Inc. is committed to equity in employment and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. We value new perspectives and non-traditional experience, particularly from those who identify as part of an under-represented community. EDAC, Inc. will make available reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities upon request.
We thank all candidates for your interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Pay: $55,000.00-$65,000.00 per year
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Application deadline: 2022-06-21Expected start date: 2022-06-27

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT ENVIRONICS ANALYTICS



Environics Analytics (EA) is a marketing services company that specializes in geodemographic-based segmentation, site evaluation modelling and custom analytics. 
EA is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you require any accommodation to participate in the hiring process please note the request in your application. We welcome people of all abilities.


At EA, you will solve meaningful and challenging tasks with a friendly team of the most brilliant minds. We hire personality, not just a pair of hands. Here you're free to express your unique qualities, explore different domains and technologies that interest you.



 ROLE OBJECTIVE:

 Reporting to the Vice President of Data Solutions, the Data Analyst is responsible for completing client project work in a timely manner using standard practices and a variety of database and software tools. This individual must be detail oriented, have strong quantitative skills and enjoy working with databases.


 SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:


 To effectively fulfill the responsibilities of this position, the employee must be able to do the following:


 Clean and geocode customer databases from a variety of sources and in different formats
Create PRIZM profiles and ranking reports of customer data using database tools such as Alteryx, Excel and ENVISION
Produce maps using GIS tools such as ArcGIS 
Create trade area and census reports
Create addressed and unaddressed mail campaigns
Analyze customer databases using data mining techniques 
Work closely with other staff in Client Services, Custom Research and Sales to meet client requirements
Maintain quality control on all projects



 QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIRED SKILLS:



Education – University degree Geography, Urban Planning, Economics or related field
Experience - A minimum of one (1) year of work experience in a related field
Technical Skills - Skilled in Microsoft Office products, GIS products such as ArcGIS and database software. Knowledgeable about GIS, spatial analysis, geodemography, database design, data mining, mapping, trade area analysis, customer analysis, market penetration and market potential, retail analysis, demographics, segmentation and survey data. Experience with census data, geographic hierarchies, postal geography, target marketing, direct marketing, addressed and unaddressed mail campaigns, and response analysis. Must also have: 
   
Basic understanding of relational database management
Experience with geodatabase structures, information and spatial data
Experience with GIS and its applications
Experience with available Canadian and US data sets
Familiarity with predictive modeling methods 

Analytical Skills – Effectively researches and synthesizes complex or diverse information; uses intuition and experience to complement data and designs work flows and procedures.
Judgment - Displays willingness to make timely decisions, including appropriate people in the decision-making process and exhibits sound and accurate judgment; supports and explains reasoning for decisions
Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities effectively. 
Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views, giving and welcoming feedback. Puts success of team above own interests and demonstrates ability to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives. Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
Communication Skills – Able to clearly communicate ideas and expectations. Effectively listens for understanding and asks questions for clarification. Presents ideas effectively in both verbal and written form. 
Interpersonal Skills – Approachable and easy to talk to. Relates well to all kinds of people in the organization. Able to effectively build rapport with others. Uses diplomacy and tact. Maintains composure and shows an ability to resolve conflicts and gain agreement.


 Note: This is a hybrid role. Candidate must be available to work in the office a minimum of 2 days per week.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Basic Function 
This position will support the organization by taking ownership and responsibility for the integrity and accuracy of the Master Data set.
Responsibilities

In collaboration with subject matter experts, define and implement data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure dataset is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.
Create & ensure adherence to current processes, updating these where required
Create and manage ERP master data including material masters, BOMs, routings, QC routings.
Develop standards and templates for Master Data and ensure data set integrity is maintained during entire new item creation process.


Lead reviews and clean-up of current master data and implement processes for scheduled reviews and data cleansing to rid the system of inaccurate, old, unused data, or duplicate data.
Implement controls and procedures designed to ensure the correct flow of information and strong cohesion of master data between the ERP system and surrounding tools such as Sharepoint.
Provide assistance in resolving data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, collaborating with subject matter experts (SMEs) as required.
Participate in Routing analysis time and motion studies to verify accuracy of ERP routing entries.

Specific short term objectives for this role include: 

Conducting a thorough review of current Master Data and leading the required clean-up initiative.
Mapping and formalizing the process for creation and maintenance of Master Data.
Establishing and communicating clear ownership and responsibility for the accuracy of specific data inputs for the Master Data set. Report non compliance
Defining and implementing a comprehensive controls and approval process that ensures data inputs are first verified and approved by area managers.

Qualifications

Comfortable in a fast-paced, demanding environment where attention to quality, detail and right the first time (RTF) are equally important.
Demonstrated knowledge of Data Management and Data Governance practices.
Ability to multitask on multiple projects/priorities simultaneously.
Excellent organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral). The successful candidate would be expected to develop and deliver appropriate training.
The ability to communicate clearly on technical issues and instill confidence in internal and external customers at all levels – Executive, Functional Management and others.
Familiarity with a variety of ERP systems – ERP implementation experience is a desired asset, as the company has the objective to transition to a new platform within 2-3 years
Previous experience controlling and maintaining accurate and robust Master Data databases.

Education/Experience

Bachelor's degree (information science, data management, computer science, industrial engineering or related fields) or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Five to seven (5-7) years’ experience working in a similar or related role.
JD Edwards knowledge and experience considered an asset.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: From $60,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Company pension
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
Profit sharing

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Brockville, ON K6V 5W5: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

Are you legally authorized to work in Canada?

Education:

Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

data management/computer science: 5 years (required)
JD Edwards: 1 year (required)

Title: Jr. Developer/Data Analyst
Description:
Company Overview: Ontario One Call acts as the communications link between buried infrastructure owners (our members) and individuals who are planning to dig in the province of Ontario. In 2012, the Ontario Underground Infrastructure Notification System Act (OUINSA) was passed, which stipulates that by law, anyone in the province of Ontario must contact Ontario One Call before they dig.Ontario One Call is charged with the responsibilities of the OUINSA, which involves the operation of a contact centre to receive and process excavation requests, compliance activities to ensure that members meet their legal responsibilities and public education around the need for safe excavation.
*Core Values: *
At Ontario One Call, we are Reliable Experts who Care:

Reliable…We are dependable and accessible
Experts…We have the mindset to lead innovation
Caring…We ensure the safety and well-being in our communities.

Do you have what it takes to join our team?
Position overview: **Ontario One Call employees enjoy a hybrid work model with both work in the office and work from home available. This role is based in Guelph, Ontario and candidates must be willing and able to work in office as required including working primarily on site during their probationary period.The Jr Developer/Data Analyst should possess an understanding and background in reporting and analytics. Reporting to the I.T. Manager, the Jr Developer/Data Analyst will assist the I.T. Manager in maintaining all reporting and analytic and operations projects.The Jr Developer/Data Analyst will be responsible for designing, building and deploying reporting and analysis.

Design and maintaining systems and databases for reporting purpose; this includes fixing coding errors, running job tools and other data-related tasks.
Creating appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the process if necessary
Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to develop new datasets and data driven solutions
Generate reports and analysis

Document processes/procedures
Travel as required

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Fluent in reading, writing and verbally communicating in English
Strong technical documentation skills
Ability to quickly learn new and old technologies to support all needs
Software Programming


C#
.Net
XML
HTML
JavaScript
Python


Strong database and SQL skillset


MySQL / Maria DB
PostgreSQL
Microsoft SQL


Familiarity of data management, data analysis and ETL process skills and concepts including data modeling and transformations.
Strong Microsoft Excel background
Strong Microsoft Access background
Microsoft Power BI (asset)

**
Education and Experience: 

Completion of post secondary in a relevant field
Minimum 1-3 years in similar role with Data/reporting/analytics

Technical Requirements: Candidates wishing to apply must be able to meet the following technical requirements while we/they are working remotely:

Title: Fuel Data Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
The Fuels Marketing Team within the Petroleum Division of Canadian Tire is responsible for the overall profitability of the Fuels business (gas and propane) for the corporation. This requires a dedicated team managing relationships with our key vendor partners, negotiating fuel and transportation costs, as well as retail (street) pricing for all grades of gas and diesel for our 288 gas bar locations across Canada within each market. 
Reporting to the Fuels Marketing Manager – the Fuels Data Analyst is accountable for providing overall support to the Fuels Marketing Team. This support includes both routine-daily reporting using existing data and analytical processes as well as conducting more in-depth analysis to ensure that the business is fully optimized from a pricing & margin standpoint in each of the markets we operate. This in-depth analysis requires the development & design of MS Access Queries & Tables to effectively access the data we have stored in various databases. 
What You'll Do 
ROUTINE DAILY FUELS MANAGEMENT SUPPORT 

Provide analytical support to the Fuels Marketing Team through daily reporting (eg. Margin Reports, Exception Reports, Incidents Reports, etc…) 
Daily cost updates – Shared responsibility with the Fuels Pricing Analyst on entering and updating supplier cost data in the AS400 system. Verify from Source documents that the information entered into the system is accurate and complete. 
Provide additional analysis for the 401/400 HWY series locations. 
Conduct ongoing analytics and reviews of ‘Margin Exceptions’ for each site to identify challenges as well as opportunities to engage in price restoration activities. 
Support the Fuels Marketing Team to implement special regulatory projects. 
Back up Fuels Pricing Analyst on communicating with fuel suppliers and transportation vendors on the day-to-day operations. 
Weekly update to the CT Hub Propane Pricing Notification. 
Infrequent Pricing Desk call centre coverage as well as routine release of day-end reports 
Provide back-up support to the Fuels Marketing Team as necessary. 

IN-DEPTH DATA ANALYTICS SUPPORT 

Conduct pricing/margin analysis to ensure that retail pricing ‘philosophies’ for each gas bar location are optimized to ensure the right balance of profitability and competitiveness. 
Leverage industry data (eg. Kalibrate data) to perform regular benchmarking analysis. 
Create MS Access queries & tables as required to help support the team effectively. 
Work with the Petroleum FP&A Team in managing both upstream and downstream data requirements. 
Analyze fuel grade spreads for each market and Identify trends and opportunities where necessary. 
Engage with the team to design and implement enhancements to current processes. 
Ensure that the Propane business is fully optimized at each location in terms of overall profitability and competitiveness. 
Support the Operations Team on developing the necessary reporting for the annual ‘Performance Plus’ Program. 
Become a subject matter expert (SME) on the AS400 system with the ability to create ad hoc reports and conduct necessary data mining. 
Respond to inquiries from Senior Management and FP&A as required. 

What you bring 

High degree of proficiency with the MS Office Suite of products, primarily Access and Excel 
Experience in MS Access database query design and/or SQL knowledge 
University degree is an asset 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret data and provide recommendations 
1-3 years of business experience in an analytical role is an asset 
Excellent verbal and written presentation skills 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . #LI-RM1 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Petroleum 
 

  Ontario-Toronto 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time

Title: Lab Clinical Data Analyst
Description:
Essential Functions


Manage delivery of projects through full data management study life-cycle with guidance from a more senior Laboratory Data Analyst or Manager, manage project timelines and quality; identify out-of-scope work. Serve as a Primary Laboratory Data Analyst for a number of regional or global studies. Bring project solutions to the LDM team.
Interact with internal and external team members to negotiate timelines and responsibilities and to help resolve issues dealing with clinical trials database.
Ensure service and quality meet agreed upon timelines and deliverables in data transmission agreements; ensure quality checks performed on data files before transmission and obtain peer-review where required.
Determine and assist with set up data requirements and specifications per project needs as requested by the Client Data Manage; identify database set up and programming gaps and solves issues using the global issue escalation/communication policy.
Ensure specification and design documentation are filed and stored according to company policy.
Understand and verify error logs generated by the LIQVIA Data Transmission creation programs and communicate to the programming/support team to resolve any issues in the data transmission (with guidance).
Record all evidence of the data transmission process from data file definition to closure of study.
Ensure the internal and external customer queries are addressed and resolved effectively.
Perform comprehensive quality control procedures to maintain the completeness, accuracy and consistency of the clinical trial database deliverables on an ongoing basis.
Uses multiple approaches or technologies to solve a problem within established standards and procedures.
Provide input for negotiations with customer relative to project details, e.g., timelines, financial, process, resources.
Perform other duties as directed by the functional manager.
Work performed is in accordance with ICH E6 Guideline for Good Clinical Practice




 Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree Computer, life sciences or a related field Required
1 year of relevant work experience including programming experience Required
Combination of computing qualification and professional experience Required
Equivalent combination of education, training and experience Required
Experience with SAS programming in the course of file format process
Good customer-focus perspective with skill to guide customer communications and customer management Beginner
Good attention to detail to anticipate, address and/or escalate issues, with aptitude to embrace and be conduit for change Intermediate
Good project and task management capabilities and ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously Beginner
Effective problem solving skills as well as ability to proactively identifying process improvements which reduce operational costs and maintain quality Beginner
Quality conscious with high degree of ethics and integrity carrying out duties in accordance to laws, regulatory standards, and with company policies and procedures Intermediate
Proficiency in Windows operating systems (user-level skills), Microsoft Office applications Beginner
Good understanding of medical, clinical research, and Lab Data Management process and terminology Beginner

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
General Information 






      Req # 
     

      WD00032866

Additional Locations:




Markham - Ontario - Canada











Why Work at Lenovo 







Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology that builds a brighter, more sustainable and inclusive future for our customers, colleagues, communities, and the planet.  And we go big. No, not big—huge.  We’re not just a US$60 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company, we’re one of Fortune’s Most Admired. We’re transforming the world through intelligent transformation, offering the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices, infrastructure, and solutions. With more than 71,500 employees doing business in 180 markets, we help millions—not just the select few—experience our version of a smarter future.   The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...









Description and Requirements 






Description
 We are seeking a savvy Marketing Data Analyst to join our Marketing Operations team. The individual will be responsible for developing and optimizing our marketing reporting and dashboards, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The Marketing Data Analyst will support our platform leads, business analysts, data engineers, and executive team on data initiatives and will ensure optimal insights analysis, visualization, and presentation is consistent throughout ongoing projects. Initially, the Marketing Data Analyst will help the team map define the marketing journey for prospects/customers in alignment with key business, reporting, and advanced analytics use-cases.

 The right fit for this role will be able to jump into a siloed organization and capture requirements from business users; translate those requirements into use-cases and relay data model requirements to data engineers to then map the data requirements for data modelling and/or data migration. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the insights and data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of designing, developing, and optimizing our group’s marketing analytics reporting and dashboarding to support critical insights and operations initiatives.
 Responsibilities


 Define the critical data requirements involved in defining the prospect/customer journey.
 Define data and integration requirements.
 Capture and map data from all relevant data sources.
 Capture and document BI data ETL, transformation and KPI calculations
 Assist with identification, design, and implementation of internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
 Build analytics tools and reporting solutions that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics.
 Create dashboards and reporting for WW/GEO marketing and marketing operations team members that assist them in building and optimizing marketing campaigns to achieve best in class performance.
 Work with Marketing stakeholders to advise on data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
 Contribute to the definition of data provisioning and governance requirements.
 Keep data secure and in compliance with corporate standards.
 Translate end-user needs into data integration requirements and assist in management of these projects.
 Interface regularly with marketing and sales users to gather business requirements and devise solutions that support end-to-end processes
 Present market analysis and campaign analysis to stakeholders of all levels including C-level on schedule
 Provide Ad-hoc reporting to meet client/stakeholder specifications

 Desired Qualifications


 We are looking for a candidate with experience in a Data Analyst role
 Experience using the following software/tools:
        
 Experience with development in BI platforms: Domo, Power BI.
 Experience with marketing deployment and analytics platforms: Adobe Analytics, Marketo, Google Analytics, Sprinklr
 Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
 Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools.
 Experience with data optimization, data visualization, digital & performance marketing

 Experience with SQL/MySQL (Python/R nice to have)
 Build data flows and ETL creation in BI platforms
 Ability to initiate a project and follow it through to conclusion
 Ability to work independently and in a team
 Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Translate end-user needs into data analysis and visual presentation requirements
 Analysis, design, and development of traditional data warehouse and business intelligence solutions
 Work with marketing stakeholders to understand and execute on their requirements
 Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture.
 Assist with the assembly of large, complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements.
 Identify, design, and implement internal process and data transformation improvements.
 Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related requirement gathering, anticipate technical issues and support data migration to a new infrastructure.
 Interface regularly with marketing and sales users to gather business requirements and devise solutions that support end-to-end processes
 Working with Stakeholders across different timezone
 Working with stakeholders and teams across the globe across multiple time zones












Markham - Ontario - Canada

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About SickKids







Dedicated exclusively to children and their families, The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) is one of the largest and most respected paediatric healthcare centres in the world. As innovators in child health, we lead and partner to improve the health of children through the integration of healthcare, leading-edge research and education. Our reputation would not have been built – nor could it be maintained – without the skills, knowledge and experience of the extraordinary people who come to work here every day. SickKids is committed to ongoing learning and development, and features a caring and supportive work environment that combines exceptionally high standards of practice.
 When you join SickKids, you become part of our community. We share a commitment and determination to fulfill our vision of Healthier Children. A Better World.
 Don’t miss out on the opportunity to work alongside the world’s best in paediatric healthcare.





 Position Description





The Division of Paediatric Emergency Medicine (PEM) is recruiting a data analyst. This is an exciting opportunity for those interested in using their background in research design, statistics, and machine learning to impact healthcare delivery at scale. 
This position provides management and technical support for clinical researchers/research databases and applications by providing statistical/computational design and analysis support for randomized control trials and observational studies, generating reports to support clinical operations, and working with our clinicians and researchers directly to provide ad hoc data science services. It also involves leveraging SickKids clinical databases for the purpose of building and deploying novel machine learning models into clinical/research workflows. 
This role includes providing extensive analytic, research and client support as part of a team that delivers health care information and consulting services to hospital or research groups. The data analyst not only has accountability for significant support of Divisional data projects, but also supplements project management activities, provides input into the development of new business proposals, mentors junior staff, and assists with other on-going project work as needed.
 The role is also responsible for supplying analytic expertise to service teams for the development and implementation of clinical, quantitative and statistical models, metrics and methods for hospital, research groups and other clinical groups.
 The Emergency Department at SickKids is leading the nation on the development and deployment of innovative healthcare technologies and research. We encourage applicants with a strong statistics and computational background to apply. 
Here’s what you’ll get to do
 Research Analysis

Provide analytic advice and support in protocol development/design and reporting of research studies with regards to proposed statistical analysis and sample size calculations to research groups
Run descriptive statistics, regression analysis including survival analysis, categorical data analysis, applied Bayesian methods, predictive modelling, and applied machine learning
Advise on how to deal with missing data
Assess and communicate impact of novel research methodology / statistical approaches and educate internal staff as needed
Attend Research Council and New Project Rounds and provide analytic/statistical input for new protocols
Contribute to knowledge translation deliverables including interpretation of results, reports, technical memoranda, posters, presentations, and manuscripts
Direct more junior Research Analyst and Research Assistant staff to extract data from various sources to support the development of research proposals, project analysis plans, project specifications, and client deliverables
Oversee the organization and cleaning of research study data and facilitate decisions on archiving

 Databases Development, Queries and Maintenance

Database configuration, development of web-based applications, tables and forms
Ensuring integrity and consistency of data in the databases
Developing data pipeline and processes to ensure databases remain up-to-date and synchronized with ongoing research study activities
Documenting workflows and creating process flow charts
Interviewing stakeholders (i.e. clinicians, researchers, administrators) to determine custom database requirements
Identifying issues and gaps in databases
Facilitate the integration of new data sources into existing clinical/research databases 
Assisting with development of data dictionaries for new databases
Working with raw data and extracting data for research and machine learning purposes
Prepare stats for administrative reports

 Clinical Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning

Utilize clinical databases for the development of novel machine learning algorithms (in collaboration with clinical artificial intelligence specialists at SickKids) 
Work with dedicated GPUs and the high-performance computing network at SickKids which is one of the top computational resources in any healthcare institution in Canada
Work with real-world healthcare data such as clinical notes, radiology images, and our point of care ultrasound databases to build NLP models, image classifiers, and semi-autonomous machine learning workflows
Collaborate directly with the Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (AIM) group at SickKids led by Dr. Anna Goldenberg and be part of our growing SickKids machine learning community
Work with clinicians and researchers throughout the entire machine learning project pipeline from use case design and data curation and processing to model training and deployment
Evaluate machine learning model impact and help construct future business cases to support ongoing resourcing and investment in new technology deployment 

Here’s what you’ll need

Undergraduate or master’s degree in Computer Science and/or Statistics 
Understanding of various research methodologies and study designs
Knowledge of MS Access or experience building and managing databases
SAS or other statistical package (e.g. python statistical libraries) 
Knowledge working with SQL Server
Experience in a research in academic setting is preferred
High level of sound judgment, business acumen, problem solving, diplomacy, and relationship building skills are necessary
High level of critical thinking, analytical and research skills are required to obtain information and provide creative and fundamentally sound recommendations on a variety of issues
Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal
A team player and able to work collaboratively with others 
Strong analytic and decision-making abilities







Our Commitment to Diversity





The children and families we care for are from a variety of communities, and so are our employees. We welcome and encourage everyone to join our organization and be part of our team.
 When requested, SickKids will provide access and inclusion supports to eligible candidates to support their full engagement during the interview and assessment process. Information received related to access or inclusion will be addressed confidentially. 
Thank you for your interest in joining SickKids. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In accordance with our Hospital policy, employment at SickKids is conditional upon the Hospital’s receipt of all necessary documentation.
 FOR EXTERNAL APPLICANTS ONLY: As a health care institution, our highest priority is the safety of patients, families and staff. As a result, we are adopting all prevention measures to ensure the safety of our patients, families and our staff. Therefore, any offer of employment is conditional upon you submitting proof that you have been fully vaccinated with a Health Canada or World Health Organization (WHO) approved COVID-19 vaccination as soon as possible and no later than fourteen (14) calendar days prior to the effective start date, in addition to satisfying any other condition(s) that may be set out in an offer. If a candidate fails to satisfy this condition (or any other condition(s) set out in an offer), any offer of employment shall be immediately rescinded.
 How to Apply
 Tip: Combine your cover letter and resume into ONE document of 20 pages or less as you cannot upload multiple documents as part of your application.
 If you are still experiencing technical difficulties please email ask.hr@sickkids.ca to send us a short description of the issues you are experiencing. Please note that we will not accept resumes sent to this inbox but we are happy to respond to requests for technical assistance.

Title: Logistics Analyst 2
Description:
Logistics Analyst 2 - Remote Opportunity 

Job Overview Support the strategic direction and performance of the Logistics department through the identification and execution of initiatives. Lead or execute identified global initiatives at a local level within timelines. Provide liaison with internal / external clients in relation to shipping regulations and logistics initiatives. Work performed is in accordance with ICH E6 Guideline for Good Clinical Practice.

 Role Responsibilities:

 Support strategic direction for global logistics
 Ensure strategic initiatives at a local level are executed in a timely manner in accordance with the project plan
 Ensure global standard operating procedures are developed to ensure compliance for import, export, and logistics regulatory processes
 Provide consultation to Project Management, Sponsors and/or CROs to ensure compliance with origin country's export and destination country's import regulations and practices
 Initiate and maintain close, collaborative working relationships with sponsors and project management before start-up and during shipping life of all projects in the region
 Provide internal and external customer consultation to ensure international projects launch on time and run smoothly relative to logistics and regulations whilst keeping them abreast of current logistics initiatives
 Participate on corporate regulatory project teams or may provide service as an independent expert
 Maintain external network of industry, logistics, and regulatory contacts
 Plan, coordinate, and provide leadership for complex logistics projects
 Develop and maintain good communications and working relationships with internal and external clients, regulatory agencies, couriers and related companies
 Maintain and adhere to standard operating procedures (SOPs) related to logistics, related regulations, and training
 Keep abreast of current data, trends, regulations, developments, and advances in area of expertise
 May serve as regulatory consultant for internal and external clients and global QLABs
 Work with global counterparts to ensure compliance and promote and facilitate global logistics standardization
 Interact with international and domestic regulatory agencies related to import, export, transportation and packaging
 Develop and implement new processes to improve logistics operations within the company
 Participate in local vendor management meetings, promoting continuous improvement
 Develop, revise and maintain current practices, policies and procedures to support both the department and internal / external customers
 Future: Manage staff in accordance with organization’s policies and applicable regulations; Responsibilities include planning, assigning, and directing work, appraising performance and guiding professional development, rewarding and disciplining employees and addressing employee relations issues and resolving problems
 Approve actions on human resources matters


 Requirements:

 High School Diploma or equivalent is Required; Bachelor's Degree is Preferred

 Leadership experience is a plus
 Knowledge of regulatory requirements
 Self-starter

 Skills and Abilities:

 Comprehensive knowledge of international logistics including import/export regulations and procedures.
 Thorough knowledge of and current certification in international and domestic air transport regulations.
 General working knowledge of lab procedures.
 Effective oral and written communications skills.
 Strong organizational and problem-solving skills.
 Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks and projects.
 Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, managers and clients.


 IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Analyst
Description:
Job Information


 Job Requisition ID: 30035
Scope: Open Competition
Closing Date: July 4, 2022


Classification: Program Services 3E
Ministry: Office of the Child & Youth Advocate
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-time: Full-time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week




 About Us


 The Office of the Child and Youth Advocate (OCYA) is an Office of the Legislature. Our Office provides advocacy for children and youth receiving or seeking to receive services under the Child, Youth and Family Enhancement Act and the Protection of Sexually Exploited Children Act, and youth involved with the youth justice system. The OCYA is also responsible for providing legal representation for young people in matters related to the Child, Youth and Family Enhancement Act and the Protection of Sexually Exploited Children Act. The OCYA conducts investigations and reports on systemic issues arising from the serious injury to or death of a child. The OCYA engages stakeholders in understanding the importance of respecting young people’s individual and collective rights, interests and viewpoints, as well as delivers public education.


The Office of the Child and Youth Advocate is committed to a diverse and inclusive public service that reflects the population we serve to best meet the needs of Albertans. We are committed to an inclusive workplace that welcomes, respects, and values the diversity of our employees that also supports them to be actively engaged in the workplace and the work we do to meet the needs of Alberta's young people.






 Role


 If you are passionate about strengthening services provided to young people and would like to further develop your analytical skills as part of a collaborative team this may be the opportunity for you. The Quality Assurance and Research team supports the OCYA’s research, data analysis, project management, process and reporting needs. In this role your work will support public reporting on issues affecting young people and inform the recommendations we make to government systems.
To meet these needs your work will be diverse and varied with a focus on data analysis. This role deals with sensitive and private information on a daily basis including information about young people who have died while involved with government services.


Your work will include:

Data analysis/management-ensuring data accuracy and integrity in internal data, accessing relevant external data, providing analysis of this information as required.
Research/Information gathering- such as current peer reviewed research, best practices, policies, and environmental scans. 
Process/Project management-establish and maintain processes to support projects on an ongoing basis.
Lead and participate in projects that contribute to meeting the mandate of the OCYA.


 
You will use your skills to gather information, review policy and practice, and track initiatives. Through research and analysis, you will compile information on various topics, which will assist in forming recommendations for government systems to improve services to vulnerable young people as well as reviewing progress on these recommendations. You will play an integral role in supporting the use of data including ensuring data quality, analyzing and packaging the data. You will maintain or implement tracking systems as required including tracking systemic issues and trends, and monitoring and reporting, on the status of projects. You will work closely with the team investigating deaths of young people involved with government systems. You will also conduct research to identify expert resources and develop contracts to facilitate expert involvement in our work.




 Qualifications


 A university degree in social sciences, or a related field combined with at least two years of related experience involving assisting with investigations; conducting and analyzing research and compiling reports; and supporting and coordinating projects, expert resources and committee work. Experience working with information databases while ensuring accurate and consistent reporting is required, combined with strong database manipulation skills and extensive experience working with MS Excel and Word.


Related experience working within child welfare, justice, or police services is preferred. Knowledge and experience with Indigenous cultural practices and communities would be an asset. Equivalent combinations of education and experience may be considered.




 APS Competencies


 Competencies are behaviours that are essential to reach the APS goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process. This link will assist you with understanding competencies: psc-alberta-public-service-competency-model.pdf


The critical competencies for success in this role are:


Develop Networks: In maintaining OCYA’s relationships with various stakeholders, you will demonstrate strong interpersonal skills by serving as a point of contact for administration and coordination.


Systems Thinking: You will review and analyze records and information and provide support to the various OCYA teams including identifying systemic issues and trends. You will help ensure that reviews take into consideration a variety of factors such as systemic issues, previous investigative reviews, and reviews completed by other provincial advocates.


Creative Problem Solving: You will track and monitor the status of projects and files and identify opportunities for enhancing or improving processes. You will recommend new approaches for engaging expert resources, conducting interviews and compiling reports.


To be considered for this position, your application must include a cover letter which identifies how you demonstrate these competencies.




 Salary


 $2,524.91 to $3,311.86 bi-weekly.




 Notes


 This position is exempt from the Alberta Union of Provincial Employees (AUPE). Final candidates will be required to undergo a Criminal Record Check and a Child Intervention Record Check. This position is based in Edmonton; however, may require some travel.


This competition may be used to fill future vacancies at the same or lower classification.




 How To Apply


 External candidates are required to apply online at: jobpostings.alberta.ca.


Please visit navigating-online-jobs-application.aspx


Existing employees should access the Career tile in 1GX to submit their application in order to be recognized as an internal applicant.


If you are unable to apply online, please contact Liz Kennedy at 780-643-9138.


To be considered for this position, a cover letter which identifies your ability to meet the above noted competencies and provides information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how your qualifications meet the advertised requirements, is required to be included with your resume.


Tips for Applicants alberta-public-service-hiring-process.aspx.


It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS) www.alberta.ca/iqas-overview.aspx. It is recommended that applicants include the assessment certificate from IQAS or any other educational assessment service as part of their application.




 Closing Statement


 We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates’ education and experience best meets the needs of the position. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.


If you require further information on this job posting, please contact Kendra Phelps at: kendra.phelps@ocya.alberta.ca or 780-643-9443.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:

ROLE SUMMARY: 
EDAC Inc. is looking for a Data Analyst to join the business development department. is responsible for providing data analytics and market data analysis. This role serves to support EDAC Inc’s sales operations.
Data Analytics

Utilize programmatic and quantitative methods to identify patterns and relationships in large data sets, as well as apply mathematical, statistical, and other data-driven analysis to address intelligent questions.


Create and maintain the data integrity of the master database.


Development and implementation of employee portal to access complete product information.


Coordinating and analyze data scrapping reports for competitive benchmarking and distribution compliance to MSRPs.


Propose and recommend market analysis data to improve market competitiveness.


Monitoring and evaluating sales performance utilizing POS data.

Facilitate and coordinate between Engineering and Marketing (SEO) teams to ensure product content data is aligned.

Market Data Analysis

Exploring and analyzing competitive activity, customer, and market trends.


Providing actionable insights to guide the sales and marketing teams.


Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams.

Sales Operations

Identify gaps internally, prepare alternate solutions to improve workflow efficiency, provide training for staff based on changes made.


Integrate Business Analysis skills within the organization's processes and procedures.


Ensure standard operational procedures are implemented and followed.


Conduct detailed analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new features.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

B. Excellent Computer skills in Office applications and data visualization tools
C. Good verbal and written communication skills
D. Advanced knowledge of MS Power BI, Excel, DBMS and SQL
E. Experienced presentation skills
F. Excellent planning and organizational skills
G. Project Management experience
H. Technical aptitude and experience in building Power BI’s and integrating multiple datasets
Experience in analyzing data to isolate trends and other pertinent information to draw attention to Senior Management
EDAC Inc. is committed to equity in employment and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. We value new perspectives and non-traditional experience, particularly from those who identify as part of an under-represented community. EDAC Inc. will make available reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities upon request.
We thank all candidates for your interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Paid time off

French not required

8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday

Markham, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)
