English (preferred)

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Union/Affiliation:
    

Administrative and Professional Staff (APSA)




     Pay range:
    

$69,903 to $83,473 annually




     SFU Department Descr:
    

Beedie School of Business




     Position Grade:
    

9




     # of openings:
    

1




     Biweekly Hours:
    

72





The Business Analyst provides operational support to systems users in different business areas of the Beedie School of Business. The incumbent takes a lead role in the investigation and troubleshooting of issues with Beedie Systems; and conducts and facilitates application testing as related to new and existing module developments as well as other configuration and software changes. The role develops test scenarios, and analyzes outcomes to assess changes; researches, analyzes, and identifies opportunities to improve business processes and efficiencies; reviews system configurations; and recommends changes to the configuration of modules and/or tables. The incumbent works collaboratively with the Business Systems Analyst, and members of the Beedie development team, on systems, business, and policy-related projects within the Beedie School of Business. The role participates in the development and delivery of training for Beedie staff by: documenting existing practices, procedures, policies, and knowledge within the School; designing, developing, and maintaining learning outcomes, training programs, and training materials; coordinating the delivery of training and evaluating learning outcomes; assisting with the development of the Beedie Knowledge Centre; and liaising with administrative personnel in the Beedie School, and its academic units to support the development and delivery of training programs.
 Qualifications:
 Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business administration, or a related discipline with three years of related experience including experience in investigating systems problems and errors; the configuration of system modules; business process review; and the development and coordination of training programs, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

Excellent knowledge of manual to automated business process and work-flow redesign.
Good knowledge of a range of academic business functions.
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.
Excellent organizational, group facilitation and training skills.
Excellent communication skills (oral, written, and presentation).
Excellent analytical reasoning and problem-solving skills.
Proficient in creating complex queries and using business intelligence software for data reporting (i.e. MySQL, MS SQL, Tableau).
Proficient in the use of documentation and knowledge base software (Wiki, Confluence, JIRA).
Proficient in the use of word processing, database, presentation, and spreadsheet applications; and database and web information systems.
Ability to design database applications for standard business processes.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Ability to exercise mature judgment, initiative, diplomacy, and tact.
Ability to analyze and resolve problems quickly, efficiently, and collaboratively.
Ability to work with frequent interruptions and meet multiple deadlines.
Ability to work cooperatively and effectively with others.

Assignment End Date: 1 year from start date
 Please include your cover letter and resume in one attachment.

Title: Data Analyst, Reporting - Hybrid
Description:
Position Title: Data Analyst, Reporting
Company Overview 
Greensaver is Ontario’s leading non-profit energy conservation organization. For nearly 30 years, we’ve helped people, businesses, and utility companies reduce their carbon footprint and, therefore, protect the environment. In total, we have helped over 100,000 homeowners, renters, and small businesses reduce their energy consumption and overall utility costs.
Our mission is to provide turn-key energy efficiency solutions for homes and small businesses, to deliver a sustainable future.
Our vision is to be Canada’s trusted energy conservation partner.
Greensaver’s leadership team has decades of experience delivering energy efficiency, conservation, and demand management solutions for utilities, municipalities, and businesses. Our team consists of experts in program management and design, marketing, customer service, energy evaluations and building retrofits.
Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent
Reports to: Supervisor, Service Delivery IT Projects, Process Control and Corporate Reporting
Department Summary: 
The Process Control and Corporate Reporting team works to improve operational performance by focusing on the alignment of all organization components. The team uses knowledge of internal systems, data and reporting and consistent communication with stakeholders to develop policies, processes, and technical solutions. Our objective is to turn data into meaningful information that supports decision making and developing streamlined processes and technical solutions for optimum productivity. We are change-makers.
Objective: 
The Data Analyst, Reporting is responsible for utilizing various data applications, programming, and visualization tools to provide insightful analysis and reports for Greensaver internal teams. The Data Analyst, Reporting is also expected to coordinate various programs with stakeholders, accumulate related data and update the corresponding sections in the database.
Primary Responsibilities: 
· Understand business requirements in the BI context and design data models to convert raw data to meaningful insights.
· Project coordination activities with internal teams related to delivering the outputs and collecting data needed for the database update.
· Investigate and scope requirements for scheduled and ad hoc analytical and reporting needs.
· Develop and maintain Excel and Power BI reports and dashboards.
· Perform data analysis to identify data integrity issues/trends.
· Ensure that automated data imports/exports contain appropriate data and run in a timely manner.
· Maintain documentation for reporting and data integrity standards and related policies.
· Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time, in line with the role, competencies and skill.
Minimum Qualifications: 
· Completion of post-secondary in a relevant field.
· Minimum 2 years in a similar role with data/reporting/analytics.
· Experience with Power BI (Power Query/DAX).
· Familiarity with data management, data analysis.
· Strong Microsoft Excel background.
· English language working capability (written and verbal).
· Strong technical documentation skills.
· Ability to quickly learn new and old technologies to support all needs.
· Attention to detail and accuracy.
· Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team.
· Ability to communicate effectively with technical peers as well as business clients.
· Nice to have: Experience with Excel VBA, Office 365, CRM systems.
Compensation: 
Competitive salary and full company benefits are available for the right candidate.
Greensaver is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

Casual dress
Commuter benefits
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
On-site parking
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care
Wellness program

Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:There is a specific COVID-19 Policy in place.
Application question(s):

Are you legally authorized to work in Canada?

Experience:

Power BI: 1 year (required)

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Fixed-Term Opportunity)
Description:
Who We Are
 

   Teranet is Canada’s leader in the delivery and transformation of statutory registry services with extensive expertise in land and commercial registries. We also market insightful property and data solutions, as well as practice management automation to thousands of customers in the real estate, financial services, government, utilities, and legal markets. Founded in 1991, Teranet operates the Electronic Registration System for the Province of Ontario, Teranet Manitoba—a service provider to the Manitoba government, and Collateral Management Solutions—the market leader in Canadian lien registration and search, asset recovery services, and insolvency management. Most recently, Teranet expanded its global footprint by acquiring Foster Moore. This acquisition expands its registry solutions to include Catalyst™; a commercial off-the-shelf registry software that delivers operational cost reductions enhanced security and process improvements. Teranet is owned by OMERS Infrastructure, a leading global infrastructure investment manager and the infrastructure arm of the Ontario Municipal Employee Retirement System.
 


   Connect. Grow. Thrive Together.
 


   To learn more about who we are visit our website: 
  
   www.teranet.ca
  



   Why Teranet
 

   We may be a global innovator in electronic services and solutions who operate one of the most advanced and secure registration systems in the world, but we’re so much more than that!
 


   Our Extraordinary People.
 

   Together, we are passionate, driven, resourceful, and authentic.
 


   Growth Opportunities.
 

   We not only encourage a culture of openly talking about our career aspirations but one where we truly invest in the continuous learning, development, and growth of our people.
 


   Our Work Environment.
 

   We believe in cultivating a work environment that makes our people feel comfortable, engaged, appreciated, and happy.
 


   Company Culture & Core Values
 

   Our company culture and core values are the core of our identity. They define who we are, how we engage with each other and our clients, and how we conduct business every day.
 


   About the Role
 

   Reporting directly to the Sr. Manager, Business Performance & Insights, the Senior Data Analyst will support the Financial Solutions line of business (LOB) to ensure that relevant, actionable/insightful metrics and trends are identified and reported to key stakeholders and/or business unit leader’s thereby ensuring information is presented accurately and in a clear, concise and business-relevant manner.
 


   The incumbent will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and enhancing data analytics products for the Financial Solutions line of business (LOB) business with a strong focus on visualization through the dashboard. As an expert in data and data visualization, the incumbent will take a significant role in supporting the Financial Solutions verticals in data visualization products. The incumbent will also participate in the delivery of other data products, enhancement of data quality and coverage, and enhancement of the quality and accuracy of the products delivered by the Data Analytics team.
 


   What will you be doing
 



     Developing, maintaining, and enhancing data visualization products for the FS Business.
   


     Delivering data analytics product solutions to key customers and partners. Extract and manipulate data from multiple data sources by using SQL, SAS, and Business Intelligence tools; Provide data analysis and standard reporting support, perform ad-hoc queries and develop/automate reports, create custom datasets in support of strategic assessments and analysis; support development of new and enhanced reporting; reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business. Tableau Administration including user setup and access management.
   


     Acquiring more and better data, enhancing data quality and coverage
   


     Assist with troubleshooting technical issues related to Tableau and reporting and escalating issues to the appropriate departments as needed.
   


     Ensuring that you are using your time wisely and allocating the appropriate time to each core task. Prioritizing your work with assistance from your Manager.
   


     Having re-usable processes in place that can be tweaked to include or exclude variables over time will cut down on time spent on rebuilding queries.
   


     Clearly identifying why any published data point is useful/required. Nee to be able to show the data in a way that the stakeholder will care about or find useful. You need to understand your audience and build visuals that will help tell a story.
   



   About You
 



     Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Quantitative Analysis, Mathematics or Computer Science
   


     3+ years working experience in data analytics, statistics or quantitative analysis
   


     Proven experience in designing and developing data visualization tools
   


     Proven experience in data mining, evaluation, and analysis
   


     Experience in data models and reporting packages and analyzing big data
   


     Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Quantitative Analysis, Mathematics or Computer Science
   


     3+ years of working experience in data analytics, statistics, or quantitative analysis
   


     Proven experience in designing and developing data visualization tools
   


     Proven experience in data mining, evaluation, and analysis
   


     Experience in data models and reporting packages and analyzing big data
   



   What We Offer
 



     A competitive and comprehensive Total Rewards Package
   


     A company with stability and strong government partnerships
   


     An Opportunity to be part of an organization that is in growth mode through numerous acquisitions
   


     An Opportunity to contribute to our teams and grow the Teranet brand
   


     An environment where you will be challenged and supported daily
   



 What’s It Like At Teranet
 



     We operate through our core values
   


     We have received numerous awards for our technologies and our successful partnership with the Government of Ontario.
   


     We have been recognized as one of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers for 4 consecutive years.
   


     We have a rich history, and we are pleased to make you a part of our exciting future
   



 At Teranet, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we live and serve. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.



 Come As You Are. We Like You that Way!

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI, SQL, Calgary, Toronto)
Description:
THE ROLEJoin Triovest as a Data Analyst in either our Calgary or Toronto location. In this role, you will work in a team environment and will be responsible for ensuring Triovest business functions maintain data integrity across core business applications and steward for the company’s Data Excellence COE. You will work closely with our business leaders to turn data into information, information into insight for business decisions. If this is a role that interests you, we look forward to hearing from you!
WHY CHOOSE TRIOVEST?At Triovest, we have clear guiding core values and principles, and we live by them every day in everything we do. When you join us, you will find that collaboration and trust go hand-in-hand, creating genuine relationships with colleagues, leaders, shareholders, and clients.
As we grow and evolve, you can too. There is ample opportunity to build your skills and grow in your career while working on exciting, industry-leading projects. Your potential is limitless.
Here is some of the great benefits that our employees enjoy:

A comprehensive health benefits package, including a health spending account and personal spending account, access to virtual health, and an employee and family assistance program (EFAP)
Pension plan with company matching
Personal & sick days
National and local social committees – fun events, webinars and team building activities held throughout the year for employees
Speaker Series to support diversity, equality, and inclusion
Corporate Charity Program – making a positive difference and supporting our communities through paid volunteering days and charity matching
Tuition for training & development
Employee Referral Program – our people are our greatest asset, we’re always looking to grow our teams, and we offer a substantial Employee Referral Program
Discounted membership fees with GoodLife
Cell phone plan discounts with Rogers

WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?

Acquire, transform and analyze data from multiple sources ensuring data quality.
Implement databases, data warehouse and data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Design and maintain dashboards in PowerBI for departments and internal/external stakeholders.
Develop or work with 3rd parties to implement and support data analytic and reporting solutions and processes.
Develop new process o collect and report data and leas implementation throughout the company.
Evaluate, implement and support system integration solutions, vendor API’s and ETL (extract, transform and load) tools.
Monitor and assist business functions with data maintenance.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Design and develop reports, dashboards, KPI scorecards, aggregating data from multiple sources.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Collaborate with Business Systems Analysts and Subject Matter Experts on projects and support work related to data analytics.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
We believe success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills: 

The ideal candidate is highly organized with a keen eye for detail, a high level of business maturity and solid decision-making skills.
The successful person will possess deeply rooted emotional intelligence and be a thoughtful and humble collaborator. As well, they must be self-starter, a strategic thinker and have a service-oriented attitude that will encourage continuous improvement of service and performance.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with an outstanding level of integrity that will gain the trust and respect of staff and external stakeholders.
Demonstrated organizational skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize in a demanding, high paced environment.
Ability to resolve complex issues and unforeseen obstacles quickly and efficiently.
Must be inclusive and supportive of the diversity within the Triovest team.
A strong communicator who can effectively address both small and large groups with empathy, credibility and trust.

To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications: 

3+ years of working experience in data analytics and business reporting.
Post-secondary education in the field of Business Administration, Finance or Management Information Systems or equivalent combination of training and experience.
Experience preferred in Yardi SQL Database tables.
Ability to grasp the essence of large data sets with advanced excel modeling skills.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Experience building dashboards in common visualization tools (preferably PowerBI).
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets.
Demonstrated ETL skills/experience (Extract, Transform, Load).
Experience in the commercial real estate industry is considered an asset.

ABOUT TRIOVESTTriovest is a Canadian investment manager and developer of institutional-quality commercial and residential properties. The company offers a full suite of complementary real estate services, including asset management, leasing, property management, sustainability, and risk-mitigation services. Its portfolio of office, industrial, residential, retail, and mixed-use properties is valued at over $12 billion, with $2 billion currently under development. With more than 45 million square feet of real estate assets under management on behalf of individual and institutional investors, Triovest is one of the largest privately-owned commercial real estate companies in Canada.
We believe that the quality of our people directly impacts the quality of our work, therefore we place a high value on attracting and retaining exceptional individuals. Triovest fosters a hands-on approach to value creation for our clients through innovation and collaboration. Learn more about Triovest by visiting our website.
Triovest is an Equal Opportunity EmployerWe believe in the power of diversity and we are dedicated to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment at Triovest. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request during the recruitment and selection process.
Vaccination PolicyTriovest requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. An exemption from this requirement is provided on an exceptional reason, such as medical, creed or religious reasons in accordance with the relevant Human Rights legislation in the province in which you work.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description:
 As a Data Analyst, you will work both collaboratively and individually to drive insights and make data accessible to internal partners. Data driven decision making is central to ISI’s strategic and tactical operations, as such, the analysis and study of data is an integral competency.

 
Responsibilities:


 Identify trends reaching meaningful conclusions that will advise strategic business decisions through the manipulation of large data sets 
Work closely and communicate effectively with Partners to understand requirements and formulate analytics solutions 
Design and implement analytics models and visualizations to provide impactful data insights
Develop and maintain scalable data transformation code
Evaluate new capabilities of the analytics platform, develop prototypes and assist in drawing conclusions about the applicability to our solution landscape 
Assist partners with data-related functional and technical issues 
Make use of statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts
Create appropriate documentation that allows others to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the analysis 



Must have:


 University degree in Mathematics, Economics or related discipline
At least 5 years demonstrated ability working with large-scale software systems 
Passionate about data and problem solving 
Proficiency in SQL with the ability to query and analyze data and understand data complexity, models and structures
Solid experience working with large data sets on enterprise data platforms and performing tasks such as managing data transformations and machine learning models 
Good experience in Reporting and Visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Domo
Solid understanding of Database Design and Data Warehousing concepts 
Demonstrated analytical skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization 
Effective verbal and written communication skills
Established interpersonal skills for work internally across departments, as well as with clients.
Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment as well as independently with minimum supervision 



Nice to have:


 Working knowledge of Python and/or R
Grasp of Machine learning concepts and techniques
Knowledge of insurance / reinsurance 



What we offer:


 Paid vacation time and personal days
Health and dental benefits, as well as an Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Opportunity to work with engaged and professional team and colleagues
Ongoing professional development & training
Opportunities to participate in fun organization activities, such as our Holiday and Summer parties
Financial incentives and time off for actuarial exams



 Who we are:


 With operations in Canada and US, Insurance Supermarket Group of Companies, including Specialty Life Insurance. is one of the largest and fastest growing independently owned Insurance Technology companies in Canada. We offer comprehensive Life Insurance products that help many Canadians with their life insurance needs. Over 250,000 Canadians a year have relied on our advice, and we have provided more than 10 billion dollars in insurance coverage.
 Our team of professionals has been proudly helping Canadian consumers with their life insurance needs for over 11 years. Our employees are professional, proactive, passionate, team players and persevere in the face of challenges.


 We hire individuals based not only on their expertise, but also on their passion for helping others, and those who live by our core values every day. Our position will appeal to individuals who want to work for an exciting and growing organization and are mature and self-motivated – we look forward to meeting you!


 Specialty Life is also committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please let us know if you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst - Cell Biology
Description:
Full-timeVancouver


 



 JUNE 21, 2022

 Job ID: 220029

 AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune systems to find antibodies that its partners can develop into drugs to prevent and treat disease. We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst, well-versed in the analysis of complex cell biology data, to join our dynamic Discovery team.
 The successful candidate will interact with a diverse team, liaising between wet-lab scientists, bioinformaticians and software engineers, in a fast-paced and focused environment. The candidate is expected to be able to multitask, problem-solve, think critically and demonstrate scientific rigor. 
How you might spend your days:

Coordinating with different functional teams, with an emphasis on Discovery and Data Science, to develop strategies for data analysis, curation, storage, presentation and interpretation
Building automated analysis pipelines for a variety of data types derived from medium- and high-throughput experiments, including flow cytometry, spectrophotometry, spectrofluorimetry and high-content imaging
Implementing and maintaining these analysis pipelines (typically in Python), ensuring data integrity, correctness and clarity
Developing and implementing software solutions for improving data flow and maintaining data standards across multiple teams
Organizing, supporting and collaborating with other team members to meet project deliverables and timelines
Analyzing and presenting data and analysis methods to colleagues and partners

We'd love to hear from you if:

You are passionate about data science and want to work in an interdisciplinary environment
You thrive in a collaborative environment
You enjoy bringing out the best in your teammates
You enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment with multiple priorities
You take pride in being self-motivated, a fast learner, a team player and a creative problem solver
You can effectively communicate scientific ideas across disciplines and levels of experience

Required qualifications and experience:

MSc in bioinformatics or computational biology with two or more years of related work experience, or BSc in a relevant field with five or more years of related experience
Proficiency in at least one programming language for analysis and data visualization (Python & SQL preferred)
Background in life sciences: Cell Biology, Immunology, or Molecular Biology preferred
Demonstrated ability to create flexible data analysis pipelines intended for use by others, such as:

Building and deploying user-friendly interactive data analysis applications, using tools such as Dash or R-Shiny
Designing standardized statistical analysis and visualizations of complex multifactorial data
Designing data analysis pipelines integrating multiple data sources, using tools such as Redshift & Bigquery or Spark & Dask

Excellent communication skills, and the ability to identify key issues and succinctly describe them
Driven to learn and master new technical skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Impeccable attention to detail

Offers & benefits:

The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problems that matter
An attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefits
A minimum of 3 weeks of vacation
Opportunities for personal and professional development

About AbCellera:
 At AbCellera, we’re solving tough problems and creating innovative solutions from the ground up - custom immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation. We’re revolutionizing how our scientists can explore antibodies and the scale at which they can do so. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.
 You’ll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. We’re a growing company with a high-throughput pipeline and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn’t just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of visionaries and innovators. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We’re looking for someone like you to help us get there.
 To apply:
 Please submit your application through our website and refer to Job ID 220029 in your cover letter. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-LC1 #LI-MS

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
Data Reporting Analyst

"The best prescription I've ever given is a wish."
 - Dr. Jeremy Friedman, Associate Paediatrician-in-Chief, SickKids Hospital & Medical Advisor for Make-A-Wish® Canada



What is Your Biggest Wish?





Is it to be part of an organization that is child-focused, values employee experience and is an inspiring workplace? If so, Make-A-Wish is for you!
 Make-A-Wish® Canada creates life-changing wishes for children with critical illnesses. We are on a quest to bring every eligible child's wish to life because a wish is an integral part of a child's treatment journey. Research shows children who have wishes granted can build the physical and emotional strength they need to fight a critical illness.
 “It’s been wonderful to have this wish to look forward to... It’s wonderful to see [Rowan] with something that brings him pure joy after all he’s been through and missed out on!” 
–Melissa, mom to wish kid Rowan (age 5, leukemia), who wished for an indoor jungle gym.







What's In It For You?






Meaningful opportunities to make an impact
An environment where you feel valued and inspired
An attractive compensation package, including Benefits, RRSP, Paid Vacation, Additional Paid Leaves
Work/life balance and flexibility
Employee Wellness Program
Corporate discounts
Continuous learning, development and internal training opportunities
Fun employee activities, contests and more!

Make-A-Wish® Canada is committed to fostering a culture that aims to change lives while offering a rewarding employment experience where your contributions make a true difference every day!
 MISSION, VISION AND VALUES
 Our mission is, together, we create life-changing wishes for children with critical illness.
 Supported by our vision to grant the wish of every eligible child.
 Our values are Child-Focused, Integrity, Impact, Innovation, and Community.







Where You Come In





We are looking for Data Reporting Analyst to join our team at Make-A-Wish Canada. We are looking for a driven, energetic, and creative person who will be responsible for supporting the mission, development, and operations teams in developing actionable and valuable intelligence from our data.
 The Data Reporting Analyst will create, implement, and maintain the canned reports, dashboards, and alerts to support business decision-making and efficient, accurate processing. The Data Reporting Analyst will monitor and control data quality, resolve errors, and perform updates in the databases as necessary to ensure accuracy. The Data Reporting Analyst will work closely with business users to analyze our data and influence how it is collected and reported in alignment with our organizational strategy. The Data Reporting Analyst is an important role in the support and delivery of our Wishes and fundraising initiatives.
 This role is located Anywhere in Canada and is a full-time, permanent position.







What You Will Do






Develop comprehensive and interactive drill-down dashboards and reports within the CRM environments.
Extract, transform, and load data from multiple sources into a comprehensive dataset to support cross-application data analysis and reporting.
Develop processes and reports to monitor and control the quality of data and support the process of identifying issues when anomalies occur.
Collaborate with business to prepare contact lists for communications supporting complex segmentation and preparing final files for loading into database as campaign members.
Maintain expertise in our data model and standards. Support and train users in working with canned reports and adjusting for unique scenarios if required.
Perform ad hoc and mass updates to data to address issues, align to standards, and to support integration between data sources.
Provide expertise and support to information management projects and regular support requests.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Work with departmental managers to outline the specific data needs for each business unit.
Works in compliance with the provisions of The Occupational Health & Safety Act in the applicable province of employment and its regulations, and complies with the Foundation’s Health & Safety Policy
Other duties as assigned









What You Bring






University degree or college diploma in Mathematics, Information Management, Computer Science or Statistics or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience required.
3+ years of work experience as a data or reporting analyst or in a related field.
Demonstrated work experience with handling data and reporting in Salesforce.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Knowledge of database languages such as SQL, R, or Python.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, Power BI, Tableau, SPSS, SAS etc.).
Proficient in Office 365 with expert-level skills in Excel
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Mathematical and statistical skills to help gather, measure, organize, and analyze data.
High-level written and verbal communication skills in English; French is an asset.
Works under pressure with multiple tight deadlines, demands, high volume workload, and dynamic/overlapping priorities
A clear Criminal Background Check required
Fully vaccinated against COVID-19 at least 14 days prior to their first day of work, subject to relevant accommodations or exemptions.









Your Work Environment






Office environment provided (pending on hiring location)
Occasional work outside of regular office hours
Occasional day and/or overnight travel








 How To Apply
 If everything you’ve read so far sounds like you, we encourage you to apply now! The application deadline is 6 July 2022.
 Make-A-Wish® Canada provides equal opportunity in employment and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Reasonable accommodations due to disability are available on request at any stage of the hiring process.


 Recruitment Process
 We thank all applicants for their interest, and we are committed to getting back to all applicants.

> Apply

 -> Reviewed by Make-A-Wish Employee

> Phone Screening


> Interview


> Reference Check


> Offer


> Criminal Background Check


> Start!



 About Make-a-Wish Canada
 Since 1983, Make-A-Wish Canada has granted over 36,000 wishes across the country, over 900 last year alone. As an independently operating affiliate of Make-A-Wish International, Make-A-Wish Canada is part of the network of the world’s leading children’s wish-granting organization. We serve children in every community in Canada, and in more than 50 countries worldwide.


 Join Our Online Community
 For more information on how you can support Make-A-Wish® Canada or get involved please visit our website at makeawish.ca.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst – Campaign Decisioning
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Sr. Data Analyst – Campaign Decisioning
 





































 Job Description





































 What will you do?
 Our team is the Client Interaction Decision Management (CIDM) team. We are looking for a passionate, energetic and talented data enthusiast to join our team. This is a hybrid/technical role where we collaborate with Marketing, Product groups and Channel partners to help drive business results. In this role, you will be responsible for the implementation of data-driven client treatments including direct marketing, triggers as well as other client communications. You will be considered the Centre of Excellence (COE) for client decisioning and distribution via various channels.

 Primary Responsibilities:

 Collaborate with key business stakeholders within Personal & Commercial Banking and Insurance to design, build and deploy data-driven client treatments
 Evolve and optimize campaign test & learn design and build to ensure alignment to business and marketing objectives
 Automate evergreen campaigns
 Responsible for quality assurance to ensure the campaign requirements accurately match the design and build
 Ensure corporate reputation is maintained by adhering to all best practices, privacy & legal guidelines, data stewardship and governance policies


 What you need to succeed?
 Must-have:

 Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics or related field
 2+ years of experience in a data analytical role: Analytical programming languages (e.g., SAS, SQL, Python, R)
 Ability to combine business acumen with technical expertise in order to deliver targeted campaigns on behalf of our business stakeholders
 Agile mindset with the ability to think creatively to solve complex problems
 Self-motivated, strong communication skills, attention to detail

 Experience in the financial services industry, including understanding of marketing

Title: Analyst, Data Governance Program
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Analyst, Data Governance Program
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity? 

As an Analyst, Data Governance Program within the Enterprise Data Governance Office (EDGO) of the RBC Chief Data Office (CDO), you will provide direct support for all the program management functions required for designing, building, implementing, and maintaining EDGO’s Second Line of Defense (2LOD) data services within RBC’s ‘Three Lines of Defense’ model. Responsibilities include detailed task status information gathering and organization, precise and high-quality written communications, and proactive project administration and planning in close collaboration with project business leads. The Analyst adds on-going value by supporting all project management functions by continually maintaining high-quality project artifacts which support prompt, accurate and complete reporting and critical analysis for senior management as well as compliance with Internal Audit levels of standards.
 The role will report to the Senior Manager Data Governance Program and provides exciting opportunities to interact with EDGO leadership, collaborate with teams involved in compliance and regulatory matters, learn about project management practices, and form collaborative relationships along the way.

 What will you do? 

Project artifact management

 Provide primary support in initiating, updating, maintaining, reviewing, organizing, and providing access to key project artifacts including project charters, status reporting presentations, meeting minutes, change requests, risk/issues/actions/decision logs, project plans, and all other documents used in formal project management.
 Own accurate and consistent project scorecard reporting for all assigned projects
 Write meeting minutes, recording action items, and documenting decisions
 Update and maintain the RAID and Change Request logs, and any other relevant project management logs, by entering and tracking risks/issues and closing out completed items.


 Project communications

 Write, review, and distribute communications to project stakeholders as necessary including meeting invitations and agendas, event/deadline notifications, status updates, etc.
 Work closely and directly with project business leads on a continuous basis in helping them prepare for the communication of their task and deliverable status.


 Project planning assistance

 Serve as a primary project support person on multiple projects providing knowledgeable project management practice expertise to business project leads
 Review forward-looking task scheduling and resourcing plans and provide critical reviews as well as proposed improvements.
 Collaborate closely with project business leads to guide their understanding of their task deadlines and recommend approaches in meeting their project and deliverables commitments.


 Project data management platform support

 Perform design, administration, and maintenance functions for data repositories and platforms used to store project artifacts and facilitate project execution (e.g. SharePoint, network shared drive, Jira/Confluence, RBC Connect, etc.).


 Project execution process support

 Support project execution process documentation creation and updates and provide recommendations for related process improvements.


 What do you need to succeed? 
Must-have:

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
 3+ years of continuous experience in actively participating in formally designed and executed projects which include standardized documentation, regular reporting, forward planning, and defining objectives and deliverables.
 Awareness of project management best practices as per recognized industry organizations such as the Project Management Institute (PMI.org) in the areas of project planning, risks / issues management, change management and other basic project management concepts.
 3+ years of experience working in financial services or other regulated industry
 MS Project experience
 Strong oral communication and presentation skills with solid experience in developing durable relationships, facilitating discussions, and building consensus
 Ability to maintain a ‘service mindset’ which views all work activities and stakeholder engagements as providing valuable support to team members.
 A strong willingness to learn new approaches and technologies as well proactively share these learnings with other team members.


 Nice-to-have:

 PMP Certification or equivalent
 SharePoint use/administration experience
 Jira/Confluence use/administration experience
 Experience performing data management or governance processes in a large financial institution or other large organization in a regulated industry
 Working knowledge of data, privacy, compliance, and regulatory risk management practices in the financial services or other regulated industry


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Flexible work/life balance options
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Opportunities to take on progressively greater responsibilities







































 Job Summary




































 At Royal Bank of Canada and its subsidiaries (RBC), data is considered a critical asset, as valuable as the organization’s financial assets. Effective management and governance of RBC’s data generates valuable insights for our clients and communities, enhances transparency with regulators, and empowers sound investment decisions to expand business activities.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Address: 55 Bloor Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Data Analytics & Reporting 
 
Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools. 

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations. 
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions. 
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. 
Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights. 
Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. 
Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations. 
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences. 
Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes. 
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. 
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives. 
Focus may be on a business/group. 
Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works mostly independently. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: 
Typically between 3 – 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience.

Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 


We’re here to help

Title: GIS Analyst
Description:
GIS Analyst
-
ENV002166




 Employment Type
: SGEU Term 9 months or more
 

 Location(s)
: SK-North Central-Prince Albert
 

 Ministry
: 026 Environment
 

 Salary Range
: $26.038-$32.630 Hourly
 

 Grade
: SGEU.07.
 


 The Ministry of Environment takes a team-based approach to protect Saskatchewan’s environment for the wellbeing of the province, its people and its future. We use science-based solutions and environmental laws to help safeguard communities, protect our air, land, water and habitat. We are committed to providing superior citizen and client satisfaction through workplace excellence, continuous improvement and innovation. Our leaders demonstrate the Government of Saskatchewan’s commitment to ensuring workplace health and safety.
Are you a proactive, details-focused, GIS professional with the ability to work successfully in a team environment? Do you have a desire to foster a positive health and safety culture and increase your technical knowledge related to forestry? The Saskatchewan Ministry of Environment has an exciting GIS Analyst (Term) opportunity in the Forest Service Branch located in Prince Albert. This Term position will support the ministry's Woodland Caribou commitments.
This term position will contribute to the development of data standards and data management protocols for the Forest Service, liaise with a wide variety of internal and external clients to facilitate timely and efficient data receipt, assess and manage large and comprehensive data sets, and provide technical support for field survey equipment including GPS units, data recorders, tablets and their associated applications.
A strong understanding of, and experience working with, Geographic Information Systems is required. Experience working with an enterprise database and editing in a versioned environment is an asset.
As the GIS Analyst you will:

manage data capture activities for GIS applications ensuring appropriate technology and protocols are used for data capture (e.g., digitizing, attribute entry) to create custom maps and other spatial data products for a wide variety of project applications;
design and develop workflow models for business processes that use multiple spatial and business datasets to produce output datasets and maps using various tools (e.g. ArcGIS software and extensions);
utilize GIS tools and data to spatially analyze and audit datasets to identify potential data gaps, overlaps and other errors;
analyze data from online systems by constructing SQL queries to extract data and prepare statistical reports and maps as required;
design and develop scripts and routines to automate the process of creating spatial datasets (e.g., shapefiles and geodatabase feature classes) from information stored in business databases and to automate repetitive geoprocessing tasks used in GIS analysis and the production of maps;
develop processes and documented procedures for the transfer, conversion, import and management of spatial and attribute data;
ensure that spatial data and map products created by the branch/ministry adheres to applicable standards; and
foster a productive, effective, healthy, and respectful work environment.

The successful candidate will have:

knowledge of the principles of geographic information systems;
ability to manage multiple projects by prioritizing work, multi-tasking and adapting to changing priorities;
ability to use Microsoft software - Word, Excel and PowerPoint;
commitment to workplace health and safety.

Typically, the knowledge required for this position would be acquired through a technical diploma or undergraduate degree in natural resource sciences, supplemented by a diploma or an equivalent combination of training and experience in Geographic Information Systems.
What we offer:

dynamic, challenging work for talented individuals;
a competitive salary;
comprehensive benefits package including pension;
vacation, earned days off (EDO) and other types of leave (maternity/paternity/adoption, family/personal leave, sick leave);
inclusive work environments;
professional development opportunities; and
flexible work arrangements.

To learn more about the Ministry of Environment, click here.
About Prince Albert:
The beautiful City of Prince Albert is situated on the North Saskatchewan River in Central Saskatchewan. The City rests on the south bank of the river, which divides the province's aspen parkland from the boreal forest on the north bank. These beautiful mixed-wood forests supply our variety of forestry industries while offering many recreational opportunities and species of wildlife. To learn more about Prince Albert visit: https://www.tourismsaskatchewan.com/community/449/prince-albert#sort=relevancy



   We are committed to workplace diversity.

: A - SGEU Office 36 - one day off every two weeks
 

 Number of Openings
: 1
 


 Closing Date: Jul 6, 2022, 12:59:00 AM

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.
 Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.
 We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that it's not just what we do that matters–it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.
 We are currently hiring a Data Analyst to join our Data Acquisition team, working in close collaboration with our Trading Strategy group. Candidates must have a passion for data and its dissemination, and the ability to think both independently and collaboratively. They will assist in the preparation of data collection strategies by collecting and processing data from a variety of sources.
 Candidates must be comfortable working within a fast-paced, and at times highly demanding environment. They must possess a keen sense of enthusiasm and attention to detail, as well as a sense of commitment and dedication to both teams. New Grads are welcome!
 You'll feel right at home if you:

Have exceptional attention to detail and data gathering skills
Are able to balance several time sensitive requests
Are able to learn and adapt to proprietary tools and database systems
Have an interest in learning about global markets and equities, and how information is disseminated therein
Are resourceful at searching for detailed information
Have effective communication skills (oral and written).
Are willing to learn and adapt to a quickly-changing environment
Have completed a Bachelor's degree in a related field - economics, finance, commerce, Information Technology or computer science
Have knowledge of Bloomberg and Reuters Eikon terminals (considered a bonus)
Basic knowledge of automation using python (considered a bonus)

What you'll be working on:

Preparing and deploying configurations of data collection strategies for use by analysts and traders
Collaborating with the research and trading teams in both pre- and post- trade analysis to prepare detailed reports and investigations
Operate proprietary tools and systems and troubleshoot issues in real-time
Collaborating with different teams to design and maintain state-of-the-art operations platforms
Designing proprietary process automation and monitoring tools and leveraging third-party technologies as appropriate

What DRW Montreal has to offer you:

Recognized as one of Canada's Best Employers for the past 8 years
Committed to continuous learning & development
Industry leading benefits package and perks
Focused on employee well-being and work-life balance
Community initiatives, volunteer program and opportunities for giving back

Find out more about all of our perks & benefits here
 For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.
 California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

Title: Senior Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
The Mark’s Decision Support team plays a pivotal role in partnering with the business to provide data driven insights to influence business performance. 
Reporting to Manager, Mark’s Decision Support, you will be operating within the Data Science space, leveraging relevant quantitative and qualitative data using innovative data gathering techniques and tools. The role will require collaboration with internal business clients to define business problems using an analytics framework and delivering actionable insights that deliver on business objectives. You will be responsible for providing proactive business insights, driving thought leadership, and ongoing development and monitoring of performance against objectives and post implementation review. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do 

Support the business with a fully analytical skillset, including data preparation, reconciliation, developing descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analysis, and making data supported recommendations that drive business change 
Partner with key stakeholders to support decision making, develop an understanding of major performance drivers and assist business decision makers in the development of action plans to meet financial goals and mitigate risks 
Ensure the integration of changes to Data Science and enable the implementation of new models into production 
Develop and present information to facilitate decision making at various levels within the organization to both financial and non-financial stakeholders 
Manage ad hoc business and finance requests, including deep dive analysis, report building, transformative company projects around technology/data 
Optimize tasks to increase efficiency and accuracy, be a champion of automation within the organization 

What you bring 

Master's or bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or other quant-focused field 
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst/Scientist solving high impact business problems 
Experience with applied statistics and quantitative modelling (e.g. regression, clustering, experimentation, and machine learning when needed) 
Demonstrated ability to translate analytical insights into clear recommendations and effectively communicate them to technical and non-technical stakeholders for the purposes of achieving buy-in. 
Demonstrated Project Management skillset – ability to prioritize work amid competing demands 
Highly action-oriented with a strong sense of ownership and growth mindset 

Technical skills: 

Deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques 
Extensive experience with data science programing languages such as Python, R 
Experience using data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau 
Experience with cloud relational database such as Microsoft Azure an asset 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . #LI-RM1

Title: Data Analyst, Authoritative Platforms
Description:
Address: 100 King Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Technology 
 
BMO has anchored its future ambition on the use of Data and Analytics across the Bank. In their current mandate, the Data and Analytics team (DnA), under the leadership of the Enterprise Chief Data and Analytics Officer is accountable for developing the broader strategy for DnA along with capabilities in support of the efforts of the Bank. 
These efforts begin with active engagement with each Group/Service through Business leaders, Digital/Technology leaders and DnA leaders; partnering with the group/service to evaluate and elevate their Data and Analytics practices, ideation on new opportunities to utilize Data and Analytics and execution through a partnership model to deliver measurable value while operating within a strong risk management framework. 

Reporting to the Manager, Authoritative Platforms, the Sr. Analyst, Authoritative Platforms will : 

Working on authoritative sources and managing the Data Governance platforms using a product-centric approach 
Contribute to roadmaps, new requests, oversight around health and adoption of the strategic data governance and authoritative data platforms in the organization 
Drive change (and evolve) data repositories (like security master, client master, product master, reference data manager, etc.) and support scalability (and sustainability) of the strategic platforms like Informatica- EDC & Axon, IGC and IDQ going forward 
Facilitate build and manage asset onboarding process into Data Catalog and integration with other data catalogs in the enterprise 
Work with technology partners to ensure ongoing resilience, health and scalability of the platforms 
Support adoption of emerging data management capabilities as applicable to the data products being managed 
In partnership with Strategic Initiatives team champion business case(s) for new data solution capabilities 


Responsibilities: 

Contribute to data product strategy, roadmap (i.e., new feature enhancements & prioritization) and forecast product adoption 
Capture user satisfaction across data products & processes and identify opportunities for improvement 
Partner with groups/functions and ideate product enhancements that accelerate value realization with a focus on user experience 
Define user experience metrics & KPI’s to challenge the status quo 
Evangelize data platform adoption for business benefit 
Identify opportunities for reuse of existing data platform for build once and reuse many times 
Gain deep understanding of the business requirements, work with business to map business need to data solutions and create data strategies and roadmaps 
Establish product support and processes, e.g. intake, access, promotion to production 
Manage / prioritize product issues & coordinate resolution 
Monitor operations (capacity, scheduling, availability, etc.) to ensure operational excellence 
Manage exceptions for deviations from standards 
Coordinate work with other internal resources and external contract teams, if required 
Participate/Coordinate in special projects such as data clean up, process improvement analysis, metrics reporting 


Qualifications: 

Typically, 3-5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience 
Experience in implementing Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog (EDC), Axon and Data Quality(IDQ) modules 
Working knowledge of data governance capabilities like data catalogs, lineage tools, data profiling and data quality tools 
Experience managing data assets as a product (eg. product ownership around security/product/client/people master, enterprise data warehouse, etc) including building product strategies, roadmaps and incorporating client needs/pain points 
Strong knowledge and experience working with different Master Data Management platforms like client, product, reference data 
Excellent collaboration skills and demonstrated passion for execution excellence 
Client-centric individual with strong communications and relationship management skills 
Experience working with external data vendors like Bloomberg, Reuters, Morningstar etc. an asset 
Well rounded knowledge of use cases for various data delivery and analytics technologies, particularly cloud-based approaches (eg. AWS, Snowflake, Power BI, etc. ) 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Ipsos
 Ipsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions.
 Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD).
 ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS:FP www.ipsos.com


 At Ipsos, we make market research work. We know numbers. We understand people. And we succeed in delivering results. That’s why so many of the world’s leading brands and organizations look to us for their research needs.
 Operating in over 80 countries, we are a global leader in survey-based market research and one of the fastest-growing and most successful firms in the business. Our research focuses on five areas of specialty – advertising, marketing, public opinion, loyalty, and media – and our work focuses on our people and our clients.
 Sound like the right place for your career? Share our passion. Share our success. And join us in being proud to be Ipsos.


 Data Analyst, Toronto


 Position Summary
 As a Data Analyst you will be responsible to support the Client Service teams by providing in-depth data/statistical analysis to help clients evaluate their advertising and brand performance relative to competition. The Data Analyst will be expected to independently process and deliver analytic deliverables, advise Client Service in study design and interpretation of results, and be able to communicate analytic results with clarity.


 Ideal Candidate has the following Skills and Experience

1-2 years’ experience in an analytics role
Bachelor’s degree in math/stats/research/social sciences preferred.
Experience with multivariate statistics (e.g. regression, factor analysis, correspondent analysis, discriminant analysis, drivers analysis) is required.
Experience with IBM SPSS Statistics, SAS and/or R;
Experience with Text analysis, working with different data sources/types (e.g. social data, qual survey data) is desirable.
Would be a plus



Programming experience in Python, VB,
Data visualization
Experience with SPSS Modeler.



 
Additionally, you have a reputation for creativity, attention to detail, excellent communication skills both oral and written and strategic insight in the delivery of research services. Above all, you are self-motivated with high energy, can work on multiple projects simultaneously and thrive in a fast paced, and deadline driven environment.
 We offer a team environment that recognizes and rewards individual achievements. A full-service team of professionals including leading-edge methodological consultants and sector and industry experts will support your work.


 Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Title: SENIOR STATISTICAL RESEARCH ANALYST
Description:
Are you passionate about data? Do you like explaining to others what the data telling them? Join the team in the Child Care Quality Assurance and Licensing Branch to lead and coordinate efforts in analyzing our inspection and compliance data to assist our regional teams in targeting and using risk-based approaches and help to determine ways to align our resources to focus on preventing and addressing the issues that matter most.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role? In this role, you will:
  

Design and carry out statistical modelling and analysis, data collection, and research and evaluation initiatives, in support of the ministry's commitment in aligning our activities with Ontario's Regulator's Code of Practice
Collaborate with I&IT partners and regional teams in developing analysis, dashboards, reports and advice that supports management and staff with risk-based operational decision-making.
Provide technical guidance and leadership to team members, and other divisional and ministry policy and program areas on analyzing and interpreting inspection and compliance data.

 How do I qualify?
 Research and Analytical Expertise:

You have knowledge of research and statistical analysis techniques to design and conduct research projects and to interpret statistical information
You have knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research and analysis methodologies to undertake analysis of trends, system modelling and evaluation of best practices, options, costs and impacts
You have knowledge of statistical software packages and tools (e.g. Power BI, Excel, Microsoft SQL Server, SSAS, SSIS, Oracle)

 Project Management Skills:

You have experience in working with multi-discipline teams in planning and leading research and evaluation projects
You have knowledge of project management techniques and tools to coordinate project activities and track progress

 Communication, Presentation and Consultation Skills:

You have effective oral and written communication and presentation skills to communicate complex information clearly in a variety of formats (e.g. presentations, reports, briefing materials)
You can interpret and translate data, statistics and modelling into meaningful reports and recommendations for senior management and regional teams
You have consultation and facilitation skills to provide leadership and expert advice and recommendations to senior management and regional teams
You possess a drive to inform inspection and compliance teams what the data means, can work cooperatively with project teams in crafting proposed approaches and provide expertise in measuring impacts of inspection and compliance interventions

Title: Junior Business Analyst
Description:
Department: Operations / Product Management Reports to: Director of Operations
 Summary:
 As the Business Analyst, you are responsible for conducting market analyses, analyzing both product lines and the overall profitability of the business. You are responsible for developing and monitoring data quality metrics and ensure business data and reporting needs are met. 
Responsibilities:

 Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs. 
Develop and monitor data quality metrics and ensure business data and reporting needs are met.
 Conduct and coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs.
 Interpret, evaluate, and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making.

 Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes.
 Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats 
Create informative, actionable, and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement.

 Detail oriented, and inquisitive

Title: Solution Analyst - MineLens
Description:
Who You'll Work With


You will join our Toronto office as part of our MineLens team and our global Basic Materials Insights network.
 MineLens leverages McKinsey's industry expertise alongside the extensive experience our mining professionals have along the entire mining value chain to help companies implement transformations at mine sites around the world. The team helps companies to compare their operating, labor and cost performance to a broad set of peers. Our proprietary database includes equipment, cost and labor metrics from mining operations across the globe.






What You'll Do


     In this role, you will perform a wide range of research and analytics tasks on various basic materials industries and topics as well as mining operations, developing perspectives that are relevant to clients. You will also collaborate with our global Basic Materials Insights network to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas.
    


      Your work will be multifaceted and exciting, and you will gain insights into many topics. In project work and in exchanges with colleagues, you will deal with new intellectual challenges daily as well as build your industry and functional knowledge on an ongoing basis.
    





Qualifications



University degree with excellent academic record, ideally in geology or mining operations
 2+ years of work experience 
Excellent written and oral communication skills 
Superior problem-solving, analytical skills and true entrepreneurial spirit 
Significant understanding of the industry dynamics of the mining sector 
Passion for analytics and interest in developing new approaches to mining data analysis and application to operational improvement 
Willing to work in a highly demanding and result-oriented team environment 
Exhibit self-motivation and high service-orientated work ethic










COVID-19 vaccination mandate:
Employment with McKinsey & Company, Inc. in the United States and Canada is conditioned on proof of full vaccination against the COVID-19 virus (with a WHO-approved or Health Canada-approved COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable) or approval of an exemption due to a qualifying medical condition or sincerely held religious belief prior to start date.
