Title: Data Marketing Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Overview: 
 
   At TrackDDB, data is the driving force behind our creative solutions. Our team of talented professionals – from analysts and technologists to strategists and creatives – works together to exceed our clients’ business objectives through the perfect mix of data, strategy and creativity.
 




  We are searching for a dedicated, team-oriented 
  Data Marketing Analyst who is a strong, confident communicator and is adaptable to different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets. In this role, they will pair their digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. They will find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. They must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy.
 

 What we can offer you:

 A friendly culture deeply rooted in mutual respect for everyone’s time and individual goals
 Opportunity for professional growth, training and industry leadership in our category
 DDB perks, including competitive benefits, referral bonuses and our unique FUEL program to help fund inspiration outside of working hours


   We are currently working in a hybrid work arrangement.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Work directly with clients, team members and senior leadership to develop analytics strategy
 Improve profitability and drive revenue through creating effective KPIs and optimization of metrics that affect them
 Guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of development
 Lead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data mining
 Ensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and training
 Drive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark data
 Interpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needs
 Use advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environment
 Facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offers
 Creation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualization
 Qualifications: 
 
Curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environment
 Undergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline
 1-3+ years analytical experience: strong presentation skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation
 Deep knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communications
 Experience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformation
 Keen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadership
 A strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-oriented
 Experience with marketing attribution modeling
 Demonstrated experience in requirements gathering and documentation for web analytics implementation including KPI development, tagging and report automation.
 Intermediate level capabilities with SQL
 Intermediate level capabilities with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics
 Familiarity with R and/or Python
 Demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projects
 Bonus Points for: 

Experience with Tableau
 Proficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)

Title: Data Analyst | Analyste de données
Business Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Business Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?

 RBC Capital Market Data Content & Modeling team is looking for a highly skilled analyst to join the team. The analyst will be part of a team of Business Analysts and Data modelers with a focus on: documenting data requirements, identifying data requirements gaps, supporting the datasets registration, ingestion and consumption processes, standardizing data within the Capital Market domain (includes but not limited to Trades/Orders/RFQ’s, Calculated Results such as Risk and Profit and loss reporting) and other structured & unstructured datasets used for analytics. He/She will be required to engage with senior Data Architects, IT System Owners, Business Analysts, Data Stewards, Data Owners to drive the standardization effort across different Lines of Business (LOB’s) and functions (Front Office, Operations, Market Risk & Finance etc.) 
Reporting to the Associate Director, Reporting & Analytics Lead in Data Content & Modeling (in the United States), this role requires a team player who will partner with other IT groups and business teams across Capital Markets to assess and document business and data requirements.

 What will you do?

 Gather requirements for standardizing data from trading applications and external counterparties for consumption within capital markets
 Assist in data standardization effort for Cash Equities, Equity Derivatives and Futures data(includes but not limited to transactional, reference data)
 Participate in the system UAT/ validate and perform outcome analysis/ assumptions.
 Work collaboratively with other teams supporting the data standardization initiative to meet stakeholder requirements within agreed upon timelines
 Manage analysis around data quality reporting and provide recommendations
 Assist in developing data quality controls for critical data elements
 Plan and manage user acceptance testing for successful delivery of end product
 Participate in agile scrum ceremonies to manage stakeholder expectations and communicate progress


 What do you need to succeed? Must-have

 Bachelor's degree or diploma in business, finance, accounting or engineering
 Experience in supporting the electronic trading domain. Preferably in Equities.
 Data system analysts/data modelers /system analyst experience
 SQL. Experience with creating Entity relationship diagrams for relational data modelling
 Exposure to data analytics
 Strong communication skills - Ability to summarize and explain clearly large and complex information to a wide range of audiences (senior managers, audit, controller, finance, model developers, regulators and controls)
 Experience working with Jira, Confluence. Highly proficient in MS Office apps- PowerPoint, Excel and Word


 Nice-to-have

 Experience with FIX trading protocol would be preferred
 Cross Asset experience of Cash and Derivative Products (Rates, Credit, and Derivatives), Commodities, Equities etc.
 Good understanding of Trade Lifecycle (Pre, Post) and Front to Back functions (Operations, Product Control, Market Risk & Finance)
 Post graduate certification
 Data modeling experience
 Fmpl, reactj, json, java
 Advanced knowledge of change management and business unit functions and how business units relate to each other.
 Ability to understand data base models and data mapping


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 Positive work culture emphasizing diversity and inclusion, volunteerism and community involvement
 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including great benefits, annual incentive program and recognition
 Leaders who support your development
 A dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work and grow your career
 Work-life integration

Title: Data Analyst Co-op
Description:
At TTi, people come for the opportunity and stay for the culture!
 


   Job Description Summary
 

   Job Description:
 


   About TTi Canada
 


   TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing, and marketing of power tools, outdoor power equipment, and floorcare products, as well as hand tools and accessories. We cover a wide range of industries, and our customers vary from consumers to professionals. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence, and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus provides TTI with a platform for sustainable leadership and growth.
  
 Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance, and compelling innovation. Our customers have access to leading brands such as Milwaukee®, RYOBI®, Hoover®, and HART®.
  
 TTI is where culture meets opportunity. We are fast-paced, our team is highly energetic, and we reward innovative thinking. We provide a multifaceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge, and reward you! TTI is a place to explore your potential, where wins are celebrated, and leaders are visible and accessible.
 


   Job Description
 

 The Data Analyst is responsible for working closely with project sponsors to deliver enhanced reporting standards and operational efficiency for the business group. This individual will be accountable for preparing and modelling data, creating visualizations, analyzing information, and managing Power BI assets to ensure projects accurately reflect our stakeholder requirements. The successful candidate must communicate clearly, think strategically, be creative, solve problems, pay close attention to detail, and be a team player!
 


   What You Will Do
  
 The Data Analyst will manage end-to-end project work assignments to deliver best in class reporting solutions.
 


   In this position, the Data Analyst will:
 

 Profile, clean, and transform raw data into trustworthy and meaningful information.
 Ensure data integrity standards by identifying and correcting variances in source data.
 Manage user profile groups and maintain object/row level security assignments.
 Provide actionable insight by creating well-designed tabular model structures.
 Monitor dataset refresh schedules and troubleshoot gateway/connection failures.
 Optimize performance of tabular models and custom measure calculations.
 Create stunning visualizations that help decision makers solve business problems.
 Analyze, interpret, and communicate report information, patterns, and trends.
 Improve current dashboard reporting by integrating Power BI AI capabilities.
 Manage distribution and sharing of report publications, dashboards, and datasets.



   Who You Are
 

 Enthusiastic about your career path and eager to learn new and emerging technologies.
 Results driven and detail oriented with the ability to deliver projects ahead of schedule.
 A collaborator who can prioritize and multitask on individual and shared assignments.
 Resilient, patient, and determined to overcome complicated business challenges.
 An excellent communicator who embraces change and motivated to do the right thing.
 Someone who sets lofty expectations of themselves and continually pursues excellence.


 What You Will Bring
 

 Bachelor’s Degree preferably in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer Science.
 2-3 years of demonstrated work experience as a Data Analyst or equivalent.
 Solid understanding of Business Intelligence tools including Microsoft Power BI.
 Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and advanced knowledge Excel.
 Experience with SQL, Python, R-Scripting and other programming languages.
 Legally authorized to work in Canada.



 TTI is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, where we celebrate, support, and thrive on diversity.



   Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please advise when submitting your application.

Title: Associate Data Analyst, Marketing & Publishing Analytics
Description:
Company Description
  Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.



 Job Description
  Marketing & Publishing Analytics is a global team based in San Francisco, Montreal, and Paris. Our goal is to deliver strategic analytics and insights to our stakeholders and support them with key decisions across the lifecycle of our games. Our stakeholders include Executive Publishing (Brand Management, Game Development), Marketing (CRM, Media, Social, Influencer Marketing, PR, Customer Experience & Support), and Finance & Strategic Planning.
 We are seeking an Associate Data Analyst who will lead support us with analytics projects for marketing and publishing initiatives. This role will challenge you to innovate and develop new ways of analyzing the many dimensions of our games, our players, and our prospects. This includes the design and management of analytics solutions, analysis of performance, and development of insights.
 *Please note that this is a 6-month contract*
 What you’ll do

 Support the team with deep-dive analysis projects to answer specific business questions and inform decisions for each stage in game lifecycles (pre-launch, launch, live game, promotions, etc.)
 Help in the development of measurement plans, identify success metrics, establish benchmarking methodologies, and set targets
 Measure impact and ROI of publishing and marketing initiatives on brand health, player engagement, and revenue using A/B testing, brand lift, and causal inference models
 Analyze historical trends and develop strategic insights to inform planning of future campaigns and marketing initiatives
 Analyze in-game player behavior and use cohort analysis to monitor segment level performance trends over time
 Create insights utilizing analytics tools (SQL, Tableau, Python, R, Excel, PowerPoint)
 Write complex SQL queries or Python scripts to extract data from Snowflake to support ad-hoc and recurring analyses
 Build Tableau dashboards to support analytics and deep dive projects
 Participate in presentations, gather feedback, and follow up with changes




 Qualifications
  What you’ll bring

 Possesses a technical or quantitative background in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering
 Proven experience or educational background in marketing/business/customer analytics
 Proven track record working with SQL, Excel, and either Python or R
 Proven data analysis skills
 Demonstrated success presenting complex qualitative and quantitative research data in a clear and compelling manner
 Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills

 Additional Information
  What to send our way

 Your CV, your expertise and/or related experience and skills.

 Just a heads up: If you require a work permit, your eligibility may depend on your education and years of relevant work experience, as required by the government.
 Additional information Skills and competencies show up in different forms and can be based on different experiences, that's why we strongly encourage you to apply even though you may not have all the requirements listed above.
 At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title:
   Data Analyst (Capacity Engineering)
  

    Requisition ID:
   R015549
  

    Job Description:
  
 Want to be responsible for the gaming experience of millions of players? How about building the infrastructure that supports players from around the world?

 Demonware is an independently-run part of Activision Blizzard. We run every part of the players' online experience, from logging in to matchmaking to climbing the leaderboards, for popular video game franchises such as Call of Duty, Crash Bandicoot and Skylanders.
 Our services impact almost half a billion players, we take on big company challenges with a small company feel.
 If you’re passionate about working with technologies for low-latency, large scale systems in a collaborative environment then we’d love to hear from you!

 Your impact:

 You will join the Capacity Engineering team in the Platform Department and help form technical direction and standard methodologies for our current and future needs. This is a new team at Demonware and will be based in multiple regions.

 You will collaborate with others to develop backend service capacity requirements and track those throughout the year with a view of where and when capacity may be needed. You will collect data on capacity requests, allocation and usage from physical hardware up to service deployments.

 You will use data to build predictive models and tooling to simplify planning for capacity needs. You will facilitate management and teams to have a clear view of changes in capacity over time.

 Day to Day:

 Work with teams to understand their service capacity requirements
 Collect data from tools and data sources across the business to better understand capacity usage and efficiency over time
 Explore data collected from backend services supporting millions of users
 Develop predictive models, identifying areas to scale up or down services
 Work on long term planning of capacity requirements for footprint expansions
 Assist in making decisions about the capacity needs of services based on real data
 Provide technical mentorship to team members though data analytics methodologies


 About you:

 3+ years practical experience, preferably in large scale and/or critical production service environments
 Expertise working with data, and data-related tools (e.g. Google Sheets, Spark/Pyspark, Hive, BigQuery etc.)
 Expertise in Python, Go or skills in a similar language
 Strong analytical skills with experience bringing together sophisticated datasets from unconnected sources
 Experience in predictive modelling and or time-series forecasting (ideally using Graphite and or Prometheus data)
 Experience with data visualisation and tools (e.g. Grafana, Kibana)
 Good understanding of Software Development Lifecycle, including agile software development methodologies (e.g. Scrum, Kanban)
 Experience with version control systems, ideally Git
 Experience with databases, ideally MySQL
 Solid grasp of some of the following: Linux, VMs, Docker and Kubernetes
 Experience of public clouds such as AWS, GCP and Azure


 Interview overview:
 This is what you can expect from your interview process with us. As our team, and closely adjacent teams, are distributed globally we may need to make some adjustments along the way. We strive for you to meet as many of the people you will work closely with during the process. We will keep you up to date with any changes.

 1x 30-60 minute engineering screen call (with up to 2 people)
 3x 1 hour technical conversations (with up to 3 people per session)
 1x 30 minutes with other team members (with up to 3 people)


 What Demonware Offers:
 Relocation Support, 25 days of vacation and 3 bonus days in December, Pension and top-tier medical, dental and life insurance coverage for you and your dependents.

 To read more: https://demonware.net/careers

Title: Business Analyst
Data Analyst Engineer - VP
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

TD Securities (TDS) is a top-two dealer in Canada with a growing US business and global execution capabilities, offering a full suite of capital markets and corporate and investment banking products. Global Foreign Exchange (FX) is a key contributor to the overall success of TDS, delivering revenue and liquidity to the firm from various sales and trading business lines. Global FX sales comprises of the following business units: Corporate, Institutional, Commercial, Wealth and Retail.  We are looking for a self-motivated individual who wants to work in a fast-paced, high-impact, front-office team, who can make a difference to the client experience here at TD Securities. 



Job Description

The goal of the Analytics and Innovation team is to build and develop our next generation of tools, practices and capabilities to provide data-driven insights to augment and transform the Global FX business.  The data analyst / engineer will need to demonstrate the ability to quickly learn on the job and be adaptable to a dynamic work environment while performing the job function at a high-level and be able to own and manage their priorities effectively. This is a truly varied, hands-on role requiring the successful candidate to be comfortable switching from individual project work, to driving discussions and communication with key stakeholders to supporting the immediate and wider team as necessary.  The objectives of the role include:

 Work with guidance from the Director and senior members of the team
 Help own, support and contribute to the planning, communication, design and implementation of key business deliverables.
 Conduct critical analysis of current system and workflows using the results to draw conclusions and make recommendations.
 Manage, support and improve critical data pipelines and reporting solutions directly supporting the business lines.
 Contribute and expand our data and quant framework; including developing tools to load, process, clean, query, analyse and visualise data.
 Evolve our reporting and forecasting tools and dashboards as required by the business and management.
 Work with and interact with the front office sales and trading desks, to understand business requirements.
 Perform data profiling using TD tooling and ad-hoc system query languages to validate data analysis.
 Establish and maintain strong working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders and business partners.
 Collaborate across business lines, functional partners (IT, Risk, Operations) and external vendors as the business SME.
 Ensure data governance and security guidelines are adhered to.
 Demonstrate and promote best practices; seek to continually evolve and improve our workflows, tooling, and development practices and environment.
 Share new skills and tools with the overall team.
 Simplify and streamline existing workflows and processes through innovation, tooling and automation.

 Projects
    

 Contribute data analysis and modelling and help build out and support our key data pipelines.
 Evolve and improve our reporting, dashboarding and analytics tool suite.
 Develop and support our strategic internal market data and analytics API.
 Build out our client value analysis capabilities.
 Implementation of dashboards to highlight key trends and insights and support further slice and dice drill-down analysis.




Job Requirements

    Key Qualifications / Skills / Experience
    

 Relevant experience in an engineering, statistical or financial role
 Knowledge of eTrading, reporting, operational or regulatory data lifecycles
 Working Python, Java programming or modern programming language experience
 Familiarity with SQL and RDBMS knowledge
 Working knowledge of pandas and visualisation libraries (plotly, seaborn, matplotlib)
 Comfortable with or understand data pipelines concepts, including cleaning data, including data-scraping and dealing with streaming and time series data sets
 Familiarity working with data in Microsoft Excel and other Office products
 Practitioner of test-driven development, tools and practices
 Understanding of analysis and design patterns and soft engineering best practices
 Familiarity with agile methodologies, continuous integration and delivery tools and practices
 Passion for engineering and intuitive and visual design
 Understanding of current and emerging technology and trends in the data and analytics space

 Behavioural
    

 Proactive, organised, self-starter
 Ability to think critically and pragmatically
 Able to work effectively and drive delivery as part of a cross-functional team and partner with multiple stakeholders
 Great team-player, comfortable working individually and as part of a globally distributed group
 Excellent verbal and written communication; able to effectively communicate technical material to non-technical audiences
 Strong sense of ownership, attention to detail and focus on the client experience
 Great interpersonal skills, sense of fun and community

 Desirable Skills / Experience
    

 Understanding of Big Data principles, design and techniques
 Knowledge of HDFS and Spark
 Prior project experience in client value and transaction cost analysis, PnL reporting or marketing analysis
 Capital markets domain knowledge
 Linux and shell-scripting experience
 Cloud, Azure experience
 DevOp tools and techniques
 Business Intelligence tools
 Tableau
 Knowledge of Tick database KDB, OneTick
 Vendor system knowledge Murex, Broadway
 JavaScript, web development
 Druid, OLAP databases




Additional Information

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
CircleCI is looking for a hardworking systems analyst to join our team. You will be responsible for monitoring the health of our critical go-to-market systems, ensure our implementation of technical solutions meet the requirements set forth by various partner, and identify potential opportunities for efficiency in our existing systems.
 We're looking for someone who's self-motivated, curious, and excited to make improvements to the company around them. Ideally, you've had experience in an environment providing insight on multiple go-to-market systems.
 This role resides in the CircleCI Central Operations organization, and would be a member of the Internal Tools Development team.
 About Central Operations at CircleCI
 Central Operations manages and administers the systems that our go-to-market teams utilize. We provide and maintain the infrastructure for everything from lead generation in pre-sales to account management and support in post-sales.
 What you'll do:

Perform detailed business analysis to formulate business requirements and identify, investigate and recommend innovative technology capabilities that improve business efficiency and customer experience
Work with a development team to ensure the design and development of technology solutions fulfills all business requirements, achieves desired customer experience objectives and goals.
Analyze current processes to find opportunities for improvement
Handle vendor relationships, contract negotiations, and renewals.
Use a combination of standard functionality and custom development to solve business problems
Collaborate with operations teams across the business, engineers, and product managers to resolve best in class solutions

What we're looking for:

Have a deep understanding of multiple systems
Thrive on organization, impactful project management, and autonomy
Have a solid understanding of programming concepts and integrations
Have strong project or program management skills
Have the ability to work cross functionally to understand business processes, and experience implementing enterprise software solutions
Are passionate about teamwork and effective communication

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
 About CircleCI
 CircleCI is the world's largest shared continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools - processing more than 1 million builds a day - CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.
 Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by Base10, Greenspring Associates, Eleven Prime, IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Baseline Ventures, Threshold Ventures, Scale Venture Partners, Owl Rock Capital, Next Equity Partners, Heavybit and Harrison Metal Capital.
 CircleCI is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Title: Analyst, Data
Description:
Reports To
     

 Manager, Data Analytics
     

 Location
     

 Sysco Canada
     



 Type
     

 Full Time, Salary
     

 Closing Date
     

 May 13th, 2022
     




 Company Overview


 Sysco connects the world to share food and care for one another. Sysco leads from the heart of food and service to deliver the freshest of foods and ideas to restaurants, healthcare and educational facilities, lodging establishments and other customers who prepare meals away from home. Our customers can count on us to deliver on-point products and solutions since only Sysco is the global leader, sitting at the heart of innovation supply, delivery, culinary and more.
   


 With over 57,000 associates and a fleet of over 13,000 vehicles, Sysco operates approximately 326 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 625,000 customer locations. For fiscal 2021 that ended July 3, 2021, the company generated sales of more than $51 billion.
   


 Sysco, one of Canada’s Best Employers 2022, as listed by Forbes, is dedicated to our global corporate social responsibility goals and to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations.
   


 Sysco is more than just a place to work. Our passion for food and our customers has made us the industry leader. To remain on top, we will continue to think bigger, work harder and never give up. Are you ready to drive success?
   


 For more information, visit www.sysco.ca or follow us @SyscoCanada at facebook.com/SyscoCanada; twitter.com/SyscoCanada or instagram.com/SyscoCanada
   

 For a full list of opportunities, visit 
www.sysco.ca/careers



 Role:


     The Analyst, Data is responsible for data aggregation and summarization functions. This role will take raw source data and turn it into useable information for the Insights team to then build reporting and analytics. This role will additionally support ad hoc analysis, reporting, and inquiries. This role will assist with investigating data quality issues, building new data metric source tables, and respond to and investigate accuracy and reliability issues. The Analyst, Data will be available to respond to same-day/same-week urgent requests.
   


 This is a technical role. The Analyst, Data will have a high degree of proficiency in data and data languages, able to interact with and understand RDBM systems, create tables and views, and write queries and scripts with minimal technical guidance. The incumbent is relied upon to be the data source Subject Matter Expert within their assigned area (responsibilities are split vertically by department). This role will play a crucial role in data integrity, reliability, and accuracy of what flows into end-user reporting and ultimately what guides business decisions.
   


 Role Responsibilities:


 Compile, transform, and aggregate source data into meaningful data structures.
 Write scripts to automate processes.
 Perform Quality Assurance actions on data, ensuring extreme levels of accuracy and consistency.
 Explore data error issues, recommend improvements.
 Build and support Excel based tools.
 Create and maintain Excel-based reporting.
 Process change requests on existing data sets.
 Meet ad hoc user needs.
 Work with customers to ensure requirements are being met during build phases,
 Open communication with Data Analytics Manager to manage deadlines, project coordination, workloads, problem resolution, and general support.
 Assist, fill in, back up, and support Business Services as needed
 Responsible for compliance with all Policies and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) comprising Sysco’s Food Safety Program, specific for the assigned role.
 Assist Food Safety Program Manager in ensuring compliance to Sysco’s Food Safety Program that leads to compliance with third party certification and customer requirements.
 Is willing to work safely with minimal environmental impact and understands the importance of reporting all hazards, incidents, and environmental spills immediately to their Supervisor.
 Understands that they play an integral role in their own safety and that of their colleagues and is willing to speak out when hazards are present.
 Perform other duties as assigned.


 Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements:


 Minimum one to three (1-3+) years experience working with data, numbers, analytics or related experience.
 Post secondary degree or diploma required.
 Degree in Information Systems or Data Analytics preferred.
 Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook.
 Strong comprehension for writing SQL and working with databases.
 Self-reliant exploring, extracting, analyzing, and presenting information with Excel (PivotTables, writing VBA code, etc.).
 Demonstrated ability to provide meaningful analytics and visualizations.
 Strong communication skills; ability to effectively communicate with internal and external teams.
 High degree of trust handling confidential information.
 Excellent organizational and project management skills, including the ability to execute multiple initiatives at the same time.
 Flexible; readily accepts change; open to new ideas.
 Proactive, self-directed, with the ability to structure a weekly schedule to be successful.





 Internal candidates apply via the Career Centre on your HR Portal / ADP Workforce Now.
     

       External candidates submit cover letter & resume via www.sysco.ca/careers
     






 Our Purpose


 Connecting the world to share food and care for one another
     



 Our Mission


 Delivering success for our customers through industry-leading people, products, and solutions
     



 Our Identity


 Together we define our future of foodservice and supply chain
     




 Sysco is committed to Employment Equity. Accommodations during the recruitment process are available upon request for candidates with disabilities.
   


 Here’s a sample of the many benefits Sysco associates enjoy:


     Comprehensive Flexible Benefits including Health and Dental, Health Care Spending and Wellness Accounts • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability • Life Insurance • Company Pension Plan • Group RRSP • Employee and Family Assistance • Stock Purchase Plan • Unlimited on-line learning • Sysco product discounts • Preferred vendor discounts • Associate Resource Groups
   

     (*benefits may vary based on location or bargaining unit)

Title: Marketing Analyst – Forecasting
Description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Demand Planner in Regina, Saskatchewan.
 The Demand Planner’s primary focus will be estimating future product demand, by analyzing and maintaining a variety of metrics and data sets for construction, forestry, roadbuilding, mining and other industrial equipment across a national network of 120 retail branches in Canada, Australia and New Zealand. Forecasting inventory and sales related metrics.
Providing input for inventory stocking levels and ensuring we have the right product, in the right place at the right time .
Developing and maintaining effective forecast models based on industry trends and demand patterns.
Supporting management with risk assessments and mitigation activities

Successfully communicating forecast and inventory estimations to senior management.

Excellent analytical and communication skills.

Excellent analytical and communication skills.

Title: Data Support Analyst [Remote PST]
Description:
Our employees are central to everything we are. They do more than share remarkable talent and build pioneering AI software—they bring fresh ideas to old ways of thinking and delight our customers. That’s why we’re committed to making sure every employee at MindBridge feels appreciated. We do this by offering a robust benefits package and by creating a culture that is both inspiring and welcoming. Working at MindBridge isn’t like any other job. We’re a team of high-spirited and dynamic individuals who are passionate about using artificial intelligence to enable humans to do better. With that comes a high-drive culture where people feel valued, supported, and primed to succeed.

 As part of our Global Services - Customer Support team, you will work alongside experienced practitioners and leaders while gaining experience in all aspects of Customer Experience. You will provide customer product functionality and configuration support. Our fast-paced environment demands adaptability, curiosity and an unyielding attitude towards delivering the best possible experience to MindBridge customers.

 Are you curious if MindBridge Customer Support is for you? Do you see yourself:

In a fast-paced, thrilling and high performing tech scale-up environment?
Interested in emerging technologies and capable of sharing your knowledge of new technology quickly?
Having conversations with our exceptional customers?
Learning new things and finding creative ways to solve problems?
Helping to create something that truly matters?



 Your responsibilities will evolve as MindBridge continues to grow. In this role, you will:

Provide technical product and data support through various mediums, including online tickets, chat, email and telephone
Investigate customer incidents by ensuring the root cause is understood, documented and resolved in a timely manner
Clean, format, and transform large datasets using Python or Excel
Research, document and provide executable solutions to customer incidents, by leveraging internal tools and collaborating cross-functionally as necessary
Provide professional customer support including courteous and timely communication throughout all levels of interaction
Contribute to the creation and enhancement of incident resolution workflows, training materials, technical manuals, and technical support FAQs
Understand and translate complex product and technical concepts to non-technical customers
Collate, synthesize and present customer feedback to cross-functional teams to advocate for customers
Identify and thoroughly log defects and/or enhancements reported by customers in the defect tracking solution
Stay current on all key support topics, including product knowledge and required technical and soft skills
Participate in software/release testing as required


 To be successful in this role, you are:

Are dedicated to delivering exceptional support and exceeding customer expectations
Are data-driven and have strong analytical and problem solving skills
Able to adjust priorities on the fly and thrive in a fast-paced environment and culture
Comfortable learning complex software and delivering training to non-technical users
Can navigate complex customer organizations and manage feedback professionally
Have strong communication skills and are able to comfortably communicate with customers from a wide variety of backgrounds
Are able to recommend improvements to system usability, customer experience, and team processes
Are willing to support customer requirements that, on occasion, fall outside of normal business hours
Must be able to obtain and hold government security clearance.
May be required to travel to the Canada, US and EU



 Desired education and experience:

Must be permanently located in the PST timezone
5+ years experience in a customer facing role providing customer service, consulting, or support role in a software/technology company
3-5 years of experience with ERP systems (Netsuite, Sage, SAP, etc.)
Experience with CRMs and ticketing systems such as Jira, Zendesk, etc
Scripting or programming experience in any of the following: Python (preferred), Java, SQL, awk, Unix shell, Perl
Proficient with Microsoft Excel (formulas, formatting etc.)
Knowledge of processes, development, and operational ability in diverse ETL environments (Informatica, Datastage and/or Talend)
Commerce/Accounting/Business degree or equivalent experience required
Financial audit or accounting experience is an asset
Able to communicate with business proficiency in more than 1 language is an asset (e.g. French, German or Spanish)

Requirements contingent on employment:

Fulfill requirements necessary to obtain full background check.



 About the company
 Through the power of human-centric artificial intelligence, MindBridge Ai helps organizations deliver rapid value to their clients with deeper insights and higher risk assurance for 100% of their data. With MindBridge Ai Auditor, the world’s first AI-powered auditing solution, organizations across multiple industries are augmenting human capacity to restore confidence in their financial data.

 MindBridge is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within our workforce; achieving it is an important competitive advantage in the global marketplace. The Company has a strict policy of equal opportunity in hiring, developing, promoting and compensating employees. The company seeks to attract, retain and reward employees who perform their work to the highest standards, basing promotions on qualification and merit. We are an equal opportunity employer and as such qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, age, or veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst, Business Intelligence, Problem Management
Description:
Req Id: 378673
 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 Our Bell Business Markets team enables the digital transformation of businesses and governments nationwide through solutions in areas including Internet and private networks, voice and unified communications, contact centre, security, Internet of Things, data centre and cloud. We’re proud to be Canada’s leading provider of broadband network and communication services for businesses and governments.

 The Data Analyst, Business Intelligence, Problem Management is accountable to provide pro-active or re-active solutions for all the different aspects of problems ‘related to customers’. Our business model is highly customer-centric, with shared accountability between Service teams for managing customer issues. This seamless approach to customer service has been a key factor in achieving Industry-leading levels of customer satisfaction. Our business strategy going forward is to leverage this strong base of customer loyalty and our stream of new IP & Value Added Services. The Data Analyst plays a key role and is an integral part of the end-to-end solution.

 Responsibilities/ Accountabilities:

 Accountable to implement solutions to improve the customer experience
 Analyze, investigate and provide solutions eliminating problematic trends
 Review Post Incident Reports, provide feedback in a timely manner
 Facilitate governance review meetings with various partners (Help Desk, Network & Field Services)
 Work with internal teams, partners and suppliers to establish communication, manage expectations and make sure Problem/Incident activities are completed
 Review implemented Changes and perform trend analysis
 Meet with Incident Managers or Customer Service Area Managers on a regular basis to present results and action plans related to Problem Management activities
 Provide communications to internal business groups and executives throughout the Problems record life cycle
 Identify opportunities and creates Risk Assessments
 Incident Manager acts as the single point of contact for customer escalations and service assurance related issues


 Critical Qualifications/Competencies:

 In-depth knowledge of telecommunications industry, more specifically in the following fields: Data Center, Managed Services (Voice and IP), LAN/WAN, Applications (e-mail, client-server applications, security, file server management)
 Proven customer management skills
 Meticulous and adheres to quality delivery at all times
 Ability to deliver outstanding service in a constantly evolving environment
 Ability to work under pressure
 Strong analytical skills with deductive reasoning capabilities
 Technical know-how: advanced knowledge of Bell Business Market products and services
 Interest in acquiring technical and business knowledge relating to one or many customers
 Good oral and written communication skills
 A recognized leader with a clear track record of using teamwork to create a competitive advantage
 Leader, self-reliant and team player who can function with little supervision or direction


 Knowledge and training required:

 Preferred Electrical Engineering degree or equivalent
 Preferred Certification training in Cisco, Juniper, F5, and similar Network Vendors
 MicroStrategy, Excel, and PowerPoint


 Additional Information:
 Position Type: Management Job Status: Regular - Full Time Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Mississauga || Canada : Ontario : London || Canada : Ontario : Ottawa || Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Quebec : Verdun Flexible work profile: Mobile Application Deadline: 07/08/2022

Title: Systems Analyst
Description:
About our Team:


      E.B. Horsman & Son (EBH) has been in business since 1900. We are strong, nimble and growing! EBH is proud to be a
    

      successful Western Canadian electrical distributor with 20+ locations throughout Alberta, B.C. & Saskatchewan, and
    

      consistently recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed companies. We take pride in living our core values and carrying
    

      our mission statement of “Providing the Best People, Best Solutions, and the Best Service in the Electrical Industry.”
    


 Why Join the EBH Team?


 The Perks.

 Full benefits package
 Competitive compensation plan
 Profit-sharing
 Employee share ownership program (ESOP)
 RRSP matching after 1 year of employment
 Birthday day off


 The People & Culture. You will be a part of a collaborative team with people you can be proud to work with.
 Continuous Development. You will have access to our EBH University for personal & professional development. Training & Development has been an essential part of our culture. Increasing our knowledge not only builds confidence but empowers growth through learning.


 About the Opportunity:

 We are experiencing an exciting growth trajectory at E.B Horsman, which creates new opportunities for entrepreneurial and self-driven individuals who are looking to make a meaningful and empowering impact to drive our company forward.
 We are looking for an experienced Systems Analyst, with a "can do" attitude, primarily responsible for all aspects of the ERP enterprise application lifecycle, including coordination with user groups to identify solutions that improve business processes, implementing process and system changes, system maintenance and maintaining an application roadmap. This role will be reporting directly to the VP, Technology and Digital Solutions.

 Position Type/Schedule


      This is a full-time position with the ability to work remotely.
    


 Work Location


      Head Office, Surrey BC
    

 Key Responsibilities:

 Coordinate, test, and implement improvements, updates, and other integrated solutions to the ERP
 Provide technical help, support, and management of the incident and request workflow for the ERP application and other enterprise business applications
 Review, troubleshoot, resolve and/or escalate system errors and technical issues to vendor if required
 Interact with vendor on issues requiring technical assistance requests for ERP or other enterprise business systems
 Research, document and resolve technical issues related to the ERP and business processes
 Perform user access and role provisioning
 Work with business teams to analyze problems and gather solution requirements
 Create, maintain, update and improve system/administrative and user level documentation
 Collaborates with technical and subject matter experts to analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs
 Manage application maintenance (coordinating patching, patching cycles, maintenance downtime, performance with ERP software) and administration tasks
 Collaborate with internal stakeholders to provide support for applications and implementation / enhancement projects
 Evaluate new software functionality and suggest system enhancements to achieve optimum system performance and to streamline processes
 Manages and optimizes integrations through API middleware and other application such as EDI
 Other duties as assigned


 You bring the following skills/qualifications:


 8+ Years of equivalent business analyst/systems analyst experience
 5+ Years of business analyst/systems analyst with Epicor Prophet 21 ERP or similar type of ERP
 Fundamental understanding of ERP processes and their dependencies within the application including finance, purchasing, inventory management, warehouse operations and customer service
 Solid understanding of relational databases, entity-relationship diagrams, data normalization, data analytics, data migrations, business intelligence
 Expertise in SQL databases is required
 Knowledge of systems analysis, software development practices, agile methodology
 PM expertise and certification considered an asset
 Firm understanding of basic accounting, business, and wholesale distribution principles
 Excellent analytical and technical skills
 Strong listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
 Excellent documentation skills


 Our Core Values: Celebrating the Past, Empowering the Future
 Teamwork & Collaboration | Integrity| Commitment | Reliability | Initiative | Continuous Improvement
 Take Your Next Step With EBH
 If you believe your skillset matches the above description and are an enthusiastic, innovative, passionate and energetic individual we would like to hear from you. Please visit our website to apply for this posting www.ebhorsman.com/careers or click “Apply” on this posting.
 Our Commitment to Inclusion & Diversity
 E.B Horsman & Son is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is a key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose E.B. Horsman & Son as your employer of choice.
 We thank all interested applicants. However, we are only able to work with those who live in Canada and have permanent working status. Please note that only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Assignment Category
 Nuclear Power
 Assignment Type
 Contract >1 year
 Location
 Tiverton, Ontario






 Representing Strategic Way Consulting, this assignment is at our Client location situated on the Lake Huron shoreline between the towns of Kincardine and Saugeen Shores. We are looking for a detail-oriented, methodical, and collaborative Data Analyst to join our growing team of driven professionals. Working in a dynamic and fast pace environment this individual will be required to be responsive, take initiative, manage multiple priorities and work with minimal direction.
 Assignment Details
 Experience

Minimum 3-5 years working as a Data Analyst or similar role
Proficient in SQL Server
Minimum 3 years of experience in data visualization tools, Power BI
Knowledge of data access through various connectors (ODBC, Excel Power Query, APIs)
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure, considered an asset
Understanding of Maximo ERP software considered an asset

Skills Required

Analyze data using audit, statistical and other methods.
Create reports to share your findings and recommendations
Collaborate with leaders and managers to determine and address data and reporting needs
Create statistical models that depict overall outage trends
Perform testing and validation of data sets for audit purposes
Derive insight from data and explain how it can be leveraged it to improve and streamline processes as well as identify areas of concern within transactional data
Document structures and types of business data.
Produce easy-to-understand data analysis reports for management
Ability to identify useful information in data sets and suggest conclusions that support decision making
Excellent analytical ability and business acumen to collect multiple sources of data and draw conclusions
Query and mine large data sets to identify patterns and trends that are indicative of potential issues using traditional as well as predictive/advanced analytic methodologies
Strong analytical capabilities.
Expert with Microsoft Excel, Active Data, Power BI and various business intelligence and analytical tools such as CaseWare IDEA or ACL.
Understanding of data gathering, inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modeling/diagramming techniques.
Communication skills with the ability to distill complex subjects to a wider audience
Excellent leadership, collaboration, and project management skills
Keen attention to detail.
Ability to learn new tools with minimum guidance and work independently.
Willingness to make decisions and solve problems
Demonstrated aptitude to prioritize tasks based on comparative importance and urgency
Professional business communications
Ability to sort through high task demand (often through email or ad-hoc requests), and stay focused on core deliverables
High level of organization, accountability and proactivity
Ability to work with minimal supervision and direction
Previous experience working in a nuclear power plant is preferred

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, information technology, or related field
Valid nuclear site security clearance is considered an asset

If you are interested in this opportunity and would like to learn more, please submit your resume to hr@strategicway.ca.
 We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those selected to move forward will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location:



 Calgary, AB

 Intern

 MQJOB-1110-0317-2021




Our ideal candidate for the position of Data Analyst will have database knowledge as well as previous experience with Linux and Mac. They will also have a solid understanding of SQL, preferably in PostgreSQL or MySQL. Duties will involve working solely on our newest product, SokoLocal, performing crawls on local websites, validating websites and content for eligibility, and maintaining crawl reports and results. Self QA (extensive and repetitive testing, not simply unit testing) of all development is a key ingredient of what we do at Mobility Quotient. Involvement in every aspect of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) by every member of the team is expected. Our employees have passion and initiative and a desire to learn and improve at every level. Dedication and commitment are essential and rewarded. 
Qualifications
Education & Experience

Working towards a bachelor’s degree in computer science or geomatics related discipline

Skills

Working knowledge of databases
Proficient with SQL
Understanding of LINUX, HTML, AJAX, JSON
Experience with content management systems (CMS)
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently.
Enthusiasm to work in a fast-paced and dynamically changing environment.

Nice-To-Haves

Knowledge of PHP, PHP Storm, Tower and Mac
Experience with JSON-LD, oEmbed, Microdata, Open Graph, Woo Commerce APIs

Apply Today
 Applications for this position must be submitted to careers@mobilityquotient.com with the subject line 'Data Analyst'


 About MQ
 Mobility Quotient (MQ) is a full-service digital agency based in Calgary, Alberta. We provide digital strategy, software development, marketing and design services to innovate and solve the business challenges of our global client base. Operating for over 10 years, our clients come from various industries including automotive, retail, media, publishing, tech and finance. Our recipe for success is simple: we work diligently with our clients to understand their business needs, challenges and goals. Then we create a best-fit strategy that works within their designated budget and act to enhance their revenue opportunities, accelerate project implementation, curate elegant solutions to complex problems, and most importantly to achieve their goals. We offer our skills and services to businesses who desire progress, efficiency and change. We design. We code. We build and support digital brands. 
 Unparalleled Experience
 Our team has worked on a variety of digital projects, ranging from small WordPress websites for start-up businesses to large-scale, connected digital ecosystems (comprised of massive websites, mobile apps, numerous properties, multiple third-party platforms, and custom-built features) for global digital publishers who serve millions of daily users. Our notable client base includes two widely known digital publishers which serve millions of daily readers in the United States: A $7 billion-dollar global automotive leader whose executive team required fast-tracked workflow optimization and mobile development, and a New York-based private equity team that relied on MQ for their three largest acquisitions and subsequent profitable turnarounds. Our technical proficiency, along with our ability to integrate with existing development processes and technologies, is what sets MQ apart from many other agencies. Our commitment, dedication and experience are why management and development teams grow to trust and rely on us to transform their business. 
 History
 Incorporated in 2009, Mobility Quotient has been helping corporate teams and leaders achieve success through a solution-oriented approach to technology & software development. From their first client in early 2010 to the launch of in-house products like JustBeer, MQ has serviced over 80 clients, worked collaboratively with over five fortune-100 companies and developed multiple websites and apps which currently serves over 75 million monthly users around the world.

Title: Crime Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities: 
Under the direction of the Manager i/c Strategic Services, the Crime Analyst is responsible for researching, collating and interpreting data through effective analytical processes, relating to crime patterns, trends and intelligence and within investigations and problem solving initiatives. This work assists decision makers in appropriately setting strategic directions while effectively allocating and deploying resources.
(1) Acts as a resource for evaluating, interpreting, analyzing, and researching crime trends and patterns with the ability to provide products to front line operations, investigative projects, special projects, intelligence files/projects, problem solving efforts, planning and research studies, and administrative and organizational planning.
(2) Act as a liaison between RPS and other law enforcement agencies, partners and analysts to gather information relevant to the criminal environment in Regina, including risk factors, movement of criminals, threat assessments to the community and identification of cross jurisdictional crimes.
(3) Submit updated crime information to management on crime patterns and risks in a timely manner;
(4) Prepares and delivers well-written reports, briefings and presentations in a timely manner;
(5) Develop and deliver presentations to police personnel, outside agencies and partners.
(6) Collects, evaluates, analyzes and monitors current and historical crime trends and patterns to forecast future crime events, and assists in developing corresponding crime reduction strategies.
(7) Develops profiles for persons (e.g., victims, suspects, gangs), incidents (e.g., vehicles, stolen property, MOs), geographical areas (e.g., beats, zones, city); and develops suspect link analysis to assist in allocation of resources and development of strategies.
(8) Acts as resource person in criminal investigation projects, providing data to assist in direction, tactics and resource allocation decisions. Collect, evaluate, organize and analyze a wide variety of investigative and intelligence data to identify, monitor and map trends, patterns, series, developments, offenders and subjects of interest. Based on these findings, prepare strategic and tactical assessments, forecasts, recommendations and action plans.
(9) Integrates information using existing computerized data sources, intelligence gathered, interviews with officers and other relevant sources. Maintains, analyzes and interprets a variety of statistical data, historical trends and cases. Develops a variety of presentation material for use in investigations. Identify gaps in investigations that may provide leads to investigators.
(10) Applies statistical analysis to data collected to identify anomalies, draw conclusions and make inferences with respect to future crime activities.
(11) Maintain and monitor current developments in the field of analysis, technology and investigative methods related to crime analysis.
(12) May be required to testify in court.
(13) Other related duties as required.
Competencies: 
(1) Education: Bachelor’s degree in Criminal Justice, the social sciences or a Bachelor’s degree or graduate certificate in Forensic Science & Technology – Crime and intelligence Analysis with minimum two years of related analytical experience which must include applied research preferably in law enforcement or government OR Master’s degree in social sciences with strong emphasis on research methodology.
(2) Work Experience: Two years of related work experience in policing or public administration that includes autonomous research, statistical analysis, report writing, presentations or other similar work.
(3) Willing to attend and successfully complete Strategic Intelligence Analysis Course (Canadian Police College), Tactical Intelligence Analysis Course (Canadian Police College), ACIIS (Automated Criminal Intelligence Information System) and CPIC (Canadian Police Information Centre) Course.
(4) Computer Applications: A good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), with experience in using analytical, mapping and/or other similar software. The ability to utilize social media platforms and conduct a range of open-source searching is an asset. An understanding of internal police databases and the ability to work with analytical software products is a must.
(5) Communication: Through presentations and written work, demonstrates an effective and accurate ability to communicate findings, conclusions and recommendations.
(6) Research: Knowledge of sound research and analytical methodologies with a demonstrated ability to compile and analyze data through well-structured reports.
(7) Must be able to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.
(8) Able to exercise independent judgement and action in executing work expectations and a wide variety of skill in data analysis, technology, telephone analysis, financial analysis, etc.
(9) Must be able to pass RCMP Security Screening and obtain Reliability status with the RCMP. (Canadian citizenship is required for this level of clearance.)
NOTE: Candidates may be required to work modified shifting patterns. All outside candidates must undergo security screening.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $68,617.00-$85,869.00 per year
Benefits:

Company pension
Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site gym
On-site parking
Tuition reimbursement
Vision care
Wellness program

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-06-30

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Background
Northwestern Polytechnic, Canada’s newest polytechnic, aspires to be the most entrepreneurial polytechnic in Canada by 2034. We are recruiting individuals who spark creativity, drive innovation, are highly engaged and are eager to embrace our core values: innovation & responsiveness. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, one who is willing to turn risk into opportunity, Northwestern is your employer of choice. A recently aligned strategic plan identifies 1, 3, 5, and 10-year goals, tactics and actions that will ensure Canada’s newest polytechnic will be the most entrepreneurial in Canada.
The Role
Under the direction of the Manager, Institutional Planning and Research, the Research Analyst will play a central role in the production of standard and customized data reports to help advance strategic planning and evidence-based decision-making at Northwestern Polytechnic. The position will also conduct primary and secondary research into labour market and student demand to support program development, conduct research studies utilizing the Polytechnic's student information systems, support government compliance reporting, and support the deployment of the Polytechnic core institutional surveys and evaluation research efforts.
The primary responsibilities of this role include but are not limited to three core areas:

Reporting and Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and produce reports
Research Services: Conduct surveys, labour market analyses, student demand analyses
Government Accountability: Support government reporting activities

 This is a full-time permanent position. Salary range from $47,652 to $67,860 as per Employee Association agreement.
What We Offer
NWP offers lifelong learning opportunities through professional development & wellness programs, a competitive salary and compensation package and a student-centered culture that is vital to our community. Consider joining Canada’s newest polytechnic, committed to be the most entrepreneurial polytechnic by 2034.


  Job Requirements 
 

The successful candidate will have completed a minimum of two-year post-secondary studies in the Social Sciences, Business, Computer Science or related field and must include courses in data analysis, social science or market research methodology, and statistics. In addition, a minimum of two years of relevant experience related to social science research and report writing is required.
Necessary skills and attributes to be successful in this role include:

Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook;
Demonstrated data visualization skills using Excel Charts, Pivot Charts, and slicers; experience using Tableau or Power BI is a definite asset
Demonstrated data analysis skills using Pivot Tables, Power Pivot; experience with R/RStudio, SPSS/SPSS Syntax is a definite asset
Experience conducting surveys using Qualtrics, Survey Monkey or Lime Survey
Demonstrated ability to produce timely, reliable, and accurate analytics and reports.
Extremely high level of attention to detail, data integrity, and accuracy.
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple and changing priorities, meet deadlines with minimal supervision, follow instructions, and maintain confidentiality.
Must possess a client-service orientation.

 How to Apply
Only applications received electronically via the Northwestern Polytechnic website will be considered.
All applicants must submit a cover letter.
We review all applications to select candidates whose qualifications and experience most closely meet our needs.
Only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. For general inquiries, please contact HR at humanresources@nwpolytech.ca.
Thank you for applying to Northwestern Polytechnic!

Title: Claims Reporting Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Claims Reporting Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity? 
As a Claims Reporting Analyst, you will provide reporting and analytics support to for the Life and Health Claims Department at RBC Insurance. You will be responsible for ensuring the effectiveness and efficiency of reporting while creating high quality analyses and insights. The role will focus heavily on the timely and accurate delivery of data, information and insight to the end user. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you.

 What will you do? 

Perform deep dive analyses of the Life & Health department data to generate actionable client insights reporting
Design business analysis utilizing recording systems for use throughout the Life & Health department.
Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports.
Create business reports that provide insight into key data points.
Communicate and provide the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to internal leadership team.
Collaborate with key partners across the organization to gather data/ insights to advance Life and Health Department targets


 What will you need to succeed? 
Must Have

3 to 5 years of insurance or analytics experience
University and or post-graduate degree
Strategic, innovative and analytical thinker with the ability to process complex information
Analytical skills that allow for the development of data-driven reports and strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively relate data to coworkers

Ability to quickly adapt to changing circumstances and competing priorities

Demonstrated ability to manage time and prioritize projects to meet deadlines
BI Tool development and Python proficiency
Tendency to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow


 What's in it for you? 

A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans
Competitive pay and high-earning potential
