Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst
About Foxquilt
Foxquilt is a leading North American Insurance technology company focused on providing small businesses insurance. Foxquilt develops, underwrites and distributes a complete line of its own commercial insurance products in the United States and Canada. The company uses a combination of data analytics and artificial intelligence to recommend the best insurance coverage and price to meet the individual needs of its small business customers.
About YouDo you want to make a big impact and grow with one of North America’s leading Insurtech organizations?
You are a curious, self-driven, and entrepreneurial Tech leader with proven analytical skills with strong attention to detail. You bring a minimum of 3 years of experience in Software Development as an engineer or BA with exposure to platform development in a SaaS transactional environment.
About The Role
Foxquilt is a leading Insurance technology company focused on empowering small businesses and B2B networks to save on small business insurance. We’re introducing new products to the market that finally provide businesses with greater value and buying power. We are rapidly expanding our geographic footprint across North America.You will be a subject matter expert (SME) for the company's products; you will be involved in, but not limited to, business analysis, technical requirements, product management, vendor relations, testing, and partnering with software engineers in executing the product roadmap.At Foxquilt, we are as committed to your growth and development as you are, and this role will have plenty of opportunities to learn and advance in your career.
Location: Toronto-based (hybrid work environment, 1-2 days in-office, 3-4 days remote)
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Be involved in analysis, product management, including managing business requirements, technical specifications, and customer experience
Coordinate backlog grooming and sprint planning
Manage vendor relations, communicate across various stakeholders and team members
Participate in customer-facing engagements and/or content production
Conduct research, business analysis and create documentation
Develop and maintain product roadmap based on customer inputs, strategic planning, and priorities of the business
Collaborate with key stakeholders to lead commercialization based on requirement; pricing, licensing, margin, sales, marketing, and strategize product positioning
Develop business and functional specification documents for product enhancements in support of product initiatives
Create, prioritize, and maintain user stories for products
Partner with software engineers and business/product teams to drive roadmap execution, including testing & data analysis

Education & Experience

Degree in Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Accounting or a related discipline
Minimum of 3 years of experience in Software Development as an engineer or BA
Experience using JIRA, Confluence, GitHub, and Slack
Prior involvement in platform development in SaaS-based environments
Technical skills: XML, JSON, CSV - experience in reading, writing, and debugging
Knowledge of Database: SQL or NoSQL - experience to run queries, performing analysis, and debugging problems
Read code, test functionally, and reproduce any issues reliably.

Additional Qualities

Ability to make decisions in a fast-paced work environment
Ability to manage conflict, ambiguity and embrace change
Exceptional communication skills in dealing with business as well as technical audiences - no one should have to “translate” for you
Be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the company’s products
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills with the ability to identify trends, establish benchmarks and provide credible analysis and business recommendations
Be hands-on and pitch in as needed as the company, product platform, and team scales up rapidly

What do we offer?

Competitive compensation
Equity in Foxquilt (Employee Stock Options)
Flexible health and dental benefits
An extra day off on your birthday!
Casual dress-code
Opportunity to work with a talented, supportive, extremely diverse team
Social events, regular celebrations of milestones, and birthdays!
Flexible work environment, with opportunities to work from home
Fun, friendly, diverse, social, and collaborative environment
A place to grow and advance in your career

How do you apply for this position?
Please apply here directly with your resume and cover letter.
Foxquilt Insurance Services Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages applications from qualified candidates of all abilities who bring diverse backgrounds, skills, experiences, and ideas. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process upon request. If you require accommodation, please contact Anjan Ravi, People Operations & Culture Lead.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Inventory Control Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Inventory Control Analyst 

Department: Procurement 


POSITION SUMMARY:
 Reporting to the Supervisor, the Inventory Control Analyst is responsible to coordinate and perform daily cycle counts and manage inventory accuracy for the site. The analyst is responsible to investigate and resolve discrepancies and make the necessary adjustments in system. 


POSITION RESPONSIBILITES:
 Daily Inventory Cycle Counts 



Oversee daily cycle counts in conjunction with cycle counter to investigate and resolve issues as needed.
Monitor and report inventory variance issues, document all inventory discrepancies and adjust records.
Obtain the required approval and process adjustments in the system.
Report inventory accuracy and location accuracy for the daily meeting and trend monthly and YTD results.
 Inventory Analysis 



Monitor and coordinate “balanced out” inventories (e.g., those items affected by changes in artwork design and changes in material or shape).
Use a problem-solving method to determine root cause and prevent reoccurrence of inventory accuracy problems.
Review mold management report to flag any potential warehouse utilization risks to scheduling team
Optimize inventory control procedures and partner with IT to develop and enhance inventory reporting
Perform User Acceptance testing for technology developments related to inventory data and systems
Analyze and process inventory obsolescence
Review slow moving and obsolete inventory and collaborate with cross functional departments to minimize waste
Monitor Intercompany transfers on weekly basis and resolve discrepancies
Collaborate with US site and cross functional departments to benchmark best practices and drive continuous improvement in processes, controls and efficiency.
Lead physical count of inventory when deemed necessary.
 Pallet Management and Materials Planning 



Maintain optimum levels of pallet and material inventories.
Conduct daily count of pallet inventory and reconcile with Finance to maintain accurate records
Liaise with Accounting, Sales and Customer Service to confirm customer on hand inventories and collection of pallets.
Review on hand inventories of pallets and place orders as required.
Daily review of cardboard box, labels and shrink sleeve inventories
Act as backup for day shift Lead to manage pallet rental charge reconciliation
 Other 



Participate in the Continuous Improvement Program.
Complete special projects as required.
Must follow food safety and cGMP processes and procedures – training is provided

SKILLS/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Educational Requirements: Post-secondary education, preferably in Inventory Control 

Minimum Experience/Field: Minimum 2 years of inventory control experience in a fast paced, high volume lean manufacturing environment. Experience in plastics and/or food packaging industry preferred 

Computer Skills: Good PC skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and MRPII systems. 


Physical Requirements: Must be able to stand for long periods of time for manufacturing related activities including physical inventory and cycle counts. 

Communication Skills: Proven track record working with people and problem resolution and strong interpersonal, collaboration skills 

Additional Education/Experience/Skills: Experience with Procure to Pay systems would be a plus 


CORE COMPETENCIES FOR THIS POSITION:


Ability to multitask in a fast paced, growth environment with many competing priorities and deadlines.
Strong understanding of Computers and Software.to seek alternatives before determining best solutions
Strong team working skills.
Proven effective planning skills.
Knowledge of pull inventory systems.
Solid understanding of lean concepts.
Good analytical skills.
 Polytainers is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Polytainers is committed to diversity and inclusivity in employment and welcomes applications from qualified individuals of diverse backgrounds. Polytainers is also committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst
We are currently looking to add a dynamic, detail-orientated person to team as a Data Analyst. Reporting directly to Bartle & Gibson’s Director of eCommerce & Marketing, you will support Best Plumbing & Lighting’s eCommerce needs.
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Microsoft excel as well as the ability to work with tables and scripting. This person will possess good communication skills and the ability to work independently on assigned tasks.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Upkeep existing PIM database(s)
Creation of scripts via Filemaker Pro (Claris)
Assistance with the normalization of data populated into excel files
Mapping of appropriate product information to relevant stock keeping units
Reformatting (in excel) of appropriate file attributes to match template files
Marketing analytics as required for projects like eCommerce

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Efficient time management skills including prioritizing, organizing, and planning effectively to meet goals and deadlines
Self-motivated; able to function effectively both independently and as a member of a tea
Proven ability to learn quickly and work effectively in a fast-paced work environment
Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills, both verbal and written
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills; ability to make quick decisions
Present a professional image at all times to customers and vendors
Talent to communicate professionally in a clear and direct manner
Attention to detail; ability to maintain a high level of accuracy in preparing and entering information. Proficient in using a personal computer, data entry terminal, and other common office equipment and software
Work effectively with other members of the team

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

College diploma in Business or equivalent education and/or experience
Extensive Microsoft Excel experience
Knowledge of management information systems (tables and relationships)
Experience in Filemaker Pro (FM19 | Claris) would be considered an asset
Ability to learn ERP software
Analytical thinker
Strong organizational skills
Detail-Orientated
Independent worker
Must be an effective communicator
Appropriate training will be provided with regard to additional programs that may be required for the position.

WHY WORK FOR US

Company paid benefits
Profit sharing
RRSP match
Career growth

Title: Analyst, Data Engineering (Integratons & Operations)
Description:
Job ID : 963 

Closing Date : 07/08/2022 

Job Category : Corporate 

Location : NOVA Head Office, Corunna Site, Geismar Site, Joffre Administration, Manufacturing East Corporate Center, Pittsburgh Corporate Admin, Red Deer Executive Place 
Relocation will be considered for this position. 
Compensation will be commensurate with education and experience. 


Who We Are:
 NOVA Chemicals develops and manufactures plastic resins and other petrochemical products that make everyday life safer, healthier and easier. Our employees take pride in our focus on safety and social responsibility by working together to ensure health, safety, security and environmental stewardship through our commitment to sustainability, ESG, and Responsible Care®. NOVA Chemicals, headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, is wholly-owned by Mubadala Investment Company of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. 
NOVA Chemicals helps shape a world where products vital to our health and happiness are even better tomorrow than they are today. We are seeking talented and passionate people who enjoy working in a collaborative, innovative environment to join our dynamic team. 

 We are seeking two enthusiastic and passionate professionals who are experienced Data Engineering Analysts. The successful candidates will be experts in building elegant and scalable data products that serve critical, up-to-date, structured information to support different types of analytics within NOVA. As a core contributor to our burgeoning data engineering efforts, you'll design and own mission-critical data pipelines to enable decision-making, all the way from enabling effective A/B testing to reporting enterprise metrics. NOVA Chemicals data and analytics strategy is focused on innovation and leveraging cloud services to meet the rapidly evolving needs of our business. You will help the team evolve NOVA Chemicals enterprise data and analytics platform, building data solutions using new and emerging technologies while maintaining stability of the platform. The ideal candidate will get a chance to work with diverse datasets and be on the cutting edge of transforming the way NOVA captures, processes, stores and visualizes data. 


You Will Use Your Expertise To:
 Deliver data pipelines, architectures, and data sets through in-depth knowledge of Model and Design of DB schemas for read and write performance . Implement data ingestion techniques (real time and batch) using best practices in data modelling, ETL/ELT processes by leveraging Azure technologies and big data tools . Design, build, develop, and maintain data transformation pipelines consolidating various data sources (streaming or batch) into specific Data Lakes / Data Warehouses / Lake house . Collaborate with engineers to help adopt best practices in data system creation, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation . Develop prototype or "proof of concept" implementations of projects where the technical solution is unknown or unproven . A ssess, document, and implement technologies and approaches for ingestion, transformation, and storage . Work in a team environment, interacting with multiple groups (very strong communication skills) . Build and use effective metrics and monitoring processes . Support operational day-to-day activities. 


What We Are Looking For:
 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent with a minimum of 8+ years related experience and continued professional development. Experienced software development professional who has deep understanding of data engineering principles and experience leading data engineering projects . Display proficiency in at least one major language ( e.g. Python, Scala, Ruby) and SQL, as well as strive to write elegant and maintainable code, and feel comfortable picking up new technologies . At least 3 years of experience with Data Integrations and Operations in Cloud (Azure preferably) . Experience with streaming and batch big data tools: Event Hub, IoTHub , Azure Data Factory . Experience building several data pipelines and the infrastructure required to deploy data models and dashboards that allow data visualization . Experience in SAP suite of products (S4/HANA, BW, SAC, SAP Cloud). Expertise in Azure Data Platforms ( SQL, ADLS, ADX, Synapse, AzureML ) . Familiar with Azure DevOps Scrum work management practices. Expertise in leveraging automation for testing and delivery. Drive to tell stories with data (actionable, creative, accurate, flexible). You are a self-starter and can drive projects with minimum supervision . A safety minded individual to support and maintain a positive safety culture by following all safety policies and procedures and actively contributing to a safe working environment. 


You Can Stand Out If: You are passionate about driving a Fact Driven mindset and culture in a fast-paced, challenging environment where you get the opportunity to work with a spectrum of tools and technologies to drive forward “ Data Insights ”. You are responsible by practicing Responsible Care® in your day-to-day work to ensure safety, health, and environmental stewardship, which is the cornerstone of NOVA Chemicals culture. You are innovative and eager to experiment with new ideas and technologies by measuring the impact of emerging technologies and recommend improvements. You are collaborative by aligning yourself on team goals and being deliberately inclusive to encourage every voice of the team. 


Additional Information: This position may be located at any NOVA Chemicals location in Canada or the United States. Relocation will be considered for this position. A valid driver’s license is required for this position. Travel to other NOVA Chemicals locations will be required. 

 Why NOVA Chemicals? 
NOVA Chemicals’ flexible benefit programs are designed to meet the diverse needs of our employees, because when it comes to benefits, everyone has different priorities. Our benefits offerings will vary based on your work location, and are an element of the “Total Rewards” package used to reward employees. 


Check Us Out Online:
 Follow us on Twitter and Instagram for company news. 
Follow us on Linkedin and Glassdoor for job updates. 
Read more on our Responsible Care ® and sustainability initiatives like Project STOP. 
​​​​​​​ 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability. 
Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

Title: Senior Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Customer Data Analyst to join our team. This individual will play a critical role within the Decision Support - Customer Insights team, reporting into the manager of this function. This team works on strategic projects to drive customer engagement across the organization. This is a high-profile role that often supports the Senior Executive team and works with other cross-unfunctional teams in the organization. 
What you will do 
You will provide proactive insights on customer behaviour to support key stakeholders across the organization. You have the curiosity, skills, and abilities to formulate actionable insights for business stakeholders and to synthesize information across a broad ecosystem to enable data-driven decision making. You will identify opportunities to drive customer engagement that will lead to increased revenue or reduced expense. You are a team player with strong communication skills and with a collaborative spirit. You can network at all levels and have a genuine curiosity that improves your understanding of projects. 
In this role, you will: 

Derive Customer Insights : Perform customer analytics, including developing models and advanced analytical processes. This includes understanding how our customers are shopping in our stores and what products they are purchasing. 
Interpret Data: Extract, manipulate and interpret data to isolate on key trends. Summarize the results into concise and informative reports that business partners across the organization can easily interpret. 
Improve Customer Profitability : Establish a strong understanding of customer profitability and financial performance to find creative ways to maximize profitability and customer engagement within our portfolio. 
Influence through data driven storytelling: Influence executives and cross-functional teams by creating presentations using data story-telling and sound insights. 
Innovate : Challenge the status quo through innovation of existing tools and processes. 
Build Models : Develop customer models which provide Marketing and Loyalty teams with alternative approaches to increase engagement and entanglement within retail banners. 

What you bring 

B.S. in Business, Engineering, Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science 
2+ years of professional work experience in data domain 
Able to turn insights into actionable opportunities through strong storytelling and visualizations 
Advance knowledge of SQL to perform complex data analysis 
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and Power Point 
Excellent written and oral communication skills 
Curiosity and strong problem-solving skills 
Balance of technical and business acumen, including modeling and strategic business case development 

Nice to have: 

SAS, Python, or another language to transform and process data 
Big Query: experience with cloud databases such as Google Cloud or Snowflake 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It is more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn . 
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibly embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 


  Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Finance & Admin 
 

  Ontario-Oakville 
 

  Permanent 
 

  Full-time

Title: Senior Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description:
About Us 

 The Ontario Cannabis Store provides safe, responsible access to recreational cannabis for adults 19 and older. We operate online store for recreational cannabis in Ontario and we are the provincial wholesaler of cannabis for private retail stores. Working at the OCS is a unique opportunity to be part of an agile start-up in a ground-breaking new industry. 

 We’re a diverse team passionate about delivering a great customer experience, working together with mutual respect and building value out of our differences. We’re an inclusive organization that understands that delivering great results comes out of ensuring every voice is heard. 

 About the Role 
We’re looking for a Senior Supply Chain Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain department to support the transformation of data into insights and intelligence that drives decisions. This is an exciting opportunity to leverage your 5+ years of experience in data mining, analysis and visualization. The Senior Supply Chain Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting the development and maintenance of business facing reports. 

 The Senior Supply Chain Data Analyst will manage reporting requirements, convert existing data extract procedures to meet the standards of Supply Chain reporting. In this role, you will manage data visualization tools such as Power BI in a cloud or server environment. As a Senior Supply Chain Data Analyst, you will support departmental goals including driving standardization, data cleansing and ensuring data accuracy on the Microsoft SQL server. 

 As a Senior Supply Chain Data Analyst, you will play a fundamental role in company-wide breakthrough initiatives, will partner directly with cross-functional team members and will also act as Subject Matter Expert (SME) to guide other Data Analysts. 

 About Your Day 


Design the conceptual, logical, and physical data models necessary to support the analytic data requirements for supply chain reporting needs
Write & run SQL queries to pull data from multiple databases
Analyze supply chain data, identify trends, and create reports, dashboards or visualizations with the data using Power BI DAX (Data Analysis Expressions)
Create, maintain & verify accuracy of dashboards, and data tables/views on a SQL Microsoft server for use by the whole department to make business decisions from
Create reports & data visualizations to meet business requirements/specifications, including for senior leadership
Identify continuous improvement opportunities and provide recommendations to leader
Utilize computer systems and databases in order to research and analyze unexpected or emerging data/trends
Partner with Data Engineers to implement and support production of analytical data models
Provide guidance and share expertise with other project team members to support breakthrough business initiatives
Act as a subject matter expert regarding Supply Chain Data and share best practices & knowledge with other Data Analysts
 About You 


Completion of post-secondary education in statistics or related field of study OR equivalent combination of experience and post-secondary education
5+ years of professional experience in data analyst role with a focus on using hard data/metrics, statistical techniques, and root cause analysis to support business
Intermediate knowledge of Oracle or Microsoft SQL, and Supply Chain systems (e.g. WMS, ERP or F&R)
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Power BI (creating dashboards and reports)
Expert knowledge of Power BI DAX (Data Analysis Expressions)
Able to analyze data and interpret the results
Cross-functional project experience with demonstrated partnerships with Data Engineers to implement and support production of analytical data models
Strong problem-solving skills and experience in training Data Analysts and other team members
Strong computer skills including knowledge of Excel, Word, Access, etc
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Proven analytical skills with strong attention to detail
 About the Job 


City: Toronto, ON
Employment Type: Permanent Full Time
Required Travel: Rare, usually within the GTA
Application Deadline: June 30, 2022 at 11:59pm
 Remote Work 



This position offers a Hybrid work schedule. You will be required to be in the office a minimum of 1 day each week, with the ability to work from home for the remaining workdays (subject to specific business needs requiring office attendance).
When working from home, a reliable internet connection is required. Remote work is supported with cloud-based applications and collaboration tools (i.e., MS Teams)
 We are committed to providing an accessible, equitable and inclusive candidate and employee experience. We provide reasonable accommodation throughout the recruitment process and in employment. If you require an accommodation, please let us know, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Observability IT Business Analyst
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.











     About the role
     










Intact Financial Corporation (IFC) is the largest provider of property and casualty (P&C) insurance in Canada and a leading provider of specialty insurance in North America. The IT component of this success is associated with an increasingly complex and innovative technological landscape.
The ability to effectively establish the state of core systems and services, prevent and resolve problems, assess performance and user experience across the IT ecosystem and up to the end user is both challenging and essential. The Observability Center of Excellence plays a leading role in the enablement and achievement of this objective.
As Business Analyst for the OCoE, you’ll actively contribute to the conception, evolution and revision of the Observability governance and associated processes. Moreover, you will play a key role in developing and documenting the Center’s public and private knowledge bases for the benefit of the internal community.
You will collaborate closely with the members of the OCoE, the product owner, the architecture departments, management and the various IT groups and clients.
The ideal candidate will have a comprehensive understanding of IT governance, processes, and familiarity with IT monitoring
Responsibilities:

Analyze, conceive, and modify processes in function of expected results and value
Gather data and analyze the needs and requirements of the business and users
Redact, review and recommend modification to the OCoE’s documentation
Facilitate user onboarding and new process integration through detailed material
Maintain constant alignment and deep understanding of the OCoE’s direction and of the associated ressources
Be a liaison between with the user community and other departements
Act as a reference on the topics of Observability and associated governance
Ensure the continuous improvement of the OCoE’s processes
Create detailed business analysis outlining problems, opportunities, and solutions for the business
Provide cost analysis and forecasting
Produce extensive reporting
Identify and resolve project issues
Evaluate and address the impacts and implications of changes
Ensure requirements are met, reviewed and validated over the course of initiatives












     Qualifications
     










Qualities:

Excellent oral and written communication skills
Interpersonal and consultative aptitude
Effective facilitation
Analytical thinking and problem solving
Organizational skills
Process modeling
Understanding IT stack, monitoring, observability and SRE

Skills

Solid understanding of high availability principles, system observability and incident management
Aptitude with financial analysis
Understanding IT security considerations
Understanding of key SRE terms: SLA / SLO / SLI, error budget etc.
Demonstrable expertise of Project Management fundamentals
Good knowledge and acumen of IT Technology fundamentals and solutions
Proficiency with collaboration tools (e.g., JIRA Agile, Teams, Yammer, Confluence)
Outstanding communication, presentation and faciliation skills
Excellent organizational and meeting coordination skills
Analytical and synthesizing skills
Ability to create dashboards/reports in tools (PowerBI, Grafana, Jira)
Ability to produce documents that are clear, concise, and well structured
Ability to prioritize activities in the face of competing demands
Experience working across organizational boundaries on a local and global basis
(Asset) Experience with Observability and monitoring solutions (Dynatrace, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Prometheus, InfluxDB, Grafana, Microfocus, …)
(Asset) Experience with JIRA, Confluence and similar tools
(Asset) Good understanding of software and infrastructure architecture
(Asset) Good knowledge of Data & Analytics


 Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

Title: Data Analyst, Embedded Systems
Description:
Who we are:
  


 Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified “Great Place to Work™.” We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.
  


 Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab’s open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.
  


 Our team is growing and we’re looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.
   




   Geotab cares about your safety. You may be required to be vaccinated based on the nature of your work (ex: travel requirements) or due to changing local governmental health requirements.
  


 Who you are: 




   We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Data Analyst, Embedded Systems who will work with both data analysts and firmware engineers to drive insights and values from massive amounts of vehicle data. As part of the team, you will be interacting with the massive amount of data, including clean data, analyze data, visualize data, and provide insights and reports and on a daily basis. If you love technology, and are keen to join an industry leader — we would love to hear from you!
  


 What you’ll do:



 As a Data Analyst, Embedded Systems your key area of responsibility will be helping firmware engineers to monitor various product related issues, detect anomalies, send notifications, and keep improving the quality of the firmware in the long run. You will need to work closely with other Data Analysts and the firmware team and gain domain-specific knowledge of GO telematics system and firmware development.
   




   To be successful in this role you will be a self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills, and have the ability to quickly understand complex, technical concepts. In addition, the successful candidate will have strong analytical and project management skills with an ability to identify needs, develop effective solutions, and manage projects through completion. The successful candidate will also be able to manage multiple timelines and contrasting priorities to ensure timely results.
  



How you’ll make an impact:


 Interact with Geotab’s BigData Infrastructure on Google BigQuery using SQL and develop Jupyter notebooks using Python.
 Work with our firmware engineers and other stakeholders to identify the firmware issues and implement visualizations and reports using the data in various formats.
 Process, clean and verify the integrity of the data that was collected by our product, and set up necessary monitors and alerts.
 Leverage big data tools and assist firmware engineers with troubleshooting and providing meaningful insights.
 Mine messy data from vehicles and build accurate and useful datasets in BigQuery to meet different requirements.
 Develop SQL queries to detect anomaly behaviours from our GO devices and vehicles.
 Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve the reliability and quality of Geotab device and firmware






What you’ll bring to this role: 


Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in large data environments and data analytics.
 Familiar with and have experience in data warehousing and data ETL processes.
 2+ years’ experience using Jupyter Notebook, Python and data analytics packages, such as Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib etc.
 2+ years’ experience using SQL and able to manipulate large amounts of data in DBMS or data warehouse (experience with Google BigQuery preferred).
 2+ years’ experience with data visualization in python and able to draw some insights by given unknown data.
 Experience working with cloud products such as Google Cloud Platform is nice to have.
 Is familiar with Version Control System such as git and Agile Project Management platform such as Jira.
 A keen interest to learn new technologies and utilize them into our Big Data Environment.






   If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed above, we still encourage you to apply.
  


 Why job seekers choose Geotab:
  


 Work from home and flex work arrangements
  

    Baby bonus & parental leave top up program
  

    Home office reimbursement program
  

    Online learning and networking opportunities
  

    Electric vehicle purchase incentive program
  

    Competitive medical and dental benefits 
  

   Retirement savings program
   




The above are offered to full-time permanent employees only



 How we work:
  


 At Geotab, we have adopted a flexible first working model in that we have systems, functions, programs and policies in place to support both in-person and virtual work. However, you are welcomed and encouraged to come into our beautiful, safe, clean offices as often as you like. When working from home, you are required to have a reliable internet connection with at least 50mb DL/10mb UL. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology!
  


 We believe that ensuring diversity is fundamental to our future growth and progress and is an integral part of our business. We believe that success happens where new ideas can flourish – in an environment that is rich in diversity and a place where people from various backgrounds can work together. Geotab encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to accommodating people with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and when people are hired. We will ensure the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities are taken into account as part of performance management, career development, training and redeployment processes. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information about our diversity and inclusion as well as accommodation policies and practices, please contact us at careers@geotab.com. Click here to learn more about what happens with your personal data.

Title: Data Analyst - TJ Sales Operations and Performance
Description:
You will be a Data Analyst on the TJ Sales Operations and Performance team, within the Business Analysis and Reporting team. You are responsible for setting targets and goals in the upcoming months/quarters and tracking results for the TJ Sales Team and all products of our portfolio, as well as designing, analyzing, and showcasing data and sales results to key stakeholders. Following the Accounting monthly and weekly reporting cycle, a keen focus on financial impact and performance within sales.
 What you'll be doing:

Collaborate to design, build, maintain, analytics dashboards using data visualization tools (Power BI) to continuously analyze product performance.
Prescriptive analytics: Analyze data and provide recommendations on how to optimize business practices to suit multiple predicted outcomes
Present clear and consistent reports to the Senior Leadership team the results of the campaigns, sales performance, and recommended optimizations
Develop a deep understanding of the company's data assets and identify opportunities for improvements and development.
Work with sales partners to provide insights from the data and drive positive growth opportunities for sales.

What you'll need to be successful:
 Must haves:

Professional experience: 2+ years in a similar key role
Advanced analytical skills and experience working with data teams and dashboards
Strong attention to detail, with the ability to clearly communicate results and to define next steps to the department and company
Bachelor or Master's in business, Statistics, Actuarial Finance or Mathematics, or any relevant STEM/Finance/Accounting background.
Strong understanding of Business and Statistics is important as well as Business experience, knowledge of accounting cycle and process.
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel Required (Pivot Tables, Experience with Cubes, Data Analysis Toolpack, graphs)
SQL, Power BI

Nice to Haves:

Python
Cloud experience w/ Azure and/or Looker

As an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees
 In this role you may be exposed to adult content

Title: Senior Risk Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Shopify’s mission is to make commerce better for everyone. From building a new product feature for our commerce platform, to helping a merchant troubleshoot an issue over the phone, we want to empower our ecosystem through our work.
 Having a unified vision, a north star, is vitally important to ensure that we are all headed in the same direction. No matter the size or experience, we want to power every merchant’s experience. This is why we’re all here.
 Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations across North America and Europe where Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere



 Job Description
  REMOTE - NORTH AMERICA
 About the team
 Within the Shopify Trust Team, the Commerce, Trust & Integrity Team is committed to making commerce better for everyone. Our work includes developing solutions to prevent, detect and mitigate bad actors as well as developing tooling to scale and streamline complex workflows. We collaborate with teams across Shopify to understand areas of risk and take steps to prevent it. Our mandate is challenging, varied and constantly evolving.
 To support our mandate we are looking to add a Senior Risk Data Analyst to identify risk vectors and leverage data creatively to figure out why they exist, and how best to address them. This role will collaborate closely with our Data Science team, as well as Product, Engineering and Operations partners to turn insights into effective risk mitigation solutions.  How to Apply:  We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We’d love to hear an example from your past experience where you used data to solve a problem, describe your approach and outcome. Please respond in the “Notes to the Hiring Manager” section of the application.  Responsibilities:

 Develop and monitor key fraud & risk metrics in partnership with Product, Policy & Data teams
 Build monitoring and alerting to track the impact and continued effectiveness of platform controls
 Use data to quantify, prioritize and conduct root cause analysis of risk vectors through detailed analysis and testing. Report out on findings and recommendations
 Generate insights to inform targeted prevention & mitigation strategies across Product, Engineering, Data, Policy and Operations teams
 Work with Data Science in the development of models and analytics to detect bad actors
 Evaluate multiple data sets to surface patterns of fraud and risk




 Qualifications
  Requirements for the role:

 A Bachelor's degree in a related field, and/or commensurate work experience. Experience with fraud & risk management is strongly preferred
 Proficiency leveraging large datasets to drive business decisions
 Strong analytical and problem solving skills using data to identify gaps, and surface mitigation opportunities
 Advanced SQL, Python and experimentation experience
 Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, exemplified through effective data storytelling
 Ability to dive-in to day-to-day workings of multiple teams and understand the full scope of their functions and responsibilities
 Endless curiosity and an ability to think outside the box

 Additional Information
  Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your experience is thisclose to what we’re looking for, consider applying. We know that diversity of thought makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.
 This posting will close on Monday, June 13th
 #LI-KO5 #LI-REMOTE

 Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.
 At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

Title: Analyst, Pharmacy Data Management
Description:
Les candidats référés ne doivent pas postuler directement pour ce poste. 
Toutes les références de candidats doivent d’abord être soumises dans Workday par un collègue de Loblaw actuel. 
Lieu: 243 Consumers Road, Toronto, Ontario, M2J 4W8 
 
Prenez les choses en main et trouvez d’autres façons d’aider nos propriétaires de magasins locaux en entamant une carrière au bureau central ou aux centres de services aux magasins de Shoppers Drug Mart. Offrez un excellent service, un savoir-faire particulier et des conseils pratiques pour aider les pharmaciens-propriétaires affiliés et leur personnel à offrir aux Canadiens les meilleurs services dans le domaine de la santé, de la beauté et de la commodité. 

  Pourquoi ce role est-il important? 
Reporting to Manager, Pharmacy Data Management, the Pharmacy Data Management Analyst will be responsible for complex third party and pricing business solutions as it applies to the ongoing maintenance of data on the proprietary pharmacy data management system (HDM). the position holds the responsibility of assistance in strategic assessment and the forward design of the HDM application for improved efficiency and functionality, as well as tactical analysis and development of all common data elements for use in pharmacy practice systems and provides custom data reporting to business units and management teams as required.


Primary Responsibilities 

Complete the implementation of data changes and support documentation including tracking logs and signoff on data changes 
Responsible for understanding specific business requirements and initiatives ensuring they are accurately implemented and approved in the application 
Assist as the central point of contact for special projects to coordinate activities with business units as part of a larger team 
Act as the domain authority on data management for strategic business initiatives relating to pharmacy data needs, coordinating with group(s) working for complete end to end balanced solutions 
Act as business content provider during the analysis, design, development and testing phases of any new central file maintenance system improvements 
Schedule internal maintenance projects 
Develop and make recommendations for custom reports and request templates as the need arises for data analysis, audits and data change requests within the central data systems (HDM & MicroStrategy) 
Responsible for user acceptance testing of central file maintenance system(s) as required 
Maintain current working knowledge of the store pharmacy application to ensure compatibility with central file maintenance system 
Provide guidance and act as SME for second level support on data elements and attributes. Identify opportunities to educate the level one support team 
Document processes pertaining to analysis for strategic and legislative business data improvement requests 
Coach, mentor and train new users on the application, processes and procedures 
Responsible for interpreting the current pharmacy system data elements, in particular pricing and third party insurance plan information 


Requirements 

This position requires independent thinking and decision-making when dealing with data requests or problems. A strong role model; an independent worker who can strategically handle time based on business priorities and personal goals, with consistent timely and accurate data delivery. Strong planning and analytical skills with small projects and must adhere to established team, department and company policies and procedures. Detail and results oriented goal minded candidate with the ability and skills for working with data. Ability to connect with all levels of staff and management in a professional and confidential manner. The candidate with strong business ethics to act as a team role model Experience 


Experience & Education 

Minimum of 1-3 years of pharmacy related experience applying current pharmacy business practices 
Solid understanding of pharmacy business practices and terminology. 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
Strong analytical skills 
Attention to detail 
Experience with Microsoft Office applications particularity with MS Word and Excel 
Experience with MicroStrategy or other Report designing applications is an asset 
Experience with Microsoft Project and Microsoft Access is an asset 
Basic grasp of relational databases, including SQL experience, is an asset 
Proficiency in French is an asset. 
Solid understanding of pharmacy practice management systems is an asset 
This position requires a University degree | Discipline: General 


Certificates, Licenses or Registration 
N/A 

Physical Environment 
Work is mainly performed in a comfortable office environment where there is minimal exposure to dust, fumes, temperature variance and other sensory attributes. Level of noise at any given time is mild to moderate and may experience frequent interruptions. 

Pourquoi travailler chez Shoppers Drug Mart? 
En agissant à titre de consultant qui soutient les clients internes et les pharmaciens-propriétaires affiliés, vous acquerrez une expérience unique au secteur du commerce du détail tout en travaillant pour une marque nationale primée. Vous bénéficierez du Programme d’achat des employés, d’une rémunération concurrentielle et de possibilités d’apprentissage en ligne par l’intermédiaire de SDMU. 
Prenez en main votre emploi et trouvez d’autres façons de vous soucier de votre travail, de vos collègues, des clients et des membres de la collectivité. 

Comment R é ussir: 
Chez Shoppers Drug Mart/Pharmaprix , nous recherchons toujours des personnes formidables pour continuellement renforcer notre culture. Nous croyons que les gens formidables façonnent nos valeurs, sont authentiques, bâtissent la confiance et créent des liens. 
Si cela vous ressemble et que vous êtes ouvert d’esprit, que vous avez une bonne attitude face aux changements et que vous aimez les défis d’un environnement de travail aux détails dynamiques, postulez aujourd’hui. 

Type d'emploi : Temps plein 
 
Type de Rôle: Poste régulier 
 
Shoppers Drug Mart/Pharmaprix considère que la diversité culturelle du Canada est une source de fierté nationale et un symbole de force. Nous nous sommes donné comme priorité de refléter la diversité croissante du Canada dans les produits que nous vendons, les gens que nous embauchons et notre culture d’entreprise. Des accommodements sont disponibles sur demande pour les postulants et collègues atteints d’un handicap. 

En outre, nous croyons que la conformité aux lois consiste à faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre Code de conduite; il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous. 

R emarque : Si vous avez accès à Libre-service de l’employé (ESS) dans Workday, veuillez postuler à cet emploi en utilisant l’application Workday.

Title: SURVEILLANCE COORDINATOR AND DATA ANALYST
Company: Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Description:
Plant health surveillance programs are essential for identification and management of plant health issues and risks posed by new pests and diseases. The Surveillance Coordinator and Data Analyst plays a key role in driving digital transformation to modernize plant health data collection, standardization and analysis for the purposes of detection, monitoring and surveillance of plant pests to enable evidence- and risk-based actions. 
  
 If you have a strong technical background in data analysis, excellent project management, facilitation, collaboration and coordination skills and a desire to drive digital transformation this role is for you.
  
 This is your opportunity to lead the transformation of new and existing research, data and ideas into practical programs, products and services which will ensure Ontario's agricultural sector remains competitive and environmentally responsible.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role?

act as the lead provincial specialist on plant health surveillance and associated data analysis
lead Ontario's technology transfer activities through the development, coordination and implementation of strategies, policies and programs 
coordinate projects designed to drive digital transformation and assess the applicability and sustainability of new and existing data, practices, products, technologies and programs
prepare and deliver educational information and awareness building tools to facilitate change
act as a liaison between the research community and industry
manage contentious and high priority issues
contribute to evidence-based policy and program development through the analysis and interpretation of statistical data

 How do I qualify?
 Mandatory requirement:

In order to conduct site visits at rural and remote locations, you must hold a valid class 'G' driver's licence or equivalent as recognized by the Province of Ontario.

 Technical Knowledge:

You have expert knowledge of scientific theories, principles and practices in the design, implementation and analysis of plant health surveillance programs.
You have knowledge of the Ontario agricultural industry (e.g. economics, social importance, roles and mandates of farm and commodity organizations).
You have knowledge of relevant acts and regulations that impact plant health surveillance programs.

 Research, Analytical, Evaluation and Problem-Solving Skills:

You have knowledge of research methods and best practices to investigate the viability and applicability of new methods, techniques and technologies, analyze the validity of research findings and make recommendations on their suitability for Ontario conditions.
You are able to identify and investigate plant health surveillance issues, trends and developments through the collection, analysis and interpretation of data.

 Project Management and Organizational Skills:

You have planning and coordination skills to manage project activities and resource requirements.
You have analytical and problem-solving skills to assess project requirements, priorities and timelines to provide technical leadership toward the development and implementation of data management and analysis.
You have organizational skills to manage concurrent projects and activities and ensure efficient use of resources.

 Communication and Interpersonal Skills:

You have written communication skills to develop professional documents, reports and educational materials using clear, concise language.
You have oral communication skills to present information, options and recommendations in a clear, concise and logical manner.
You have the proven ability to develop and present information in many formats and can determine the most effective way to transfer technical information.
You have interpersonal skills to develop and maintain effective provincial, national and international working relationships and demonstrated ability to develop partnerships with clients.

 Consultation and Facilitation Skills:

You can encourage and motivate agricultural and rural organizations to develop and support policies and programs that encourage the adoption and maintenance of sustainable practices in their agricultural and rural communities.
You have verbal communication skills to discuss and present information, outlining options and recommendations on how technologies, policies and programs can be applied. 
You have tact, diplomacy, and consensus-building skills to establish and enhance partnerships, coalitions and networks.

 Computer Skills:

You are proficient with a variety of computer applications, including, spreadsheet, statistical analysis and database software.

 Diversity, Inclusion, Accessibility and Anti-Racism: We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.
  
 We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.
  
 Visit the
  OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the 
  OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service. 
  
 We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of Ontario's 
  Human Rights Code. Refer to the application instructions below if you require a disability-related accommodation.

Title: Sr. Business Analyst (GCS)
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Sr. Business Analyst (GCS)
 





































 Job Description





































 Join the team of Cyber Security experts that are focused on delivering value by automating security operations on industry leading security orchestration and automation of response (SOAR) platform. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible to organize and lead process mapping workshops, produce documentation of current and future state processes, quantification of improvement opportunities and will support the implementation of such changes. You will collaborate to define automation opportunities and implement latest and greatest automation solutions.

 WHAT WILL YOU DO? 

Manage the intake to capture requirements and leverage techniques to prioritize and drive out business value.
 Collaborate with business users to understand their challenges with current processes and data to be solved by proposing optimized processes that will be automated on security automation, orchestration and response (SOAR) platform.
 Lead data driven discussions to help business to determine potential improvements and perform top-down process analysis.
 Collaborate closely with subject matter experts to capture and translate inputs, business logic and data models into successful business outputs.
 Identifying business processes, roles within those processes, and developing workflow diagrams with multiple swim lanes.
 Capture business requirements, process mappings, data dictionaries using MS Office suite and process mapping software of choice (Gliffy, Lucidchart, Visio).

 WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?
 Must have: 

A bachelor’s degree in business or related field.
 2-5 years of experience with business analysis tools and techniques.
 Analytical and conceptual thinking skills with focus on data driven insights.
 Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
 Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills.
 Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously.
 Proficient in MS Office with emphasis on Excel (for data models) and process mapping tool of choice (Gliffy, Lucidchart, Visio).


 Nice-to-have:

 Lean six sigma or equivalent process mapping/optimization experience
 General knowledge of Security Operations and Cyber Security processes and tools.
 Reporting and dashboard development experience (Tableau, PowerBI, etc).


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 A world-class training program in financial services
 Flexible work/life balance options
 Opportunities to do challenging work







































 Job Summary










































































 Address:




































 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
 




































 City:




































 CAN-ON-TORONTO

 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities. Title: Technical Marketing Analyst
Description:
Technical Marketing Analyst



 Job brief


   We are looking for a Marketing Analyst who’ll research and identify ways to build our brand and acquire new customers. Marketing Analyst responsibilities include tracking the ROI of the marketing expenses, researching consumer behavior and exploring market trends, and identifying opportunity areas.
 


 To be successful in this role, you should have proven digital marketing experience with the ability to implement, monitor, and analyze. Ultimately, you will help us ensure we allocate our marketing budget efficiently and effectively target our audience through successful campaigns.
 


 Responsibilities:


 Design, execute, and analyze targeted strategic marketing campaigns.
 Analyze sales funnels and customer intent
 Measure ROI of online, on-site and offline advertising campaigns
 Report on marketing KPIs like leads, conversion rates, website traffic and social media engagement
 Track email campaign metrics (delivery, open, click-through rates)
 Monitor budget distribution and performance of paid ad campaigns
 Conduct competitive research and analyze benchmarking data
 Recommend website and campaign optimizations
 Research and implement marketing tools to support our promotional projects (automation software, social media scheduling/listening, email campaigns, etc)
 Work closely with the marketing and IT teams to identify opportunities for new customer acquisition



 Requirements and skills


 Expertise in Google Analytics and CRM environments
 In-depth understanding of SEM campaign strategies and SEO practices
 Experience with PPC campaigns
 Expert knowledge of MS Excel
 Analytical abilities
 Proven working experience in digital marketing
 Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
 BSc in Marketing research, Statistics, computer science or another relevant field
 Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement



 Successful marketing analysts possess excellent analytical and numerical skills and are deeply creative with great problem-solving skills.
 


 Frequently asked questions
 

   What does a Marketing Analyst do?
 

   Marketing Analysts are responsible for analyzing data from different sources and identifying opportunities in the market. They use this information to produce reports that identify areas of growth, branding strategies based on research patterns they've identified through their studies, as well as client acquisition methods such as an inefficient place within a funnel where there could be more conversions happening than before.
 


 What are the duties and responsibilities of a Marketing Analyst?
 

   Marketing Analysts are responsible for figuring out why some marketing campaigns work and others don’t. They make recommendations based on data collected, explaining to decision-makers how it will affect revenue or cost-effectiveness for their company. They understand consumer behavior to track trends properly without making mistakes due to errors from lack of information.
 


 What makes a good Marketing Analyst?
 

   Marketing Analysts have an understanding of data analysis and reporting, budgeting skills for the organization, and excellent oral and written communication abilities in order to manage projects from beginning through end-users and customers.
 


 Who does a Marketing Analyst work with?
 

   The Marketing Analyst is often part of a team, which means they must conduct research independently but share their findings with the whole group. This includes sharing with the Marketing Strategist, Project Managers, and executives.
