It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Title: STO 21R - Geospatial Analyst
Description:
Geospatial Analyst Scientific Technical Officer R21
Currently there are 2 permanent opportunities available. An eligibility list may be established for future temporary and/or permanent opportunities. The recruitment process for this competition may take place virtually.
The locations listed are to assist applicants in searching for this opportunity. This position may be performed in other approved locations within the Province of BC. For specific information about a location, applicants must contact the Hiring Manager to confirm if working remotely from that location could be considered.
On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here.
An excellent opportunity to join this dynamic team and apply your technological skills.
The Geospatial Services section team of GeoBC is spread across the province in regional teams to serve the Natural Resource sector ministries. These positions with the Thompson Okanagan Region team in Kamloops conduct advanced spatial data analysis and provides geospatial products in support of government decision makers for a wide range of natural resource sector, land, and water projects.
Kamloops is mid-sized city of 100,000 people that offers great urban amenities in close proximity to the outdoors. Surrounded by mountains, lakes and rivers, popular outdoor activities include hiking, mountain biking, fishing, paddling, skiing, snowmobiling, and ice-fishing. Kamloops has a very strong First Nations culture.
The BC Public Service is an award winning employer and offers employees competitive benefits, amazing learning opportunities and a chance to engage in rewarding work with exciting career development opportunities. For more information, please see What We Offer.
The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
For information about the Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service please visit: Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service - Province of British Columbia (gov.bc.ca).
For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact chris.ens@gov.bc.ca. DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.
NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.
Job Requirements: In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below:

Education


Undergraduate degree or higher in Geographic Information Systems, resource management, geography, computer science or a related field; OR
A Technical Diploma in Geographic Information Systems, resource management, geography, computer science or a related field; OR
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.



Related experience includes the following:


Minimum 1 year of experience using ESRI ArcGIS Desktop 10.x or ArcGIS Pro for spatial analysis, cartography, and data management.
Minimum 1 year of experience in automating GIS workflows using python scripting.
Minimum 1 year of experience developing web-mapping applications using ArcGIS Online, JavaScript, or HTML5
Minimum 1 year of experience in managing and implementing geospatial projects, providing geospatial solutions, and delivering complex analysis projects in support of client’s business needs.
Minimum 1 year of experience consulting or providing expert geospatial advice to non-technical people (clients, decision makers, technical and professional staff) and in ensuring the provision of technical products that meet the needs of natural resource clients and users.
Experience communicating information clearly and effectively, both visually and orally.



PREFERENCE may be given to candidates with 1 or more of the following additional experience and skills:


Experience with using additional programming or GIS scripting languages: JavaScript, R, Arcade, GitHub, ArcGIS API for Python.
Experience using ArcGIS Pro
Experience processing LiDAR or drone imagery; imagery interpretation and analysis
Experience using open source GIS software such as QGIS, SAGA, GRASS
Experience supporting clients’ use of mobile devices for field work using ArcGIS Field Maps, ArcGIS Collector, Survey 123, or FileMaker Pro.
Experience with a wide variety of environmental and natural resource management data sets, particularly from BC.


Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting.
A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.
APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Cover Letter: NO - Please do not submit a cover letter as it will not be reviewed.
Resume: YES - Ensure your resume includes your educational accomplishments, employment history including start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.
Questionnaire (COMPREHENSIVE): YES - As part of the application process, you will be prompted to complete a comprehensive online questionnaire to demonstrate how you meet the job requirements. Please allot approximately 60 minutes to complete the questionnaire.
IMPORTANT: Comprehensive questionnaire responses will be used to shortlist applicants against the job requirements. Please ensure you include all relevant information about your educational accomplishments and employment history including job titles, start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and your accountabilities and accomplishments.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
VERSATILITY. EXPERTISE.


 With these two words, Vertex makes the promise that we will always be versatile in developing solutions to our clients’ unique needs and that we will always demonstrate expertise in our designated fields.

 
Since 1962, Vertex has been a leading North American provider of environmental services. With over 50 years of expertise, Vertex helps clients achieve their development goals through our versatile suite of services. From the initial site selection, consultation and regulatory approval, through the construction, operation and maintenance phases, to conclusion and environmental cleanup, Vertex offers a diverse range of services throughout the life cycle of our clients’ projects.

 OVERVIEW
 Vertex is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst in Sherwood Park, AB. The purpose for this position is to provide analysis and support on internal applications being implemented or used within the company. Duties will include software, hardware support, procurement, integrations, reporting, various projects and additional duties as required. Remote support and some travel to various locations is required.

 CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS

3 to 5 years of relevant work experience in a comparable roll
Post-secondary Degree in Business or a related technical field 


Project Management Certifications is an asset
Experience in the fluid hauling industry is an asset
Experience with AssetWorks applications is an asset
Strong ability to research and analyze data
Experience in the design, development and implementation of complex application solutions
Experience in the development of project documents for a wide variety of initiatives and projects 
Ability to facilitate meetings and communicate with senior management and stakeholders of the project 
Experience in making decisions and recommendations on highly technical or complex issues
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Suite focusing on Excel


Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving ability
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and prioritize accordingly
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to interact with different levels and types of users



 RESPONSIBILITIES

Provides business analysis, consulting, project leadership and client relationship management to support corporate and divisional objectives
Lead the implementation, installation, configuration, upgrade, and conversion of application systems and operational software
Setup, maintain, re-configure, add, change modules, and fields with related applications
Work closely with the Accounting and IT departments to achieve goals
Provide Accounting, and Operational application user support for Sherwood Park and district offices
Manage and select appropriate software applications for systems according to business requirements and ensure achievement of results. This includes collaboration with Accounting, IT, Operations, and vendors to ensure achievement of all business objectives
Ensuring both business and technology related solutions adhere to standards, regulations and 
Engage with senior management and assist end-users and stakeholders to resolve and lay out required information infrastructure
Manage and coordinate with departments to develop and provide technical reports, training materials, programs, and documentations for end users
Administer applications and provide technical expertise in development and execution
Organize regular research studies for new technologies and fit them into organization
Assist with system check and quality assurance
Assist users with troubleshooting and identifying problems
Provide post-implementation support and on-going support measures
Work with the IT department to review, coordinate and execute system updates, upgrades, and conversions
Establish and roll out training plans for system and software changes
Follow Change Management Procedures when deploying changes to the varying environments



 LOCATION


 This position will be based out of Sherwood Park, AB with some travel required.



 ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


 Compensation is commensurate with education and experience
A comprehensive benefit package is provided 



APPLY NOW


 With a track record of success, Vertex provides a fast-paced environment where people thrive. We recognize that each member brings a valuable skill-set to the Vertex team and we make health, safety and community well-being a priority by supporting numerous endeavors at each of our locations across North America.

 At Vertex, we value teamwork through collaboration and provide support across the entire organization. If you think you have what it takes to play for the Vertex team, please apply.


 *We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position, however only those selected for interviews will be contacted*

Title: Analyst, Data Engineering
Description:
External Title: Analyst, Data Engineering
 Internal Title: Analyst, Data Engineering
 Location: Remote - Anywhere in Canada
 Reports to: Managing Director - Product Management




The Role:
 JD Power is looking for a data engineering analyst with excellent quantitative and analytical skills. Our ideal candidates are determined to use their skills to combine multiple data sources together to solve complex client questions around vehicle valuations, market readiness, and customer purchase decisions. You'll work hands on with quantitative data to help create new capabilities, and to improve and maintain existing capabilities.


 The Impact:
 We make data products that solve problems for the auto industry. Every data analyst will work on projects that go into production and directly impact new and existing products.


 About the job:

Daily immersion in automotive industry data
Collaborate with stakeholders to define data requirements
Engineer robust and extensible data pipelines for new and existing products
Design, troubleshoot, and execute repeatable data processes, in which you're finding bottlenecks and ways to become incrementally more efficient
Generate valuable insights from our data and package them into insightful client-friendly interpretations
Interdisciplinary work: you'll interact with multiple teams across the firm to implement solutions and improve processes. This includes Consulting, New Product Development, Data, Engineering, etc.



 What we would love to see: 

Expertise in extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes with quantified efficiency and accuracy outcomes. Experience in bringing together data sets across multiple sources, with multiple dimensions and layers of complexity
Demonstrated exposure to (not expertise in) data analytics, and/or statistical concepts such as: promotion/price, media mix modeling, multivariate regression, logistic regression, time-series modeling, data mining, simulation, optimization, and/or forecasting
Fluency of database software: SQL preferred
Fluency in statistical programming software: R or Python preferred (and knowledge of STATA)
Experience resolving data issues in creative and effective ways. Acumen and gut instincts to know when to say, "This doesn't seem reasonable."
Independent professional who can take a vision and implement with limited instruction
Bachelor's degree (required) with statistics or mathematical background: Econometrics, Statistics, Operations Research, Quantitative Marketing, Finance, Engineering or similar
An effective cross functional communicator in both written and verbal skills
Ability and willingness to learn in a fast-paced environment
Resilient work ethic
4-6 years of full-time quantitative analytics professional (non-academic) experience and quantified business impact

The Career Opportunity:
 Grow as a data analyst as part of a medium sized team. You will pipeline data, deploy them in the cloud, and build monitoring suites.
 The Team / The Business:
 The team is an experienced set of creative thinkers who are uncovering new and emerging consumer dynamics in an industry starting to go through rapid disruption
 Our Hiring Manager says:
 We want data analyst candidates who can monitor, evaluate and improve data processes independently and with an eye toward continuous improvement. We need the capability to leverage the right data sets efficiently from an impressive set of data assets that is unrivaled in this space.


 J.D. Power is a global leader in consumer insights, advisory services and data and analytics. A pioneer in the use of big data, artificial intelligence (AI) and algorithmic modeling capabilities to understand consumer behavior, J.D. Power has been delivering incisive industry intelligence on customer interactions with brands and products for more than 50 years. The world's leading businesses across major industries rely on J.D. Power to guide their customer-facing strategies.

 Company Mission


   J.D. Power is clear about what we do to ensure our success into the future. We unite industry leading data and insights with world-class technology to solve our clients' toughest challenges.
 



 Our Values


   At J.D. Power, we strive to be Truth Finders, Change Makers and Team Driven - the distinct behaviors that, together, define our unique culture.
 



   Truth Finders - At J.D. Power, we are proud of the unbiased data and findings we provide. As individuals, each and every member of our team is dedicated to living this same objectivity and embodying the highest ethical and professional standards – the only 'favorite' we have is the truth.
 



   Change Makers - At J.D. Power, we never stand still. We constantly seek better ways – innovating and evolving in everything we do to support our colleagues and our clients alike – and all in service of delivering data and insights that drive meaningful business impact.
 



   Team Driven -
   At J.D. Power, we are one team and we are activated. Regardless of individual role, every member of our team is dedicated to supporting their immediate colleagues and our broader J.D. Power family to deliver on our collective purpose and make us greater than the sum of our parts. At J.D. Power, these values are more than words. We bring these values to life throughout our organization through our employee event series — J.D. Power Values Days. Each quarter, we celebrate one of our core values and hold an annual event to celebrate our combined values at the end of the year.
 



   We are dedicated to leveraging comprehensive and equitable practices which contribute to the overall success of the company and its employees. We invite you to learn more about our DE&I efforts.
 



   J.D. Power is an equal opportunity employer and compliant with AODA/ADA legislation. If you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please specify.
 



 To all recruitment agencies: J.D. Power does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Description: 
  SENIOR ANALYST, BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE
 BUSINESS PLANNING & ANALYTICS

 NorQuesters are difference makers and we’re searching for someone to find ways forward, starting small and thinking BIG in the design, development, implementation and support of the College’s business intelligence and analytics initiatives.

 Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence, the Senior Analyst collaborates closely with college stakeholders to design and implement solutions for the presentation of data for analysis for various areas across the college. The Senior Analyst works with data cleansing, transformation, modelling and the development of visualizations to ensure the information shared is accurate, consumable, and helps tell a story of where we’ve been and where we’re headed.
 HOW YOU’LL MAKE A DIFFERENCE


 Provide design support and development of business intelligence solutions, including inception, technical design, development, testing and delivery.
 Work with stakeholders to discover, analyze and evaluate business intelligence needs in order to design appropriate solutions.
 Work with the data architect to ensure that the data needed for the solution is integrated into the data warehouse.
 Develop work plans and estimates relating to the delivery of business intelligence solutions.
 Identify and provide input into new technology opportunities that will have an impact on college BI services.
 Design and develop reporting components including queries, views, OLAP cubes, reports and dashboards.
 Lead testing of business intelligence output.
 Take action to improve data timeliness, accuracy, and clarity.
 Apply secure development improvement practices, ensuring that business intelligence services and related information are confidential, reliable, and available.
 Provide specialist guidance to support data testing and quality assurance, contributing to continuous improvement of data quality.
 Explore college data to discover patterns, meaningful relationships, anomalies and trends.
 Schedule and monitor implementation of new services and changes to existing business intelligence services, ensuring effective communication with stakeholders throughout the process.
 Ensure that personnel are in place to transition services, service components, and packages in compliance with standard operating procedures.
 Creates and maintains operational documentation for the solutions created.


 WHAT YOU BRING


 Bachelor’s degree in a related field (e.g. Computer Science, Computer Engineering).
 An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
 5+ years progressively responsible experience with business intelligence and data warehouse technologies.
 2+ years of experience with the design, development and maintenance of enterprise level data visualization solutions.
 2+ years of experience with the MS BI Stack, SQL, SSAS modeling, Power Query, DAX.


 WHAT MAKES YOU A DIFFERENCE MAKER?


 As a difference maker you bring:
 


 Ability to present data in queries, dashboards and reports in a way that is easy to understand.
 Ability to articulate and translate technical language for non-technical customers both orally and in writing.
 Ability to solve complex problems and to work independently through ambiguity.
 Ability to confirm/understand business needs and translate those needs into operational support and reporting tasks.
 Analysis and data analysis and interpretation skills.
 Strong oral and written communication skills.
 Ability to effectively engage and influence others.
 Problem solving and creativity.
 Preference to candidates with experience in educational settings.


 SALARY: $75,044 - $93,777 reflective upon what you bring AKA your education and experience. This is a full-time permanent position with immediate access to our great pension and benefit programs.
 
NorQuest College offers a Workstyles Program with options that include working on campus or flexibly up to 70% of the time.

 COMPETITION NUMBER: 2022-3519

 CLOSING DATE: July 6, 2022

 Apply to become a NorQuester: If this opportunity delights you and your expertise will shine in this role, we invite you to apply for this position online by uploading your resume and cover letter combined as one document.

 Psst: Only candidates shortlisted for an interview will be contacted and we’ll make sure to do this within 28 days of the closing date.


 Difference Makers. If we were to describe what NorQuest College is, we’d say these two words. We are so fundamentally driven in our mission to make a difference to our students, our community, and to our fellow NorQuesters, that it guides what we do, who we meet, and where we are headed.
 

   So how do we make differences?
 

 We empower NorQuesters. When it comes to working, it’s up to you to decide where (on campus or from another location) and how you work. NorQuesters are expected to embody our Qs—lead from where you are, be dependable, find ways forward—to name a few, but how you do that is your choice!
 We unlock potential. Whether its newcomers to Canada who want to improve their English, students who want to complete their academic upgrading, learners pursuing post-secondary education, or anyone who wishes to strengthen their skills through professional development, our passion to educate touches people of all levels and all backgrounds.
 We strengthen Alberta. From our graduates who hit the ground running, to our partnerships with government, industry, and business, to our commitment to communities, including a dedicated focus on Indigenous communities, we contribute to our province and make it stronger. We strive to be an employer of choice for First Nations, Metis and Inuit people in Canada by leading, supporting, and being an ally through our work toward decolonization, reconciliation, and Indigenization.   


  And that’s a snapshot of how we are Difference Makers. But there’s so much more to us and we invite you to explore further!

Title: Advertising Technology Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

The Digital, Social and Content Marketing (DSCM) team develops and manages the Bank's digital marketing and communications ecosystem. We optimize the end-to-end customer journey, improve performance and drive return on investment across digital marketing channels, enterprise functions, and business lines. Our professionals offer subject matter expertise on digital, social, and content marketing strategies and provide dedicated research and analysis on industry trends and technological advancements. If you want to be a brand ambassador who can help strive efficiencies for the bank, then join our team and make an impactful contribution to TD and your own success.



Job Description

The successful candidate will be a key part of the North American Digital Marketing & Customer Orchestration Team. This team is a dynamic, innovative team that is a part of the central marketing function within TD Bank Financial Group.  As an Advertising Technology Analyst on the Ad Capabilities & Digital Targeting team, you will be a part of a group dedicated to enabling capabilities that support marketing performance (online and offline). There is significant opportunity to develop customer-centric analytics technologies, marketing strategies, and segmentation frameworks to accelerate TD's digital growth, resulting in higher ROI, deeper customer relationships, and a better customer experience.  Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here’s some of what you may be asked to perform:

 Act as a leader on initiatives that advance digital analytics and targeting capabilities at TD.
 Leverage knowledge of data capabilities to develop and deliver customer insights
 Tell a story with data including exploratory data analysis and data quality validation
 Proactively provide analytical guidance to partners, based on understanding of their respective businesses, where you see opportunities to optimize marketing spend
 Develop and inform enterprise-level cloud/marketing technology roadmaps

 #canmarketing



Job Requirements

    What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:
    

 5+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, digital marketing
 2+ years of demonstrated hands-on Google Cloud Platform experience
 A degree in business, marketing, engineering, science, or other quantitative discipline
 Financial services experience is an asset, especially related to digital marketing analytics
 A broad understanding of digital marketing, cloud platforms, web tracking, analytical tools, and knowledge of where analytics may add value to marketing and/or the business
 Site tag implementation, custom rules development and data layer development experience.
 Experience with digital marketing platforms and tools including Google Campaign Manager (DoubleClick), Facebook, Google Search Ads, Google Analytics, and Adobe Analytics
 Experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, DOMO, Google Data Studio, Looker)
 A passion for analytics, high comfort level and interest in interpreting data and results; ability to tell stories with data and facts
 Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills including the ability to leverage data to formulate solutions that address complex business problems
 Strong interpersonal skills with experience in driving productive collaboration with internal clients and cross-functional team members
 An overall dedication to producing high quality work and desire to continuously learn, develop and do better




Additional Information

    #LI-Hybrid
   


Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Senior Business System Analyst
Description:
Senior Business System Analyst
Remote Work, Full Time




Description
We are looking for Technical BSA for a long term project with one of our banking clients, the role requires extensive knowledge of SQL & API.
 These skills are required:
 1. Requirement gathering and documentation of Requirement package, SRS.
 2. Data Mapping & Data Lineage including API mapping – worked on mapping URI for API between source application and target database. Can model URI from RAML.
 3. Hands on SQL knowledge Can reverse engineer existing query. Can write query to profile and validate data.

    5-8 years of BSA experience in data analytics in an agile environment.
   

Strong experience in data analysis, profiling, clean-up, data wrangling and validation. Hands-on experience building data quality checks and writing complex SQL queries.
Experience working in large scale Enterprise Data Lake ingestion and extraction projects.



Experience working with Jira, Confluence.

 Hands-on knowledge in gathering Reporting requirements for visualization, integration for tools such as Tableau, Power BI.

Solid knowledge of metadata management principles, metadata modeling and writing metadata definitions.


Excellent verbal, written, communication, presentation, organizational, and interpersonal skills


Strong analytical, organizational, and technical skills to analyze, model and interpret data


Knowledge with Solutions Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and structured methodologies including agile, waterfall and iterative


Experience with DevOps/CICD methodology and basic understanding of data engineering and ETL tools.


Demonstrable experience with conceptual, logical and physical data modeling techniques.


Work Experience in investigating, analyzing, estimating system applications in a large integrated solution environment


Proven experience with all stages of automated system implementation in complex solutions, with online and batch processing of transactions


Proven experience with sprint facilitation, interpretation of business needs to technical requirements, facilitation of project meetings for reviews

 •• Experience in current state analysis through reverse engineering, identify source & downstream systems.

Experience in developing and participating in UAT collaborating with business leads.


Experience in conducting feasibility analysis, project scoping and providing project work estimates.


Experience with requirements development involving requirements elicitation, analysis, specification and validation.


Experience with documenting user stories, planning and managing product backlog, planning and managing sprints, and implementing in an iterative manner


Hand-on experience in capturing Data Lineage and Data Mapping between Source and Target systems.


Demonstrated experience in the facilitation of project meetings for reviews.


Experience in reporting progress of assignment(s) on a regular basis to Project Management and raise any issues / concerns and propose mitigation strategies.


Ability to manage large scale and complex projects with many stakeholders as part of a program. Can work effectively independently and in a team environment.


Experience with Day 2 Support tasks, perform RCA, provide resolution.


Strong communication, interpersonal, collaboration, and negotiation skills to work seamlessly in an agile cross-functional team, with clients, vendor(s) and other stakeholders.


Creative, innovative, and can think outside the box to visualize solutions that meet business needs.


Able to resolve issues in a timely manner, provide options and recommendations.


Able to prioritize change requests from clients and guide the team in determining how best to address them.

Qualification : 
Salary : $60.00-$70.00 per hour

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
Business Insights Analyst <Marketing Analyst>

  V-Soft consulting is currently seeking a 
  Business Insights Analyst <Marketing Analyst> for our premier client. This is a 6-month contract position with option to hire. It’s a fully remote position but candidate will need to reside in Ontario, Canada.
 


Primary Location: remote in Ontario
The Decision Science team works to help bring client data to life, measuring and interpreting complex data sets, delivering actionable insights to our clients. We act as business consultants to our clients, enabling them to make data-driven decisions about their marketing programs and optimize customer communications.
WHAT YOU’LL NEED:
Education and Experience »

Post-secondary education in a quantitative discipline, (Math, Statistics, Political Science, Economics or Computer Science, etc.) or equivalent experience.
Passion for understanding data patterns and application of data to diagnose what happened, predict what may occur and prescribe what to do about it.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities »

4+ years’ experience in a data and analytic insight role
Connect insights and gain inspiration from disparate sources
Experience within sourcing or supply chain analytics and/or detailed data analysis
Experience with database languages and data query code (e.g. SQL, Python)
Demonstrated experience using business intelligence software such as Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
Expertise in Microsoft Excel, Word and intermediate PowerPoint
Experience developing, cleansing, manipulating and transforming datasets
A team-first attitude and willingness to do whatever it takes to accomplish goals
A desire to learn new techniques and share knowledge with others

WHAT YOU’LL DO: This role focuses on menu item packaging and bundling analytics within the quick service restaurant space. You will support our local market business development team in analyzing program performance, finding growth opportunities, and developing business cases to ignite new programs. 
 Stakeholder Engagement

Deliver insights to stakeholders through the preparation of reports, dashboards and presentations, in conjunction with other decision scientists and managers
Translate analysis and insights into actionable business recommendations that are realizable by client and business teams
Coordinate and deliver BI reporting to stakeholders (weekly, monthly and quarterly) including insight summaries and deep dive investigation of findings via research and data queries

Data Analysis & Insights Management

Definition, setup and execution of measurement plans that capture supply & demand measures inclusive of supply gaps, early risk identification and diagnostics of severity of risk
Collect, aggregate and quality check large complex datasets to derive business intelligence
Manage business rules that structure quantification of supply needs based on demand schemas, as-well-as as lead/lag time dimensions concerning supplier time to market vs. demand timing
Create, track and manage supply & demand across product categories using forecasting to determine supply shortages, demand needs and future risks due to fluctuation in production
Design, integrate and manage business intelligence dashboards and the data that supports them
Manipulate, query and extract data from datasets to answer ad-hoc client queries

Interested?
Qualified candidates should send their resumes to Neha Gahlot neha@vsoftconsulting.com
V-Soft Consulting is a trusted partner with experience across diverse technology stacks to help business get IT done. What makes V-Soft different? Our expertise is derived from over 20 years of delivering world-class IT staffing, consulting, engineering, and managed services to Fortune 1000 and mid-market companies in the U.S., Canada, and Asia.
V-Soft is headquartered in Louisville, KY with strategic locations in India, Canada, and across the U.S., including Madison, Chicago, Denver, Harrisburg, and Atlanta. V-Soft has been recognized among the top 100 fastest growing staffing companies in North America and is known for the ability to provide highly qualified consultants for any project at any scale. V-Soft has a wide variety of partnerships across diverse technology stacks, and holds such titles as MuleSoft Certified Delivery Resource, Oracle Gold Partner, ServiceNow Partner, Microsoft Partner, and Cisco Registered Partner, amongst many others. For more information or to view all our open jobs, please visit www.vsoftconsulting.com or call (844) 425-8425.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
OVERVIEW
 Are you looking to make a tangible difference to fight climate change and tackle food insecurity? At CubicFarms we believe in the power of technology to feed a changing world. We actively seek passionate, life-long learners who want to make a difference in the ag-tech space and create a healthier, more sustainable world. Come join our dynamic and innovative team as we break new ground in the ag-tech revolution!
 ABOUT CUBICFARMS
 CubicFarms (TSX:CUB) is an ag-tech company providing automated growing systems for fresh produce and nutritious livestock feed. CubicFarms offers turnkey, commercial scale, hydroponic, automated controlled environment growing systems that can grow predictably and sustainably for 12 months of the year virtually anywhere on earth. The company has sold and installed systems in Canada and internationally and continues to grow a global pipeline of prospective customers. Visit us at www.cubicfarms.com.
 THE ROLE: BUSINESS ANALYST
 We are looking to add an experienced Business Analyst to our dynamic Product & Technology team. You will collaborate with stakeholders to plan and deliver effective business solutions and report to the Director of Operations. This is an opportunity to grow your career with an incredible group of people working towards meaningful solutions in our changing world.
 YOUR EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE INCLUDE:

 Computer Science or Business Administration degree or equivalent experience.
 3+ years of experience as Business Analyst.
 Experience working on business process analysis and business process improvement projects.
 The ability to work legally in Canada.

 YOUR SKILLS INCLUDE:

 A growth mindset
 The ability to build relationships to connect with and influence others at all levels in the organization.
 Effective management of multiple priorities and projects.
 A Strategic mindset with strong analytical skills.
 SharePoint, NetSuite, CRM and HRIS applications.
 Microsoft Products including Azure, M365, SharePoint and Office products as well as NetSuite, CRM and HRIS applications.
 Mediation of differences in business perspectives to drive consensus.
 An exceptional attention to detail.
 A strong work ethic.

 WE WILL OFFER YOU:

 Hybrid and Remote work options.
 A supportive and fun work culture.
 Professional growth and development.
 Extended medical benefits.
 Reasonable accommodations for persons with a disability.
 A diverse and inclusive community.

 YOUR WORK WILL INCLUDE:

 Working with stakeholders to plan and deliver effective business solutions.
 Translating business needs into functional/technical requirements.
 Providing estimates, impact assessments and cost-benefit analyses on solution options.
 Preparing business cases, requirements documentation, process maps, data models and roadmaps for digital transformation.
 Leading cross-functional teams to define processes and desired future state improvements.
 Implementing enterprise applications to enhance business processes and improve efficiency throughout the organization.
 Managing projects and external consultants to define and deliver on SOW.
 Providing an integrated set of information systems, tools, and services to meet the organization’s current and growing needs and improve communication and collaboration.
 Celebrating wins and learnings with your team.

 EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
 We are an equal opportunity employer committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We encourage applications from all qualified and enthusiastic candidates.
 CubicFarms is a growing organization in an emerging industry that offers significant potential for advancement in the ag-tech space. We look forward to meeting with you soon!

Title: Analyst, Market Insights (iGO)
Description:
Position Term: Permanent Full-Time 

Location: Toronto, ON 


Application Deadline: July 4, 2022 


Level: 8 

Salary Range: Min: $70,680 Max: $83,155 
The Government of Ontario is committed to establishing a new online market for internet gaming (igaming) that is both competitive and protects consumers. iGaming OntarioTM (iGO) was established in July 2021 as an agency of the Government of Ontario to conduct and manage internet gaming in the province when provided by private gaming operators. 

 iGaming Ontario is seeking an Analyst, Market Insights to deliver data-driven insights on the iGaming market in support of iGaming Ontario’s market insights and data analytics program. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Market Insights, the successful candidate will conduct advanced statistical analysis, produce data mining models, and deliver reporting to inform strategic decision making and highlight. 


In this role, the successful candidate will:


Conduct independent research and data analysis by employing advanced techniques and statistical methods using both internal and external sources
Communicate data insights to stakeholders to explain analytical findings, identify areas of further research and refinement, and potential business impacts
Support the design and delivery of data analytics projects, both on a proactive basis and in response to specific requests from initiation to close-out
Support the development of iGO’s data analytics program and deliver analytical expertise as part of an interdisciplinary insights team
Provide tactical advice and support to business users in the areas of data extraction, validation, consolidation, analysis and reporting
Visualize complex data to tell a story, derive data-driven insights, and demonstrate value
Assist in the technical implementation and automation of the data analytics pipeline

The ideal candidate must have:


University Degree in Analytics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations Research, Business Administration, Economics or related field with 2+ years’ experience applying analytics techniques to business problems
Strong competency in dashboard design and data visualization in business intelligence tools such as Power BI
Proficiency in writing SQL queries
Proficiency in R and/or Python programming
Advanced working knowledge of Excel
Experience with Microsoft Azure platform an asset
Working knowledge of statistics and data mining algorithms including decision trees, clustering, forecasting, regression, and neural networks
Strong attention to detail and the ability to adapt in a fast-changing environment
Strategic thinker possessing sound judgement, a business mindset, and ability to conceptualize, evaluate, and problem-solve
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, including negotiation and issues management
 The successful candidate must be eligible to work in Canada and will be subject to a criminal background check. 

 iGaming Ontario has a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy that requires all staff, including prospective new employees, be fully vaccinated by a Health Canada approved COVID-19 vaccine. Individuals with valid medical or other human rights-based exemptions will be considered for appropriate accommodation within the policy. 

 iGaming Ontario is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. 

 iGaming Ontario has the responsibility to lead by example in advancing racial equity and to build a diverse, inclusive, accessible and respectful workplace where every employee has a voice and the opportunity to fully contribute. To this effect, you are encouraged to reflect upon the diversity you would bring to the role within your application including, but not limited to, individuals identifying with one or more of the under-represented groups identified within Ontario’s Human Rights Code. 

 Disability related accommodation during the recruitment process is available upon request.

Title: BUSINESS ANALYST
Description:
Overview: 
 
   This position will generate data-driven insights, as well as lead client’s thinking in how to action/profit from those insights. This role is intended to be deeply involved in the sales planning process. This person will also own and manage several small projects.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Enhances business operations through development of consultative insights and presentations directed towards generating increased sales.
 Manages the use and application of syndicated and non-syndicated data resources.
 Understands CROSSMARK capabilities/processes and able to recommend insights-based actions that generate incremental revenue for CROSSMARK.
 Conducts a broad range of strategic business planning including, but not limited to, category management, space management, product evaluation, promotion planning and evaluation, trade funds evaluation, and resource allocation.
 Streamlines and template standard/established analyses.
 Supports business operations to the sales effort through interaction and consultation with sales executives and other business partners.
 Take a proactive approach to owning the projects assigned. This includes shepherding, planning, and administration from project initiation through closeout following the established Project Services process. Must take an active role in resolving issues and conflicts that they encounter while managing a project as well as being the primary source of information for the Company on an assigned project.
 Facilitate meetings for other departments as required by projects assigned. This includes distributing and tracking action items from the meetings.
 Provide weekly status updates following the Project Services process.
 Develops and shares best practices.



 NOTE: This job description does not imply that the above functions are the only tasks that may be performed. Associates will be expected, if possible, to follow any other job-related instructions and perform any other job-related tasks as directed by management.
  Qualifications: 
 
 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.



 Education/Experience: Bachelor’s Degree required. Requires a working knowledge of a broad range of consultative and analytical techniques and concepts, and 2-5 years of experience. Working knowledge of a broad range of consultative and analytical techniques and concepts.
 


 Computer Skills: Superior knowledge and use of Microsoft applications. Knowledge of other software applications as defined by need and assignment of position. Working knowledge of syndicated data analysis tools.
 


 Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: Certificates of Achievement from a recognized institution or organization for computer skills and appropriate disciplines of consultation are preferred.
 


 Supervisory Responsibilities: None
 


 Work environment: Office environment. Travel for the purposes of presentation may be required.
 


 Language Skills: English is the primary language skill, however, bilingual skills may be required based on business necessity.
 

 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.


 Crossmark is committed to providing accessible employment practices and welcomes applications from people with disabilities. If you require accommodation for a disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please let us know.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Improving healthcare through innovative technology is at the core of Intelerad’s work. Our scalable medical imaging platform connects clinicians to a powerful imaging ecosystem that is fast, smart, and tapped into the data they need, no matter their location. We’re focused on delivering a best-in-class medical image management solution that improves provider efficiency, decreases the cost of healthcare, and improves the overall health of populations.
 Intelerad offers one of healthcare’s most comprehensive imaging and analytics platforms. Headquartered in Raleigh, NC and Montreal, Intelerad has nearly 700 employees located in offices across six countries. The company empowers nearly 2,000 healthcare organizations around the world with the speed, scalability, and simplicity needed to increase business performance while, most importantly, improving patient outcomes. Intelerad’s modern enterprise solutions have been acknowledged by a Best in KLAS recognition, ranking #1 for PACS Asia/Oceania in the 2021 Best in KLAS: Global Software (Non-US) report.
 To learn more, visit intelerad.com and follow Intelerad on LinkedIn and Twitter.



 Job Description
  The Business Systems Analyst contributes to Intelerad's success and growth by translating the company's business requirements into software solutions, with a particular focus on supporting our Business Operations Engine.
 The incumbent will work closely with stakeholders to optimize cross-functional processes, through analysis, design, configuration, development, testing, training, implementation, and operational support of business applications, including NetSuite, Salesforce, OpenAir, and other enterprise systems.

 Interface with stakeholders to collect and analyze business requirements
 Challenge user community to develop global processes where possible and advocate for industry best practices
 Design software solutions and changes to meet business needs, incorporating technical considerations alongside development team
 Document business processes and solution designs, including process flow diagramming, user stories, and fit-gap analysis
 Coordinate activities between process owners, users, software developers, system administrators, and leadership
 Create and maintain user guides for system processes and train end-users on new functionality
 Identify process improvement opportunities and work with other team members to implement them
 Support systems integration of acquired companies through discovery sessions, solution design, user acceptance testing, data migration, training, and go-live
 Monitor incident queue for Business Systems and respond to incoming tickets with a resolution to system issues
 Assist with data management and monitoring activities as needed
 Schedule and lead meetings related to ongoing project work and new requests




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent experience
 2+ years experience in business analysis, process mapping, and/or continuous improvement
 Strong business acumen, especially regarding basic financial processes
 Experience working with NetSuite and Salesforce, or other Tier 1 ERP/CRM systems
 Experience with OpenAir, ServiceNow, Dell Boomi, Avalara, and HRIS systems a plus
 Understanding of SDLC and project management processes
 Demonstrated ability to communicate complex information clearly
 Ability to prioritize and work under pressure in fast-paced, ever-changing environment
 Self-starter and able to deliver quality and results with directional guidance
 Strong customer service skills gained through prior roles

 Additional Information
  All applicants meeting minimum qualifications will be required to complete a 30 minute online assessment as part of your application.
 Intelerad and Ambra Health Combine to Form the Global Industry Leader in Cloud PACS and Enterprise Imaging
 Intelerad Partners with Strategic Radiology to Bring Innovative Medical Image Management Solutions to More than 1,300 Radiologists Across the US
 Meet Intelerad’s Leadership Team: https://www.intelerad.com/en/about/leadership-team/
 #LI-remote

Title: Performance Analyst I, Virtual Care - TELUS Health
Description:
Location: Montreal, Quebec, CA Calgary, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA Ottawa, ON, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA 
    







     Req ID: 26661 
    







     Jobs by Category: Health 
    







     Job Function: Health Solutions 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies?


Who we are


At TELUS Health, we are on a mission to create innovative technologies and services that drive our vision, which is to create a healthier world, one life at a time. We are a market leader in the rapidly growing industry of virtual care.


We enable employers to offer to their employees a secure online access to medical practitioners and nurses via a computer, tablet, or smartphone. Telemedicine is the biggest trend in employee benefits and an exponential number of companies are looking to offer the service in the near future.


The Reporting and Analysis team is responsible for developing interactive visualizations and dashboards from multiple sources, providing actionable insights for the business. Our team consists of motivated business, data and performance analysts who share the desire to unearth the nuggets of information that support effective decision-making.


We specifically analyze performance data across all TELUS Health Virtual Care products and offerings (Primary Care, Disability management, Specialized Digital Therapy…) and support multiple divisions (Client Success, Marketing, Operations, Products…) while working with cross-functional teams and leadership. We embrace and thrive in a highly dynamic and competitive environment.


As the Performance Analyst, you will primarily be responsible for ensuring quality data structures for the analysis of data, use of proper statistical analysis, and implementing visualization best practices in creating content through Advanced Excel (power query) and Metabase.


You will be working with a variety of data sources to develop, and implement data and business intelligence applications to enable management and customers to make data-driven business and critical decisions.




 Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together




As a Performance and data Analyst in the Reporting and Analysis team, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining innovative self-serve reporting solutions that drive insights into the performance of all products under THVC in order to guide strategy and decision-making.


You are a subject matter expert proficient in enabling insights and analytics with technology. Your expertise in analytic platforms like Advanced Excel (power query) and Metabase along with your working knowledge of building data pipelines, tables, and views contribute to a mandate that allows our management and customers to unlock information that enables their decision-making.


You will be working with a team of talented analysts and data experts to build a self-serve reporting environment. In addition, you will assist our stakeholders in translating their needs into feasible and usable data solutions. As a builder, you will collaborate with a team of talented resources to build enriched dashboards and data pipelines to enable management to take guided and informed decisions to accomplish goals and produce desired results.


Our team loves



Learning and it extends to our passion to understand the “why” behind the data so we can provide value to the organization
Collaborating and our mix of business acumen and technical skills are optimal in delivering data insights and unpacking business rationale for our stakeholders
Winning and we are champions of Big Data - we believe timely data centric analysis and insights are critical to our ability to win in the market


 
Here is how:



Develop new and innovative ways to present reporting insights, with flexibility for users to self-serve and drill into the data
Work closely with different stakeholders to articulate new KPI reporting requirements
Collaborate with data experts to actively manage the performance of the platform of visual dashboards and reports
Work closely with cross-functional teams and data experts to enable a data environment that automates our stakeholders’ needs with the balance on efficiency and accuracy
Analyze and determine information needs and elements, data relationships and attributes, data flow and storage requirements and data output and reporting capabilities
Coordinate new data development, ensuring consistency and integration with the existing data warehouse structure


 
You must be comfortable working within a dynamic, cross-functional environment and be able to understand, and explain complex concepts, performance reporting methodologies, and analysis results to a diverse stakeholder community. Your familiarity and comfort with TELUS Health Virtual Care is desirable and you must be willing to roll up your sleeves and get close to the data.






 Qualifications




What You Bring:



Post-secondary diploma / certification
2+ years working experience in a market/business intelligence, database marketing and data-warehousing environment
Strong experience in leveraging MS office and Metabase to develop self-served dashboards and reports
Strong presentation, analytical and data interpretation skills
Ability to define scope, objectives, and prioritize work demands within a dynamic environment
Possess an innovative, problem-solving, and solutions-oriented mindset
Ability to learn quickly, be a team player, and manage multiple work projects
Strong knowledge of best practices for dashboards and visualization


 
Great-to-haves:



Hands-on Metabase and MS Office experience
Knowledge of Virtual Health business models, measures and metrics
Deep experience with data visualizations and tools, preferably Advanced Excel and Metabase experience
Strong analytical skills and comfortable working with large data sets
Ability to transform data into actionable insights

Title: Assistant Project Manager & Junior Business Analyst (2022-821-CS)
Description:
Employment Type:
 Full Time, Non-Bargaining Unit


 Work Hours:
 35 hours/week


 Application Deadline:
 July 6th by 11:59 pm





 Program Overview – Project Management Office, Central Services


 Straddling the divide between a traditional PMO and a Strategic Projects division, the Project Management Office delivers high impact and high-quality work, leading large-scale, enterprise-wide initiatives, including technology and product implementations, business transformation projects, strategic and operational planning, new business development and execution, and other priority work as identified by the Office of the CEO and the senior leadership team at WoodGreen.





 What You Will Do




 Support PMO and project managers with end-to-end delivery of projects, specifically systems assessments, business process decomposition and reporting initiatives across the organization.
 Prepare, iterate and maintain key resources, including process maps, SOPs, reporting templates and other as needed.
 Organize and manage key artifacts, including maintaining Teams & SharePoint sites, document version tracking, and collecting and organizing prepared documents.
 Liaise with all stakeholders, including senior leadership, business unit leaders, working teams and vendors, to document key systems and business processes.
 Identify and communicate continuous improvement opportunities across processes, including recommendations to reduce process waste, automate steps, adjust staffing models and other.
 Support planning and implementation of continuous improvement initiatives, including developing project documents, managing workbacks and supporting key change and training initiatives. 
Support Manager, Business Analytics to capture and prepare key reports and dashboards to support in-unit work, including funder reports, operational success and risk reports, financial reports and staff performance reports.
 Support Manager, Business Analytics in disseminating key reports to business units, including working with supervisors and managers on how to interpret critical data and drive operational, program or staff improvement initiatives.
 Support overall data and technology strategy, standardizing business processes, practices, and data sets where appropriate. 
In collaboration with PMO and Business Units, develop and document policy and governance documents for identified systems, processes and data sets. 



What You Bring to the Team




 Bachelor’s degree in business or relevant field, or equivalent professional experience.
 1+ years of experience with business administration or operations, continuous improvement, business analytics, or similar experience.







 What Will Set You Apart




 Strong ability to coordinate and support work across multiple different projects.
 Drive and ability to learn quickly and effectively across a diverse range of systems, processes and sectors.
 Excellent organization and time management skills.
 Excellent analysis and evaluation skills. 
Excellent process mapping skills. 
Demonstrated ability to operate independently with sound decision-making skills.
 High degree of comfort with Microsoft suite of products (PPT, Excel, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, etc.).
 Experience in a matrixed reporting structure.
 Familiarity with PMBOK an asset.
