Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
Company Overview 
Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments — when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out. And in everyday moments — when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesn’t miss the school bus home. 

We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters. 
 Department Overview Data Management Analyst - At Motorola Solutions we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems. 
  Job Description 
As a Data Management Analyst, you will collaborate closely with a diverse group of stakeholders including manufacturing, engineering, purchasing, project management and product managers. In this role, the candidate will review, validate and be responsible for assuring all required setups in SAP are done properly in a timer manner across all sites for a successful launch in all sites. 

Responsibilities will include but are not limited to: 

Coordinating cross-functional teams to ensure accurate and timely creation and maintenance of item data in SAP and Agile enterprise systems 
Performing data validation, analyzes, and data mining analysis between PLM, ERP and other systems. Analyzing master data, identifying inconsistencies, recommending and driving the implementation of corrective actions 
Design, construct, modify, integrate, implement and test data models and database management systems 
Supports manufacturing, supply chain, engineering, product management and customer facing teams as needed 
Data integrity support of pre-production builds in manufacturing 
Conduct research and provide advice to others regarding the selection, application and implementation of database management tools 
Review BOM, AML/AVL and change orders in SAP and Agile system ensuring accuracy and effectiveness. 
Research, develop, document, and implement data administration policy, standards and models 
Strong analytical skills for Pre-Load and Post-Load validations and analysis (Use of Microsoft Excel, standard SAP reports and SAP queries) 
Provide master data training to operations employees 
Other duties as identified by Management 


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: 

Strong analytics skills 
Undergraduate degree or certification in a relevant discipline (manufacturing, mechanical or electrical engineering, procurement, inventory management); 
Minimum of two years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment; 
CMII an asset 
Excellent organization, time management, and follow-up skills 
Excellent English communications skills, both written and verbal. 
Self-motivated person who enjoys challenges and working in a fast-paced environment with a daily sense of urgency. Taking initiative to solve problems and deliver results. 
Working knowledge of SAP and Agile within a manufacturing environment is a benefit 
Ability to work in teams, maintaining a high level of communication and interaction. 
Strong business acumen, a passion for structured problem solving 
Understanding of Configuration Management processes 
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, CM tools and Report Generators. 
Experience in SAP Material Management – Material Master, Inventory Management, Purchasing (Purchasing Info-Records, Purchasing Requisitions, Purchasing Orders) 
Understanding of circuit board manufacturing processes and cera like mechanical assembly processes including work order management in ERP 
Excellent understanding of change management processes; 
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools, ERP (SAP preferred), and PLM (Agile preferred) systems. 
Possess strong communications and interpersonal skills while able to work with multiple internal stakeholders to drive positive business results. 

 Basic Requirements 

Undergraduate degree or certification in a relevant discipline (manufacturing, mechanical or electrical engineering, procurement, inventory management); 
Minimum of two years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment; 
Change Management Certificate or Skills preferred 

 Travel Requirements Under 10% 
  Relocation Provided None 
  Position Type Experienced 
  Referral Payment Plan Yes
 
  EEO Statement 
Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Motorola Solutions will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities upon request. Motorola Solutions souscrit aux principes d’équité en matière d’emploi. Nous accueillons favorablement la diversité au sein de notre effectif. Sur demande, Motorola Solutions offrira des accommodements raisonnables aux candidats handicapés.

Title: QA Analyst, Fall 2022 (Co-op/Internship) - 8 months
Description:
Address: YSC - 2 Sheppard Avenue East 
 







Job Family Group: 






Technology 
 
Ensures the quality of the products that technology delivers, working closely with all applications, common services/middleware, and infrastructure teams throughout the development/engineering lifecycle. Designs, develops, executes, and maintains test plans of infrastructure, common services/middleware, data, and applications in various environments. Records and documents testing results (including anomalies and issues) and compares them to expected results. Detects solution failures so that defects may be discovered and corrected. Generates historical analysis of test results and maintains a list/repository of defects. Reviews and interprets all documentation related to testing, including business requirements and functional and design specifications, to provide input to the project team on the planning of testing activities. Provides immediate response to production program problems. 

Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. 
Reviews, evaluates, and derives requirements for testability. 
Designs, develops, executes, and maintains testing strategies and plans to ensure stability and efficiency, enabling a seamless customer experience. 
Executes and verifies test cases as part of the overall functional testing of Information Technology products as well as reporting defects and test results to the stakeholders. 
Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and systems in the organization to improve overall efficiency and improve the bank. 
Ensures the accuracy and consistency of test results through documentation processes. Follows BMO’s SDLC process. 
Communicates the overall quality of a deliverable and ensures metrics are used to drive delivery and identify any areas of concern. 
Participates in programs/projects across the enterprise. 
Participates as an active stakeholder in every initiative, driving quality based on fact-based metrics. 
Ensures development teams’ unit testing practices are in place and confirms core criteria met prior to integrated testing delivery. 
Proactively provides improvement opportunities to the team to enhance the customer experience. 
Drives the testing automation capabilities. 
Identifies opportunities to strengthen the quality assurance capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks. 
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning. 
Focus may be on a business/group. 
Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works mostly independently. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: 
Typically, 1- 2 years of work experience in IT or business environment and/or B.S./B.A. in computer science, engineering, information systems, math or business. 
Knowledge of the SDLC, testing concepts, methodologies, metrics, automated testing frameworks and BMO documentation standards. 
Understanding of BMO applications and infrastructure components. 
Problem solving skills including the ability to troubleshoot and identify problem areas throughout testing. 
Collaborate well with others. Ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand terms. 
Able to analyze data and use testing metrics to highlight improvement opportunities. 
Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Staff Business Analyst
Description:
Overview

   Small businesses and the self-employed community make up the world’s largest workforce. In SBSEG, it is our job to provide the tools, resources, and community to power prosperity for small businesses and self-employed people around the world. Our products include QuickBooks and Mailchimp. In this role you will operate in a face-paced environment, managing cross functional initiatives and partnering with the SBSEG International team to operationally mature the service at scale, and deliver value to internal and external customers.
 

 What you'll bring

 3-5 years of experience with Contact Center operations (forecasting, capacity planning, and real time operations frameworks)
 3-5 years of experience in project management, program management, or business operations
 Familiarity with online project management & collaboration tools - Slack, SmartSheets, Atlassian, Google Suite, LucidCharts, etc; can help teach & train teams how to use
 Experience with analytics to understand, manipulate and report data in an impactful way
 Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well in dynamic & matrix team environment
 Communicates equally well with senior leaders, front-line employees and cross-functional groups, both verbally and in writing
 Data driven - uses methodologies, metrics, and analysis to plan and assess performance against business goals
 Continuous improvement mind-set
 Ability to work independently and navigate ambiguity
 BS/BA degree required



 How you will lead

 Own the operational relationship with the SBSEG International Business Unit (Canada, Mexico, United Kingdom, France, Brazil, Australia) providing operational insights to influence strategic planning, partnering cross functionally with technical and business teams to launch and support new capabilities and workflows at scale, and communicating operational performance to stakeholders
 Drive operational rhythm across SBSEG and Intuit Customer Success teams, including operational performance reviews, continual service improvement initiatives, and leadership read-outs
 Gather, prioritize, and source operational capabilities from SBSEG
 Provide operational requirements to technology and business partner teams
 Support capacity planning and workforce management activities
 Create frameworks and best practices for repeatable processes (e.g. season readiness, service level management)
 Present operational performance to KPIs to senior leaders

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Remote Friendly)
Description:
At Vendasta, we believe in helping great local businesses survive and thrive in a world that’s more competitive than ever—and we’re growing our team! This is an opportunity to join one of the fastest growing tech companies in Canada and make a direct impact on local economies worldwide. In a world where local businesses all over the globe have had their livelihoods turned upside down, Vendasta continues to help them embrace digital solutions and flourish.

 Vendasta is a certified Great Place to Work and Best Workplace™ for Today’s Youth and Women. Keep reading if you’d like to join us on our mission to support small businesses all over the world.

 About the Job
 The Senior Data/BI Analyst will be responsible for the design, development, and delivery of enterprise business intelligence (BI) solutions to Vendasta’s internal stakeholders and enable them to achieve their business goals. As a Senior Data Analyst at Vendasta, you will work closely with the Finance, Corporate, and other teams, ask questions and discover meaningful answers that drive Vendasta’s growth and success.

 The impact you'll have:

Work closely with leadership teams within Corporate and Finance and other divisional leaders to develop robust research questions and contribute to all steps of the data analysis process, including exploring and cleaning data, modeling, interpreting, and communicating results, and measuring their implementation.
Be the subject matter expert; develop functional and technical expertise, understand the needs for corporate, Saas and finance metrics within the organization, and provide the right information to the business in the form of reports and dashboards
Build, maintain & monitor internal dashboards for each department to track productivity, revenue, quality, expenses, efficiency metrics, and more
Develop SQL queries; Acquire, Integrate, and Distribute data, data models, and deliver BI dashboards and reports using Google Cloud Platform.
Work in a fast-paced, agile environment; Work closely with the stakeholders, understand their needs, and deliver data, metrics, and reports that provide reliable and clear information to enhance their business and improve operational efficiency.
Must enjoy coordinating with interdisciplinary teams, learn quickly, and be comfortable working independently and also as a team.



 The value you'll bring:
 7+ years of experience as a BI Developer/Data Analyst/Senior Data Analyst with the following skills:

Experience in SQL Programming with strong analytic and troubleshooting skills


Experience Developing BI reports using visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, MicroStrategy, Looker, DataStudio, etc.,
Manage data - acquisition, integration, and distribution - using technologies such as SQL Server, MySQL, Google BigQuery and orchestration tools such as Informatica, SSIS, Dataflow, Airflow, DBT, etc.
Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple and concurrent tasks.
Experience working in an Agile (SCRUM) environment and ability to deliver requirements following an iterative & incremental approach.
Ability to work independently as well as a team in a fast-paced environment
Ability to tackle problems quickly and completely.
Strong communication skills
Develop and foster a working relationship with team members, other Analysts, Software Developers, Product Managers, Sales, Marketing, and Operations Executives.

Preferred:

Experience working closely with Finance, Corporate, and Senior Leadership.
Technical Certifications/Expertise in Google BigQuery, Looker, DataStudio, and Airflow but not mandatory



 About Vendasta
 So what do we actually do? We create an entire platform full of digital products & solutions that help small to medium sized businesses (SMBs) have a stronger presence online through digital advertising, online listings, reputation management, website creation, social media marketing … and much more! Our platform is used exclusively by channel partners, who sell products and services to SMBs, allowing them to leverage us to scale and grow their business. We’re trusted by 60,000+ channel partners, serving over 5.5 million small to medium businesses worldwide!

 Perks

Benefits - health, dental, life, and disability insurance, an employee assistance program (EAP)*, and $500 annual Health Spending Account. Premiums for health & dental insurance will be covered by Vendasta!
Vacation - Minimum 3 weeks paid vacation per year; uncapped sick time policy.
Employee Options Program - get in on Vendasta’s growth and success!
Sweet Eats - On site cafeteria with beverages & snacks all day and free catered lunch every Friday
Training & Career Development - Education reimbursement program, professional development plans, leadership workshops, mentorship program, and so much more!
Culture - comprised of our core values: Drive, Innovation, Respect, and Agility
Social Events - Ideas on Tap, ski trips, virtual talent shows, yoga classes, and more!
Giving Back - endless opportunities to take part in programs and initiatives that give back to the community we work in, including paid volunteer ti

Title: Digital Analyst - Research & Insights
Description:
Are you creative, dynamic and passionate? Do you like to think outside of the box and find new ways to achieve your goals? Corus Entertainment has an exciting opportunity for you. If you have a passion for excellence, and would like to work for Corus Entertainment, we encourage you to apply. 


Division: Research & Insights 

Work Status: Full time 

Location: Toronto, ON - Flexible. 

 About the role 

 We are looking for a Digital Analytics pro who can tag, collect and present digital data across the entire Corus digital footprint. As we expand and grow our content into new and emerging platforms (think Amazon Channels, Apple TV, ROKU, and so many more), our analysts are our champions in data, delivering clarity and understanding to our team, our stakeholders and our clients. 

 About the team 

 The Digital Analytics team at Corus is responsible for the digital data across 200+ web, mobile and television apps at Corus. Our aim is to demystify our massive datasets into fantastic stories about customer experiences to enable the entire Corus team. We are trusted advisors within Corus, where our research, dashboards and stories help drive innovation and strategy while providing a lens into the hearts and minds of our customers. 

 About you 

 You are a data analyst who is comfortable collaborating at all levels within an organization – marketers, developers, product managers and executives are your partners. You naturally know when to discuss technical details as well as when to transform raw data into persuasive and compelling storytelling. 

 You understand that measurement is an art as well as a science – and can appreciate both. Challenges do not dissuade you, but motivate you to develop creative solutions. You are comfortable prioritizing your work and leaning on your team when you need them. 

 You are a strong believer that your personal well-being matters as much as your career – we believe it too, which is why we offer a choice of flexible working arrangements, innovative offerings within our benefits packages, and a leadership team which will support you in your professional career goals. We also offer you the flexibility of working anywhere in the world for up to 8 weeks out of the year – because we believe your physical presence and your contributions are two different things. 


As a Digital Analyst for Corus you will:


Contribute to the informational needs of the business by implementing analytics tags, creating dashboards, automated reports development
Collaborate effectively with internal teams to define and deliver the implementation of analytics for data collection
Integrate a large variety of internal and external data sets into clear and concise reports
Be an active member of the Digital Sales and Revenue Management teams to develop forecasts that will be used as the basis for revenue projections
Advise internal groups such as our Data Science team as well as Web and App developers to help deliver collected data
Validate the accuracy and consistency of our digital data implementations
Be an advocate for digital data at Corus
Be relentlessly curious and take advantage of both formal and informal learning opportunities
Support your team and be a great partner by being approachable and accountable in your work

Here is what you need to succeed (our minimum requirements):


3+ years of experience in an analytics role, preferably for digital data
3+ years of experience with Adobe-based marketing and measurement solutions
2+ years of experience in reporting or solution design for digital analytics
An understanding of audience segments
Experience with SQL

Any combination of these will make your application stand out:


A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Math, CompSci, CompEng or Statistics
Proficiency in JavaScript, Python or R
Experience using REST-based APIs for data
Experience building visualizations in Power BI or Tableau
Administration skills for Adobe Experience Platform products
Media/Entertainment/Broadcast industry experience
 We're looking forward to meeting you! 

 Why Corus? 

 Corus is a driving force in the media industry with a diverse portfolio of strong brands that entertain and inform audiences through great storytelling and compelling content, reaching millions of people around the world every day. 

 We have a passionate drive to connect with the world around us: to express, to share, to be part of people's lives. Walk around our offices, our stations, our studios across the country and you'll feel it. You'll see it in action. 

 You'll see it in the open communication and the approachability of our people. You'll see it in our care for quality work and the interest in new, creative solutions. You'll see it in how we work with external partners, and how we care about our communities. These are all core to the values we commit to living each and every day - Win Together, Think Beyond, Make It Happen, Learn Every Day, Show We Care. Our values describe what makes us pretty unique - and amazing - place to work. 

 At Corus we value and actively involve the full range of what makes people unique in order to create a strong and innovative company where amazing people thrive. A company where people have the full opportunity to show their unique value and develop their potential. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, people of colour, people with disabilities, people from all gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities. 

 Corus is also committed to providing accommodations throughout the interview and employment process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. 

 How to Apply 

 If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now'. 



No phone calls please. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Inventory Control Analyst
Description:
The Corporate Inventory Analyst – Attachments works closely with the ordering teams, specifically the Construction and Forestry division within Brandt Tractor. This position will be responsible for forecasting attachment requirements, assisting in placing orders and providing inventory control of incoming and outgoing attachments.
 Be a part of projects pertaining to new product lines, product changeovers, cross reference material as well as vendor management and analytics. Analyze and coordinate vendor returns to determine the best course of action whether it be transfers to central hubs or direct to vendors.
 DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Report Creation and Running (Stock Leveling / Returns / Data Integrity)
Running price tapes, checks, and update within the business system
Manage ongoing relationship with key vendors and their personnel
Complete price checks at bordering dealers quarterly
Ensure update of all prices assigned align with our pricing strategy
Provide input on pricing changes that need to be made
Complete surplus returns and provide to stores to pick/execute
Return Closeouts (AR Docs / Removal of Inventory)
Special Projects (Product Changeover / Cross References / Strategic Sourcing)
Create larger top up, seasonal or container load orders to be reviewed by Inventory Manager
Will be a Subject Matter Expert within the Attachment business segment
Additional Duties as assigned


 Required Skills
 
 Required Experience
 

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Attention to detail, accuracy, deadline oriented and the ability to multi-task are essential.
Excellent organizational and communication skills are required.
Previous experience in the heavy equipment business, with demonstrated history of managing inventory for regional distribution and working with department managers for local inventory at the branch (right parts, right place, right time and right price) would be an asset.
Analytical / critical thinker who can problem solve and think outside the box
Ability to contribute to process improvement regarding parts processes
Strong work ethic, willing to put in extra time as needed to get the job done

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Job Overview 
Working closely with the IT Team and reporting to the Director of IT, The Business Analyst will be responsible for bridging the gap between IT and the business, using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders. We are looking for the right candidate to leverage data for innovation and business growth, and to apply sound practices of business and data analytics to improve efficiency and solve problems.
The role will require effective engagement with leaders and stakeholders in various departments to understand how data-driven changes to process, products, services, software and hardware can improve efficiencies and add value. They will need to articulate ideas and recommendations, and balance them against what is feasible, as well as financially and functionally reasonable. The role will require strong analysis of data to help improve products, services or process.
The Business Analyst will be responsible for the insight, analysis & administration of Cloverdale Paint’s data and information, and assist the IT Team in the coordination and planning of computing and network related activities. In this role, the Business Analyst will be expected to analyze and support current data systems and assets, recommend and implement solutions and upgrades, and provide guidance to the IT staff. The ideal candidate has extensive knowledge of IT operations, experience with database management, and advanced knowledge involving Data, ERP, SQL, Power BI, SharePoint among others.
Cloverdale Paint is on a digital transformation roadmap to replace its current legacy ERP system with a modern solution that will provide harmony and integration among the many functional areas within the organization. The Business Analyst will be involved in the ERP Replacement project as it moves into next stage of the initiative to design the new system and develop the required new processes. The project will provide an invaluable opportunity for the Business Analyst to be a part of a highly visible initiative.Responsibilities 

Actively participate in the ERP Replacement project utilizing sound practice to assist in the development of new processes, workflows to meet the requirements of the business
Perform administration of corporate application data and databases to identify and prioritize technical and functional requirements. Performing detailed analysis of data, outlining problems, opportunities and solutions for the business.
Analyze and determine business requirements by partnering with key stakeholders across the organization to develop solutions to build effective reports, dashboards and strategies to utilize corporate data to its fullest extent.
Execute data mining techniques to extract and discover anomalies, patterns and correlations with data sets to predict outcomes. Retrieve important and relevant information to provide departments with the statistics to apply constructive trending and forecasting predictions.
Fulfill pricing and costing administration duties providing essential costing analysis to allow the business to develop productive pricing strategies and ensure consistency and standardization of processes.
Work closely with IT team to maintain essential operation and security of data, information, systems, and networks across the organization. Preserving and securing company information and data is a priority to protect against vulnerabilities and threats.
Participate in projects and initiatives of new applications, systems and services that strengthen the company’s data sets allowing the organization to tap into the data and use it to its fullest potential.
Perform systems and database administration and optimization ensuring availability of data and the integrity of information flows securely throughout the company.
Monitor performance of systems to determine cost and productivity levels, and help define IT infrastructure strategy, architecture, and processes.
Research and evaluate emerging trends, technologies, hardware, and software to bring forward recommendations for implementation within the organization.
Identify problems, troubleshooting with database and systems to resolve issues and return to normal operation.
Maintain quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.

Qualifications 

Degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience that demonstrates a firm grasp of data management, analytics and IT operational best practices.
Experience as a Business or Data Analyst is required with a desired minimum 5 years of experience working data in an administrative capacity.
Experience with projects, and implementing systems and solutions across various technologies, displaying strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize.
Advanced understanding of Business Intelligence with validated ability to apply the strategies and technologies used for data analysis and management of business information.
Advanced understanding in the disciplines of Data Management and the necessary governance to ensure integrity and security of data.
Advanced working knowledge of the key systems and applications vital to core business data requirements: ERP, databases, Power BI, SharePoint.

Required Skills 

Demonstrated capabilities in gathering business requirements from the interaction and communication with stakeholders and business leaders.
Proven skills to translate data into meaningful business insights with ability to generate reports in a clear and relevant way, and with accuracy.
Self-starter with the motivation and drive to set and achieve goals, and the passion and drive to continually learn and improve.
Strategic thinking with an understanding of the role technology plays in helping an organization achieve its goals.
Demonstrated ability to apply strong critical thinking and decision-making skills to understand complex requirements and produce solutions to problems.
Interpersonal skills with ability to effectively communicate with the team, and to establish relationship with other departments to educate, inform, resolve issues and develop solutions.
Ability to work well under the pressure of deadlines, or when faced with issues and challenges to complete projects, or return systems to normal operations.
Attention to detail to minimize the potential for error, and to identify and correct potential problems before they occur.

Core Competencies 

Business awareness and acumen
Communication and interpersonal skills
Time management and organizational skills
Problem solving and analytical skills
Detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
BI (Business Intelligence)
Database administration
Report generation

Title: SENIOR RESEARCH ANALYST (DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR)
Description:
The Job

 “What is the difference between NoSQL and relational databases?
   “What is the difference between T-SQL and SQL?
   “How can you identify if a database server is running properly?
  
 If you're still reading this, chances are you have an affinity for designing and developing data management structures, and large-scale database administration, and you might be a great fit for our team.
  
 The Research and Analysis unit in the Treasury Board Secretariat is seeking one Senior Database Administrator who can provide technical consulting expertise in data management and database administration.
  

This role will focus exclusively on database administration

 What can I expect to do in this role? As a Database Administrator, you will:
  


Provide data management expertise in development of information technology plans and strategies
Develop methodologies, techniques, and tools for reactive and proactive, manual and automated database performance monitoring
Lead corporate projects for building, maintaining corporate data model or developing Windows-based database systems by providing technical direction and project leadership to teams
Evaluate and recommend technical design features and alternatives to ensure proper procedures for backup, recovery, and security of all ministry databases
Propose cost-effective use of new data base products, data modelling tools and application development aids.
Provide database backup and recovery expertise to develop procedures and perform Disaster Recovery Planning (DRP) exercise to ensure timely recovery of Justice Mission Critical Systems in case of any disasters

 How do I qualify?
 Database Design and Development Knowledge:

You have experience working with Microsoft Azure Cloud databases, Microsoft SQL Server (all versions) and database replication.
You can provide data management expertise and advice on database design standards for the ministry.
You have working knowledge of Azure Data Factory (AD).
You have knowledge of Windows computer system technologies, an understanding of database management using Windows operating systems, and knowledge of data management and application software.
You have knowledge of database development methodology, programming languages, database concepts, data types, data dictionaries, and data storage and retrieval techniques to lead the design, testing, and implementation of multi-purpose and multi-client based databases and data management structures.
You have knowledge and experience in coding, testing and implementation of SQL, triggers, stored procedures and others.

 Database Monitoring and Technical Software/Hardware Knowledge:

You can analyze and maximize capabilities of databases using available technology and advise on acquisition of new software/hardware.
You can monitor and maintain database systems performance through development of standards.
You can advise on solutions to data recovery, integrity, security issues, and assess impact of data organization on systems performance.
You can evaluate database software and data management techniques/services for potential use by the ministry.
You have knowledge in SQL database administration and tuning, Windows system administration, database and system backup and recovery.
You are proficient in Windows host scripting, Python, database replication, and enterprise backup.

 Problem-Solving and Evaluative Skills:

You can apply project management principles and techniques to lead and participate in policy and research projects.
You understand research and data gathering methodologies to analyze data management requirements such as integrity/security/recovery issues and developing recommendations for ministry standards on database design and data organization.
You can assess clients' requirements in relation to multi-purpose and multi-client database systems and lead project team in design/development of corporate data models for systems, databases, data management structures, standards, policies and procedures.
You can conduct research, assemble and analyze data and information.
You can identify and resolve issues and problems impacting the Ministry and supports the Ministry in achieving its objectives.

 Communication Skills:

You can explain technical solutions to non-technical personnel.
You can deliver presentations to senior management (systems and non-systems managers) on proposals for data management aspects of information architecture and information technology plans/strategies.
You can present and discuss benefits/drawbacks of proposals on data management strategies with senior managers and encourage support of recommended approach.

Title: Business Process Analyst
Junior HRIS Analyst
Description:
Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.
              







Description 

Job Summary: Ledcor are seeking a Junior Human Resource Information Systems (HRIS) Analyst for a full-time permanent position. In your new role you will be responsible for supporting the effective configuration, integration, communication, maintenance, compliance and reporting of employee data and for the ongoing management of Ledcor’s HRIS and other HR Systems. 
           
 As the Junior HRIS Analyst you will partner with the Human Resources group to support a Cloud based solution in the areas of core HR, recruitment & applicant tracking, employee onboarding, compensation, learning and dashboards & analytics.
           
 This is an exciting opportunity for an individual who has a strong foundational experience in Workday and is looking to develop their career within HRIS Analysis. This position can be based from your home office, with the understanding you may be required to attend an office as required. Come join Ledcor’s HR Technology team today by applying through this job posting!
           
 Essential Responsibilities

 Support the effective functioning of the integrations from Workday to other systems through data audits and testing new functionality, etc.
 Provide support with the data flow between Workday and JD Edwards and audits on data accuracy and integrity regularly to support the weekly HR / Payroll processing cycle.
 Document procedures to ensure data integrity.
 Work with internal clients to design, develop and distribute reports as requested to support more user self-sufficiency.
 Analyze data for accuracy and provide analytical reports to internal customers
 Provide support with the day-to-day data workflow including providing the HR team members with training related to the HR Systems.
 Support on assigned HRIS projects for enhancements and changes including testing HRIS system enhancements and upgrades
 Understand system requirements and ensures administration of data is in alignment with HRIS, IS, Payroll, and legal requirements.
 Identify opportunities for continuous improvement.
 Provide support for company compliance with all provincial / state and federal reporting laws, prepares all necessary data and analysis for required reports and filings in a timely manner.
 May perform other related duties as assigned.


 Qualifications

 Degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems or Human Resources preferred
 3-5 years related professional experience in a role that relies heavily on data administration and analysis
 Experience with HRIS/Talent Management systems such as JDE Edwards, Oracle HCM, ServiceNow, Cornerstone, Workday
 Report writing and database management experience
 Strong knowledge of HR concepts, practices, processes and procedures
 Experience with structured project management, implementation and testing methodologies
 Knowledge of web services, SFTP and other data integration tools
 Knowledge of web servers, process schedulers, and application servers is a plus
 Experience with SaaS solutions (Cloud based)
 Excellent oral and written communication skills, including development and delivery of presentations and / or relevant knowledge transfer
 Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to meet and juggle tight deadlines
 Ability to work with a wide range of customers and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization
 Ability to use and modify tools and methods to support customer needs and have an understanding of business strategic issues
 Ability to excel in a team environment


 Additional Information:
 Company Description
 The Ledcor Group of Companies is one of North America’s most diversified construction companies. Ledcor is a company built on a rich history of long-standing project successes.

 But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

 Employment Equity
 At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.
 Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   As a Business Systems Analyst, you will join CIBC’s Technology team, Enterprise Content Management Technology group, to ensure collection of information, accurate requirement gathering, data analysis, documentation of information, and presentation of findings to advance initiatives and ensure project success.
 

   The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for formulating system scope and objectives, validating developed requirements, testing, training and implementing applications, and providing end user support. The role performs tasks of technical depth and breadth, validating and documenting business requirements for assigned projects to ensure the maximization of operational efficiency, and ensuring project control procedures and policies are executed. The Business Systems Analyst determines methods and approaches to projects, providing business support relative to the development, analysis and identification of process changes or system enhancements. The role uses judgement and autonomy on day to day tasks, providing operational support for projects after implementation including problem resolution and recommendations to ensure ongoing success. The role proactively addresses problems within the scope of responsibility and identifies areas for possible improvements.
 


   At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.
 


   How You’ll Succeed
 

 Client engagement – Meet with clients to understand their priorities, advise them on solutions, and provide a forward-looking financial plan. Use your knowledge of cash management, credit, investment and wealth protection to help clients meet their goals.
 Relationship building - Engage in marketing and outreach activities to show clients you value them and their communities. Grow your network, deepen existing relationships, and collaborate with others to ensure clients are connected to the right people and opportunities.
 Leveraging technology - Become a technology expert. Share your knowledge by introducing clients to our mobile banking applications, enabling them to better manage their banking needs.



   Who You Are
 

 Understanding Requirements - Work closely with Business Partners to guide formulation of complex business requirements and solution design discussions to meet project needs through daily scrums, sprint reviews, backlog refinement. Participate in key Agile/Scrum rituals including Sprint Planning, Daily Scrums, Sprint Reviews and Retrospective Meetings. Participate and lead solution requirements gathering sessions in a waterfall environment.
 Solution Design - Work closely with Business Partners to guide formulation of complex business requirements and solution design discussions to meet project needs.
 Coordination & Collaboration - Coordinate and lead cross-functional tasks or work packages to identify and document functional or reporting requirements, work flow, information sources and system specifications. Partner with project manager, technical resources, vendors, and management to ensure accurate execution of project(s).
 Organization and Effectiveness - Manage competing requests from projects and management to deliver all required artefacts with quality and timeliness.
 You can demonstrate experience in: 2-3 years of hands-on experience in a Business Systems Analyst role within a financial institution. You have experience with business process modeling, IT project management, and knowledge of IT standards, procedures, and policies.
 You must have experience gathering requirements, and analysis such as Use Case analysis and User Story development. Ideally you have professional exposure to System Development Life cycle, Application Delivery and Implementation.
 You must be an excellent communicator - both written and orally.
 You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
 You’re goal oriented. You’re motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.
 You're passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You connect with others through respect and authenticity.
 You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge. You have a strong sense of curiosity.
 Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.



   What CIBC offers
 

   At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
 

 We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
 Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
 We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-81 Bay, 24th Floor
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Agile Methodologies, Business Analysis, Enterprise Content Management (ECM), Requirements Gathering, Waterfall Model

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for a 
  HR Data Analyst to join our small but mighty team! Manager, HR Reporting and Analytics, the successful candidate will work collaboratively leading optimization activities through data and reporting. You are a self-starter who enjoys problem solving, finding innovative ways of working, and providing exceptional solutions.
 



  This position will be located at our Head Office in Markham, Ontario and will have flexibility for both remote and in-office work based on our hybrid work model.
 



  ACCOUNTABILITIES:
 

Work with developers and stakeholders to create data schemas, data feed requirements and work with our broader data organization
Support the HR team initiatives with financial modelling and KPI tracking
Support the Payroll team with Federal and Provincial programs for health care workers
Liaise between the Human Resources functional user groups and other stakeholders to help define, analyze, and validate functional business requirements, and be able to translate those requirements into effective technical solutions
Ensure business requirements are clearly defined, documented, communicated, implemented, and tested for all assigned projects


  QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:
 

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, Engineering, Computer Science or similar
1-3 years of data management and analysis experience in growth environment
Knowledge with SQL Server building complex queries and MS Excel
Background with BI tools like PowerBI is an asset


  What Extendicare has to offer:
 



  At Extendicare, we believe that working as a team creates an environment that allows us to reach our potential. We value each employee, encourage equal opportunity for growth and recognize achievement. As a valued member of our team, you can expect:
 

Continuous mentorship, support for life-long learning and growth opportunities
Opportunities for advancement and career growth within the organization
A rewarding and meaningful work experience where you can enrich your life and the lives of others through your work.
Employee Family Assistance Program.
Robust benefits package.


  Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of over 115 operated senior care and living centres, as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 individuals are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada.
 



In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Extendicare's Policies on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of Extendicare’s hiring process.


  Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Technical Business AnalystMississaugaOntario9558BRJob Description and RequirementsAre you a problem solver who enjoys getting to the bottom of difficult situations? Do you have a drive to take existing processes to the next level? Are you a collaborative team-player who considers trust and respect important in building real partnerships? If so, we’re looking for you!About UsTC Transcontinental has close to 8,000 employees globally, 41 operating facilities, and revenues at $2.6 billion for fiscal 2021. TC strives to drive growth and innovation and optimize the creation of sustainable solutions for our customers. Following the transformational acquisition of H.S. Crocker, TC Transcontinental has broadened the packaging solutions portfolio in the food sector and expanding pharmaceutical and medical expertise in advanced coatings product offering. With our 3 business segments in Print, Packaging and Media we continue to optimize, transform, and grow while making impressions that count!This position will be part of our Premedia team. Our Premedia team is the largest division of its kind in Canada. With over 500 talented employees in our group, we are proud to provide our national retail and CPG customers with key services ranging from creative, photo/video, language services, production, packaging and technology solutions. You will join this very passionate and dynamic team, in an exciting environment that is second to none!About this opportunityReporting to Director of Technology, Solutions and Development, Technical Business Analyst will primarily be supporting TC’s proprietary digital platform by actively collaborating with clients, development, QA, design, and product teams. Successful candidate will be required to participate in daily standup meetings, lead discovery sessions, coach team members, provide feedback and contribute with process improvements. Heavy focus will be put on building and translating business and technical requirements for existing platform and helping in its overall evolution.****Responsibilities: The incumbent will be responsible for but not limited to:

Working with the business and clients to gather requirements for TC’s proprietary digital platform and transform them into detailed functional and technical specifications
Collaborating with the development, product, QA, PM and design teams to ensure requirements are understood, concise and ready for implementation
Working with project managers to identify change management requirements (e.g., communication, training, workflows etc.) and ensure that they are executed successfully
Collaborating with other internal teams and external vendors to ensure that reciprocal business needs or limitations are considered throughout all stages of the project
Provide on-going support for current implementations
Guides QA through testing objectives and assist with analysis of testing results if needed
Functions as a liaison between the business and the project team. Walks stakeholders through requirements and manages expectations regarding scope

Qualifications: 

Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Business, Information Technology, or related field
4+ years of experience as a business systems analysis in software development
Experience within system implementation projects
Experience with business process mapping and data mapping
Excellent communication skills across a range of forums, channels, and stakeholders
Experience with JIRA or related software
Excellent documentation and presentation skills
Strong analytical, problem solving, decision making and negotiating skills
High attention to detail and ability to learn and adapt to high paced environment
Ability to work well in a team environment and under tight deadlines is a must
Maintain knowledge of software development, methodologies and information technology trends through training, appropriate literature, and other means
BABOK, CBAP, CCBA, or equivalent certification is an asset
Experience in print/digital marketing is considered a strong asset
Experience with Adobe suite is a strong asset (InDesign)
Agile Certification (CSM, CPO) is an asset
Project management certification is an asset
Experience in working with projects based on Agile or Waterfall methodologies

What makes you technical: 

Broad exposure/experience of software development life cycle typically 2-3 or more years of related experience
Excellent in-depth knowledge of SQL, .NET technologies, APIs, Azure/AWS infrastructure, C#, XML data structures and different operating systems/browser environments
Experience in development of multi-tier web and API solutions

What we have to offer

Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly motivating work environment where you can develop your potential and launch an exciting career;
Development opportunities where your input makes a difference. Competitive compensation package, pension and flexible benefits that are customizable to you and your family needs;
Employee perks such as discounts from suppliers on various products and services such as insurance, wireless bundles, travel, and much more.

Title: Analyst, Sales Performance
Description:
Reports To
   

 Sales Performance Manager
   

 Location
   

 Remote
   



 Type
   

 Full Time, Salary
   

 Closing Date
   

 June 28th, 2022
   




 Company Overview


 Sysco connects the world to share food and care for one another. Sysco leads from the heart of food and service to deliver the freshest of foods and ideas to restaurants, healthcare and educational facilities, lodging establishments and other customers who prepare meals away from home. Our customers can count on us to deliver on-point products and solutions since only Sysco is the global leader, sitting at the heart of innovation supply, delivery, culinary and more.
 


 With over 57,000 associates and a fleet of over 13,000 vehicles, Sysco operates approximately 326 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 625,000 customer locations. For fiscal 2021 that ended July 3, 2021, the company generated sales of more than $51 billion.
 


 Sysco, one of Canada’s Best Employers 2022, as listed by Forbes, is dedicated to our global corporate social responsibility goals and to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations.
 


 Sysco is more than just a place to work. Our passion for food and our customers has made us the industry leader. To remain on top, we will continue to think bigger, work harder and never give up. Are you ready to drive success?
 


 For more information, visit www.sysco.ca or follow us @SyscoCanada at facebook.com/SyscoCanada; twitter.com/SyscoCanada or instagram.com/SyscoCanada
 

 For a full list of opportunities, visit 
www.sysco.ca/careers



 Role:


   The Sales Performance Analyst provides analytical support to the Sales Performance Manager related to local sales compensation and compensation analytics. Secondary to compensation, the incumbent will also be responsible for creating other Sales Performance related reporting and metrics, including regular reporting of defined performance metrics.
 


 Role Responsibilities:


 The primary responsibility for this position is to provide analytical data and reporting to support the execution of centralized sales compensation Payroll and Sales Performance reporting.
 Assist in the reporting of key performance metrics to help drive sales performance.
 Extract data sets and perform analysis to support sales incentive calculations, and sales performance efforts on a weekly/monthly/quarterly basis.
 Understands key metrics to include outside data, year over year performance and run rates in relationship to overall company goals with a bottom up approach.
 Manage, resolve, and route CRM related issues/requests from sales associates.
 Proactively monitors and strives to maintain high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in the sales organization’s planning efforts (CRM platform).
 Maintains reports tracking standardized sales process, standardized KPIs, and executive dashboards.
 Responsible for compliance with all Policies and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) comprising Sysco’s Food Safety Program, specific for the assigned role.
 Assist Food Safety Program Manager in ensuring compliance to Sysco’s Food Safety Program that leads to compliance with third party certification and customer requirements.
 Is willing to work safely with minimal environmental impact and understands the importance of reporting all hazards, incidents, and environmental spills immediately to their Supervisor.
 Understands that they play an integral role in their own safety and that of their colleagues and is willing to speak out when hazards are present.
 Perform other duties as assigned.


 Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements:


 Minimum 1-3 years of experience working with data, numbers, analytics, or related experience.
 Completion of post-secondary education; Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or Data Analytics preferred.
 Learns quickly when facing new challenges; thrives on fast-paced environment.
 Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook.
 Strong comprehension for writing SQL and working with databases.
 Self-reliant exploring, extracting, analyzing, and presenting information with Excel (PivotTables, writing VBA code, etc.).
 Demonstrated ability to provide meaningful analytics and visualizations.
 Strong communication skills; ability to effectively communicate with internal and external teams.
 Able to handle superior level of confidentiality concerning employee information.
 Excellent organizational and project management skills, including the ability to execute multiple initiatives at the same time.
 Flexible; readily accepts change; open to new ideas.
 Experience with compensation programs is highly favorable.
 Proactive, self-directed, with the ability to structure a weekly schedule to be successful.





 Internal candidates apply via the Career Centre on your HR Portal / ADP Workforce Now.
   

     External candidates submit cover letter & resume via www.sysco.ca/careers
   






 Our Purpose


 Connecting the world to share food and care for one another
   



 Our Mission


 Delivering success for our customers through industry-leading people, products, and solutions
   



 Our Identity


 Together we define our future of foodservice and supply chain
   




 Sysco is committed to Employment Equity. Accommodations during the recruitment process are available upon request for candidates with disabilities.
 


 Here’s a sample of the many benefits Sysco associates enjoy:


   Comprehensive Flexible Benefits including Health and Dental, Health Care Spending and Wellness Accounts • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability • Life Insurance • Company Pension Plan • Group RRSP • Employee and Family Assistance • Stock Purchase Plan • Unlimited on-line learning • Sysco product discounts • Preferred vendor discounts • Associate Resource Groups
 

   (*benefits may vary based on location or bargaining unit)

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Job Information




Job Requisition ID: 13868
Ministry: Energy
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-Time: Full Time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Regular
Scope: Open Competition
Closing Date: July 4, 2022
Classification: Program Services 3




 About Us


  Energy Operations Division:  As a steward of Alberta’s energy system, the Department of Energy is taking a proactive, networked approach to managing the many perspectives, relationships and interactions within government, industry and stakeholders who comprise or influence the energy system. The Energy Operations Division is tasked with the management of Alberta’s energy and mineral rights, the assessment and collection of royalties related to the development of those mineral rights, and the implementation of major, strategic initiatives for the department. The primary goal is to enable the efficient, transparent and sustainable development of Alberta’s mineral and energy resources in order to drive investment in Albertan jobs and to generate revenue for the Crown.




 Role


 Do you like working on complex, challenging files alongside smart and fun people? Do you have a high tolerance for ambiguity and thrive in navigating the unknown? Are you interested in helping shape the long-term direction of energy in Alberta? If you said yes, consider joining our team!  The Senior Business Analyst in the Royalty Information Management (RIM) unit within the Oil Sands, Coal and Mineral Operations Branch has the end-to-end responsibility to manage and develop tenure and royalty job functions. The candidate will be responsible for various business processes and business systems that are used to support ongoing business operations across the Division. The Royalty Information Management (RIM) Unit is responsible for managing the information systems and data that supports the administration of our Oil Sands royalty and tenure business.  The Senior Business Analyst in RIM will help manage systems information, make technical and strategic decisions affecting our IT systems using solid business and technical knowledge, process complex program related information, and support policy and operational issues and decision making by ensuring the right information is available.  The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for: 

The completion of complex I.T. systems design, testing and implementation work to ensure information systems are responsive to business needs and function in accordance with the applicable acts and regulations.
Providing leadership, support and direction to operational analysts.
Supporting business decision making with accurate information and timely analysis.
Providing subject matter expertise to other members of the team as well as to other staff within the branch, division and department.
Completion and/or oversight of royalty audit processing including both revenue and cost adjustments and follow-up correspondence with internal and external stakeholders.
Processing and/or oversight of Alberta Energy Regulator Scheme approval information into the OASIS system.
Managing quarterly royalty accrual information for financial forecasting.


 Knowledge: 

In-depth technical knowledge of the design and function of related I.T. systems including the Oil Sands Administrative and Strategic Information System (OASIS) and the Electronic Transfer System (ETS). A good understanding and working knowledge of the interfaces between OASIS and other department systems including the Royalty and Marketing (RAM) system, Foundation and the Corporate Accounting and Reporting System (CARS2).
Understanding of the Information Systems Development Lifecycle including systems design, business requirements gathering, business use-case development, user acceptance testing, implementation and end-user training.
Experience with maintenance and enhancements of I.T. systems, including requirements gathering, systems design, user acceptance testing, implementation and end-user training.
Advanced knowledge of the Oil Sands Royalty Regulation, 2009, the Allowed Costs (Ministerial) Regulation and the Bitumen Valuation Methodology (Ministerial) Regulation and related Legislation.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of the Oil Sand Royalty Regime for approved royalty Projects and for non-Project wells.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of the Alberta Energy Regulator Scheme Approvals.
Critical thinking, attention to detail and sound judgment are crucial skills required for this position.





Qualifications


 University graduation in business, economics, environmental sciences, natural resource sciences, public administration or a related field plus 2 years of relevant and progressively responsible related experience or equivalent as described below.  Equivalency:  Directly related education or experience considered on the basis of:

1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or
1 year of experience for 1 year of education.


 The following skills and abilities would be considered strong assets for the Senior Business Analyst, Royalty Information Management unit position:

In-depth understanding of the Oil Sands Royalty Regulation, 2009, the Oil Sands Allowed Costs (Ministerial) Regulation and the Bitumen Valuation Methodology (Ministerial) Regulation.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of the Oil Sand Royalty Regime for approved royalty Projects and for non-Project wells.
Detailed working knowledge of the Oil Sands Administrative and Strategic Information System (OASIS) and the Electronic Transfer System (ETS) as well as a good understanding of the interfaces between OASIS and other department systems including the Royalty and Marketing (RAM) system, Foundation and the Corporate Accounting and Reporting System (CARS2).
Knowledge of the Information Systems Development Lifecycle including systems design, business requirements gathering, business use-case development, user acceptance testing, implementation and end-user training.
Detailed knowledge and understanding of Alberta Energy Regulator Scheme Approvals.
Strong computer skills and in-depth Microsoft Office suite working experience





APS Competencies


 Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.  This link will assist you with understanding competencies:  Both positions require the ability to function with maturity in most components of the GOA Competency Model, but the following are deemed to be of somewhat higher profile to success in the position: 

Agility
Drive for Results
Systems Thinking
Creative Problem Solving





Salary


 $2,556.10 to $3,355.81 biweekly ($66,714.21 to $87,586.64 annually)




 Notes


 This is a full time position working 36.25 hours per week.  This position is based in Edmonton.  Other information: 

A cover letter outlining how your experience relates to the qualifications outlined in this job ad is required.
A written assessment may be used as part of the screening/selection process.
In your resume, please include dates (including months and years) associated with all education and work experience. Also, please indicate whether your work experience is casual, part-time or full-time. For example: January 15, 2006 – June 25, 2009: Assistant (PT three 8 hrs shifts/week).
This competition may be used to fill future vacancies. 

Links and information on what the GoA has to offer to prospective employees: 

Working for the Alberta Public Service –
Public Service Pension Plan (PSPP) –
Leadership and mentorship programs
Professional learning and development
Positive workplace culture and work-life balance





How To Apply


  If you are not currently an employee with the Government of Alberta, the first step in applying for a job is creating your candidate profile within our online application system,  Existing employees should access the Career tile in 1GX to submit their application in order to be recognized as an internal applicant.  Once you have created your candidate profile, visit the Alberta Public Service job site to apply for jobs at  Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.  Resources for applicants:

 It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS)




 Closing Statement


 This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.  We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.  If you require any further information on this job posting or a copy of the role profile, and/or require a disability related accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact Christie-Anne Silverthorn at Christie-Anne.Silverthorn@gov.ab.ca  If this competition is closed as per the closing date noted above, please continue to check
