Title: Client Technology - Product Analyst
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 ***This role is open for Internships and Full-Time Permanent campus hires. Deadline for submission of application is June 20, 2022.

 Fueled by strategic investment in technology and innovation, Client Technology seeks to drive growth opportunities and solve complex business problems for our clients through building a robust platform for business and powerful product engine that are integral to innovation at scale. You will work with technologists and business specialists, blending EY’s deep industry knowledge and innovative ideas with our platforms, capabilities, and technical expertise. As a champion for change and growth, you will be at the forefront of integrating emerging technologies from AI to Data Analytics into every corner of what we do at EY. That means more growth for you, exciting learning opportunities, career choices, and the chance to make a real impact.
 The opportunity
 Rotational program where you will have the opportunity to tackle different roles and develop Analyst skills in the areas of Project Management, Business Analysis, and Product Management. By the end of the program, you will be mapped to the role that best aligns to your skills and interests.
 Your key responsibilities


 Project Management, you will support the project team with the delivery of small to medium projects within planned scope, schedule and budget while developing technical capabilities.
   
 Analyze, review and document the requirements of a project throughout its lifecycle and monitor progress, costs and timescales. We have established processes and tools that you will use to support the execution of project deliverables and raise risks and issues where required
 Develop your skills in communication, leadership and risk management as you manage the project through its lifecycle

 Business Analysis, you will plan, collect, analyze and interpret business situation, challenges, models, processes and operations to develop an understanding of business needs and requirements.
   
 Develop your skills in business analysis knowledge areas encompassing of business analysis planning, elicitation, requirements analysis and design definition, requirements lifecycle management, solution validation and strategy analysis
 Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to assemble, understand, document and analyze business situations and challenges to identify business requirements and value
 Develop and apply your interpersonal skills to engage with different functions within EY and negotiate various aspects of work effort to enable the business future state

 Product Management, you will be aligned to specific products and are responsible for daily activities, including requirement development and socialization, understanding design methodologies, and interpreting data and metrics of product performance.
   
 Support the product management team with daily activities aligned to a specific product, such as analyzing requirements and assisting with product selection, development and socialization
 Build relationships across the wider product delivery team and other roles to assist with the definition of product features and requirements
 Develop market awareness and apply creative thinking to identify market potentials where research and analysis of qualitative and quantitative data are encouraged to provide insights to the product group



 Note: These are global roles and may require travel and/or working across time zones.

 Ideally, you’ll also be able to:


 Demonstrate an understanding of business ideas and articulate different business dynamics in the current market (ex. why driverless cars matter?)
 Demonstrate general knowledge and interest in technology and how it is being used in regular life (ex. converse on AI and how companies like Amazon uses it to improve customer experience)
 Demonstrate ability to engage and collaborate in diverse settings of people, approach and experience

 What we look for
 Results-oriented individuals with diverse skillsets and technological emerging competencies, like analytics, blockchain, artificial intelligence and cybersecurity. We are looking for individuals with initiative, creativity, and a growth mentality. Individuals with the ability to learn new skills and adapt quickly are far more valuable to us in a dynamic technological environment.


 Bachelor's degree in business, computer science or related field preferred
 Zero to one year of relevant work experience
 Ability to meet deadlines while simultaneously working on multiple projects
 Exceptional active listening skills with strong written and verbal communication skills
 Experience with analyzing and solving problems of a complex nature
 Experience working with business, management, and technology concepts

 What we offer
 As part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, global team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer:


 Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
 Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
 Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
 Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


 Please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team.

 The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 EY | Building a better working world
  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Preference will be given to Canadian citizens. 
   
 If you are looking for a dynamic and challenging work environment with a fun, diverse and dedicated team, the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council (SSHRC) and Natural Science and Engineering Research Council’s (NSERC) Information and Innovation Services Division is the place for you! We are growing our team and looking for dedicated professionals.
   
 Visit our career page at www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca or www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca to learn more about SSHRC and NSERC and meet some of our employees. In addition to the excellent benefits provided by the federal government, you will enjoy work-life balance with offices in the heart of Ottawa’s new and upcoming Zibi business district. Important note: As a result of the global pandemic, NSERC and SSHRC employees are currently working remotely until further notice and will likely adapt a hybrid telework environment in the coming year. 
  



Job Summary
Provide business intelligence software solutions to the Research Councils and to the Information and Innovation Solutions Division (IISD) by participating in the requirements gathering, analysis, design, development and implementation of flexible reporting solutions that satisfy the informational requirements of both the internal and external client communities.


Statement of Qualifications


Education
Successful completion of two (2) years of an acceptable post-secondary educational program in computer science, information technology or in a field of study relevant to the position being staffed, or an acceptable combination of education, training or experience.   Degree equivalency   Foreign Credential Validation against Canadian Standards


Experience
Experience in using complex relational databases;  Experience managing deliverables within a multidisciplinary teams;  Experience in the field of Business Intelligence, providing operational/strategic reporting solutions and maintaining semantic layers considered an asset;  Experience in participating in the administration of a Business Intelligence system considered an asset.


Knowledge
Knowledge of current and emerging trends related to Business Intelligence;  Knowledge of Business Intelligence Reporting platforms such as SAP Business Objects, SQL Server Reporting Services and Cognos BI;  Knowledge of database management systems such as SQL Server, Sybase and Oracle;  Strong knowledge of SQL data definition language (DDL) and data manipulation language (DML);  Knowledge of SQL performance tuning;  Knowledge of project management practices and principles;  Knowledge of computer science theories, engineering methods and principles, in order design, develop, test, and, implement internal and/or externally focused Business Intelligence solutions utilizing information technology.


Competencies
Competency to handle pressure and to respond to multiple demands at one time;  Competency to work alone or unsupervised when necessary and manage priorities effectively;  Competency to gather user requirements and translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements;  Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities;  Competency to effectively communicate orally an in writing. Strong interpersonal skills  Team oriented  Client Services oriented


Condition(s) of Employment
Security Clearance: Reliability  Willingness to keep skills current and to learn new technology


We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment processes and work environments. If contacted regarding this competition, please advise us in a timely fashion, of any accommodation assistance you require to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Organizational Needs

 Selection may be limited to members of the following Employment Equity groups: Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, women.

Title: Intermediate Research Systems Analyst
Description:
SAO-Strat Analysis & DWhouse






       Competition No. -
      

S109248133





       Posting Date -
      

Jun 23, 2022





       Closing Date -
      

Jul 11, 2022







       Position Type -
      

Full Time - Operating Funded





       Salary Range -
      

$67,002 to $94,046 per year





       Grade -
      

12





       Hours -
      

35










This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA).
 This position has a term length of 2 years and offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed on our Benefits Overview page.
 Location
 This role is hybrid with a mix of remote and in-person at Enterprise Square.
 Working for the University of Alberta
 The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.
 The University of Alberta is teeming with change makers, community builders, and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, 260,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for over a decade.
 Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross section of people—from our students and stakeholders, to our renowned researchers and innovators who are quite literally curing diseases, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger, and more just.
 Working for the Department/Faculty
 Performance, Analytics and Institutional Research is a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, where the ability to respond quickly, clearly and with accuracy, is paramount.
 Position
 This is a 2 year temporary position reporting to the Director, Operations. The Intermediate Research Systems Analyst will play a key technical leadership role in the build, delivery and support of the Institutional Data Warehouse (IDW), providing data assets to the University’s senior executive officers, other University units and external partners. The successful candidate will have a good level of technical and business expertise, including the ability to understand users’ business requirements and translate these into technical solutions. These skills will be supported by exceptional understanding of Data Concepts, Modeling and technical programming skills as well as the ability to communicate in a non-technical, business style.
 As the successful candidate you will:

Make a difference and have a lasting impact at one of Canada’s top universities
Have leaders who support your work and professional development
Work with a high performing team in a positive and collegial environment
Support challenging data projects and develop skills and business knowledge
Build and understanding of core data assets used in the University

Duties

Perform data analysis necessary to support the build of the IDW
Understand requirements and designs of proposed solutions
Build and deliver components of the IDW solution, confirm interpretation and provide further detail of requirements
Define plans, including use cases for testing IDW modules and coordinate or conduct testing
Define mechanisms to ensure data quality and manage data quality issues
Develop and deliver information products sourced from the IDW, including, but not limited to, standard reports and queries, ad hoc statistical reports, data marts, and business intelligence solutions
Liaise with Senior Staff and Subject Matter specialists within and outside PAIR.
Develop and maintain documentation, including detailed textual methodology, entity relationship models, data dictionary and taxonomies

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Computing Science, or related field; equivalent combinations of education and experience may be considered
Two to five years of experience in data warehouse and reporting.
Knowledge of data warehousing principles.
Knowledge of Data Management Body of Knowledge.
Ability to define, propose and use Measures, Metrics, and KPIs.
Strong knowledge of programming and database management/operations.
Good programming skills in SQL.
Data Visualization skills using Industry standard BI reporting tools is an asset.
Superior ability to work cooperatively with colleagues and with data specialists to identify and solve data quality, data validity and data selection problems to the mutual satisfaction of report clients and system contributors.
Excellent problem solving and investigative skills.
Excellent time management, including accurate preliminary estimates of project time expectations.
Good written and oral communication skills, both for internal and external consultations and reports.
In-depth knowledge and understanding of relevant university data, issues, policies and procedures in a range of areas
Business intelligence and data presentation skills is considered an asset
Equivalencies will be considered



How to Apply

Note: Online applications are accepted until midnight Mountain Standard Time of the closing date.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
The University of Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. We encourage women; First Nations, MÃ©tis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas and the University to apply.

Title: Systems Analyst
Description:
What makes us a different kind of employer?
 



  As a national health solutions partner, Medavie is committed to improving the wellbeing of Canadians — and in our digital-first culture, technology is key to providing the products, services and solutions that increase access to care and improve health outcomes.
 



  Our technology team is the backbone of our organization with over 500 employees and growing. We are constantly creating, testing, and learning to enable personalized, digital experiences in all we do.
 



  When you join us, you’ll be part of an in-house, innovation led team focused on cutting edge digital health solutions that help provide the best care possible, when and where it’s needed.
 






Job Title:


     Systems Analyst
    




Department:


     Application Development
    




Competition:


     84595
    




Internal/External:


     Internal/External
    




Employment Type:


     Full Time, Permanent
    




Location:


     Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, PEI, Newfoundland, Quebec, Ontario - Remote
    




Salary:


     Competitive Compensation and Benefits
    




Reports To:


     Team Leader
    








The Opportunity




  Medavie is looking for a motivated, enthusiastic, and organized individual to fill the position of Systems Analyst to assist with system support and implementation activities for the Disability Claim Management system. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to get training and experience in development, configuration, and support for an industry leading SaaS claims and case management system.
 



  You’ll collaborate with the team to turn business needs and requirements into high-quality software solutions, while following departmental software engineering processes, methodologies, and standards.
 



  Our ideal candidate is collaborative and team-minded, while also being capable of independent self-direction. You're a great communicator, with a knack for innovative solutions and a keen interest in dynamic and emerging technologies. You are detail-oriented and organized, able to understand the big-picture goal while focusing on a complex timeline of tasks.
 



Your everyday with us will consist of:




Analyze requirements and conceptualize, define, and document appropriate solution considering development and Quality Assurance
Analyze data and system integrations to understand underlying functional impacts introduced through business requirements
Estimate with high degree of accuracy the effort required to produce appropriate solution
Lead efforts to carry out appropriate solution with goal of fulfilling all business requirements
Assess business needs and document requirements
Transition and communicate problem solution to designers, developers, and testers
Communicate and collaborate with business counterparts the solution status and plans
Advise, persuade &/or negotiate on problems or situations of a simple to complex nature
Manage multiple priorities and activities
Plan and coordinate simple to complex projects and activities with team members and any stakeholders both internal to Medavie Blue Cross and external clients or software vendors.





Qualifications




Education: University degree or college diploma in Computer Science or similar program
Work Experience: 6+ years in a functional or system analyst role.





Skills




Solid understanding of traditional SDLC and Agile methodologies 
Experience working with cross-functional teams to develop requirements, communicate effectively, and collaborate productively.
Experience implementing and/or supporting SaaS products.
Experience with system integration and data migration solutions.
Have excellent oral and written communication skills.
Demonstrate mature and professional judgment and decision-making ability.
Demonstrated skills facilitating and building consensus among process stakeholders.
High attention to detail, using logic and good judgment in decision making for when different situations and skills may call for different approaches.





  #CBM2
 



 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.




  Medavie Blue Cross strives to foster a culture where everyone is enabled to achieve their full potential - a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) where we live our values every day in the way we treat each other, our members and the communities we serve. Accessibility is a top priority.
 



  For applicants with disabilities, we provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform Medavie Blue Cross Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation. All personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.
 



  We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest. Please note only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
 

 Job Segment: Systems Analyst, Test Engineer, Testing, Data Conversion, Software Engineer, Technology, Engineering, Data

Title: Business Process Analyst
Description:
Level of position: Professional (P2)
 


 Position Purpose:



 The purpose of this position is to support the enterprise-wide management of business processes through mapping, conducting the detailed examination and interpretation of data to gain insight and drive business planning and re-engineering for business units and operating divisions to run lean and efficiently. It will also support the design, development, maintenance, and continual improvement of a Quality Management System Framework as well as continuous improvement, process optimization and quality management initiatives relating to overall delivery of IO’s Capital Program.
 
 What You Will Do:

 Assess client needs through facilitation of problem identification and scope creation
 Support clients through business process mapping, design and performing end-to-end analyses, and running scenarios modelled to optimize process performance
 Support clients in identifying process gaps, analyzing options, implementing improvement solutions, and work with various operating divisions to automate processes where appropriate
 Develop performance metrics and conduct performance monitoring to inform continual optimization. Contribute to the processes and activities to meet functional and organizational KPIs
 Maintain and make accessible all processes in a centralized resource repository and track the evolution of processes in standardized documentation change logs
 Identify gaps and influence the development or enhancement of quality assurance components such as processes, performance and monitoring tools, training materials, and programs
 Coordinate and manage the standardization of quality assurance component templates (e.g. user needs assessment, work guides, roles and responsibility matrices)
 Manage continual improvement of Quality Management Systems, including holding regular performance reviews with client groups and overseeing implementation of action plans
 Provide strategic advice and education to client groups on quality management, process optimization, client needs assessment, and continuous improvement
 Provide instruction on quality methodologies and educate client groups on how to define, measure, and improve the quality of their products and processes
 Implement and maintain quality frameworks and optimization of business processes within IO’s operating divisions in close partnership with the relevant IO business units
 Develop systems and controls to increase the consistency of project and process outcomes, including the organization of lessons learned workshops in conjunction with business units
 Manage maintenance and delivery of quality management frameworks within IO’s business units and the carrying out of root cause analyses following failures or errors identified in quality control exercises or as part of ongoing continuous improvement
 Project manage priority continuous improvement initiatives within IO’s operating divisions in a manner that is fully embedded and in partnership with applicable functional groups

 Who We’re Looking For:

 A few years experience working in a matrix environment with process owners assisting with the detailed examination and interpretation of findings and mapping of workflows; demonstrate knowledge of the concepts of Lean and continuous improvement and have past experience of analyzing root cause and recommending improvements; experience within continuous/process improvement teams, either as core function or as a secondary role
 Demonstrate knowledge of Project Management concepts and methodologies
 Lean Six Sigma Green Belt is required
 Project Management Professional (PMP) or Project Management Certificate (PMC) would be considered an asset
 Certified Quality Process Analyst (CQPA) would be considered an asset.
 Business Process Management Professional (BPMP) or Business Process Management Certificate (BPMC) would be considered an asset


   The salary range for this position is $58,300 - $87,435, with a corresponding job level of P2.
 

   Closing date: 
  Thursday, July 7, 2022.
 

   Please note that interviews will occur on a rolling basis until the role is filled.
 


 At Infrastructure Ontario, we strive to create a culture that encourages a diverse equitable and inclusive environment that fosters belonging. We believe that experience comes in many forms and through learning from each others’ differences and perspectives gives us strength. We are committed to enhancing our culture and encourage applications from all walks of life. Let us know if you require any accommodations for the selection process, by contacting the Talent Acquisition Team.
 


 By submitting your application you are granting Infrastructure Ontario permission to process your personal data during the recruitment process and for keeping records of the process. Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.

Title: Analyste en intelligence d'affaires BI
Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Our client is looking for a 
  Data Quality Analyst for a 
  6-month contract position with possibility of extension. Remote work within Canada is acceptable, although 
  preference would be in Alberta. Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
 

 The 
  Data Quality Analyst will be responsible to design processes, generate, facilitate, and maintain test data through test data generation processes to support the overall testing team with regards to the generation and maintenance of pre-requisite test data required for executing complex test cases. 
 


Responsibilities:




    Responsible for driving the generation of test data for the Testing team through, Database Injection, API scripting, and maintaining the scripts and test data system(s). 
   


    Consulting on the test data generation Proof of Concept which will formalize the overall solution(s) leveraged for test data generation. 
   


    Responsible for supporting the Testing Team on key Initiatives in regard to test data generation and ensuring that test data is aligned to the Test Scenarios prerequisite test data.
    


    Develop, design test data generation strategies, and maintain test data.
    


    Strong work experience in test data management processes (data creation/population, data mining, data conditioning, data maintenance) and tools.
    


    Strong analytical capability to understand system architecture and Data Model Analysis
    


    Application and Data Flow Analytical skills to identify data flow through different systems
    


    Strong understanding of Data mapping analysis to source and target systems
    


    Analyze the test data requirements and recommend the test data management tools and techniques leveraged for application under test
    


    Develop and support test data generation processes to populate test environment(s)/ test databases with effective test data
    


    Scripting and Programming skills: Java or Python, PL/SQL, Unix Shell scripting, File manipulation using Unix or shell commands
    


    Database & SQL: Hands-on experience in handling & creating complex SQL queries to join multiple tables
    


    Drive the review and assessment of functional specifications and requirements to determine test data requirements
    


    Collaborate with Developers, Business Analysts and QA Leads to determine pre-requisite test data and develop test data artifacts
    


    Work with cross functional teams and clients to ensure quality through the product
    


    Report bugs through identification, analysis, and thorough documentation.
    


    Collaboration with QA Leads regarding Test data process, risk, solutions 
   


Qualifications:


Degree from an accredited college or university, with major coursework in systems analysis, information systems, computer science or a related field
Minimum 2 years of experience working with an Oracle Database, including 2 years working with a Logical Data model, Physical Data Model, or data modelling tools (Erwin)
Minimum 2 years' experience injecting/populating test data, with a focus on test data generation techniques, tools with regards to front end and back-end test data population.
Dedicated, driven individual who can identify issues, analyze problems, and propose solutions related to the Test Data Generation/population processes.
Minimum 6 years of software testing and QA experience, testing of both client/server and web-based applications
Experience successfully implementing and supporting enterprise applications
Experience in database data injection through SQL, PL/SQL with regards to test data population.
Experience with test data generation through API scripting.
Experience with test data management, test data support, test data maintenance and test data generation tools.
Experience with performance, stress, and load testing tools, as well as automation tools to inject test data through the front-end application and backend DB.
API Testing Experience using tools like Postman, SOAPUI, Ready API, REST Assured
Strong methodology skills, Waterfall and Agile
Knowledge of SDLC
Strong knowledge of Software Testing Life cycle (STLC)
QA Automation skills on industry standard commercial testing tools is an asset (1 to 2 years preferably in testing frameworks for web-based applications).
Strong analytical and interpersonal skills
Exceptional team player
Any past development experience using latest technologies - Java is an asset
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Experience with Jira, Zephyr, TestRail, Confluence, AccelQ, NeoLoad would be considered a significant asset.
Experience testing health/pharmacy systems that require adhering to privacy and security standards is an asset.
Experience writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test artifacts (test plans, test cases, test scenarios, test reports)
Experience working with debugging tools and development tools (Chrome Devtools)
Experience working on multiple deliverables simultaneously and managing time effectively
Experience identifying and communicating testing risks and product issues with stakeholders.
Experience acting as Process Warden with regards to identifying and resolving/improving test process.
Experience and participation in defect / bug tracking status meetings / triage meetings
Knowledge and experience in testing complex assessment, eligibility, and business rules


 Please note that while all applications are appreciated, 
  only those candidates selected for interview will be contacted.



InSync Systems Inc. is a privately-owned boutique Canadian Resourcing and Consulting Services Company that works closely with a range of corporate clients across multiple industries to bring them solutions that effectively address their business needs

Title: Business Analyst - New Business and Underwriting (Ingenium exp preferred)
Description:
Address: 60 Yonge Street 
 







Job Family Group: 






Technology 
 
Liaises with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities and, recommends solutions to enable the achievement of organizational goals. Builds exceptional relationships with business partners and internal stakeholders. Analyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholders. Ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meet essential quality standards. Participates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products. 

Perform AURA Underwriting rules configuration and data analysis activities. 
Understands and can explain to others the core processes, risks & mitigation techniques for designated areas. 
Anticipates and reduces complexity for others. 
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues. 
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues. 
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives. 
Assists in the preparation of end-user materials. 
Plans and conducts third-party software analysis as needed for inclusion in the project solution. 
Gathers requirements and documents these requirements for use in various audits, reports, & projects. 
Participates in the creation of use cases and user expected results to ensure that software is delivered to end users with zero Severity 1 or Severity 2 defects. 
Works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs. 
Ensures system specifications meet expectations/requirements, and negotiates solutions. 
Creates documentation to ensure the supportability of analyses. 
Maintains existing requirements to ensure that current-state needs are known. 
Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality. 
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets. 
Filters and “cleans” data, and reviews computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems. 
Remains alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and devises new ways of applying them. 
Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. 
Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency. 
Facilitates discussions and follows a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage requirements with stakeholders. 
Provides analytical support and insights. 
Identifies opportunities to strengthen business analysis capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across BMO. 
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning. 
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. 


Qualifications: 

Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
Demonstrates applied knowledge of one or more analysis and problem decomposition technique. 
Understands complete Software Development Life Cycle and can apply the applicable portions of the ‘Feasibility,’ ‘Requirements,” and ‘Analysis’ phases. 
Demonstrates writing and documentation skills. 
Understands and can explain to others the core processes involved in their area of support. 
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. 
Prior Business Analyst experience with INGENIUM and/or AURA - preferred 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
BCIT’s 
      School of Health Sciences is currently seeking 
      two
regular, full-time Operations Analysts to join their team. Reporting to the Operations Manager, this position plays a critical role in providing support to the operations function within the School of Health Sciences. Working proactively and independently within the School, the Operations Analyst reviews school financial and operational data to ensure departments meet their goals, targets and objectives as set out in the operational plans. The Operations Analyst also handles a variety of human resources and project related activities, and contributes to developing processes and procedures that increase operational efficiency.
     




Duties & Responsibilities



DUTIES
 
AND
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
:

Financial:


Provides senior support and leadership for the preparation of the annual budgets, by working to lead, create, maintain, complete and compile in-house budget templates to calculate FTE and budget; reconciling variances, organizing financial information required for quarterly forecasting and analyzing year-end results for planning future budget cycles.
Reviews financial, performance or statistical data and prepares reports including analysis of trends, variances and provides recommendations. Takes initiative to reconcile variances and/or follow up to remediate. Presents findings as required to the School’s Leadership Team (LT)
In conjunction with LT members and programs, takes a lead role in reviewing, analyzing and providing recommendations of financial impact of new programs, proposed program expansions, program changes and planned program reductions.
Independently conducts financial scenario analysis for a variety of potential projects to ensure viability/planning capability. Presents findings to LT and other stakeholders.
Prepares and processes cross-charges, budget transfers, expense accruals and revenue deferrals; reviews for accuracy and follows up.
Prepares and tracks payment of invoices; maintains accounts receivable records; investigates financial transactions for accuracy, completion and follows up and remediates any questionable transactions.
Assembles data and prepares analysis of the monthly revenue and expense, enrolment, staffing complement and marketing summary reports to the LT.
Prepares operational and financial monthly reports including a detailed analysis displaying statistics and trend analysis for the LT.
Monitors funding allocated for curriculum development and revision, research and capital expenditures to budget.
Represents the School for the coordination and disbursement of bursary payments to program specific students as well as oversees subsequent invoicing Health Authorities (HA) with Finance and program team. Demonstrates a professional relationship with external partners concerning bursary payments and student data for hours completed. 



Human Resources:


Initiates and/or processes requests for competitions, e-hires from the Departments; identifies issues requiring further review and decision-making.
Manages test centre auxiliary hires for the School’s PTS programs.
Reviews staffing complement reports for programs with input from the Program Heads and Associate Deans. Identifies positions that have assigned program responsibilities e.g. program heads, program leads, clinical coordinators, and keeps staffing complement updated.
Maintains the position control database showing each position within the school, and updating it as required by gathering information from Banner and LT.
Acts as the primary contact within the School for inquiries related to position control and vacancy status reports. Initiates requests for new temporary Position Control Numbers (PCNs) from Budget Office for Part Time Studies (PTS) and e-hire contracts as needed.
Creates PTS contracts for instructors/curriculum developers as required.
Prepares cross charges for Professional Development (PD) staffing costs to be redirected to the appropriate funding accounts.
Oversees > 30 days sick leave utilization to ensure backfill costs are charged to the Institute sick leave funds or cross charged to Human Resources with supporting back up documentation.
Deals with a variety of confidential information in a respectful and professional manner. 


Information Systems and Processes:


Creates and oversees the maintenance of electronic administrative resource materials such as statistical information, operational guides, databases and directories, including file management of the shared drive.
Performs data analyses and translates raw forms of data and/or databases into usable information using a variety of databases and platforms (e.g., Banner, Access, Cognos Reports) to extract and summarize data as needed for the School Leadership Team.
Creates and maintains an interactive/self-serve database for tracking agreements.
Reviews existing electronic access processes and recommends improvements to the Manager to increase efficiencies and improve internal control; creates standardized processes to streamline activities.
Develops, creates and maintains various monthly and ad hoc reports and supporting analyses for management team. Creates unique data sets to support operations and management decision-making as required.
Ensures the on-line signing authority record in Banner is accurate for all departments. 


Projects and Administrative:


Undertakes special projects, in a self-directed capacity and/or as requested, including researching, compiling and analyzing information from both internal and external sources. Creates and compiles information to monitor funding and expenditures of special projects, identifying issues or areas requiring SOHS Leadership Team review. Identifies LEAN projects designed to facilitate efficiencies for management, faculty and staff across the School.
Represents the School with external partners associated with the preparation and coordination of the approval process of affiliation agreements, seat purchase and rental agreements and MOU’s, including: collaborating with Program Heads, Associate Deans (AD’s), clinical sites, the School’s signing authority and supply management team to arrive at duly authorized agreements. Independently creates and maintains tracking system for expiry dates and initiates follow up on renewals, as well as creates, evaluates and updates templates for efficiency.
Monitors contracts for Instructional Enhancement Grants, maintains detailed records and prepares cross charges for work completed within each fiscal year.
Acts as a departmental resource for BCIT policies and procedures, including Finance and Collective Agreements.
Undertakes the duties and responsibilities of Records Custodian in compliance with FOIPOP and Institute policies and procedures, including: maintaining index and retrieval system of office files through the Directory of Records Database (DRDB), or appropriate alternative; procuring file folder labels through the (DRDB), or appropriate, indicating the classification to which files belong; filing incoming documents into the records management system to support the business process; and, as appropriate, assisting other office staff with proper security levels to identify and retrieve active records.
Provides support to co-workers during their absences or peak periods.
Undertakes related duties as assigned, consistent with the job grade of this position.






Qualifications



QUALIFICATIONS
:

Definition:
 The qualifications section for this position was developed using the approved job evaluation plan, agreed to between the BCGEU and BCIT. The qualifications represent the minimum qualifications required in the future (i.e. to be reflected in job postings) and may not reflect the incumbent’s existing qualifications.
       
Education:


Completion of a two-year post-secondary certificate or diploma in Business Administration, or a related discipline plus completion of specialized education in Accounting or Finance.



Experience:
 Two years general experience plus four years of relevant business experience in a position of similar responsibility
       
Software/Computer Application(s) and Expertise:


Advanced level knowledge of Excel. Intermediate level knowledge of Word and Power Point and Access. Experience using Banner, TM1 and Cognos reporting tools an asset.
Expertise in the development of appropriate databases, statistical and analytical tools. Demonstrated ability to perform data analysis and translate raw data into meaningful narrative analysis. Demonstrates ability to prepare power point presentations of financial data as needed. 


Communication/Interpersonal Skills:


Strong verbal and written communication, interpersonal, organizational, planning and follow up skills.
Ability to present findings, lead group discussions and provide training to a variety of staff on various processes and tools.
Proven ability in requesting information from, providing updates to, and coordinating with senior clients and stakeholders both internally and externally.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a team member.
Ability to maintain strict confidentiality and to deal with situations using respect and discretion.



Administrative Skills:


Proven ability to establish priorities, work to deadlines and make responsible decisions while maintaining high levels of customer service and coordinating completion of multiple projects concurrently.
Self-directed and self-motivated with the ability to exercise sound judgement when dealing with a variety of complex issues.



Other Skills/Abilities:


Comprehensive knowledge and technical expertise in financial analysis, knowledge of business applications and demonstrated business acumen with the ability to communicate with all levels of employees.
Ability to effectively and accurately respond to the needs of stakeholders and demonstrated ability to understand the impact of decisions and actions on the School/organization.
Ability to independently identify and analyze issues; demonstrated strong problem resolution skills.
Effective organizational skills; ability to prioritize work in response to multiple and competing deadlines.
Strong problem solving, critical thinking and conceptual skills. Strong understanding of accounting principles.






Additional Information



Benefits – Why you’d love working with us



Competitive pay
Minimum of fifteen days of vacation
Competitive employer-paid extended health and dental plan – take a look at our benefit plans!
Defined contribution pension plan with employer contributions
Flexible hybrid work arrangements available
Professional Development funds and resources
Access to most BCIT PTS courses free of charge
Wellness and Employee Assistance programs
Complimentary membership with free access to the Fitness Centre, Gymnasium, and more 






Salary Range


      Pay Grade 9; $57,937 to $62,941 per annum
     




Additional Salary Information


      External hires are initially placed at the minimum of the salary range with progression to the maximum. Salary prorated based on percentage and term of appointment.
     







   Position Details 
  





Posting Category


      Administration
     




School/Service Area


      SOHS Dean Health Sciences Office and Technologies
     




Campus Location


      Burnaby campus
     




Bargaining Unit


      BCGEU Support Staff

      Regular
     




Full-Time/Part-Time


      Full-Time

Anticipated End Date

Title: Supply Planning Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
As a member of our Supply Chain team, you will make a daily impact on the lives of others. Apply today and you will get a chance to work with high-functioning, driven people who all have the same mission of making healthcare better. Plus, we have an award-winning culture and were recently named one of the World's Best Workplace by Fortune!

 Who we want






Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes – finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.
Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data, and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.
Strategic thinkers. People who enjoy analyzing data or trends for the purposes of planning, forecasting, advising, budgeting, reporting, or sales opportunities.

 What you will do
 This role will have a direct impact on improving patient lives within our endoscopy division and successfully planning for our SPY Portable Handheld Imaging System product.

 Responsible for creating the supply plans for our San Jose, CA machine shop, as well as the detailed supply plans for our Burnaby, Canada plant.
 Analyzing data used to create supply plans
 Inputting and adjust supply plans in to necessary MRP tools
 Communicating supply plans to cross functional teams such as marketing, customer care, plant managers, procurement managers, and commercial operations counterparts
 Working with purchasing analysts, engineers, and other operation's team members to understand risks in supply chain and how this can impact build plans
 Root cause analysis to help the larger operations team solve complex problems
 Using Microsoft suite tools such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
 Leveraging visualization tools such as PowerBi

 What you need 

Bachelor’s degree required
 0+ years of experience required 
Relevant work experience in Supply Chain is preferred





 Know someone at Stryker?
 Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program at https://careers.stryker.com/referrals/
 About Stryker
 Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes.
 We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com

Title: FL Business Analyst
Description:
The Business Analyst will have at least 5+ years’ solid experience working on large enterprise IT projects in a multi-disciplinary team environment. The role involves working with a range of highly knowledgeable stakeholders (internal and external teams) to elicit requirements, analyze processes, and produce documentation, for improved business systems and operational effectiveness. 
The Business Analyst will be expected to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and deliver high quality written products, in a timely manner. 
The successful candidate will be an accomplished self-starter with exceptional interpersonal communication skills (verbal, presentation, written), and who possess a very strong capability to facilitate collaborative business decisions amongst business and IT stakeholders. Must be extremely adept with quickly organizing information from multiple sources, and rapidly producing succinct and accurate business documentation using predetermined methods and templates. 
Excellence with English language (written and spoken) is essential. 
Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to the following: 
• Requirements gathering for a system to system interface, and input into other specification for development/customization 
• Developing business process maps for the as is and to be process based on stakeholder input, review of procedures, and other documents 
• Updating, creating, and/or coordinating deliverables related to business analysis activities 
• Some exposure to Project Management Principles 
• ServiceNow ticket and work orders creation 
• Work with Business to gather requirements and prioritization 
• Work items estimates, scope, timelines, actions, solution, prioritization reporting 
• Progression report to Application Lead/Business Lead 
• Process Documents written/updates 
• Able to work fairly independently reporting to the client 
Mandatory Skills/Experience: 

A minimum of 5+ years’ direct, accumulated experience in the role of Business Analyst. 
Manage stakeholders at all levels; facilitate collaboration and agreement of needs and objectives. 
Demonstrate business acumen, including ability to analyze and communicate strategic requirements, and develop action plans for senior stakeholders. 
Develop or participate in development of business cases for senior stakeholder review and sign-off. 
Decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user suggestions from the underlying true needs. 
Elicit functional and non-functional requirements with support of technical specialists. 
Elicit current state processes, create diagrammed models, workflows and task step descriptions. 
Decompose process workflows into use cases with functional definitions, logical data models and system requirements. 
Plan, estimate and manage project roll-out and implementation activities 
Experience with MS Visio, Excel and Powerpoint. 
Use of Business Analysis methods, principles, practices and techniques in an IT project team environment. 

Desirable: 

Experience or exposure to Project Management Principles, either directly or indirectly. 

Important note : As this posting is for the recruitment of a position at a specific Fujitsu client who requires COVID-19 full vaccination as a condition to assignment, please note COVID-19 full vaccination (along with acceptable proof of vaccination) is a condition of employment of this position at Fujitsu. Any requests for exceptions will be coordinated with the client in accordance with its policies.



Fujitsu at a Glance 
Fujitsu is a leading information and communication technology (ICT) company, headquartered in Japan, offering a full range of technology products, solutions, and services. Approximately 132,000 Fujitsu people support customers in more than 100 countries. We use our experience and the power of ICT to shape the future of society with our customers. 
We are a corporate culture that places great value on the pursuit of new possibilities previously unimagined and brings them to fruition. This has been the foundation of Fujitsu’s success since its inception. In an increasingly competitive world, in which the pace of change continues to accelerate, Fujitsu must strive for continuous innovation. Each and every employee will rise to the challenge of creating new value amid changes in the management environment, technology, society and the marketplace. With a spirit of challenge, we are committed to the continuous creation of new value. Fujitsu wants innovators like you! 

At Fujitsu, one of our corporate principles is "We respect human rights." This principle underpins all our corporate and individual activities and guides the actions of every Fujitsu Group member. We embrace diversity and equal opportunity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, political belief, social condition, family, marital or civil status, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or conviction of an offence that is unrelated to employment. By empowering people, we can unleash our collective strengths to create a better experience for our employees, our customers, and our partners .

Title: Asset Management Analyst
Description:
Division





Administration






Important Notices & Amendments





The Asset Management Analyst will be required to work both in person at the work site and remotely.






About Us





Serving a diverse urban and rural population of more than 475,000, Niagara Region is focused on building a strong and prosperous Niagara. Working collaboratively with 12 local area municipalities and numerous community partners, the Region delivers a range of high quality programs and services to support and advance the well-being of individuals, families and communities within its boundaries. Nestled between the great lakes of Erie and Ontario, the Niagara peninsula features some of Canada’s most fertile agricultural land, the majesty of Niagara Falls and communities that are rich in both history and recreational and cultural opportunities. Niagara boasts dynamic modern cities, Canada’s most developed wine industry, a temperate climate, extraordinary theatre, and some of Ontario’s most breathtaking countryside. An international destination with easy access to its binational U.S. neighbour New York State, Niagara attracts over 14 million visitors annually, as well as a steady stream of new residents and businesses.
 Please note that the Niagara Region requires that all newly hired employees are to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of being hired and provide proof of full vaccination, or provide proof of a bona fide medical or Human Rights Code exemption on a form issued from and approved by Niagara Region.






Job Description



Job Summary 
Salary Pending Review

 Reporting to the Manager, Asset Management Office, the Asset Management Specialist is responsible for the organizational asset data and asset information needs, assisting to find efficiencies and improvements in existing asset management processes and systems, and planning and implementing new systems and processes that help business units align with the Corporate Asset Management strategies.
 Education

Post-secondary degree in Engineering, Commerce, Business Administration, Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Formal training in asset management, business analysis, ITIL, project management or other similar discipline is preferred.

 Knowledge

Minimum of 5 years systems or infrastructure management planning, support, feasibility studies, and design experience in a medium to large organization of a complex diverse nature.
Demonstrated understanding of the full life cycle for asset information from multiple perspectives, including information systems and data, assets, asset systems and hierarchies, people and knowledge, business processes, and communication.
Knowledge of business process modeling, structured analysis, design, programming techniques, lean practices and/or continuous quality improvement methods.
Experience with data analytics, trend and forecast analysis.
Demonstrated knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices
Demonstrated knowledge in Asset Management and Functional System analysis is preferred.
Direct experience related to the selection, configuration and implementation of solutions for infrastructure asset inventory, work management, budgeting, and related business processes is preferred 
Project management experience and in depth experience developing software and business process testing scripts and procedures is preferred.
Knowledge and understanding of financial principals, policies, procedures/processes, and reporting requirements is preferred.
Designation or Certification in Asset Management, Accounting, Lean, Business Analysis and Project Management is preferred

 Responsibilities
 Provides asset management expertise and support for Engineering, Infrastructure Management and Information Management (25% of time).

Use, support, analyze, assess and develop current asset management processes, including gathering information and input from stakeholders.
Conducts detailed analysis and forecasting on infrastructure deterioration, risk, and levels of service.
Compiles, collates, analyzes, interprets and reports on asset management data for lifecycle planning and decision-making
Applies appropriate statistical and/or graphical methods to data sets.
Develops tools and spreadsheet models for the simulation and analysis of complex asset condition, performance and investment scenarios
Develops and maintains corporate asset registers and asset data including acquisition, maintenance management and valuations 
Understands and analyses information sources and maps the information and systems architecture in the Corporation and the systems and data types captured in each.
Identifies methods, tools and solutions for sharing data and results and visualizing information easily and simply within the organization. 
Assists with development and/or improvement of data systems, controls, and processes to improve relevance, accuracy, access, timeliness, and presentation of appropriate data for asset management decision support. 
Conducts audits of data and systems and provides reports on compliance to industry or the Region’s standards.

 Provides project management and project support, executing project management methodologies, in the delivery of projects and systems enhancements, to be delivered on time, within budget, and in adherence to project management standards aligned to the corporate strategic objectives (25% of time). 

Assists with defining project scope, goals, business cases, project charters, success criteria and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with management and stakeholders.


Coordinates project activities, providing back-up support to Manager in planning, coordinating, communicating, and executing projects.
Ensures that all project and task timetables are kept up-to-date and provides status reports. 
Produces written deliverables (requirements, fit-gap, work plans, functional specifications, testing plans and scripts, and user guides) as required.

 Leads and facilitates business analysis activities under the direction of the Manager, Asset Management Office supporting the development of the Asset Management System, plans and strategies through analysis of levels of service, service demand, asset life cycle and asset maintenance strategies, financial forecasting, risk management, and capital improvement planning, working with business area experts, managers, and senior managers from across the Corporation (15% of time).

Contributes to the development, implementation and review of corporate asset management best practices; collaborating with business units across the organization.
Conducts feasibility studies, develops systems designs, prepares use cases, assists system implementations, develops or recommends changes to business unit work methods and supports such initiatives.
Identifies and documents problems and consults with key stakeholders to develop options to select and implement the most appropriate solutions
Researches and recommends future systems to enhance compliance with Asset Management strategies and objectives, 
Develops and co-ordinates training for clients on new corporate asset management systems/procedures.
Prepares end-user documentation as required to support asset management applications and increase understanding/acceptance of new processes.
Develops and implements standardized business processes, policies and procedures , workflows, reporting structures including supporting system configurations

 Prepares reports, memos, drafts, letters, and other correspondence and conducts presentations to meet the Asset Management Office’s requirements (15% of time).

Contributes to the development of strategic and implementation plans, ensuring that major initiatives are in line with the Asset Management Office and the Region’s strategic direction. .
Generate charts, maps and visual aids for analysis and reporting, analyses data, and develop quality control procedures to ensure accuracy, consistency and completeness of data; format data records and/or facilitate the transfer of files into asset database (s).
Develop and prepare a variety of written documents, including technical reports, staff reports, work plans, business cases, and terms of reference.

 Manages relationships with internal/external stakeholders, client business units and project participants.

Provides feedback to and manages stakeholder/client expectations (10% of time).
Develops strong working relationships with key staff members in departments across the corporation. 
Collaborates across the organization and with external partners to develop and participate in data and practices sharing initiatives and share information broadly within the asset management community.

 Identifies opportunities to improve/enhance processes and business solutions with respect to Asset Management (10% of time). 

Reviews technical literature regarding system methodologies, development productivity tools and techniques.
Interprets new or revised legislation and legal or policy decisions in order to make appropriate recommendations concerning the application of process changes or technology solutions to meet the Region’s obligations arising from regulatory commitments.

 Special Requirements

In accordance with the Corporate Criminal Record Check Policy, the position requires the incumbent to undergo a Criminal Records Check and submit a Canadian Police Clearance Certificate.
Regional staff strive to enable the strategic priorities of council and the organization through the completion of their work. Staff carry out their work by demonstrating the corporate values of service, honesty, choice, partnership and respect.







Closing Statement





Uncover the wonder of the Niagara Region and join a team dedicated to meeting tomorrow’s challenges TODAY!  Let us know why you would be an excellent team member by submitting your online application.  We thank all candidates for their interest however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 If you require an accommodation for the application process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, the alternate formats for contacting us are as follows:

Email: myhr@niagararegion.ca
Phone: 905-980-6000 ext. 3252 or 1-800-263-7215
Bell Relay: 1-800-855-0511
In-person: Sir Isaac Brock Way, Thorold, ON L2V 4T7 – Human Resources Department

Title: Environmental Data Analyst - Flow Monitoring
Description:
Incorporated in 2008, AMG Environmental Inc. provides storm water and sewer flow monitoring services for clients such as municipalities, water districts and housing development companies. AMG offers specialized technical field services, flow monitoring data collection and data management services in order to provide its clients with essential data used to identify and resolve sewer capacity and flow issues. AMG Environmental also partners with engineering firms to develop customized sewer solutions based on the data collected and analyzed by the AMG team.
Description
The Data Analyst, under the direction of the Manager of Environmental Data Services, is responsible for the quality of environmental monitoring data. Primarily, the Data Analyst will use internal web-based analysis tools such as hydrographs, time series data plots, scatter graphs and field reports to analyze trends and interpret results of environmental flow monitoring projects. They will also be required to perform necessary data repairs and schedule field crew maintenance on equipment. Prior experience with flow monitoring, inflow/infiltration studies, open-channel flow hydraulics or wastewater systems would be beneficial. The Data Analyst must possess a degree or diploma in a related field and three years of related experience.
Job Duties

Assist in collection and tracking of data from a variety of different sensors (depth, velocity, temperature, pH, H2S, turbidity, DO, rain gauges etc.)
Daily review and processing of data using web-based statistical software – analyzing trends and interpreting the results
Perform daily data evaluation, maintenance and data repairs (i.e. after sensor calibrations)
Prioritize and efficiently schedule field crews for routine site maintenance
Create and submit work orders with a high degree of accuracy and professionalism
Interact with field personnel, production personnel, engineers, and clients on scheduling and data quality related issues
Act as a technical consultant and provide customer service through various means including telecommunications, internet research and database systems
Prepare reports, research papers and educational texts
Generate flow balancing spreadsheets and other related documents as needed for assessing data quality
Actively participate in company quality management systems and QA/QC procedures; including internal audits, root cause analysis and corrective actions
Contribute to the development of new projects and ideas
Maintain a safe working environment

Job Requirements

Degree or diploma in environmental studies or a related field
Three years of related work experience is considered an asset
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word and Microsoft Outlook
Ability to understand and accurately interpret data quality
Proven ability to analyze complex information and conduct relevant research to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts
Knowledge of GIS (Geographic Information System) and other statistical software is considered an asset, but not required
Experience with SQL databases is considered an asset, but not required

Competencies

Detail oriented
Strong organization & time management skills
Project coordination
Excellent problem-solving skills
Effective communication & listening
Ability to work individually as well as part of a team
Commitment to Health and Safety
Continuous Improvement

Work Conditions

Nearly always work indoors
Safe ergonomic operation of desktop computer and peripherals
Attendance and participation in training
Use of required personal protective equipment

Equal Opportunity Employer
AMG Environmental Inc. is committed to providing a barrier-free work environment in concert with the Accessibility for Ontarian's with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. As such, AMG Environmental Inc. will make accommodations available to applicants with disabilities upon request during the recruitment process.
AMG Environmental Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, AMG Environmental Inc. will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.
AMG Environmental Inc. seeks to fully integrate the principles of Employment Equity and will ensure the full participation and advancement of members of historically disadvantaged groups (i.e., members of visible minorities, persons with disabilities, women, and aboriginal peoples). AMG Environmental Inc. will achieve this by ensuring that its hiring process is fair and equitable for all persons.
AMG Environmental Inc. strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, AMG Environmental Inc. will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout the course of employment.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $45,000.00-$48,500.00 per year
Benefits:

Company events
Dental care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Vision care
Work from home

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
