Title: Analyst
Credit Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a talented Credit Analyst to join our growing credit risk team to help meet the demands for our industry leading programmatic advertising platform. The Credit Analyst will work closely with the other departments to build out a Credit Risk function and to improve the integrity and strength of our credit processes and balances.
   




   Our team consists of talented professionals who are passionate and are able to adapt in the fast-growing programmatic advertising industry. At Stackadapt, we instill a growth mindset and embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered. If you exude positive energy, are immensely driven, and can’t wait to join a growing team, apply below!
  


 StackAdapt is a Remote First company, we are open to candidates located anywhere in Canada for this position.




What you'll be doing: 


Facilitating the customer onboarding process related to credit limits
 Manage customer credit limits and budget requirements
 Monitoring credit risk of the entire portfolio
 Maintenance and reporting for our Credit Insurance Program
 Reviewing accounts to ensure accurate provisions or insurance is in place
 Assisting the Collections team with managing the collections of key customer accounts
 Assisting with the issuance of client collection reports
 Assisting with the processing of insurance claims, legal claims and lien filings
 Assisting with internal and external audit process
 Assisting with documentation of all credit processes
 Knowledge and ability to support the Accounts Receivable team relating to Accounts Receivable reports, cash receipts, and banking and data entry
 Knowledge and ability to prepare Accounts Receivable reports and audit reports as required






What you'll bring to the table:


 University or college degree in Finance or Accounting
 3-5 years of high volume corporate experience in Commercial Credit Underwriting
 Credit accreditation or working towards one is an asset
 Experience working in programmatic advertising or a startup/tech culture is an asset
 Strong organizational skills, ability to work in a fast-paced environment with little supervision, and attention to detail
 Basic accounting knowledge: Ability to analyze financial statements, calculate financial ratios and determinate probability of default
 Excellent interpersonal & communications skills (written and verbal)
 Exceptional customer service skills, takes initiative and is eager to learn
 Proven ability to successfully build strong working relationships with team members; team player
 Microsoft Office skills – Excel, Word, PowerPoint & Outlook - ability to effectively analyze data using Excel
 Experience using D&B Credit Scoring, Moody's RiskCalc and other credit scoring platforms is a significant asset






StackAdapters enjoy: 


Competitive salary
 Full benefits from League on day one of employment
 RRSP Matching
 Work from home reimbursements
 Global WeWork membership
 Coverage and support of personal development initiatives (conferences, courses, etc)
 An awesome parental leave policy
 A weekly $15 lunch credit via Ritual
 A friendly, welcoming, and supportive culture
 Our social and team events (virtually!)






StackAdapt is a diverse and inclusive team of collaborative, hardworking individuals trying to make a dent in the universe. No matter who you are, where you are from, who you love, follow in faith, disability (or superpower) status, ethnicity, or the gender you identify with (if you’re comfortable, let us know your pronouns), you are welcome at StackAdapt. If you have any requests or requirements to support you throughout any part of the interview process, please let our Talent team know.



 About StackAdapt



 StackAdapt is a self-serve programmatic advertising platform used by the most exceptional digital marketers. This state-of-the-art platform is where some of the most progressive work in machine learning meets cutting-edge user experience. Ad buyers plan, execute, and manage data-driven digital advertising campaigns across all devices, inventory, and publisher partners. StackAdapt is a Top 100 Software Product on G2, being the only DSP on the Best Software Products and Highest Satisfaction lists.
  


 We've been recognized for our high performing campaign conversion rates, award-winning customer service, and innovation by numerous industry publications including:
  


 #1 DSP on G2 and leader in the Video and Cross-Channel Advertising Categories
  

    Top 5 on Ad Age's 2022 Best Places to Work
  

    Great Place to Work® named StackAdapt as one of Canada’s Best Workplaces for Start-ups in 2021
  

    A Top Growing Company in Canada based on the Globe and Mail's 2020 Business Report
  

    Named a Technology Fast 50™ Program Winner for 2021
  


 #LI-Remote

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description:
Overview: 
 
   Are you a passionate innovator looking to harness the power of technology to do more good? You’ve come to the right place. At Bonterra, our purpose is to power those who power social impact. To that end, we serve the people who make social good possible—the doers behind the scenes across nonprofits, public agencies, corporations, philanthropic organizations, and foundations.
 


 As the second-largest and fastest-growing social good software company in the world, Bonterra brings together leading solutions from CyberGrants, EveryAction, Network for Good, Social Solutions, and their respective entities. By bringing our intuitive technology and expertise together, Bonterra will enable unprecedented connectivity between social good organizations and their community of supporters and constituents. This will reshape philanthropic giving, empower digital transformation, and bring the social good sector the technology it needs to accelerate lasting social change.
 


 While this position can be fully remote, prefer candidates who currently reside in Ontario.


 Responsibilities & Requirements: 
 
 What You’ll Do



 As 
  Senior Business Data Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Tailored Services, you will work with Bonterra’s clients and product team to develop common reporting data sets for Bonterra’s market sectors as well as custom client reports. You will tailor solutions to meet these needs by querying a Penelope (PostgreSQL) database, creating custom views and functions to facilitate updating and designing reports and creating data visualizations and/or data exports in multiple formats. This is a very technical role involved with data migration, integration, developing custom scripts and views across multiple products – Penelope, Apricot as well as other Bonterra products.
 


 You solve client’s complex business problems by scoping, designing, developing, testing and demoing custom reports using SQL, Excel (including VBA), Tableau or other reporting/analytical tools. 
You gather and document requirements and provide informed quotes for estimated effort.
 You write SQL queries and create visual representations of data in third party tools such as Excel, Tableau, and XML.
 You write custom API functions to support integrations to Penelope.
 You communicate with Bonterra’s clients regarding process and change requests, understanding the business issues and data challenges of their organization and industry.
 You liaise with project and business leaders to interpret analytical requirements.


 Who You Are



 You have hands-on experience with SQL (and other database languages), you know your way around databases – whether documentations exists or not. You are comfortable with tight timelines and quickly changing priorities. You are a self-starter and able to manage your time effectively, you ask questions, and have a curious mindset. You are a problem solver by design; client-oriented as well as analytical. You possess at least five years related experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Programming.
 


 You have strong knowledge of SQL and relational database management systems, with experience in querying databases with complex relationships between tables.
 You have experience creating dashboard reports in Tableau or other Business Intelligence tools. 
You have hands-on experience with writing Python scripts.
 With outstanding written and verbal communication skills, you are able to succeed in a dynamic, driven environment, trail-blazing creative solutions to complex challenges.
 You are a self-starter who is able to learn new applications swiftly, independently, and with confidence. 
You have expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including VBA.
 You have a track record following through on commitments.
 You can monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion of projects
 You have experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations to external stakeholders.
 You have an Undergraduate University Degree or equivalent experience in Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science or Programming


 This position is permanent and full-time.


 About Us: 
 
 Our Culture:



 Our team is made up of industry experts and advocates who are 100% committed to supporting the doers of social good. We are currently undergoing an effort to create the vision and values that embody our collective organization and embrace the individuals who make up our community.
 


 Some of our comprehensive and competitive benefits include:
 

 Generous PTO policy


 Equity for ALL regular, full-time employees from individual contributors to management – share in our success!
 Up to 15 paid company holidays including some commemorating social justice events and self-care
 Paid volunteer time
 Resources for savings and investments
 Paid parental leave


 Health, vision, dental, and life insurance with additional access to health and wellness programs.
 Opportunities to learn, develop, network, and connect
 When we can—company-sponsored events and swag!!

Title: Senior Marketing Science Analyst
Description:
Senior Marketing Science Analyst
 What we are looking for:
 Valtech is seeking a data-minded Senior Analyst with experience in measurement, data, analytics, dashboards, and optimization. We are looking for individuals with a passion for helping solve clients’ challenges through data and attain an ROI from their digital investments & data sets.
 This is an exciting opportunity to grow your skills and work with a fantastic roster of clients within an expanding Marketing Science practice at Valtech. We place a strong emphasis on KPIs, measurement, and tagging across the customer journey, with an experiment-driven approach.
 You’ll be hands-on with a variety of platforms including Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch, Adobe Analytics, Sitecore, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Optimizely, and others (feel free to bring your favorite tools into the mix).
 Your day will have immense variety; you’ll be running client workshops, designing tagging strategies, mining data for opportunities, and reporting on campaign performance. There will be plenty of opportunities to apply your strategic and analytical skills to link tactics and experiments to revenue and conversion lift, in a variety of client and vertical contexts. If you’re interested in data science or machine learning, we’re working on applying those techniques to marketing data as well!
 Most importantly, you love to tell data-driven stories of measurable improvements to digital performance.
 Before we continue to dive into the requirements for the role let’s talk about Why you should join Valtech?
 Flexibility: We trust in the expertise, skills, and actions of our colleagues. That’s why we provide a flexible work schedule that supports work/life balance.
 Career Advancement: We offer a career, not just a job. We invest in the personal and professional growth of every employee because we believe growth leads to both business impact and personal fulfillment.
 Learning and Development: We foster a culture that encourages and promotes professional growth and development, with continuous learning through our in house LMS (Ask us about the Academy)
 Toronto Benefits: 

We offer competitive compensation, Group Benefit Plan, and a Health & Wellness program ($1000 toward mental health!) 
Flexible PTO
Monthly events with an active culture club
We close over the winter holidays and keep summer hours to help you make the most of those sunny Friday afternoons

 Want to learn more about our unique culture and awesome people click here
 What you will do:
 You will be working closely with colleagues across North America and the role breaks down into two large buckets:

 Billable client work including but not limited to:
    

Delivery of workshops to define KPIs, digital objectives, project requirements, education on digital best practices


Delivery and implementation of optimization roadmaps and experiments


Delivery and implementation of data strategy, data layer design, and tagging plans


Delivery and implementation of dashboards & ongoing reports


Delivery and implementation of marketing automation plans


Research into the latest practices, tools, and approaches to make informed recommendations


Providing general guidance and expertise to our clients as a trusted advisor


Non-billable opportunities include but are not limited to:
    

Producing thought leadership


Sales & business development support


Direct reports at the analyst level to mentor and guide


Ability to evolve & own divisions within the growing Marketing Science practice

 

Travel within Canada and US is expected to deliver client workshops (pre-COVID 19).
 What you should have:

 Experience presenting to stakeholders and delivering workshops and training engagements
Understanding of the digital marketing space, including popular tools and common channel strategies spanning web, email, social and mobile
Experience in configuring and using Google Tag Manager & Google Analytics, and/or Adobe Launch & Adobe Analyst to understand visitor behavior and identify opportunities for optimization
Understanding of audience segmentation and content targeting to segments
Experience developing and prioritizing KPIs to measure a program, initiative, or project
Understanding of marketing strategy and optimization tactics including personalization, SEO, A|B testing, automation
Experience embedding analytics and optimization within larger digital delivery projects
Experience with DXPs such as Sitecore, Optimizely, Salesforce Commerce Cloud
Experience with analytics tools such as Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Adwords,
Familiarity with SEO / optimization tools such as Semrush, CrazyEgg, HotJar, SiteSpect, VWO
Experience with dashboard tools such as Google Data Studio, PowerBI, Tableau

 Here’s a little about us:
 Valtech is a global digital agency that focuses on business transformation for our clients. Founded in 1993, Valtech has established itself as one of the largest independent global agency groups with more than 3.000 exceptional individuals operating out of 40+ offices in 15 countries. We work with some of the world’s best-known brands from travel to retail, connected experiences to automotive and we’re now ready to bring on even more talented colleagues to join us.
 We believe diversity is essential to creating the best digital products & experiences. Valtech is committed to providing and maintaining a work environment where all employees and candidates are treated with dignity and respect and that is free of bias, prejudice, and harassment. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status. 
So, if you are looking for your next challenge? Then this is your chance to join our team of exceptionally talented, creative and innovative professionals working with composable Best-of-Breed technology platforms within the large-scale digital experience and e-commerce business area.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
IO’s Finance, Technology, and Lending Enterprise Team ensures that IO is a financially efficient and effectively managed organization and that the agency’s finances are monitored, reported, and managed appropriately. The team also manages the infrastructure lending program, which has supported more than $18 billion in local infrastructure development, and IO’s Information Technology and Business Services, providing tools and systems to ensure secure, effective, and efficient operations.
 


 The role acts as a liaison between business teams and the Information Technology team for a wide range of technology projects. The role will collaborate with business stakeholders at all levels to facilitate, gather and document business requirements. This includes ensuring successful delivery of solutions, collaborating with developers on implementation of requirements, ensuring thorough IT and business testing, and developing required documentation and resolving issues as they arise.
 
 What You Will Do: 

Solution identification, assessment, and recommendation: 
Work cross-functionally with stakeholders to identify and critically evaluate optimal technology design solutions.
 Develop use cases defining interactions between roles and systems as well as the steps to achieve stakeholder goals.
 Support the engagement with vendors for product capability assessments, demonstrations, and design specification evaluations.
 Develop and present business cases summarizing projects needs or problems, potential solutions and recommended options, benefits, cost analysis including the return on investment.
 Support in the planning and execution of procurement activities.



 Understand business problems and translate into requirements: 
Act as liaison between business stakeholders (partners and end-users) and the information technology team to identify business process and system improvement opportunities. 
Collaborate with the Business to gather and document detailed requirements for new, or enhancements to, existing technology.
 Facilitate problem-solving meetings to discover business needs, understand business problems, and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders to establish improvement priorities.
 Identify, create, and facilitate business process changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design. Focus on meeting short and long-term business strategies, quality improvement, data and records management, and integration of systems and business processes (existing and new). 
Analyze and communicate stakeholder needs by translating business requirements into system requirements and technical specifications.



 Understand business problems and translate into requirements: 
Act as liaison between business stakeholders (partners and end-users) and the information technology team to identify business process and system improvement opportunities. 
Collaborate with the Business to gather and document detailed requirements for new, or enhancements to, existing technology.
 Facilitate problem-solving meetings to discover business needs, understand business problems, and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders to establish improvement priorities.
 Identify, create, and facilitate business process changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design. Focus on meeting short and long-term business strategies, quality improvement, data and records management, and integration of systems and business processes (existing and new). 
Analyze and communicate stakeholder needs by translating business requirements into system requirements and technical specifications.



 Support technology implementations: 
Assist business teams and the Information Technology team in the execution of technology solutions.
 Collaborate closely with developers to implement system requirements.
 Ensure the effective use of the end application and evaluate integration with other new modules or applications. 
As technology constraints are discovered, facilitate problem-solving meetings to identify alternate solutions to meet business requirements.
 Support the project management team to develop and deliver user documentation and change management activities.



 Manage stakeholder relationships, support the use of business analysis best practices and help mentor others on Business Analysis practices:
 Forge effective and trusted working relationship with key stakeholders to stay current with business partner needs and strategies and communicate updates and findings through presentations and reports.
 Support the management of business analysis best practices and knowledge base through contributing to the introduction and maintenance of standardized tools, methodologies, templates, and training. Recommend continuous improvements and lead changes. Mentor others on business analysis to help grow the practice.

 What We’re Looking For:

 Several years experience in a Business Analyst role handling multiple projects concurrently.
 Certified Business Analysis Professional certification is preferred.
 Experience partnering with the Business and Technology teams. 
Experience with business case development, requirements/ use-case creation, testing plan and test case development.
 Proven experience with Agile and Waterfall delivery methodologies.



 This posting will close on Thursday, July 7 @ 11:59 pm


 Please note that interviews will occur on a rolling basis until the role is filled.


 


 The salary range for this position is $77,145 – $115,725 with a corresponding job level of P4



 At Infrastructure Ontario, we strive to create a culture that encourages a diverse equitable and inclusive environment that fosters belonging. We believe that experience comes in many forms and through learning from each others’ differences and perspectives gives us strength. We are committed to enhancing our culture and encourage applications from all walks of life. Let us know if you require any accommodations for the selection process, by contacting the Talent Acquisition Team.
 


 By submitting your application you are granting Infrastructure Ontario permission to process your personal data during the recruitment process and for keeping records of the process. Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
RouteThis is a region of Waterloo success story whose time has come to level up and we’re on a mission to help companies intelligently automate their support teams for amazing customers such as Facebook/Meta, Amazon, Wyze, Start.ca, Telus, Traeger, NordicTrack, and more.
If you’ve had to call tech support, and been frustrated by long queues, unhelpful agents or unresolved issues, you know the pain RouteThis addresses. Our products are changing the tech support world with mobile and self diagnostics solutions at the center and we are looking for amazing talent to join us and build products to revolutionize this $15 billion dollar industry.
Reporting into the Director, Customer Experience our ideal candidate would focus on the use of data produced by RouteThis and Customers to determine if pilots or ongoing engagements show positive ROI, or future ROI for the Customer. They rely both on a strong understanding of data and analysis techniques as well as the ability to understand the story that the data tells.In this role you will: 

Analyze RouteThis data and merge with customer data to produce complex ROI analyses
Work as part of project teams for Pilots and/or with Customer Success teams to demonstrate ROI from RouteThis usage
Collaborate with customer data analysts to influence data collection and analysis process and align best practices
Own data schema and align customer data stakeholders to generate data to the schema defined
Take a leading role in determining if there are errors or risks associated with data being produced by customers
Dictate required data format for pilots and other engagements
Work closely with the Sales and Success teams to package up data insights into good news/ROI stories and help deliver and discuss with customers
Enjoys leading the charge in data-related activities, not just sitting in the background
Can lead calls directly with Customers when data is being discussed
Can interpret data to tell a story and figure out the real-world impact of the interpretation
Has previously acted as data analyst/lead for SaaS pilots
Can ask questions to understand the source of data and if that underlying source is trustworthy

You bring to the table: 

3+ years experience completing data analysis for the purposes of ROI and/or Pilots
Strong and advanced excel skills
Experience in Kibana or a similar data visualization platform
Experience working with large data sets (larger than you can open on a desktop PC)

Do you feel like you’re able to tackle this role? Show us what you got! We absolutely don’t expect applicants to check off every box for any of our positions, and welcome you to apply if you feel like you are an excellent fit.
Who we are: RouteThis is a fast-growing tech company that is changing the way ISPs and Smart Home companies handle technical support around the world. Instead of dealing with frustrating, long support calls where agents are unable to accurately identify issues, the RouteThis platform gives technical support teams the answers they need to immediately identify and resolve customers’ issues - or help customer to solve it themselves before even needing to call.
We are headquartered in the Waterloo Region and our customers are all over the globe. If you want to work on the next generation of network diagnostics that provides a disruptive new approach for tech support teams, you should be working at RouteThis!
*Why RouteThis?*Growth: As a rapidly growing startup, we’re constantly facing new challenges and prefer to promote from within. By working with us, you can jumpstart and shape your career.Team: At RouteThis you’ll be working on a highly-motivated team full of the best talent you can find. We’re carefully selective on who we hire as we’re a close team.Fun: Monthly team social events, and weekly team lunches and happy hours are all part of our culture. We never forget that work should also be fun.Perks & Benefits: We offer competitive salaries and a generous benefits package.Location: Located in the Waterloo-region in downtown Kitchener, we offer flexible work arrangements including hybrid and virtual options.
Please note: We thank all applicants for your interest in RouteThis. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Agency calls will not be accepted. RouteThis is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability and we will work with you to address your needs.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Analyst
Description:
Please refer to the 
  
   How to Apply for a Job (for External Candidates)
   job aid for instructions on how to apply.
 


   If you are an active McGill employee (ie: currently in an active contract or position at McGill University), do not apply through this Career Site. Login to your McGill Workday account and apply to this posting using the Find Jobs report (type Find Jobs in the search bar).
 


   POSITION CONTEXT
 

   Contribute to the development and support of the IT Systems to ensure that they meet the current and future needs of the stakeholders and users community.
 


   Primary Responsibilities:
 

 Support IT team in resolving system incidents/problems and act as a liaison between Business Subject Matter Experts, technical teams and/or third-party vendors as required
 Lead the implementation of simple enhancements to existing systems that meet business requirements and are aligned with IT orientations:
   
 gather business requirements
 evaluate feasibility, provide estimates, design solutions and prepare detailed specifications
 coordinate team effort in developing and implementing the enhancements

 Work with other IT Professionals and Business Subject Matter Experts in implementing new systems that meet business requirements and are aligned with IT orientations
   
 Provide estimates for tasks and artifacts under own responsibility
 Transform business requirements and conceptual system designs into detailed functional specifications in accordance with design standards

 Develop the following artifacts (not limited to) for hand off to the development team and/or third-party vendors: functional specifications, interface designs and configuration specifications
 Develop test scenarios and conduct detailed functional and integration testing to ensure programming/configuration has been done in accordance with detailed functional specifications and business requirements
 Perform or assist in the configuration and control of system parameters and files to meet business requirements
 Support Business Subject Matter Experts and users during user acceptance testing
 Assist in the development of application documentation, user documentation and training materials



   EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

   OTHER QUALIFYING SKILLS AND/OR ABILITIES
 

 Desired: Four (4) year degree (Undergraduate) in Management Information Systems or Computer Science or equivalent experience
 Functional knowledge of IT business domains
 Experience in the implementation, development and support of ERP, client-server and web-application systems.
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills – ability to perform root/cause analysis
 Demonstrated knowledge of functional analysis and data analysis - ability to understand and clarify business needs formulated by requesters and stakeholders
 Experience in working with third-party software and third-party suppliers.
 Knowledge of the following would be an asset: business process techniques (BPMN), Master Solution Delivery methodologies (Macroscope Productivity Center), SOA concepts, Research Data Management Software.
 Demonstrated effective communication, writing and planning skills. Self-motivated and ability to work well with multiple teams in cross functional set-up.
 Demonstrated ability to work on multiple initiatives and to manage deadlines.
 English spoken and written. French spoken and read.
 Familiarity with Oracle, SQL, Java considered a plus
 Experience with Ellucian’s Banner applications considered a plus

Title: Intern - Procurement Operations Analyst
Description:
Req ID:330443
Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide
 Located in St. Bruno, Quebec, you will be responsible for supporting the Procurement - Transformation and Efficiency team on mandates related to the transformation and efficiency improvement of procurement processes.


YOUR INTERNSHIP


In your role, you will be asked to perform the following tasks:



Review and Support in Supply Chain Continuous Improvement Initiatives
Develop Standard Work documentation
Follow-up on procurement & supply chain process key performance indicators
Maintain database of ongoing opportunities




Responsibilities:

Analyze current procurement processes and tools
Identify areas that need improvement
Develop plans to increase procurement effceincy and decrease costs
Implement plans and inform staff on new procedures
Extract, manipulate and analyze data to be used in decision making
Assist transformation and efficiency team on broader scope when needed.


 
As our ideal candidate, you:



Are pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Industrial Engineering or Operations Management
Have a Continuous Improvement mindset
Are Proficient in Microsoft Office
Have strong communication & interpersonal skills
A first roject Management experience would be an asset
You are fluent in English & French, spoken & written




Requirements:

Coursework in business strategy, project management, or business development field is preferred.
Knowledge of key purchasing and negotiating methods, principles and concepts and general business operations.
General knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements related to procurement.
Basic understanding of continuous improvement techniques and methods.
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, and percentages.
Ability to research and analyze data and develop recommendations or resolve problems by drawing on internal information and referring to prior decisions.
Ability to respond to common inquiries or concerns.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions and effectivly communicate outcomes.


 
If you’re looking for a company with a strong purpose and the ambition to play a role in climate change by leading the way to greener and smarter mobility, if you are ambitious and would like to embark on a challenging, global journey, and if you have a certain sense of entrepreneurship:
Join us and help us create a better tomorrow !


Alstom is the leading company in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?


Equal opportunity statement: Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.



Job Type:Internship/Apprenticeship 
 Job Segment: Operations Manager, Procurement, Supply Chain, Business Development, Project Manager, Operations, Technology, Sales

Title: Human Resources Business Analyst
Description:
HUMAN RESOURCES BUSINESS ANALYST


J.D. Irving Sawmills and Woodlands Divisions are currently seeking candidates for a Human Resources Business Analyst role located at Head Office in Saint John, N.B.


This is a fantastic career opportunity for the right person to grow their career and develop Human Resources skills, as well as gain exposure working with Senior Leaders. If you have a positive attitude, proven communication skills and the energy to execute, this is the opportunity for you!


The Role
The HR Business Analyst works within our HR Operations Team and will lead, and coordinate activities related to our HR Information System (Oracle HCM). Turning data into actionable and visual information will be an important component of the role.  The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who likes problem solving, is driven to identify continuous improvement opportunities and enjoys a challenge.


Responsibilities:

Power user for SharePoint, HCM and Taleo (including reporting, transactions, and MyLearn).
Data integrity management, training, and communication for the HR Information System (HCM) users.
Support the implementation of HR Processes including but not limited to the annual performance reviews, employee engagement surveys and wage reviews.
Periodic reporting for management on employee lifecycle changes and activities. 
Own and maintain the divisional learning management system
Act as key contact for the HR Operations team, receiving inquiries and requests and troubleshooting to find a solution.
Participate in and/or lead specific projects or initiatives in support of the people strategy as required


 
As our ideal candidate, you will have:

Post-Secondary education in Business or related field with a minimum of two years’ work experience
Proficiency with MS Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Strong reporting and data analytics skills. 
Prior experience with data analytics, reporting, HRIS (preferably Oracle HCM) and ATS (Taleo)
Demonstrated capability to work on multiple priorities with a strong sense of urgency to execute and deliver results.
High level of attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and successfully manage change.
HR certification would be considered an asset


 
What We Offer:

Hybrid work arrangements to provide you the opportunity to work some days in the week from the comfort of our office and other days from your home office
A dynamic, safe, and rewarding work environment
A competitive wage with a full benefits package including health, drug, and dental, life and disability insurance, Group RSP with matching contributions
Employee recognition programs and provide reimbursement for gym memberships, weight management, and smoking cessation programs

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Position Overview
 The primary role of the Business Systems Analyst is to provide support and reporting to internal stakeholders regarding SOPs and ERP: Microsoft Dynamics 365. Responsibilities include documenting and mapping processes as well as supporting end users and day-to-day operating system functions. This is a permanent, full-time position, and requires someone with strong computer skills and attention to detail.
 Key Responsibilities:

Work closely with the Business Process & Systems Manager on the ERP system daily activities and reporting including:


Documentation and clear mapping of business processes.
Documentation of all training materials for end users.
Analyze functional issues with Dynamics 365 CE/BC presented through support enquiries, working to resolution in a timely fashion
Consistently using active listening skills with a focus on capturing user needs, urgency, and issue details
Providing excellent technical support via phone, email, and video call
Creating user-facing knowledge base articles from resolved support cases
Prepare functional design documentation for customizations
Conduct solution, user and administrator testing as required
Assist with analysis, design and development of Data warehouse structure and content.
Complete daily system administrative and reporting tasks


Ad-hoc related duties as required, related to both ERP and finance.

 Qualifications

Minimum of two years’ experience Education and Experience with MS Dynamics, preferable experience with D365 (BC & C
A degree or diploma in a post-secondary technical or business program is considered an asset
Intermediate proficiency with MS Office applications, data analysis tools, and ERP systems.
Experience building business and/or technical explanatory documentation or manuals.
Experience with DW development, data analysis and report writing (Jet Reports/Power BI)
Experience with business and technical requirements analysis, modeling, and documentation.
Restoration industry experience, considered an asset

 Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Applied knowledge of process planning, business analysis, and reporting.
Strong attention to detail, as well as accuracy and professionalism in written communication.
Ability to take direction and constructive feedback and work within a time-sensitive environment.
Ability to work with internal end-users and customers in a collaborative way, supporting team & business goals.
Strong work ethic and the ability to work independently
Strong ability to convey technical information to non-technical users

 Working Conditions

This position is a hybrid role and primarily reports out of the Coquitlam office
Flexible start/end times during business hours Monday – Friday
Company laptop/computer will be provided.

Why join Canstar Restorations as a Business Systems Analyst?

Canstar is a Canadian restoration company, owned and operated since 1985. We love taking part in community events and are pleased to help our furry friends by sponsoring the BCSPCA. We pride ourselves as being the best in the restoration industry by providing excellent service, prioritizing safety, and delivering a high level of quality work to our customers.

We take good care of our team too! We like to have fun and celebrate our success with things like popcorn Fridays and an annual visit to Playland for staff and their families!
 Perks of working for Canstar…

Competitive compensation and vacation package
Extended health and dental benefits for you and your family
Flexible hours and work from home opportunities
Great company culture and career advancement opportunities
Monthly ‘Bring-Your-Pooch-to-Work’ days!
Industry-related Tuition Reimbursement (50% - 100% of tuition costs!)



 Agencies: Please do not contact us about this position.
 We celebrate equality and diversity in the workplace. Our commitment is to ensure equity in employment, and we affirm and welcome applicants from all backgrounds of race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, and age, except as prescribed by law.

Title: Reporting and Business Insight Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
 TD Business Management, Strategy and Governance covers all TD business management, governance and control functions. Business and technology groups naturally team up to support a technology function leader or a segment CIO, with overall effectiveness as their guiding force. Experts focus on four main areas: 1. Business Performance, Financial and Technology Strategy, Planning & Coordination 2. Operational Effectiveness 3. Portfolio Program & Project Governance and Oversight, and 4. Business Governance and Controls.
 There's room to grow in all of it.



Job Description

The Reporting and Business Insight Analyst is responsible for the FP client transition process and providing monthly reporting to Leadership.  As an Analyst, you will lead the data gathering and production of the Monthly Senior Leadership reporting package and adhoc reporting as well as adhere to strict quality verification and audit procedures throughout the process. This role involves working with our FP Business, Wealth Shared Services, FP National Sales and other key support areas with the ultimate goal to support People Managers with timely reporting for an overall positive employee experience.

 Retrieve and combine various data sources to prepare the Monthly Senior Leadership reporting package
 Review, analyze and understand the data and data sources to ensure that all business requirements are met and that the reporting is comprehensive, efficient and accurate 
Proactively put forward ideas that speak to project objectives (e.g. development, testing solutions, and tools).
 Act as point of escalation for resolving partner issues by analyzing options and determining solutions that are best suited for the partner and escalate when necessary
 Foster good relationships with finance, reporting and technology partners to positively contribute to the overall partner experience
 Prioritize, assign and monitor the daily workflow ensuring processing is completed meeting Service Level goals
 Identify, lead and actively participate in process improvements and determine solutions that will allow business to grow
 Protect the interests of the organization – identify and manage risks, and escalate non-standard, high risk transactions / activities where further clarity and interpretation is required for higher complex polices or rules




Job Requirements

Skills / Experience

 Demonstrated ability to multi-task and independently self-manage; ensure all key accountabilities are planned for, executed and delivered within deadlines 
Demonstrate a proactive approach in day to day accountabilities and interactions (e.g. issue resolution, providing recommendations)
 Exceptional communication skills with the ability to communicate for an executive level audience 
Strong collaborative skills and experience partnering with business units
 Business acumen: strategic thinking, business process development, analytical and problem solving skills 
Excellent oral, written, interpersonal and relationship building skills
 Intermediate skills in Microsoft Office is essential (PowerPoint, Word, Excel), including strong excel spreadsheet and modeling capabilities 
Proficiency with SAS, SQL, VBA Expert in Excel & MS Access an asset
 Other language skills are an asset

 EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION: 

Undergraduate degree
 3+ years relevant experience




Additional Information

#LI-POST



Inclusiveness

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. Title: Revenue Operations Analyst
Description:
Daasity is looking for a Revenue Operations Analyst near the Toronto, ON, Canada area to help us build a foundation for excellence by reinforcing revenue strategy with metrics, infrastructure, business processes, and best practices. You will help the sales team to maximize their sales and attainment through analytics, reporting, data streams and KPIs. You will be the partner of sales managers and directors in forecasting, territory planning & management as well as their business review cadence.
Who Should Apply?You will be a trusted partner of the sales management team and will make supporting recommendations on ways to improve the productivity and scale of the sales organization, therefore it is important that you are a curious, independent, rigorous, and proactive kind of a person. It is vital that you are an excellent team player, have a strong attention to details, and have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
What will your day-to-day look like?

Find, document, and implement highly creative solutions to problems using a wide range of technologies and applications
Understand and utilize best practices during development and release processes
Champion the use of technology, tools, and processes to maintain the source(s) of truth of our sales, marketing, and customer success data
Proactively search for areas to improve, streamline and scale using data, process and systems analyses that measurably impact company revenue
Collaborate with end users and stakeholders to understand the details of a business problem, it’s impact on the business and the desired outcome the team wishes to achieve
Perform detailed investigations to reveal potential insights into root causes, areas of most impact, priorities of focus and recommended paths forward
Work across a mix of proactive projects and reactive support for business stakeholders in Marketing, Sales, and Customer Experience
Lead development of projects, measuring the real impact of solutions and adapting as necessary to overcome unexpected roadblocks or other obstacles
Manage cross-functional stakeholders and lead by influence on company-wide initiatives to move the needle on revenue growth
Leverage a service desk ticketing queue to prioritize tasks and track deliverables

Requirements: 

Live near the Toronto, ON, Canada area
2-4 years Hubspot or SFDC experience required
1-3 years of experience in Sales Operations, Revenue Operations or Business Operations in high-growth SaaS or technology companies
Administration experience with best-in-class CRM and related tools in the Marketing, Sales & Customer Experience tech stack for SaaS companies (e.g., Marketo, Salesloft, Gong, Zoom, InsightSquared), with a desire to learn how to become an expert
Understanding of key SaaS Sales, Marketing, and CX concepts and how they work in practice (e.g., solution selling)
The ability to conceptualize business processes, clearly illustrate pain points, and recommend changes to the systems that support those processes
Basic understanding of the SaaS technology landscape
Strong quantitative capabilities with a passion for numbers and analytics
Experience working with BI/Analytics tools
High proficiency in Excel
SQL knowledge
Ability to tell the story and present the results in a clear and interesting way
Great communicator and can build relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders
Experience working in an Agile environment

Who We Are: At Daasity, we believe every company – no matter the size – should have access to the data and tools they need to be successful. But far too often, that’s not the case. Founded in 2017, Daasity is the first and only data analytics platform built exclusively for Direct-to-Consumer brands by industry leaders in the Direct-to-Consumer space.
Daasity provides DTC brands with a business insights solution tailored to their specific needs. Start seeing value today with a platform that’s built to last for tomorrow. When it comes to making big decisions and big data, we get it. When it comes to your business, we get that, too.
Daasity embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.
What We Offer: 

Remote first organization
Competitive compensation
Competitive medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your dependents
Ancillary Benefits include Short & Long-term Disability Insurance, FSA/HSA options, Mental Health Services via TalkSpace, Health Advocate
401(k) with over 20 investment options
New MacBook and $450 Home Office Credit
Stock Options
Unlimited PTO
Paid parental leave
Growth potential company-wide
Collaborative, transparent, and fun-loving work environment

Application Process: These steps may vary by role and are dependent on the needs of the company.

Application Screening


Initial/Behavioral Interview with the Recruiting Team


Interview with the hiring manager


Follow up interview, if applicable


Reference Check


Offer Package


Background Check

Title: Business Insights Analyst (18-month contract)
Description:
Who We Are, What We Do, Where We Are Going
     

       Magnet Forensics is a global leader in the development of digital investigative software that acquires, analyzes and shares evidence from computers, smartphones, tablets and other IoT related devices. We are continually innovating so that our customers can deploy advanced and effective tools to protect their communities, countries and companies.
     



       Headquartered out of Waterloo, ON but with over 400 employees spread out globally, Magnet is continuing to expand and grow. Where we are today, is not where we want to be tomorrow.
     


 Your Role
     

       The Business Insights Analyst role will provide support to continually improve the productivity of sales, service and marketing teams to achieve the corporate revenue and contribution objectives. This individual will use their strong set of analytical skills to develop and deliver data-based insights to help teams make wide-ranging business decisions. The ability to identify inefficiencies will drive continuous improvements and innovation in our processes and operations through data-based insights.
     


 What You Will Accomplish
     

Perform research, collect and analyze large, complex data sets to identify trends, key indicators, patterns, insights, issues or shortcomings that will address strategic and operational business questions
Lead data quality and transformational initiatives as required to continuously improve Magnet’s operations
Present data-driven stories about key findings and how they are impacting Magnet’s operations
Translate data from multiple sources to facilitate data-driven decision-making to drive business improvements
Implement and manage reports and dashboards required to track key business KPIs for sales service, and marketing stakeholders
Lead initiatives to enable self-service data analysis and reporting throughout Magnet
Manage the business intelligence platform and supporting data models
Provide ad hoc reports to broader company departments as needed
Investigate and propose industry best practices and technology to support business intelligence initiatives



 What We Are Looking For
     

       We’re looking for someone who checks off most, but not all, of the boxes listed in “skills and experiences”. It’s more important to us to find candidates who can display 
      indicators of success through skills they have developed and experiences they have been a part of, than to find folks who have ‘been there, done that”. We want to be part of your development journey, and we’ll learn as much from you as you learn from us.
      




      There are a couple must haves, but we will keep that list short: 
     

3+ years of work experience in a Business Insights Analyst or related role
Proficiency with Microsoft Power BI or other business analytics tools
Proficiency in Salesforce.com and other sales, service and marketing platforms
Experience with sales, service and marketing processes
Strong technical acumen



 The Most Important Thing
     

       We’re looking for candidates that can provide examples of how they have demonstrated Magnet Inte
      GRITy throughout their previous experiences:
     



       The Most Important Thing
     

       We’re looking for candidates that can provide examples of how they have demonstrated Magnet Inte
      GRITy in their previous experiences:
     


 Greater Good – We think beyond our own interests and strive to improve communities around the world. This demonstrates our passion for making a difference in the world.
     

 Respect – We hold ourselves accountable through transparent sharing of information and we have faith in each other’s abilities
     

 Innovation – We lead the industry in excellence and reliability while keeping the user experience simple and relevant. We are not afraid to push the boundaries to stay ahead of our competitors.
     

 Teamwork – We collaborate internally and externally, while caring about each other and listening to our customers.
     



 Magnet Forensics Inc. is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer. It is Magnet Forensics policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best-qualified person for the job. Magnet Forensics does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law.




 Magnet Forensics encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Magnet Forensics has a great record of accommodating persons with disabilities. Contact our AODA contact at 
aoda@magnetforensics.com
 or 519-342-0195, if you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Location*:
 OTF Canada Head Office
  10357 109 St NW, Edmonton, AB T5J 1N3
 

Please note this is an office focused position. Employees may work from home on a varying basis. 

About us
 Join the fast-growing phenomenon where you get to work alongside industry-leading talent in a high-performance culture who are passionate, experienced, and determined. Ranked as one of Inc. magazine's Fastest-Growing Private Companies - we are ambitious and innovative: we are motivators. At Orangetheory, you are part of a dynamic brand that is changing lives around the world.
 

By joining our Orange team, you will enjoy:

Industry-leading compensation plans and benefits
Career development opportunities
Complimentary OTF sweat sessions
A fitness-casual dress-code

About the role
 The Business Analyst will facilitate studio performance excellence at Orangetheory through effective monitoring and communication of performance metrics, business practices, systems & processes. In addition, the Business Analyst will be responsible for working closely with the field & development team in providing analytics, audits & resources to drive franchisee studio performance excellence. This individual must incorporate a high caliber approach to the production of analytics, intuitive analysis and project management. 
 Essential duties and responsibilities

Develop standard data extracts/reports/analyses for senior leadership
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex datasets.
Liaise with business and technology partners to build insightful analytical solutions and dashboards
Help implement data analysis best practices
Assemble, monitor and report on sales & operations KPIs
Ensure studio compliance & operational requirements are monitored and flagged in a sensitive time frame
Oversee Canada’s net promoter score & ensure effective best practices for customer service/follow-ups occur in franchise studios with assistance of field team
Assemble and transmit all sales & operations communications to franchisees
Create programs and participate in special projects as required

Education and experience Minimum Education:
 
 Year 3 or 4 of Bachelor’s degree in one of the following post secondary programs:
   
Business Analytics/Intelligence
Management Information Systems
Operations Management
Computer Science
Mathematics/Statistics
Engineering
Physics
Or similar programs

Required Skills:
 
Basic to intermediate Microsoft Excel user
Practical experience assembling dashboards and presenting information using Power BI or Tableau (Power BI Preferred)
Power Query/M experience
Basic understanding of DAX or experience creating variables in some language for data analysis (R, Python, or MATLAB)
Problem Solving, program debugging
Nice to Haves
 
Advanced Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with at least one scripting language such as R or Python (R Preferred)
Experience writing Excel VBA/Macros
Experience writing advanced DAX measures
Basic SQL Knowledge

Core competenciesThe successful applicant must demonstrate knowledge of a wide range of qualitative and/or quantitative methods for the implementation and ongoing support/management of major OTF administrative programs, demonstrated analytical ability, and strong leadership & project management skills in working with others.
 
Strong technical skills working with internal data management platforms
Strong Visual Presentation Skills
Strong analytical mind and capable of recognizing & communicating the meaning of data
Good interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written)
Good understanding of financial and performance metrics (KPIs)

Personal attributes

Highly organized and detail oriented
Independent thinker

Position typeThis is a full-time position. 
 TravelTravel may be required. You must have a valid drivers license and passport.
 

Orangetheory Fitness is committed to being an equal employer and a leader in supporting and valuing the diversity of the people, organizations, and communities we serve. Orangetheory Fitness is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment and business decisions at Orangetheory Fitness are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Business Systems Analyst III
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD
 We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
 TD Business Systems Analysis covers a mandate that includes (but isn't limited to) proposing technical systems to accomplish business requirements enterprise-wide. These experts build relationships with business partners and other groups of diverse subject matter experts and stakeholders (both internal and external) to: 

Plan + Elicit + Analyze + Document + Communicate +Manage system requirements;
 Assess client needs and recommend the right technology; and
 Offer operational and process-related analysis and support.

 There's room to grow in all of it.



Job Description

About This Role
 We are looking for someone to provide support and produce detailed system requirements and technical and functional specifications that align with standards and frameworks. You will work in close partnership with our ambitious business and technology partners, project teams and stakeholders to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.
 Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:

 Work with technology partners (e.g. Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
 Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, taking into account non-functional requirements.
 Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
 Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
 Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
 Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
 Provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
 Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
 Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
 Work with vendors to support business case development (consistent with technology requirements and guidelines) including benefits identification, RFI/RFP and service level agreements
 Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle.




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have: 

Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
 3-5 years relevant experience.
 Commitment to applying advanced knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards, including design, development, testing and project management.
 Sound to advanced knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
 Ability to perform work on all aspects of the system analyst process from end-to-end (on projects of moderate to high complexity), under minimal supervision.
 Experience and comfort level acting as a reference for Business Systems Analyst roles. 




Additional Information

Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:

 Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
 Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, 




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Senior Analyst, Website Marketing
Description:
Cvent’s Global Demand Center is seeking an experienced, analytical-minded, and data-oriented digital marketer to support ongoing data collection, analysis, and reporting efforts across the marketing organization. The Senior Analyst, Website Marketing will be responsible for analyzing data and website user behavior to uncover opportunities for optimizing Cvent’s web properties and digital channels.
 The primary objective of this role is to oversee our digital reporting and analytics strategy, compiling data from Adobe Analytics (Omniture SiteCatalyst) and a variety of other marketing tools including: call-tracking, digital publishers, web personalization, and many others. This person will develop and maintain dashboards on website performance, share insights, and provide recommendations to support strategic decision-making for our global team of web designers, product marketers, and executives across sales and marketing.
 What You Will Be Doing

Design and produce dashboards and ad hoc reports to present trends and measure progress against established KPIs, goals, and lead-gen activities
Analyze website data to determine areas of site improvement. Identify traffic trends, abandonment issues, and opportunities for improving site conversion rates
Segment website traffic by source, channel, visitor frequency, location, etc. to understand and optimize user experience and engagement
Provide analytical support for A/B and Multi-variate tests and landing page optimization efforts
Collaborate with members of the digital, product marketing, and web teams to provide actionable insights on the performance of digital channels
Create visualizations (tableau/powerpoint/excel) to present analytical findings
Operate as a key go-to insights person for the marketing team
Partner with Cvent’s Corporate Analytics team to learn and leverage new tools and custom metrics

What You Need For This Position

BS/BA Degree Required
3 - 6+ years of experience in digital analytics or digital marketing in-house or at an agency
Must be proficient in using Adobe Analytics (SiteCatalyst) or equivalent web analytics platforms to create dashboards and analyze data
Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel or similar tools
Ability to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve web tracking errors
Excellent organizational skills, accuracy, and attention to detail required
Strong communication skills (verbal & written); ability to provide concise, clear reporting and actionable analysis
Ability to manage multiple priorities and competing deadlines
Knowledge of the implementation, measurement, and optimization of digital marketing channels preferred
Experience with Optimizely or similar A/B testing tools preferred
Experience with website heatmap tools preferred
Experience with Tableau, Google Data Studio or similar data visualization tools a plus
Knowledge of tag management solutions a plus
Experience with CRM, marketing automation, SEO, digital attribution, and campaign management a plus

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title
Business Intelligence Analyst – Based in Lower Mainland, British Columbia with occasional travel involved (passport required)
Reports To
Information Systems Manager
Job Overview
We are seeking an experienced business analyst to provide expert-level insight and analysis on our products and services. The successful candidate knows the value of leveraging data to increase sales and profitability. They have a strong background in database technology, with an emphasis on the use of analytical and reporting tools. They are proficient in data manipulation strategies, techniques, and tools (ex: Tableau) for effective visualization and informed decision-making. They have a good understanding of data and its governance.
Key Responsibilities

Designing and developing enterprise-wide data analysis and reporting solutions
Develop processes and procedures to ensure business solutions meet strategic goals
Participate in the development of performance and economic indicators based on the company’s strategy
Promote the understanding of company data and propose innovative solutions
Provide data visualization techniques such as dashboards and reports
Manage internal and external company resources
Develop data cleansing rules for the company, reviewing and validating data
Develop proof of concept and prototype to validate need
Maintain and adapt implemented solutions over time
Manage the integrity and validity of information contained in the data warehouse and source systems
Write and document business requirements, functional requirements, and design specifications
Continuously improve existing business processes and strive to develop new ones to improve efficiency

Qualifications
Education

Bachelor’s degree with specialization in Business Information Systems, Computer Science or Data Science, or Master’s degree in Business Intelligence
5 years of experience

Competencies

Strong business intelligence best practices in:

- Data Warehouse- Data Loading (ETL)- Data Visualization * Proficiency in SQL Server technologies (TSQL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS), Tableau or equivalents

Understand different software systems such as CRM, ERP, MRP
Knowledge of an AGILE project management methodSkills


Methodical and detailed
Strong people skills, customer service oriented
Strong problem-solving and management skills
Proactive, forward-thinking
Bilingual a strong asset (French, English)
Technical writing ability
Excellent written and oral communication

The offer

Competitive salary - we take great pride in offering our workforce the best benefits and compensation packages in our industry, and we think you will too.
Healthcare and Dental for single, couple or family coverage
Insurance benefits and employee assistance program
Group RRSP – save for retirement – you are eligible after 1 year of continuous employment and Convoy matches your contribution based on years of service
Time Off – Everyone needs time away from work to recharge and be with family and friends - receive a generous amount of paid holidays
Employee Referral Bonus Program
Paid training/tuition reimbursement – Ready to further your education?
Open door policy in a supportive and encouraging work environment
Overtime available in peak periods
Internal Promotions - Find out more at https://www.convoy-supply.com/careers/overview

Additional information

Convoy can be a job… or a career. Find out more at https://www.convoy-supply.com/careers/overview

Convoy Supply is a leading North American distributor of premium building products with 44 locations across North America, from the Canadian Rockies and Pacific Northwest forests, across the Prairies to the Great Lakes and places in between.
Our company was founded in 1972 and Team Convoy prides itself on being the most responsive, problem solving and fun place for our customers to conduct business.
It’s What We Do!
