Title: Research Analyst I
Description:
Job Posting #901355
 Position: Research Analyst I, Epidemiology Site: Krembil Research Institute Department: Arthritis Research Unit Reports to: Principal Investigator Salary Range: $45,277 to $56,547 per annum commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN Compensation Policy Hours: 35 hours per week  Status: Temporary Full-time (1 year with possibility of extension)
 University Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Research Analyst I, Epidemilogy, in our Arthritis Research Unit.
 Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning.
 The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,600 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.
 University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's seven research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.
 Our research unit is looking for a Research Analyst I,Epidemiology. Our research program includes a spectrum of applied epidemiologic research within arthritis, using population-based and clinical-based datasets. We also provide the Arthritis Society with up-to-date evidence-based information on arthritis epidemiology and population needs. More information can be found at: https://www.uhnresearch.ca/researcher/anthony-perruccio.

   Major responsibilities will include participating in various aspects of the research program with an emphasis on analysis of data sets. Specific duties will include: 
  

Conducting literature reviews 
Data analysis including the application of multivariable statistical techniques using appropriate software 
Interpretation of results and preparation of reports, papers, and presentations 
Assistance in project design, setting of research goals and assistance with grant applications
General research support as required



 Qualifications 


At minimum, a Bachelor’s Degree in epidemiology, public health, or equivalent discipline; Master’s Degree preferred
At minimum, 1 year related experience
Experience in quantitative analysis using statistical packages (such as SAS, or R)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good organizational and time management skills
Ability to learn quickly and work independently
Excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to work under pressure and attention to detail
Ability to perform duties in a professional and courteous manner and produce high quality work while meeting deadlines in accordance to UHN standards
Ability to perform multiple concurrent tasks


 Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
 Posted Date: June 23, 2022 Closing Date: July 7, 2022
 For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.
 UHN thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, BIPOC, persons with disabilities and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Title: Business Analyst and Process Improvement Specialist
Description:
Established in 1997 ILAC is one of the leading English Language providers in international education located in Toronto and Vancouver. Our mission is to provide the highest quality service, support and opportunities to our customers and employees. We provide English language training as well as professional certificates and diplomas to thousands of international students every year. ILAC operates under, ILAC-Adult and Young Learner English Language programs, University Pathways and ILACIC-Private Career College accredited by the MAESD and PTIB.
 Who are we looking for?
 You are a highly motivated, analytical, and process-oriented professional who enjoys working in a highly diverse, multicultural, and fast-paced working environment.
 This position would be working closely with the Director of IT to drive technology projects and business process improvement initiates across ILAC to make us more efficient and provide better service to both students and the rest of the ILAC team.
 Job Duties and Responsibilities

Collaborate with various stakeholders to analyze current business processes and help design future business processes.
Be the champion of the project: help stakeholders see the vision and possibilities of the future. Cater message keeping the audience in mind.
Facilitate discovery and solution development sessions and engage stakeholders to identify gaps and opportunities. Distinguish user requests from true underlying needs.
Set up meetings, ensure project stakeholders are updated regularly.
Meet and exceed timelines
Timely escalation to relevant issues

Requirements:

University degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Management Information Systems, or equivalent education.
3+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst or Project Lead within IT settings.
Experience in Education industry would be an asset.
Project management experience a plus.
Formal certificates or training in Business Analysis and/or Project Management jurisdictions would be ideal.
Experience in Lean process improvement, Value Stream Mapping, Six Sigma would be desired.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, Visio, or similar tools.
Familiarity with Software Development Life cycle (SDLC).
Strong research, analytical, data collection and problem-solving skills.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.

Apply Now! We are accepting applications Immediately!
 HOW TO APPLY:
 Email your application; Include your resume and a cover letter (tell us why you want to work at ILAC); All candidates must be eligible to work in Canada..
 We thank all candidates who are interested in applying for the position, kindly note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Analyst, Commercial Real Estate
Description:
Job Category: 
Commercial Property Valuation 
 
Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group! 

Altus Group is currently seeking a candidate in the position of an Analyst based out of our Calgary, Alberta office to join our Research, Valuation, and Advisory division. The selected individual will work within a dynamic team gaining experience in (but not limited to) land valuation, appraisal methods, building inspections, and data analysis. 

The Analyst will be responsible for the collection, analysis and organization of industrial to commercial real estate data, which is to be used for property assessment and valuation consulting services. In addition, the role will work closely with senior staff providing research and consulting support for key assignments. 

Key Responsibilities: 

Prepare accurate analysis or portions of appraisal reports using the latest market information obtained from various internal / external partners. Extensive senior co‐worker review is anticipated 
Develop cash flow projections to be used in the appraisal process, using industry standard software such as Excel, Argus DCF, Argus Enterprise, Argus Developer or other appropriate software. Extensive senior co‐worker review is anticipated 
Conduct research and collect data from both internal database and third party sources with respect to market rental rates, comparable building transactions and general market knowledge 
Ensure data collected as part of on‐going assignments is entered accurately into the company database in a timely fashion 
Conduct market surveys and research by calling various market participants (e.g. brokers, developers, property managers, leasing agents, municipalities, City Planners, etc.) 
In partnership with the Sr. Analyst, Consultant, Sr. Consultant, Associate Director, Director, or Sr. Director, perform building inspections 
Continuously upgrade the level of knowledge regarding market and industry trends 
Accurately complete time sheets on a daily basis ensuring non billable time and recoverable expenses are clearly outlined 
Become a Candidate with the Appraisal Institute of Canada. Maintain Candidate status by completing requirements outline by the AIC, e.g. completing minimum of one (1) of the required courses towards designation per year 


Position Requirements: 

University degree, preferably in Commerce, Economics, or Finance or related experience in commercial appraisal/real estate valuation 
Excellent communication skills – written, verbal, and oral presentation 
Valid driver’s license with the ability to work flexible hours and travel locally for building inspections 
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Outlook, Excel (vlookup, if statements, pivot tables, etc.) 
Basic skills in creating financial models (i.e. Excel, Argus, etc.) 
Excellent research, quantitative and analytical skills 
Ability to work in a team and independently 
Excellent time management skills and ability to manage multiple deadlines 
Ability to take initiative and be resourceful 
Self-motivated with a high degree of integrity, honesty, and ethics 
Candidate for the Appraisal Institute of Canada (AIC) designation is considered an asset 
Real estate experience is considered an asset 

Come realize your potential at Altus Group! 

Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
BI Analyst Full Time Location: Montreal 
Our large banking client is looking for a BI Analyst to work with our HR leaders.
BI Responsibilities: 

The BI Analyst will turn raw data into valuable insights that the organization needs in order to grow and compete.
They will interpret and analyze the data from multiple sources to come up with imaginative solutions to problems.
Produce analysis and sharp visualizations through business analytics and intelligence technologies such as Power BI to help make informed decisions.
Identify and use multiple data sources, analyze and present results – interpret data and derive significant patterns or points of attention, provide recommendations and insight based on key trends and knowledge of business challenges
Design, develop and maintain standardized dashboards, metrics, KPIs, and reports
Maintain data integrity, create and utilize reports and data queries to authenticate the integrity of employee information, resolves differences between Finance and Human Resources systems, and assist with reconciling data between PeopleSoft and other internal compensation systems, including Payroll
Participate in auditing and maintenance of employee records, including HR status updates, terminations, and new hires

BI Requirements: 

5+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or similar roles
Experience in data mining, text analytics, data collection strategies
Solid experience with Power BI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent English communications skills

Job Type: Full-time
Additional pay:

Bonus pay

Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
RRSP match

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

Montréal, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

Power BI: 5 years (required)

Title: Business Systems Analyst (On-Site)
Description:
Texcan provides customers with high quality wire and cable products at the best value possible. As one of Canada’s largest distributor for over 40 years, we have built a reputation for going to great lengths for our customers. We supply solutions for a variety of different markets in residential, commercial, industrial and emerging green markets such as wind farms, solar energy, hydroelectric, water and waste treatments.
We are a member of the Sonepar Group, the world’s largest privately-held electrical distributor. The Sonepar Group is present in more than 40 countries with over 45,000 employees.
Why Join Us?

You will be joining a market leader with over 40 years of experience to help you elevate your potential.
You will be working for the world's #1 privately held business to business distributor of electrical products and related solutions.
Be part of an ISO certified company with a strong a quality assurance program and new technologies which help you perform at your best.
Attractive compensation with benefits and “other perks” such as tuition reimbursement.
Employee Referral provides the opportunity to earn more while you work by referring one of the best you know.
In-depth process and product training provided by a mentored approach, product knowledge sessions hosted by the Product Manager and lunch and learn meetings.
We house the largest inventory to better service our customers and deliver on sales commitments.

Texcan is looking to add an enthusiastic full-time Documentation Specialist to work with our Major Projects team. If you are a self-motivated individual, who thrives in a busy environment and enjoys coordinating the control of professional documents, keep reading.
Business Systems Analyst
The Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for the Texcan Business Applications including Rubicon ERP\Dynamics CRM\Power Apps alongside the other Business Analysts within the Texcan BA team. The position is also responsible for developing reports, configuring systems and workflows to meet the company’s needs. Also, provide daily application support to branches and departments.
Major Responsibilities

Business analyst and documenting business requirements
Day to day support and training to branches
Testing new system enhancements or modules
Developing Reports in Cognos or Power BI
Assist the Rubicon Specialist with the development of documentation to support Rubicon
Creating documentation for users
Data analysis to identify areas of improvement
Other duties as assigned.
Able to travel (infrequent).

Education & Training

Post-Secondary IT related diploma preferred

Experience

2 - 3 years of experience providing support on an ERP system. [Preferably Rubicon ERP or other distribution ERP]
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel/Word) & Adobe Acrobat
Knowledge of Dynamic CRM, Cognos, Power Apps, and Power BI is an asset
Database knowledge is preferred

We are interested in knowing more about you! Start an exciting career and enjoy a number of employee benefits by applying online. Texcan thanks all applicants, only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
To explore and learn more about Texcan, please visit www.texcan.com.
Watch our employee videos on our new careers page: https://www.texcan.com/careers
Sonepar is committed to providing a safe environment for our employees, customers, and the communities we serve. We believe the COVID vaccination adds a layer of protection that complements the extensive and necessary health and safety protocols that we have taken to date. In order to be considered for employment at any Sonepar location you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Additional pay:

Bonus pay

Benefits:

Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
RRSP match
Tuition reimbursement
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Application question(s):

Please provide your compensation expectations.
Please confirm you are aware this is an in-office position in Surrey BC with no options for remote. You must respond these questions if you want to be considered for the position.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Why Fraser Health?: 
 
   Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of nearly 40,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
 

   Effective October 26th, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and the Provincial Health Officer must approve individual medical exemptions.
 

   We are proud of the innovation, dedication, partnership and resourcefulness of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
 

   This is a 
  permanent full-time role, based at our Central City Offices, Surrey, B.C.
  Detailed Overview: 
 Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:

 The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for providing leadership in Business Process Reengineering concepts, methods and technologies. Leads the analysis and documentation of business requirements for client-facing and internal Informatics services delivery processes for business, clinical, and systems support services within Fraser Health. The Senior Business Analyst will be engaged in multiple initiatives and will be responsible for project planning, business requirements gathering, data analysis and supporting the execution of projects and change management. Provides leadership and acts as an escalation point for Business Analysts to assist in resolving complex problems. Responsibilities: 
 

Provides strategic planning support and change management services by leading and providing senior level support and guidance in streamlining business processes and best practices for health and corporate information systems capture and utilization.


Leads, develops, and maintains the business processes necessary to facilitate care provider access to health and corporate information systems by conducting feasibility studies and determining user requirements for the uptake of health and corporate information functionality or systems. Leads, coordinates and/or participates in initiatives and process redesign that supports and follows the service management methodology.


Provides senior level business analysis by carrying out work flow analysis, developing business information requirements and models, defining business scope and objectives and planning, designing, or modifying practical manual and automated business processes.


Provides health information systems projects responsibility, under the direction of the Lead or Portfolio Manager, by performing business systems analysis support. Will lead small projects and provide project management guidance to Business Analysts.


Analyzes and diagnoses health information systems applications and/or business issues and provides resolution to either the systems or the business processes. Supports business process changes and/or functional changes to health information systems in support of business practice requirements by testing, modifying, and maintaining the integrated health information systems applications.


Develops Service Level Agreements between Informatics and assigned business areas to support the movement of projects to operational status, maintenance, and support.


Resolves operational issues with health information systems as identified internally or externally from the Informatics Customer Service desk.


Participates in the development, implementation, and evaluation of health informatics goals, objectives, policies and procedures for Informatics and assigned business areas within Fraser Health.


Participates on assigned internal and external committees as required and works collaboratively as a member of the Health Information Systems and Services team. 

 Qualifications: 
 Education and Experience

 Bachelor's Degree in Health Information Systems Management or a related field or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. Three (3) to five (5) years of recent, related experience in a medium to large sized organization. Experience with health and corporate information systems.
 

Skills and Abilities
 Demonstrates the LEADS capabilities; Leads Self, Engages Others, Achieves Results, Develops Coalitions and supports Systems Transformation. 
Professional/Technical Capabilities

Demonstrated knowledge of health and corporate information systems. 
Ability to analyze business processes and business specifications. 
Knowledge of systems analysis, design and development life cycle theory, concepts and practices. 
Ability to develop innovative system/computing technology approaches and
solutions for customer business needs. 
Analytical reasoning and problem solving skills. 
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing. 
Ability to deal effectively with others. 
Ability to organize and prioritize work. 
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team. 
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.

Title: Business Systems Analyst III
Description:
Who we are
 

   Moneris was created as a joint investment between RBC and BMO Bank of Montreal (including Harris Bank) in December 2000. By maintaining the tradition of security and strength of our parent banks, today we are Canada's #1 processor, and one of North America's largest.
 

   We are re-imagining commerce and shaping the future of FinTech. To do that, we empower our teams to redefine what's possible, enable them with the right tools and resources, and support them every step of the way.
 

   Connect. Impact. Grow. Join one of Canada's top employers and make your mark at Moneris.
   What you'll do
  
 Leads the design of technology solutions by collecting and/or analyzing business requirements, working with developers and users to design and document functional solutions. Creates and maintains platform and project artifacts including solution documents, user interface designs and wireframes, data mapping, user and system workflows, reporting, etc.
  
 Uses subject matter expertise on the platform to provide support and consultation for end users, business and project teams
  
 Provides project management for various projects and change requests
 

   What you bring
 

Work with business groups to elicit, and review requirements.
Analyze and translate the business requirements into functional requirements for the platform, always keeping in mind the optimal user experience.
Support the day-to-day portal platforms support team where required.
Effectively communicate the designed changes to both business and technical groups to ensure a common understanding. This requires working directly with QA and software development teams to ensure what is developed and tested meets the business requirements, and working with the business groups to present how the solution fulfills their needs.
Viewed as a subject matter expert for the platform, provide input into the feasibility and reasonability for the requested changes. Analyze the changes and provide viable options to accomplish the change.



   Must-have experience, knowledge, skills & abilities
 

   Bachelor's degree required; or equivalent work experience
  

Minimum 5 years of experience working as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role



Experience working with SQL queries
Experience working with web based applications
Proficient in reviewing, analyzing, writing, and maintaining documentation
Experience leading small to medium scale projects


   Nice-to-have experience, knowledge, skills & abilities
 



     Proficiency in payment systems and the merchant acquiring business is an asset
   


     Working with Agile and Waterfall is an ass
   



   What you get
 



     The chance to be part of one of Canada’s top employers and leader in FinTech
   


     Competitive pay and annual bonus program based on individual performance and productivity
   


     Emphasis on Wellness - Meeting Free Fridays (MF2), company-wide holiday closure, just to name a few
   


     RRSP matching & defined contribution pension plan
   


     Flexible benefits package starting from day 1
   


     Thrive in a Hybrid or Remote Model - including a tech peripheral rebate!
   


     Extensive learning & development programs and resources - plus unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning and Udemy courses!
   


     Lots of opportunities to advance your career – 30% of Moneris' roles are filled internally
   


     EAP (Employee Assistance Program), Educational Assistance and Recognition Program
   


     Employee perk program with incredible discounts for over 2,400 vendors!
   


     Get involved in one or many of our Moneris Committees and Employee Resource Groups - Inclusive Workplace Council (IWC), Black Employee Network, just to name a few
   


 Who you'll work with
 

   Our Technology team's goal is to connect ideas and technology to create solutions that shape the way people pay. Connection is in our DNA, and we are a team enabling our merchants, business partners, and each other with the tools we need to thrive. We're a team of over 400+ people, broken into six functions, who oversee all technology aspects at Moneris, including software, infrastructure engineering, cyber security, data analytics, and project management.
 


 Learn more about how Moneris is striving to be at the forefront of Fintech!
  



   Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous people, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

Title: Single Molecule Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to make a real impact in a mission-based organization revolutionizing the biotechnology industry? ScopeSys is hiring a Single-Molecule Data Analyst and wants to hear from YOU! 
About ScopeSys 
At Scopesys, we partner with big pharma to bring single-molecule imaging to the next level. Our unique Convex Lens-induced Confinement (CLiC) platform helps access crucial information for drug and vaccine delivery without the need for tethering chemistry.
As a start-up with the support of an NRC IRAP award, we are developing a revolutionary single-molecule imaging platform in the biotechnology space! We provide biomedical, pharmaceutical, and nanotechnology researchers with the first simple, general tool for investigating some of the biggest, unanswered questions in biotech with the highest possible level of precision-analyzing molecules one at a time.
About You 
As a Single-Molecule Data Analyst at ScopeSys, you will be an integral part of our growing team who continues to develop and commercialize our exclusive and innovative technology. You are a talented scientist with strong coding and data visualization skills coupled with a strong understanding of the technical intricacies involved in communicating complex concepts. Your bias toward perfection and a keen eye for detail allows you to analyze elements that others might miss. Your articulate communication and strong interpersonal skills drive you to collaborate seamlessly with team members of different skillsets and backgrounds and simplify complex data for all stakeholders.
A Day in the Life  

Harness your exceptional written communication skills to create high-quality code and review your team’s code with insightful feedback.
Present newly acquired key data to collaborators using your data visualization expertise. 
Support in constructing a more efficient and well-prepared process for partnership meetings by integrating closely with highly technical engineers and data analysts to communicate sound results.
Accelerate analysis and interpretation of our data by developing innovative algorithms and software for extracting quantitative information to support with analysis of our data.
Support in molecular experiments and report on these experiments using your informative and concise writing skills.
Communicate and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of biophysicists, applications scientists, and engineers, as well as with ScopeSys’ business team and early-access users in multiple locations to drive ScopeSys’ mission forwards with purpose.

What You Bring to the Table 

1+ years of experience in the biotech industry.
Bachelor of Computer Science, Engineering, or in a related scientific field (Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics/Engineering Science, Physics, Molecular Biology, or Biochemistry).
Experience with programming and/or developing software.
Excellent presentation skills and data visualization interests to help present novel data and organize it to create new perspectives.
A strong analytical mindset and scientific approach to both R&D and problem-solving.
Experience in instrumentation and image processing, specifically with acquiring images and videos using ImageJ, LabVIEW, etc.
Experience in developing algorithms and software tools for automated analysis of experimental data, in particular fluorescence or similar images.
A strong motivation to learn and understand our imaging technology in detail.
Excellent English communication skills and a strong passion for writing.
Strong coding abilities and experience developing analysis tools with data and creating simulations that model the data and varying interpretations.
Ability to travel to ScopeSys’ offices in Vancouver, the Lab, as well as to customer/user sites to collaborate and receive coaching from our team as needed (up to 4 times a year).

It’s a Bonus If You Have: 

Previous scientific research environment or experience designing, conducting and analyzing scientific experiments and data.
Experience in life sciences research, molecular biology, biotech, etc.
Experience with MATLAB, Jira, and/or Confluence.

Why ScopeSys? 
In addition to working on revolutionary projects with a great team and using innovative and new technology, we also offer:  

A competitive compensation plan.
A supportive and positive company culture – you will be part of a small but mighty team! 
Stock options upon eligibility.
Three weeks of paid vacation time so you can truly relax and take care of yourself.
Career growth opportunities and career development support.
Flexible work situation – you can operate remotely (Montreal or Vancouver area) or use our Vancouver office!

ScopeSys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We know from experience that a diverse team is central to ensuring varied perspectives and better ideas to solve complex problems. Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion are unwavering and the core of how we build our team, cultivate leaders and create impact. 
If you’re qualified for the job and can see the value in our mission, we’re ready to talk. Sound like something you could get behind? 
Apply today to join our growing team and help revolutionize molecular science! 
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Flexible schedule
Paid time off

Application question(s):

Do you have experience working in Biotechnology? If so, how many years?
Which science industries do you have experience working in? How many years?
What are your salary expectations for this opportunity?

Title: INVENTORY CONTROL ANALYST
Promotions Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kids-wear, and Everything Else™.
 SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.



 Job Description
  Reporting to the Promotions Manager, the Promotions Analyst will play a key role in the growth of the business by initiating and delivering new ecommerce projects, and conducting analysis to provide actionable insights. You will identify new business development opportunities in line with our strategic direction and be responsible for their implementation leading cross functional teams.
 The ideal candidate will possess a balance of analytical capabilities and project management experience; and is relentlessly curious and proactive about optimizing and growing the online sales.
 Responsibilities

 Deliver new projects and initiatives with a focus on promotional activities by building business cases, providing requirements to the Technology teams, monitoring the performance and doing post mortem to further identify new opportunities
 Manage the promotions operations from planning to execution and improvements recommendations.
 Use internal and external data to identify strategic growth opportunities
 Prepare documented business cases for senior management and develop actionable roadmaps
 Collaborate with all business units (Email, Advertising, Loyalty, Buying, etc.), and more closely with our Technology teams, to help shape the mid to long term vision for the SSENSE expansion
 Review the competitive landscape and gather intelligence.




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Engineering, or a related field
 Master’s degree an asset
 3-5 years of relevant working experience including data analysis, project management, preferably in an e-commerce, retailer or fashion environment
 Strong knowledge of Excel
 Google Workspace, Google Analytics, and Tableau/BI an asset
 Excellent English written and verbal communication skills, French an asset

 Skills

 Very strong analytical skills and the ability to work with big databases
 Very strong project management skills with an attention to detail
 Highly autonomous, proactive and organized
 Ability to synthesize and simplify complex information in order to effectively communicate with senior leadership
 Creative thinker with a bias for problem solving
 Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment
 Strong interpersonal skills with a natural ability to build relationships

Title: Senior Finance Master Data Analyst
Description:
Address: 120 Bloor Street East 
 







Job Family Group: 






Data Analytics & Reporting 
 
Creates a culture where data is managed as a valuable corporate asset. Provides input to, and follows, data governance standards and processes to improve the quality of BMO data and reduce overall data risk for the designated business/group. Develops and implements data strategies, tactics, products and a curated data model to achieve business objectives. Reviews, designs and implements data governance practices and data management processes within the business/group in alignment with Enterprise Data Governance Operating Directive. Provides guidance on the interpretation of enterprise data governance policies and maintains alignment between data governance practices and the data strategy. 

Monitors and reports on data management requirements and compliance issues, impacts and resolution status to leadership and data governance team. 
Supports the assessment, root cause analysis, and formulating proposed solutions/remediation strategies. 
Escalates data and compliance issues. 
Conducts needs assessments, identifies gaps and provides suggestions to improve and streamline data management processes based on operational insights. 
Documents and maintains operational procedures and processes. 
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives. 
Develops stakeholder communications and training in support of data management process implementation. 
Supports the resolution of data issues by coordinating stakeholders in the information chain. 
Performs quality assurance activities to ensure handling, storage, and collection of data complies with Bank Policy and regulatory requirements. 
Supports the management of BMO’s data as a key asset that facilitates effective decision making. 
Analyzes structured and unstructured data to support the design and development of a business / group curated data model. 
Contributes to the development of business/group data strategies and data governance policies, procedures, and processes. 
Develops data solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. 
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of data solutions. 
Identifies and implements the optimum means to collect, process, analyze and report on information and ensure ongoing accuracy, integrity and security. 
Participates in the timely resolution of operating/technical problems or manages escalation with other BMO technical support groups. 
Assists in the identification of change impacts through requirements gathering, mapping and documenting current and proposed processes. 
Provides support to projects and/or manages operational changes including supporting Technology with the validation and testing of systems. 
Provides support on data management process implementation and sustainment activities to ensure stakeholder awareness and adoption of data governance in work including but not limited to development of business tools and end use procedure documentation. 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations. 
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment. 
Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. 

 Qualifications: 

Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Skilled in statistical analysis environments (e.g. R, MATLAB, SPSS or SAS). 
Skilled in working with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau and Microstrategy, relational databases and Hadoop-based data mining frameworks. 
Knowledge in working with SQL, Python, Java and C/C++. 
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
First Capital [TSX: FCR.UN] is a leading owner, operator, and developer of mixed-use real estate located in Canada’s most densely populated cities. First Capital’s focus is on creating thriving urban neighbourhoods to generate value for businesses, residents, communities and our investors. We strive for performance excellence at our properties and new developments, creating healthy and sustainable urban neighbourhoods. As one of the Greater Toronto Area’s top employers, we foster a vibrant corporate culture that ensures equal opportunity and well-being for all employees in a dynamic and rewarding workplace. 
SUMMARY:
 Reporting to Director, Applications & Services, we are seeking a new member of the Information Technology team in the role of Senior Business Analyst. This role will support the business in the assessment of requirements, transforming them into solutions for the company’s financial reporting, budgeting, and transactional applications. The individual for this role is committed to continuously working with the business on areas for process improvement; has a deep understanding of financial concepts from entry through consolidation; and is a subject matter expert with the vision to create innovative solutions to complex problems. We are looking for someone with strengths in the end-to-end process from gathering requirements to creating User Acceptance Testing scenarios and collaborating with our vendors and IT team on the administration of our financial applications.
 PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:


Business Engagement
. Working directly with various stakeholders within our accounting and finance teams to conduct analysis of business user needs, develop a deep understanding of requirements, and translate them into solutions:


 Interpret needs and translate them to detailed specifications
 Define and develop technical and business process requirements documentation
 Understand the financial applications and create opportunities for continuous improvements for the business based on deep understanding of financial concepts
 Champion the best options for the business needs and the IT team’s feasibility, to guarantee the solutions are impactful to the users 
Work closely with technical resources to ensure the requirements are understood and provide validation during the development process
 Level II support of existing suite of financial applications including, but not limited to, JDE Edwards (ERP), Financial Reporting, AP Automation, Budgeting

 Process Improvement
. Analyze current processes and identify needs to be translated into improved processes or, when streamlining, the removal of redundancies. This will include a full business case that will allow for opportunities to be evaluated and prioritized:

 Document recommended changes for implementation of new/revised processes and outline impact and outstanding issues to be solutioned
 Documentation with sufficient detail to serve as requirements of identified processes
 Validate that any changes in process conform to IT general and financial controls of the organization for audit purposes
 Conduct User Acceptance Testing on final solutions to ensure accuracy in implementation
 Provide training and/or knowledge documentation for new or enhanced solutions and processes

 Data Strategy
. Support the Director, Data & Automation to continue to develop and enhance data integrations, automation opportunities and reporting:

 Review the implementation of data integration from existing platforms and analyze impact to workflows across business processes 
Work with data providers to improve quality and streamline data formats received to fit platforms
 Produce use cases for the consumers of data to improve business reporting processes or enhancements to develop efficiencies in decision making
 Identify opportunities where automation can be implemented to improve the quality or efficiency of financial processes

 KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:
 Required level of education and related experience:

 A post-secondary degree in Business, Finance, or Commerce
 5-8 Years’ related work experience collaborating with all various levels of an organization as a business or financial analyst or project leader with a focus on accounting and finance ideally in the Real Estate industry
 Understanding of financial and/or IT general controls for organizations with experience in implementation or enforcement preferred
 Understanding of ITSM including Change Management processes and experience in the implementation of projects
 A high degree of comfort with technology and related applications 
Experience using JD Edwards, Hubble Insight Reporting 
Experience with lease budgeting &/or forecasting support an asset
 Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office suite including Power BI exposure


 Specific skills you'll need to be successful:


 The ideal candidate will embody the FCR Core Values into their daily responsibilities: Collaboration, Innovation, Excellence, Accountability, Passion.
 Experience working as a BA - You know how to break needs down into user stories and translate into requirements. A creative thinker with exceptional diagnostic and problem-solving competencies.
 Innovation and Technology - You learn new software quickly without handholding. You take any opportunity to learn new skills.
 Personality - You have a way of engaging with the business that instills confidence and credibility. You know how to leverage communication tools.
 Detail oriented - Your attention to detail guides you.
 Passion - You love what you do. This isn’t a job. This is a career. You are invested in satisfying the needs of the business.
 Problem solver - You investigate issues thoroughly and create effective solutions that solve problems and discover new opportunities.
 A team-player – You are willing to step in and lend a hand as needed and you identify the opportunities to do so.

 
WHAT WE OFFER:
 We invest in People. Along with our competitive compensation packages—we’re always thinking of new ways for our people to share in the company’s success. We are very proud to offer the following to our employees:

 Flexible Hours
 Remote workdays
 Company-matched savings plans
 Annual Wellness Subsidy
 Tuition & Development Program
 Employee Referral Program
 Rewards and Recognition Programs
 Paid time off during December holiday season
 Parental leave benefits


 First Capital is proudly a fully vaccinated workforce to ensure the safety of all our employees and visitors. Successful applicants will also be subject to a background check.
 Our people are what makes us different. At First Capital we are committed to workplace diversity and inclusion within our organization, therefore, we encourage all qualified persons from all backgrounds to apply. Accommodations are available, upon request, to all applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process.

Title: Inventory Analyst
Description:
Effective asset management is an integral piece of Brandt’s continued growth. Managing assets to meet Brandt sales goals, and financial control metrics will be key to future success. The Inventory Analyst is charged with maintaining Brandt’s Estimate To Cash (ETC) data inputs and reporting tools to enable effective inventory planning that includes allocation of inventory and accurate order timing.
 Reporting to the Wholegoods Inventory Manager, the Inventory Analyst will be the lead to gather and report on key ETC inputs such as sales forecasts, order lead times, and historic data.
 Duties & Responsibilities:

Provide and maintain key data sets that allow effective order allocation of inventory to Brandt regions and divisions.
Accountable for analysis on stocking logic metrics and reporting of both overages and deficiencies to management teams of all dealerships.
Will work directly with Brandt Operations and Sales teams on both forecasting and allocations of inventory.
Provide new order configuration to Sales leadership for review and approval.
Provide new order data to Brandt Finance teams for financial planning.
Provide order data to regional Order Fulfillment coordinators, PDI teams, and Logistics group on new allocated orders.
Maintain and develop Brandt ETC system.
Maintain the manufacturer’s ETC systems for target stock and sales forecast data.
Maintain the tracking and analysis tools used in asset configuration tracking.
Provide guidance and communication to sales leadership and operations teams.
Other duties as assigned.


 Required Skills
 
 Required Experience
 

The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated individual who possesses excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Must be an analytical thinker and be proficient in the use of Microsoft Excel.
Experience within the equipment industry, inventory management, ERP system maintenance or supply-chain is preferred.
3-5 years of relevant experience and/or post-secondary education in Business Administration, Analytics, or similar discipline would be considered an asset.

Title: Customer Experience Analyst
Description:
DescriptionWorking for the City of BurlingtonA great career is closer than you think. Come work for the City of Burlington, where you’ll be joining an innovative and progressive workplace focused on building a 21st century city that respects the diversity of our residents, visitors and employees; and prioritizes continuous opportunities for you to learn and grow.We don't just spend time attracting the best talent. We spend time and resources to keep the best talent. This may include: flexible working hours, mobile and hybrid working arrangements, a great benefits package, as well as programs to foster innovation and leadership.LocationThis position is temporarily working remotely due to COVID-19 for an undetermined period. Once our offices re-open you will be based out of City Hall. This position is eligible for a hybrid working arrangement that will include in-person meetings. Work location is subject to change at the discretion of the City due to operational demands.Position OverviewThis position provides system and data analysis, reporting and training activities to support the successful delivery of customer experience across the organization. The CX Analyst facilitates system usage, reporting and analysis for all CRM-enabled services, and compiles data to support Voice of the Customer initiatives. The CX Analyst is also a key resource on effective use of CRM and the creation of customer-facing online forms.ResponsibilitiesThe CX Analyst will be responsible for:

Designing and building data-driven dashboards, reports, and charts to satisfy reporting requirements from all levels of the organization.
Facilitating conversations with service leads to ensure great performance on customer-facing web pages and implementing changes to improve.
Building strong relationships with all departments and to maintain a thorough understanding of business processes as related to the creation, collection, and maintenance of customer information, how the CRM system is being used, the effectiveness of CRM requests and Knowledge Base Articles.
Providing guidance on creating accessible, inclusive online content, forms and documents.
Assisting in maintaining a corporate Knowledge Base including writing, publishing and maintain Knowledge Base Articles for the CRM system.
Identifying cross-functional business process issues related to the use of CRM and the collection, creation, maintenance and use of customer data and make recommendations for improvements.
Conducting end user testing of web-based applications, and enhancements to Burlington.ca to assess user experience, accessibility requirements and ease of design.
Conducting research to gather feedback on customer’s ease of use and satisfaction on the City’s websites and online service products.

RequirementsThe successful candidate has a three (3) year diploma/degree in business, computer science, communications, information management, data analysis, web development, user experience design or a related field.One (1) to three (3) years of experience related to data and analysis for contact centres, call centres, website or telephony systems is required.Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software is considered an asset.Additional InformationAll City of Burlington staff are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire in accordance with the City’s COVID-19 Staff Vaccination Policy. Please call us at 905-335-7602 or email us at: hr@burlington.ca if you require accommodation to ensure your equal participation in the recruitment and selection process.

Description




Join our team


Our Team – TELUS Business Solutions Marketing BI - has a mandate to build solutions for our stakeholders using data to drive business outcomes. We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


As Business Consultant, you will have the opportunity to develop solutions to effectively report on P&L, business and product performance. You would be collaborating closely with Corporate Finance, Strategy and Product teams to produce official numbers that are reported out to the streets.

Master degree #LI-REMOTE

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Regulatory Reporting, AML Risk
Description:
Requisition ID: 154875  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Job Purpose
 The Senior Analyst scrutinizes and evaluates FINTRAC regulatory reporting with a focus on analytical procedures for effective reporting. Guided by Bank policy, receives direct supervision from the Senior Manager. Within a well-defined task, the Senior Analyst is expected to function independently while ensuring that management is kept informed and that problems and issues are escalated appropriately.

 Key Accountabilities


 Provides senior management with consistent, consolidated, annotated reporting on AML regulatory reporting to FINTRAC, specific to Canadian legislation, with specific emphasis on Large Cash Transaction Report (LCTR) and Electronic Funds Transfer Report (EFTR) requirements.
Identifying unacceptable AML risks and escalating appropriately to Manager.
Identify, track, and communicate system improvement opportunities and analytic defects, and participate in the implementation process.
Assist in the creation and maintenance of analytical tools (Advanced Excel tools) and reporting dashboards (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI) in respect to FINTRAC regulatory reporting.
Assist in the development of business requirement documents and user acceptance testing of AML front end and detective controls. Participate in the operational implementation process by assisting in the creation of job aids and workflows, the development of communications and publications, the development of conversion and implementation strategies, training staff, and post-implementation support.
Support and continuously improve the on-going initiatives in respect to AML regulatory reporting to FINTRAC, by providing ad hoc reporting, monitoring efficiency/effectiveness of reporting through analytical processes, soliciting feedback, and critically assessing procedures.
Prepare documents for audit review and validate.
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, Enterprise AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.


 Functional Competencies


 A proven ability to critically assess, prioritizes tasks, and delivers meaningful results in a fast-paced environment.
Basic knowledge of operational processes including best practices, current and anticipated regulatory requirements, Back Office processes, and the end-to-end workflows among the Front and Back Offices.
Good interpersonal and communication skills in both oral and writing, and to ability exercise diplomacy and judgement, to effectively work with end users, members of project teams, and stakeholders across the global organization.
Proficient with querying in database management software (e.g. Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, Oracle, MySQL)
Proficiency in advanced functions in Microsoft Excel, such as VLOOKUP, Nested IFs, SUMIFs, Fuzzy Logic
Proficiency with languages and tools: Python, VBA
Proficiency with data analytics and visualization/ case management software, (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI).
Working knowledge of XML an asset
Proven ability to effectively analyse large amounts of transactional and case management data.
Proven creative, self-starter, results-oriented, and highly motivated individual with good analytical skills in order to apply this knowledge to improve existing solutions and assist in the development of AML/ATF strategies.
Strong knowledge of regulatory compliance, particularly with respect to FINTRAC regulatory reporting (including LCTR/EFTR).
Experience with SWIFT EFT/Non SWIFT EFT/LCTR reporting (e.g. MT 103 messages)


 Education / Experience


 A recognized under-graduate degree in a business or technical discipline (Accounting, Finance, Data Science, Statistics or a related field) or a minimum of 2 years of related experience



 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Sr. Business Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 152070  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Hiring Details:

 Work location: 90 Wynford Drive, North York ON
 Working hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00am - 5:00pm
 Full-time; permanent


 The Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for the analysis, control, escalation and resolution of production and process-related day-to-day reporting issues as identified by management. The incumbent is responsible for the creation, review, and analysis of operational reporting to identify key trends, highlight risks and close operational gaps. The Business Analyst provides support for teams across Collections, Fraud and AML, and is responsible for identifying opportunities to create efficiencies within the departments. He/she will have a high degree of knowledge of products, processes and procedures that support Mastercard Collections. The Business Analyst works collaboratively across all functions to achieve operational consistency and maintain key controls.

 Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

 Create, review, and maintain/distribute of necessary reporting required to achieve key performance indicators, service level agreement and operational business controls.
 Create and maintain reporting necessary to achieve SLAs and identified compliance/regulatory controls.
 Provide analysis of business data using advanced analytics and modelling tools
 Work closely with team members, business partners, and management to clearly understand business and/or data requirements to provide intuitive files/reporting in user friendly format.
 Develop and maintain complex databases and reporting to support Department needs. This will include current reporting and future developments
 Prepare reports for trending info/analysis, obtaining and reviewing explanations for discrepancies as well as preparing management reports for review which includes analysis and recommendations. This includes providing analytical support in the implementation or review of new/existing projects, systems, processes, and technology as well as assisting in the delivery and implementation of solutions as required.
 May participate in the development and preparation of specific business plans and initiatives. Must be able to summarize information in executive level presentations.
 Manage and support analysis for a variety of ad-hoc and recurring reports.


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:

 Strong problem-solving, collaboration, and communication skills
 Experience with reporting & statistical software packages such as SAS, SQL, report builder, Power BI, and Python (Experience with Python is a nice to have)
 Experience with SAS to SQL code migration 
Results driven individual with high level of curiosity and ability to dive into details without losing sight of the big picture
 Exceptional organization skills to prioritize, manage, and implement a variety of competing initiatives, on a concurrent or staggered basis
 Two years’ experience in a collection’s operations environment delivering performance reporting is a nice to have


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Ottawa  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Business Systems Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 At the heart of our economy is a national payments system, safely circulating billions of dollars each day. But the payments system must modernize to support the rapidly changing needs and expectations of the Canadian marketplace, foster innovation and strengthen competition within the payments ecosystem. RBC has an opportunity to learn from modernization initiatives around the world and set its own path towards a world-class payments system capable of meeting the needs of a global economy and to put in place a solution that will establish a competitive advantage for RBC. To address this opportunity, RBC is currently undertaking a multi-year initiative to modernize its payments system and is seeking to hire an experienced Senior Business Analyst who can manage and support both business and system requirements process.

 What will you do?

 Facilitate collaborative sessions with large and diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review. Apply advanced elicitation techniques to work with different types of stakeholder groups
 Perform business analysis includes understanding of business objectives, planning, eliciting, scoping, analyzing, documenting, prioritization, managing changes, maintaining traceability, managing backlogs, stakeholder analysis and effort estimation
 Translating business needs, processes and procedures into a workable system, and articulating on specific software requirements by communicating about these requirements with technology experts and business stakeholders according to project standards and methodologies.
 Perform data mappings, reverse engineering, documenting as-is flows, performing gap analysis and elicit requirements to support to-be end state
 Produce requirements documents – Problem Opportunity Analysis, Scope Modelling, Business Process Mapping, Business Context Diagraming, High-level and Detailed Requirements, Use Cases & Scenarios, Business Rules & Data Catalogue, User Stories, Story Decomposition, Story Mapping and Requirements traceability
 Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

 Minimum 5+ years of experience in a Senior Business Systems Analyst role with proven experience with various methodologies such as Waterfall and Agile delivering large-scale payments projects/programs
 SWIFT message knowledge (MT and/or MX / ISO)
 Experienced in facilitating group discussion with various stakeholders to elicit requirements. Ability to collaborate with colleagues of various roles (Business, Technical, Architecture, Operations)
 Experience in:
   
 Documenting requirements - Problem Opportunity Analysis, Scope Modelling, Business Context Diagraming, High-level and Detailed Requirements, Use Cases & Scenarios, Business Rules & Data Catalogue
 Requirements planning, effort estimation, prioritization, managing change, maintaining traceability, managing backlog
 Data mapping, documenting as-is and to-be process flows, and gap analysis
 Confluence, Jira, Visio

 Excellent communication, active-listening, stakeholder analysis, relationship-building, self-management, proactive, team-player, critical thinking and problem-solving skills
 Relevant college, university, and/or post-graduate degree in Business Analysis
 Nice to have: Knowledge of SWIFT MX /ISO 20022 and MT message standard and Wires processing


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
 Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies







































 Job Summary










































































 Address:




































 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
 




































 City:




































 CAN-ON-TORONTO
 




































 Country:




































 Canada
 




































 Work hours/week:




































 37.5
 




































 Employment Type:




































 Full time
 




































 Platform:




































 Technology and Operations
 




































 Job Type:




































 Regular
 




































 Pay Type:




































 Salaried
 




































 Posted Date:





































2022-06-13-07:00
 




































 Application Deadline:




































 2022-06-26-07:00
 







































































 Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.  We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Questrade Financial Group (QFG) of Companies is committed to helping Canadians become much more financially successful and secure. We are everything a traditional financial institution is not. Our vision is to revolutionize financial services for the benefit of Canadians by providing the most innovative and cost efficient financial services online. 

 That’s why we empower our employees to continuously grow their professional careers with QFG. We believe in having a diverse, inclusive place to work and our flexible working arrangements brings that to life so you can unleash your creativity. Our values are a part of our DNA, and we care deeply about our people helping us fulfill our mission and become an important part of our community. We are always looking for like-minded professionals to join our team. Come grow with us. 

 What’s it like working as a Technical Business Analyst at Questrade? 

 As a Technical Business Analyst, you will be working in the CISO organization and reporting to the Senior Manager, Cybersecurity Governance. 

 Using your Technical BA expertise, critical thinking, exceptional communication and negotiation skills, and foundational cybersecurity knowledge, you will help bridge technical and business gaps and align the cybersecurity team with business goals and strategies. You will help promote cybersecurity initiatives and drive the concepts of security-by-design and privacy-by-design throughout the organization. 

 Need more details? Keep reading... 



Translate technical cybersecurity strategies and findings into management reports and presentations to facilitate senior leadership visibility into cybersecurity performance
Translate business targets into measurable KPIs and KRIs, and define dashboards
Apply your business analysis and exceptional communication skills to assist with responses and attestations to regulators and auditors and help produce
 cybersecurity policy and standards documentation 


Continuously identify opportunities for the CISO organization to support yet secure the business
Participate in documentation projects to create and maintain cybersecurity policies, standards and guidelines
Liaise with key stakeholders throughout business and technology areas, across and outside of CISO organization, IT and business, to keep the CISO
 function informed and aligned with business and engineering initiatives 


Identify requirements and help create dynamic dashboards and automated reports
Create and present slide decks and data-driven management presentations
Participate in writing and maintaining framework, policies and procedures
 So are YOU our next Technical Business Analyst? You are if you have… 



2+ years of experience as a Technical BA
Knowledge of Agile methodology, epics and stories
Proven ability to quickly learn and understand complex topics
Previous experience working in financial services or other regulated or critical infrastructure sectors is preferred
Understanding and interest in the areas of cybersecurity, risk and compliance is a bonus
University or post-graduate degree or equivalent in computer science, IT or business disciplines, or equivalent work experience
ECBA or CPRE or similar certifications are a bonus
Strong communication and presentation skills (written and oral)
Strong documentation skills
Strong project management and coordination skills
 Sounds like you? Click below to apply! #LI-CP1 

 At Questrade Financial Group of Companies, with multiple office locations around the world, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive and accessible work environment. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings, and believe that when our teams feel supported and motivated, their creativity becomes a source of innovation. We are also committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and also one which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in to help us revolutionize financial services for the benefit of all of our customers. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment/selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Analyst Work Experience Student (Department Strategy)
Description:
Business Analyst Work Experience Student (Department Strategy) 8 months 
      

       Job Number : 43937 
      

1 temporary full-time position for 8 months intended specifically for students currently enrolled in a operations management, management information science, computer science, or business related co-op or equivalent post-secondary work experience degree program, commencing in September 2022
Want to help improve how the City of Edmonton provides permit and licensing services? Working as part of the Department Strategy Section, you’ll help the team collaborate with customers and staff to design and implement solutions improving services. You’ll have a chance to impact services essential to building a vibrant, prosperous Edmonton.
Not only do you get to be part of an impactful and engaging initiative, within a diverse and enthusiastic team, you’ll get hands-on experience with process improvement. You’ll help with a variety of tasks such as data gathering, research and analysis, project coordination, training support, and more!
As a Business Analyst Student, you will create and implement process and service improvements through analytical support focused on the fiscal, administrative, and operational services. Reporting to the Service Experience and Improvement manager, you will contribute to improving the delivery of services by:

Support the Service Experience and Improvement team, focusing on major process improvements being designed and implemented
Undertake project coordination, with supervision, relating to stakeholder engagement and training
Complete data collection, research, process mapping, best practices scans and analysis
Develop and update standard operating procedures, web content, and call centre scripts to support implementation of improved processes and services
Create a range of internal communication materials to support change management activities
Perform other related duties as required

Note: This position may be a combination of working from home and on-site working conditions.


       Qualifications : 
       
Currently enrolled in an operations management, management information science, computer science, or business related co-op or equivalent post-secondary work experience degree program
Ability to work independently and make decisions in the absence of a supervisor
Excellent organizational and multitasking skills
Effective verbal and written communication skills and the ability to maintain strong working relationships
Demonstrated ability using Microsoft Office and Google Workspace applications with expert knowledge of Excel and Google Sheets
Ability to express ideas and concepts effectively, both oral and written
Access to reliable high-speed internet while working from home

Additional assets would be skills, experience or knowledge of:

Familiarity with business process improvement, process mapping, process management, and performance measurement
Experience with data visualization
Experience with Tableau, POSSE, SAP, PeopleSoft, SQL and Oracle database, statistical tools or Geospatial tools


Please note, as part of your application, we ask that you attach an unofficial transcript, and an enrollment verification letter (indicating you are enrolled in a co-op or related post-secondary work experience degree program).
