Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join our team in Winnipeg, Calgary or Toronto.As a Business Systems Analyst, you manage the functional & non-functional requirements solicitation & requirements management process. You are expected to use facilitation, interviewing, concise communication techniques to extract business needs and work closely with Product Owners, Solution Architects, Business Systems Analysts and other technologists in the realization management of those requirements through to solution implementation.
You are responsible for process analysis, data analysis and systems analysis. You will be expected to possess or rapidly acquire depth & breadth in both Business & Technology domains. You play a crucial role working with team members to facilitate requirements sessions and ensuring business needs are reflected in both functional & non-functional requirements deliverables produced.The Business Systems Analyst will: 

Liaise with business stakeholders to understand industry trends and business priorities that must be factored into solution designs.
Define and communicate system requirements at the appropriate level of detail to ensure requirements are concise enough to drive the establishment of the right technology solution.
Analyze and conceptualize design of the solution, working with the Solution Architects, Vendors, Software Developers and Quality Assurance Analysts to achieve the business objectives.
Possess or rapidly acquire business and technical acumen to successfully represent the business and technology domains in solution brainstorming & design sessions
Assist with the creation of test strategies, test plans and test summary reports required to support Transition to Production processes.
Lead changes to process and procedure improvements.
Follow established enterprise practices, standards and processes.
Maintain a high level of knowledge on current system standards and department established methodologies.
Create interface mapping & specification documents to the level of detail that allows developers to code to those specifications.

T*o be successful *as a Senior Business Systems Analyst with People Corporation, you will need: 

Degree in Business Administration or/and Computer Science
2+ years progressive experience working in an Analyst, Solution Analyst, Business Systems Analyst capacity or strong business side knowledge of the TPA space and ability to rapidly acquire analysis methods and processes using a framework
Technical expertise regarding data models, data handling, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Strong analytical & critical thinking skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrated experience in supporting, integrating and testing third-party enterprise applications and associated interfaces.
Strong understanding of ETL (data transformation) processes, tools and practices, including mapping specifications.
Advanced problem solving and time management skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a strong customer service orientation.
Able to communicate complex and technical information to peers & business audience in natural language.
Able to prioritize, multi-task and work as a member of a team and independently.
Flexible and comfortable working in a fast paced and constantly changing environment with shifting priorities.

All-star candidates will have: **

Working knowledge of scripting or programming languages is an advantage.
Insurance industry experience is considered an asset.

What's in it for you: 

Learn by working alongside our experts
Extended health care and dental benefits
A retirement savings plan with company contributions
A suite of Health & Wellness offerings
Mental Health programs and support for you and your family
Assistance for the completion of industry designations
Competitive compensation

At People Corporation we are committed to helping businesses succeed. We are a national provider of benefits, retirement, wealth, wellness, and human resource solutions. Our experts and solutions serve over 20,000 clients representing nearly 3 million Canadians. We offer customized solutions designed to fit the unique needs of businesses and their employees, members and stakeholders.Providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and clients feel valued, respected and supported is something we're committed to. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential. If you require an accommodation or an alternative format of any posting please reach out to careers@peoplecorporation.com
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a Business Analyst to join our Professional Services team! This role will require a combination of skills including business analysis and most importantly – a consultative approach to working with clients. You will need to have a strong work ethic, a positive attitude, and the ability to listen, allowing you to efficiently decipher client needs.
.What you will be responsible for: 

Translates customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear and concise manner
Analyze existing systems to understand both the business domain environment that the systems support and the technical environment in which they operate
Develop solution alternatives leading to recommendations for new applications, technology installations or changes to existing ones
Participate in the development of test strategies/plans and where required, execute functional tests
Perform impact analysis on the changes to existing systems and processes
Develop technical writing materials, including user guides, process guides, operations manuals, business analysis work products (BRD, matrix, etc.) data dictionary, testing reports, training documentation
Participate in business process reengineering (innovation or improvement) as required/requested to meet defined business objectives (increased quality, reduced cycle times, reduced cost)
Assist to develop project cost and benefit estimates to establish project
Identify general data sources and document data flows, including the development of mapping rules to standardize data across systems
Support projects through different project stages, including development, quality assurance, user acceptance testing and production implementation
Work on both business and technology projects
Perform package (software) selection process
Create and execute the Request for Proposal process for IT solutions
Capable of using Project Management methods to oversee smaller projects
Support other Resolute team members with knowledge sharing, brainstorming, coaching, collaboration, etc., as required

.
What you bring to the table: 

Post-Secondary Degree, Certifications or equivalent work experience as a Business Analyst focused on Information Technology
7+ years of experience with a combination of business analysis focused work
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Initiative and a passion to deliver results that make a difference
Experience with Microsoft O365 suite and providing solutions to business challenges
Proven ability to perform in a fast paced and demanding environment
Mastery of Microsoft Office Products, including MS Project and Excel

.
What RTS gives back to you: 

A collaborative and creative work environment that truly values and cares about their employees as people
Bonus Program
Comprehensive benefits package
Training and education opportunities
A fun and inclusive team building environment

If you have any questions, please contact our Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist Kam Singh or visit our Careers Page for more opportunities! We are not able to hire (or sponsor) out-of-country applicants that do not have a current Permanent Resident Status or Work Visa.
.
About Resolute
Resolute is a Full-Service IT firm with a multi-disciplined team that can handle every aspect of business IT. The two sides of our business are Professional Services and Managed Services.
We are a trusted partner for growing, mid-sized, and enterprise organizations to enable them to achieve their business goals to scale up operations, reduce risk, and get a consistent level of service.
--
We guarantee to do IT right for businesses. Whether it is managing a company’s entire IT footprint and operations, leading a project, or conducting an assessment – we bring best practices at every level of service.
Our mission is to help organizations solve their most challenging IT problems through expert analysis, technology solution implementation, and experienced professionals.

Title: Cloud & Data Center Systems Support Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Cloud & Data Center Systems Support AnalystLocation:  Flexible (Victoria, Vancouver, Regina, Calgary)Compensation:  Negotiable (depending on experience)Reports to: Service Desk Manager
Skills Overview
The role is diverse in its exposure to technology and vendors but is focused on data center support. While it is not mandatory that candidates have skills in all the areas listed below, priority consideration will be given to those that possess previous experience in several areas and desire to broaden their exposure and experience to align with the tactical and strategic directions within Charter.
Charter partners with a several top technology vendors, including Cisco Systems, Juniper, Extreme, NetApp, Microsoft/Azure and others. The candidate should come with a strong ability to learn and adapt quickly to as many as possible:

Cloud – O365, Azure, AWS and other cloud environments
Data Center - Cisco UCS, Cisco ACI, NetApp, Cisco Hyperflex, Cisco Nexus, Veeam, VMware, Nutanix.
Routing and Switching – Cisco Catalyst/ISR, Juniper EX/MX/SRX, Meraki
Microsoft – Exchange, SCCM, SQL, Active Directory, File Servers
Management Platforms – Cisco Prime, Juniper Space, SKY ATP
Automation – PowerShell, Ansible, Puppet, Python

In addition to the above, the candidates should highlight any additional relevant technical skills that may be applicable to the Charter business.
Additionally, candidates that holds CCNP Enterprise, Data Center certifications, NetApp NCDA would be preferred. The candidates should highlight any additional relevant technical skills that may be applicable to the Charter business.
Responsibilities & Accountabilities: 
Teamwork

Work cooperatively within a team to provide support to Charter customers.
Attend team huddles and be an active participant team planning activities.
Bring subject matter expertise and leadership in Cloud, Microsoft Active Directory, MS Exchange, and systems applications.
Bring subject matter expertise and leadership in Cisco UCS, NetApp, Nutanix, Veeam and VMware.
Use provided workflow tools to reflect the status of tickets, tasks, effort/labor etc.
Identify areas to create, improve and maintain Charter intellectual property in the form of configuration templates, testing guides and other tools that assist in allowing Charter to be efficient and support with high quality.
Work collaboratively within the broader team (pre-sales, architecture, project delivery) to bring your skills to bear where and when they are required.

*Support Desk: *

Provides timely delivery of customer communications regarding troubleshooting and restoration of services.
Tier 2 Remote Support & incident resolution
Develops, maintains, and continually improves standardized work practices.
Work with Aligned vendors for Tier 3 Support
Assist in establishing governance, process and identify efficiencies.
Providing reports and activity updates to Team Lead / Supervisor

Culture Building and Professional Development: 

Engage deeply within the Charter company, becoming active in the company community and culture.
Attend company town halls and events, focused on bringing people together and aligning to a single vision. Participate actively when appropriate.
Use available social and collaboration tools to engage broadly with the company in a positive and constructive manner.
Provide mentorship to others in areas of subject matter expertise and personal growth and management.
Recognize Charter company values and strive to apply them to your position and personal relationship with individuals and the company itself.
Explore and seize opportunities for growth that benefit both yourself and Charter, aligning with the overall vision.
Engage strongly in professional development activities with your mentors, reporting manager and HR to ensure growth, fulfillment, and overall success for all parties.

Qualifications and Experience: 

Minimum 5 years of experience in IT & Infrastructure administration.
Proven experience providing technical design, deployment and support of Data Center Networking, Storage, Systems and Cloud based solutions.
VMware, Microsoft and Cloud environments
Competence in the configuration and troubleshooting of networking hardware, specifically switches, routers, firewalls and wireless access points considered a strong asset.
Ability to establish strong working relationships.
Demonstrated ability to obtain and hold industry certifications such as VMware VCP, Microsoft, or AWS certificates. Current certifications are not mandatory, but it is expected the candidate will obtain what is necessary as part of professional development.
Time management, organizational skills, and excellent communication skills are greatly desired.

Essential skills: 

Excellent written and oral communication skills, and able to read and write in English in a professional manner.
Ability to create technical documentation, both written and diagrammatical using tools such as Word, Power Point and Visio.
Strong interpersonal skills: proven team player with ability to deliver outstanding product/service and build relationships with clients.
Self-motivated; demonstrated ability to take initiative, effectively prioritize tasks and accomplish goals with minimal supervision.
Authorized to work in Canada.

Working Conditions: 

Full-time, Permanent
Overtime as required
Part of on-call rotation
Minimal Travel – Less than 10%
Comprehensive benefits package with profit sharing

Job Type: Full-time

Title: Co-op Analyst, Pharmacy Pricing
Description:
Les candidats référés ne doivent pas postuler directement pour ce poste.  Toutes les références de candidats doivent d’abord être soumises dans Workday par un collègue de Loblaw actuel. 
Lieu: 243 Consumers Road, Toronto, Ontario, M2J 4W8 
 Prenez les choses en main et trouvez d’autres façons d’aider nos propriétaires de magasins locaux en entamant une carrière au bureau central ou aux centres de services aux magasins de Shoppers Drug Mart. Offrez un excellent service, un savoir-faire particulier et des conseils pratiques pour aider les pharmaciens-propriétaires affiliés et leur personnel à offrir aux Canadiens les meilleurs services dans le domaine de la santé, de la beauté et de la commodité. 
Pourquoi ce role est-il important? 
SUMMARY 

Reporting to the Director, Pharmacy Pricing, the incumbent analyzes and develops prescription pricing strategies and tactics by province and/or customer group while supporting the strategic, legislative and contractual requirements of the company. The incumbent identifies opportunities and conducts impact analysis to provide supporting recommendations. 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

Identifies strategic gross margin initiatives by province and payor and conducts detailed analysis to support initiatives including the analysis of pricing and the identification of potential regulatory or policy risk 
Manages retrieval of data and generates and creates reports for business users and senior management to detail potential and actual financial impact of pricing initiatives 
Liaises with and coordinates central support and pharmacy level resources to develop and implement action plans to support new initiatives 
Perform competitive market analysis to assess competitiveness. 
Ad-hoc analyses to facilitate operational and strategic decisions 


QUALIFICATIONS 

Provides solutions by using imaginative approaches where constructive thinking and innovation are required 
Utilizes decision making skills to determine the best use of resources and operational processes 
Able to work with diverse personalities and styles 
Communicates with clarity, verbally in one-on-one situations, group situations or over the telephone 
Communicates well in writing by composing clear documents 
Proficient in MS suite 
Knowledge and experience in SQL and Python an asset 
Knowledge of pharmacy industry, prescription pricing principles or general insurance claim submission and reimbursement an asset 

Pourquoi travailler chez Shoppers Drug Mart?  En agissant à titre de consultant qui soutient les clients internes et les pharmaciens-propriétaires affiliés, vous acquerrez une expérience unique au secteur du commerce du détail tout en travaillant pour une marque nationale primée. Vous bénéficierez du Programme d’achat des employés, d’une rémunération concurrentielle et de possibilités d’apprentissage en ligne par l’intermédiaire de SDMU.   Prenez en main votre emploi et trouvez d’autres façons de vous soucier de votre travail, de vos collègues, des clients et des membres de la collectivité. 
Comment Réussir:  Chez Shoppers Drug Mart/Pharmaprix, nous recherchons toujours des personnes formidables pour continuellement renforcer notre culture. Nous croyons que les gens formidables façonnent nos valeurs, sont authentiques, bâtissent la confiance et créent des liens.   Si cela vous ressemble et que vous êtes ouvert d’esprit, que vous avez une bonne attitude face aux changements et que vous aimez les défis d’un environnement de travail aux détails dynamiques, postulez aujourd’hui. 

Type d'emploi: Temps plein 
 Type de Rôle: Poste contractuel (Durée déterminée) 
 Shoppers Drug Mart/Pharmaprix considère que la diversité culturelle du Canada est une source de fierté nationale et un symbole de force. Nous nous sommes donné comme priorité de refléter la diversité croissante du Canada dans les produits que nous vendons, les gens que nous embauchons et notre culture d’entreprise. Des accommodements sont disponibles sur demande pour les postulants et collègues atteints d’un handicap.   En outre, nous croyons que la conformité aux lois consiste à faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre Code de conduite; il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous. 
Remarque : Si vous avez accès à Libre-service de l’employé (ESS) dans Workday, veuillez postuler à cet emploi en utilisant l’application Workday.

Title: Systems Analyst 1
Description:
City of Maple Ridge
Systems Analyst 1

 Competition #22-123 Status: Temporary Full Time Department: Corporate Planning & Consultation Salary: $37.00 - $43.64 per hour Closing: June 29, 2022  Come grow with The City of Maple Ridge! Are you a team player with a “can do attitude”, excellent communication and customer service skills? We have the perfect opportunity for you!  POSITION OVERVIEW The Systems Analyst 1 will be working with the City's Corporate Planning & Consultation team on ongoing data and analytics projects. The Systems Analyst 1 will work with departments to provide data analytics and data visualizations using a variety of off-the-shelf and customized solutions. This work with data visualization will be to support the organization and respective business areas to monitor performance metrics, key performance indicators, and other measures. This role will be focused on the development of Microsoft Power Platform micro-applications, ArcGIS analytics tools and business process documentation.  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Completion of a two-year diploma course in computer technology at an institute of technology or community college plus sound related experience OR an equivalent combination of training and experience.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Considerable knowledge of computer programming methods, practices and procedures as applied to the work.
Working knowledge of windows operating systems used on the Maple Ridge computer systems to complete the required work.
Working knowledge of basic computing science concepts including computer architecture, file structures, databases and one or more programming languages.
Sound knowledge of problem definition and solution techniques applicable to analyzing business problems.
Some knowledge of the information technology concepts of word processing, communications and data base technology as applied to the work.
Some knowledge of Municipal and/or financial applications.
Ability to establish and maintain effective work relationships with internal & external contacts.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing.
Ability to analyze and evaluate data and information required for programming and to develop logical solutions for assigned problems.

  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION This is a temporary full-time position for 6 months which may be extended or concluded due to unforeseen circumstances.  WHAT WE OFFER YOU The City of Maple Ridge is a great place to work with competitive compensation packages that include the Municipal Pension Plan, a strong employee wellness program and the opportunity for professional career growth and professional development. If you want to help shape a growing community in a municipality that strives for service excellence, then this is the position for you.  We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted.  Apply here

 Education : College, CEGEP or other non-university certificate or diploma from a program of 1 year to 2 years 
 Experience : Experience an asset

Title: Business Performance Analyst Marketing
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.











     About the role
     










Reporting to the Manager, Data Marketing, the Marketing Business Performance Analyst will be responsible for evaluating the results of relationship marketing campaigns, creating complex analyses, and proposing avenues for continuous improvement of various initiatives.
You will be responsible for analyzing email, mail and telemarketing campaigns for the various brands and regions served by the relationship marketing team within Intact Financial Corporation’s direct distribution and broker network.
In addition, you will be responsible for producing strategic reports, and performing data analysis and studies to develop business intelligence. Using your in-depth knowledge of our business domain, and your computer and analytical skills, you will drive the evolution of the relationship marketing activities and the marketing database environment.
Your responsibilities:

Analyze the quantitative results (financial, responses, test cells, etc.) of the various direct marketing activities by identifying highlights and making recommendations and present the results to the various teams involved.
Extract and prepare data from various internal databases via SQL in order to prepare analysis sets.
Participate in the planning, organization, and management of direct marketing campaigns. Interact optimally and proactively with the various stakeholders based on a good knowledge of the challenges, issues, and operational and business processes.
Coordinate the planning and participate in the design, execution and validation of analytical tools and information reports developed by the team.
Conduct studies and ad hoc analyses from marketing databases and external data sources to develop decision-making information systems.
Act as a project lead for mandates and activities related to the optimization of the database environment in order to improve the efficiency of the team and the quality of the information produced.












     Qualifications
     










What you bring to the table:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Marketing, or another relevant field.
5 years of experience as a marketing analyst, BI or equivalent.
Good knowledge of SQL language, Oracle databases.
Knowledge of Power BI and Snowflake, an asset.
Experience in insurance and selling insurance products, an asset.
Perfectly bilingual (French and English), an asset
Experience in fast-paced and constantly changing environments.
Autonomy and resourcefulness.
Excellent analytical and synthesis skills.
Attention to detail and thoroughness.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements
We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.
#hybrid











     Closing Statement
     










We are an Equal Opportunity Employer If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.
Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.











     Referral Bonus
     










This role is eligible for employee referral bonus. #myReferrals1000

Title: CRM Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Laura Canada is an iconic and innovative family-owned retailer housing two leading women’s fashion apparel brands, Laura and Melanie Lyne. Based in Laval, Quebec, we design, produce, market and distribute quality apparel across Canada. We proudly employ over 2,000 dedicated team members and operate more than 140 locations and two online stores. We attribute our success to the unwavering commitment of our team to delivering outstanding customer experiences while embodying our shared values of integrity, respect, teamwork, performance, and passion.
 At Laura Canada, we believe that delivering an outstanding customer experience is driven by our commitment to an outstanding employee experience.



 Job Description
  The CRM Analyst is responsible for the implementation and development of CRM and digital analytics solutions across Laura and Melanie Lyne websites. They will play both a technical and strategic role across our organization. They will shape the future of online and offline marketing efforts by providing key analyses on a variety of business metrics.
 1. CRM Analysis

 Provides multi-channel (direct mail, email, social, paid media, affiliates, etc.) analysis of marketing campaigns including ROI reports and other KPIs.
 Provides customer-specific statistical reports, as required.
 Prepares and distributes various daily, weekly and monthly CRM reports, as required.
 Performs the maintenance and reporting of all loyalty programs and provides assistance when needed.
 Works with the email team to setup marketing automation communications and manages all related dataflow required.
 Develops and presents clear and comprehensive findings/recommendations to leadership on key analytical initiatives.
 Integrates existing analytical tools (segmentations, models, etc.) into analytical deliverables, manipulates, analyzes, and interprets data from different sources.

 2. Database Maintenance

 Subject matter expert on the data sources contained in the customer database and how they can be leveraged to address business challenges and opportunities.
 Verifies and processes all incoming sales, merchandise, employee, email, store and customer information into CRM system. Ensures all internal processes related to CRM are running correctly.
 Performs various database maintenance functions.

 3. Internal Customer Support

 Assists in CRM/Analytical-related IT projects.
 Assists all other departments with CRM/Analytics-related requests.




 Qualifications
 

 University degree with a minimum three (3) years of experience performing and leading digital and CRM analytics.
 Expert in site analytics tools implementation and development, in particular Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
 Experience with behavioral, funnel, cohort, checkout and attribution analysis as well as A/B testing in an eCommerce context
 Experience with data integration (FTP, API, email) and data modeling in a web analytics context is an asset.
 Experience with the Google Marketing Platform products (Adwords, DCM, DBM) and their integration within the Google Analytics suite is an asset.
 Experience using a CRM data tool like Aptos
 Proficient in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and Microsoft PowerPoint/Google Slides
 Has a true passion for analyzing data.
 Has developed project management skills.
 Strong interest and knowledge of the fashion industry (brands, designers, customers)
 Bilingualism

 Additional Information
  At Laura Canada, there are no limits to what you can achieve - come see for yourself!
 To know more about the Company, visit https://www.lauracanada.ca/en/.

Title: Analyst, Trade Management
Description:
Reports To
   

 Vice President, Business Development
   

 Location
   

 Remote
   



 Type
   

 Full-Time, Permanent
   

 Closing Date
   

 July 03rd, 2022
   




 Company Overview


 Sysco connects the world to share food and care for one another. Sysco leads from the heart of food and service to deliver the freshest of foods and ideas to restaurants, healthcare and educational facilities, lodging establishments and other customers who prepare meals away from home. Our customers can count on us to deliver on-point products and solutions since only Sysco is the global leader, sitting at the heart of innovation supply, delivery, culinary and more.
 


 With over 57,000 associates and a fleet of over 13,000 vehicles, Sysco operates approximately 326 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 625,000 customer locations. For fiscal 2021 that ended July 3, 2021, the company generated sales of more than $51 billion.
 


 Sysco, one of Canada’s Best Employers 2022, as listed by Forbes, is dedicated to our global corporate social responsibility goals and to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations.
 


 Sysco is more than just a place to work. Our passion for food and our customers has made us the industry leader. To remain on top, we will continue to think bigger, work harder and never give up. Are you ready to drive success?
 


 For more information, visit www.sysco.ca or follow us @SyscoCanada at facebook.com/SyscoCanada; twitter.com/SyscoCanada or instagram.com/SyscoCanada
 

 For a full list of opportunities, visit 
www.sysco.ca/careers



 Role:


   To provide analytical support and reporting to the Trade Management and National Sales teams.
 


 Role Responsibilities:


 Support the Trade Management team in the daily management of Trade activities.
 Set up and maintain business review templates to service National Account customers, with a view to provide concise, visually appealing and consistent messaging.
 Set up and run data reports. Analyze data as required to build meaningful Business Reviews for National customers.
 Build, analyze and communicate PGM reports, status and follow up of converted business to Trade Management and National Sales Team
 Maintain business review calendar, PGM calendar & contract expiry calendar
 Responsible for compliance with all Policies and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) comprising Sysco’s Food Safety Program, specific for the assigned role.
 Assist Food Safety Program Manager in ensuring compliance to Sysco’s Food Safety Program that leads to compliance with third party certification and customer requirements.
 Is willing to work safely with minimal environmental impact and understands the importance of reporting all hazards, incidents, and environmental spills immediately to their Supervisor.
 Understands that they play an integral role in their own safety and that of their colleagues and is willing to speak out when hazards are present.
 Perform other duties as assigned.


 Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements:


 Minimum 3 years’ experience in an analytical capacity.
 Experience in a sales environment would be preferred.
 Marketing experience would be an asset.
 High School diploma required.
 Completion of a Certificate or Degree in Business Administration, Sales, or related field or related work experience is preferred.
 Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook
 Thorough understanding of analytical tools (COGNOS etc.)
 Must be extremely detail-oriented, fast learner, and able to handle multiple tasks.
 Ability to communicate with all levels within the Sysco organization in a professional manner.
 Excellent customer service and time management skills.
 Smart Sheet experience an asset
 High level of organization is essential.





 Internal candidates apply via the Career Centre on your HR Portal / ADP Workforce Now.
   

     External candidates submit cover letter & resume via www.sysco.ca/careers
   






 Our Purpose


 Connecting the world to share food and care for one another
   



 Our Mission


 Delivering success for our customers through industry-leading people, products, and solutions
   



 Our Identity


 Together we define our future of foodservice and supply chain
   




 Sysco is committed to Employment Equity. Accommodations during the recruitment process are available upon request for candidates with disabilities.
 


 Here’s a sample of the many benefits Sysco associates enjoy:


   Comprehensive Flexible Benefits including Health and Dental, Health Care Spending and Wellness Accounts • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability • Life Insurance • Company Pension Plan • Group RRSP • Employee and Family Assistance • Stock Purchase Plan • Unlimited on-line learning • Sysco product discounts • Preferred vendor discounts • Associate Resource Groups
 

   (*benefits may vary based on location or bargaining unit)

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Why Kyndryl
Our world has never been more alive with opportunities and, at Kyndryl, we’re ready to seize them. We design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. Kyndryl is at the heart of progress — dedicated to helping companies and people grow strong. Our people are actively discovering, co-creating, and strengthening. We push ourselves and each other to seek better, to go further, and we carry this energy to our customers. At Kyndryl, we want you to keep growing, and we’ll provide plenty of opportunities to make that happen.  Please be aware that we have the Kyndryl candidate zone hosted by IBM for a certain period. If you have applied for an IBM role previously, you will be able to log into the candidate zone using your previous IBM log in details. When in the candidate zone, you will be able to see your previous applications for both IBM and Kyndryl.  For further information on privacy, please visit www.kyndryl.com/privacy.
Your Role and Responsibilities The Business Analyst supports the Bombardier account in preparing, validating, and maintaining accurate and auditable record databases/files for proposals and projects. This requires cooperative collaboration with the account leadership, delivery teams and other supporting departments (Procurement, Pricing, Legal), with the objective to fulfill the validation requirements for customer proposal and to provide signed project registration, billing, and invoicing in a timely and accurate manner.
 
 Responsibilities:
  Ensures projects are registered in applications to allow labor claiming and revenue booking.
  Ensures that proposal is valid and meets customer expectations.
  Ensure data integrity in Bluesight, PgMP, and other tools
  Reports on, and identifies issues with, client and internal KPIs
  Oversees labour claiming on all projects and proposals.
  Works with RFS/Project team to ensure adherence to all processes
  Tracks, monitors, and reports project financial status frequently to the account leadership team.
  Initiates corrective actions, where actuals deviate from plan.
  Updates cost and revenue accordingly.
  Responsible for account PMO audit readiness
  Ensures that the Project Folder is updated, and billing data is captured, upon customer acceptance of solution deliverables.
  Performs final billing and invoicing reconciliation with the billing team
  Other adhoc requests that may need oversight 
 Required Technical and Professional Expertise Fluent English and French language skills
  10+ years’ experience in Project Administration
  Experience with corporate audits
  Proficient in Excel, Word, Powerpoint
  Attention to detail
  Excellent coordination, communication, and negotiation skills
  Problem-solving skills
  Affinity to working with numbers and calculations
  Positive behavior towards time pressure 
 Preferred Technical and Professional Experience Fluent English and French language skills
  10+ years’ experience in Project Administration
  Experience with corporate audits
  Proficient in Excel, Word, Powerpoint
  Attention to detail
  Excellent coordination, communication, and negotiation skills
  Problem-solving skills
  Affinity to working with numbers and calculations
  Positive behavior towards time pressure

Bachelor's Degree
Preferred Education
Bachelor's Degree
Eligibility Requirements
Bachelor's Degree
Being You @ Kyndryl
Kyndryl is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. Kyndryl is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Divisional Sales Solutions Analyst
Description:
Westburne is much more than electrical products. We are Canada’s market leader in energy solutions, renewables, lighting, wire & cable, automation and connected network solutions. We have access to the best partners in the industry and we go above and beyond to help our customers and partners grow.
 To learn more about Westburne, please visit us at LifeHere.westburne.ca and westburne.ca


 What You Will Do With Us
 As the Divisional Sales Solutions Analyst based in Calgary, you will be responsible for creating all reporting required to manage the Company’s sales strategies. In addition, you will support the Sales Team in areas such as database management, data analytics and modeling as well as generate predictive and proactive analytical data to be utilized within Salesforce on a customer by customer basis.
 In this position, you will

Provide regular reports to the General Manager and Sales Managers to encourage the implementation of action plans as determined to be necessary
Create new reports as required to assist sales representatives and management to monitor existing sales and future opportunities
Work closely with the Sales Performance Solutions Group to create and maintain specific KPI’s to highlight the measurement of sales success within the banner
Analyse historical data by customer and populate customer profiles in Salesforce
Revise existing and create new dashboards within BI Sales and Pricing
Execute strategies and participate in special projects as requested by the General Manager
Identify continuous improvement opportunities and other responsibilities as outlined.

Who Are You

You have a College diploma or university degree in business and/or statistics
You have 3-5 years of related experience in data management/analytics role
You have advanced Excel and MS Office skills
You have demonstrated your ability using mathematical models to solve business challenges
You have experience with AS/400, Business Intelligence, Business Analytics and/or product knowledge
You are able to write reports\correspondence at a high level for management review.
You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and are able to effectively communicate at all levels up to senior management.

What We Offer

Our employees enjoy a positive work-life balance while thriving in an environment that is ever-changing and motivated by new and exciting challenges.
We offer competitive compensation, a series of benefit options and pension packages, and the opportunity for success and growth across the organization.
Westburne provides equal employment opportunities for all applicants. We encourage everyone to apply.

What Is Next

If this is the right position for you, click apply.
Westburne is an equal opportunity employer firmly committed to the Canadian marketplace.
We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
If you require any accommodation in the application process, please contact us with the “Need Help” button in Fitzii.

Title: Client Support Services Program Analyst
Description:
Position vacancy 
Closing date: July 01, 2022
 






       Employment Type
      

        Full Time
      






       Job ID
      

        1825
      






       Pay
      

        $45,500/year
      






       Effective
      

        Immediately
      






       Reports to
      

        Manager - Client Support Services Program
      






       Location / Region
      

        Due to Covid-19, this is currently a remote work position, eventually transitioning to working at 2200 Yonge Street YMCA, Toronto, ON
      






       Application Deadline
      

        July 01, 2022
      





Why Work for the Y?
 The YMCA of Greater Toronto aspires to be a great work place committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, where different backgrounds, experiences, and identities are appreciated and celebrated. Guided by our shared values — kindness, well-being, integrity, inclusiveness, respect, and optimism — the YMCA provides thousands of employees with meaningful jobs and the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of individuals and the health of our communities. We recognize the contributions of our staff through innovative practices, great benefits, and growth opportunities.


Nature and scope
 The YMCA of Greater Toronto, a leader in coordination of national and provincial programs, acts as the National Coordinator for the National GAR Case Management - Client Support Services Program (CSS). The objectives of the CSS program are to provide resettlement services to more than 5,200 Government-assisted refugees (GARs) through an empowerment-oriented case management and community capacity building model of service delivery, while engaged in continuous quality improvement initiatives. The YMCA as the National Coordinator provides both indirect/direct services to GAR clients through a collaborative network. The key coordination activities include: National administration, database management and reporting, communication and information sharing and program delivery, support and training.


 The Client Support Services Program Analyst reports to the CSS Manager and partners with YMCA IT Support in ensuring the nation-wide program database is efficiently and effectively evaluated and developed to track program outcomes. The position is responsible for providing technical support and training to program sites and as well, contributes to the National reporting requirements through systematic gathering, analyzing and reporting of data. The Applications Support Analyst promotes the YMCA programs to the community and organizations in order to market the programs to those in position to assist the Association in achieving Strategic Outcomes. Additional program administrative tasks are also the responsibility of this position.
Responsibilities

Provide advanced management, support and analysis for nation-wide customized database system (Effort to Outcomes- ETO) with local sites.
Coordinates with National Programs Manager (CSS) and YMCA IT Support team to implement/update the database/reporting plan in consultation with the CSS program sites in order to identify national program requirements, key settlement performance indicators/outcomes and successfully translate them into an efficient software model.
Identifies software application adjustments and develops new customized tracking and reporting Systems.
Identify reports in regards to the program outputs as requested by various stakeholders.
Monitors and collects ETO user requests for further customization.
Prepares monthly/quarterly and annual statistical reports of each program site and comparative analysis nationally; identifying and analyzing trends and progress of the CSS program.
Coordinates with National Programs Manager (CSS) and YMCA IT Support team to implement new data system features and evaluation tools that can be used to measure program impact at the individual, community and national level.
Ensures quality standards of data integrity are in place; provides monthly data integrity reports to senior managers in each program delivery site.
Provides first level technical support to the program sites; tracking relevant system issues and required actions/follow-ups.
Coordinates both online and in-person ETO software training with CSS program staff /managers as required/ iCARE upload training; provides expert advice and support to all sites; ensuring updates are made to ETO User’s Manual and FAQs.
Participates in advanced ETO software training and workshops; liaises with YMCA IT support team as required.
Effectivelytrouble-shootsandproblem-solvesissuesastheyariseandkeepstheCSSManager informed.
Demonstrates appropriate behaviours in line with our Mission, Vision and Values as reflected in our YMCA competencies; takes a member focused approach to increase their understanding of programs offered across the Association.Represents the YMCA and the Association in a professional manner.
Understands the legal responsibilities and moral imperative to report suspected child abuse to Child Protection Services.
Understands the importance of the volunteer staff partnership and integrates the value of philanthropy and volunteerism in dealings with members, volunteers, donors and staff.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

University Degree preferred or completion of Community College Diploma in Information Technology, Research, Statistics, Community Development or related field
Minimum two - three years of related work experience
Solid experience and understanding of data systems and reporting application software
Demonstrated knowledge with evaluation/research design, data collection and both qualitative and quantitative data analysis
Knowledge of webi, API, SQL would be considered an asset
Knowledge and/experience of Salesforce is an asset
Must possess advanced computer skills (Excel & Access)
Experience with webinar/tele-conferencing tools, html and other web-based applications
Excellent time management skills, attention to detail, capacity to prioritize by assessing situations to determine urgency, ability to develop a work schedule, set goals, implement action plans and monitor progress
Able to facilitate groups and function in a diverse team environment
Well-developed interpersonal, and relationship building skills; ability to establish rapport and excellent communication with members, staff and volunteers
Excellent written communication skills
Commitment to respecting diversity and demonstrating inclusive behaviour, responding with sensitivity and self-awareness to the unique needs of colleagues and members, including visible and non-visible dimensions of diversity
Communicates in a thorough, clear and timely manner and supports information sharing and goal achievement across the Association
The position requires the following Core Association Competencies: advanced competence in: Effective Interpersonal Communications; Ethics and Self-management; Being Results Focused; Teamwork and Collaboration; Valuing Diversity and Social Inclusion; fundamental competence in: Being Member Focused and Relationship Building and Partnering;

Job offers are contingent upon the successful completion of a Police Records Check. Within the first four months and every three years thereafter, a Vulnerable Police Records Check is required. 
If you are hired, prior to your start date and as a condition of your employment, you will be required to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have a valid medical or other Human Rights Code-related exemption.

The YMCA of Greater Toronto values the diversity of people and communities and is committed to excellence and inclusion in our Association. We are committed to an environment that is barrier free. If you require accommodation at any stage during the hiring process, please inform us in advance to arrange reasonable and appropriate accommodation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst


 Location: This position can be located in Winnipeg or Toronto.


 Application Deadline: July 30, 2022


 Our organization:

 Founded in 2017, Wellington-Altus Financial Inc. (Wellington-Altus) is the parent company to Wellington-Altus Private Counsel and Wellington-Altus Private Wealth —the top-rated* wealth advisory company in Canada and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies. With more than $20 billion in assets under administration and offices across the country, Wellington-Altus identifies with successful, entrepreneurial advisors and portfolio managers, and their high-net-worth clients.

Investment Executive 2021 Brokerage Report Card



 The opportunity:


 Reporting to the Vice-President, Data Architecture, the Senior Data Analyst will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualization. Additionally, the incumbent will be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-driven reports for continued innovation and growth.

 Key responsibilities include:



Overseeing the development and use of data systems by identifying and developing efficient ways to organize data store, and analyze data, while also paying attention to security and confidentiality. 
Planning, managing, and leading the delivery of detailed system requirements and technical / functional specifications in alignment with standards and frameworks. 
Providing technical leadership and working in close partnership with business partners / technology / project teams and stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications. 
Developing, implementing, and maintaining complicated problems and building simple frameworks. 
Identifying trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets. 
Evaluating organizational methods and providing source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for data sets. 
Creating best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization. 
Evaluating internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, developing and maintaining protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data. 
Working directly with management and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships. 
Capturing and converting business requirements into consumable artifacts & information to be used by the data engineer and quality analysis team to support project & support requests. 
   
Working closely with project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers. 
Proactively analyzing data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity. 
Creating and maintaining rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources. 
Defining and implementing data acquisition and integration logic, selecting appropriate combination of methods and tools within defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution. 
Developing and maintaining databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and building scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets. 

Performing other duties as assigned.



 The ideal candidate will possess:



An undergraduate degree in computer science, economics, or statistics or equivalent combination of appropriate experience.
7 years' experience leading and managing a data analytical team.
7+ years' experience mining data as a data analyst. 
7+ years' demonstrating proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization. 
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations. 
5-7 years' data analyst experience in teams following Waterfall and/or Agile methodology. 
Experience working with data model designs. 
Experience executing end user testing in UAT.
Experience with Azure, AWS. Hadoop, Confluence, and Jira. 
A foundational understanding of SDLC and Agile delivery methodologies. 
Experience in business process and data mapping. 
Experience and comfort level acting as a subject matter expert and consultant. 
Experience working with external vendors. 
Excellent communication skills, including group facilitation and presentation skills. 
Strong SQL skills, data mining experience, working on a cloud platform, MS Office expertise. 
An ability to work with a data cloud team and to converse requirements/use cases to each member. 
An understanding of data modelling and design, with the ability to translate requirements to existing and/or new data models.  
An ability to validate and test on behalf of the end user any data deliverable to ensure requirements were met.
Prior experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques is an asset. 
Experience working within the financial services industry; wealth management and/or Institutional services is an asset. 
Strong programming experience with frameworks including XML, Javascript, and ETL languages is an asset. 
Practical experience in statistical analysis using statistical packages including Excel, SAS, R in an asset. 
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment is an asset.



 Conditions of employment:



Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
A background check, satisfactory to the employer, may be required of the successful applicant prior to commencing employment.



 Wellington-Altus is strongly committed to equity and diversity within its community and welcomes applications from women, racialized persons, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and genders. All qualified individuals who would contribute to the further diversification of our organization are encouraged to apply.


 If you require accommodation for the recruitment process, please let us know at the point of application.

 Click the Apply For This Job button to submit your resume, cover letter and salary expectations. You will be contacted if you are selected for an interview. More information about working at Wellington-Altus can be found on our website at www.wellington-altus.com.

Title: Contact Center Business Analyst
Description:
Contact Center Business Analyst

 People Management: No
 Travel Required: Occasional
 Location: Markham, Ontario

 Join our Team:

 DecisivEdge is a Company of talented consultants dedicated to identifying and addressing our Customers’ most pressing opportunities. We have offices in three geographies, Newark, Delaware, United States; Markham, Ontario, Canada; and Magarpatta, Pune, India. Our capabilities include operations consulting, application development, data management, analytics and business intelligence, which we leverage to enable digital transformation in financial services and healthcare. Our Company has developed and commercialized several solutions in a variety of industries including financial services, healthcare, and marine management.

 We are looking to hire a Contact Center Business Analyst to join our growing CX Transformation team. In this role, you will work as part of a team that helps lead initiatives and projects towards deployment and success.

 This role is based in our Markham, Ontario office on sunny, green Allstate Parkway. We are conveniently located near Highway 404, with a direct connection to the Don Valley Parkway (DVP). The communities of Richmond Hill, Aurora, Newmarket, Scarborough, and North Toronto are located very close to our offices. We are focused on team participation and commit to working a minimum of three days a week in the office and an option of two days a week from home.

 The Business Analyst will be part of a professional, friendly, and fun-loving team that prioritizes its corporate culture focused on four foundational core values:

Put Integrity First
Think “We” not “Me”
Be Passionate
Execute Flawlessly



 Who We Need:

 The Business Analyst will draw on past experience to curate well-articulated business requirements to lead our technical team to develop solutions for client needs.

 Responsibilities include eliciting business requirements from clients in an agile cadence within our sprint calendars to meet production release criteria. You will need to work effectively with all members of the project team to cohesively produce results that exceed client expectations.
 Success in this position is driven by your ability to understand the client’s current capabilities and business needs and coordinate the efforts of the Technical Team to design, execute and improve solutions to meet those needs.

 The overall success of the BA team is founded on the collective efforts of all members to work together to create seamless solutions, not only to meet the business need but to anticipate future requirements as our clients continue to grow.
 The successful candidate should be able to effectively leverage available tools, such as Microsoft Visio, Jira, and others, based on need.

 What You’ll Do:


 Lead requirements elicitation with client staff on assigned projects
Continue to build expertise within specified domains throughout project work
Build leadership skills as a subject matter expert on the project team



 What You’ll Need:


 A degree in business administration or communication
Strong technical understanding of multiple types of enterprise systems on various platforms like FIVE9 or any other Contact Center/telephony platform with the ability to understand and create process and system diagrams
Strong written and oral communication skills
Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities required
Ability to work individually as well as part of a collaborative team
Microsoft Office Suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)



 What We Offer:


 A competitive compensation package
Health, dental and vision coverage
Paid life insurance and long-term disability coverage
401k program with Company matching contributions
Hybrid work model
Empowered Company culture
Paid professional development
Recognition programs
Open-door policy
Diverse team makeup
Participation in Company-sponsored charitable causes

Title: Senior Group Risk Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Operational Risk Management (“ORM”) is accountable for the design and implementation of TDBG’s Operational Risk Management Framework, which sets out the Bank’s governance, policies, processes and practices for the identification, assessment, reporting, mitigation, and control of operational risk. ORM, as an independent team, works in partnership with the business units and corporate groups of TD Bank Group to further the understanding and management of operational risk across the enterprise.  Risk Marketplace is an operating model that features dedicated 1B resources who collaborate with Journey/ Platform teams and 2A Risk & Control Partners to provide real-time risk mitigation and guidance, ensuring risk and control objectives are met. Risk Marketplace is a strategic asset that strengthens TD's risk-taking capability, enabling excellence and early value realization while keeping the Bank safe.  The Risk Marketplace (RMP) is transforming how risk and control partners identify and manage risks in journeys and platforms. RMP 1Bs are at the core of the interaction model between the first line and the second line of defense



Job Description

The Senior Group Risk Analyst reports to the Senior Manager, Operational Risk Management aligned to the Transformation, Enablement and Customer Experience (TECE) business. This role is a second line of defense function responsible for providing operational risk management oversight and challenge to the EPDE Business and Innovations Project team, performing the Reporting & Analytics function. This is a unique opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment where new and innovative ways of digital banking and customer authentication are continually introduced. Provide a broad range of risk analysis, reporting, monitoring or support to business partner requests and acting as a specialist/expert in providing guidance on a range of risk related matters within assigned.  Accountabilities: Risk Marketplace Practice (RMP)

 As part of the ORM Risk Marketplace (RMP) team, support the transition to the Next Evolution of Work (NEW) which will include:
 Working with RMP 1B Teams for Journeys/Platforms to coach and support successful adoption of the RMP model
 Manage JIRA Risk Board, ensure applicable RMP documentation / processes are up to date
 Work with RMP 1B teams to support Journeys / Platforms
 Coach Lines of Business on the RMP model
 Assist with various RMP deliverables
 Support the DEF, L&D, EPMAG and Tooling Pods with work related to RMP
 Build and provide training to Journeys and Platforms on an ongoing basis
 Create documentation (standards, job aids, etc.) to support the implementation of the RMP Model
 Provide bi-weekly updates to the NEW Transformation executive on RMPs key achievements and updates
 Supporting the evolution of RMP Community of Interest for RMP 1Bs and 2As to collaborate, innovate and learn best practices
 Ensure the applicable RMP documents/ processes are up to date, including target operating models, playbooks and talent approaches
 Work with Journey/Platform RMP 1B Teams to support RMP readiness activities for NEW Journeys and Platforms
 Partner with RMP 1B and 2A Teams in identifying, reporting and mitigating RMP TOM issues and be the subject matter expert in the RMP TOM
 Own RMP tasks and see them through to completion. Also leverage Confluence and MS Teams for documentation updates and knowledge sharing.
 Establish relationships and interface with Risk Partners and 1B in the execution of tasks for RMP.




Job Requirements

    Reporting
    
 Lead the production of key reports, dashboards and presentations (e.g. Risk and Compliance Committee, TECE ORM team reporting etc.) on overall business trends, operational risks, losses, and issues on an aggregated basis and recommending management action to minimize risk exposures where appropriate.
 Partner with Innovation, Technology & Shared Services businesses to provide effective challenge while coordinating the creation of the reports required for the Monthly TECE Risk and Compliance Committee meeting, and Sub-Committee meetings. Manage submissions / content, lead prep meetings and track action items.
 Educating and communicating with business partners with respect to operational and enterprise risk management policy and program requirements
 Challenging the business on the effectiveness of their execution methods and outputs with respect to ORM programs
 Building and maintaining strong relationships with key internal and external partners including first line business management as well as business partners in support and control functions.
 Assist with the identification, measurement, management, and escalation of Operational Risk exposures within TECE businesses and on projects.
 Protect TD Bank's interests by keeping abreast of business trends, risk management issues, and by maintaining a good knowledge of existing and emerging risk issues across the business
 As the second line of defense, provide effective oversight and challenge for the Enterprise Project Delivery Excellence (EPDE) business ensuring adherence to ORM Framework policies and program requirements.
 Participate in key EPDE business initiatives and projects to provide effective challenge over the identification, assessment, escalation and mitigation of key operational risks.
 Keep abreast of emerging issues, trends and evolving regulatory requirements which would have impact to the EPDE business.
 Conduct meaningful analysis at the functional or enterprise level using results to draw conclusions, make recommendations, assess the effectiveness of programs/ policies/ practices
 Monitor service, productivity and assess efficiency levels within own function and implement continuous process / performance improvements where opportunities exists.
 Job Requirements
    
 Prior experience with TECE business, ORM, risk and control functions, reporting / analytics functions or audit is an asset.
 Prior experience with Risk Marketplace and Next Evolution of Work processes, and the use of associated tools such as Confluence and JIRA.
 Excellent reporting and analytical skills with the ability to synthesize information into key messages for executive reporting and communications.
 Applies best practices to implement process, product or service improvements
 Acts as a subject matter expert within their own area of specialty or a resource for others
 Leads projects of moderately to complex risk and resource requirements; may lead end-to-end processes or functional programs
 Organizational awareness and demonstrated relationship building skills, with a superior ability to make things happen through the use of positive influence.
 Strong organization skills, with the ability to work in a fast paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and priorities.
 Skillful communication (written and verbal), negotiation and conflict management skills.
 Proven ability to distill and communicate complex information
 Ability to manage processes, identify and recommend process improvements and / or automation opportunities to enhance the productivity and operational efficiency of the team
 Highly developed critical thinking, data analytics and problem solving skills
 Strong interpersonal skills including demonstrated influencing, conflict management and negotiation skills
 Ability to thrive within an environment with a high level of ambiguity.
 Proven self-starter with the ability to work independently




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Senior IT Business Analyst - Regular Full-Time
Description:
Senior IT Business Analyst – Regular Full-Time  Play a critical role delivering solutions in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment! 
The District of Squamish is seeking a Senior IT Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will  maintain, support, and build on the District’s growing array of business applications. As a Senior IT Business Analyst, you  will play a key role in driving positive change by implementing new technology and communicating effectively with all  areas and levels of the organization. This position works closely with Districts departments to assess the current  practices, processes and systems and to assist in determining and implementing technology solutions to business  problems. 
In this role you will bring your superior analytical skills and excellent communication skills to support a variety of  activities including: 

Researching detailed, multi-layered business problems, identifying cause and effect, and generating a range of realistic 
and practical solutions. 
   
Eliciting, analyzing, validating, and documenting requirements; using expert knowledge to ensure the appropriate 
methods are used; ensuring that the requirements gathered meet the business objectives, satisfy organizational goals 
    and follow best management practices. 
   
Mentoring and providing leadership for other members of the Business Applications team 


Leading and facilitating sessions across departments at all levels for the purpose of effectively scoping and assessing 
the impact of proposed changes to business processes, systems, equipment, infrastructure and the organization. 
   
And much more! 

What we’re looking for: Our ideal candidate will have at least four years of directly related experience along with  completion of a Bachelor’s degree in computer sciences or a related field, or at least six years experience along with a  two-year accredited technical diploma program. Ideally you also possess a Professional Business Analyst Certification or  are a Certified Associate in Project Management. 
Who we are: The District of Squamish is a progressive and growing community. Our friendly, small-town setting,  spectacular natural environment, thriving arts, culture and heritage scene and world-class recreational opportunities  offer an incredible live-work-play lifestyle that few places can beat. 
We are a team of fun-loving yet highly dedicated and hardworking professionals who are committed to continuous 
learning, improvement, and excellence in service to our citizens - and so is our ideal candidate. 
Think you would be the perfect fit? Then come and Deliver Outstanding Service at the District of Squamish!  The hourly rate for this position is $42.55 plus comprehensive benefits, paid vacation and one of Canada’s top pension  plans – the Municipal Pension Plan.   We offer a compressed work week which allows for an earned day off every second week as well as a flexible in-office  or remote work schedule. 
Scroll down to view the complete job advertisement! 
Please submit your cover letter and resume quoting competition #22-89 to: 
Human Resources 
District of Squamish 
37955 Second Avenue, P.O. Box 310, Squamish, BC V8B 0A3 
E-mail: jobs@squamish.ca 

Application deadline: Open until filled. 





 External Job Posting 
Position: Senior Business Analyst (2 positions) 
Status: Regular Full-Time 
Work Area: IT 
Posting Date: June 16, 2022 
Closing Date: Until position filled. 

GENERAL SUMMARY 

Under the general supervision of the Manager of Business Applications, the Senior Business Analyst works closely with 
District departments to assess current practices, processes, and systems and helps to determine and implement 
technology solutions to business problems. This position leads multifaceted programs and projects covering multiple 
departments and stakeholders to ensure business solutions meet organizational and operational goals and objectives. The 
Senior Business Analyst plays a key role in driving positive change by implementing new technology and communicating 
effectively with all areas and levels of the organization. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

Customer Service 

Contributes to the success of our team and creation of our community, by fostering the District of Squamish corporate 
values in their work: thinking beyond today, working together, acting with courage and enthusiasm, doing the right 
    thing, and striving to do better every day. 
   
Follows the District of Squamish’s Customer Service Guidelines to ensure the Delivery of Outstanding Service. 

 Project Management and Technical Duties: 


Elicits, analyzes, validates, and documents requirements; uses expert knowledge to ensure the appropriate methods 
are used; ensures that the requirements gathered meet the business objectives, satisfy organizational goals and follow 
    best management practices. 
   
Provides expert level analytical and business function support for critical departmental initiatives including system 
work flows and consolidations, significant business area(s) process improvement projects, and new 
    product/equipment initiatives. 
   
Acts as project manager for business solution projects, applying project management principles through all stages of 
the project. 
   
Uses tact and diplomacy to negotiate and motivate vendors, staff at all levels and senior Managers using appropriate 
communication methods and achieves support even under difficult conditions; resolves conflicting positions and 
    facilitate agreements which satisfy all parties. 
   
Conducts sustained analysis of technology changes on cross organizational business processes and existing 
technologies. 
   
Researches detailed, multi-layered business problems, identifies cause and effect, and generates a range of realistic 
and practical solutions. 
   
Leads the training and system testing for business unit leads and end users of the systems. 


Leads and facilitates sessions across departments at all levels for the purpose of effectively scoping and assessing the 
impact of proposed changes to business processes, systems, equipment, infrastructure and the organization. 
   
Prepares and delivers reports that address risks and opportunities, cost-benefit, and return on investment analyses. 


Presents business and technical solutions clearly and effectively; adapts communication and engagement styles 
appropriate to audience and situation; effectively translates technical concepts into layman's terms. Builds, sustains, 
    and leverages relationships and networks with internal clients, external organizations and vendors. 
   
Mentors and provides leadership for other members of the Business Applications team 


Develops work procedures and standards. 


Performs other related duties as required. 











REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES 




Superior analytical skills, including the ability to comprehend complex issues and related data and present information 
in concise meaningful ways 
   
Demonstrated knowledge of accounting principles, practices and procedures, financial systems and accounting 
operations 
   
Advanced skill in identifying, analyzing and recommending solutions to problems, including business process mapping 


Advanced skill in using spreadsheets and enterprise database applications 


Understands and identifies business implications of data system designs and the data requirements of user needs 


Understands business analysis methodologies to gather and analyze data and develop recommendations for moving 
forward 
   
Advanced skills in the use of report writers and data extraction tools 


Advanced ability to work with complex data sets from various sources and in a variety of formats, and to analyze and 
interpret statistical and transactional data 
   
Excellent communication (verbal and written), interpersonal and customer service skills 


Ability to liaise effectively with Management, external agencies and software providers on data management, system 
design, and statistical issues 
   
Ability to work in a confidential environment and convey information in a diplomatic manner, respecting the policies 
and practices to protect personal information 
   
REQUIRED TRAINING, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE 

Bondable 


Able to obtain and maintain an RCMP Enhanced Security Clearance 


Grade 12 or equivalent 


Valid BC Class 5 Driver’s License with a safe driving record 


Six (6) years directly related experience 

AND 

Completion of a two-year accredited technical diploma program in computer sciences or a related field including 
network and communication systems courses 
   AND 
Certified Associate in Project Management or Professional Business Analyst Certification. 
OR 

Bachelor’s degree in a directly related field from a recognized institution plus 4 years directly related experience 

OR 

An equivalent combination of education, training and experience 

Disclaimer: 
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people
