Title: Inventory Material Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Product Data Management Manager, the Inventory Material Analyst is responsible for providing information and analytics to Operations Management to improve inventory accuracy and help Operations Managers achieve targeted inventory turns at each Brandt Industries manufacturing facility. This position will act as a central hub that will setup and communicate standard inventory management practices across all manufacturing facilities and work collaboratively with operational departments to ensure inventory and materials strategies are optimized.
 Duties & Responsibilities

Development and adherence to standard inventory management practices among manufacturing operations.
Work with purchasing to setup required fields in item data that effect MPS (lead time, order interval, order multiple, MOQ).
Work with Ops Managers, IMMs and other applicable manufacturing departments to evaluate sales and MPS to establish and monitor safety stock logic for select inventory items as well as ensure PIT demand is triggered in a timely manner when inventory levels fall below minimum.
Review safety stock items regularly and refresh the list as required.
Identify slow-moving inventory and recommend actions in consultation with Ops, Sales and Engineering management.
Facilitate proper disposition of material when Engineering changes occur. This role will be a permanent member of the change review board (CRB).
In conjunction with the CRB, facilitate proper disposition of end of life/model change.
Manage non-current Wholegoods and part numbers as well as obsolescence due to end of life or discontinuation.
Ensure minimum order quantities (MOQs) are accurate.
Create and track inventory performance indicators like inventory turns (or days of supply) and support IMMs with tools to manage inventory accuracy, dock to stock times, etc.
Facilitate the creation of material plans for MPS items.


 Required Skills
 
 Required Experience
 

At least 5 years working experience in a manufacturing environment.
Relevant post-secondary education in Engineering, Business (MBA or CPA advantageous) or professional training in SCMP or CPIM.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Experience working with a variety of inventory management practices and principles (Min/Max, Kanban, Safety Stock, Lead Time, Kitting, etc.).
Experience in MRP systems and proficient with MS Office tools especially EXCEL.

Title: Technical Analyst
Description:
Position Description:

   We offer the opportunity to work with Canada’s largest Information Technology Outsourcing and Management Consulting Company with a true global presence in a fast-paced and energetic atmosphere where your personal and professional growth is accelerated by your desire and sense of commitment. CGI’s continuous growth is a testament to the confidence clients place in them and to the dedication of their professionals. At CGI, all employees are called members because they feel a powerful sense of ownership and accountability. Members at CGI are building their own company – in 100+ offices worldwide. CGI has the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for clients – and for members; that’s why an astounding 90 percent of them are CGI shareholders.
    We're expanding in Atlantic Canada and we need your skills, enthusiasm, and dedication as part of our team.
   
 Position Summary:
    The Technical Analyst participates in all phases of the development life cycle in support of the development team. The analyst needs to have a strong understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle and is engaged in planning, defining, documenting and implementing the proposed system changes and enhancements. Analysts are responsible for gathering and documenting detailed system requirements in collaboration with the business and business analysts. This involves mapping changes to the database, mapping extracts from the database, participating in design discussions with the Solution Architects and supporting the Quality Assurance analysts during the testing phase. Strong communication skills enable the analysts to work across all layers of the organization including Architects, Developers, QA Testers, Project Management and the business. 
    The Technical Analyst is often also required to carry database designs for systems impacted by new or changing business requirements. This requires documentation of logical and physical data models, source to target data mappings along with transformation logic. Technical Analysts will also be involved in report design and documentation utilizing UML methodology. They will also be responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing database mapping templates and their policies and procedures.
   
 Job Duties and Responsibilities:
   

Works in a collaborative manner with the Business Account Manager (BAM) from a Business Requirements Document, develops and documents 
a detailed statement of requirements for the proposed solution in the Technical Requirements Document. 
   

Performs preliminary analysis of functional requirements to identify data, process and application changes or defect fixes. Assists clients in developing correction strategies. 
Defines and documents interfaces of manual to automated operations within application subsystems, to external systems, and between new and existing systems. 
Create and document data profiles to drive data modeling and source to target mappings 
Create and maintain data mappings, transformation logic (for logical and physical models) to support implementation and ongoing maintenance of the 
operational data stores and warehouses. 
   

Ensure data models evolve to meet new and changing business needs. 
Possesses SQL and PL/SQL skills with an excellent understanding of the Oracle database environment and data warehouse design and modeling concepts.
Has knowledge of database relationships and table design to support modeling approach and standards compliance. 
Provides detailed analysis on all new data model and ETL development requests to ensure the solution is developed in an efficient manner and works 
properly with other applications within the system.
   

Works with developers and quality assurance testers to ensure that there is a complete understanding of the Technical Requirements Document.
Supports Defect Management process, using a defect triage approach, for both integration and UAT; 
Provides regular project status updates. 
Possesses excellent oral and written communication skills and works well in team environment.

 Required Level of Education: 
   

Technical Diploma in IT with Equivalent Experience 
Oracle SQL/PLSQL Certification (Optional) 
5+ years of IT experience as a minimum

 Technical skills:
   

Very good knowledge of consulting practices and systems development (SDLC). Proficient in Waterfall and Agile SDLC methodologies
Ability to develop detailed documentation of impact and changes to systems 
Ability to operate within an Oracle environment – SQL essential, to perform SQL queries on databases for data analysis purposes
Ability to map business requirements to technical requirements carefully detailing the before and after states of the system resulting from the change.
Must be able to understand the insurance, managed care business in order to intelligently interact with others. 
Working knowledge in the following areas:
ETL and Data Quality, 
Toad or SQL Developer
SVN or other Configuration management tools
MS Excel, Visio and PowerPoint
Oracle 11g, SQL Server, MS Access, ERwin, ER/Studio, or similar tool
Cognos or similar reporting tool
SQL , PL/SQL, XML
Experience with highly normalized and star schema database approaches

 Nice to Have:
   

Oracle Certification would be an asset
Experience with Health Insurance 
Experience in supporting various standard EDI transactions
Ensuring EDI interfaces are performing as designed
Collaborating with payer, clearinghouses and/or trading partners 
Solving EDI incidents/problems and actively managing and communicating issues
Knowledge of end-to-end EDI processes with proven hands-on experience
In depth knowledge of Other HIPAA/EDI X12 4010/5010 healthcare-related file formats 
General understanding of the file transfer protocol (FTP) process and SQL
Experience in SOAP UI
Working on Source to Target mapping on EDI loops and elements. 
Knowledge in TIBCO Job process and various TIBCO services.

 Soft Skills:
   

Strong written and oral communication skills
Effective status reporting 
Critical eye for detail
Positive attitude
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work as a team
Ability to see the big picture (thinking out of the box)
Able to multitask effectively
Have excellent time management, task planning and prioritization skills
Able to adapt quickly to changing client requirements
Able to work effectively with minimal supervision
Enjoy working in a self-teaching, learning organization
Ability to build strong relationships with clients and team members 




Skills:

ETL
 Requirements Analysis



What you can expect from us:
Insights you can act on  While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.   When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today — one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.  At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.   Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI — where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Title: TML Data Analyst
Description:
Acuren is a trusted, single source provider of technology-enabled asset protection solutions used to evaluate the structural integrity of critical energy, industrial and public infrastructures. Committed to delivering a Higher Level of Reliability, Acuren provides an unrivaled spectrum of capabilities including inspection, traditional and advanced NDE/NDT, failure analysis, rope access, materials engineering, reliability engineering and condition based monitoring services.
 Our work is critical to the integrity and safety of industrial firms, including petroleum refinery, pipeline, power generation, pulp & paper, mining, pharmaceutical, aerospace and automotive industries. Acuren employs over 4,500 dedicated professionals supporting the mechanical integrity and inspection programs of the world’s largest industrial segments.
 Acuren is a market leader. Our formula for success is straightforward: be capable locally, with certified and well-equipped personnel supported by trained, experienced leaders. Continuing to build on a strong heritage of safety, quality and professionalism, Acuren strives to maintain incident free work environments, pursues advanced technical developments, and supports reliability programs that are valued by clients and employees. Acuren is a part of Rockwood Service Corporation, together with Hellier and Tacten.
 Acuren is currently recruiting for Visual Inspector for to support projects in the Prairies Region. If you are seeking a dynamic industrial environment with opportunities for individual growth and learning, this is for you.
 Position Information

 Rotational scheduled: 7/7 rotation
 FIFO from Alberta Hubs

 Position Requirements

 Experience with Visions Software and and NDE background
 EIT or P.Eng. considered an asset
 CWB 2 considered an asset
 API 570 considered an asset
 Strong work ethics
 Ability to maintain positive working relations with clients
 Exceptional safety and quality awareness
 Ability to solve problems and manage time effectively
 Self-motivated and capable of working at a high technical and performance level
 Valid driver's license
 IRATA training or willingness to obtain is an asset

 We Support an Equal Opportunity Workplace
 Consideration for employment is based upon capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as established by law. Applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada; work permits may be applied for in the case of appropriately qualified applicants.
 Other
 Prospective employees must be able to perform all tasks as detailed on the complete Physical Job Description, be Fit for Duty at all times and be able to comply with the Canadian Model for Providing a Safe Workplace which includes alcohol and drug testing.
 The strength of Acuren lies in its’ outstanding people. As a rapidly growing, intensely innovative, international privately held company, the opportunities to pursue challenging and diverse career development paths are vast. Complemented by an attractive and comprehensive total compensation package and a commitment to the principles of a respectful workplace, Acuren offers tremendous opportunities to those who wish to succeed.
 Next steps
 If you are interested in this employment opportunity, please apply in confidence through Acuren's online application process with copies of your certifications at www.acuren.com.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Location: Edmonton / Calgary / Central or Western Canada
Our Company
Willowglen Systems is an innovative company delivering industrial automation solutions for the last 50 years. Our products are developed and supported by our team of developers, data scientists, mathematicians, and engineers. Willowglen Systems has a global customer base and is chiefly involved in the metro-rail, oil and gas, pipelines, electricity distribution, and water distribution sectors – in locations including North America, South America, Asia, and the Middle East.
At Willowglen Systems, we pride ourselves on our innovative solutions and the meaningful impact we have on mission-critical industries.
About the Role
Does the idea of working on new technology, including Machine Learning and IoT excite you? Do you want to make a positive impact on the world with the work you do? If so, this opportunity may be perfect for you. 
Willowglen Systems is looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our talented team. We seek candidates with a range of experience from intermediate to senior. The Business Analyst will act as the interface between clients, project managers and project teams. The incumbent will also be involved in exciting projects and new product development opportunities using Machine Learning, Agile development, data analytics, big data, and Industrial IoT that are currently underway.

Identify problem or opportunity and contribute in business case development/quotation
Business analysis planning and developing configuration specifications for projects
Conduct stakeholder analysis and manage them
Perform requirements elicitation and analysis
Identify, analyze and manage solution risks

Business Analysis Certification (CBAP/PMI-PBA)
5 years’ experience

Exceptional communication skills (verbal, written, and listening)

Title: EDI business analyst
Analyst, Business Analytics
Description:
Seeing beyond numbersº At Laurentian Bank, we believe we can change banking for the better. Founded in Montreal in 1846, Laurentian Bank helps families, businesses and communities thrive. Today, we have over 2,800 employees working together as One Team, to provide a broad range of financial services and advice-based solutions for customers across Canada and the United States. We drive results by placing our customers first, making the better choice, acting courageously, and believing everyone belongs. This role sits within Laurentian Bank, a subsidiary of Laurentian Bank Financial Group. The incumbent will be responsible for creating and developing business analytics solutions, helping to implement BI tools and develop best practices in analysis and dashboards for the various business units, as well as produce various analyses for several projects.









 Responsibilities :








 º Define the required information and intelligence business needs with the end users to create reports and dashboards. º Set up reports and dashboards based on the needs identified by the end users. º Perform analyses on data sets to submit findings and recommendations to the direct manager. º Take charge of potential improvements to the various analytical tools. º Act as a change agent with the business lines for the analytical tools. º Ensure the integrity of our business line data. º Collaborate with the IT team on optimization projects for our BI tools and data sources. º Optimize all reports and dashboards to produce them more efficiently and reduce the number to be produced. º Follow best practices in dashboard design and content. º Suggest potential improvements to the data capture process so as to increase efficiency. º Actively participate in implementing potential improvements related to his/her business area. º Perform any other related tasks.









 Qualifications :








 º University degree in business, with a focus on business intelligence or finance, accounting or economics or actuarial science º Two to three years of relevant experience related to the role º Good knowledge of data visualization tools (Tableau, an asset) º Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) º CRM knowledge, an asset º Resourceful, with strong analytical skills, research and analysis skills º Demonstrated interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills º Self-motivated, self-starter who can work with minimal supervision º Bilingual (English/French) verbal and written communication skills required º A professional and ethical demeanour









 Additional Information :








 Equity, Diversity & Inclusion We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible work environment that reflects the diversity of our customers and our communities. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including Indigenous people, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability or any other legally-protected ground. Title: Business Analyst
Description:
BUSINESS ANALYST


Location: Saint John, NB


Are you curious about how technology and processes drive business and innovation? You don’t need to have a technical background to grow into the IT world. If you are motivated by connecting with others and leading change this is an opportunity to spread your wings in a new, diverse, and critical position within a fast-paced environment. To be successful you will need to live and breathe detail. Organization is your middle name and no one can lead a meeting as effectively as you. We are seeking aptitude and passion to learn, grow and contribute.


A day in the life includes eliciting and documenting the needs of stakeholders—which frequently involves investigating and clarifying their expressed desires—to determine underlying business requirements.


 Business Analysts are key members of a team that enables change within JDI by defining needs, determining solutions and delivering value to stakeholders while also considering the potential implications of technology in the current business environment.


Your Focus:



Supporting JDI Corporate Human Resources Department to achieve their business goals by leveraging technology
Understanding key business data and quality
Performing requirements elicitation & documentation
Building use cases (definition and development) and developing test cases
Documenting business processes
Understanding capability of analytics tools and enabling business to act from analytical insight
Managing integrity, confidentiality, and security of all datasets
Understanding the risk tolerance/profile of the business
Collaborating with design and architecture
Translating business process model to technical realization




You Have:



A University Degree in a related discipline
3 years’ work experience in a business environment, preferably IT
Experienced in Microsoft Technologies; particularly in Office 365




You Are:



Customer focused: motivated by inspiring others to do things differently
Technically inclined, process oriented and driven by a natural curiosity
Happy in an environment where you can work independently as well as collaboratively
A continuous learner: acquiring new skills and software applications is second nature
At home in a fast-paced work environment where solutions are not always clearly defined
A practiced communicator with strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
Organized, analytical and business savvy




Extras:



Oracle Human Capital Management (HCM) or other Human Resource solutions
Business Process Modeling
Entry Certification in Business Analysis (ECBA)
Lean Six Sigma Methodologies
Agile methodology for project management




JDI IT: Who we are and what we offer


At JDI IT, the belief that what people experience matters more than technology is part of our foundational core.


With over 300 employees, we offer the opportunity to create real value by helping people and businesses work smarter. JDI IT supports the entire J.D. Irving Limited group of companies which means we offer opportunities and experiences across a wide breadth of IT areas, businesses and industries. From forestry, to transportation, to shipbuilding, we are working directly with our business counterparts to align their strategies to continued advancements in IT. As a member of the JDI IT team, you will be a key player in enabling the business to win by overcoming obstacles and “getting it done”!


We believe in the power of diverse teams and invest in continuous professional growth. We are seeking naturally curious change makers looking to join a collaborative and motivated team. Come help JDI IT Raise the Bar!


We appreciate your interest in our company! Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


To learn more about our products and services, click here.


J.D. Irving, Limited is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

Title: Database Analyst 2
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Position Type: Full Time
 Department: Information Technology - IT Solutions Delivery
 Work Location: 1 Robert Speck Parkway, Mississauga,ON
 Work Hours: Days
 Job Level: 15
 Travel: No
 Posting Expires: 2022/07/07

 About Symcor
 Symcor enables secure data exchanges and supporting business processes, to help clients succeed in an evolving digital world. Trusted by Canada's largest institutions for over 25 years to support their digital transformations, Symcor aligns industry participants to solve common challenges in the most effective and efficient way.
 For more information, visit www.symcor.ca.
 The Opportunity
 Database Analyst 2 (DBA) will implement database solutions for Symcor. The individual will be part of the DBA team and have experience with database design, modeling, and performance tuning to provide guidance on design, configuration and deployment of Symcor databases based on the requirements of clients and application teams in alignment with industry best practices. The DBA will also ensure that database solutions meet requirements for availability, performance, scalability, disaster recovery, data integrity and security
 This role is Hybrid
 About The Role

 Install, build, configure and deploy database solutions based on technical and business requirements
 Provide database support and technical assistance to diagnose and resolve issues
 Maintain and monitor database performance, integrity, security and resolve issues
 Schedule and perform database backup and recovery activities
 Perform regular health checks of the databases, maintenance and troubleshooting
 Participate and/or lead the design and development of database systems
 Install, create and configure databases and database infrastructure
 Support projects to ensure successful completion of development and testing activities
 Provide feedback and act as SME on database components of application design
 Database capacity planning
 Execute Disaster Recovery plans
 Maintain database polices for deployment, development, security and best practices
 Participate in security audits
 In collaboration with the Infrastructure teams, install and create databases based on the application design requirements to ensure successful completion of development and testing activities and production environment. Deploy database changes to the environment as required to ensure testing teams can test for application defects.



 What You Need To Succeed
 Education:

 Completion of a post-secondary college diploma or university degree in a related discipline or a combination of education, training and experience deemed to be equivalent.

 Experience:

 3+ years experience in a database administration role
 Experience building and managing secured, highly available database solutions on Azure
 Experience in design and implementation of database solutions

 Skills:

 Knowledge of database queries
 Knowledge of database theory
 Knowledge of database design

 What’s In It For You
 At Symcor, we define our success by what we help others achieve. We were created to support our clients and, through our products, services, and solutions, protect their brands and help them meet their business needs. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program that includes a competitive compensation package, flexible benefits and time away options, retirement and savings plans and a commitment to your overall health and well-being through our myWell-being program.
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
 Opportunities to do challenging work and progressively take on greater accountabilities for growth.
 We foster an inclusive atmosphere of One Symcor with our philosophy of +1 Unique You®, we harness each employee’s uniqueness, different skills, backgrounds, and perspectives to contribute to mutual success. It is the diversity of our people and the inclusive environment that has been and will always be key to Symcor’s success.

Title: Technical Pricing Analyst
Description:
Change the future with us.
 We are looking for dedicated and talented people who tackle ever-changing challenges, customer needs, and questions from colleagues with clever concepts and creativity. We embrace change and work with curious minds re-inventing the future of work. Join us and let us focus together on what’s truly important: making lives better with new ideas and the latest technology around the world.
 Why you’ll love working for Siemens!

Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.

Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
Employee perks and discounts.
Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2022, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2022 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.
 What will you do?
 The Technical Pricing Analyst will work closely with the Product, Sales, and Pricing teams to assist on pricing related activities.

Support Pricing inquiries from customers
Assist in pricing analysis for strategic agreement
Conduct technical audits on existing contracts
Support with the annual pricing adjustment
Work with large sets of data to update and maintain pricing records
Facilitate the roll out and adoption of new pricing tools
Provide analysis and input to make pricing decisions
Responding to ad-hoc pricing requests

What will you need to succeed?

College or university degree or diploma in Electrical Engineering/Technology preferred
Minimum 3-5 years’ work experience in an electrical field and/or analytics role
Strong knowledge of Excel Reporting
Strong Financial skills
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Customer Service Skills
Ability to analyze
Attention to detail
Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
Eager to learn

About us.
 We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.
 For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Active across Canada, the company focuses on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems and on automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. Siemens brings together the digital and physical worlds to benefit customers and society. Through Mobility, a leading supplier of intelligent mobility solutions for rail and road transport, Siemens is helping to shape Canada’s passenger rail services. Via its majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, Siemens is also a leading supplier of medical technology and digital health services. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power.
 Making a difference together we raised $385,000 towards charitable contributions, support over 38 non-profit organizations and planted 660 trees in our local communities. Siemens Canada has 2,500 employees from coast-to-coast and 24 office and production facilities across Canada. Join our team of approximately 293,000 talented professionals in more than 190 countries/regions and help us tackle the most exciting challenges to build a successful future together. So, what are you waiting for? Take your next career step with us.
 To learn more about Siemens Canada, visit our website at www.siemens.ca
 While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

 Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. Title: Senior Business Technology Support Analyst
Description:
Questrade Financial Group (QFG) of Companies is committed to helping Canadians become much more financially successful and secure. We are everything a traditional financial institution is not. Our vision is to revolutionize financial services for the benefit of Canadians by providing the most innovative and cost efficient financial services online. 

 That’s why we empower our employees to continuously grow their professional careers with QFG. We believe in having a diverse, inclusive place to work and our flexible working arrangements brings that to life so you can unleash your creativity. Our values are a part of our DNA, and we care deeply about our people helping us fulfill our mission and become an important part of our community. We are always looking for like-minded professionals to join our team. Come grow with us. 

 What’s it like working as a Senior Business Technology Support Analyst at Questrade? 

 The Senior Business Technology Support Analyst is part of a team responsible for Questrade’s Trading platforms. The Analyst provides expert support to Trading, Back Office & Compliance departments. Responsibilities include monitoring trading, data interfaces, server connectivity, critical batch processes, providing on-demand trade support to internal trading departments and working closely with external vendors, trading venues and internal IT departments for a variety of functions including reporting, troubleshooting, upgrades & maintenance cycles and new implementations. 

 The successful incumbent is able to effectively merge trading with technological knowledge and skills obtained through years of relevant industry experience. 

 Need more details? Keep reading… 



Daily, ensure applications are functioning as expected. Ensure all applications are accessible.
Work with the business and vendors to escalate and communicate end user issues
Perform initial troubleshooting on LMS, Portfolio Plus and Laserfiche systems and provide details/logs and recommendations to vendors.
Investigate and triage tickets through Service Desk and Google Forms.
Create basic scripts/workflows to automate/simplify processes.
Implement and manage change control at Community Trust for all Lending applications
Participate and coordinate QA, UAT and Production roll outs of software updates
Administer and Manage Rate Tables changes
Create and Maintain reports in LMS and Portfolio Plus
GIC Order support
Follow up with vendors on support tickets
Manage incidents impacting CTC Business Workflows
 So are YOU our next Senior Business Technology Support Analyst? You are if… 



Technical support experience
Knowledge of Mortgage and Banking Business Processes
Working knowledge of both Windows and Linux operating systems
Experience with Change Management
Experience with Incident management
Experience in a QA role working with scripts and acceptance testing
Experience with Software Development Life Cycle
Experience with Jira Service Management, Service Desk and Google Workspace
Ability to work on a flexible time schedule outside of normal working hours. Willingness to start early or stay late, as required
Having a growth mindset with eagerness to learn new systems, processes and technologies.
Strong communications skills both verbal and written for a client facing role
Proven team player
 Brownie points if you… 



Knowledge of online brokerage operations
SQL/database experience
 Sounds like you? Click below to apply! 
#LIJM1 

 At Questrade Financial Group of Companies, with multiple office locations around the world, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive and accessible work environment. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings, and believe that when our teams feel supported and motivated, their creativity becomes a source of innovation. We are also committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and also one which reflects the diversity of the communities we serve and operate in to help us revolutionize financial services for the benefit of all of our customers. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment/selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Ecommerce Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Job Description 
 Under the direction of the Data Quality Supervisor, the Data Quality Analyst will lead the charge in examining the online data foundation and ensuring data alignment between systems. The Data Quality Analyst will provide overall data health assessment by performing large scale data audits to maintain online data standards. Data Quality analyst will compile regular and timely data report to articulate data issues with cross-functional stakeholders and teams and drive internal process improvements.
  

Responsibilities:


40% Executes in-depth analyses by gathering, inspecting and correcting online dataset to ensure optimal data health – identify problematic areas to initiate overall cleanse
 20% Works with cross-functional teams to create processes and documentation that will be implemented as data governance standards in order to improve online data quality
 20% Assist in troubleshooting ongoing operational gaps and engage with cross-functional teams to provide analysis and recommendations
 20% Leverage system dashboards to compile insight reports on data quality data health performance and key data initiatives.



Experience / Knowledge Required:


Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets expectation, Consistently demonstrates).
 The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree/diploma program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job is required
 SAP and/or PIM (Product Information Management) software experience preferred
 Hybris and/or product content management software experience preferred
 Alteryx and/or data processing software experience preferred
 Proficient with utilizing big data analytics platform (Looker, tableau) to conduct data analysis
 Systematic approach to problem solving
 Strong multi-tasking and organization skills with the ability to flex and remain objective
 Well-developed project management skills including exceptional attention to detail
 Strong communication skills appropriate for all levels of the organization
 Ability to manage difficult situations with calm, patience and respect
 Strong organizational skills, including the ability to balance multiple priorities & manage time effectively

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
About Mavencare


 Interested in leveraging your skills and passion to change the lives of your parents, grandparents and loved ones needing home care? At Mavencare, we believe that all seniors should be able to age in the comfort of their own homes. Mavencare is a fast-growing, entrepreneurial, home care technology company with the goal of connecting compassionate caregivers with clients seeking home care. Awarded Deloitte’s Companies to Watch and selected as one of 22 companies as C-100’s 48 Hours in the Valley Cohort - our vision is to revolutionize home care by providing technologically advanced services that allow for hospital-level care at home.


 We are obsessed and passionate about all things home care and are on a mission to deliver a healthier, more meaningful home care experience. Join our trusted and knowledgeable team by offering your skills to improve the lives of our rapidly growing seniors’ population.


 Based in Toronto, Ontario. This role is currently hybrid with some duties as needed performed in the office.


 The Role:


 The Business Analyst works with our customers to help them get greater value from our product. They are a member of the Data Integration and Analytics team which manages the interface with third party systems and provides reporting capabilities. The Business Analyst is in regular contact with our customers to gather requirements, assist with implementation and help them improve their business processes by using our product.


 Key Responsibilities:


 Data Integration

Develop business requirements for the integration with external partners and third party softwares
Coordinate with teams outside of the organization to define new, and improve on existing, integration workflows
Build strong and trusting relationships with our partners by providing clear, meaningful and timely communication both in person and written
Write clear documentation of integration features for development work by engineering team



 Reporting

Collect and cleanse datasets via written data queries, searching external sources and gathering data from partners
Work with large datasets and business intelligence tools to develop key metrics and reporting dashboards
Meet with partners to define reporting needs and deliver end product to their users



 Required Skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Excellent communication skills in dealing with colleagues, the management team, and external partners
A keen eye for detail that helps efficiently detect and solve problems
Analytical thinking skills
Knowledge of basic accounting principles and financial statements
Excellent Microsoft excel skills
Effective time management skills
Working knowledge of query languages
Ability and eagerness to quickly learn new skills and techniques
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau or PowerBI



 Nice to Have

NoSQL query language specifically mongoDB
Experience working with QuickBooks or other accounting software

Title: Sr Business Insights Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. 
We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data.

Title: Principal Gameplay Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities: 

Perform product tests on user behavior and present findings to determine the impact of newly developed features
Analyzing data to provide clear reports about engagement, behavior, acquisition, monetization, and retention;
Support decisions by providing standard and event-specific reports to help the team understand player behavior;
Support operations and developers with insights based on telemetry data.
Identify & analyze consumer insights, as well as communicate these results to the internal clients in order to improve their comprehension of the market & the consumers and fuel their strategic vision.

Qualifications: 

Proven professional experience working with Data Analytics within the Gaming industry;
Knowledge of user research methodologies and the human-centered design process
Passionate about Games.

About NetEase Games
NetEase Games is the online games division of NetEase, Inc., developing and operating some of the most popular mobile and PC games in markets including China and Japan. As one of the world’s largest incubators of quality online game content, NetEase Games is dedicated to supporting the growth of innovative studios around the globe and growing an international presence along the way. To complement its self-developed games and world-class R&D capabilities, NetEase Games also partners with other industry leaders including Blizzard Entertainment, Mojang AB (a Microsoft subsidiary) and other global game developers to operate some of the most popular international online games in China.

Title: Business Analyst
Policy Analyst (Research & Statistics Officer 3)
Description:
Department: Advanced Education
Location: HALIFAX
Type of Employment: Term
Union Status: NSGEU - NSPG
Closing Date: 7/4/2022 (Applications are accepted until 11:59 PM Atlantic Time)



 About Us




The Post-Secondary Accessibility Services (PSAS) division’s mission is to ensure equity of access to quality post-secondary education, tools and training for students with disabilities. PSAS is responsible for the ongoing development of policy and the administration of programs that support students with disabilities in post-secondary environments and transitioning to the workforce. PSAS partners with other federal and provincial government departments, disability advocacy organizations and post-secondary institutions in the ongoing development and implementation of programs that increase the participation of adults with disabilities in post-secondary education and training.




 About Our Opportunity




If you are passionate about accessibility for students with disabilities in post-secondary education and enjoy working with education partners such as universities, the Nova Scotia Community College, private career colleges and non-profit disability organizations on accessibility initiatives, this may be the opportunity for you.


Reporting to the Director Post-Secondary Accessibility Services (PSAS), the Policy Analyst is responsible for providing comprehensive policy and program decision support; and accountability, evaluation, and reporting for federal/provincial cost-shared programs.




 Primary Accountabilities




Some of the key areas of focus for you include:



Program evaluations of existing and proposed programs. 
Data collection for analyzing the impacts of current and proposed programs.
Carry out jurisdictional policy research on programs and services for students with disabilities to determine best practices and identify cross-country issues on access to higher education. 
Manage the reporting, accountability, and integrity of programs funded under a federal/provincial cost-shared agreement) to ensure compliance with funding agreements.
Provide support on work related to accessibility for students with disabilities, to federal/provincial/territorial (F/P/T) committees, provincial government accessibility tables, and educational partner working groups





Qualifications and Experience




This may be the right opportunity for you if you have a university degree in a relevant field of study, such as public administration and several years of related experience in the areas of higher education and accessibility in post-secondary education.


As the successful candidate you have:



Proven experience in policy development and program analysis.
Demonstrated experience in report writing and preparation of briefing materials.
Demonstrated ability to build collaborative working relationships..
Proficiency in a Microsoft Office environment, including word processing, spreadsheets, and presentation tools.


 
We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.




 Equivalency




Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.




 Benefits




Based on the employment status and Union agreement, the Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offering and eligibility criteria.




 Additional Information




This is a Term employment opportunity with an anticipated end date of March 21, 2023, with the possibility of extension. The appointment status (‘term’, ‘temporary’ or ‘casual’) is dependent on the start date of the successful candidate.



Candidates are encouraged to submit a cover letter with their application. Failure to do so may result in their application being screened out.





What We Offer





Career development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.
Engaging workplace: our employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in, we have forward-thinking policies and strategies.
Numerous career paths for Nova Scotians.
Department-specific flexible work options.






Pay Grade: PR 13
Salary Range: $2,396.86 - $2,913.59 Bi-Weekly


Employment Equity Statement:
Our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the citizens we serve. The Government of Nova Scotia has an Employment Equity Policy, and we welcome applications from Indigenous People, African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Persons with Disabilities and Women in occupations or positions where they are under-represented. If you are a member of one of these equity groups, you are encouraged to self-identify on your electronic application.


This is a bargaining unit position initially restricted to current civil service employees represented by the Nova Scotia Government Employees Union (NSGEU). If applying from outside a government office, employees must apply correctly via this link:


 
Failure to apply correctly means that your application will not be given first consideration as a bargaining unit applicant, and will only be included if external applications are pursued.


External applicants and current casual employees will only be considered if there are no qualified civil service bargaining unit candidates. PLEASE NOTE: Candidates will not be considered for an interview if applications are incomplete or are missing information.


Offer of employment is conditional upon the completion of all applicable background checks and confirmation of credentials, the results of which must be satisfactory to the employer. We thank all applicants for the interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. All questions and concerns may be directed to Competitions@novascotia.ca.

Title: Trade Analyst
Description:
Our goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels. The Halifax Port Authority welcomes applications from Aboriginal People, African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Persons with Disabilities and Women, in occupations or positions where they are under-represented. If you are a member of one of the above groups, you are encouraged to self-identify, on your covering letter, or on your resume.
The Port of Halifax is about making connections between people, commerce and opportunity. We take a leadership role in developing business for the Port of Halifax in collaboration with our partners and we responsibly manage Port of Halifax assets.
The Port of Halifax is Canada’s Ultra Atlantic Gateway, connecting to more than 150 countries. The direct economic output of Port of Halifax operations and Nova Scotia exporters is $2.45 billion, generating 13,600 jobs. Offering a natural, deep harbour and big ship infrastructure, Halifax can accommodate large volumes of containerized cargo, breakbulk cargo and project cargo of any size. Collaborating and working with strong partners and stakeholders, the Port community in Halifax continues to deliver excellence.

At this time, the Halifax Port Authority (“HPA”) requires a
Trade Analyst
 

  Reporting to the Senior Manager, Trade & Trade Analytics, the Trade Analyst uses expertise in data analysis to help the Trade Department drive trade growth at the Port of Halifax. Duties include using data to analyse historical performance and customer and industry trends, generating statistical reports, and responding to customer data inquiries. This position requires an individual who is proficient in communications, business development, as well as data analysis and will help the port authority develop our business through the strategic use of data and statistics. This individual will be a 
  data
user rather than a 
  database programmer.
 



The successful candidate must have a university degree in Business, Engineering, Economics or related field with a minimum of three (3) to five (5) years’ related practical experience. They must be an advanced user of Excel and other MS Office applications, and data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, SQL. Experience in supply chain management and project management considered as an asset. Data Analytics certification or any professional designation be considered as an asset.
The successful candidate must have excellent critical thinking and analytical skills in both marketing and finance. Must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills with both internal and external customers and a capability to identify opportunities to create value for the business. Must have the ability to work in a team environment and interact with management and stakeholders. Ability to work independently and resourcefully, as well as creatively research and implement new solutions.
The successful candidate will be subject to successfully completing a physical examination, must pass and maintain a Criminal Record Check and must be able to obtain and maintain a valid Marine Transportation Security Clearance (MTSC). The Halifax Port Authority has a policy requiring all individuals to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Exemptions may be considered for individuals who cannot be fully vaccinated due to a certified medical contradiction, religion, or any other prohibited ground of discrimination as defined in the Canadian Human Rights Act.

This is a unionized position with a salary range of $62,652 to $73,704 per annum.
HPA takes the health and safety of its job applicants and employees seriously. All recruitment activities and interviews will be done following all social distancing and COVID-19 restrictions. For applicants with concerns about the recruitment process or to request another accommodation, please contact humanresources@portofhalifax.ca.

Title: Risk Analyst
Description:
Company Description*_We are Chandos_*Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do.Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.
Job DescriptionThe Risk Analyst will support all areas of compliance and risk focusing directly on insurance, bonding, internal audit and enterprise risk management. This is a great opportunity to learn about all areas of the business and work closely with our operations and legal teams to ensure risk is mitigated across the organization.

Provide assistance, ensure accurate and timely response to project teams for all insurance inquiries
Record monthly internal insurance premiums as well as code and track invoices to ensure timely payments are made.
Assist with the compilation of insurance renewal information and provide monthly insurance reporting requirements.
Maintain and safeguard records including insurance certificates, bonds and other documents.
Prepare quarterly internal control testing, summarizing findings as well as recommending process changes
Facilitate the quarterly ERM voting process, providing training and support to senior management.
Opportunities to be involved in process improvement projects within the area of risk and loss prevention.

Qualifications

A minimum of undergraduate degree or diploma in; business, construction management, risk management, insurance preferred, however, a combination of education and experience in the related fields will be considered.
Experience in insurance or the construction industry is an asset.
Ability to perform data analysis, with strong knowledge and experience working in Microsoft Excel.
Effective and clear communication skills, both written and verbal.

Additional InformationChandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process.We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
Competitive wages
Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
Recognition and annual salary reviews program
Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

Job Type: Full-time

Title: HR Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
Position: HR Reporting & Data Analyst
Location: Montreal, Canada
The Maples Group has operated in Montreal since 2009. The Group is a standard bearer in financial services, trusted by many of the world’s largest hedge fund managers, private asset firms and international corporations. In 2022, the Group was again recognized as one of Montreal's Top Employers by the publisher of Canada's Top 100 Employers list.
Our distinction flows from our carefully curated team: 2,000+ professionals characterised by tenacity, ethics and exacting excellence. We hire smart and sharpen smarter, arming talent with best-in-class resources and skills. Operating in key financial centres across the Americas, Asia, Europe and the Middle East, our international presence offers a unique springboard for career development and cross-cultural immersion. Our side-by-side financial and legal services are similarly ripe for interdisciplinary learning and growth.
The Maples Group looks to add a Montreal, Canada-based HR Reporting & Data Analyst to our team and invites eager and qualified candidates to apply. Recognised as one of Montreal's top employers, we are committed to diversity, inclusion and equality of opportunity as we attract, retain and develop world-class talent.
Who We Seek
Our merit-based culture suits professionals in pursuit of boundless careers and lives. Beyond their acumen, team members are collaborative and conscientious, bringing a healthy sense of drive and purpose to each interaction and to all aspects of their work.
About the Role
The HR Reporting & Data Analyst is responsible in creating reports, conducting analytics and providing strategic insight into the effectiveness of various HR strategies, programs, and processes. The individual is also expected to help support the HR systems.
Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:
· Responsible in producing approved HR reports and analytics packages.
· Develop and sustain appropriate controls to maintain and report on information.
· Analyse data and identify trends on people matters.
· Build and maintain reporting automation/visualisation tools to create efficiencies in support of HR and/or business strategies.
· Identify opportunities to improve established practices
· Identify opportunities for automation and reduction of manual processes. Perform regular business process reviews, make ongoing suggestions, and create an action plan.
· Work with HR process leads, subject matter experts and leadership to analyse HR performance metrics and other people data insights, and come up with recommendations and actions to improve HR services.
· The HR leadership may determine other functions or projects from time to time.
What You Bring
In addition to indisputably high ethical standards and autonomy, the ideal candidate possesses the following:

Bachelor’ s Degree in Information Technology, Human Resource, Business or related field
3 years+ experience in various HR CoEs / domains, preferable in HR Data Management, HRIS, HR Technology, People Analytics and/or related areas
Experience with PowerBI, Tableau, or other Report visualization tools.
Certification a plus (HRIP, APA, Project Management Professional, Six Sigma).
Ability to proactively diagnose and solve medium to complex problems
Strong organizational skills and stakeholder management
Ability to report and organize data in a manner that will help both HR and the business make strategic decisions.

Benefits & Rewards
The most enduring professional relationships are reciprocal relationships. The Maples Group prioritises employee health and wellbeing. Depending on your location, we offer a range of benefits, including:
· Comprehensive health coverage (medical, dental and optical)
· Competitive vacation packages
· Educational assistance and professional development programmes
· Savings or pension plan
· Life insurance
· Travel insurance
· Global mental wellness programme
· Sports clubs and social events
About the Maples Group 
Over five decades, the Maples Group has grown from modest beginnings into one of the world's preeminent professional services firms, offering specialised fiduciary, fund administration, regulatory and compliance, entity formation and management and legal services on the laws of the British Virgin Islands, the Cayman Islands, Ireland, Jersey and Luxembourg.
You can learn more about the Maples Group on our corporate website. Experience our culture and our people on our Careers Page or on LinkedIn.
Disclaimer: All personal information collected during the application process will be used for recruitment-related purposes only. Please refer to our Job Applicant Privacy Notice at maples.com/privacy for details on how we handle personal information relating to job applicants.
Poste : Analyste de rapports et données de RH
Lieu : Montréal, Canada
Le Groupe Maples est présent à Montréal depuis 2009. Le Groupe est un porte-étendard des services financiers auquel font confiance de nombreux gestionnaires de fonds de couverture, des sociétés de capital-investissement et des entreprises internationales parmi les plus importants au monde. En 2022, le Groupe a de nouveau été reconnu comme l’un des meilleurs employeurs de Montréal par l’éditeur de la liste des 100 meilleurs employeurs au Canada.
Notre distinction est établie grâce à notre équipe soigneusement formée : plus de 2 000 professionnels qui font preuve de ténacité, d’éthique et d’excellence. Nous recrutons des personnes intelligentes et perfectionnons leurs talents en leur fournissant les meilleures ressources et en développant leurs compétences. Active dans les principaux centres financiers d’Amérique, d’Asie, d’Europe et du Moyen-Orient, notre présence internationale offre un tremplin unique pour le perfectionnement professionnel et l’immersion interculturelle. Nos services financiers et juridiques sont également favorables à l’apprentissage et à la croissance interdisciplinaires.
Le Groupe Maples cherche à ajouter un analyste de rapports et données de RH à son équipe à Montréal et invite les candidats enthousiastes et qualifiés à poser leur candidature. Reconnus comme faisant partie des meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, nous nous engageons à favoriser la diversité, l’inclusion et l’égalité des chances en attirant, en maintenant en poste et en perfectionnant des talents de classe mondiale.
Candidats recherchés
Notre culture axée sur le mérite convient aux professionnels en quête d’une carrière et d’une vie sans limites. En plus de leur expertise, les membres de l’équipe sont coopératifs et consciencieux. Ils possèdent une grande motivation et se fixent des buts à atteindre, ce qui se reflète dans chacune de leurs interactions et dans tous les aspects de leur travail.
À propos du poste
L’analyste de rapports et données de RH est responsable de la production de rapports, d’analyses et d’observations stratégiques sur l’efficacité de divers processus, programmes et stratégies en matière de ressources humaines. La personne doit également contribuer à soutenir les systèmes de RH.
Les principales responsabilités associées à ce poste comprennent notamment :
· Produire des ensembles de rapports et d’analyses de RH approuvés.
· Concevoir et maintenir des contrôles appropriés pour conserver les informations et en faire rapport.
· Analyser les données et déceler les tendances en matière de ressources humaines.
· Créer et gérer des outils d’automatisation et de visualisation des rapports afin d’accroître l’efficacité des stratégies des ressources humaines ou de l’entreprise.
· Trouver des possibilités d’améliorer les pratiques établies.
· Cerner des possibilités d’automatisation et de réduction des processus manuels. Effectuer des examens réguliers des processus d’affaires, faire régulièrement des suggestions et établir un plan d’action.
· Travailler avec les responsables des processus de RH, les experts en la matière et la direction afin d’analyser les paramètres de rendement des RH et d’autres données sur les personnes, puis de formuler des recommandations et de présenter des mesures pour améliorer les services des RH.
· La direction des RH peut déterminer d’autres responsabilités ou projets de temps à autre.
Votre contribution
En plus d’une autonomie et de normes en matière d’éthique incontestablement élevées, le candidat idéal possédera les caractéristiques suivantes :

Baccalauréat en technologies de l’information, en ressources humaines, en affaires ou dans un domaine connexe.
Plus de trois ans d’expérience dans divers centres d’excellence ou domaines des RH, préférablement en gestion de données de RH, en systèmes SIRH, en technologies des RH, en analyses de personnes ou dans un domaine connexe.
Expérience avec l’utilisation de PowerBI, Tableau ou d’autres outils de visualisation de rapports.
Certification (HRIP, APA, accréditation professionnelle en gestion de projet, Six Sigma), un atout.
Capacité à déceler les problèmes de complexité moyenne à élevée et à les résoudre de manière proactive.
Solides compétences en organisation et en gestion des parties prenantes.
Parvenir à présenter et à organiser les données de manière à aider les RH et l’entreprise à prendre des décisions stratégiques.

Avantages sociaux et récompenses
Les relations professionnelles les plus durables sont les relations réciproques. Le Groupe Maples accorde la priorité à la santé et au bien-être des employés. Selon votre lieu de résidence, nous vous offrons une gamme d’avantages sociaux, notamment :
· une protection complète en matière de santé (soins médicaux, soins dentaires et soins de la vue);
· des offres de vacances compétitives;
· des programmes d’aide à l’éducation et de perfectionnement professionnel;
· un régime de retraite ou d’épargne;
· une assurance vie;
· une assurance voyage;
· un programme global de bien-être mental;
· des clubs sportifs et des activités sociales.
À propos du Groupe Maples 
Depuis ses débuts modestes, le Groupe Maples est devenu, en cinq décennies, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de services professionnels au monde, offrant des services spécialisés de fiduciaire, d’administration de fonds, de réglementation et de conformité, de formation et de gestion des entités ainsi que des services juridiques sur les lois des îles Vierges britanniques, des îles Caïmans, de l’Irlande, de Jersey et du Luxembourg.
Pour en savoir plus sur le Groupe Maples, visitez notre site Web d’entreprise. Découvrez notre culture et notre équipe dans notre page Carrières ou sur LinkedIn.
Clause de non-responsabilité : tous les renseignements personnels recueillis au cours du processus de candidature seront utilisés uniquement aux fins de recrutement. Veuillez consulter notre avis sur la protection de la vie privée des demandeurs d’emploi à l’adresse maples.com/privacy (en anglais seulement) pour en savoir plus sur la manière dont nous gérons leurs renseignements personnels.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
CTC006799 : Business Analyst





Location : Montreal, Quebec 
    
Field : BA
    
Position Type : Contract 
   

Starting : July 11, 2022 
    
Ending : July 14, 2023 
    
Resources Required : 1
   




    Position Description
   





Duration: 1 year
 Telework: : 100% telework, open to face to face meetings (ex: PI planning...) / Hydribe
 Bilingualism: Very desirable. French, mandatory. English as much as possible functional. 60/40 French/English - External partner based in Toronto
 Start as soon as possible 
Your Role

Master the technology ecosystem and understand the interrelationships


Understand and document current processes


Be able to establish and optimize target processes by working closely with multiple stakeholders


Produce impact analyses resulting from the changes caused by the target processes


Understand business issues, identify stakeholder needs, propose and implement IT strategies and solutions, taking into account the diverse nature of the issues to support project delivery


Prioritize work to be done based on business value and risk


Gather, document and analyze information to validate and prioritize the business needs of the client and all stakeholders and ensure that they are aligned with the Bank's strategic directions


Analyze the data required for the delivery of the solution


Make the link between business needs and technology requirements


Ensure the delivery of a solution that adequately meets the business needs and fits the target architecture


Identify and document information on stakeholders and their needs (issues to be resolved, technical requirements, business processes, data flows, etc.)


Ensure the delivery of analyses and documents related to smooth operational change management for stakeholders


Support the business sectors and IT in each step of the program implementation


Carry out various analyses (context, issues, impacts, functional, non-functional and informational, processes, business rules) to produce a diagnosis of the gaps between the current situation and the target situation.

 Your profile

Bachelor's degree related to the business sector and four years of relevant experience OR University Certificate/College Diploma and seven years of relevant experience


Demonstrated experience in business analysis


Knowledge of the banking IT ecosystem Enterprise (Asset)


Knowledge of Agile methodology (Scrum and Kanban)


Experience in complex project delivery and multiple integrations


Experience delivering ERP, CRM and business systems.


Experience in SAFE mode delivery, Agile Jira, Confluences etc.


Experience in business process management


Experience in change management


Strong ability to think strategically, strong vision, excellent analytical and synthesis skills, as well as oral and written communication skills


Ability to work in a team and facilitate decision making


Experience working cooperatively with multiple Business and IT architects and Product Owners.


Ability to make presentations to and participate in strategic and executive committees


Understanding of product/service delivery/life cycle desirable


Rigor and strong ownership skills


Customer focus and strong interpersonal skills


Team player, ability to positively influence and mobilize stakeholders


Adaptability in a changing environment 


Leadership, initiative, autonomy and communication skills

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Operations
Description:
It's a new day, and it's time to answer the call to elevate your career and make life accessible for all.Our purpose is to make life accessible.Our compassion and knowledge set us apart. We support individuals with kindness and expertise by delivering the right mobility, accessibility, personal care, and daily living solutions. We believe that providing people with comprehensive solutions empowers and fulfills us all.Who you areWe are adding a Senior Analyst, Operations to our team in Toronto, Ontario. Reporting directly to the Chief Operation Officer and working closely with the senior executive team and field Regional Directors, you will drive change through operational effectiveness across field operations. You will provide analytical and tactical support to build business cases for strategic initiatives with a focus on business growth, customer service, policy/procedure development and enhancements.Who you are and what's in it for you?You are an experienced operations professional and you want to advance your career at a healthcare solutions company. You thrive in a fast paced environment, where you can identify and own areas for new processes and programs. You are looking for a place with purpose where you can channel your expertise and be supported as you develop your skills and grow your career.What you will do

Operational Effectiveness. You will develop, execute and measure the success of strategic initiatives that will drive growth and operational improvement on a national scale. You will use your expertise to identify and define strategic business opportunities and provide solution recommendations to key stakeholders such as the senior leadership team and regional partners.
Partnership. You will partner with key stakeholders within the business including the senior leadership team, regional directors and support center teams to collaborate and provide operational solutions.
Adoption & Engagement. In partnership with key stakeholders, you will influence and support change management of the strategic initiatives through communication and training. In addition, you will measure outcomes to provide further process improvements.
Analytics. You will use data analytics to find efficiencies and process improvements as it relates to revenue, margin or field operational processes. In conjunction, you will provide financial planning & analytics information to ensure operational risks are appropriately managed.

What you bring

Education and experience. You have a degree or diploma from a post-secondary institution in business management, sales management or relevant experience. You must have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience in driving P&L, launching new programs/initiatives that drive financials at small to mid-size organizations.
Communication. You have experience working with people and leaders to find the best solutions to fit their needs. You have exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal and can explain your ideas and thoughts in a variety of ways to get your point across.
Flexibility and organization. You are an expert at juggling multiple projects, stakeholders and deadlines all while keeping your cool. You can prioritize, manage and organize a myriad of tasks as they come up throughout the day from clients or other team members. You can easily change your course of action to address changing needs and requirements while still delivering on deadlines.
Technical skills. You are proficient in using data visualization software such as Tableau and Power BI. Experience using Looker is desired, but not required. You have a strong command of MS Office suite and an Excel superuser. Experience with an ERP or CRM solution is desirable.
Travel. This role will be a hybrid work from home position with a requirement to visit Motion locations to partner and provide the best operational solutions possible.

Why join? We are MotionWith a strong reputation as experts in our field, we're turning inwards to foster a culture of belonging, giving, and strength. Joining us now is a chance to be part of that momentum and an opportunity to make an impact in people's lives and help create a company environment you believe in.Thank you for taking the time to consider joining us. If you want to be part of our team, express your interest here.Motion is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us.Protective measures for COVID-19At Motion, the safety of our employees and our clients is paramount. We’ve implemented several measures to reduce the risk of exposure to Covid-19. These include: 

Ensuring safe physical distancing at all locations and warehouses.
Providing all employees with full personal protective equipment, including face shields, gowns, masks, and gloves.
Disinfecting all locations and warehouses regularly and thoroughly.
Continuous monitoring of the ongoing situation and updating policies as needed.
