Title: Supply Chain and Inventory Analyst
Description:
Overview: 
 
   Hunter Engineering, a third-generation family company, is the world leader in automotive service equipment. We design and build industry-leading wheel alignment systems, wheel balancing systems, vehicle inspection systems, and more. Hunter equipment, made in America, is approved, and used by vehicle manufacturers, tire companies, and dealers in over 130 countries. Hunter is a fun and innovative place to work, where we constantly develop new products from ideas generated by our team. As a family company, we do not answer to Wall Street demands or changing Private Equity owners. Our people come first as we aim for excellence. We value work/life balance and take pride in our culture of excellence, respect, innovation, teamwork, and service to others.
 

   We are currently seeking a
   Supply Chain and Inventory Analyst for our Hunter Canada entity located in Aurora, Canada. This role reports to the Finance and Administration Manager located in Canada.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Inventory and procurement analysis and reporting: interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
 Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
 Inventory management analysis and reporting
 Cost management: collecting, analyzing, and reporting cost information to more effectively budget, forecast and monitor costs.
 Order management, tracking purchase orders and ERP analysis
 Working with cross functional teams including but not limited to operations, logistics, warehouse, purchasing
 Monitor daily inventories and production to anticipate storage problems and to maintain proper supply levels
 Qualifications: 
 
University degree in Business or similar major required, Master’s degree preferred
 1-2 years of experience in a professional business environment; equipment sales and distribution experience preferred
 Proficient in English; both spoken and written
 Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint); Power BI and ERP system use is preferred
 Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
 Analytical, highly organized, able to work with little supervision, motivated to successfully meet deadlines, attention to detail and ability to multi-task
 Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Title: Chapter Lead, Business Analyst
Description:
Chapter Lead, Business Analyst - 0003SA
  



 Posting Date: Jun 22, 2022, 10:32:53 AM
 

 Primary Location: Ontario-Toronto
 

 Job Type: Permanent
 

 Schedule: Full-time
 


 EDC is Canada’s export credit agency, offering information, knowledge and innovative commercial solutions to help Canadian exporters and investors expand their international business. We take on risk so Canadian businesses can take on the world.
When you join our team, you’ll be helping Canadian companies bring their vision, passion and innovation to the global marketplace. Your knowledge and expertise will support more than 25,000 Canadian companies and their customers in as many as 200 markets worldwide. You’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with the best and brightest in an inclusive, collaborative environment that fosters professional development and success. And you’ll know that you’re making a difference every day—for companies, for Canada and for the people you work with.
Year after year, EDC has been recognized as a Top 100 and Top Family-Friendly Employer. #LI-Hybrid
Team & Job Overview
In 2020, senior management presented to the Board of Directors an integrated digital strategy and transformation roadmap to meet the long-term corporate aspirations of EDC. The strategy has been approved by the Board of Directors and is now in execution. Most recently, a centralized transformation office (TO) has been created which incorporates all orchestration, change, culture and technology teams. TO employees are empowered to deliver impactful solutions and sustainable change to our business and employee experience platforms. Everyone is tasked with evolving ways of working and bringing the exporter at the center of the design cycle. EDC is currently deploying agile ways of working at scale for all digital solution and value delivery. We are now seeking tenured leaders to establish a chapter lead practice for specific domains, build capabilities, empower employees, foster customer centricity and develop the future workforce. Key elements of the digital transformation effort in partnership with the business are estimated at $390M+.
We are seeking a chapter lead to lead the domain of business analysts (BA). The BA community at EDC is well regarded and has contributed to delivering significant customer impact in the past few years. Having operated as a community of practice in past years, EDC is ready to increase investments in the domain to drive further impact across the entire transformation portfolio. The incumbent will need to be sough as an expert in their domain and have been able to stand up a BA chapter and scale its capabilities. As EDC takes an employee first approach to deliver its 2030 strategy, attracting, developing, and growing the workforce of BAs is essential. Close collaboration with family and squad product owners will be essential to ensure BA assignment is optimal and performing. Fostering a common sense of development and exemplifying innovative ways BAs can increase their impact is welcome.
Key Responsibilities

Develop and manage organizational expertise in the business analyst area of knowledge
Define professional standards/ work methodology within the Chapter competence and serve as a guide for others in their area of knowledge
Develop Chapter members over time to create "T-shaped" profiles while steering development to match organizational demand of capability and skill
Drive consistency of the knowledge and skills of the Chapter, sharing best practices and common challenges in their/her cell and others
Actively manage workforce; promote EDC, seek new talent, hire, onboard, develop and empower your talent to have impact in process and product teams.
Define and evolve capability building roadmap for Chapter members at both the individual and aggregate levels
Manage quarterly planning for Chapter members (including external consultants) and coordinate with them on their long-term professional development. Hold 1-on-1s as needed.
Partner with family and squad key stakeholders (PO, scrum, architecture) to assess and manage performance and evaluate Chapter members; 360, etc.
Resolve organizational issues, including planning, allocation, reallocation, and accounting for absences
Drive qualitative and quantitative problem-solving, innovation and lines of communication within development teams
Conduct analysis of complex information and drawing insights from that data and multiple sources
Build robust, timely business cases for technical products, from coordination to approval with business finance manager
Promote culture of inclusion and diversity and be an active supporter of EDC’s cultural change
Communicate effectively to multiple audiences and can bring in additional view in building recommendation

Screening Criteria

Minimum 10 years of experience and expertise as a business analyst with proven track record of delivering impact to technology and business teams
Advanced understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and agile ways of working
Undergraduate Degree with a specialization in business analysis, technology, or relevant field
Minimum 5 years of experience in establishing, and scaling a technical domain in a Chapter structure or large scale center of excellence (CoE)
Bilingualism in both official languages (French and English)*


However, in the event a qualified bilingual candidate is not found, a qualified unilingual candidate will be considered. Both bilingual and unilingual candidates are encouraged to apply.

Assets

Agile Business Analyst Certification (e.g., IIBA Agile Analysis Certification)
A passion for developing your workforce and evolving your technical domain
Thorough understanding of Cybersecurity principles and how they can be applied to the requirements gathering process
Experience in financial institutions and/or highly regulated sector
Experienced with developing business cases

Salary Range

$124,800 - $187,300, plus performance-based incentive

Location

For this position, EDC is recruiting top talent across Canada. We offer full flexibility to work remotely during and after the pandemic.

Please note that EDC will be following a mandatory vaccination policy.



How to apply 


Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


 Application deadline on www.edc.ca/careers : Jul 1, 2022, 10:59:00 PM
  
 EDC is committed to employment equity and actively encourages applications from women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities. If selected for an interview, please advise us if you require special accommodation.
  

 Candidates must meet the requisite government security screening requirements.

Title: Associate, Business Intelligence
Description:
Company Description
  Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
 When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
 CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:

 Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
 Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
 Accelerated exposure and responsibility
 Global career development opportunities
 Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
 A flexible/hybrid work environment combining in office collaboration and remote working
 A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance

 If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.



 Job Description
  The Business Intelligence (BI) Team is looking for an Associate who is enthusiastic about using data to tell stories and solve problems. Within the Finance, Analytics and Risk (FAR) department, the BI team delivers self-serve analytical solutions to support Management and Investment Department decision-making.
 You will be responsible for designing new Tableau dashboards to measure, analyze and explain key aspects of the Fund’s activities. The opportunity:

 Gain a broad perspective of the business across investment departments and core services functions.
 Effectively turn business questions into data analysis, drive insights and provide meaningful recommendations to Senior Management.

 Role-Specific Accountabilities

 Build information solutions, including scalable views and dashboards to measure key metrics and activities across both public and private market strategies.
 Deliver insightful and polished content.
 Partner effectively with multiple stakeholders to deliver effective presentations and create visual displays of quantitative information.
 Work closely with different teams to identify new financial opportunities in different areas of the Fund.
 Taking an infographic story document and mocking up sketches or wireframes for the infographic’s layout & visuals.
 Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.
 Other duties as required.




 Qualifications
 

 Undergraduate degree
 5+ years of Tableau experience
 Experience with data, including working experience with programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R, pandas, pyspark, SQL) to build data and analytical solutions is considered an asset.
 Strong skills in Microsoft Excel, Power Point, Word. Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Power BI, or Qlik is considered an asset.
 Blend alternative sources of data with discretionary investment research to generate important and actionable investment ideas.
 Excellent analytical skills with a curious and tenacious approach to answering difficult questions
 Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, co-located with data engineers and data scientists
 Exhibit high attention to detail and accuracy while meeting deadlines and working under pressure.
 Exemplifies our Guiding Principles of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance.

 Additional Information
  Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-AF1
 #LI-Hybrid
 At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.
 We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.
 Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity:
 In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
 Disclaimer:
 CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

 Mandatory Vaccine Policy
 All employees in the Toronto, New York, San Francisco, Mumbai, Sydney, Hong Kong, and Sao Paulo offices will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Accommodations to this policy will be made for medical or other protected grounds. Please contact us to discuss any accommodation needs.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Solutions & Analysis (Risk & Total Fund Management)
Description:
Company Description
  Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
 When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
 CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:

 Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
 Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
 Accelerated exposure and responsibility
 Global career development opportunities
 Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
 A flexible/hybrid work environment combining in office collaboration and remote working
 A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance

 If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.



 Job Description
  We are hiring a Senior Analyst in the Data and Advanced Analytics team within the Technology and Data department to support our Risk & TFM groups.
 In this role, you will combine your expertise in data products and understanding of investment management data to support new data and analytics initiatives. You will be called on to find solutions and solve data issues related to a variety of short- and long-term initiatives and projects focused on bringing new data capabilities at CPP Investments.
 The Opportunity:

 Build solutions to complex business problems on topics such as risk and performance data analytics, classification, and estimation, finding and using unique datasets
 Communicate and engage with internal stakeholders across all areas of the business to analyze problems and deliver the appropriate solution recommendations including supporting artifacts as needed: data requirement documents, functional, data specifications, use cases, data flows, metrics, reports and designs.
 Manage data onboarding, data ingestion and assessment of new datasets.
 Conduct and coordinate proof-of-concepts with external vendors, internal data resources alongside multiple internal stakeholders
 Identify manual processes or user-developed applications as candidates for data automation/operationalization to reduce operational instability and human error
 Identify inefficiencies in the use of data in current business processes as candidates for data consolidation, centralization, and data scalability
 Develop models, algorithms, or data integration solutions, and run live experiments to prototype the improvements and prove their efficacy
 Support internal business partners (Investment Departments and Core Services) in the development and execution of new data capabilities
 Produce data visualizations and deliver insights through transformation & analysis of various internal and external data sets.
 Ensure that new enhancements address immediate business needs, while ensuring system alignment with data strategy and roadmaps.




 Qualifications
 

 Experience with investment management data required, and an ability to understand and interpret investment concepts, and Specifically within risk analysis and portfolio performance analysis considered an asset
 Programming experience in with one or more of the following: SQL, Excel/VBA, Python
 Experience in analyzing, manipulating, transforming, and interpreting large and complex datasets, structured and unstructured data in a variety of formats such as XML, JSON
 Experience working with investment management application teams for data requirements to support downstream data integrations
 Experience and understanding of data linkages, data lineage, data modeling, data interface contracts considered an asset
 Experience working with AWS, Microsoft Azure or GCP considered an asset.
 Experience with market data vendors (Bloomberg, CapIQ, RIMES) would be an asset.
 Understanding and familiarity of data used in the investment process: valuations, performance, exposures, risk, fundamentals, estimates, industry KPIs, economic indicators would be an asset
 Strong communication skills with ability to work individually as well as in a team environment.
 Commitment to CPP Investments’ guiding principles of integrity, partnership and high performance.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
AdaptAbilities is registered charity that provides an essential service to individuals with special needs and their families. Our unique programs promote positive self care and wellbeing, empowering individuals to grow, succeed and belong. We are looking for dedicate professionals who share this vision to join our team. This is an opportunity to make a difference, supporting individuals to be a part of their community.
Purpose
The Business Systems Analyst will report to the COO. As the Business Systems Analyst you are responsible for performing strategic support for various department business goals and objectives. In this position you will review and recommend processes and policies as necessary for the purpose of determining and meeting the company’s operational plans. The Business Systems Analyst will also be responsible for the management of the company’s ERP software and working with our IT Service Provider to ensure the company’s technology is functional at all times. The conscientious Business Systems Analyst, will act with integrity, be open to growth, live our purpose, cultivate teamwork, and put forth an extraordinary effort to empower people with special needs and their families to grow, succeed, and belong.
Key Functions

Oversight of information management including the organization and access to information and data
Review company policies/procedures, analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of business processes, and provide recommendations for improvement
Work closely with the Leadership Team to achieve outcomes based on company goals and objectives
Oversight of the management of AdaptAbilities ERP
Collaborate with the IT Service Provider for the smooth running of AdaptAbilities IT

Qualifications

Diploma or degree in computer science, business administration or equivalent
2-3 years' direct work experience as a Business Systems Analyst or equivalent
Experience with relational databases and reporting/data visualization tools such as Power BI
Knowledge of SQL
Experience involving technical systems and end user support
Ability to troubleshoot business process changes, errors, and subsequent modifications
Experienced in writing operational policies and processes
Ability to troubleshoot business process changes, errors, and subsequent modifications
Exceptional verbal and written English communication skills
Familiarity with project management methodologies and best practices
Good interpersonal skills to work with different management levels
Strong business acumen
Excellent analytical skills
Must be able to work with minimal supervision
Strong attention to detail
Clear Police Information Check and Intervention Record Check

Working Conditions
This is a permanent, full-time position based out of our Head Office location. Core hours of work are Monday to Friday from 8:00am to 4:30pm.
What we offer: AdaptAbilities is continually working to be an employer of choice. We offer a competitive salary, a comprehensive health/dental benefit plan, paid wellness days, a flexible spending account, RRSP/TFSA matching, support for professional development, policies and programs that support a balanced lifestyle including a Hybrid Work Arrangement and access to corporate discount with the City of Edmonton for Activities, Parks and Recreation.
Application Deadline:  Until position is filled.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
Avenue Living Communities is western Canada's fastest growing private rental properties operator, with a growing presence in regions throughout Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba. Communities is in our name because we care about bringing our communities & employees together. We inspire positive action and make a difference in the lives of the people in our communities, and in the lives of our employees. We pride ourselves on our diverse and inclusive place to work. Our Core Values drive our culture, and our people bring our Mission to life. We are in it together, employ an entrepreneurial spirit to drive change and relentlessly pursue progress.
 Embracing rapid growth, we use the skillsets of our knowledgeable teams to continue to adapt and remain focused on placing our customers' needs first. Our innovate teams work together to provide our residents with quality, value, and a clear choice of a safe, comfortable place to call home.
 Learn more about Avenue Living Communities.
 WHAT WILL YOU DO?

 Support the management and delivery of operational insights, including supporting our new Voice of Customer capabilities.
 Support organizational understanding of customer data, customer segmentation and performance management tools.
 Generate insights leveraging customer data to enable customer-first strategy and planning cross functionally.
 Understand the business and develop both prescriptive and predictive analytics to help identify and resolve business challenges and data needs.
 Employ data mining techniques to generate insights and identify opportunities to help drive business growth or address business needs.
 Aggregate disparate and broad data sources, and synthesize insights into actionable recommendations by developing scorecards and executive presentations or communications.
 Demonstrate business and analytical acumen by providing answers to questions posed by cross-divisional partners regarding customers and their behaviour across the entire journey.
 Support design and operationalization of customer and business insights dissemination processes (e.g., dashboards, scorecards, etc.) to inform strategic, management and operational programs and investments.
 Develop solutions and make recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy.
 Lead/participate in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions.
 Providing contingency support on production reports and solutions as required to teammates.
 Responsible for providing day-to-day mentoring and support to other team members to assist in individual and team development.


 WHAT WILL YOU NEED?

 Bachelor's degree required in Data Analytics, Computer Science or equivalent work experience in a technology or business environment.
 Team player skills with a collaborative style.
 Demonstrated experience with organizational data analytics projects and initiatives; and working knowledge of analytics best practices, data design, architecture, and governance.
 Strong problem-solving skills with an ability to work through business problems and create solutions to meet objectives.
 Great verbal and written communicators, including technical writing and the ability to debate or talk through complex scenarios.
 Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications (Excel, Access), and any data visualization software tools.
 Proven time management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
 Proficiency with BI platforms and data visualization tools an asset (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik, etc.).
 Experience with SQL, Python, R for data processing is an asset.


 WHAT DO WE OFFER?

 We live and breathe our core values. We go the extra mile. We're honest. We always have each other's back. We have tons of integrity. And we always own it and adapt – no matter the challenge.
 With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there's no limit to the impact you can make.
 We provide a competitive compensation package composed of a group benefits plan, rent subsidy and discretionary profit-sharing program.
 We are committed to a strong safety work environment.


 Subject to reasonable accommodation, this position will require the successful candidate to show proof of a vaccination.
 What makes us different makes us stronger. We want Avenue Living to be a great place to work for everyone; where people feel safe, included, inspired, trusted and supported so they can be, and bring, their best.
 We're committed to creating a respectful and inclusive workplace where unique perspectives, experiences, backgrounds, cultures and attributes are valued and utilized to help achieve better results. As an organization with operations across different geographies, we celebrate the fact that our workforce is made up of people with diverse demographics.
 We are committed to ensuring our workplace is fair, equitable and free of discrimination and harassment.
 #LI-PRIO

Title: Business Development Associate, External Development Intelligence (XDI)
Description:
Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.
XDI's purpose is to accelerate development by identifying the world's best external partners, ensuring successful engagements, and sharing industry knowledge.
As part of EA Create, we search the globe for trusted and talented external partners to work with EA Studio game teams and central technology teams. We are a central team that owns EA’s due diligence evaluation process and risk management process. We support multiple disciplines, including co-dev, porting, art, animation, cinematics, UX-UI, engineering, and audio.
Key Responsibilities:

Partner evaluations and due diligence reporting using XDI’s risk management framework.
Supporting strategic partner portfolio management including regular check-ins and on-site assessments with established partners to ensure ongoing trust and viability.
As a key partner in EA’s Game Development Framework we support a portfolio of internal game teams and central tech teams by consulting on external development strategy, recommending partners, providing partner risk assessments, and occasionally helping with issue resolution.
Collaboration with a broad cross section of central teams including Legal, Security, Audit, Global Strategic Sourcing, Finance, Compliance, and other central roles to ensure clear process and program management of EA’s requirements for working with external partners.

Team Related:

The XDI team works in a mostly distributed fashion. We have members in Redwood Shores (California), Stockholm (Sweden), Vancouver (British Columbia), Orlando (Florida) and Shanghai (China)
We interface with team members and partners around the globe. Our work is primarily conducted using Zoom, email, Slack, and project management tools.
Early morning or evening calls and travel (when possible) are a reality for this role as we interface with global partners and teams. That said, our team is encouraged to strive for work life balance and to proactively manage capacity in a way that supports this goal.
Candidates with a strong preference for an in-person team dynamic may not thrive in this role as much communication and collaboration is now done remotely.
Our team members know that our team doesn’t start and stop with XDI. It’s important to expand our network (both within EA and externally).
Our team members are self-directed with an ability to quickly surface the right information at the right time to those who need it.

Business Partnerships:

XDI manages EA’s Strategic Partner portfolio. As an associate, you will be a supporting point of contact for a subset of this portfolio. You will assist in evaluating development and operational risks, issue resolution, and have a high degree of integrity when it comes to conducting oneself with outside key partners.
You will share critical knowledge about our partners with XDI, other Business Development groups, and teams across the company to ensure those working with our partners access the information they need to make key decisions.

Experience & Capabilities:

Our team strikes a fine balance between advocacy for our partners, both internal and external, and conducting risk evaluations to ensure EA’s IP is protected. Candidates have to be able to do both.
Ability to think and act globally. We interact with EA teams and external partners from all over the globe. We expect our team members to conduct themselves with high integrity and embrace cultural differences, value diverse opinions, and do their part to promote an inclusive development environment.
Demonstrated business acumen: this role requires objective decision making, and excellent collaboration ability with diverse teams and partners.
Lifelong learner who is inquisitive and enjoys knowledge acquisition as much as knowledge sharing. Should have a degree of comfort with public speaking, delivering presentations/panels, and facilitating brainstorming sessions.
Game development experience is highly desirable.
Experience in centralized departments such as studio operations, publishing, licensing, program management, business development are highly transferable for this role.
You will be expected to travel on-site to visit your partners on occasion and while often you will travel with other XDI team members or EA game team members there are times you will be asked to travel alone. Must have a degree of comfort with business travel and everything that comes with it (expense reports, airports, time zone changes, etc). On average, XDI team members do one international trip (1 week+/- duration) and 2-3 short domestic trips a quarter.

XDI Team Values:

Collaborative team players.
Ethical, fair, objective decision makers.
Support and solution focused.
Think and act globally.
Work life balance is key to our success.
Self-directed with inner drive.
When the going gets tough, the tough get going!
Influence without ego.
Passion and enthusiasm.

Reporting:
This role reports to a Manager of External Development Intelligence, as part of the EA Create organization.


 Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.
 We operate or service some 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated employees to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.
 You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.
 So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.
 Your role

Identify, evaluate, document and validate technical, functional and business needs in order to make improvements to existing computer systems, in order to implement a new solution that better meets the needs of the organization.
Document and execute the various tests (unit, functional, automated) that will validate the quality and proper functioning of a program

Work with internal development teams as well as external partners.

French and English written and oral
Experience in BI
Understand the software development cycle, be able to write scripts and be able to review the solutions implemented by other developers in order to identify bugs
Must have good analytical and communication skills
Must also be organized, meticulous, rigorous, and be able to write documentation.
Also demonstrate some creative spirit
Support and contribute to project management activities by participating in defining and estimating project effort, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating the status of the project activity and timely notification and escalation of possible issues/problems to the Project Manager
Support collaboration with key stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact on existing work processes and systems and how to manage integration
Maintain continuous communication with all stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle
Manage own workload to deliver quality results and meet deadlines
Able to assess the appropriate level of priority and detail and/or effort on a given project.
Demonstrate effective problem-solving skills.
Availability to do support outside of Open Hours.

The qualifications we are looking for

SQL Server / SQL Language
Knowledge of Oracle (SQL and PLSQL)
Knowledge of PowerBI or any other reporting software (MicroStrategy an asset)
Expertise in Excel with good knowledge of VBA is an asset
Azure Analysis Services / Visual Studio (Microsoft Analysis Service Project)
Relational Database Management Systems (knowledge of relational model principles)
Frequent communication in English with internal/external partners and/or clients/employees outside of Quebec


Quality


Creative, imaginative and curious with a great DIY mentality, along with self-learning interest
Good knowledge of the business and ability to understand users’ needs and problems; commercial finance understanding.
Problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Self-motivated, proactive and autonomous
Good organization and time management skills, easily adapting to changing priorities and ability to cope with deadline pressure
Ability to work directly with clients



 Your benefits of working for Lowe’s Canada: 
By joining the Lowe’s Canada family, you’ll enjoy many benefits, such as:

A fitness centre, sports activities, and showers
A childcare centre that can accommodate up to 78 children
A cafeteria with a delicious menu prepared by a dedicated chef, healthy options, as well as FARO Roasting Houses and Tim Hortons coffee stations
Exclusive employee discounts, plus a 10% discount on store merchandise (at all Lowe’s Canada locations)
Benefits: retirement savings plan, annual bonuses, stock purchase plan, student incentive program, etc.
Flexible hours and remote working
Electric car charging stations
Career growth opportunities within the company
An inclusive and safe working environment
Promotion of work-life balance
An employer that’s involved in the community
And much more!



 The masculine generic is used without discrimination and only in order to simplify the text. Lowe’s Canada is committed to encouraging diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, or any other status protected by law.

Title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst (SQL)
Description:
Overview: 
 
   At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions.
 


 Neo is looking for an experienced and customer-driven Business Intelligence Analyst (SQL) to join our team at our Calgary, AB headquarters.
  What you'll be doing:: 
 
Reviewing and analyzing data from multiple sources
 Creating, maintaining, and updating company dashboards for the growth team
 Using SQL to Develop Business Contextualized Databases off of Raw Data, specifically relating to productivity metrics and funnel optimization reporting
 Writing SQL queries to store, sort and retrieve data for further analysis
 Extracting and communicating insights from data
 Handling day-to-day data requests
 Engaging with the data engineering team to ensure data quality and integrity
 Reviewing data reports
 Who we're looking for:: 
 
4+ years of experience working in Databricks, Snowflake or other data warehouses
 2+ years of experience creating and maintaining dashboards
 Proven track record of being able to convert data into meaningful insights
 Strong proficiency level of SQL.
 Experience using tools such as Looker, PowerBI, or Tableau
 Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada and willing to relocate to Calgary
 About applying with us:: 
 
   At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future.
 


 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Staff - Non Union
 

   Job Category
  M&P - AAPS
 

   Job Profile
  AAPS Salaried - Information Systems and Technology, Level E
 

   Job Title
  Senior Business Analyst
 

   Department
  Ecosystem | Delivery | Leadership | Integrated Renewal Program Student | Enrollment and Academic Facilities | VP Academic
 

   Compensation Range
  8,647.50 - $13,511.58 CAD Monthly
 

   Posting End Date
  July 3, 2022
 

   Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.
 


   Job End Date
  Nov 30, 2024
 

   There will be two (2) vacancies for this position
 


   Job Summary
 

   UBC has embarked on a multi-year journey to transform its academic and administrative support processes and system environments for the entire UBC community. In November 2020, UBC successfully went live with its new HR and Finance implementation of Workday. The Integrated Renewal Program (IRP) is now focused on the journey to renew the Student information ecosystem, anchored by the implementation of Workday Student.
 


   The Integrated Renewal Program—Student (IRP Student) vision is to transform the way UBC supports learning and research, and how UBC works, to create a cohesive, integrated, and enriched experience for students, staff, and faculty. This implementation will result in superior support for UBC students, a better user experience, a new set of tools, a new way of working, and improved reporting for informed decision-making. IRP Student will leverage the industry-leading cloud enterprise solution Workday to replace our current core Student administration systems with a new integrated, user friendly, mobile-enabled platform.
 

 For more information on the IRP, please visit 
  
   www.integrated-renewal.ubc.ca
  



   The Senior Business Analyst analyzes business needs and develops overall strategies for how automated systems can be used to support the short- and long-term direction of the business.
 


   The Senior Business Analyst provides expertise in the areas of requirements definition, business process definition, business process analysis and design, functional design, configuration, implementation, testing, training, facilitation and documentation to deliver enterprise solutions to the UBC community. The Senior Business Analyst may manage the entire lifecycle of sub-projects which include developing a project plan, coordinating the activities of a project team, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing schedules to ensure timely completion of project.
 


   As part of the Student Delivery Centre, the Ecosystem Delivery team focuses on the required IT & Business Changes to ensure business continuity for the impacted UBC ecosystem. There are three standard change types associated with Ecosystem delivery for in scope applications: (1) Retrofits - Code & integration changes to legacy (2) Integration - Common service subscription or bespoke API builds (3) Sunsets - Decommissioning of an application as its functionality is replaced with Workday and/or other applications.
 

 Organizational Status
   The Senior Business Analyst will work closely with IRP project team members, including project managers, business analysts, developers, functional experts, and other project specialists. This role will report into the Associate Director, Ecosystem Delivery. Strategic or day-to-day direction on work performed may also be provided by various cross-functional leader of IRP – Student team
  
 Work Performed
 

   Specific Duties:
 

Supports team members in, as well as leads the assessment of client needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to identify business priorities and recommend options for the implementation of business solutions.
Facilitates working groups effectively within the complex team structure within the IRP Program to achieve desired outcomes
Develops and delivers effective presentations and workshops
Leads and conducts workflow and gap analysis for operational support processes.
Acquires and maintains a working knowledge of the university's technical and business environment.
Understands and applies business architecture concepts to analysis to ensure strategic alignment with organizational goals, outcomes and business value.
Develops and maintains a productive working relationship with project sponsors, vendors, key stakeholders other project teams, including technical teams for data conversion, reporting, security and integrations
Works with multiple vendors to foster effective working relationships in order to ensure alignment with project goals and deadlines
Manages multiple operational projects and provides work direction and leadership to associated project teams, including scheduling, assignment of work, review of project efforts and removal of roadblocks that may inhibit project success.
Conducts needs analysis, plans, organizes, manages, monitors, completes, and evaluates projects within allocated time and resources
Identifies, obtains and effectively manages organizational resources (e.g., people, materials, assets, budgets)
Conducts comprehensive and in-depth feasibility studies for projects and enhancements.
Develops user test cases and validates test results during user acceptance testing and system acceptance testing, operational acceptance testing.



   Core Duties:
 

Analyzes business needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes).
Develops overall strategies and provides advice on options, risks and costs versus benefits.
Communicates with stakeholders of varying technical ability and subject matter expertise and explains services to clients of all management levels to ensure they have a clear understanding of IT roles, processes, and activities.
Manages liaison relationship with clients to ensure technical solutions meet user needs.
Conducts feasibility studies and drafts proposals for evaluation by appropriate users and managers.
Develops and assists in the presentation of business cases.
Leads short and long-term planning sessions to implement integrated business process improvements.
Identifies, elicits, and documents business requirements, defines business rules and communicates requirements for the implementation of business solutions.
Prepares functional, system and program specifications bridging multiple projects.
Reviews test plans and monitors the testing process to ensure that business results are adequately tested with minimal risk.
Procures technical assistance to help in problem resolution.
Provides technical leadership, coaching and mentoring to less-experienced individuals.
Maintains appropriate professional designations and up-to-date knowledge of current information technology techniques and tools.
Performs other related duties as required.


 Consequence of Error/Judgement
   Decisions and actions taken by the Senior Business Analyst will have a direct impact on how efficiently and effectively the systems and processes will perform and function. Errors in judgment, poor analysis, or failure to act decisively could have a detrimental effect and adversely impact the university community, affecting up to tens of thousands of students, faculty and staff, and could result in lost productivity, funding and revenue.
  
 Supervision Received
 

   The Senior Business Analyst reports directly and works under general direction of the Associate Director, Ecosystem Delivery or day-to-day direction on work performed may also be provided by Project Manager, Ecosystem Delivery.
 

   Must be able to work independently as well as contribute actively and collaborate openly as a team member.
 

 Supervision Given
   Plans, directs and supervises work of project team members, such as other business analysts, consultants, quality assurance analysts, and other staff assigned to the project.
  
 Minimum Qualifications
   Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. Minimum of eight years of related experience including at least two years of managerial experience, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
  
 Preferred Qualifications
 


Experience on large project teams implementing transformational change
Experience in a higher education environment is an asset
Formal certification from a recognized professional organization or professional development provider is an asset
Demonstrated ongoing career development through active and self-motivated professional development in the field of Business Analysis.



Demonstrated effective leadership, consulting, consensus building, conflict resolution, and negotiation and team-building skills
Proven ability to work effectively and diplomatically with a wide range of individuals at all organizational levels.
Proven ability to develop and maintain a productive working relationship with project sponsors, vendors and key clients.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively, work in a fast-paced environment, and manage responsibilities and tasks to meet time sensitive, critical deadlines.
Working knowledge of project management, quality assurance, change management disciplines and best practices; and development methodologies.
Demonstrated knowledge and proven experience in producing BRDs, use cases, user scenarios, user stories, BPMs.
Good knowledge of application implementation methodologies and best practices
Ability to effectively facilitate groups to achieve appropriate outcome.
Ability to develop and deliver effective presentations and workshops.
Ability to identify, obtain and effectively manage organizational resources (e.g., people, materials, assets, budgets).
Experience in a higher education environment is an asset.
Experience with agile practices, patterns and techniques.
Working Knowledge of business process re-engineering improvement.
Knowledge of data analysis and data modeling (conceptual, logical).
Solid understanding of key trends and players in the IT industry and higher-education sector.
Excellent organizational, planning, and prioritization skills.
Superior interpersonal skills.
Demonstrates the willingness, ability, and enthusiasm to learn new processes, methodologies, or technologies.
Proven knowledge and continuous learning of business analysis discipline and best practices.
Demonstrated contributions to the continuous improvement of business analysis practices, methodology, and implementation.
Working knowledge of user experience
Scrum master experience is an asset.
Staff management experience is an asset.
Experience in project management tools (Microsoft Project, Smartsheet, JIRA & Confluence) is an asset.



   Core Competencies:
 

   Collaboration - Consistently fosters collaboration and respect among team members by addressing elements of the group process that impedes, or could impede, the group from reaching its goal. Engages the right people within and beyond organizational boundaries, by matching individual capabilities and skills to the team's goals. Works with a wide range of teams and readily shares lessons learned and credit for team accomplishments.
 

   Communication for Results - Converses with, writes reports for, and creates/delivers presentations to all levels of colleagues and peer groups in ways that support problem solving and planning. Seeks a consensus with business partners. Debates opinions, tests understanding, and clarifies judgments. Brings conflict into the open empathetically. Explains the context of multiple interrelated situations, asks searching, probing questions, and solicits expert advice prior to taking action and making recommendations.
 

   Problem Solving - Diagnoses problems using formal problem-solving tools and techniques from multiple angles and probes underlying issues to generate multiple potential solutions. Proactively anticipates and prevents problems. Devises, facilitates buy-in, makes recommendations, and guides implementation of corrective and/or preventive actions for complex issues that cross organizational boundaries and are unclear in nature. Identifies potential consequences and risk levels. Seeks support and buy-in for problem definition, methods of resolution, and accountability.
 

   Role Based Competencies:
 

   Analytical Thinking - Determines criteria for assessing issues and opportunities. Establishes clear goals and priorities needed to assess performance. Identifies relationships and linkages between different information sources. Anticipates issues that are not readily apparent on the surface. Identifies root causes and effects. Establishes clear goals and priorities. Anticipates potential problems and develops solutions needed to resolve them. Systemically analyzes relationships between apparently independent problems and issues. Reviews and cross-reviews reports. Identifies trends as well as isolated events. Translates analytical reports into management presentations, and provides guidance to resolve issues. Anticipates the possible outcome of potential solutions. Identifies areas of significant concern or opportunity. Probes and initiates research to identify critical problems.
 

   Business Process Knowledge - Describes and documents critical cross-functional business process flows. Applies business process reengineering techniques and methods in analyzing process flow and accountability charts.
 

   Recommends and advocates substantive process enhancements and assesses both internal and external implications.
 


   Initiative - Describes future scenarios and related opportunities. Plans potential responses involving resource holders, peers, processes, and technology. Leads a timely response, seeking internal/external advice and consultation, and sustains progress through uncharted territories.

Title: POLICY ANALYST INTERN (INDIGENOUS)
Company: Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development
Description:
Experience working in the Ontario Public Service – grow your future.

 The OPS is dedicated to recruiting and advancing top talent while building a diverse public service that is reflective of Ontario's population and communities. This exciting opportunity offers recent Indigenous post- secondary graduates the opportunity to develop their careers and gain valuable work experience with one of Canada's Top 100 Employers.
  
 Bring your knowledge, experience and perspectives to the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development. Working with a team of engaged professionals and dedicated leaders, you'll take the next step in your career in a dynamic environment that provides opportunities for personal growth, competitive salary, mentorship, learning and development opportunities, and work-life balance.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role? There are three Policy Analyst Intern opportunities. You will be asked to identify and rank which area(s) you are interested in applying for in your cover letter:
  

Office of the Fairness Commissioner - Bay Street or Dundas Street


The Office of the Fairness Commissioner's mandate is to assess the registration practices of certain regulated professions and trades to make sure they are transparent, objective, impartial and fair for anyone applying to practise his or her profession in Ontario.
In this capacity, the Office works closely with the trades and regulators and uses a variety of tools (including education) to ensure compliance with the Fair Access to Regulated Professions and Compulsory Trades Act and parts of the Regulated Health Professions Act.
The OFC has recently moved to a new risk informed compliance framework, which will require research and analysis to develop ways to work with high risk regulators to improve their registration practices, and how to gather and use quantitative information for future risk assessments.


 Strategic Policy Division, Data Analytics and Research Branch - Front Street


The Labour Market Information and Research (LMIR) unit undertakes cross-divisional and ministry studies and projects related to labour market, workforce development and training issues and trends.
The unit also provides advice and helps formulate strategies to build the division's capacity in the design, development and implementation of labour market information related policies and programs.
LMIR leads policy and program consultations, including liaising with stakeholders, to obtain input/feedback on policy/program initiatives, identify issues/concerns and prepare summaries of findings for senior staff. 


Workforce Policy and Innovation Division, Strategic Partnerships and Evaluation Branch - Front Street


The Inter-jurisdictional Relations Unit (IJRU) leads Ontario's collaboration with the federal government, provinces and territories on labour market policy and funding.
It undertakes strategic analysis of present and future workforce development trends and issues using an inter-governmental lens and offers expert advice to advance Ontario's workforce development positions, priorities, and objectives. 
IJRU works across government and with other jurisdictions on the strategic management of the Canada-Ontario Labour Market Transfer Agreements, to provide leadership through the Forum of Labour Market Ministers and other tables, and to support policy and coordination on domestic labour mobility issues.


 Alternative work arrangements may be available to successful candidate(s) living outside 125 KM of the work location.

 How do I qualify?
 Mandatory

You must have graduated from a college or university, with a degree, diploma or post-graduate certificate, within the past 5 years.
You must be an Indigenous person (i.e. First Nations, Métis, Inuit).


 View Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) for Indigenous Self-Identification 


Analytical and Research skills:

You can provide research support to projects and branch initiatives.
You can gather and analyze information to support the development of recommendations and resolutions to issues.
You can interpret and apply legislation, policies, processes and procedures.

 Communication skills:

You can prepare and present various documents, including presentations, reports, summaries.
You can clearly and concisely communicate information and recommendations.

 Interpersonal and teamwork skills:

You can establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues and stakeholders at varying levels to seek and exchange information.
You can participate and contribute to working groups.

 Planning and organizational skills:

You are able to plan, organize, and manage multiple tasks and projects with competing deadlines.

 Computer proficiency:

You are proficient using common office productivity software (i.e. word processing, spreadsheets, presentations) to draft documents and reports, prepare presentations, conduct analysis, and perform research on the internet.

 OPS Commitment to diversity, inclusion, accessibility, and anti- racism: We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.
  
 We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.
  
 Visit the 
  OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the 
  OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.
  
 We offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of 
  Ontario's Human Rights Code. Refer to the application instructions below if you require a disability-related accommodation.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Since our inception in 2010, OAK+FORT has curated collections that reflect our design philosophies. OAK + FORT is a belief that fashion should be uncomplicated and thoughtfully designed. We are not distracted or fettered by trends. We will continue to provide attainable luxury to like-minded individuals.
 POSITION SUMMARY
 Oak + Fort is hiring an experienced Business Analyst to ensure processes and technologies used are on path of continuous improvement and aligned with corporate objectives.
 Reporting to the Vice President of IT and eCom, this position will analyze business requirements and address them through process and solution enhancements supporting our omnichannel retail business. The successful candidate will lead the design, configuration, testing, and implementation of solutions, troubleshoot and assist users with reporting and data analysis. Experience in an enterprise retail environment is required.
 RESPONSIBILITIES Business Analysis 80%

 Gather and manage technical and functional requirements through clear and precise documentation. 
Collaborate with appropriate business units and production team members to understand capabilities and limitations.
 Lead process mapping and business process re-engineering workshops.
 Design, document, and implement processes and enhancements based on collaboration with end users and analysis of business requirements
 Ensure solutions follow industry best practices and solutions leverage system features and functionality where possible.
 Document functional and technical specifications in work packages for internal and external distribution.
 Document, develop and revise system design procedures, test procedures and quality standards, as well as updating system documentation.
 Conduct testing and data validation in system test environments, validation that system setup and configurations meet end user specifications.
 Lead UAT and change management, ensuring the successful implementation and adoption of solutions 
Work closely with application vendors, support groups, and internal users and escalate issues for resolution

 User Support 20%

 Troubleshooting with end users across all business units
 Provide reporting and key data points to assist users in their roles.
 Assist staff in resolving issues, such as system incidents, as well as training users on core functionalities and enhancements.
 Coordinate sessions across business units to enhance communication and user adoption.

 BEHAVIOURS RELATED TO THE FUNCTION

 Proficient analytical and communication skills.
 Strong organizational and planning skills.
 Self-motivated and driven.
 Able to work in a team and independently.
 Maintains a positive attitude and remains calm in stressful situations.
 Demonstrates a high degree of adaptability and initiative.

 ACADEMIC SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

 Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of experience in a similar role, or equivalent 
Previous experience in systems implementation, enhancement and integration
 Proven track record in process improvement
 Exceptional communication and listening skills
 Must have desire and aptitude to work in technical, fast-paced atmosphere
 Good analytical and troubleshooting skills
 Related experience in the retail fashion apparel industry required
 Experience with NetSuite would be an asset

Title: Senior Credit Risk Analyst (New Grad) - 1-Year Contract
Description:
Address: 100 King Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Data Analytics & Reporting 
 
Applies knowledge of advanced analytic algorithms and technologies (e.g. machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to deliver better predictions and/or intelligent automation that enables smarter business decisions, improved customer experience, and drives productivity. Applies strong communication and story-telling skills to summarize statistical/algorithmic findings, draw business conclusions, and present actionable insight in a way that resonates with business/groups. Drives innovation through the development of Data & AI products that can be leveraged across the organization and establishes best practices in in alignment with Data & AI governance frameworks of BMO. 

Develops analytical solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. 
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of analytical solutions. 
Works with stakeholders to identify the business requirements, understand distinct problems and expected outcomes, and models and frames business scenarios which impact critical business processes and/or decisions. 
Works with various data owners to discover and select available data from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system, and alternative data) to fulfill analytical needs. 
Applies scripting / programming skills to assemble various types of source data (unstructured, semi-structured, and structured) into well-prepared datasets with multiple levels of granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions). 
Develops agreed analytical solution by applying suitable statistical & machine learning techniques (e.g., A/B testing, prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to test, verify, refine hypotheses.

Documents data flow, systems and processes in data collection to improve efficiency and apply use cases. 
Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses. 
Uses the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns. 
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment. 
Supports development of tools and delivers training for data analytics and AI. 
Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes. 
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.  Qualifications: 
Typically between 1-3 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Knowledge of visualization techniques and concepts. 
Knowledge of distributed computing and/or distributed databases. 
Experience with distributed computing language (e.g. Hive / Hadoop/ Spark) & cloud technologies (e.g. AWS Sagemaker, AzureML). 
Experience with programming languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R, SAS, SPSS, , Perl) and machine learning /deep learning algorithms/packages (e.g. XGBoost, H2O, SparkML). 
Experience in statistical analysis, data mining, and data cleansing / transformation. 
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Title: Retail FTP Analyst 8 month Co-op
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































 Job Title




































 Retail FTP Analyst 8 month Co-op
 





































 Job Description





































 What will you do?  Support the implementation and maintenance of RBC’s non-trading funds transfer pricing framework that o provides market and customer behavior based pricing guidance for the retail bank’s products and services; o transfers and/or prices interest rate and liquidity risks inherent in the products for risk management; and o provide a robust basis for market based performance management reporting  Perform reporting, data analytics, investigation of FTP queries and rates.  Work with senior team member to automate and enhance various reports, excel models, and processes.  Document funds transfer pricing methodologies, assumptions and processes.  Assist senior members of the FTP team with data extraction, reporting, power point decks and analysis relating to funds transfer pricing, product pricing and margin.  The incumbent may work with Liquidity and Interest Rate Risk Measurement and Management teams to ensure alignment between risk management and FTP mechanisms.

 Must-have

 Pursuing Undergraduate/Graduate Degree in one of the following: Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Risk Management.
 Excellent Excel, Microsoft Word and Power-point skills.
 Basic understanding of mathematical/financial principles, risk concepts.
 Basic understanding of bank’s products and balance sheet.
 Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.


 Nice-to-have

 Experience with VBA or other programming languages, databases (SQL Server), business intelligence (Tableau, Power BI), statistical software (R).
 Understanding of the drivers of bank margins across different products is an asset.
 Knowledge of Funds Transfer Pricing concepts and application.
 Preferably a student in the later years of the Degree program.


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
 Opportunities to building close relationships







































 Job Summary





































 The Retail FTP Analyst Co-op, Funds Transfer Pricing is responsible for supporting the maintenance and enhancement of funds transfer pricing methodologies and processes related to transfer of interest rate risk (IRR) and liquidity risk. The role has a direct impact on the management reporting of the transfer priced businesses (Canadian Banking, WM, I&TS platforms). 
  A good of understanding of financial/mathematical/economic concepts, bank’s products and balance sheet, and strong technical and analytical skills are preferred. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, are also preferred. 
  In the delivery of the above mandate, the position provides timely and actionable information to senior members of Corporate Treasury. The incumbent will have the opportunity to interact with Corporate Treasury, Finance and different lines of businesses and will get an opportunity to learn about the key drivers of the bank’s margin across various products.

 Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
