Title: Programmer Analyst
Description:
PROGRAMMER ANALYST
Permanent, Full-Time position
The Sudbury Catholic District School Board is located in Northeastern Ontario and serves approximately 6,000 students in 18 schools located in Greater Sudbury, as well as in Markstay and Killarney. Greater Sudbury is 3,627 square kilometers in area, making it the geographically largest municipality in Ontario and second largest in Canada. Greater Sudbury is considered a city of lakes, containing 330 lakes and the largest lake contained within a city, Lake Wanapitei. Our school board is host to and celebrates diverse cultures and is comprised of dedicated staff committed to high quality education that inspires and promotes lifelong learning. The Board is looking for a Programmer Analyst to join our dynamic Information Management Services team.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS
Education / Certification
3-year College education in Computer Science, Software Development, Database development & administration, or a related field.
Ministry of Labour Worker Health and Safety in 4 Steps Training (available on-line, click here).
Experience Required
Four years of work-related experience in enterprise level application, programming and database design, development and maintenance.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in a school board setting and knowledge of education sector information systems is an asset for the position.
KEY ACTIVITIES
Participates (under the functional guidance of the Senior Programmer Analyst) in the effective and reliable operation of corporate systems (e.g. HRP, Finance, Student Information System), as well as the interfaces between them and 3rd party systems/solutions, including data synchronization between HRP, student information system (SIS), email and Active Directory systems.
Participates in the administration and management of corporate and student data (SIS, HRP, Finance, etc), including analyzing, aggregating information from various sources, and providing insight into relevant business intelligence gleaned for those information sources.
Perform data analysis and manipulation to meet system needs, as well as migration and integration of corporate data & systems, including 3rd party systems.
Research, suggest and design/develop innovative and effective programming solutions (using a variety of tools and/or software such as Excel, PowerBI etc.) to meet identified needs.
Provide technical support for various systems (e.g. Web server, In-house custom systems, Office 365 applications, Sharepoint, Teams, Exchange Online, etc) as well as assist in technical support for end-users.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
Scope of Knowledge
Sound knowledge of enterprise level programming and scripting (including open source as well as Microsoft based environments).
Sound knowledge of systems analysis and documenting design requirements.
Strong knowledge and experience in Excel, as well as data manipulation and analysis, and the ability to communicate information effectively.
Basic knowledge of software licensing and copyright concepts and regulations.
Skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, especially in relation to providing support in the implementation, operation and maintenance of student information, financial, and HRP systems (both on-premise and 3rd party services).
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to demonstrate and explain general and complex system and information topics, policies, and practices. Ability to respond in a reasonable manner to inquiries from other departments, various ministries, and Board partners. Skill is required in adapting the format and content of communication for audiences with varying ranges of technical sophistication. Ability to actively listen and respond to the needs of the end user through consultation and to express a clear understanding of the requirements.
Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to provide accurate and timely information while managing multiple conflicting deadlines.
Occasional travel to schools within the Board’s jurisdiction requiring a valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle.
Physical Requirements
Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals.
The annual salary range for this position is $66,468 to $83,092 with a comprehensive benefit package.
For more information on this opportunity and working for the Sudbury Catholic District School Board, please visit www.sudburycatholicschools.ca. Please contact Human Resources Services for the fully detailed job description.
Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply online: sign in/register through sudburycatholicschools.simplication.com. Please complete the information requested under the ‘Portfolio’ Tab including the contact information for three professional references, attach a cover letter and resume by 12:00 p.m., July 4, 2022.
Please note that an acceptable Police Record Check, Vulnerable Sector Check, is a condition of employment.
The Sudbury Catholic District School Board is committed to building a diverse and qualified workforce which reflects and serves the needs of its students and its communities, and supports the mission, vision and values of the Board.
All applicants are thanked for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
In accordance with the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, personal information is being collected under the authority of the Education Act and will be used for employee recruitment and selection purposes. For questions about this collection of information please contact Human Resources Services at (705) 673-5620.
If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, or if you have questions about this collection of information, please contact Human Resources Services at (705) 673-5620.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $66,468.00-$83,092.00 per year
Schedule:

Day shift
Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-07-04

Title: FP&A Analyst
Description:
About Behavox
 Behavox is shaping the future for how businesses harness their most important raw material - data. Our mission is bold: Organize enterprise data into actionable information that protects and promotes the business growth of multinational companies around the world. From managing enterprise risk and compliance to maximizing revenue and value, our data operating platform presents a widespread opportunity to build multilingual, AI / ML - based solutions that activate data for every function within a global enterprise.
 Our approach is unique, and it's validated by our customers who tell us to keep forging ahead because no one else is aggregating, analyzing, and acting on data to uncover opportunities or solve problems quite the way we are.
 We are looking for fearless innovators who have an insatiable appetite for building what no one has built before. 
About the Role
 We're looking for a self-motivated finance analyst with a strong commercial analytical ability to join our FP&A team. The role will support our Head of FP&A with budgeting and forecasting process for the company, together with regular analysis of financial performance.
 This role is a great opportunity for the right talented individual to:
 1) Build on your financial skills & experience within an exciting and growing finance team and company.
 2) Develop a deep understanding of the technology strategy behind an exciting tech growth story.
 3) Be part of a transformative finance function that is setting the foundations for a future IPO.
 What You'll Bring

3-5+ years of business finance or other relevant experience (preferably in a SAAS company).
Ability to analyze data and prepare well-structured reports/summaries to facilitate decision-making processes.
Tech-Savviness as well as being a fast-learner, able to grasp new concepts and technologies for finance.
Financial Modelling skills & experience with the proven ability to build well-grounded forecasts.
Self-starter mentality with excellent interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills.

What You'll Do

Build financial models to determine the impacting business factors in MS Excel/Google Sheets.
Organize data flows within the model to improve analysis accuracy and process efficiency.
Provide valuable insights to business leaders by preparing management reporting packages, including Plan/Actual analysis.
Use a wide range of technical tools to solve financial modelling problems (external software / custom scripts for workflow automation).
Communicate across organisation effectively to drive business alignment and impact.

What We Offer

A truly global mission with a passionate community in locations all over the world
Huge impact and learning potential as our aspirations require bold innovation
Highly competitive compensation with 100% bonus pay already integrated
Benefits include fully covered health coverage for employee and family
Generous time-off policy and flexible work schedule

About Our Process
 We take Talent very seriously and we are building a community of extraordinary individuals working together in very high performing teams. We also know that the best Talent always has options so we believe that the process has to be a two way assessment - the company AND the candidate assessing the business needs alignment, the career next step alignment, and the cultural alignment.
 During the process we will begin by exploring the core factors regarding salary and location along with core experience and skills and values alignment. We will then deep dive explore the critical technical competencies we have identified for the role, and then we will deep dive in behavioural competencies.
 The most aligned candidate will then be asked to do a practical work task simulation activity so we can make sure that you will enjoy the kind of work the role requires, and this task will typically be presented and discussed with a group of colleagues and managers. Finally we may ask you to meet with a number of our senior leaders to make sure that you are making the most informed call possible.

Title: Supply Chain Analyst, 12 months contract
Description:
Conagra Brands is one of North America's leading branded food companies. We have a rich heritage of making great food, and a team that’s passionate about innovation and growth. Conagra offers choices for every occasion through iconic brands, such as Hunts, Aylmer, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, VH Sauces, Pogo and Vlasic®, and emerging brands, including Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein®, and Frontera®.
 


   We pride ourselves on having the most impactful, energized and inclusive culture in the food industry. For more information, visit 
  
   www.conagrabrands.ca
  .
 


   Conagra Brands est une des principales entreprises d’aliments de marque en Amérique du Nord. Son histoire est jalonnée de grands succès alimentaires qui sont le fruit du travail d’une équipe passionnée par l’innovation et la croissance. Conagra offre des choix pour toute occasion grâce à des marques réputées comme Hunt’s®, Aylmer®, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, les sauces VH®, Pogo®, Vlasic® et des marques émergentes, dont Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein® et Frontera®.
 


   Nous sommes très fiers d’avoir la culture la plus influente, la plus dynamique et la plus inclusive du secteur alimentaire. Pour en savoir plus, visitez 
  
   www.conagrabrands.ca
  .
 


   Position Summary:
 

   The Supply Chain Analyst position is primarily responsible for providing analytics, and data mining for supply and operations planning metrics. Build and automate reports/dashboards to identify opportunities for process improvements that improve service, speed, or cost, through analysis of supply chain information and metrics.
 


   Reporting to the Senior Demand Planner, this is an entry level position designed to provide general support to the supply chain function at Conagra and assist on projects as needed. The analyst will work closely with the Supply & Operations Planning team and various cross-functional teams to assist with developing long term sustainable decision support tools.
 


   Job Responsibilities:
 



     Manage large data and using it to consolidate and build insightful reports and dashboards, while partnering with stakeholders to increase understanding and adoption
   


     Liaises with internal and external parties as required, maintaining positive stakeholder relationships
   


     Supports supervisor in implementation of the S&OP strategies
   


     Recommends process improvements for area of responsibility
   


     Analyzes work processes with the objective of driving efficiency, service levels and cost reduction
   


     Statistically analyze, interpret, and manipulate data for forecasting models
   


     Assists with testing of new procedures and systems
   


     Collaborates with team members and communicates relevant information to leadership.
   


     Provides cover for colleagues where necessary
   


     Other duties as assigned
   



   Job Qualifications:
 



     University Degree or Community College Diploma in business related fields such as accounting, economics, statistics, computer science, supply chain or finance.
   


     Understanding of Data Management Principles
   


     Strong computer skills with Microsoft Applications, especially with Excel and Access
   


     Experience with Power BI, Sequel or similar applications are an asset
   


     Excellent analytical, organizational skills and be very detailed oriented
   


     Ability to quickly synthesize information to help drive results
   


     Clear and effective communication skills, both oral and written
   


     Can effectively interact and communicate with cross functional groups and different level of management.
   


     Passionate, self-motivated, results oriented, collaborative, accountable and creative
   



   Our Modern Workplace: Conagra’s culture of collaboration enhances our ability to meet critical business goals, deliver value to customers and consumers and provide you with the flexibility you need to achieve a better work-life balance. We carefully consider each role and how often each team member needs to collaborate in-person. This position requires you work from our Mississauga office 3 days a week.
  
 Notre Lieu de Travail Moderne: La culture de collaboration de Conagra améliore notre capacité à atteindre les objectifs d’affaires critiques, à offrir de la valeur aux clients et aux consommateurs et à vous offrir la flexibilité dont vous avez besoin pour parvenir à un meilleur équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée. Nous examinons attentivement chaque posts et la fréquence à laquelle chaque membre de l'équipe doit collaborer en présentiel. Ce poste exige que vous travailliez de notre bureau de Mississauga 3 jours par semaine.
 


   SF:LI
 
 Conagra Brands is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or any other protected factor. Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
The future you want is within reach.

 At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We’re a community of builders committed to building better communities. That’s why we’re always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what’s next in our industry.

 We’re also looking ahead at what’s next for you. We’re ready to help you build a career you’ll love — one where you get to use your best talents as you discover new ones along the way. If you can picture yourself working with a team that enjoys tackling challenges while encouraging each other to succeed, then you belong at PCL.

 If you see yourself growing with PCL as a Business Systems Analyst, apply to this posting and we’ll consider you for future opportunities.

 Once you apply, our recruitment team will review your application and contact you if your experience is a good fit for the position. In the meantime, sign up for our talent community so you can be the first to know about PCL opportunities.

 Here's how a Business Systems Analyst contributes to our team:



 Responsibilities



 Documents and analyzes data requirements and leads the business verification of data-conversion activities.
 Prepares training data and conditions and creates and updates training materials, and delivers training as required.
 Promotes adherence to processes and system best practices to maximize adoption and buy-in. Gathers and analyzes system-adoption data and metrics.
 Identifies opportunities for improved utilization of existing business applications and processes and integrates business process improvements with system improvements to create wholistic and cost-optimized processes.
 Defines and tracks metrics to measure project/solution success.
 Analyzes business problems to identify solutions and makes recommendations for improvement.
 Works in an Agile fashion, delivering projects according to accepted methods as directed by the department manager.
 Liaises with other teams and stakeholders to implement integrated cross-department processes.





 Qualifications



 Postsecondary degree or diploma in information management, information technology, business administration, computing science, or a related discipline.
 Certification from Business Analyst Body of Knowledge (BABOK) or International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA), or equivalent preferred.
 Effective verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas and concepts clearly and concisely.
 Strong ability to work effectively and collaboratively with employees at all levels and areas of the organization.
 Ability to independently conduct effective meetings and give presentations in support of various projects and deliverables.
 Experience with advanced system troubleshooting.
 Experience with relational database, cloud computing, mobile application delivery, and data integration.
 Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.




 PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scene of vacations, careers, education and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams.

 The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating equitable opportunities and an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We make employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status.

 Should you require an accommodation during the application process, please contact us at careers@pcl.com with the position and location you are interested in.

 Safety is a core value that guides everything we do. As such, all PCL salary and student employees based in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees may request an exemption due to medical condition(s) and other applicable human rights grounds. Learn more about PCL’s COVID-19 response to keeping our workplaces safe.

 Together, we can build success and a better future. Let’s get started!

 Primary Location: Edmonton, Alberta (Corporate)

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence
Description:
Requisition ID: 148637  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose of Job:

 The Manager, Business Intelligence, Retail Credit Risk, GRM will monitor and report on retail lending portfolios. Much of this will include creating dashboards and ad-hoc data pulls. As well, you will provide actionable insight to the Risk Management teams [Acquisition and Account Management] and business line partners.
 The role is highly technical and requires expert SAS, T-SQL, ETL, data analytics and BI tools skillset. The incumbent will deliver ongoing portfolio reporting and monitoring to senior management, as well as address ad-hoc data requests.

 Job Responsibilities:

 Retail Credit Risk Portfolios Tracking & Data Management

 Use a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (ex. SAS, SQL, Power BI, Tableau) to provide dynamic reporting on key performance metrics to various stakeholders in GRM and business lines. 
Define and help implement system enhancements to process improvements
 Assist in developing and implementation of BI strategy and supporting BI architecture for GRM inclusive of developing a roadmap, scope and implementation plan to advance data analytics and reporting maturity
 Managing and driving changes to reporting based on feedback from the senior management team and functional leads
 Respond to AdHoc requests from executives and key stakeholders with a sense of urgency. Perform required data pulls, reconciliations to answer questions. Prioritization and working on more than one request at a time is often required.
 Provide actionable insights and meaningful messages from the reporting to drive credit risk decisions. Able to tell a story by synthesizing vast amounts of data into coherent messages.
 Proactively provide strategic analysis that will assist in optimizing risk rewards ratios and grow the portfolios.
 Collaborate with Acquisition, Account Management and Collections teams to provide measurement and reporting on strategic initiatives such as acquisition dynamics and quality, line optimization and collections effectiveness


 Customer Focus

 Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions
 Using our data, continually develop and refine a more holistic customer view


 Innovation

 Explore opportunities for using latest innovative analytics, Business Intelligence and ETL tools to showcase portfolio dynamics, derive insights and streamline processes
 Aim to move from descriptive to prescriptive analytics by focusing on key drivers of portfolio risk and profitability


 Risk Appetite Framework alignment
 Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

 Job Requirements:


 Bachelor's Degree in Math, Engineering, Computer Science or Statistics
 5+ years related experience 
Strong development experience with T-SQL, Stored Procedures
 Working knowledge of implementation of ETL processes
 Must be proficient with Excel, SAS,T-SQL, Power BI, Tableau
 Strong communication skills essential with clients and management
 Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, presentation, project management, people management and relationship building skills
 2+ years’ experience in Retail Products would be a great asset
 2+ years’ experience in Risk Analytics would be a great asset


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Research and Statistical Analyst
Company: Association pour la santé environnementale du Québec - Environmental Health Association of Québec
Description:
ENGLISH TEXT BELOW
Analyste statistique
L'Association pour la santé environnementale du Québec (ASEQ-EHAQ) est à la recherche d'un(e) analyste statistique, pour un poste contractuel à temps plein, à partir du 4 juillet 2022, ou avant, jusqu'au 31 décembre 2022.
À propos de l'ASEQ 
L'ASEQ-EHAQ est un organisme de bienfaisance sans but lucratif qui vise à améliorer le bien-être des personnes souffrant d'hypersensibilité environnementale/de sensibilité chimique multiple. Nous créons des projets qui visent à lutter contre l'isolement social, à fournir des solutions écologiques pour la vie quotidienne et à promouvoir une vie saine. Nous comptons actuellement près de 2000 membres de partout au Canada et dans le monde qui bénéficient et participent à nos nombreux projets et services de soutien et de formation.
Résumé du poste 
Le titulaire du poste sera appelé à analyser et à interpréter les données d'enquête de l'Enquête sur la santé dans les collectivités canadiennes (ESCC) afin de concevoir un projet et un cadre méthodologique statistique pour répondre aux questions de recherche liées à la sensibilité chimique multiple.
Rôles et responsabilités 
· Effectuer une analyse documentaire de la portée de la compréhension actuelle et des lacunes dans les connaissances sur la sensibilité chimique multiple au Canada.
· Identifier les variables d'intérêt dans l'ESCC en relation avec la littérature et la question de recherche.
· Identifier les tests statistiques pour répondre aux questions de la chercheuse.
· Utiliser un logiciel d'analyse statistique pour évaluer, analyser et visualiser les données pertinentes.
· Communiquer avec des organismes de financement, comme les Instituts de recherche en santé du Canada, afin d'élaborer un projet de recherche.
· Préparer les données pour la communication d'articles, de rapports ou de présentations
· Participer à des réunions de recherche virtuelles.
· Effectuer toutes les autres tâches liées au lancement du projet de recherche (approbation éthique, demandes de subventions gouvernementales, etc.)
Qualifications 
· Maîtrise en biostatistique, épidémiologie, santé publique ou dans un domaine connexe.
· Minimum d'un an d'expérience académique ou professionnelle dans l'utilisation de grandes données sur la santé et l'analyse quantitative.
· Bilinguisme en français et en anglais, à l'écrit et à l'oral.
· Connaissance de la conception et de la réalisation de grandes enquêtes sur la santé (ESCC)
· Expérience de l'utilisation de logiciels statistiques pour l'analyse de données quantitatives (SPSS, SAS, R)
· Excellent sens de l'organisation
· Expérience de la préparation de subventions auprès d'organismes gouvernementaux (IRSC, CRSH, FRQS) (atout)
· Connaissance des questions entourant la sensibilité chimique multiple (atout)
· Expérience de l'utilisation de Microsoft Office Word, Excel et PowerPoint pour analyser et présenter des données sur la santé de la population.
Conditions d'emploi 
35 heures / semaine, 20 $ / heure, Travail à distance.
Si vous répondez aux exigences de ce poste, nous vous invitons à faire parvenir votre curriculum vitae et une lettre de présentation à l'ASEQ-EHAQ à l'adresse bureau à aseq-ehaq.ca.
Statistical Analyst
The Environmental Health Association of Quebec (ASEQ-EHAQ) is looking for a statistical analyst, for a fulltime, contract position, beginning July 4, 2022, or earlier, until December 31, 2022.
About us
ASEQ-EHAQ is a non-profit, charitable organisation that aims to improve the well-being of individuals suffering from environmental sensitivities/multiple chemical sensitivity. We create projects that address social isolation, provide ecological solutions for everyday living and promote healthy lives. We currently have close to 2000 members from across Canada and around the world who benefit from and participate in our numerous projects and support and training services.
Position Summary 
The incumbent will be called upon to analyse and interpret survey data from the Canadian Community Health Survey (CCHS) to design a project and statistical methodological framework to answer research questions related to multiple chemical sensitivity.
Roles and Responsibilities 
· Perform a scoping literature review on the current understanding and gaps in knowledge on multiple chemical sensitivity in Canada
· Identify variables of interest in the CCHS in relation to the literature and the research question
· Identify statistical tests to answer research questions
· Employ statistical analysis software to assess, analyze, and visualize relevant data
· Contact funding agencies such as the Canadian Institute of Health Research in order to develop a research project
· Prepare the data for communication of articles, reports or presentations
· Participate in virtual research meetings
· Complete all other related tasks in relation to the initiation of the research project (ethics approval, government grant applications, etc.)
Qualifications 
· Master’s degree in biostatistics, epidemiology, public health or a related field
· Minimum of 1 year of academic or professional experience working with large health data and quantitative analysis
· Bilingualism in written and oral French and English
· Knowledge of the design and conduct of large health surveys (CCHS)
· Experience using statistical software to analyse quantitative data (SPSS, SAS, R)
· Excellent organizational skills
· Experience preparing grants with government organisations (CIHR, SSHRC, FRQS) (asset)
· Knowledge on the issues surrounding multiple chemical sensitivity (asset)
· Experience using Microsoft Office Word, Excel and PowerPoint to analyse and present population health data
Employment Conditions 
35-hours / week, $20 / hour, Remote work.
If you meet the requirements to fulfil this position, we encourage you to send your résumé and cover letter to ASEQ-EHAQ at office AT aseq-ehaq.ca
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $20.00 per hour
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:Person will be working online from home
Education:

Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

 Intermediate Production Support Legacy WMS Technical Analyst
  
 Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team

Use database management systems to complete complex SQL and PL/ SQL queries against large databases to perform data analysis to solve production support issues and use Nike proprietary tools for developing alerts to supervise system health and issues.

Track record of leading others & positive change in solution design, technical delivery, and process improvement



Demonstrated ability to pull together diverse team members with different goals and impact outcomes across loosely coupled teams



Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills to effectively engage with both business and technical IT teams



Ability to build and maintain relationships with peers and partners



Self-motivation, strong tolerance for ambiguity, and strategic agility

 Qualifications

2+ years SQL experience.
2+ years Manhattan 2011, DCMS, and/or WMi
2+ years Warehouse Management System experience in lieu of Legacy Manhattan WMS experience.
2+ years’ experience working as an IT Professional Analyst/Consultant

 Travel
  
 Yes, 5 % of the Time

Title: IM/IT Senior Business/Systems Analyst
Description:
Req ID: 134167 Company: Nova Scotia Health Location: Central Zone, Abbie J. Lane Memorial Building - QEII Department: IMIT Telecom Application Support Type of Employment: Permanent Hourly FT (100% FTE) x 1 position(s) Status: Management/Non Union Position Posting Closing Date: 4-Jul-22
 Nova Scotia Health is the largest provider of health services in Nova Scotia, with some specialized services also offered to clients throughout Atlantic Canada. We’re on a mission to achieve excellence in health, healing and learning through working together, which is reflected in the hospitals, health centres and community-based programs we operate across the province. Our passionate team of professionals provides a variety of high-quality inpatient and outpatient services including academic, tertiary, and quaternary care, as well as continuing care, primary health care, public health, and mental health and addictions. Join a diverse team of innovators, collaborators and creative thinkers today.

 Nova Scotia Health employs professionals in all corners of our beautiful province. We believe there's a place here for everyone to call home, from vibrant cities with exuberant nightlife to quaint towns with picturesque trails. The work-life balance that comes with an Nova Scotia Health role means you'll have the time to explore, discover, and participate in that coveted Atlantic lifestyle. Visit us today and check out www.novascotia.com to see why more people from across the globe are moving here.



 Responsibilities



      Business Analysis and Recommendations
     

Review and analyse business requirements with stakeholders.
Evaluate alternative vendor and in-house solutions, which take into consideration Provincial multi-departmental impacts and the complexities of various solutions.
Present recommendations to stakeholders.



      Application and Systems Management
     

Design and implement clinical communication application solutions in accordance with customer business requirements including a range of activities - from programming to configuration of turnkey software in consultation with relevant vendors.
Provide in-house maintenance for application software and/or liaise with the software vendor to ensure that upgrades and enhancements are applied and tested.
Assist user departments in defining their requirements for complex software applications, which often have multi-departmental impact.
Develop, implement and maintain application security. Install and maintain updates as required. Identify, apply, and test patches and upgrades to database, application and web server software.
Follow NSH Change Management policies and procedures
Become familiar with the operating environment of the hardware platform on which the application system resides.
 Documentation and User Support
     

Work with vendors and clients to develop user manuals and training materials.
Participate in training sessions for super users and staff.
Assist users during implementation and throughout the life of their applications.
Document automated and manual application management procedures associated with the application for the customer and Voice Services use.
Develop triage and troubleshooting procedures and processes.
Trains users in the operation of application software.



      Quality Assurance and Control
     

Unit, integrated, and user acceptance testing.
Assisting or managing application changes including scheduling, implementation, monitoring, documentation, and communicating to all stakeholders.
Participate in user department quality improvement and risk management projects to improve departmental procedures and workflows, as they apply to the application system.



      Triage and Issue Management
     

First point of contact for responding to and resolving application issues.
Triage and coordinate resolution of issues with vendors, IT resources, and clients.
Track resolution progress and escalate to management when appropriate.



      Supporting Responsibilities
     

Under the direction of the Clinical Communication Services Manager, assist or lead projects or initiatives as assigned. Duties include the development, evaluation, and maintenance of all associated documents such as: Project Plans, Request for Proposals, Work Breakdown Structure, Scope Definition, Statement of Work, Negotiation of Support Processes and Risk Management Plans
This position is required to provide after hours on-call support on a rotating schedule.



Travel to various sites through Nova Scotia will/may be required.





 Qualifications



A University Degree from a recognized university with a specialization in Computer Science, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in advanced Clinical communication applications in large enterprise environment
Minimum 10 years’ experience in Clinical communications systems preferred.
Demonstrates skills in the area of decision making, problem solving, and communications.
Knowledge and skills in the areas of needs analysis, hardware and software selection methodology and applications design.
Knowledge of project management tools and techniques.
Knowledge and skills in the areas of clinical communications, including, but not limited to, private branch exchanges (PBXs), significant experience with nurse call systems, RTLS, ACD and Call Centre Solutions as well as knowledge of paging technology includes the management of private paging networks and applications of the public paging network technologies.
Extensive knowledge of clinical integration engines; Nursecall (HillRom) and Centrak RTLS Systems.
Previous experience programming clinical interfaces
Experience supporting communications systems in a complex health care organizational environment considered an asset.
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to multi-task to meet tight deadlines
Strong interpersonal skills
 High level of accuracy and attention to detail
    

Understanding of IT communication tools and telehealth
Ability to execute through effective delegation, motivation and oversight
Experience in data analytics for decision support
Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Excellent verbal, written communication and influencing skills
Clearly communicates the NSHA vision, mission and values
Experience in working with patient care leaders
Ability to earn confidence, trust,and respect from colleagues; present ideas clearly and concisely and follow through on commitments.






 Hours of Work



 Full time permanent position; 75 hours bi-weekly





 Salary Information


 $35.27 - $44.09 hourly



 Once You've Applied
 Thank you for your interest in this position. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

 This is a Management/Non Union bargaining unit position. Preference is given to bargaining unit employees for unionized positions. Title: Senior Infrastructure Technical Analyst (Global Data Protection)
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 
Senior Infrastructure Technical Analyst (Global Data Protection) 

Role Description 
Does Cybersecurity Data Protection excite you? Want to take your cybersecurity career into a new challenge? Join GCS Global Data Protection team that have Unstructured Data Protection, Data Loss Protection (DLP), and Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) as focus solution areas. In this role you will work with unstructured data protection toolsets tailored to monitor and protect our hybrid on-prem and cloud environments as well as improve our security posture. 

What Will You Do: 

Demonstrate an expert knowledge of unstructured data discovery and file analysis tools (preferably Varonis platform), and a good understanding of DLP tools (Microsoft, Symantec, etc.) 
Administer, configure, support, health checks and design improvements for an enterprise wise Varonis platform which provides unstructured data discovery and security services for all on-prem and cloud storage. 
Provide guidance, recommendations, best practices, for Varonis platform operations. 
Design and implement Varonis platform integration with NetApp, SharePoint and cloud services (SaaS, PaaS, IaaS) 
Stabilize and optimize system performance, including rules and reports; improve operational efficiency by identifying and automating repetitive tasks 
Liaise with vendors on technical support, performance issues, scalability, and upgrades 
Develop technical standards, operating procedures, and/or runbooks for unstructured data discovery and classification operations 
Maintain ongoing project management and relationship development to ensure the highest level of customer service 
Follow Agile and DevOps methodology with active participation in sprint planning and stand-ups 
Ensure SLAs/SLOs/OLAs related to the availability, and incident, change, and service requests are met. 


Qualifications and Skills 

[must have] 3+ years of experience in a data security related operational role in a hybrid (on-prem and cloud native) environment with at least two years’ experience working as system administrator of Windows and /or Linux servers (physical and virtualized). 
[must have] Strong understanding configuring, implementing, and managing unstructured data discovery and analysis tools e.g., Varonis, Digital Guardian, or similar. 
[must have] Good understanding of cloud native solutions such as Azure, Google Cloud, and/or AWS 
In-depth knowledge of Active Directory, Azure Directory and/or related Directory services, PAM solutions (such as CyberArk, Centrify). 
In-depth knowledge of Windows and Unix File systems, and network file sharing protocols 
Good knowledge of networking technologies relating to VLAN, routing, and other IP related services such as DNS, DHCP 
Good knowledge of on-prem storage technologies (DAS, SAN, NAS) and cloud storage (block storage, storage buckets, blob storage) 
Good technical understanding of data protection, data security, data classification, application security concepts, standards, frameworks and related attack methods and mitigation best practices (e.g., OWASP, SANS, NIST, MITRE, etc.) 


Experience with automation and scripting using Python or PowerShell; experience creating Regular Expressions (regex) 
Exposure to metadata management and data tagging, and creating custom data analytics and reports 
Familiarity with agile scrum methodology 
Strong verbal and written communications skills with ability to effectively communicate technical details and thoughts in non-technical/general terminology to various levels of the organization 
Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in computer science, information technology security, or a related field 
System Administration Certification – Windows or Linux, desirable.

Title: BI Developer
Business Analyst
Description:
Company Profile
 De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing, and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.
 Position Summary
 De Havilland Aircraft of Canada is currently searching for Business Analysts to join our team in Mississauga, ON or Calgary, AB.
 Business Analysts are responsible for providing analytics, reporting, process management, and project management for the supply chain function. The successful candidate will be required to analyze, manipulate and integrate data from various sources and synthesize the information into reports that generate discrete actions that drive value for the organization. Business Analysts will also bring project management and process management expertise to drive execution of projects and optimize/align processes for the business. Business Analysts will work closely and build positive relationships with the supply chain, aftermarket, finance, and operations teams.
 At De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Limited, our employees work together worldwide. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.
 WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

 Competitive salary
 Full extended health and benefit plan
 The opportunity to join a growing organization with exciting products
 Great task diversity and unique challenges

 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

 Collect, integrate, and analyze various datasets to produce business performance reports and identify risks and issues on team projects to ensure delivery, quality, and cost objectives are achieved.
 Maintain & enhance key supply chain databases containing cost data, inventory data, revenue data, supplier data, & opportunity management initiatives.
 Support the supply chain team with on-demand data analysis & reporting to improve negotiation outcomes.
 Measure & monitor team performance on key projects & initiatives to ensure on-time performance.
 Work with various functions to solve business problems through process mapping and alignment sessions that enable the business’ IT solution and transformation objectives.
 Provide clear, concise and accurate recurring progress and impact reporting in compliance with Organization governance and management systems.
 Build positive relationships with suppliers as well as internal stakeholders from the working level to executive level to achieve program objectives.
 Gain a thorough understanding of the market for the product family and have a solid comprehension of suppliers’ capabilities, their positioning in the market, and their strategies.

 WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:

 Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Business Administration and/or have extensive experience in supply chain
 Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in business analytics/project management
 Experience in the aerospace industry and/or manufacturing environment (Asset)
 Experience on development programs and in supply chain/sourcing (Asset)
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
 Outstanding organizational and multi-tasking skills
 Strong presentation skills with excellent proficiency of MS PowerPoint, and ability to get into details as well as provide executive summaries of complex situations
 Comfortable dealing with all levels of an organization
 Strong financial acumen with excellent proficiency in MS Excel to analyze and compute large amounts of data
 Strong knowledge of MS Access or other database administration
 Results oriented and a team player comfortable working with all aspects of the organization
 Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and experience using ERP systems
 Ability to work in a highly technical environment
 PMP certification (Asset)
 Lean/Six Sigma certification (Asset)

 De Havilland Canada is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minorities to apply. De Havilland will accommodate the needs of applicants with disabilities throughout all stages of the selection process. If you need accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise your Talent Acquisition representative. Title: ADMN R18 - R24 (Developmental) - Policy Analyst, Medical Services Commission
Description:
Policy Analyst, Medical Services Commission Administrative Officer R18 – R24 (Developmental)
Developmental Opportunity- Applicants will be appointed to the appropriate classification level based on their qualifications.
An eligibility list may be established to fill future temporary and permanent vacancies.
NOTE: The recruitment process for this competition will take place virtually.
On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here.
Come be a part of policy development in the ever-changing health sector. The Ministry of Health is investing in Policy Analysts and now is a great opportunity for you to join, learn and apply your passion for policy analysis with a fantastic team.
About the Team:
The Health Sector Workforce and Beneficiary Services (HSWBS) Division is responsible for workforce planning and development and operational delivery of beneficiary services that contribute to effectively meeting patient and population health needs and improving patient outcomes through the efficient delivery of health services. There are over 100 policy positions in this division.
Each of these branches are contributing to the delivery of a coordinated Provincial Health Sector Human Resources & Workforce strategy. This is a unique opportunity to be a part of the implementation of a strategy of this size, scale and reach. The HSWBS division needs talented, diverse and passionate policy professionals to contribute.
The Beneficiary and Diagnostic Services Branch leads and is responsible for the beneficiary policy and services stemming from the Medicare Protection Act and administered through the Medical Services Plan (MSP). This includes but is not limited to eligibility, enrolment, residency, diagnostic services, the Travel Assistance Program, and Out of Country medical service requests.
The Branch leads and directs legislation and policy changes for MSP beneficiary programs and directs Health Insurance BC on approach and implementation on behalf of the Ministry.
The Branch provides secretariat and policy support to the Medical Services Commission and leads development and implementation of the Province’s response to extra billing.
The Branch is also responsible for the Supplementary Benefits program, including implementing negotiated agreements for midwives, dentists, osteopaths and optometrists and the fee for service payments for acupuncturists, chiropractors, dentists, massage therapists, midwives, naturopaths, physical therapists and podiatrists.
About the Job:
This is a developmental position with up to three levels. An entry level at Grid 18, an intermediate level at Grid 21 and the full working level at Grid 24. Initial level placement and movement along the continuum is based upon individual assessment of skill, competencies and experience. This position would be ideal for a new or aspiring Policy Analyst ready for learning, diverse task variety and steady progression through the levels. Read the description below for examples of work you’d be involved in.
This position supports the work of the Medical Services Commission (MSC). The MSC manages the Medical Services Plan (MSP) on behalf of the Government of British Columbia in accordance with the Medicare Protection Act and Regulations.
The Policy Analyst works with considerable independence and is expected to make a critical contribution to the Commission, realizing its mandate and meeting accountability requirements. They also analyze and develop policy and program alternatives and recommendations with respect to a wide range of issues emanating from decisions and discussions of the MSC.
This position provides issues management and support services to the MSC and assists the Ministry of Attorney General with various areas of litigation. The Policy Analyst manages assigned policy development projects focused on the review and revision of existing ministry programs or legislation.
Finally, extra billing is a core function for the Ministry of Health and the MSC and is a key deliverable of this position. The position supports the growing number of complex beneficiary complaints regarding extra billing.
The capital of British Columbia, Victoria is a beautiful city, with beautiful beaches and harbours, and a variety of provincial parks to explore. Located on Vancouver Island, Victoria offers a bustling downtown scene and has a wide range of restaurants and entertainment venues to choose from.
The BC Public Service is an award winning employer and offers employees competitive benefits, amazing learning opportunities and a chance to engage in rewarding work with exciting career development opportunities. For more information, please see What We Offer.
The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
For information about the Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service please visit: Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service - Province of British Columbia (gov.bc.ca).

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Role Summary:

Locate, review, and validate data on the company and market
Analyze big data to identify business performance, trends and patterns
Monitor process of data collection and storage
Produce insightful models and presentations for management
Assist team to improve data analytic and business intelligence techniques
Ensure security and confidentiality of all data and information


 
Qualifications:

Proven working success in Business Intelligence/ Analysis solutions
Proficient working knowledge and experience in Google Big Query, Power BI/ Tableau, Looker, JavaScript/ Python
Strong SQL knowledge
Experienced in creating technical documents and presentations

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
SE Health is currently seeking a Business System Analyst (BSA) for our Finance Technology division of the Information Services team. This role will provide support to the Enterprise within the Finance function and will have an opportunity to significantly impact organizational growth and effectiveness through delivering best in class technology solutions. This will be a Hybrid role, where you will be working mainly remote with the expectation to come into our Head Office located in Markham on an as needed basis.
Engaged in all phases of the application support and development lifecycle, the BSA would be responsible for analyzing challenging production issues, designing, testing, documenting and implementing new solutions for our dynamic customer base in Finance.
This position is a 12 month contract
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with the team to support, investigate, and resolve production issues in different Finance applications (both custom and Microsoft Dynamics – Great Plains)
Work collaboratively with functional areas to identify and document business requirements and obtain client sign off
Developing an in-depth understanding of business processes and recommend changes that leverage best usage of the application
Analyze current software to identify opportunities to optimize and improve efficiency of business processes
Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments
Assist in defining project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation 
Advise on technical issues involving configuration, development, integration 
Create or update programs and applications according to specifications 
Establish solid, working relationships with end users, software vendor, and our internal technical team members
Lead functional testing efforts for enhancements, fixes and upgrades.
Administer critical analysis of test results and deliver solutions to problem areas 
Research, respond to and resolve inquiries, issues or concerns in a timely manner
Test customizations, hotfixes and upgrades, including design of UAT test cases
Own accountability of outcomes to internal and external customers.

REQUIREMENTS:

A Computer Science degree or System Analyst diploma, or similar disciplines, preferably in Finance Technology
Minimum 2 years’ experience in an systems analyst or similar role
Minimum 1 year experience as a developer / programmer in any language
Exceptional attention to detail with proven analytical and problem-solving abilities 
Experience in data modeling or architecture
Experience working with MS-SQL databases and data structures
Strong customer service skills 
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills
Flexible and adaptable in learning and understanding new technologies & processes
Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
Agile methodology and experience in delivery of solutions is strongly preferred
Healthcare experience is an asset
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics GP is also an asset

ABOUT US:
At SE, we love what we do. Every day, we bring hope and happiness to clients, homes, and communities across Canada. We treat each person with dignity and love, like our own family; we build empathy; and we do the right thing. We are always inspired to make a difference. As a not-for-profit social enterprise, we share knowledge, provide the best care, and help each client to realize their most meaningful goals for health and wellbeing. We’re a great place to work, and we hope you’ll join our team.
SE Health is monitoring the global COVID-19 pandemic closely and following all public health directives, including recommendations from the World Health Organization, Government of Canada, and federal and provincial health authorities. Our top priority is the health and safety of our clients, their families and our staff.
Please note that due to the unprecedented circumstance of the Global Pandemic and the resultant public health crisis; and in the interest of the health and safety of our patients/clients, employees, and greater good of public health, SE Health requires those that wish to work for this organization to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Fully vaccinated means a person has received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine and it has been 14 days since the last dose
SE Health is committed to the success of all its employees. If you feel you need accommodations because of illness or disability, please do not hesitate to contact Human Resources at HumanResources@sehc.com at your earliest convenience.
Please apply online wincychong@sehc.com

Title: Business Analyst - Capital Markets
Description:
Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated in delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.
We are currently seeking competent individuals to fill the role of Business Analyst on our dynamic team for our client, one of the big five banks
Contract Duration: 6 monthsExtension: PossibleFTE: Possible
Typical Day in Role: 

Research, formulate, and perform data-driven analytics using SQL and/or other tools such as Elastic Search, Postman, and Kibana.
Regular deliverables include creation of source to target mapping
Assist in resolving complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the system needs of the Institutional Equity Trading Desks and their internal and external customers, by applying your business and technological knowledge to perform analysis, reconciliations, defining user requirements, design and implementation of system enhancements/solutions.
Support, liaison, and gather requirements from senior stakeholders and clearly articulate business requirements to technical teams.
Building relationships with vendors to allow for regular communication for needs and adequate time to implement changes
Working with technology and business partners and stakeholders to do data mapping, data analysis, order and trade data mapping from federated systems (TT and Tradebook data is being mapped into a consolidated data model).
Test, validate, and deploy solution to production environment
Create artifacts required for deployments
Working with data platform team and connect with other teams from data governance, etc. to deploy solution from one environment to another.
Work with raw data from developers to reroute data to different topics (understanding of NiFi is required)
Working primarily with institutional equities
Analysis of business needs (trading, regulatory, etc.) resulting in the creation of requirement
Build relationships and work with key stakeholders to quickly deliver value added solutions.
Produce conceptual interface designs through iterative wireframes, mock-ups, user flows, conceptual diagrams and provide detailed specifications to the development team
Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, perform under pressure, and change priorities as needed.

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills: 

5+ years’ experience in a relevant capacity as a technical BA
2+ years’ experience within capital markets data (trade lifecycle, securities, doing reconciliations, vendor management, equities post-trade processes, institutional equities, etc)

o in-depth knowledge of Capital Markets data analysis, data mapping, data publication/consumption and business

Understanding of how FIX Protocols work, professional experience in this realm
Strong data driven analysis knowledge, ability to write SQL queries
Seeking candidate with strong hands-on experience in at least two of the following (in order of preference): Kafka, NiFi, Elastic Search, and/or Kibana
SDLC, data/business analysis experience
Documentation skills (ability to produce conceptual interface designs through iterative wireframes, mock-ups, user flows, conceptual diagrams and provide detailed specifications to the development team)

Nice-To-Have Skills: 

Experience with other ETL tools to understand how flows work
Ability to work with third-party APIs, Postman, and other API/data tools.
Knowledge/experience with reporting tools/platforms such as Business Objects, Power BI, Excel Macros/Pivots, and other similar tools.
Hadoop/Big Data experience to analyze and help develop solutions
Vendor application and federated trading platforms experience with products such as Duco, Fidessa, Bloomberg, etc
Prior experience with Jira, Confluence, and ServiceNow.

Soft Skills: 

Great communication (verbal and written) required
Ability to prioritize, produce plans, and deliver on deadlines

Best vs Average: Ideal candidate would have in-depth data driven analysis experience and ability to communicate with stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. A candidate with previous Scotia experience within capital markets or middle office reconciliation experience would be able to adapt to the role quickest. Experience with the full lifecycle is useful (front/middle/back office). Understanding of stream processing is required to adapt to this role.
Degrees or certifications: 

Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required
Financial education (relevant courses, CSC, CFA…) will be considered as an asset.

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $80.00-$105.00 per hour
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Title: Enterprise Security Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 154863
 Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

 The Cyber Security team is responsible for developing, implementing and sustaining Tangerine’s Cyber Security Programs and ensuring Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations and Scotiabank’s policies and standards. The Enterprise Security Analyst is responsible for many aspects of Tangerine’s Cyber Security programs. The incumbent will be responsible for leading programs such as vulnerability/patch management, security scanning, data loss prevention, and security reporting programs. The Analyst will utilize a risk-based approach in order to produce substantiated, relevant data to be utilized within a regularly produced security dashboard.
 Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


 Act as core competency and subject matter expert reference for business lines in the matters of governance, risk management, advisory, and compliance.
 Coordinate security scans on the Bank’s servers and endpoints
 Manage, track and report on identified vulnerabilities and collaborate with stakeholders to remediate and resolve vulnerabilities in a timely manner
 Monitor and respond to data loss alerts
 Review and analyze data loss alerts for effectiveness (rule logic tuning)
 Prepare monthly and quarterly statistical reports summarizing security activities, and tasks performed.
 Administrate and maintain security technology tools and platforms


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? - We'd love to work with you if you have:


 Knowledge and experience in monitoring and tracking cyber threats and vulnerabilities
 Knowledge and skill in performing cyber threat and vulnerability impact/risk assessments
 Ability to identify systemic security issues based on analysis of vulnerability and configuration data.
 Knowledge and experience in identifying data loss risk vectors and deploying detection and prevention counter measures.
 Knowledge of computer networking concepts, network protocols and network security methodologies.
 Knowledge of system administration, network and operating system hardening techniques
 Knowledge and experience in security scanning technologies and methodologies (vulnerability scanners, SAST, DAST, SCA, etc.)


 What's in it for you?


 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences
 You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
 Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does
 Access to thousands of online and in-person courses so you can brush up on skills or learn new ones
 Career progression opportunities. We hire you for your talent and not just for the job. We want to see you succeed not just in your role but in your career as a whole
 We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), vacation, personal & sick days, paternity/maternity leave, medical, vision and dental benefits and much more

 #LI-Hybrid
 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : North York
 At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Consultant
Description:
About Project X
 The heart of what we do is drive for unique and innovative solutions that solve our customers problems. We are trusted advisors who create data and analytics solutions for complex client problems. We do this through collaboration, creativity and an innate need to solve tough data problems. Data runs deep in our veins and is what makes up who we are, individually and as a team, allows us to do the work we’re passionate about. We think differently.  Role Summary
 The Consultant, Business Systems Analyst works with internal and external stakeholders including the technology and business teams to develop and implement data solutions tailored to a project’s requirements. The nature of the projects varies from Waterfall to Agile and technology varies from legacy to cutting edge. They are involved throughout the project lifecycle by capturing and documenting requirements, test strategy/plans, test cases, execution of testing, sign off and implementation into production. They are supported by team members and the Practice Manager.
 This position does not have any direct reports.  Major Areas of Responsibility

 Deep, multilayered understanding of the business issues and the data challenges of the clients’ organizations and their industries.
 Ensure requirements are clear and complete, eliminating uncertainties and ambiguities.
 Establish quality solutions and validation against the requirements.
 Participate in the development of project plans to establish appropriate workload expectations and schedules.
 Communicate clearly with project team members, identify/resolve issues, and escalate when required.
 Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of, and adopt, relevant market trends and practices.
 Gather project requirements and develop a requirement matrix to identify gaps
 Create a detailed, functional/non-functional requirements documents, review and obtain sign off from key stakeholders.
 Provide ongoing updates and review throughout the project lifestyle.
 Create test strategy/plans and execute test cases.

 Nice to Have:

 Analytics / Business Intelligence tools (MicroStrategy, Tableau, Cognos, Looker)

 Required Education and Experience:

 Around 3-5 years’ experience on technical projects including three as a Business Systems Analyst
 Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Software or Computer Science/Engineering fields or related industry experience or acumen
 Experience in Data Warehousing, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Cloud Projects (AWS, GCP, Azure) or Big Data (Hadoop, Hive, Impala)
 ETL experience
 SLDC methodologies, specifically Agile and Waterfall
 SQL, Teradata, or Oracle
 MS Project (or similar project management tool)
 Data analysis (i.e., data quality, data migration, data processing and data manipulation)
 Leadership and integrity
 Open Communication
 Level-headed decision making and ability to think on your feet
 Innovation, creative, solution-based approaches to solving problems
 Time management, prioritizing effectively while delivering high quality work

 Why Join Project X: 
Project X Ltd drives success by focusing on building teams of incredibly talented, fun, dedicated people. We reward hard work and forward thinking with recognition and a fun company culture. We offer the following incentives:

 Competitive Salary
 Health and Dental benefits package
 Additional Health and Wellness Benefit - (i.e., bikes, fitness classes, health / fitness club memberships)
 Opportunities to advance your career
 Employee Referral Bonus

 In our commitment to promote fair and equitable treatment of all employees and applicants, Project X Ltd. provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals regardless of age, sex, disability, race, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sexual orientation, marital status or any other ground as described in the Ontario Human Rights Code. In addition, accommodation will be provided during the hiring process.
 Project X is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
 Due to the current COVID 19 Pandemic:

 Interviews are conducted online
 Project X Ltd. staff are currently working from home
