Title: ST-Analyst, Biowaivers, Biocorrelation and Statistical Support - 12 months
Description:
About Apotex Inc.
Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com.



 Job Summary


 Acts as a part of a multifunctional team focused primarily on development of new drug products as solid dosage forms.
 The Incumbent will have the opportunity to learn about biopharmaceutical aspects of the development of the new drug product, data analysis and Regulatory requirements. Additionally the incumebent will gain knowledge related to statistical approaches in assessment of various pharmaceutical data in support of development, process improvements and investigations.




 Job Responsibilities



Data compilation, data entry and data checks
Literature searches and literature reference verifications
Drug release/Dissolution data plotting and dissolution profile similarity calculation
Assist in drug release and absorption modelling and IVIVC correlations using computer software
Assist in compilation and formatting of technical report
Statistical analysis such as bivariate analysis, ANOVA, linear regression, and multivariate modelling
Assist in preparation of regulatory submission documents
Works in a safe manner collaborating as a team member to achieve all outcomes.
Demonstrate Behaviours that exhibit our organizational Values: Collaboration, Courage, Perseverance, and Passion.
Ensure personal adherence with all compliance programs including the Global Business Ethics and Compliance Program, Global Quality policies and procedures, Safety and Environment policies, and HR policies.

All other relevant duties as assigned.




 Job Requirements



Education



Enrolled in undergraduate (BSc) or postgraduate (MSc) studies in Pharmaceutical, Pharmacology, Chemistry or related sciences.



 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities 
      
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A demonstrated ability to prioritize and achieve results while managing multiple concurrent tasks
Must be timeline driven
Must work well under pressure
Desire to learn and contribute to team goals is a must
Must have the ability to work independently as well as work well in a team setting
Must have solid Microsoft Office skills (such as MS word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Must have a solid Pharmaceutical background (e.g.Pharmaceutics, Pharmaceutical chemistry, Biopharmaceutics, Pharmacokinetics)
Understanding of statistics or biostatistics



 

Experience 
      
Previous courses/training in statistics or biostatistics preferred
Previous courses/training on pharmacokinetics or bioequivalence is an asset
 

Exposure and understanding of statistics or biostatistics



 COVID-19 VACCINATION POLICY: In accordance with Apotex Inc. (“Apotex”) policy, as of November 15, 2021, all individuals entering a Canadian site (including but not limited to employees, visitors, contractors and agency workers) must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with the current government requirements. Further, all employees must maintain all future booster vaccines as approved and recommended by Health Canada. Accommodation from these requirements for reasons pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code, or any other applicable law (most commonly for medical and/or religious reasons) will be reviewed and considered by Apotex.


At Apotex, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.
Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

Title: Lead Analyst, Data Risk Management
Description:
Overview: 
 
   At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions.
 


 Risk Analytics @ Neo



 Neo’s Risk Analytics team works hard to enable a high growth portfolio with sound risk management principles while optimizing credit decisioning across the customer lifecycle. This team of high-performers leads the development and implementation of key credit risk strategies to effectively manage the lending portfolio inline with our business objectives.
 

 We’re looking for an experienced data leader with a keen interest in building a risk data function to join us as a full-time 
  Lead Analyst, Data Risk Management in our Calgary headquarters. In this role, you’ll manage a team of high-performing analytics professionals to build, run and maintain data pipelines and data services that solve complex business challenges in the Risk Analytics domain. You will collaborate with our risk analysts and data scientists to improve data transparency and to enable better decision-making processes. 
 What you'll be doing:: 
 
Design, develop and deliver a risk analytics data strategy, enabling advanced data-driven credit decisioning
 Working closely with our Data team, define and govern data modeling and design standards, tools, best practices related to data modeling
 Utilize large volumes of data in order to extract and manipulate large datasets using standard tools such as SQL and Python; leverage large-scale data processing tools such as Apache Spark
 Propose, design and engineer solutions and improvements to data technologies finding ways to automate, optimize and scale processes
 Design, implement, and test advanced data solutions to equip risk analysts with appropriate data to develop sound credit strategies
 Build and maintain dashboards, and metrics to ensure successful monitoring of live data, features and models; utilize BI tools such as Looker or Tableau
 Lead and support various ad hoc projects, as needed


 Who we're looking for:: 
 
You bring 5+ years in practical work experience in the data management with a familiarity in big data platforms such as Apache Spark or similar
 You bring 3+ years of experience in leading risk management teams
 You have experience in data warehouses, design and development
 You bring advanced programming skills in languages such as Python, SQL, Javascript
 You have a post-Secondary education in a quantitative field preferred (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science, etc)
 You are data-driven; eager to understand the numbers and provide meaningful insights


 What will help you succeed:: 
 
You have strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt communication to different audiences
 You think strategically with the ability to see the big picture may be affected by risk strategies
 You’re self-organized with the ability to operate independently and prioritize effectively
 You’re a self-starter who is highly focused and driven to achieve business objectives
 You take a collaborative approach and with the ability to engage purposely with stakeholders
 You have experience in a fast-paced environment where competing priorities, uncertain outcomes and iteration is the norm


 About applying with us:: 
 
   At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future.
 


 Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

Title: Transportation Analyst

· Independently devise solutions for business cases and development.
· Analyze reports to identify areas of improvement and future growth.

· Weekly billing reconciliation
· Maintain reports and develop weekly / monthly metrics reports.
· Provide timely (daily, weekly, or monthly) reporting and data to functional members to drive business growth and process improvements.
· Perform data analysis and written audits of processes such as internal usage patterns or customer service level analysis.
· Perform other projects, analyses and data extraction as assigned.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

· Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required.
· A high degree of initiative and integrity required.
· Experience using Warehouse Management Systems would be considered a strong asset.
· Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PPP & Outlook.
· Pro-active and strong organizational skills.

· Problem solving and attention to detail.
Domain Logistics is committed to fostering a diverse workforce founded on the principle of equal opportunity employment, in an environment free of discrimination and harassment. We encourage people of all ages and from underrepresented groups to apply to be part of our team.

RRSP match

Title: IT Developer and Systems Analyst
Description:
Who we are:


   We are aviation professionals obsessed with the provision of exceptional customer service and consumed with the desire to remain Canada’s #1 provider of private jet services. For over 35 years we have honed our skills and continuously evolved and are proud to be Canada’s most trusted and innovative provider of private jet services. We are committed to the delivery of safe, reliable, and authentic aviation solutions.
 


 Our culture is rooted in our core values: Reliable, honest, transparent, and safe. Each member of the Chartright Team is encouraged to initiate change that will bring about continuous improvements that enhance these core values. We want you to join our team of professionals who are customer-focused and innovative. So, if you get excited about making a real difference as part of a winning team as we do, we want to hear from you.
 


 Why Chartright:


 The opportunity to make a difference by contributing to the ongoing success of a high growth company in an exciting industry
 We are a high-performance, customer-driven, and people-focused culture
 We’re highly committed to ongoing improvement and achieving excellence in processes and ways of working through collaboration, employee engagement, and teamwork
 You will learn, grow, and develop your skills and career with opportunities to move into new, expanded roles
 Competitive total compensation including 100% company-paid extended health and dental benefits
 RRSP/DPSP matching program, which can serve as an important part of your future and retirement security
 We offer a hybrid, flexible work approach



 The IT Developer and Systems Analyst will design and develop professional and intuitive web-based user solutions using web technologies with a focus on Microsoft development technologies that communicate to the various Chartright backend information systems. A majority of the work is organized into projects but there will be the occasional ad-hoc development requirement.
 


 What you will do:


 Develop web-based based solutions in support of business objectives
 Develop web tools and/or internal web forms for various ad-hoc requirements
 Develop and maintain internal systems according to management requirements
 Review functional and technical designs, and reviewing coding based on set criteria
 Master all aspects of product development and life cycle
 Update and maintain existing web systems
 Work on multiple projects simultaneously
 Ensure timely implementation and development
 Collaborate with the design and other team members to develop creative ideas and functions
 Assist with other duties and responsibilities as required
 Provide data analytics and reporting support as assigned including report/dashboard design and report development.
 Assist in the develops of ETL’s to create, modify, and maintain data flows; performs other related Business Intelligence development duties as required.



 What you bring:


 B.A. in a Computer science or College diploma in Computer Programming, Application Developer, or related field
 Proficient using ASP.NET, .NET, C#, CSS, and SQL
 Understanding of Azure DevOps, web servers, routing, SSL/TLS, DNS, HTTP, HTTPS, and other core web technologies
 Proficient with Microsoft SSIS.
 Proficient working with relational databases and SQL queries.
 Backend SQL database development using triggers, functions and stored procedures
 Should be proficient in graphical/design skills for building front ends.
 Has performed Web-Architect role/responsibility in one of the assignments.
 Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
 Ability to conduct research into a wide range of development issues as required.
 Ability to collaborate and work effectively with team members across the organizaton
 Manage a variety of responsibilities with constantly changing priorities.
 Ability to work independently and take initiative in identifying and resolving problems utilizing sound judgment and reasoning skills.
 Excellent organizational skills, work prioritization and follow-through ability.
 Ability to employ creative and innovative thought processes.
 Ability to be flexible and adaptable.
 Ability to learn to new technologies quickly
 Professional, ethical and committed to excellence.
 Able to occasionally work after hours



 Technical Requirements:


 Web Development: HTML 5, .NET, ASP.NET, C#, MS SQL, Oracle SQL, AJAX, Xamarin, JavaScript, CSS
 Web Server/Components: IIS, SSL/TLS, DNS, Apache
 Databases: Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS
 Web Browsers: IE, Firefox, Chrome, Safari
 Desktop Software: MS-Visual Studio, MS-Office, Visual Studio Code, Adobe Creative Suite
 Reporting: Crystal Reports 8.5, 10, XI, 2008, 2016, Telerik Reporting. Tableau
 iOS Development: Experience in native iOS development or Xamarin

Title: Corporate Development Analyst
Description:
Job PurposeThe Corporate Development Team drives and supports the growth of our business by identifying and evaluating commercial opportunities for customer driven solutions that are cost effective. This individual will help define key commercial opportunities through cashflow modelling and market analyses while providing support for commercial negotiations and guiding projects from the idea phase through to infrastructure commissioning.Reporting to the Manager, Corporate Development, this position is part of a high-functioning and specialized team.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesThe responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:

Complete oilfield activity research and analysis including market assessments and development maps
Analyze and develop detailed financial models including projections, valuations, investment return analyses, debt impacts and corporate models
Prepare and develop business cases/plans to feed growth hopper, and identify commercial opportunities
Analyze accounting and regulatory statements, debt and equity filings and documents, financial projections, and models in support of organic growth projects
Maintain industry network outside of the company to keep current on industry trends and developments
Market research and analysis, regulatory applications, and competitive intelligence analysis
Design presentations related to new projects, acquisitions and divestitures, potential investments, and commercial negotiations
Work closely with team members to provide support on projects and commercial negotiations when required

Preference will be provided to candidates with previous experience in the following areas:

Project stakeholder relations
Commercial contracts experience
Customer interfacing experience
Mapping experience (GeoSCOUT or AccuMap)

Qualifications/CompetenciesThe individual in this role will have:

University or College degree in related field (Business, Economics, and Finance preferred)
Possess experience within the North American oil and gas industry
Previous midstream commercial experience with an understanding of commercial contracts and associated cashflow/risk implications
Strong Excel skills and in-depth understanding of discount cash flow modeling
Ability to multi-task and work on a wide variety of projects in a deadline-orientated environment
Ability to be pro-active and anticipate the needs of the Team
Ability to work under tight deadlines to generate timely, accurate and efficient results
Ability to travel to sites as required

The following are considered preferred assets in this role, but are not required:

Working towards post-graduate financial designation (CFA, MBA, CBV)
Previous experience working in Corporate Development, Business Development, Acquisitions and Divestitures, Management Consulting, Data Analytics, and/or Investment Banking
Varied technical and field experience

EducationPreferred

Bachelors or better in Business Economics
Bachelors or better in Economics
Bachelors or better in Finance

Licenses & CertificationsPreferred

Drivers Licence (Class 5)

SkillsPreferred

Solid Work Ethic
Analytical Capabilities
Ability to Work with Little Supervision
Ability to Meet Timelines

BehaviorsPreferred

Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity

MotivationsPreferred

Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization

Job Type: Full-time

Title: Inventory Analyst
Description:
Chatters, proudly Canadian owned with over 115 locations and growing, has an immediate opening for an Inventory Analyst to join our dynamic team. 
The Inventory Analyst is responsible for the allocation of merchandise to the stores, inventory analysis and purchase orders. The Inventory Analyst will work cross functional with the Merchants, Planning and Store Operations to ensure that the stores have an optimal product mix to maximize sales.
 This position will report into our Director of Merchandise Operations and Allocations and will be based out of our Head Office in the Greater Toronto Area, ON. A little about the role responsibilities:

 Analyze sales and inventory data to make informed decisions regarding replenishment of items at the store level
 Analyze and make recommendations to optimize and control inventory levels while meeting business requirements
 Design and develop monthly reporting of KPIs and daily activities


 Working closely with the planning team to ensure that inventory levels are maintained to achieve sales targets
 Monitor purchase orders: ensuring salon credits, supplier credits, and inventory records are reconciled.
 Lead effective solutions and procedures to ensure continuous improvement and the optimal performance targets are achieved
 Initiative to see beyond the day-to-day business and seek opportunities to maximize the sales potential
 Establish and maintain significant cross-functional relationships with buying team, distribution center, store operations and other departments.


 Assist and support senior management in implementing the company vision and goals through execution of inventory management transactions and processes.

 A little about you:

 Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain or post-secondary education or equivalent experience relating to inventory management.
 Minimum 5 years of experience in inventory management or a similar discipline.


 Minimum 5 years of experience with MRP systems (ideally Navision and AIMs or another large scale MRP system)
 Experience in generating reports related to inventory variance, turn over, returns etc.
 Distribution Retail and/or Beauty Industry experience preferred.
 Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written.
 Excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills; team building skills.


 Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
 Strong organizational, time management and planning skills with the ability to prioritize and multi-task.
 Strong problem-solving skills and sound decision-making abilities.
 Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint)
 Working knowledge of working in an ERP system (SAP, Oracle, JDE, Navision, AIMs).


 A little about Us:
 We believe that great employees deserve great benefits.

 Chatters employee benefit offerings include things like discounted products and services, medical and dental, employer RRSP contributions and endless opportunities to learn and grow.


 If you’re someone who is looking for a fast-paced environment where you are not afraid of a little hard work and exploring the unknown, please apply directly to this posting.
 Feel free to check out our website to learn more about us at www.chatters.ca
 
MdP03gPIXz

Title: Senior Analyst, Insights
Description:
Les candidats référés ne doivent pas postuler directement pour ce poste.
 

   Toutes les références de candidats doivent d’abord être soumises dans Workday par un collègue de Loblaw actuel.
 

   Emplacement:
  500 Lakeshore Blvd. West, Toronto, Ontario, M5V 2V9
 

   Lorsque vous embauchez des gens formidables, de grandes choses peuvent arriver. PC Financial offre une valeur sans précédent aux Canadiens grâce à des produits de paiement. Nous sommes un type de banque différent avec un type d’équipe différent. Nous sommes collaboratifs et solidaires et avons la liberté et la responsabilité de prospérer. Notre objectif est de rendre le quotidien simple et meilleur pour nos clients, et nous nous efforçons de faire en sorte que chaque dollar vaille plus.
 


   Fièrement au service de plus de 3 millions de clients, PC Financial continue de croître en offrant des solutions et des services de paiement qui récompensent nos clients chaque jour. En tant que filiale de Loblaws Company Inc., nous partageons les valeurs FONDAMENTALES que sont le soin, l'appropriation, le respect et l'excellence. Nous nous engageons à aider les Canadiens à bien vivre leur vie. Rejoignez-nous dans notre voyage.
 






       The Senior Analyst of Insights is accountable for delivering tactical and strategic knowledge through data manipulation, dashboarding, and statistical modeling. The Senior Analyst will report directly to the Senior Director of Category Management for PC Telecom and will provide analytics, data integration, and visualization support for all PC Services lines of business (The Mobile Shop, Gift of Choice (Gift Cards), PC Insurance). The Senior Analyst utilizes point-of-sale, loyalty, credit card, and operational data to design/evaluate marketing initiatives, uncover key business insights, and inform product strategy.
      
 What You'll Do:
     

 Manipulate and calculate large complex data from various sources; convey complicated information concisely, simply, and with clarity; and deliver actionable insights that enable business partners to fully understand key drivers of business results
 Collaborate with product and marketing teams to assess opportunities, develop targeting strategies, and measure the results of campaigns & initiatives. Ensure timely communication of strategic and operational results
 Empower business users with their own data through the development/improvement of data cubes, visualizations, and dashboards
 Conduct sophisticated multivariate analysis/predictive modeling at the customer, product, and enterprise levels, and recommend appropriate actions to ensure profitable and sustainable business growth
 Develop and implement statistical models using machine learning techniques that include linear/logistic regression, decision trees and k-means clustering analysis
 On a monthly basis, extract and assemble data to provide product-level KPI reporting to the Category Management team



       What You'll Need:
     

 Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g. computer science, engineering, statistics or other analytically based discipline). Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Management Analytics or other professional designation is highly preferred
 Minimum 3 years proven strong business analytical and modeling experience including statistical and segmentation analysis; data analysis and insight development; dashboarding and data visualization
 Must be proficient with SQL; experience working with large datasets in SQL Server, Teradata, and/or other related systems; knowledge of SAS Enterprise Data Miner an asset
 Proficiency with programming languages; experience with Python and R strongly preferred
 Advanced proficiency in MS Excel & VBA for data exploration, ad-hoc analysis, and reporting
 Experience working with dashboarding tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy, MS Power BI, etc.)
 Experience working with machine learning algorithms including linear/logistic regression, decision trees, k-means clustering analysis
 Strategic critical thinker with proven ability to think conceptually (use numbers to tell a story) and make meaning of complex data to develop insights and communicate results
 Strong communication skills and desire to work in cross-functional groups







   Rejoignez une équipe gagnante qui fait preuve d'innovation, d'énergie, de créativité et de vision. Nous reconnaissons l'importance d'une main-d'œuvre diversifiée et nous encourageons donc les candidatures d'Autochtones, de femmes, de membres d'une minorité visible et de personnes handicapées. Nous remercions tous les candidats pour leur intérêt, cependant, seuls les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés.
 

   Nombre d'ouvertures:
  1
 
   La Financière PC reconnaît la diversité du Canada comme une source de fierté et de force nationales. Nous nous sommes fixé comme priorité de refléter la diversité évolutive de notre pays dans les produits que nous vendons, les personnes que nous embauchons et la culture que nous créons dans notre organisation. Des hébergements sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats et collègues handicapés.
 

   De plus, nous croyons que le respect des lois signifie faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre code de conduite - il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous.
 


   Remarque : Si vous disposez d'un service libre-service pour les employés (ESS) sur Workday, postulez à cet emploi via l'application Workday.

Title: Procurement Analyst
Description:
Introduction

 At IBM, work is more than a job – it’s a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you’ve never thought possible. To lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world’s most challenging problems.
 


Your Role and Responsibilities


Supporting and managing competitive bid events for client(s) (i.e., Request for Proposal, Request for Quote, Request for Information, Reverse Auctions, etc.) within assigned spend categories.
Managing tactical buying request queue with requests ranging from $50k-$500k from multiple client stakeholders, achieving savings targets and maintaining high client satisfaction.
Analyzing client’s historical spend data in one or more categories to: support category strategy development, measure compliance with supplier agreements, and identify sourcing opportunities.
Building and maintaining stakeholder relationships across all levels of the client’s business, procurement, and legal organizations.
Understanding commercial terms and facilitating contracting processes with the client’s suppliers.
Analyzing and documenting cost savings versus historical spend to ensure IBM meets or exceeds contractual savings commitments to our client(s).
Supporting Global Category Leaders and Category Managers with development of category strategies and developing sourcing project strategies.
Collaborating with IPS Procurement Consultants supporting our other clients to share and leverage useful templates, strategies, lessons learned, and case studies.

Candidates must be willing and able to travel to client locations based on business requirements. Peak client travel may be up to 4 days/week and 3-4 weeks per month (e.g., early months with a new client); however, steady state travel is purposeful in nature and often less frequent (e.g., 2 weeks per month in most roles).
 Skills & Expertise

Data Analysis: Ability to utilize procurement and financial data to understand spending trends within a business, and to leverage that information to identify procurement insights that result in process efficiencies or cost savings for the client.
Running RFx’s: Preferred previous experience leading multiple competitive bid events for indirect sourcing projects.
Strategic Thinking: Understanding of the importance of “big picture” thinking and planning. Ability to apply business acumen to focus on key success factors for the organization.
Accuracy and Attention to Detail: Understanding the necessity and value of accuracy and attention to detail; ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.
Dealing with Disorder: Knowledge of tactics and ability to function effectively in the face of volatility, uncertainty, complexity, and ambiguity.
Microsoft Office: Strong knowledge and proficiency of Microsoft Office suite. Ability to efficiently and accurately analyze procurement data using Microsoft Excel, and to build client-ready presentations using Microsoft PowerPoint.
Client Relationship Management: Ability to build rapport with clients and maintain professionalism in communications with all levels of client stakeholders. Delivery of high quality analyses and presentations on time and with the level of quality the client expects.
Procurement Knowledge: Knowledge of Procurement methods, technologies and processes. Ability to analyze and improve a client’s procurement organization.





Required Technical and Professional Expertise



Strong business acumen to focus on key success factors for the organization and client
Ability to efficiently and accurately analyze procurement data using Microsoft Excel (create/modify v-lookup’s, pivot tables and/or Macros)
Adaptable and flexible e.g. experience with handling uncertainty, complexity, and ambiguous situations
Proven ability to build rapport with stakeholders and maintain professionalism in communications with all levels of client stakeholders.
Travel requirements can be up to 50 – 60%.





Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise



Previous experience in a client facing / consultative role.
Experience with analyzing and improving client’s procurement organization. a
6+ months of experience running end-to-end RFx events in any of the following categories: Facilities, MRO, Real Estate, Corporate & Professional Services, Information Technology, and/or Logistics




 Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.
 


Key Job Details Country/Region:CA State:ONTARIO City:Markham Category:Supply Chain Required Education:Bachelor's Degree Position Type:Professional Employment Type:Full-Time Contract Type:Regular Company:(0026) IBM Canada Limited – IBM Canada Limitee Req ID:573187BR Travel Required:Up to 60% or 3 days a week (home on weekends – based on project requirements)

Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Req id: 27869 
    







     Waterloo, ON, CA 
     Richmond Hill, ON, CA 
     Mississauga, ON, CA
     










OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

 As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.
     



Life At Opentext:




      At OpenText and in IT, we believe in every employee having meaningful, purposeful work. By joining our team, you will join a community of supportive and collaborative peers focused on innovation, teamwork, and driving successful outcomes. You’ll be expected to bring with you an ideation and “Yes, if” mindset. And, as you build your network and demonstrate your professional excellence, you will have the opportunity to forge your own career path and professional growth.
     



The Opportunity:




      The Senior Business Systems Analyst will deliver results that will make the organization more profitable. They can work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that improves corporate processes. Their focus will be on process design, process reengineering, business requirements, gap analysis, data flows and provide internal ticket triage support for the business. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will work with their manager and leads to ensure the quality and timeliness of work.
     



You Are Great At:




Working closely with broad user groups to coordinate and complete Operational Excellence activities to support sponsored projects and enhancements by 
       
Documenting and developing current state process flows
Determining and documenting business requirements for business processes and ensure they don’t conflict with the requirements for future projects
Preparing Gap Analysis
Documenting and developing future state process flows
Participating in the discussions of the functional spec & technical design
Developing comprehensive E2E test cases and steps that will be loaded into HPALM
Managing & triaging defects assigned during testing
Obtaining sign off from the business for go live
Preparing communications out to the business for the change impacts
Preparing user training documentation for new functionality if required
Documenting & coordinating the deployment plan

Holding regular stakeholder meetings to keep all interested parties updated in project progress
Providing support to business users on systems issues, escalating to Manager, CoE or an IT development/technical team as appropriate
Providing period end support to finance users as required, tickets, escalations, solutions.
Creating and building Operational Excellence Culture through inclusion, engagement, communication, and celebration
Using active listening and discussion skills to identify issues, ensure understanding and facilitate problem-solving
Matching different influence strategies and negotiating styles to fit the person or situation
Providing development opportunities and support to maximize Operational Excellence orientation across the organization
Collaborating with others to generate appropriate Operational Excellence deployment plan with organizational measures of success.
Acting as communication liaison between IT team and other pillars and functional areas.
Involving and coaching business leaders in preparing for and sustaining change
Being a change champion within the site and network by prompting questions and promoting team-based behavior





What It Takes:




3 - 5 years of professional/technical experience – prior experience with Salesforce (SFDC) and SAP preferred 
BA certified or equivalent experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in business / accounting
Strong experience in user testing and project management
Experience with the order to cash, procure to pay processes and record to report in a software or technology company is an asset
Good understanding of finance business processes, ability to prioritize, organize, and accomplish multiple tasks, both as part of a team and independently
Proven project management skills. Ability to develop value-based business cases along with our business partner, document detailed process flows, and define gaps
Ability to write detailed business requirements to translate into functional design
Attention to detail with emphasis on accuracy and quality
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Experience in production support is an asset
A high standard for work ethic and quality is required





      OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com.
     



      Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Data Analyst - 2022 New Grad
Description:
We’d love to hear from you if you are looking for a tech company with the following:

 Huge market ($2T billion market size), we are building the first AI-powered super app to help people owning a car
 Innovative product with the combination of cutting edge mobile, AI, and big data technologies
 Start-up energy - come join one of LinkedIn’s Top 50 Tech Start-ups
 Hypergrowth - 17x revenue growth in the past two years
 Best user experience: #1 ranked app in the insurance comparison category
 Strong leadership: from Amazon, Microsoft, Facebook, Nvidia, Alibaba, etc. and rockstar colleagues

 About the Opportunity:
 The Data and Analytics (DNA) team owns data at Jerry and drives intelligent business decision-making through analytical insights and advanced models. The DNA team is seeking a business analyst to build analytical insights and drive business decisions.
 As a data analyst, you use data to tell stories and make actionable recommendations to help the business. You will join a team of data engineers, data analysts and data scientists. We are passionate about our mission to build a car ownership super app. We work hard and we also like to have fun.
 How you will be contributing:

 Transform and refine raw production data for analytical needs
 Develop reports, visualization, and business insights using data
 Perform deep-dive analysis on business opportunities and challenges
 Partner with other analysts and scientists to build analytical models

 About you:

 Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative discipline
 Hands-on experience and intermediate knowledge of SQL
 Excellent communication and problem-solving skills

 A few more specifics about you:

 Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative discipline
 1+ years of relevant experience in an analytical role
 Hands-on experience with ETL and data warehouse
 Knowledge of a modern programming language (Java, Python, etc.)
 Experience with analytical and visualization platforms (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, etc.)
 Strong written communication and data presentation skills

Title: Program Analyst
Description:
Provide expert analytics and support on all high profile and confidential procurement activities for the WSIB. Ensuring high quality output through procurement data stewardship strong process control.
 Act as a source of expert advice to internal clients across the organization on the most appropriate approach to spend and savings data collection, analysis, supplier performance metrics and strategy.
 Major Duties & Responsibilities:
 Provide technical support for high risk, confidential and outsourcing procurement activities by:

Supplying market data, researching current consumption and projecting future spend. Participating from beginning to end in the go-to-market process including requirements gathering to ensure that the final contract is defendable, to the contract implementation
Building evaluation and consensus documents supporting the procurement process
Developing various specialized regular and ad hoc reports including supplier/provider report cards and distributing to appropriate internal stakeholders; providing analysis of costs, utilization and trends that contribute to increases/decreases in spending
Anticipating and providing advice on potential risk and quality management issues, and make recommendations to management as appropriate.

 Research, advise on, and support contracts and procurement supported categories by:

Identifying, tracking and reporting on trends that may prompt a policy review or an amendment to internal and external payment processes
Documenting any new categories and assisting in transferring these to the Category Analysts
Determining scope of claim file reviews to identify pre-sourcing spend details; verifying that supplier/provider payments reflect negotiated pricing; initiating recovery of over-spend
In collaboration with Category Specialists/Managers, creating supplier reports to capture supplier performance metrics; creating scorecards, inputting supplier data, and analyzing and reporting on supplier performance
Producing various specialized regular and ad hoc reports including supplier report cards required by Category Manager/Specialists for reporting and presentations. Recommending report design and work with Category team and internal clients on appropriate design and parameters, ensuring that monthly updates are consistently processed.

 Design, develop and enhance support systems for sourcing/procurement activities including category spend analysis, financial modelling for bid analysis, lease vs. buy modeling, total cost of ownership modeling, cost benefit analysis, process analysis. This includes:

Investigating and developing information technology tools to capture the data, creating new databases, writing computer programs to extract and manipulate data from existing databases or data warehouses
Accessing and compiling collected data into appropriate format for data analysis, evaluation, reporting and projection modeling, using various tools and applications/programs in order to conduct business and statistical analysis

 Provide technical advice and guidance to procurement services management and staff, and other internal clients on the processes of data collection, analyses, warehousing, data management of spend data for assigned categories by:

Working collaboratively with internal stakeholders including but not limited to Procurement Services, Health Services, Business Technology Services, and Specialized Claims Services
Reviewing work of Category Analysts to ensure proper methodology and rigor is applied to work. Creating and documenting Spend and Savings calculation methodology to the source of practice for the analytics group
Ensuring data and analysis are methodologically sound and meet commonly accepted standards in the statistics gathering/analysis field. This includes assessing different methodologies and determining the most appropriate analytical or statistical method or technique to be used; use inferential statistical methods or other types of analysis on the data collected and to define client requirements for report generation

 Perform other related duties and responsibilities as assigned or required.
 Job Requirements:

BA in Business, Computer Science or Mathematics; Certification in Procurement and/or Business Analysis is preferred.
4 years experience in business analytics, computer systems, problem solving, etc.
Background in various programming languages and working with Microsoft Office, Cognos, PeopleSoft and other reporting tools; certification in various programming languages (example: SQL, VBA, Python, PHP, Java, Javascript) preferred.











Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion
 We respect and value the diversity of our people. We strive to create an environment where employees can be themselves and where our differences are celebrated.
 The WSIB is committed to being accessible and inclusive, and following barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please let us know when we contact you and we will work with you to meet your needs.
 Disclosing conflicts of interest
 As public servants, employees at the WSIB have a responsibility to act in an ethical way at all times to create a respectful workplace and maintain public trust. Job applicants are required to disclose any circumstance that could result in a real, potential or perceived conflict of interest. A conflict of interest is any situation where your private interests may impair or be perceived to impair the decisions you make in your official capacity. This may include: political activity, directorship, other outside employment and certain personal relationships (e.g. with current WSIB employees, customers and/or stakeholders). If you have any questions about conflict of interest obligations and/or how to make a disclosure, please contact the Talent Acquisition Centre at talentacquisitioncentre@wsib.on.ca.
 Privacy information  We collect personal information from your resume, application, cover letter and references under the authority of the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997. The Talent Acquisition Centre and WSIB hiring parties will used this information to assess/validate your qualifications, determine if you meet the requirements of vacant positions and/or gather information relevant for recruitment purposes. If you have questions or concerns regarding the collection and use of your personal information, please contact the WSIB’s Privacy Office at privacy_office@wsib.on.ca. The Privacy Office cannot provide information about the status of your application.
 As a precondition of employment, the WSIB requires that prospective candidates undergo a criminal records name check any time before or after they are hired.
 To apply for this position, please submit your application by the closing date.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview: 
 
   Visier is the leader in people analytics. We are passionate about a 'people first' approach to business strategy and our addictive technology is transforming the way that organisations make decisions. Recently closing a hugely successful funding round and a landmark $1b valuation, Visier is embarking on an incredible phase of its 12 year growth Journey.
 


 We are seeking a self motivated, intellectually curious and technically brilliant individual to dive into complex analytics projects serving multiple internal stakeholders. The Business Intelligence (BI) analyst will drive improvements and expand Visier’s internal reporting capabilities. Visier has a data warehouse, along with corporate level analytics that are built off Visier’s own leading technology platform serving up analysis and insights to serve leadership in tracking and decision-making. 
 What You'll be Doing...: 
 
   This position is a highly visible role involving extensive collaboration with cross functional teams (Finance, IT, Sales, Marketing, Customer Experience, HR, Development).
 


 As a part of Visier’s Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) team, the BI Analyst will be responsible for helping Visier to implement its continuous performance management initiatives to measure and monitor Visier’s progress in meeting its objectives, and to provide insights that drive quality decisions.
 


 Understand various aspects of Visier’s business and underlying data (e.g. CRM, Project, Financial, HR) and processes in order to build appropriate operational reporting 
Assist functional stakeholders in quickly and efficiently gaining insights to support decision making
 Correctly translate business metrics requirements from functional stakeholders to technical scope
 Load data from various source systems (e.g. Salesforce, ServiceNow) into the data warehouse
 Develop robust and scalable data models, workflows, security matrix to continue to build out the company-wide analytics solution that enables efficient data-driven decisions
 Working closely with the EPM team’s technical resources, modify and build metrics and visualizations using Visier’s technology platform
 Collaborate with functional stakeholders and the EPM team, applying technical leadership to ensure stakeholder needs are met
 Manage projects of competing priority simultaneously
 Design and publish dashboards and analysis to support the changing needs of the business
 The impact you'll have...: 
 
You prefer working in a small, entrepreneurial team wearing multiple hats including both implementation and support. 
They enjoy learning various aspects of business, both horizontally (e.g. from go-to-market to back-office) and vertically (e.g. from demand gen activities to post-sales care)
 Experience implementing data analysis and reporting projects. 
You understand the value of analytics and are eager to help drive process improvement and help stakeholders sophisticate how they use data to drive their decision making
 An entrepreneurial mindset that is comfortable dealing with change. Visier is a growing company and we often iterate rapidly
 Self-starter attitude - you are comfortable figuring things out on your own by plotting a path forward and asking intelligent questions where instructions might be limited
 Good business sense in combination with technical knowledge. You understand the “why” of certain KPI’s and are comfortable talking to stakeholders about them
 Ability to absorb and learn new concepts quickly and multi-task on different projects.
 Experience designing dashboards and analysis in Tableau and/or other visualization applications
 Knowledge of how to utilize and manage ETL tools (e.g. Matillion) in relation to Snowflake
 Knowledge of database management systems and SQL skills
 Completion of a degree in Management Information Systems, Data Science, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related discipline, or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent


 Most importantly, you share our values...


 You roll up your sleeves
 You make it easy
 You are proud
 You never stop learning
 You play to win


 Health & Safety at Visier
 Visier is committed to creating a safe and healthy environment for our employees, customers and community. As part of this commitment, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for an exemption.
 


 See the #VisierLife in action



 Instagram


 LinkedIn



 Hear what it's like to work Visier 
here

Title: HR Analyst
Description:
Current ENMAX employees are encouraged to apply through their internal Workday access.
Posted: June 22, 2022Closing Date: July 6, 2022Position Type: PermanentUnion: CUPE
PEOPLE. That's the power behind ENMAX Corporation. As one of Alberta's leading energy and utility providers, our employees are the strength and knowledge that continue to drive our success. At the ENMAX group of companies, we look for energy solutions for today, while knowing we have the power to provide for a better tomorrow.
As an analytics expert, you will partner with stakeholders across ENMAX to develop and enhance our HR reporting capabilities using predictive analytics.
Major Responsibilities:

Drive Human Resources and Business Unit strategies with the advancement of custom reporting, dashboards and analytics, including, but not limited to:


Regulatory and compliance reporting


Workforce demographics and trends


CEO and Board reporting


Inbound and Outbound Integrations


Metrics development (Trend analysis, scorecards, benchmarking, template development etc.)


Provide coaching and leadership to HR, by sharing reporting experience and knowledge of industry best practices


Enable analytics through dashboard development and maintenance standards for ENMAX, and provide guidance on standards and best practices


Evolve and expand the use of technology and automation in the HR department


Provide reporting consultation and expertise to future HR programs and initiatives relative to data and measurement


Prepare and provide technical training on reporting and dashboards, customized to the audience – business units vs. HR team, etc.


Participate in the management and preparation of bi-annual Workday releases, including assessing impact of changes, developing required training and communication plans, and coordinating user acceptance testing specific to reporting, dashboards and integrations


Be a thought leader within HR to advocate for automation, enhancements, communication, and continuous improvement opportunities

Qualifications & Experience:

Degree focused on data analytics (e.g., Human Resources, Information Systems)


5+ years of progressive experience in an analytical role, with 2+ years’ experience in HR analytics specifically


Experience working with Workday Analytics (e.g., Advanced report writer, BIRT, Configuration) is a highly desired.


Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel, Power BI and SharePoint


Strong understanding of HR/organizational people data (e.g., payroll, compensation, workforce planning)


Experience building effective dashboards

Competencies:

Experience working across various levels of an organization, while building trust and fostering collaboration


Detail-oriented and demonstrated competency in analysis, storytelling through data, process improvement and problem-solving


Demonstrated ability to analyze complex data and deliver findings in a meaningful way to diverse audiences


Strong ethical standards regarding the handling of confidential information


Comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced, demanding environment, under pressure


Well versed communication skills

Did we mention the ENMAX Advantage?
We offer competitive compensation including a comprehensive flexible benefits program, non-downtown location that includes great building amenities such as free onsite fitness facility with programming geared to employees needs, onsite child care centre (upon availability, offered from our ENMAX Place location 141 – 50 Ave. SE), free parking and much more. If you share our values and would like to make a difference with your career, join the team and see where the ENMAX possibilities can take you.
Salary: Financial/Business Analyst Level C (Current CUPE 2022 rates)$91,830.10 - $97,622.80- $103,336.14- $109,029.65- $114,802.51
ENMAX Values – Safety, Integrity, Accountability, Service, Teamwork, Agility, Innovation
Location: This role will be part of our hybrid (home and office) work force with office workspace located at ENMAX Place (141 - 50th Avenue SE, Calgary, AB). You will work from home on Mondays and Fridays and in the office on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.
Note:

We have changed the way we connect with our candidates. Initial interviews may be done virtually as well as parts of our on-boarding and job training may be completed remotely.


Technical testing may be done as part of the interview process.


If we can provide an accommodation or adjustment to make the process more accessible for you, please let us know. ENMAX welcomes all qualified applicants to apply and is committed to a safe and respectful workplace. It is our aim to have a workplace which is inclusive and values safety, diversity, personal integrity, respect for individual differences, and encourages ownership and accountability for our actions.


Every ENMAX employee is responsible to take reasonable care to protect the health and safety of themselves, of all other workers, and of the public. Each employee must become familiar with safety procedures and rules applicable to their job and are required to follow them while working at ENMAX.


Must be legal to work in Canada and requires the successful completion of a criminal background check. Two pieces of valid Government issued ID will be required.


Two professional references will be requested.


Education requirements for this position will be verified by a third party.

Please visit our careers pageto learn more about other opportunities at ENMAX Corporation.#LI-POST

Title: Student, Pension Analyst (Fall 2022, 4 Month Term)
Description:
Why join us? 
Our people make all the difference in our success. 

 As the Analyst, Pension Insights, you will be joining Pension Data & Operations within OMERS to enable cross-platform success for Pensions data – assisting with the maturity and evolution of our data program to enable broader data capabilities and drive analytical insights. 

 This is an exciting opportunity for those with an interest in pensions and working with data as a means of enabling all Pensions teams to make pension administration decisions grounded in data. Reporting to the Lead, Pension Insights, you will use your analytical and problem-solving skills to explore insights about our members. 

 A successful candidate will be responsible for assisting with the development of a broad range of reports, conducting a wide variety of data analysis and peer reviewing. The Pension Analyst will work collaboratively across a variety of technical, data science and business teams, as well as with external stakeholders, while always upholding and demonstrating the OMERS vision and core mission. 


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
 Preparing, validating and delivering reports and data extracts to enable all Pensions teams to make pension administration decisions grounded in data 

 Conducting research and performing analysis on a broad range of pension data and issues in order to deliver insights and put forth thoughtful recommendations 

 Compiling detailed documentation outlining methodologies used 

 Assisting in the development of strategies and tools to deliver on the mandate and objectives of the Pension Insights team 

 Supporting other initiatives within Pension Data & Operations as required 


To succeed in this role, you have:
 Enrolled in a relevant University program in Business, Math, Actuarial Science, Computer Science or Data Analytics studies 

 Experienced in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint 

 Conceptual thinker with strong analytical skills, including the ability to research and analyze complex issues and develop insightful solutions while considering risks, costs to the plan and stakeholders’ views 

 Excellent attention to detail with a focus on accuracy 

 Ability to multi-task and prioritize to ensure tasks are completed on a timely basis 

 Strong written and oral communication skills, including preparation of presentation decks 

 Pension or relevant experience (e.g., actuarial, pension administration, policy) is an asset 


Our story:
 Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst - EDI (Hybrid)
Description:
Sr. Business Systems Analyst – EDI (Hybrid)


 Can you effectively document and communicate business requirements to IT developers?
 Do you enjoy writing IT testing and end user testing plans?
 Can you ensure that projects stay on time and avoid project creep?


   As a Sr. Business System Analyst – EDI, you will be responsible for addressing the day-to-day needs of various sales, operations and administrative teams, including work related to system enhancements, upgrades and integration, data preparation, reporting and analytics, and works closely with stakeholders on IT/system projects at Canon Canada. Additionally, you will develop and execute transition plans to ensure successful operationalization of newly developed system enhancements, processes and solutions, which includes preparing documentation, leading training sessions, and providing subject matter support to team members, as well as during solution delivery and transition periods.
 


 We are excited to offer a new and adaptive way of working that provides flexibility in the workforce while maintaining operational readiness! By blending remote and in-office work, we are able to take advantage of the independence and flexibility that comes with working from home, and the collaboration, teamwork and sense of belonging that comes from working together face-to-face. Our Workstyle Program offers the best of both situations: structure and sociability with independence and flexibility.
 

 Key Responsibilities


 Act as a point of contact to assigned business units
 Compile, Review and Analyze IT requirements with the assigned Business Units
 Work closely with the development teams to finalize the design and deliverables
 Compose internal IT testing plans
 Build, Review, and Finalize the business unit testing plans
 Support and/or Develop project plans and monitor progress
 Assist Business Units with post-implementation support
 Provide guidance to Junior Business Systems Analysts


 To Succeed, You Will Need:


 Post Seconday Degree in IT or Business Analysis
 EDI system support, troubleshooting experience required
 IIBA Certification is an asset
 PMP Certification is an asset
 Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience
 Experience in working with/analyzing JAVA applications and Oracle database
 Experience with Sharepoint, Visio, SQL
 Knowledge of Excel, Word, PowerPoint
 Project and Time Management Skills
 French is an asset


 Why Join?


 COVID-19 SAFETY PRECAUTIONS


 Canon is committed to the health and safety of our employees, customers and communities.
 By monitoring public health conditions and following local COVID-19 guidelines, we are taking necessary precautions and putting the safety of our employees and candidates first. A critical component of our workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy. Employees are required to be fully vaccinated and must provide Canon with proof of vaccination or undergo regular COVID-19 Rapid Antigen Screening in order to access the workplace. Canon will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.


 HYBRID WORK


 This position offers a Hybrid work schedule. You will be required to be in the office Mondays and Wednesdays each week, with the ability to work from home for the remainder of the week (subject to specific business needs requiring office attendance)
 When working from home, a reliable internet connection is required. Remote work is supported with cloud-based applications and collaboration tools


 BENEFITS


 Comprehensive health coverage plan that includes medical, dental and vision
 Life insurance, disability and wellness programs
 Vacation, Paid Personal Time and Sick days
 Matching RRSP contribution & Profit Sharing Program
 Tuition Assistance Program for professional continuing education
 Discounts on Canon products, retailers, memberships and more!


 EMPLOYEE PERKS


 Free coffee and snacks
 On-site cafeteria and outdoor patio
 Employee gym and fitness centre
 Employee referral program
 Inspire Program, online peer-to-peer recognition for redeemable points on hundreds of products.
 Community involvement

 Come and join our team and reap the rewards as we work to take Canon to the next level! 
We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, exceptional growth potential and stability, all within a casual and professional work environment. 
While we appreciate all applicant submissions, only those considered to be most qualified will be contacted for further assessment. 
Canon Canada Inc. is proud to provide accommodation(s) during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodations, please indicate this on your application/cover letter and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us via email at accessibility@canada.canon.com or via phone at 1-855-531-3850 or 905-863-8713 

Since 1973, Canon Canada has been the leading provider of consumer, business, professional and medical digital imaging innovation. Technology continuously changes, but our vision and commitment to delivering exceptional solutions and great customer experiences never does. 
Headquartered in Brampton, Ontario, with 12 additional offices across the country, Canon is the preferred choice for technology and services that enhance the lives of people and drive business performance. We are committed to the highest level of customer satisfaction and loyalty, and provide 100% Canadian-based service and support for every product we distribute. 
Every day our team comes to work excited to tackle real-world challenges, conceive new ideas and develop groundbreaking, innovative solutions — to make a difference for our customers, our business partners, our colleagues and our company. 
We’re proud of the difference we make for our customers and our business partners, and in the communities where we live and work.

Title: Analyst, Organizational Performance
Senior Pricing Analyst
Senior Analyst, Case Mix
Description:
Category


    Data Analysis
   




City


    Ottawa, Toronto, Ontario, Canada
   







Job Description


    Senior Analyst, Case Mix 
    
 Who we are
    
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
 CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
 At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include

 HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Benefits Pension)
 Retirement Planning Program
 Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
 Work-life balance
 Career Planning Program
 Learning and Professional Development Program
 Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts



 Why is this role important?
     Working as a part of the Case Mix team, the Senior Analyst will carry out a range of activities that contribute to the development, maintenance and enhancement of methodologies and products that support health system and population health decision-making. Major responsibilities include leading data analyses, incorporating new data sources, conducting quality assurance activities, and communicating analyses to internal and external audiences. In addition, the Senior Analyst will coordinate projects, prepare and contribute to reports and documentations, and assist with other project activities such as supporting the use of the CIHI products. The Senior Analyst will be working with a range of data sets from the hospital, primary care, mental health, residential care, and home care sectors. 
    
 What you'll do
     1. Performs qualitative and quantitative analyses using data across multiple healthcare settings to understand population health and analyze the patient journey
    
 2. Leads analytical activities related to the ongoing development and evolution of case mix grouping methodologies 
    
 3. Provides analytical support to additional ad-hoc requests and special studies as required. 
    
 4. Develops and maintains detailed knowledge of the case mix methodologies and CIHI data holdings used to produce outputs.
    
 5. Prepares related documentations as required; presents work progress, findings, summaries to internal and external audiences.
    
 6. Develops and maintains relationships by working in collaboration with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
    
 7. Respects privacy and confidentiality of information by following policies in privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information at CIHI and related procedures and directives. 
    
 What you'll bring to the table
    
Undergraduate degree in epidemiology, statistics, mathematics, economics, health services research, health administration or other relevant field. Masters degree is considered an asset.

3-5 years experience working in a health care research/information environment involved in the analysis, design and dissemination of research studies and related information products.

Advanced SAS programming skills. Experience with R or Python is considered an asset.

Strong analytical skills, with experience using predictive modeling to manipulate and draw insights from large datasets.

Strong interpersonal, presentation, verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology.

Project planning, time management and organizational skills.

Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Existing knowledge of CIHI clinical databases is an asset. 

Fluency in both official languages is an asset. 

Ability to meet minimal travel requirements. 

 Closing Statement
    
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
 We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


 Employment Equity
    
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.





Analyste principal, Groupes clients 
    
 Notre organisation
    
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
 Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
 L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants : 

une structure salariale concurrentielle
 un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
 l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
 un programme de planification de la retraite
 un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
 un programme de planification de carrière
 des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel



 Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
     Au sein de l’équipe des Groupes clients, l’analyste principal effectue un éventail d’activités contribuant à l’élaboration, à la mise à jour et à l’amélioration de méthodologies et de produits qui orientent la prise de décisions relatives aux systèmes de santé et à la santé de la population. Il est principalement appelé à diriger des analyses de données, à intégrer de nouvelles sources de données, à mener des activités d’assurance de la qualité et à diffuser les résultats des analyses à des publics internes et externes. L’analyste principal coordonne des projets, participe à la préparation de rapports et d’autres documents, et prend part à d’autres activités de projet comme le soutien à l’utilisation des produits de l’ICIS. Il travaille avec une variété d’ensembles de données provenant des hôpitaux et des secteurs des soins primaires, de la santé mentale, des soins en hébergement et des services à domicile. 
    
 Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
     1. Effectuer des analyses qualitatives et quantitatives à l’aide de données provenant de divers milieux de soins afin de mieux comprendre la santé de la population et d’analyser le cheminement des patients.
    
 2. Diriger les activités d’analyse liées à l’élaboration et l’évolution continues des méthodologies des groupes clients
    
 3. Offrir au besoin un soutien analytique dans le cadre d’autres demandes et études spéciales. 
    
 4. Acquérir et maintenir une connaissance approfondie des méthodologies des groupes clients et des banques de données de l’ICIS utilisées dans la production des rapports.
    
 5. Préparer des documents connexes au besoin; présenter des rapports d’avancement des travaux, des résultats et des résumés à des publics internes et externes.
    
 6. Cultiver des relations de collaboration avec divers intervenants internes et externes.
    
 7. Respecter le droit à la vie privée et protéger la confidentialité de l’information en suivant les politiques sur le respect de la vie privée et la confidentialité de l’information sur la santé de l’ICIS ainsi que les procédures et directives connexes. 
    
 Que mettriez-vous à profit ? 
    
Diplôme universitaire de premier cycle en épidémiologie, en statistique, en mathématiques, en économie, en recherche sur les services de santé, en administration de la santé ou dans un domaine connexe. Maîtrise, un atout.

3 à 5 ans d’expérience de l’analyse, de l’élaboration et de la diffusion d’études de recherche et de produits d’information connexes dans le domaine de l’information ou de la recherche sur les soins de santé.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la programmation SAS. Expérience des langages de programmation R ou Python, un atout.

Excellentes aptitudes pour l’analyse et expérience de l’utilisation des techniques de modélisation prédictive afin de manipuler des données et de tirer des enseignements à partir de grands ensembles de données.

Entregent, excellentes aptitudes pour la présentation et la communication verbale et écrite, dont la capacité de vulgariser des concepts complexes.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la planification de projets, la gestion du temps et l’organisation.

Capacité manifeste à travailler seul ou en équipe.

Connaissance des bases de données cliniques de l’ICIS, un atout. 

Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle; maîtrise du français, un atout. 

Capacité à répondre aux exigences minimales de déplacement. 

 Declaration
    
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
 Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.
 La vaccination reste l’outil le plus efficace pour réduire le risque de COVID-19. L’ICIS s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de ses employés au lieu de travail. Par conséquent, l’ICIS exige une preuve de vaccination pour tous ses employés, à moins qu’une mesure d’adaptation ne s’applique en vertu de la loi.
 L’utilisation dans le présent document de la forme masculine ou féminine, selon le contexte, a pour seul but d’alléger le texte.


 Équité en emploi
    
L'ICIS s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, sans obstacle et accessible. Il s'engage entre autres à prendre les mesures d'adaptation nécessaires en vue de favoriser une participation équitable aux processus de recrutement et de sélection. Par conséquent, si vous avez des besoins spéciaux, nous nous efforcerons d'y répondre.
