Title: ETL/BI/Systems Analyst Information Management & Privacy Department
Description:
ETL/BI/Systems Analyst
Information Management & Privacy Department
Reporting to the Manager, Information Management, the ETL/BI Developer/Systems Analyst supports the maintenance, development and expansion of the BI platform with a focus on the analysis, design, and development and maintenance of SQL Server databases, ETL processes, SSIS & SSAS packages. The Developer will have oversight of the organization’s business intelligence (BI) operations and capabilities and will help advance the Agency’s data strategy related to data integration, architecture and statistical modelling.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Analysis, design, and development and maintenance of SQL Server databases, ETL processes, SSIS & SSAS packages:

Builds and maintains the required ETL processes and SSIS packages to extract the information from disparate sources to the data warehouse
Develops databases from conceptual, logical and physical modeling through to implementation
Creates complex queries, stored procedures and SQL scripts to implement business logic for ETL processes Develops SSAS cubes, based on cube specifications
Assesses the impact of changes in source systems to the Data Warehouse and reports
Performs routine database maintenance including re-builds, de-fragmentation, re-indexing, expansion, back-ups and archiving
Handles common database procedures such as upgrade, data cleansing and data migration backup, database administration and maintenance, performance tuning, query tuning and optimization, recovery, migration, etc.
Expands and enhances the existing database design and architecture, data model, ETL rules, data lifecycle management and reporting elements to support new reporting requests and required reporting platform
Develops security procedures and measures including building SSAS row level security to avoid unauthorized access
Creates and maintains data-related documentation, technical and functional design documents (e.g. ETL/Data warehouse architecture, data dictionary, metadata and data governance documents and manuals)
Identifies any issues related to database performance and ETL processes and provide corrective measures
Ensures data processes are performing efficiently and are using best practices, standards, and guidelines to meet high standards of data quality and integrity in databases
Applies automation and innovation on new data platforms and on-going on any new development projects / initiatives aligned to business or organizational strategies

Reporting & Analytics:

Architects data models that are used in business reporting, analytics, business performance, usage stats, automation, artificial intelligence and machine learning
Creates compliance/performance dashboards and scorecard using business intelligence tools (i.e. Cognos and Power BI)
Provides consultative and analytical support regarding the collection, interpretation, analysis and presentation of data to help teams ensure that clinical information management practices support best practice standards.
Develops and enhances data reports using complex SQL queries based on report specifications


Acts in accordance with and incorporates Society's Code of Ethics, Confidentiality, Anti-Oppression/Anti-Racism, Harassment & Discrimination policies, etc.
Uses sound judgment in consideration of financial resources.
Complies with Society’s financial policies and procedures.
Works in a safe manner in accordance with the Society’s health and safety policies and procedures and all relevant legislation.
Performs other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
Education and Experience

Undergraduate Degree or Diploma in Health/Child Welfare Administration, Information Management, Math/Statistics, Business Administration, Software Development) or related discipline
Minimum of 3-5 years of progressive work experience in the field of BI development, SQL programming, reporting & analytics experience

Knowledge and Skills

Demonstrated knowledge of programming language and coding experience
Strong hands on experience in ETL (extract- transform-load) technology and data Warehousing design strategies, OLTP and OLAP and design best practices
Strong hands on experience in ETL (extract- transform-load) technology and data Warehousing design strategies design best practices, including operational maintenance.
Strong SQL Skills; Write complex SQL queries, functions, triggers, stored procedures
Experience in performance tuning SSIS packages
Proficient in the integration of data from different sources
Experience in creating OLAP cubes, identifying dimensions, attributes, hierarchies and calculating measures in SQL Server Analysis Services
Knowledge and experience with Microsoft ecosystem (e.g. Azure, SSRS, SSAS, SSIS and SQL Server, Office365, PowerBI).
Experience with SQL or SAS, advanced report writing with Cognos BI and/or Power BI reporting systems
Strong aptitude to learn new data sets.
Experience in the design and development of scorecards, key performance indicators, with appropriate targets to support ongoing quality measures, planning and reporting
Understanding of information and information technology and its application to business problems (e.g. business intelligence platforms, data warehouses, and visualization tools)
Demonstrated ability to understand and communicate complex business requirements to technology teams
High-attention to detail and problem-solving ability to address data quality and performance issues and reporting requirements
Ability to assess, evaluate and interpret information for data quality
Excellent oral, writing, editing and public presentation skills.
Demonstrated critical thinking, problem solving and decision-making skills.
Strong teamwork and communication skills, plus a flexible approach to tasks and the working environment.

Assets

Experience in the child welfare sector

OTHER INFORMATION
Accommodation at CAST 
We are committed to a selection process and work environment that is inclusive and barrier free. Accommodation will be provided in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code. Applicants need to make any accommodation requests for the interview or selection process known in advance by contacting the Human Resources Department at 416-924-4640 x2300. Human Resources will work together with the hiring committee to arrange reasonable and appropriate accommodation for the selection process which will enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.
Equity Hiring Strategy and Application Process 
The Children’s Aid Society of Toronto (CAS of Toronto) is committed to building a skilled workforce that reflects the population of Toronto as well as the diverse communities we serve. For this specific career opportunity to support our Equity Hiring Strategy, CAS of Toronto is inviting applications from qualified individuals who self-identify as being part of one or more of the following under-represented groups:

racialized (visible minority)
persons with disabilities
2SLGBTQ+

This initiative is deemed to be a Special Program under the Ontario Human Rights Code.
During the online application process, applicants will have the opportunity to complete the Employment Equity questionnaire, to indicate if they self-identify as being part of one or more of the above under-represented groups. Answering the questionnaire is voluntary and all responses will be kept confidential and used only for the purposes outlined in this program. If the questionnaire is not completed by an applicant, they will not be considered as being from an equity seeking group.
The information collected will help us identify qualified applicants from the listed under-represented groups for this specific opportunity as part of our Equity Hiring Strategy. In addition, information provided will be used to understand the diversity of candidates that apply to roles within CAS of Toronto. A summary of the responses to this questionnaire will be used to help assess application trends and inform the development of enhanced and future recruitment programs which are equitable and accessible.
Qualified applicants who are interested in this opportunity can apply for position by submitting their application consisting of a cover letter and resume at https://www.torontocas.ca/careers , fax (416-324-2400), or mail (30 Isabella Street, 5th Floor) to the attention of Human Resources.
Applications must be received in the Human Resources Department, NO LATER THAN 11:59 PM on MONDAY JUNE 27, 2022.
***All newly hired Children’s Aid Society of Toronto employees are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a condition of hire*** 
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $33,525.83-$136,722.62 per year
Benefits:

Company pension
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Vision care

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-06-27

Title: Building Performance Analyst
Description:
CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for a Building Performance Analyst in our Toronto, ON office. Take a look at the description below. If you think your skills and experiences make you a good match for this position, we'd love to hear from you. We're looking for creative, curious, empathetic people to join our Living-Centered Design movement.
 ABOUT OUR FIRM
 CannonDesign is an integrated design solutions firm focused on helping people continuously flourish. Whether designing for innovations in health, new scientific discoveries, equity in education or the next big idea in business, we use our Living-Centered Design approach to help organizations realize widespread change. Our ability to design transformational places, plans and strategies is why Fast Company named us a World Changing Company and one of the most innovative design firms in the world.
 ABOUT THE ROLE
 You will be a member of our multi-disciplinary sustainability team, collaborating with design and technical leadership as an integral part of project teams across the firm. The primary responsibilities will include the following:
 WHAT YOU WILL DO

Perform building performance analysis and produce graphical representations of results for communication with our multi-disciplinary teams across multiple markets and office locations.
Develop visually appealing graphical representation of building energy consumption, thermal envelope performance, daylighting, glare, thermal comfort, renewable energy analysis, climate analysis, massing, orientation and other performance metrics for project pursuits and active design work.
Develop detailed energy and daylighting analyses to complement early design simulations and feedback.
Manage the documentation for LEED energy credits, energy code compliance reports and other performance rating systems.
Assist firm sustainability leadership in business development and management of building performance-related work.
Research performance modeling methodologies, workflows and software to improve how the firm delivers high-performance design solutions.
Develop research, case studies and white papers to present findings and recommendations both internally and externally.
Represent the firm and our building performance work at interviews and conferences.
Assist in the production of narratives, approaches, and fees for project proposals.
May perform related duties as required.

ABOUT YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Architectural, Environmental, Civil or Mechanical Engineering required. Masters or advanced coursework preferred.
Minimum of 5 years of building performance analysis experience required.
Must have experience in data analysis, energy modeling, and visualization tools, and be well versed in A/E/C industry trends related to high performance buildings. Experience with net-zero energy buildings and advanced metering technologies is preferred.
Must have familiarity with ASHRAE Standard 90.1, ASHRAE Standard 62.1, LEED Reference Guides, California Title 24, IECC, and other energy related codes.
Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills are essential.
Experience with EnergyPlus, OpenStudio, IES-VE, eQuest, EnergyPro, and/or similar building energy modeling and performance optimization software is required.
Proficiency with BIM applications strongly desired.
Experience in computational design and programming languages such as Python strongly desired.
This position may require travel to other CannonDesign offices as well as client locations.
One or more credential such as LEED, CPHC, BEMP or similar strongly desired. PE or RA a plus.




  ABOUT WORKING HERE
 


We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about.
We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our DEI Council, Employee Resource Groups and other community advocacy initiatives.
We're about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we're ready for you.




Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.



  As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.
 


  CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce and is committed to Employment Equity and the Federal Contractors Program. We encourage applications from qualified aboriginal Canadians, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities and women. CannonDesign is committed to providing accommodation for people with accessibility needs due to disabilities in all aspects of the hiring process. If contacted, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

Title: Senior Analyst, PMO
Description:
Highlights of the job

   We are hiring a Full-Time Permanent position working out of Edmonton, AB!
 


 The Senior Analyst, Drainage Services PMO is accountable for the performance of the Drainage Services Project Management Office (PMO) by working with Drainage Services Project and Program Managers, Capital Finance, and Capital Steering Committees.
 




  This includes providing document training and support to Project Managers throughout the project management lifecycle, delivery of appropriate project reporting (monthly, quarterly, budget and year-end), providing expert training in Oracle Projects, scheduling and participating in the capital steering committee and project/program level meetings.
 
 What you’d be responsible for

 Provide input to the Drainage Services, PMO plans and directions.
 Ensure an appropriate understanding of Drainage Services PMO strategies.
 Maintain Drainage Services capital projects information systems (Oracle Projects, CAPEX Dashboard, Project SharePoint sites, Work Management Systems); recording, monitoring, forecasting, and budgeting of all project expenditures.
 Analyze the monthly and quarterly project variance and forecast reports for review by the Capital Steering Committee. 
Provide data mining and analytics support to retrieve project information from various sources such as Oracle, CAPEX Dashboard, SharePoint, and Power BI. 
Work with the Manager, PMO to maintain consistent project management templates, forms and standards. 
Create and use spreadsheets and databases to collect, compare, and analyze data and prepare trends
 Provide support and training to Project Managers in the functionality of Oracle Projects to facilitate accuracy in project financial reporting. 
Assist the Manager, PMO in the delivery of the annual capital budget, long-term plans and regulatory filings including development of associated template and reports, providing training and holding meetings. 
Develop and maintain collaborative and supportive relationships with all Drainage Services departments and groups including, but not limited to:
   
 Project Management
 Supply Chain
 Regulatory and 
Individual Project Managers

 Ensure an appropriate understanding of capitalization policies and communicate potential issues in application to Capital Finance for review and assessment. 
Must be comfortable and experienced in written and oral communications. Will be asked to prepare reports and make presentations at meetings as required. 
Review, understand and incorporate the company policies (i.e. capital investment, supply chain, finance) and procedures into daily activities. 
Demonstrate a high performance, high discipline, safe, accountable, focused, innovative and achievement-oriented, easy to do business with manner of working.

 What’s required to be successful

 Completed diploma or degree in operational management, accounting or a related project management field. 
Minimum 7 years of related experience in the area of projects/project management and/or data analytics.
 A minimum of 5 years in a Project Management Office and/or Stage Gate Administrator role would be preferred.
 Understanding and experience of Project Management processes and knowledge areas and stage gates processes.
 A minimum of 5 years experience in analyzing technical information and the ability of making timely, well rationalized decisions would be considered an asset.
 Experience in providing and/or facilitating training would be preferred.
 Demonstrated proficiency of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Access, Project and Visio)
 Strong familiarity with Oracle Applications or similar ERP systems. Proficiency with Oracle Projects will be considered a strong asset
 Strong familiarity with SharePoint and workflow approvals will be considered a strong asset.



 As our best candidate, you demonstrate excellent communication skills both verbal and written. You will also possess the ability to transition between working independently and supporting team initiatives and have a keen attention to detail with excellent planning and organizational skills.
 


 Our ideal candidate must also portray an urgency and understanding to critical issues with applications and diligently work to resolve them. Our best candidate possesses active learning skills to allow them to continually adapt to new changes to technology and business requirements. In addition, a strong work ethic and critical thinking skills are for successful project management.
 
 Other important facts about this job

   Jurisdiction: CSU52
 

   Class: T3
 

   Wage: $47.76 - $57.00 per hour (Final Wage and Step will be determined at the time of selection and is based on a combination of factors as outlined in the Collective Agreement that may be found online.)
 

   Hours of work: 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week
 


 Internal Applicants please ensure that you are using your “
  @epcor.com”
 


 Application deadline: June 30, 2022
 


 This position may be eligible for a $500 employee referral reward! Ensure you enter Employee Referral as the referral source when you are applying.
 


 Learn more about Working at EPCOR!
 


 Please note the following information:
 


 A requirement of working for EPCOR is that you are at least 18 years of age and legally entitled to work in Canada. (A copy of a valid work permit may be required.)
 If you are considered for the position, clearance on all applicable background checks (which may include criminal, identity, educational, and/or credit) and professional reference checks is required. Some EPCOR positions require an enhanced level of background assessment, which is dictated by law. These positions require advanced criminal record checks that must also be conducted from time to time after commencement of employment.
 A technical/practical assessment may be administered during the selection process and this exercise will be used as a part of the selection criterion.
 To meet the physical demands required of some positions, candidates must be in good physical condition and willing to work in all weather conditions. Clearance on pre-placement medical and drug and alcohol testing may be required.

Title: Senior Research Data Analyst
Description:
About Ipsos 

 Ipsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions. 

 Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD). 


ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS: FP www.ipsos.com 

 At Ipsos, we make market research work. We know numbers. We understand people. And we succeed in delivering results. That’s why so many of the world’s leading brands and organizations look to us for their research needs. 

 Operating in over 80 countries, we are a global leader in survey-based market research and one of the fastest-growing and most successful firms in the business. Our research focuses on five areas of specialty – advertising, marketing, public opinion, loyalty, and media – and our work focuses on our people and our clients. 

 Sound like the right place for your career? Share our passion. Share our success. And join us in being proud to be Ipsos. 

 Senior Research Data Analyst, Toronto 

 (May be open to considering other major US and Canadian cities for the right candidate) 

 Position Summary 

 As a Senior Research Data Analyst you will be responsible to support the Client Service teams by providing in-depth data/statistical analysis to help clients evaluate their advertising and brand performance relative to competition. The Senior Research Analyst will be expected to independently process and deliver analytic deliverables, advise Client Service in study design and interpretation of results, and be able to communicate analytic results with clarity. 

 Ideal Candidate has the following Skills and Experience 

 2-3 years experience in an analytics role 
MS degree in math/stats/research/social sciences preferred (advanced degree completion may be considered for job experience). 
Experience with multivariate statistics (e.g. regression, factor analysis, correspondent analysis, discriminant analysis, drivers analysis) is required. 
Experience with SPSS, SAS and/or R; 
Experience with Text analysis, working with different data sources/types (e.g. social data, qual survey data) is desirable. 
Would be a plus 
Programming experience in Python, VB, 
Data visualization 
Experience with SPSS Modeler. 

 Additionally, you have a reputation for creativity, attention to detail, excellent communication skills both oral and written and strategic insight in the delivery of research services. Above all, you are self-motivated with high energy, can work on multiple projects simultaneously and thrive in a fast paced, and deadline driven environment. 

 We offer a team environment that recognizes and rewards individual achievements. A full-service team of professionals including leading-edge methodological consultants and sector and industry experts will support your work. 

 Ipsos is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other protected class and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. 

 #LI-HYBRID #LI-FM1

Title: Operation Support Services Analyst
Description:
WORK ILLUSTRATION:   The Operation Support Services Analyst provides support in the effective business operations within the Supply Chain and Procurement Services department. Responsibilities include; data gathering, data analysis, identifying gap/variance/trend, conducting research and preparing reports, leading or supporting department projects and programs and providing recommendations against findings to support departmental performance objectives. Additionally, the role provides support to leaders in the day-to-day operations of the group.  The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.
 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead and/or support assigned departmental projects and programs. This includes conducting research on best practices, performing quantitative and qualitative analysis, provide recommendations, and managing project through to implementation and post-evaluation
Support Grid Emergency Management as it relates to Supply Chain
Review and analyze Inventory usage patterns to provide recommendations on ROP, ROQ, and Safety Stock levels
Support Strategic Sourcing, RFx and contract negotiation process
Assist in the identification, creation, development and maintenance of business process flows
Develop governing performance standards as well as training material relevant to the process
Prepare and analyzes Supply Chain departmental metrics and scorecards
Identify gaps and provide sustainable options for continuous business improvement associated with the group. Continuously seek process and business improvements and provide recommendations
Support testing and implementation of various system enhancements in SAP & ARIBA
Conduct cost benefit studies and develop business cases
Assist in the preparation of annual budgets, estimates, forecasting data
Support day-to-day operations of the Supply Chain team


 
COMPETENCIES:

Post-secondary education in Business Administration or equivalent
Three (3) to Five (5) years of experience in Supply Chain, Procurement and Inventory Management
Supply chain/procurement/logistics experience with increasing levels of responsibility or related experience
Knowledge and experience with supplier and contract management
SCMP, CPIM designations or equivalent designation are an asset
Advanced data analysis including but not limited to SQL, Excel, Power Pivot, BI Cubes, SAP ME16 Etc.
Knowledge and experience with process development
Experience in an operationally focused environment is an asset
Knowledge of SAP and Ariba is an asset
Able to manage project schedule, scope, and implementation strategy
Excellent computer skills with advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (i.e. Excel, Word & PowerPoint); ability to build and automate reports and use statistical methodologies for tracking performance or building models
Experience in compiling and presenting reports; must be detailed oriented
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Demonstrates customer focus: Able to influence, gain support and commitment from others


 
Toronto Hydro has implemented a mandatory vaccination requirement for all its employees. Proof of full vaccination will be required upon receiving a conditional offer of employment. Toronto Hydro will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code.


 Job Segment: Logistics, Supply Chain, Data Analyst, Strategic Sourcing, Emergency Management, Operations, Data, Government

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

 Job Description:

 Role Summary
 Client Experience Office (CXO) aims to provide a holistic "One Sun Life" experience to Clients as we help them achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. We design and execute clear, compelling, caring journeys to help Clients navigate some of the most important moments of their lives. Through personalized, proactive and relevant content, we act on a deep understanding of Client needs on a multitude of communication channels—so we can be there for Clients when and where they need us.

 To understand our Clients, we actively listen and learn by employing experts in Client experience, engagement, marketing, strategy, and digital, data and analytics.

 As a Senior Data Analyst on the Analytic Operations team, you will be part of a large analytics community and will be focused within the Client Acquisition business helping the team by, but not limited to, mining data for business insights, analyzing and interpreting trends using statistical tools and techniques, reporting on business performance, and triaging code and data-related issues.

 Sun Life views success in this role related to 4 key characteristics:
 Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles, with strong attention to detail. Understanding business. We’ve got a lot of data, and you need to turn it into insights, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean. A passion for solving problems. The most successful data analysts don’t just spin data and give numbers, they solve the problem. Technical skills and a thirst for learning. How to wrangle structured data is a must (i.e., SQL) with strong SAS skills needed currently. The transition to Python is underway as our data environment matures, and we’re looking for people who strive to continuously learn and try new tools and techniques.

 What will you do?

 Stitch together complex data sets to unlock insights for the business aiming to evolve the Smart Lead Assignment process
 Analytic work from requirements specification, data gathering, analysis to presentations in order to solve business problems
 Ability to draw out business insights from analytical output and work with team leads to put together business recommendations.
 Put together effective presentations of findings and desire to present to multiple levels of stakeholders
 Automate recurring tasks to free up capacity. Find efficient ways of working
 Work with stakeholders across Sun Life as a subject matter expert in the prospect, client and advisor data
 Develop metrics and KPIs to measure the performance of analytical and data products in the overall portfolio
 Support campaign deployment


 Measure progress and roadmap of the related projects within the Assignment and Matching portfolio.


 What do you need to succeed?

 Over 4 years experience working with data (i.e., quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data, hypothesis testing, A/B testing and creating analytical reports)
 Minimum of 4 years experience with SQL. Comfortable writing accurate, efficient, but complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources
 Minimum of 3 years experience using SAS to work with data, including macros
 Experience using oral and written storytelling to share data driven insights in a clear, succinct way
 Ability to work as a team to help deliver multiple projects with courage in managing expectations of team leaders
 Ability to document work
 BSc in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)


 What will be nice to have?

 Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, re-insurance and casualty insurance)
 Understanding of predictive and prescriptive techniques (i.e., regression, decision trees, deep learning etc.)
 MSc preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science)
 Additional statistical programming languages (i.e., Python/R)
 Experience working with unstructured data
 Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka, etc.


 What is in it for you?

 Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
 20 days vacation per year and an innovative sabbatical program
 A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
 Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
 Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family
 Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
 Fitness and wellness programs that help you balance work and life and enjoy a healthier lifestyle


 The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

 Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

 Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

 At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

 Sun Life is committed to the health and safety of all those in our workplaces and our communities. In accordance with Sun Life’s Vaccination Policy (Canada):

 Employees permitted to work remotely are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location where activity related to Sun Life business occurs.
 Employees whose job duties require them to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location for Sun Life business must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective May 1st.
 Employees whose regular workplace is a Financial Centre and SLFD field leaders must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or participate in Sun Life’s Rapid Screening Program to attend a Financial Centre or an offsite event.


 We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 Salary Range: 68,400/68 400 - 111,700/111 700
 
 Job Category: Advanced Analytics
 
 Posting End Date: 30/06/2022

Title: Business Analyst II, Corporate Digitization, Automation & Innovation
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

    The Corporate Transformation and Operations group (CTO) is an integrated shared services group across Finance, TBSM (Treasury & Balance Sheet Management), HR (Human Resources), Risk and Compliance with the strategic objectives of leveraging the best of our capabilities, enhancing operational alignment, creating greater capacity and focus, and unlocking new and exciting career paths for our colleagues.
     The Corporate Digitization, Automation & Innovation (CDAI) team is a part of the CTO and is a strategic partner-centric organization that develops the CTOs automation strategy and supports corporate partners through education & ideation discussions, prioritization, development and delivery of automation solutions that drive sustainable business value and help realize TDs CTO strategic objectives.
   



Job Description

    Reporting to the Senior Manager, the Intermediate Business Analyst will work closely with CTO partners to support Corporate Work Enablement (CWE) strategy and promotion of 'DIY' tools & enabling technology; support outreach, education, and development of automation builds for corporate partners. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with other CWE and CDAI colleagues to capture meaningful metrics and build reports using dashboards and other visualization tools. This individual will work collaboratively with stakeholders including business, technology, and other CTO partners.
    
 Additional accountabilities include, but are not limited to:
    
 Educate stakeholders across the corporate areas and create awareness of the available capabilities to improve and automate processes
 Support CDAI and CWE teams in building and managing positive relationships with key stakeholders in business, technology, and other enabling practices
 Delivery of key Tech & Tools focused tactics through CWE working groups
 Project coordination of CWE & CDAI initiatives, such as tracking status against timelines, and identification and escalation of risks to team leaders (when needed)
 Understand feasibility of new opportunities and assess their alignment to other initiatives to ensure overall fit
 Meet regularly with CTO and other Corporate partners to share status updates for in-flight builds
 Work with internal teams to identify critical success factors and integrate appropriate cost, quality, and risk mitigating strategies into project plans.
 Create awareness amongst corporate partners to ensure teams understand the post-delivery support model and their role during the development lifecycle, such as:
      
 Definition of the future-state process
 Articulating the benefits opportunity of automating some / all of a process (to support prioritization)
 Documentation of requirements
 Identifying validation scenarios
 Providing input into Change Management plans (as needed, based on initiative size)

 #LI-Hybrid
   


Job Requirements


Post-secondary education and 2+ years related project experience
 Sound to intermediate knowledge of business analysis, project delivery practices, and standards across the project life cycle
 Sound understanding of Project Management lifecycle and Change Management methodologies
 Diligent in gathering information and critical evaluation against defined criteria
 Very strong analytical and problem-solving skills; design and data mindset
 Self-motivated with deep intellectual curiosity; enjoys 'hacking' processes and creating efficient flows
 A logical thinker, demonstrates strong business acumen
 High degree of attention to detail with the patience to solve puzzles
 Proven ability to work effectively with teams and individually
 Comfortable presentation and facilitation skills; writes clearly and concisely
 Process Mapping (intermediate)
 Problem Solving (intermediate)
 Process Coordination & Management (intermediate)
 Analytical Thinking (Working)
 Change Leadership (Working)
 Influencer (Working)
 Working knowledge of Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Alteryx, Power BI / Power Apps and other visualization tools would be considered a strong asset
 Undergraduate or graduate degree focused on Business or Technology is an asset




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Intelligence Team Lead
Business Intelligence Project Lead
Description:
JOB SUMMARY
 




   Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager for the Consumer Goods division, the Business Intelligence Project Lead acts as the data business leader for the analytics hub. DATA is fundamental to our growth, not only on the 1p Customer /Marketing / Digital (our core focus today) but also on all sales related processes (sell in, pos, sell out) and support processes (supply chain, allocation, customer care,).
 




   YOUR ROLE:
 




   You will interact daily with your peers in the Sales & Data team, the Zone BI teams, brands, other L’Oréal division partners (external data scientists from Startups or universities) and of course our IT/Data teams (NYC, Latam and Local). You will act as the Sales Business Intelligence Project Lead for L’Oréal Canada Customer Product Division.
 




   USE CASES ROADMAP 
 

Drive use case generation at Customer Product Division Level 
Use case Opportunities: Interact with business stakeholders to understand their business contexts and key business issues 
Use case feasibility of business intelligence use cases, in collaboration with the teams (both business and technical) 
Work with Business Intelligence manager to prioritize use cases based on ROI, feasibility, time to market or any other considerations





   USE CASES DELIVERY 
 

Manage the resources that will work on Business Intelligence use cases 
Understand and challenge their process and goals 
Review delivery, assess quality of work and documentation 
Manage the relationship with internal tech teams 
Data accessibility with IT teams (data factories) 
Build the end user business logic and ways of working 
Manage data quality process for POS, Customer Inventory and Sell-Out





   BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE CULTURE 
 

Contribute to the visibility of Canada Customer Product Division Business Intelligence both internally and externally 
Design dashboards and tools to meet the user needs 
Test data deliveries to make sure they meet user requirements 
Educate our workforce (from Execs to operational teams) on data (why and what) 
Act as a mentor for Data Analysts (or related data jobs) who are eager to develop themselves into more advanced data related jobs





   KEY PROJECTS
  




  Customer inventory: work with Zone IT to understand the different data sources available and what is available in them. Understand different data owner cultures and expertise. Guide and build the required data sets to support the dashboards needs. Understand the different user stories. Build a connected data set to report information and\or work with developers to build it. Design the final dashboards and Excel files for the users to consume information. Provide training and documentation on the use cases. 
 

  Business Planning: work hand in hand business planning, finance, and Zone IT to deliver the Business Planning analytical environment solution. Bridge the gap between user stories and deliveries. Make sure the data meets the end user expectations merging multiple sources to define the Sales single source of truth. Build a connected data set to report information and\or work with developers to build it. Design the final dashboards and Excel files for the users to consume information. Provide training and documentation on the use cases.
 




   WHO YOU ARE:
 




   The ideal candidate has a proven track record and experience in DATA, advanced analytics knowledge, but is also able to influence, communicate and interpret data with business stakeholders. Challenge businesses current processes, disrupt the existing process and influence decisions.
 




   PROFILE 
 

About 5 years of experience in data and analytics – could be a mix of business/analytics and IT role 
Excellent knowledge of analytics at large 
At least 2 years of experience in Power BI desktop and Service 
Capacity to understand business challenges and opportunities 
Will and capacity to grow the business (growth hacker mindset) 
Capacity to think on the strategic layer but also on the execution one 
Experience working with Agile-driven projects & teams 
Capacity to think out of the box, data driven with good communication and project management skills 
Experience in Retail/consumer goods industry /finance/sales a real asset 




  L'Oreal Canada is an inclusive employer for all.
 



You can apply to up to three jobs within a rolling 30-day window. 
You cannot withdraw your application once you applied, so please make sure to choose a job that matches your dreams. 
Please visit "Your Application Space" to see the jobs you have already applied to. 
Please don’t create another account with a different email. If you do so, your account might be merged and your application record will be deleted.

Title: Business System Analyst - Salesforce
Description:
We’re growing!! And looking a for passionate, driven, and energetic candidate to join our team for the position of Business System Analyst - Salesforce located in our Head Office in Guelph, Ontario.
 Job Description
 Reporting to the IT Manager, the Business System Analyst - Salesforce is responsible for strategizing with Skyline and its Group of Companies to create customized solutions and deliver unique solutions that illustrate value and benefits to the business. This role will review and learn the challenges that Skyline is facing and implement updates according to those needs as well as while enforcing database standards while maintaining focus on our shared goal of creating meaningful value and an exceptional experience for our customers, our people and our communities.
 What you will be doing:

 Maintain performance, security and integrity of all applications and databases.
 Partner with internal stakeholders, including implementation consultants and software training specialists, to create and execute implementation plans that are on-time and with the highest customer satisfaction.
 Investigate and analyze businesses needs in order to work with users to develop, model and design various programs.
 Extract data, compile reports, and develop customized reporting as required by users and management. Ensure appropriate approvals and access for new projects or requests.
 Coordinates team efforts to resolve complex issues and conflicts and escalate to executive level wherever required.
 Assist in identifying process improvements for software performance, reliability and stability.
 Troubleshoot complex database issues in a timely fashion.
 Develop training materials as required and assist in training of users.

 What we look for:

 A deep knowledge of Salesforce product offerings and solutions.
 Someone who really wants to develop, analyze, customize and review current Salesforce practices, specifically for financial services.
 You know your stuff when it comes to technical configuration plans based on business needs and requirements.
 Skilled in Internet related applications and web browsers including cloud and SAAS.
 Strong SQL programming expertise and ability to create SQL reports.
 A Jack of all trades, you have mid-level knowledge of mainstream software (e.g. MS Office, Windows, Apple products) and associated set-up and management.
 You're a troubleshooting and problem solving wizard!
 Understanding and appreciation of network concepts.
 Strong project management skills including risk management, you keep things on track!

 Why you want to work here:

 You like to be recognized for the magic you do (trouble shooting technical problems).
 Providing great customer service is something you thrive on.
 You get a thrill from staying organized and details are your “thing”
 Coding and problem solving really amps you up!
 Being part of a great team has been your dream.
 You see the matrix (i.e. have good judgement and innovation)
 Working for a growing company that supports environmental stewardship and social responsibilities is a must for you.
 You want to work for a company that supports work-life balance and truly cares that you are 100% fulfilled in your life.

 The Skyline Group of Companies is a fully integrated investment management organization: grounded in real estate, powered by people, and growing for the future. Every aspect of Skyline is managed with the utmost care and attention to detail, from consulting with investors to fostering a sense of community at each and every one of its properties.
 We offer our employees competitive pay, benefits, paid volunteer day, group RSP, on-going training, growth potential and so much more. Our workplace culture empowers staff at all levels to become involved in supporting and building vibrant communities.
 Come be a part of Skyline – Building Careers and Communities!

Title: Business Intelligence Coordinator (Remote)
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies. 
Sports Experts – Business Intelligence Coordinator 
Part of the Canadian Tire family is Sports Experts. Your Sports Experts! Built on more than 50 years tradition on customer focus, Sports Experts is headquartered in Laval, Quebec. Sports Experts is proud to promote a wide selection of sports equipment, clothing and footwear of renowned and exclusive brands. We are the destination to Stay fit. Live well. 
FGL Sports is looking for a Coordinator – Business Intelligence, in order to meet the requirements and priorities of the Business Intelligence department. Your role will be to support the analysts using different data tools. You will have to organize, evaluate and update several data sources needed for the Business Intelligence department. 

What you’ll do 

Define the data structure to meet the visualization needs 
Set up the data model and the necessary data transformation layers to optimize the company's KPIs 
Ensure the quality, integrity and truthfulness of the data used in the BI tools and perform data validation tests with the help of different departments 
Maintain and/or update the different dashboards and other necessary reference tools of the company and manage access to the different tools 
Support the BI team with the different departments of the company and the franchisee network regarding the technological issues of the data tools (Cubes, Power BI, etc.) 
Participate in the maintenance of the DevOps of the different tools (daily uploads, improvements and training documents) 
Perform all other related duties necessary for the proper functioning of the Business Intelligence department 


What you bring 

College or university degree, preferably in computer science, business intelligence, analytics or another related field 
2 to 3 years of experience in data/analysis, a business intelligence tools integration team, e-commerce or any other relevant experience 
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (advanced formulas, VBA, Power Query) 
Excellent French required, excellent English an asset 
Retail experience an asset 
Experience with an ERP, Power BI (an asset) 
Good research and learning skills 
Analytical mind with problem-solving ability 
Important sense of precision and meticulousness 
Autonomous, rigorous and excellent at managing priorities 
Ability to work as part of a team 


About Canadian Tire Corporation 
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . #LI-MM2

Title: Business Analyst for Accounting
Description:
Business Analyst for Accounting 
Reporting to the Regional Controller, the Business Analyst for Accounting is responsible for the coordinated analysis, research and reporting, to support the various projects and strategic planning initiatives within the business units. Key areas for active involvement and accountability include conducting ongoing analysis of financial and business data, identifying data requirements for measurement of deliverables using advanced statistical and analytical methods and data-driven methodologies, validating or modeling data, and compiling customized reports to suit departmental business needs. This position advises management on recommendations for improving internal and external processes and/or optimizing the use of organizational resources. The Analyst will monitor and advise on the performance of the management system, produce data and report on business performance, measuring against set indicators.
Responsibilities 

Be responsible for providing financial, accounting, planning and business support and advice to various levels of management, including special projects and initiatives.
Contribute financial expertise and support for monitoring, analyzing, and assessing and reporting on fiscal performance and forecasts relative to budget and actuals, with respect to expenditure patterns and resource utilization.
Be responsible for quarterly forecasting and annual budgeting process along with monthly results.
As required provide support and coordination to enable completion of various projects on time within budget and within scope, including monitoring and summarizing outcomes and preparing reports for senior leadership.
Provide support in other aspects within the Finance Department.
Assist with annual audit process by maintaining accurate records of support.
Ensure all deadlines and schedules are met on time and in accordance with established timelines.
Develop bridge between legacy reporting and new reporting requirements.
Perform quality assurance audits on data and results generated from analyses, and reports on outcomes.
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications 

A Certified Public Accountant (CPA) title is preferred
Strong familiarity with productivity tools such as Microsoft Office Suite, and in particular

Microsoft Excel

Prior experience with software such as Oracle, SAP, etc. an asset
Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting plus more than 3 years of accounting experience
Critical math skills and a proven ability to do difficult calculations
Ability to utilize independent judgment in establishing the accuracy and reasonableness of information
Must be able to travel into the U.S. as needed from time to time and have a valid passport
Possess strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure.
Demonstrated financial planning, monitoring, analysis and reporting expertise.
Comprehensive technical expertise, process management, analytical skills and business acumen.
Excellent organizational skills and works effectively under time pressure to meet deadlines.
Superior analytical skills including the ability to comprehend complex issues and related data/information and present information in concise meaningful ways.
Broad knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles, and financial analysis techniques.
Broad knowledge of computerized financial systems and procedures.
Results oriented within a high-pressure working environment with numerous critical timelines.
Demonstrated communication skills and ability to understand and clearly relate to others, at all levels of the organization
Utilizes initiative, vision, independent thinking and creative problem-solving abilities.
Equally comfortable working as a member of a team or working independently.
Ability to organize and prioritize workload and meet deadlines.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $70,000.00-$85,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Commuter benefits
Dental care
Disability insurance
Extended health care
Life insurance
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care

Schedule:

Day shift

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Are you excited about the prospect of joining a startup organization on the ground floor? Interested in being a part of the changing skies in Canada and beyond? Want to work with world-class leaders who have extensive industry know-how? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! 
We are seeking a Pricing Analyst for our Commercial division to join our rapidly expanding, dynamic team!
 WHO WE ARE:
 Lynx Air is Canada’s newest ultra-affordable airline, on a mission to make air travel accessible for all. With airfare sky-high in Canada, we give value-seeking travellers an affordable, safe and customer-first flying experience.
 Lynx has taken to the skies, piloting our brand-new fleet of Boeing 737 MAX planes to select Canadian destinations. Our mission is to bring safe, affordable, low-cost air travel to millions of Canadians and we are excited to be building our team that will help us get there!
 Backed by significant financial investment from a group of prominent Canadian and American investors, we are poised to change the Canadian airline landscape. Combining the financial strength of our talented partners with the skills and energy of Canadians like you, we can bring the best practices of the aviation industry to Canada!
 WHAT THE ROLE ENTAILS:
 Reporting to the Revenue Manager, the Pricing Analyst is responsible for the development of short and long-term pricing strategies for fares and ancillary products for the airline. You will be developing competitive, revenue-optimizing strategies for the airlines’ fares and ancillary products across the entire network, including bags, seats, fees, product bundles, etc. as well as management of the revenue forecast and ancillary revenue and pricing systems.
 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

 Develop competitive fare and ancillary revenue initiatives and programs to maximize revenue and provide industry-leading product solutions
 Analyzes demand and customer behavior related to fares and ancillary products and implements pricing strategies
 Manage and administer the process of implementing fare filings in ATPCO
 Reviews reports of market historical performance and advance booking information to isolate areas of need and opportunity
 Examines changes in market conditions such as new competition, merchandising platforms, and selling dynamics to develop appropriate responses to ancillary programs
 Oversight of tactical and strategic pricing actions and monitors and reacts to competitive pricing actions
 Analyzing booking patterns using data analysis, modeling research optimization, and other optimization parameters, identifying trends, outliers, and/or additional revenue opportunities in constantly evolving market conditions
 Implements business processes and revenue improvements by creating procedures for measurement, upkeep, and revision of priced products
 Tracks ancillary performance and reports revenue trends to senior management
 Coordinates cross-department planning and execution for ancillary revenue fees, product pricing, and policies with key stakeholders 
Works to continually improve the customer experience in shopping/purchasing for ancillary products 
Constantly monitors competitor websites for fares and other competitive programs
 Maintain pricing and product data in the Passenger Services System (PSS)

 WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ROLE:

 2+ years of experience in the airline industry 
Proven success in financial planning, budgeting, and PNL
 Working knowledge in business intelligence – data mining, analytics, data cleansing, report conversion 
Conceptually strong and capable of seeing the bigger picture, as well as analyzing and monitoring in detail, with the ability to take actions and quickly react to operational issues 
Analytical approach to problem-solving and data-driven decision support; efficiently pulls and analyzes large data sets for revenue-driving decisions
 A high degree of motivation, commitment, and adaptability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, changing environment
 Experience with Airline Pricing and Revenue Management tools (ATPCO, PROS, etc) is considered a strong asset
 Presentation skills and solutions design delivery, translating ideas into reality
 High proficiency in Excel as well as knowledge of all other MS office suite products

 WHAT YOU WILL GET FROM US:

 Industry competitive salary 
The chance to be part of building something from the ground up. Aggressive growth plans of the organization mean there is no limit to how far you can grow your career with the organization
 An environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance
 Open and collaborative work environment. You bring your great ideas, and we will put them to action 
Comprehensive benefits and HSA
 The opportunity to travel where we fly

 We're an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that places value on the strength that diversity brings to the workplace and that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any kind. Our employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We encourage all applicants who meet the requirements for the role to apply.
 Interviews will be commencing right away, so don’t hesitate and apply today to be part of Canada’s changing aviation landscape! Cover letters are not required.

Title: Manager, Analytics & Business Intelligence, Full Time, Markham Site
Description:
Land Acknowledgement:
 Oak Valley Health honours the traditional territory of the closest Indigenous communities, the Chippewas (chi-puh-waas) of Georgina Island and the Mississaugas of Scugog Island. The Haudenosaunee (Ho-de-no-shau-nee) and Anishinaabe (Ah-nish-in-ah-beh) have lived, worked and existed on this land from time immemorial. This land is covered by Treaty 13 signed with the Mississaugas of the Credit, and the Williams Treaty signed with many Mississauga and Chippewa bands.


 COVID Statement
 As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic and the need to strengthen and promote health protection to patients, staff and members of the public attending in the hospital, prior to the first day of employment with the Hospital, all successful candidates are required to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination (full vaccination is required). In order to provide you with fair & equitable accommodation, you must submit supporting medical exemption documentation or an affidavit detailing why your religion prohibits you from receiving the COVID-19 vaccine.


 Who you are:

You encompass Oak Valley Health’s core values and live the words of Respect, Trust, Commitment, Compassion and Courage
You are a patient and/or client centered individual who performs at an exemplary standard
You are a team player with excellent communication, critical thinking and prioritization skills



 What we need:
 As Analytics & Business Intelligence Manager, you will manage and coach Decision Support and Business Intelligence teams and lead the charge in developing the next stage of data analytics and business intelligence at Oak Valley Health. You will lead and oversee human resources, operations, and all projects within the department.


 The Analytics & Business Intelligence department at Oak Valley Health provides analytical support to all sites and services across organization as well as to selected internal and external initiatives. Our team is composed of highly qualified and experienced data management and analytics professionals from a range of backgrounds and use variety of methods from simple analysis to advanced modelling to support our clients.


 We are seeking a passionate, creative and innovative individual to join our team as Analytics & Business Intelligence Manager.


 What you will achieve with us:
 Reporting to the Director, Business Analytics and Information Management, you will:

 Manage and coach a team of business analysts and BI developers with varied skills and experience levels.
Be responsible for hiring staff, identifying individual training needs proactively, training and advising new and existing staff, conduct performance reviews and maintain a healthy team culture
Research, design, implement and maintain a reporting infrastructure that leads to automated, flexible and insightful reporting - diagnostic and predictive reporting, not just reporting data
Implement best practices in business intelligence development, technical documentation , testing and release, user experience, data modeling, and reporting and be an advocate for agility within the team
Make quick and effective data-driven decisions using sound problem solving and analytical skills and roll-out strategies that align with organization goals and values
Focus on quality, continuous improvement, and standards
Keep the team focus on reliability, performance, and scalability while driving productivity
Work closely with business and clinical teams to understand the problems/challenges they need to solve, and find a creative way of simplifying into an easily understood data model
Effectively and efficiently, collaborate and engage with external and internal stakeholders and act as the point of contact in resolving stakeholder issues
Effectively Manage department projects from inception to completion and lead execution of department roadmap
Commit to, and actively work to remain knowledgeable and up-to-date in the field
Provide strategic advice on the impact of clinical and operations changes on hospital utilization, funding (HSFR and QBP), and performance



 What you bring to the role:


 Required:

Completion of a recognized university degree in Health Administration, Health Informatics, Engineering, Computer science, or equivalent combination of education and experience
Six (6) or more years of progressive related experience in analytics preferably in healthcare
Strong domain knowledge in data and reporting infrastructure design, data modeling and data warehouse configuration and optimization, and providing recommendations on approach and execution.
Experience with relational database structures and the extraction and manipulation of data using SQL
Advanced understanding of visualization techniques with an ability to translate findings into actionable insights
Effective team management skills/mentorship skills and ability to rally the team around an exciting vision
Practical project management skills and ability to handle multiple projects at a time
Proficient use of MS Office suite (specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision and also possessing a positive team spirited attitude
Excellent interpersonal and client relationship skills
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Ability to multi-task with strong attention to detail within a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
Adhering to confidentiality and privacy requirements for sensitive financial and clinical information.

Considered an asset:

A Master’s degree in Health Administration, Health Informatics, Engineering, Computer science, Business, or equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience in leading a team of data analysts, BI developers or data engineers
Experience working with the CIHI datasets (DAD, NACRS, OMHRS, NRS, and CCRS) and other large healthcare datasets (e.g., IntelliHealth, Case Costing)
Working knowledge of health care funding methodologies (HSFR and QBP)
Knowledge & experience with advanced analytics and AI techniques, such as multivariate regression analysis, predictive modelling, logistic regression, Simulation
Prior experience with a major Health Information System (HIS), specially Meditech
Prior experience in working with “Information Builders”
Programming and data management skills, including proficiency in a statistical or programming tool (e.g., SAS, R, Python)



 Compensation:
 BAND D: $93,327-$116,630 annual


 Office:
 Our office is in the Markham area (381 Church Street).


 Why to Stay and Grow with us:
 We are committed to making Oak Valley Health a favored place to work and learn. We offers excellent benefits and programs to our employees, activated upon their start date. These include medical and dental benefits, a leading pension plan (HOOPP) with retirement income for life, group life insurance, and a strong vacation package.
 Oak Valley Health takes pride in serving some of Canada’s most diverse communities. We are committed to fostering an environment of equity and inclusivity where every person can work and receive care safely, openly and honestly. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nation of origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, marital or family status, belief system, or other factors related to one’s personal identity and/or values. Furthermore, Markham Stouffville Hospital is committed to meeting the needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please contact Human Resources.


 Who we are:
 Oak Valley Health is one of Ontario’s leading community healthcare organizations. Across our two sites (Markham and Uxbridge) and Reactivation Care Centre (RCC), we provide high quality, patient-centred care to more than 435,000 patients each year. We offer diagnostic and emergency services and deliver clinical programs in acute care medicine and surgery, addictions and mental health, and childbirth and children’s services. We are also proud to be part of the Eastern York Region North Durham Ontario Health Team (OHT).


 Our 526 physicians, 28 midwives, 2,400 staff and 1,000 volunteers serve patients and families with an honoured to care mindset and are focused on delivering an extraordinary patient experience to the residents of Markham, Whitchurch-Stouffville, Uxbridge and beyond. We are dedicated to providing access to the right care, at the right time, in the right place by the right people and at the right cost. Are you ready to join us?


 Oak Valley Health Diversity Statement


 Oak Valley Health takes pride in serving some of Canada’s most diverse communities. We are committed to fostering an environment of equity and inclusivity where every person can work and receive care safely, openly and honestly. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nation of origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, marital or family status, belief system, or other factors related to one’s personal identity and/or values. Furthermore, Oak Valley Health is committed to meeting the needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please contact Human Resources.

We’re working to ignite hope and foster change for people in our community experiencing mental health or addictions challenges.To help us ensure that we're maintaining best practices and external accountability, this role directly supports all departments through informing evidence-based decision making and service planning. Through efficient data collection and analysis this role supports quality improvement within our services.This role plays a crucial part in making sound recommendations that our leadership and staff will utilize to guide policies & procedures, Health Information Management and programming decisions.Consider revitalizing your career and making a difference in your community by joining our team!Successful candidates must have a Police Vulnerable Sector Check completed in the last six months. What your benefits will be - After a 90-day waiting period, will be enrolled in our extended healthcare benefits plan.


Your pension plan – Will be enrolled in the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP)


PSLRTA Notice - This posting characterizes this position as non-union. However, please be aware that the organization has filed an Application under the Public Service Labour Relations Transition Act to determine whether (a) OPSEU will have bargaining rights for all its employees; or (b) OPSEU will lose its bargaining rights, with the result that all employees will become non-union.

*HOW YOU WILL BE MAKING A DIFFERENCE: *

Assess requests for data, select data elements and identify data sources
Support the development and automation of program evaluation and quality assurance systems and measure as applicable to community mental health programs
Prepare analytical data and provide support to develop and report on performance indicators for all funders
Identify and analyze trends in reported data; monitor and analyze statistical data and indicators against industry benchmarks and the LHIN M-SAA
Compile and analyze data to inform service planning and to identify potential efficiencies

Develop and deliver briefings that identify issues, trends, implications, and recommendations

Collaborate with Directors and Managers in the development and roll-out of performance measures
Disseminate information to inform departments of evolving performance standards
Provide leadership to teams across the organization in transforming data into information and knowledge to be leveraged for quality improvement initiatives and achieving best practice outcomes


Monitor use and support users of the electronic client record and other data collection tools to ensure data quality across the organization


Conduct data quality reviews/audits of inputs and outputs
Provide ongoing technical or functional education to teams across the organization to ensure the standardization of data input and the appropriate use of data collection tools
Liaise with clinical, finance, IT, HR, Quality, and other teams to identify data issues and to initiate changes for improvement of reporting processes and tools.


Acts as database administrator and systems expert for the electronic client record
Acts as primary contact with the electronic client record vendor and leads system updates / upgrades and maintenance in collaboration with the IT team
Acts as lead in integration of systems (ie. CRMS) with business / clinical practices to optimize data utilization and reporting


Orient new and current employees and students to Health Information Management policies and procedures and best practice standards regarding Health Information Management
Provide training and support to employees in the consistent and effective utilization of the electronic client record
Provide support to the Privacy Officer around data requests, audits and protocols
Develop electronic data collection forms/templates for the electronic client record database
Coordinate the storage and maintenance of client records
Ensure the integrity, confidentiality, and security of information held in the electronic client record
Maintain and / or develops training materials for specific software applications
Host a helpdesk to respond to information needs and employee support with

respect to the electronic client record

Lead or participate in special projects as required
Act as a resource to CEO, Directors, Managers, and Committees on data collection, analysis, and interpretation

*WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO APPLY: *Vaccination RequirementsCMHA Thames Valley Addiction & Mental Health Services requires that all staff members be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, with the rare exemption of those individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to approved exemptions (medical reasons or religious grounds as recognized in the Ontario Human Rights Code). Proof of full vaccination or approval of exemption will be required; further details will be provided to those candidates moving forward in the recruitment process.Police Vulnerable Sector Check RequirementsSuccessful candidates must have a Police Vulnerable Sector Check completed in the last six months. Interested applicants who reside in the City of London and are in need of a Police Vulnerable Sector Check (PVSC) are encouraged to apply for one as soon as possible as PVSCs in the City of London are currently taking approximately 3 weeks to be processed and offers of employment cannot be made without receipt of a PVSC.We require the following qualifications: 

Post-secondary education in Healthcare Administration, Health Information Management, Health Informatics, Epidemiology, Statistics or relevant combination of education and experience
A minimum of two years’ experience with data collection, information management, statistical analysis and/or information systems
A minimum of two years’ experience in a community-based healthcare setting in a senior administrative role
Excellent administrative and organizational skills
Proficiency in the use of Windows based applications and other required reporting tools, such as: MS Excel, Crystal Reports
Knowledge of best practice recommendations and applicable legislative compliance standards with respect to privacy, and the collection, use, and disclosure of personal health information (Personal Health Information Protection Act)
Superior oral and written communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively with and encourage administrative staff at all sites within the branch
Proven ability to perform well under pressure, meet deadlines, and adjust to changing priorities

*_We prefer the following qualifications: _*

Certified in Health Information Management (CHIM) by the Canadian College of Health Information Management
Working knowledge of relational databases and SQL
Knowledge of MIS/OHRS and CDS reporting requirements Strong attention to detail
Excellent time management skills and an ability to prioritize multiple tasks
Bilingual both official languages, preferred; préférence sera accordée aux candidats qui sont compétents dans les deux langues officielles du Canada
