Title: Database Analyst 3
Description:
Database Analyst 3

Regular Full Time


Be a part of a historical policing transition by joining our Surrey Police Service 
team today.


The Surrey Police Service (“SPS”) is bringing an era of modern and progressive policing to Surrey. We are a community-based policing service that is at the forefront of public safety. We are committed to meeting our city’s unique priorities and building a
 team that reflects the communities we serve. Help us build a new community-responsive police service that will support one of the fastest growing and diverse cities in Canada.

 Surrey Police Service has an exciting opportunity for a Database Analyst to join the Investigations Bureau unit. This position will be critical as SPS (Surrey Police Service) builds out the information technology infrastructure and support systems to better connect and protect our police officers through our state-of-the-art IT systems and solutions, on our road to police of jurisdiction.
  
 Reporting to the Manager, Information Management and Technology, our successful candidate will apply their database management talents by accessing and allocating database resources for optimum configuration and performance; performing backups and recovery; configuring database parameters and prototype designs against logical data models, defining data repository requirements, data dictionaries, and warehousing requirements. In addition, the Database Analyst supports multiple services and databases of medium to high complexity with multiple concurrent users, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility of data.
  
 This role will require strong communication skills, including an ability to write IT procedures, reports, and documenting business processes and policies. In addition, a person in this role will also need to be comfortable with presenting recommendations to various senior management audiences and key stakeholders at a business level of communication. Finally, providing oversight, communicating work procedures and mentoring junior IT employees may be required as needed.
  
 Our successful candidate will be highly organized and solutions-focused with an ability to think critically and efficiently. Our candidate will thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment with an ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with users, team members, and key stakeholders.
  
 The successful candidate will possess a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Management, or related field by a recognized educational institution supplemented by 2 or more years of related work experience in similar position preferably within a policing and/or public sector organization. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
  


Candidates with Microsoft SQL Server experience will be given preference, however experience with additional database technologies will be an asset.

 This position is unionized represented by CUPE Local 402. The salary range for this position is 
  $50.37/hr-$57.13/hr based on 2022 Rates.
  
 Interested applicants are asked to apply online with a resume and cover letter to our 
  Careers page by 
  11:55 pm, Sunday July 3rd, 2022. For updates on recruitment opportunities and other Surrey Police Service news, follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter.
  

SPS has a vaccination policy in effect with requirements for all current and future 
employees.
Applicants under consideration will be required to undergo a criminal record 
check.


The Surrey Police Service is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We thank all applicants for their 
interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Supply Chain Strategy & Optimization Analyst
Description:
: 1219140
 





 Who we are 
As the Working and Learning Company, we at Staples Canada, are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. At Staples, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We look for people who are curious, approachable and passionate, and who enjoy finding solutions.
If that’s you, let’s work, learn and grow together. 
We are building an inclusive and diverse team
Staples Canada is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
Some of what you will do
As the Supply Chain Strategy & Optimization Analyst, you will support the B2B and B2C business with the right amount of inventory, at the right time, at the right place to serve the business and our customers. You will work closely with Category Specialists, Category Managers and other cross-functional team members to forecast, provide order recommendations, order fulfillment and overall inventory management duties. You will also perform data analysis on a regular basis analyzing current and historical trends, providing insights within their categories. Each day will be rewarding and meaningful.
Specifically, you will:

Perform daily inventory fulfillment tasks in their category including purchase order creation.
Review inventory KPI’s on a frequent basis and discuss the results with the Category Manager to evaluate inventory management opportunities and results.
Manage Store and Fulfillment Centre inventory balancing customer experience, sales while managing to the inventory KPI’s.
Maintain proper SKU/Vendor setup as it relates to replenishment parameters in AS400, JDA Advanced Store Replenishment and/or Advanced Warehouse Replenishment applications.
Complete the daily out of stock review, identifying trends and inventory depth opportunities that could result in out of stocks.
Collect, analyze and report on sales/inventory data to support seasonality and trends. Adjust the forecast/demand in JDA at different fulfillment nodes.
Promotional forecasting – Analyze inventory and sales data (where required) to support proposed promo position and evaluate impact on current and future inventory levels to determine the best way to support customers.
Collaborate, determine load in and maintain forecasts for new items as created by the Category Specialist.
Identify unexpected inventory opportunities between sales and forecast. Research to determine root cause working closely with the Merchant team. Providing recommendations to resolve opportunity.
Manage customer fulfillment KPI’s such as in-stock, late purchase order management, vendor fill rates, system lead days, etc.
Issue and follow up with fulfillment nodes regarding the return to vendor (RTV) program to ensure cost recovery and that inventory is removed from the system in a timely manner.
Execute department and SKU level plans to drive unique Store/FC merchandise inventory strategies. This includes localization and monitoring for smooth transition between selling periods.
Evaluate minimum presentation quantities, stock balancing, and inventory variances at store and make required changes and/or recommendations as required.




 
Some of what you need

2-3 years prior experience in a Merchandising, Buying or Supply Chain role is preferred.
Experience with business intelligence/decision support software
Experience in JDA software 
Successful completion of post-secondary education, with a focus on retail management, inventory or supply chain is an asset.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (specifically Excel, Outlook, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI), SQL and VBA.
Big Data Analytics - Ability to provide insights, and/or predict opportunities proactively by extracting information from the data lake
Ability to manage multiple priorities and to manage their time effectively with changing priorities.
Curious
Approachable
Passionate
Problem solver

Some of what you will get 

Associate discount
Health and Dental benefits
RRSP/DPSP
Performance bonuses
Learning & Development programs
And more...

Additional Information 

Hybrid

#Bringyourpassion
Vaccine Requirement
Staples is committed to taking every reasonable precaution to protect our associates, our customers, and the communities we operate in. To support the health and safety of our associates, COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this position. As such, all offers of employment will be conditional upon either (i) proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or (ii) proof of need for accommodation under relevant human rights legislation, and Staples determination that the requested accommodation can be provided without undue hardship. You will be required to submit proof of full vaccination or proof of need for accommodation during our background screening process







 Job Merchandising/Buying
 

 Location(s) CA-ON-Richmond Hill
 

 Schedule Full-time
 

   :
 

   :
 

   :
 





 Employment Statement


   Staples Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and we encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including those with disabilities.

Title: Senior Analyst, Application
Description:
Reporting to Senior Manager, Information Technology the Application Analyst provides technical guidance and support to staff members on existing and new deployments of server-based technology including MS Exchange, virtualization, storage, and other server administration duties. This role will also provide level 1 support for all the organization’s applications, integrations and related infrastructure including the end-user devices. This involves closely working with and supporting the Manager of Information Security in doing assessments, research, and analysis of IT operations to pre-empt issues before they arise as well as to resolve any issues when they arise.
 


   The applicant must be a team player who has the skills to build trusting relationships with the business users and other internal and external key stakeholders to ensure the smooth functioning of all applications and data integrations allowing business users to be more productive with their day-to-day application use.
 


   Operational Responsibilities
 

 Support the Manager of Information Technology to lead and manage the development, implementation, and improvement of IT infrastructure, operations, and services.
 Ensure the organization’s assets related to information technology including all end points (workstations, printers, etc.) and all software and applications are in optimum operating condition.
 Support the Manager of Information Security in analyzing IT vulnerabilities and implementing methods to address the gaps for remediation.
 Act as the primary point of escalations contact for issues and investigations related to all IT applications, integrations, tools, utilities, and end-user devices. This involves working with the business and, for issues that cannot be resolved locally, engaging the appropriate vendors or managed service providers.
 Execute service delivery per the IT Service Management (ITSM) procedures published by the organization
 Perform administrative tasks pertaining to server builds, access management, operating system upgrades, capacity planning, performance tuning, resource optimization, vendor fixes and monitoring
 Maintain applications, processes, and maintenance procedures, perform tuning and documentation.
 Ensure systems stay updated on all relevant patches and upgrades by overseeing Managed service providers.
 Develop and maintain a comprehensive IT operations manual that describe the operations and interdependencies of all applications and data integrations.
 Proactively monitor applications to ensure they are in an active state and are not reporting errors and that all data feeds to/from other systems have completed normally.
 When incidents are discovered or have been reported by other users, take immediate action to put dependent systems and users on notice so that the subsequent activities do not proceed without having source or updated data.
 Log, assign and follow-up on all incidents to ensure they are properly addressed updated and closed in accordance with predetermined Service Levels and established Incident and Problem Management processes.
 Perform trend analysis to highlight recurring incidents and initiate root cause analysis (Problem Management)
 Identify, research, and resolve technical problems pertinent to the applications and integrations, including code level analysis where possible.
 Fulfil approved service requests from users for IT assets. These requests could range from simple password resets to requests for new hardware. When new assets are delivered, provide basic user training whenever possible to get the users operational as soon as possible.
 Assist the management in planning all changes organization’s production environment to minimize disruptions.
 Display commitment to productivity, effectiveness, and operational efficiency.



   Project Responsibilities
 

 Engage in project meetings when requested, to ensure they fully understand the operations of existing systems.
 Work with the IT project teams to ensure a smooth transition from the implementation and warranty to regular production support. This includes reviewing project documentation to understand and update the IT operations manual so that the contents are kept current.



   Your wellness is our priority
 

   To protect your health and wellness, Fairstone will conduct recruitment digitally for this position. You will receive virtual onboarding and training and will initially work remotely with the Fairstone team. We look forward to introducing you to the team at Fairstone once physical distancing measures are lifted.
 

   Education & Experience
 

 College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science and/or 5 years equivalent work experience.
 ITIL certification is preferred (or equivalent ITSM training/certification)
 Hands on working experience on Microsoft Intune and Azure.
 System Admin Experience preferred for working on O365 Admin Centre, Financial (Corporate Credit Cards) and Data Analytics (SAS Viya) applications in a cloud environment
 A self-starter with the creativity to solve problems both independently and collaboratively
 Ability to learn new concepts, systems, and software independently and quickly
 Experience in database / Server (Linux and Windows ) administration skills strongly preferred



   What’s in it for you?
 



    At Fairstone, we offer all our permanent employees:
  

 A minimum of 3 weeks paid vacation (prorated to your start date)
 Wellness days
 Employee referral program $2000.00 or more.
 Great Benefit Program (flexible health and dental benefits, access to virtual health care provider Dialogue, pension plan and much more!)
 Ongoing Learning and development Training
 Tuition Assistance Programs
 Paid volunteer day and organized volunteering event across the country
 A growing company with potential for personal growth and career advancement.
 And Much more.



    If you’re seeking a role with a growing business that values employee development, Fairstone is the right place for you!
  


    Come join our team!
  


 Fairstone is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minorities, and disabled are encouraged to apply in confidence.



    Whether you’re seeking first-time employment or are making a career change, Fairstone has the internal support to help our team members grow and succeed.
  



   Time Type:
  Full time
 

   Job Type:
  Permanent

Title: Senior Investment Risk Analyst
Description:
At Franklin Templeton, everything we do is focused on one thing – delivering better client outcomes. We do that by partnering closely with our clients, assessing their strategic needs, and identifying the solution or solutions that can meet the challenge. Over 12,000 employees working in 34 countries around the world are dedicated to servicing investment solutions for our clients in more than 160 countries. For more than 70 years our success has been a direct result of the talent, skills and persistence of our people, and we are looking for qualified candidates to join our team.
 


   This is a HYBRID role, working onsite in our Calgary office several days per week.
 


   We are looking for a Senior Investment Risk Analyst – Fixed Income to join our team in Calgary. The role calculates, analyzes and reports portfolio characteristics, weights, attribution and risk statistics. The senior analyst must be competent to interface directly with portfolio managers and sophisticated clients and operate effectively within a team providing support to the Global Macro Group.
 


   What are the ongoing responsibilities of this position?
 


Identify, build and implement reporting requirements supporting the investment group.
Coordinate with risk consulting team in generating specific reports supporting the investment group.
Perform sophisticated ad hoc analyses, such as stress tests, sensitivity or hedging analysis give various market conditions
Act as backup to team members for critical deliverables specific to the investment group.
Maintain and manage data required for the investment group’s reporting requirements.
Respond to complex requests for portfolio characteristics and risk statistics information.
Assist with creation of marketing materials and pitch books based on client-tailored optimization analysis to assist sales force.
Meet with existing and potential clients
Remain current on performance related trends, topics and issues.
Assist in conducting industry-wide studies and data analysis.
Remain current on performance related trends, topics and issues.
Assist in conducting industry-wide studies and data analysis.



   What qualifications, skills and experience would help someone to be successful?
 


Minimum 4 years relevant work experience in Fixed Income Risk Management, preferably in a global setup
Bachelor's degree in finance, math or other quantitative discipline
CFA or FRM designation preferred
Experience using financial/risk application/software, i.e. Barclay’s Point, Bloomberg
Knowledge of statistical calculations and strong quantitative abilities
Knowledge of financial instruments and markets (especially bond and derivative instrument mathematics)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills including presentation skills
Ability to maintain updated knowledge of procedures, products and activities of assigned area
Ability to work independently with light supervision as well as in a team-based environment


   #LI-HYBRID
 

   #MID-SENIOR-LEVEL
 


   What makes Franklin Templeton unique?
  
 In addition to the dynamic and professional environment at Franklin Templeton, we strive to ensure that our employees have access to a competitive and valuable set of Total Rewards—the mix of both monetary and non-monetary rewards provided to you in recognition for your time, talents, efforts, and results.
 


 Highlights of our benefits include:


 Flexible medical, dental and vision insurance
 Corporate Pension Plan
 Employee Stock Investment Program
 Purchase company funds with no sales charge
 Competitive vacation package that includes three annual personal days
 Company paid short-term and long-term Disability Insurance
 Education assistance


 Franklin Templeton Investments Corp. is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
 



    We believe that being a good corporate citizen is good business. To us, corporate citizenship means being accountable, serving our clients, being an employer of choice, managing our environmental impact, and 
   
    supporting our communities
   . An emphasis on corporate citizenship is embedded in our 
   
    culture and values
   , and is an important element of how we achieve success.
  




    We are also committed to your learning and development with resources focused around 
   Experience, Exposure, and Education, to help you achieve your professional development goals. Take some time to, 
   
    meet some of our people
   

    ,
    and see what it means to say, "
   
    I AM Franklin Templeton
   ”.
  


    Franklin Templeton is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment. If you believe that you need an accommodation to search for, or apply for, one of our positions please send an email to 
   
    accommodations@FranklinTempleton.com
    . In your email, please include the accommodation you are requesting and the job title and job number you are applying for. It may take up to three business days to receive a response to your request. Please note that only requests for accommodations will receive a response.

Title: Business Analyst II - Security Technology Migrations Team
Description:
Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Calgary, AB, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA 
    







     Req ID: 27241 
    







     Jobs by Category: Security & Automation 
    







     Job Function: Planning and Analysis 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Ready to grow a new business and transform an entire industry?

 TELUS has entered the SmartHome and Security market in a big way – transforming an industry while we make our customers’ homes and businesses safer and bring convenience and peace of mind to their lives. By using our premier networks, technology, and services, TELUS is bringing the power of SmartHome and Security Solutions to life for our residential and business customers in new ways with creative product and service offerings. We are seeking forward-thinking individuals with a passion for continuous improvement and delivering success to join our SmartHome & Security team as we continue to grow and rapidly transform our business.

 Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 This is a career-shaping opportunity that will truly develop you into a business athlete by working in and across our end-to-end SmartHome and Security business. We operate in an ambitious start-up environment and collaborate with teams across multiple functions including Marketing, Product & Service Development, Contact Centres, Field Technicians, Application System Development, and Technology Strategy. Together with members of these teams you will work on projects across multiple segments including Residential, Small Business, and Consumer Health customers to deliver extraordinary customer experiences. In turn the experience in this dynamic industry and with this wide range of teams, functions, and customer segments will provide an opportunity to accelerate your professional development as we successfully deliver against our top priorities.


Here's how


As a Business Analyst II on the National Security Enablement - Security Technology Migrations team, your primary responsibility will be to support the execution of successful migration programs for our acquired customers and effectively transition them into the TELUS ecosystem. You will ensure that together we deliver on our business objectives while delivering a best-in-class customer experience. Key responsibilities include:



Support a PMO team to define, steer, and execute a program plan that will enable a winning strategy for integrating security acquisitions across multiple functional teams
Contribute in cross-functional initiatives that will drive growth and efficient operational practice across ADT, PA, TCSS, and TELUS
Collaborate across all segments of the organization to ensure strategic and transformational initiatives are aligned, while identifying and supporting gaps where required
Proactively work with project leads to delivery on time while helping to remove any program roadblocks
Assist in the transformation of our end-to-end customer service support model built to scale and support our ambitious growth and cross-sell targets
Contribute in the development of the narrative in order to gain buy-in from multiple stakeholders
Fostering and supporting a high-energy, results-oriented, inclusive work environment that encourages a culture that inspires everyone to give their best to our customers, to our community, to TELUS and ultimately to our shareholders








Qualifications




Here’s what makes you a great fit for this role:



You have a proven success record in delivering bottom line business, people, and customer benefits through your thought leadership and project management experience
Through your excellent verbal and written communication skills in both business and technical situations and the ability to speak the language of many different audiences
You have proven problem-solving, strategic, and analytical capabilities with a convincing track record of setting and delivering against key metrics
Understand the importance of change management principles and leverage strategic communication plans/mediums to achieve buy-in and successful execution outcomes
Showcase your systematic approach to solving complex problems
Excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills
You are passionate about working in a dynamic, high performance culture
You're innovative and excited about pioneering a new business for TELUS
With your proficiency with Microsoft (MS) Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), and Google Suite (Slides, Docs, Drive, Hangouts, etc.)
Showcase your thought leadership as empowered by your curiosity and passion for the business while recommending creative ways to deliver bottom line benefits
Strong analytical skills with abilities to conduct thorough root cause and fit-gap analysis


 Great-to-haves



Degree in business or technology e.g. engineering, computer science
Knowledge and experience in the home security industry and its business and operational key performance indicators is an asset
Knowledge of performance improvement methodologies and practices e.g. Lean Six Sigma
Comparable integration experience in migrating customers onto a new service support model and/or technologies
Experience with post-acquisition integrations and change management
Knowledge and experience in the home automation and security industry and its end to end operations
Experience in systems enablement and integration and/or working with Business Transformation and Enablement teams
University degree in business, economics, engineering, information management or equivalent experience
PMP, Agile, Lean Six Sigma and/or equivalent certification
Knowledge and experience in the home automation and security industry and its end to end operations
Strong experience in data analysis, project management and/or communications
Experience working in multiple areas across TELUS

Title: Senior Analyst
Description:
Work at an award-winning top employer! If you are looking for an empowering and progressive place to shape your future, then you’ve landed in the right place at BCAA. With our corporate Head Office in Burnaby and locations around BC, we offer a wide variety of opportunities all across the province. Share our purpose to together mobilize a brighter future for all and help British Columbians down’s life’s many roads.
Full vaccination against COVID-19 is a precondition of new employment. A successful candidate offered employment at BCAA will need to provide proof of full vaccination prior to commencing employment. Exemptions permitted under applicable employment and human rights legislation.
Summary:
The Senior Analyst is responsible for supporting the CXO Analytics Team and the Customer Experience group’s priorities and projects in enabling BCAA team members to deliver amazing customer experience across all channels by providing in-depth operational analysis and designing/developing/maintaining operational reports and dashboard. This includes understanding complex business issues to provide analytical insights into sales performance and process improvement/optimization to facilitate and drive business decisions and strategies.
Key Responsibilities:
Supporting projects in the Customer Experience team by providing in-depth and insightful analysis with innovative solutions or options that address operational issues with careful consideration of risk and implications.

Develop, design, and maintain operational dashboards, reports, tools and/or procedures to enhance the quality and timeliness of operational reporting to support the network in delivering amazing customer experience.
Interpreting business problems, retrieving, and analyzing data, and effectively communicating results and options/recommendation at all levels of the organization.
Prioritizes initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Leverages experience in forecasting, budgeting and financial analysis combined with an understanding of our key performance indicators to streamline and improve internal reporting.
Troubleshoot and resolve any dashboard errors or discrepancies in a timely fashion.
Deliver monthly financial results to the CXO division via defined communication channel.
Oversees the CXO Analyst activities to ensure accuracy and consistency in operational reports.
Monitoring and recommending improvements, automation and enhancements of processes and capabilities as they relate to the reporting and retention of operating data.
Provides leadership, training, and guidance to the CXO Analyst
Works in close collaboration with Customer Experience group, Marketing, Sales, Finance, and Information Services teams.
Through effective work planning identifies actionable items on data roadmap that can be accomplished in 1-2 years and bases output around these timelines.
Effectively communicates insights and plans to CXO Data Specialist to ensure cross-functional buy in.
Provide recommendations to P&D and L&D on training and recruitment results based on analysis.

Senior Leadership Communication

Present analysis and insights to ST and ET

Decision Making:

Ability to balance facts, figures, logic, feedback, and emotions when coming to a decision or recommendation.
Collaborates and provides direction to the CXO Analyst and determines guidelines on how data is displayed in dashboards and consumed by CXO.
Must exhibit the ability to persuade an audience and influence outcomes and decisions by use of data.
Evaluates the costs and benefits associated with a recommendation and can articulate risks associated with implementation.
Demonstrates an ability to use logical reasoning by fully evaluating and analyzing information, options, and feedback to make decisions stronger.

Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Business, or Economics, or equivalent with emphasis on quantitative analysis and methods
Other Skills:

Proficient knowledge in excel modeling, statistical analysis, research, data mining, and data querying (spreadsheets, relational databases, and SQL) and standard productivity software (word processing, presentations, email)
Proven analytical and critical thinking abilities
Demonstrated ability to work with a large number of details with accuracy without losing sight of the big picture
Proven interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Excellent communication skills in dealing with colleagues, management, and executives

Experience:
3 - 5 years of relevant experience
Preferred Qualifications:

Operational analysis experience
Project management experience
Experience with large, complex projects across multiple areas/divisions
Previous experience in an insurance or other financial institution

We aspire to be one of the best places to work with those who share our beliefs:
We believe in:
DOING THE RIGHT THING
We stay true to our word, and help British Columbians move forward.
THE POWER OF COMMUNITY
Together, we create a more vibrant, inclusive and connected province for everyone.
PUTTING PEOPLE FIRST
We treat each other with the same care and respect that we treat our Members.
PROTECTING OUR HOME
It's our responsibility to protect life in BC now, and for generations to come.
SHAPING THE FUTURE
We look to new horizons and actively embrace change.
By putting these beliefs in to action each of us will do engaging work with inspiring people and grow personally and professionally.
Job Type: Full-time
Additional pay:

Bonus pay
Overtime pay

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Title: MES Business Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Junior to Intermediate Business/Validation Analyst to assist the implementation of a number of shop floor systems on a new pharmaceutical facility. The project includes the implementation and validation of Manufacturing Execution System (MES) and Data Historian System (DHS) with interfaces to a plant wide control systems and small equipment.
The Business Analyst who will under the supervision of the MES project lead, support the implementation and validation of the MES and DHS systems within a dedicated infrastructure.
Deliverables (not limited to the following): 

All documentation deliverables consistent with Corporate methodology and generally accepted industrial standards.
Meet with the project leads at least weekly to review deliverables, confirm expectations, and address issues / concerns.
Ensure changes are approved and documented as per project change control, and shall execute all tasks based on the project plan / validation plan
Ensure that the solution being provided follows standard pharmaceutical industry practices (e.g. GxP)
Report incidences having potential impact to security, IT services, health / safety, and GxP.
Adhere to code of ethics and other Corporate policy related to transparency and good corporate citizenship.

(Must Have) Skills, Experience, and Qualifications: 

Engineering degree and 2+ years of experience in an IT or automation environment
Good technical writing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work in a challenging and fast paced environment
Experience working with wide range of stakeholders (customers, end users, sponsor, vendor, project team, extended team, etc) to develop relationships, identify and define requirements/gaps, and educate users.
Demonstrated ability to deal with and report to different stakeholders, build relationship, host project meetings, deal with tension, deliver projects on time and on budget (must provide reference contacts to verify)
Good understanding of the IT Software Development Life Cycle (SLDC) and Project Management Methodologies
Strong understanding of risk analysis
Excellent analytical, prioritization, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
Strong team player, transparent, open, honest, confident (must provide reference contacts to verify)
Ability to adapt to changes and various paces within a project
Working experience with all the MS Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project, etc.)

(Nice to Have) Skills, Experience, and Qualifications: 

Prior experience in Werum PAS-X or another MES system
Prior experience with SAP and interfacing with other systems
Prior experience with OSIsoft PI or another data historian
Experience using electronic document management systems (such as Documentum or SharePoint)

Note:  This position requires to work onsite 90%. Therefore, applicant from Greater Toronto Area only.
Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractContract length: 18 months
Salary: $40.00-$60.00 per hour
Benefits:

On-site parking

Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Experience:

Werum PAS-X or other MES system: 1 year (preferred)
OSISoft PI: 1 year (preferred)
SAP: 1 year (preferred)
Pharmaceutical industry: 1 year (preferred)
GMP or GXP: 1 year (preferred)
technical documentation: 2 years (required)
working with wide range of stakeholders: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

Business Analysis Certification (e.g. IIBA or CBAP) (preferred)

Title: POL SIH 27R - Senior Policy Analyst
Description:
Senior Policy Analyst Policy Social/Info/Health R27
There are 2 positions available: An eligibility list may be established to fill future temporary and permanent vacancies.  On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here.  Bring your policy and legislation expertise to this exciting leadership role  The Ministry of Health designs and delivers quality outcomes for people across the full continuum of health and ensures the sustainability of the B.C. health system. Our vision is optimal health and wellness for all in British Columbia. In order to contribute effectively to the health of all in British Columbia, the Ministry of Health needs to function cohesively. The ministry is an integrated system that brings together diverse lines of business to meet the multifaceted needs of the health system. Like a complex machine that requires each component part to perform its role efficiently and effectively in order to function, each division plays a key role to support the delivery of programs and services.  The Health Sector Workforce and Beneficiary Services Division is responsible for workforce planning and development and operational delivery of beneficiary services that contribute to effectively meeting patient and population health needs and improving patient outcomes through the efficient delivery of health services.  The Allied Health Policy Secretariat is responsible for providing provincial strategic policy direction and provincial oversight for the allied health workforce to ensure optimization of the allied health workforce and support scope of practice and models of care that meet the Ministry’s strategic priorities to meet population health needs. This is achieved through three key areas of focus:

Education and training
Recruitment and retention
Professional practice (role/scope optimization)

 The Senior Policy Analyst is a senior policy professional with considerable experience in the design and development of policy. This position can review the work of junior policy analysts and work is performed under minimal direction and supervision. The focus of this position is to offer leadership and advice on complex policy initiatives.  The BC Public Service is an award winning employer and offers employees competitive benefits, amazing learning opportunities and a chance to engage in rewarding work with exciting career development opportunities. For more information, please see What We Offer.  The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
For information about the Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service please visit: Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service - Province of British Columbia (gov.bc.ca)
For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Carolyn.Knox@gov.bc.ca. DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.  NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.  Job Requirements: In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below:

Master’s degree in a related field* and 2 years of related** experience; OR
Bachelor’s Degree* and 3 years of related** experience; OR
Diploma* and 4 years’ related** experience; OR
Certificate or other coursework*** and 5 years’ related*** experience.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. 


Related field for post-secondary programs may include: Public Policy, Public Health, Public Administration, Law, Social Sciences (i.e Political Science, Economics, Sociology, Psychology), Business or a related field.
 **Related experience may be obtained through working in the private, public or non-profit sector, through volunteerism or through internships such as Co-Op.
   ***Certificates and Coursework that may be considered: Project Management Professional (PMP), IAP2, Prosci Change Management, Behavioural Insights, Service Design, UX, Design Thinking, Research Techniques, Public Policy, Data/Analytics, Communications
  

Core experience requirements must include all of the following:

Experience in full cycle development of policy, legislation, and/or regulation, including evaluation and reporting on performance and policy.
Experience in managing complex projects/assignments.
Experience in concisely and persuasively writing a range of documents/content.

  Supplemental experience requirements must include at least one (1) of the following:

Experience leading engagements and consultations with multiple partners and stakeholders; or
Experience utilizing both traditional and emerging policy approaches, instruments, and methodology. 

Preference may be given to applicants with any of the following:

Experience working in policy in the public sector.
Experience working in direct patient care.
Experience working as a member of an interdisciplinary health care team.
Experience in health workforce planning and development.

  Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting.  A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.  APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Cover Letter: NO - Please do not submit a cover letter as it will not be reviewed.  Resume: YES - Ensure your resume includes your educational accomplishments, employment history including start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.  Questionnaire (COMPREHENSIVE): YES - As part of the application process, you will be prompted to complete a comprehensive online questionnaire to demonstrate how you meet the job requirements. Please allot approximately 60 minutes to complete the questionnaire.  IMPORTANT: Comprehensive questionnaire responses will be used to shortlist applicants against the job requirements. Please ensure you include all relevant information about your educational accomplishments and employment history including job titles, start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and your accountabilities and accomplishments.

Title: Game Security Operations Analyst - NHL
Description:
Game Security Operations Analyst - NHL

 
EA SPORTS is one of the most iconic brands in entertainment with over 25 years of innovation, passion, and connecting millions of players across the globe to their favorite sports, teams, and players. EA SPORTS NHL has revolutionized sports gaming for tens of millions of players around the world, pioneering award-winning and creative technology and experiences that connect players to the speed, skill, and creativity of the NHL.

 
The EA SPORTS NHL franchise is founded on passion and new ideas. Located in Vancouver, British Columbia, the team is composed of remarkable talent on a mission to accomplish on-ice experiences that connect gamers around the world through play. If you're a creative pioneer with a passion for your craft, you will have the chance to turn a job into something you love.

 
We are looking for a Game Security Operations Analyst who is passionate about security operations and how we provide a fair, fun, and safe environment for millions of players everyday.

 
Your Responsibilities

Perform analysis on suspicious player behaviors using data and analytical evidence to determine if enforcement actions are correctly applied
Work with the Security Operations team, responding to security incidents and ad-hoc investigations related to game security and enforcement
Perform forensic investigations to understand how bad actors are exploiting infrastructure or game design flaws
Provide insights and business intelligence on player behaviours using Splunk and other analytics to help make decisions
Work with the Data Science team to tune detections and improve the player experience
Communicate operational risks and trade offs to product teams



Your Qualifications

You enjoy fast-changing threat landscapes and different challenges day-to-day
You are comfortable working with Splunk and other data analytics tool
Knowledge of NHL and HUT is a plus
Experience with information security or game security 
Experience incident management 
Experience with live-service operations 
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, SAS, Grafana


 Electronic Arts is an innovative tech company that creates incredible experiences for millions of players around the world. But what matters most is our people who inspire us, and the world, to play. As we bring new forms of entertainment to people around the world, we need innovative, collaborative, diverse and adaptable people to keep making Electronic Arts better.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
COME GROW WITH US!



 ABOUT US:



 McDougall Energy Inc. (“McDougall Energy”) is a Canadian, privately owned, family business serving energy customers since 1949. McDougall Energy is a marketer and distributor of heating oil, propane, gasoline, diesel fuel and commercial lubricants, as well as an Esso™ and Shell® branded retailer. McDougall Energy is proud to be a Platinum Club member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, having retained its designation consecutively since 2011. Now in its third generation of ownership, the energy company serves communities across regions of Ontario and Western Canada. The company is headquartered in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario.
 

   Our success is driven by an uncompromising commitment to provide the highest quality customer service to each and every customer. We recognize that our employees are our most valuable resource and offer opportunities for development for personal and career growth.
 


 Position could be in one of our following locations:
 

 Sault Ste. Marie, ON
 Goderich, ON
 London, ON
 St. Thomas, ON
 Kingston, ON
 Brantford, ON



 ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:


   McDougall Energy is looking for a high energy, results focused individual as a 
  Business Analyst, reporting to Project Management Office and Continuous Improvement Manager. The Business Analyst will facilitate business process improvement via the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of functional business specifications. The Business Analyst will help assess, understand, and improve a wide variety of operational processes and system solutions to help the organization meet its goals and objectives.
 


 Manages requirements development process through elicitation, analysis, specification, and verification of requirements and works to develop technical specifications and test plans that will ensure the delivery of high-quality outcomes
 Develops supporting data analytics and decision support elements of projects, to enable successful business process improvement outcomes
 Consults with management and staff to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current and future state operational processes and procedures, issues, input and output requirements
 Engages with all stakeholders to validate and clarify requirements and desired outcomes
 Acts as a liaison between departmental end users and PMO & CI in the analysis, definition, design, configuration, testing, and maintenance of application systems to ensure optimal operational performance
 Analyses the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing applications, and ensures the solutions being delivered meet the needs of the business and other stakeholders
 Participates in and/or leads Continuous Improvement activities
 Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information system and/or non-system changes; assists in the preparation to develop new system and/or operational changes
 Facilitates the creation of user stories and use cases, acceptance criteria, test plans, testing, and training guides
 Develops analytics dashboards to support project and solution objectives
 Helps transform data into information that stakeholders can use to make informed decisions



 ABOUT YOU:



 The ideal candidate will have:
 


 Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role with direct experience working with Information Technology; Business Analyst certificate an asset
 Bachelor’s degree in Business Analysis, Business, Information Technology, Operations Management, Engineering, Science, Accounting or related field
 Business process re-engineering experience
 Excellent communication skills; both verbal and written
 Project Management experience working as part of a project team and/or Team Lead in project
 Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement, process mapping, IT Controls (ITIL, COBIT, SDLC, etc.), and Lean Six Sigma
 Effective problem solving and research skills
 Experience working with data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI
 Demonstrated ability to make timely, informed decisions; in realm of accountabilities and authority, and in consultation with functional groups and Information Technology
 Experience working with SQL an asset



 WHAT WE OFFER:



 Competitive Compensation
 4 weeks paid vacation
 Company paid Health & Dental Benefits
 Group RRSP
 Employee Assistance Program (EAP)



 Apply on-line at www.mcdougallcareers.com.
 


 Confidentiality of all applicants assured. Only those selected for interviews will be contacted and we thank all other applicants for their interest.
 


 McDougall Energy is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you require any accommodations, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Sr Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Welcome to 
ivari

 Let us introduce ourselves. With 300 employees across Canada, ivari is a company that’s making a difference in the world of life insurance. How? By finding and hiring employees who are passionate about helping people protect their families, and by giving them the best, most supportive workplace possible.
 At ivari, everyone is welcome! It is our mission to attract, develop, and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and the communities in which we do business. We offer an inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported.


 Here’s the job opportunity…



 We are hiring a Senior Business Systems Analyst for a 12-month contract opportunity. In this role, you will be responsible for the system analysis, design of solutions, and operational support to address business needs related to the company’s financial systems. As part of the team, you will design, configure, and deliver quality business requirements for requested changes to business processes, functions and/or products.
 

   You will also work with the business, IT and Project Management Office (PMO) stakeholders to develop requirements and ensure these are reflected in system and business process deliverables. You will develop solutions, investigate, analyze, design and test requirements for projects, products, system change requests, and production fixes.
 

   The Business Systems Analyst will:
 

 Provide end-to-end support through all the phases of application systems solutions development to delivery in order to support the approved business requirements.
 Participate in gathering of business requirements and documentation of business processes as they relate to interaction with the application system.
 Conduct required analysis to arrive at solutions through use of JAD sessions and/or related research gathering processes.
 Work closely with business partners, business sponsor(s), subject matter experts, Business Analyst, Quality Assurance Analysts, Programmer Analysts and other IT staff, to design solutions and ensure the solution is viable, supportable and meets the customer’s needs.
 Document solutions using the Design Specification Document.
 Coordinate and perform functional testing to ensure individual requirements have been met.
 Provide implementation support, production support, and problem resolution for the application systems and associated test environments.
 Act as subject matter expert on application(s) supported. This includes products, processes and data.
 Secondary duties may include business analysis and quality assurance.



 What we are looking for…


 3-5 years as a Business Systems Analyst supporting finance or actuarial systems (JD Edwards or AXIS preferred)
 Experience in insurance or financial services industry, along with familiarity with financial systems and applications; an understanding of accounting principles would be an asset.
 Experience with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) would be an asset.
 Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
 Excellent written and oral communication skills, negotiation and influencing skills.
 Ability to facilitate business meetings and application design sessions within all levels of the organization.
 Good ability to work independently and collaboratively in larger groups.
 Ability to create clear documentation and explain complex process flows.
 Experience with data query tools such as SQL / Infomaker, XML.
 Knowledgeable in data driven analysis or data mapping or design flow practices.
 Ability to create work breakdown structures and estimations.
 Knowledgeable in Solutions Delivery LifeCycle processes.
 Background knowledge in Waterfall methodology; understanding of Agile framework an asset.
 University degree or post-secondary accreditation in preferred areas of study such as computer science, information technology, actuarial science, or related field.



 What's in it for you…

 At ivari, it's important for us to keep our people motivated, recognized and rewarded. We offer competitive base salaries plus a bonus, one of the many reasons ivari is a great place to work.
 We also offer health and dental benefits for the entire family from Day 1! But that’s just the beginning. When you join the ivari team you also get…

 A fantastic vacation plan and time off
 A pension plan with 100% match by ivari
 Employee savings plan with 75% match to help you save even more
 Flexible and hybrid work arrangements
 Opportunities for professional development
 Recognition programs to cheer you on, motivate and reward
 Wellness programs to keep you healthy and happy


 Who you are…
 Someone who enjoys a culture where everyone is genuinely respectful and you can be your authentic self every day. Your contributions and opinions are not only sought, but valued. You know the importance of, and live by, our core values of…

 Bringing clarity and focus to your work
 Taking ownership and doing what you say you will
 Remaining flexible
 Collaborating with others


 Does this sound like you? We’re looking for great people to join our team!
 Our commitment to inclusivity is reflected in the safeguards, policies and commitments we have in place to remove barriers and provide equal opportunities to prospective and current employees, without discrimination.


 To apply, please email your resume to: human.resources@ivari.ca
 


 A Human Resources representative is available to consult with applicants who require accommodation in the application or recruitment process. Any information shared by the applicant about an accommodation will be treated as confidential. If you do require an accommodation, please email human.resources@ivari.ca.

Title: Product Lead / Business Analyst
Description:
Veriday is a digital marketing and technology company specializing in developing strategies, products, and solutions to transform online user experiences and engagement. At Veriday, our people are our number one winning strategy, which is why we strive to attract and retain the very best talent. If you are looking to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we’re growing and need people like you to join our team!
 We are hiring a Product Lead / Business Analyst to join our growing company for a 6 months contract with the potential for full-time employment.
 Role:
 Responsible for adoption, retention, and engagement metrics across the products funnel. Responsible for ensuring data analytics, measurement, and product KPI is part of the product development process. Create user stories, diagrams, and screen/interface designs annotations for both projects and products. Works with design and UX team alike to develop, annotate and test UX/ UI. Create UAT plans, UAT cases, and training material to facilitate UAT. Tracks and prioritizes defects and releases to production. Maintain existing documentation and knowledge base. Support business requirement gathering and elicitation for enterprise clients.
 What You’ll Do:
 Determine and prioritize customer and client wants to result from implementation requirements and product roadmaps discussions and needs utilizing market and user research techniques Work cross-functionally with Marketing, Design, Engineering, and Service teams to deepen understanding of the customer, client, and team needs/areas of improvement Lead product discovery engagements by analyzing qualitative and quantitative data points to make sure we’re solving the right problem Define and oversee product feature creation, with a focus on MVP development and future iteration planning Be a key contributor to the build phase by ensuring the product meets and exceeds the quality and methodologies that make our product a leader in the space Work and collaborate with the team to plan sprints, run story acceptance meetings, and monitor progress to move projects forward Measure, analyze, and report on product metrics to help grow, innovate, and improve Establish product processes within the team and across the organization to ensure effective communication and execution Present, train, and educate clients, employees, analysts, and the broader market on the benefits of Veriday products.
 What You’ll Bring:
 2+ years of specific experience in business analysis and/or product management in enterprise SaaS or B2B SaaS or equivalent application development environments. The ability to translate complex market problems and needs into clear business value for enterprise customers. Knowledge of portal, intranet, and CMS platforms is an asset. Experience using market data to successfully inform decision-making and measure outcomes Solid understanding of Agile methodologies, CSM, CSPO is an asset Proficient technical knowledge of CMS, web design is an asset The expertise of Google analytics/amplitude/mixpanel/Heap is an asset Enthusiastic pursuit of product growth derived from the entrepreneurial spirit.
 We offer a competitive salary, a remote workspace, and great people to collaborate with. If this job sounds perfect for you, please apply.

Title: Analyst, Capital Markets Portfolio Strategy
Description:
Reporting to the Director, Capital Markets Portfolio Strategy, the primary focus of Analyst is to provide support in the development of Capital Markets overall strategy. This may include activities relating to capital allocation, investment strategy, portfolio design, performance evaluation, business model best practices, operating plan development and investment & thematic research. 


Responsibilities:
 Perform data analysis to profile the overall portfolio including details pertaining to use of capital, leverage, expected returns, risk and diversification 
Assist in providing portfolio breakdown of underlying investment programs and strategies 
Contribute to a document outlining Capital Markets overall strategy that will touch on investment strategy, investment approach, portfolio design and ESG strategy 
Consolidate and organize data and strategic inputs from all investment programs as part of the annual operating plan development process 
Provide support in analysis relating to periodic reviews of operating/business model 
Conduct research relating to public market investment strategies/approaches and/or thematic long-term trends 
Collaborate with teams across the organization to syndicate / validate analysis and insights 
Maintain databases, presentations, and tools for the Capital Markets Portfolio Strategy team 
Manage competing priorities and support the initiatives of the team as needed 


To succeed in the role you have:
 Strong academic background combined with 1+ years professional experience working in investment management, management consulting and/or financial services/asset management 
Some knowledge in asset allocation, broad range of investment securities and operating models of investment management firms 
Ability to synthesize complex topics into presentations for senior management or leadership 
Detail-oriented and innately curious with an interest in staying ahead of trends and continually learning about new topics 
A high attention to detail that complements your ability to see the big picture 
Proficiency of MS Excel and PowerPoint 
Familiarity with financial database software such as FactSet, Bloomberg is an asset 
Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to build relationships across OMERS 
Ability to prioritize among several tasks while delivering high-quality products within deadlines 
A willingness to act with a high degree of initiative and ability to deliver results 
Ability to contribute to and foster a collegial and creative team culture 
Humility and self-awareness, values feedback, invites and integrates different perspectives 


Our story:
 Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Title: System Analyst
Description:
Our Manitoba customer is currently looking for a System Analyst on a 6-month contract. The role will be based onsite in Winnipeg.
If you have strong system analysis experience and feel that the responsibilities shown below describe you to a tee, we’d like to hear from you!
The candidate’s skillset will include:

Demonstrated ability to provide technology recommendations to the business stakeholders
Experience with Delivery - working with Developers, Architects and Quality Assurance to design and analyze alternatives, assist in dev/test as SME, and complete a smooth implementation with business partners
Proficient SQL skills and experience connecting data analysis to logical/business concepts
Proficient analytical, troubleshooting, and problem solving/decision request experience
Advanced knowledge, experience, and understanding of architecture, application systems design, and data integration patterns
Demonstrated proficiency in a team environment with projects involving the integration of disparate types of technologies/platforms and agile development
Capability to establish and maintain effective partnerships and relationships
Strong communication skills (oral, written, facilitation, presentation)
Excellent ability to summarize complex and sensitive topics to effectively communicate to senior stakeholders
Demonstrated initiative and leadership abilities - comfortable managing issues in cross functional teams
Positive attitude, keeping a constant watch on how to do things better
Adaptability and a willingness to take on new challenges
Conflict and issue resolution and escalation
Ability to self-direct, own tasks and provide appropriate status to leadership
Post-secondary education in a related discipline
Knowledge of the Wealth Management and Financial Services industry advantageous
Experience with Varicent Incentive Compensation Management (ICM) advantageous
Experience with SAP ECC, and HANA advantageous
Experience using JIRA and Confluence advantageous

Paradigm Consulting Group is in an active growth phase and securing talented consultants is a critical component of our success. The desired candidate will be a dynamic and energetic individual will join lead a high performing team of professionals committed to helping our customers get the most from their investments in business processes and information technology.
To learn more about our Benefits, Culture or apply for these opportunities, please visit our website: Careers.ParadigmConsulting.com
We thank you for your interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Paradigm Consulting Group is committed to cultural diversity, inclusiveness and gender equity. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.
Job Type: Contract

Title: Analyst, Environment and Resource Efficient Operations
Description:
Position Title: Analyst, Environment and Resource Efficient Operations
 Position Type: Temporary - Full-Time 
Position Location: Florenceville Main
 Grade: 00
 Requisition ID: 17288

 
As Analyst, Environment and Resource Efficient Operations, you will be responsible for building and maintaining systems to support our environment and resource efficient operations strategy.

 You will support and collaborate with various internal teams within McCain to:

 Develop data integration, visualization and analytics for decision making
 Manage sustainability data with a focus on environmental compliance, CO2 emissions, energy efficiency, water usage and waste
 Manage sustainability data gathered from various business functions and utilize platforms to analyze data to support efficient resource usage, visualization and management


 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Working in close collaboration with global SMEs, the regions and supporting external consultants this person will execute the following tasks:

 Environmental Performance Measures
   
 Maintain and improve data collection systems to track environmental performance
 Develop approaches to replace manual data collection with automated data retrieval processes
 Maintain and improve global greenhouse gas inventory, and support internal and external verification
 Provide environmental performance data as required

 Scope 3 Emissions
   
 Work with agricultural, procurement and supply chain teams to build streamlined data collection processes to be able to efficiently and effectively report on Scope 3 emissions
 Support these teams as they develop carbon reduction roadmaps to ensure that we have the data collection tools in place to effectively measure and report on the improvements

 Life Cycle Analyses
   
 Leverage existing organizational data to develop product level life cycle assessments to provide to customers in support of Scope 3 emissions reporting using Life Cycle Analysis Software such as GaBi

 Environmental Management System
   
 Support the Manager, Global Environment to build an effective environmental management system that provides visibility to risks, incidents and continuous improvement efforts throughout the organization






 Support internal and external audits as required - work with multiple data sources, platforms and software, including SAP, Intelex, OSI PI and Power BI.


 Assist Manager, Resource Efficient Operations and Manager, Global Environment as required
 Additional responsibilities as required

 KEY QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCES:

 A Bachelor’s Degree is required. A degree in Engineering, Environmental Science, Computer Science, Business or other technical field is preferred
 You must have a passion for environmental and sustainability initiatives 
Experience and interest in managing large datasets


 Strong influencing skills and the ability to:


 work with resource constrained internal teams to help them achieve results; and
 work and succeed in a matrixed organization, flexing and modifying approaches as necessary
 Ability to work effectively as part of a multicultural team
 Excellent communication skills in multicultural, multi-lingual environments


 Strong project management skill:


 Well organized and structured
 Ability to use initiative, prioritize, multi-task, and work well under pressure to meet deadlines and deliver results


 Technical capabilities in the areas of:


 Strong technical and analytical skills
 Clear and systematic thinking that demonstrates good judgment and problem solving competencies
 Computer programming would be an asset
   
 Structuring data relationships and working with databases
 Understanding of databases, and how to structure data relationships
 Business Analytics software such as Power BI would be advantageous
 Exposure to the concepts of Life Cycle Analysis



 Proven analytical and problem solving skills are required, as well as excellent attention to accuracy and detail
 Fluency in English is required. Proficiency in other languages are an asset


 KEY COMPETENCIES:

 Ensures Accountability – Holding self and other accountable to meet commitments
 Collaborates – Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
 Courage – Stepping up to address difficult issues, saying what need to be said.
 Customer Focus – Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions
 Drives Engagement – Creating a climate where people are motivated to do their best to help the organization achieve its objectives. (People Managers only)
 Being Resilient – Rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations
 Drives Results - Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances


 OTHER INFORMATION


 Key internal relationships: Director, REO, Environmental Teams, Engineering teams, Operational leaders, CSR teams, Global Engineering team, Global IT team
 Key external relationships: Supplier, Consultants, Contractors
 Travel: limited international travel may be required
 Job is primarily performed in a standard office environment.


 The above information indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

 The health and safety of McCain employees and their families has been our number one priority since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. Supported by science, and in line with our culture and values, we believe that being vaccinated is the most effective way to protect each other, our families, our customers, and our communities. It is therefore a requirement that the successful candidate for this role be fully vaccinated and have completed the mandatory incubation period prior to the candidate’s start date with McCain, subject to reasonable accommodations if you are unable to be vaccinated for protected grounds under applicable human rights legislation (e.g. medical or religious reasons).

 McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. We see value in ensuring we have a diverse, antiracist, inclusive, merit-based, and equitable workplace. As a global family-owned company we are proud to reflect the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that diversity drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger.  McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.  Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with the Global Employee Privacy Policy
