Title: Tax Analyst, Fall 2022 (Co-op/Internship) - 4 Months
Description:
Address: 100 King Street West 
 







Job Family Group: 






Finance & Accounting 
 
As a co-op/intern student at BMO, you will have the opportunity to be heard, keep growing and make a difference. You will be part of our campus program to gain the skills and knowledge needed to take on roles similar to the description listed below. 

Our student experience is designed to integrate you to the BMO team from day one by adding value in the work you do. You will have the opportunity to participate in programs such as the Women in Technology Mentorship Program, BMO First Friend peer assignment, BMO Social Squad student-led activities, BMO U corporate learning platform and access to various Employee Resource Groups to further develop your network within BMO. 

Interested in learning more about our campus program? Stay up-to-date with BMO Campus Recruitment by following us on Twitter @BMOonCampus & Instagram @BMO_on_Campus . 

Note: Only students currently enrolled in an academic program and returning to their studies will be considered for Co-op/Internship opportunities. Student who recently graduated are invited to apply to our New Grad opportunities which are available at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en/new-grad 

To apply for this opportunity, please submit your cover letter, resume and an unofficial copy of your academic transcript. By applying for this general posting, you will be considered for a number of different student opportunities across multiple locations. If you are selected to move forward, you will be provided additional information. 

Supports the tax accounting, provisioning, tax compliance, audits and governance for BMOFG and its businesses. Applies knowledge and research of the relevant tax legislation and guidelines that can impact the business reporting and compliance. Develops tax related technical and accounting solutions and tax reporting advice. 

Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. 
Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of solutions. 
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy. 
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues. 
Provides input into the planning and implementation of tax accounting, reporting & compliance programs / processes e.g. tax provisioning, return filings, payments and audits. 
Supports the maintenance of the database / records management of all required filings and other tax compliance activities including audit responses; designs and produces regular and ad-hoc tracking reports to help ensure timely compliance. 
Researches and identifies position statements on current and proposed tax related issues, programs, initiative or legislation for the business/group/enterprise. 
Analyzes data and information to provide taxation insights and recommendations related to returns, re-assessments, objections etc. 
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to collect and provide tax information for related accounting entries; support tax provision; compliance; audits, etc. 
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. 
Acts as liaison between stakeholders in order to align agendas and ensure a clear understanding of the business context. 
Monitors compliance with tax policies, procedures and controls to ensure completeness and accuracy of financial information. 
Executes work to deliver timely, accurate, and efficient service e.g. prepares / supports preparation of accounting entries, reconciliations, reporting packages and financial statements for tax provisions, payments and returns. 
Provides no tax advice directly or indirectly to particular customers or employees of BMOFG. 
Focus may be on a business/group. 
Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works mostly independently. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.   Qualifications: 
As a full-time employee, we would require 3-5 years of experience, however as part of the BMO campus program, we are looking for motivated individuals with a strong desire to learn. 
Accounting designation required. 
Working knowledge in the application of corporate taxes for the assigned jurisdiction(s) / portfolio. 
Working knowledge in the application of tax accounting concepts. 
Working knowledge of specialized tax return software. 
Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. 

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en . 

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter. 

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Joining AbbVie means, you will be part of a team of outstanding professionals dedicated to making a remarkable impact on patients' lives. At AbbVie, we conduct ground-breaking science on a global scale every day. AbbVie Canada is one of the Best Workplaces in Canada whereby 92% of our employees are proud to say they work for AbbVie.
When choosing your career path, choose to be remarkable.
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health, and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio.
We have a new opportunity for a Business Intelligence (BI) Developer to join our Business Technology Solutions (BTS) team. In this career opportunity you will be responsible for working within the Data & Analytics solutions team to deliver reporting and dashboard solutions that meet the needs of the organization. The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for successfully collaborate with local business teams (key stakeholders) as well as from Global analytics and integration and support functions focused on delivering solutions to functions within AbbVie Canada. This position is based in Montreal (Saint-Laurent) and reports to the Data and Analytics Solutions Lead.
Key responsibilities:

Design, develop, valid, and implement data reports.
Ability to analyze issues within data reports.
Design and build lists, graphs, scorecards, metrics, filters, prompts, and dashboards.
Follow and enhance BI standards and best practices across the team.
Collaborate and mentor cross-functional team members on methodology, design, and architecture.
Ensure optimal end user performance by establishing and consistently executing overall system performance assessment processes and associated action plans.
Provide consultation on complex projects and act as a top-level contributor.
Partner in a team setting, along with the data engineer and business analysts from functions and have excellent organizational, prioritization, communication, and time management skills.


Education / Experience required:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field is required.
Previous experience with technology with a strong focus on DataWarehouse and enterprise reporting solutions (minimum of five to seven years). 
   


Developing applications, reports, and dashboards experience (minimum of five years).
Developing reports against an OLAP data source. Strong SQL skills and experience with performance tuning are required (minimum of four years).
Strong ability to troubleshoot.
BI development, testing and change management (minimum of four years).



Understanding of pharmaceutical industry is preferred.
Ability to think and plan strategically (work plans, activities, timetables, targeting) and operating with execution excellence.

Essential skills and abilities:

Must be at ease with technology (the use of various tools/systems to perform day-to-day tasks).
Extensive ability and proven experience with report development using various tools (Qlik suite preferrable or Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Ability to design and plan scalable BI solutions.
Strong SQL Developer skills.
Comprehension of Hadoop/Hive/Big data preferred.
Expertise working with relational and multidimensional database schemas and writing queries.
Ability to solve real-world business problems by designing and building queries sourced from OLAP (online analytical processing) cubes, applying data mining algorithms, writing queries, and designing reports using various tool sets and a SQL Server data warehouse.
Expertise in DataWarehouse, ETL and report design and development.
Skilled with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.).
French and Advanced English language proficiency (oral and written).

Key leadership competencies:

Strong analytical skills.
Ability to provide estimates to support timelines and deliverables.
Operates with a wide degree of creativity and latitude. Ability to work on multiple projects at once.
Operate and communicate effectively in a Matrix environment.
Facilitate internal information sharing.
Use strong analytical skills to solve business problems and think independently.
Quick learner and ability to multitask effectively.
Actively listen to internal stakeholders to understand their business needs, issues, and opinions to translate these into appropriate market research goals.
Work collaboratively with team members.
Prioritize decisions and activities to ensure efficient use of resources and address critical issues impacting the business.
Keen attention to detail.

Travel: minimum 5% 
AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.
Covid vaccination new hires amendments:
Full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment for this position, with possible accommodation for validated exemptions, within the limits of applicable legislation. AbbVie employees are also required to comply with any COVID-19 related external requirements, including any testing requirements, applicable to their work activities outside AbbVie premises (for example, travelling and visiting stakeholders and customers).

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

 Job Description:

 The Senior Business Analyst will build strong working relationships with business partners to help them achieve the maximum functionality from Canadian Document Services. Duties include establishing standards based on industry standards and ensuring process consistency at all sites for Image Services and also other areas of Canadian Document Services. Also, providing regulatory guidance, creating and maintaining workflows and procedures and managing the Image records retention.

 If you have the ability to identify problem areas and propose changes, if you love interviewing business resources to support process design, we want to hear from you!

 What will you do?

 Consult / create Business Partner new or changing business processes
 Provide analysis, measurements, and estimates for business partners and Canadian Document Services leaders
 Develop business processes, practices and tools, and facilitate implementation with the business teams
 Create and measure process resources management – Process Compression Analyst, production reports, FTE projections, etc.
 Accountable for the measuring of process performance by gathering and analyzing data
 Provide Image compliance guidance for business partners and Records & Document Management leaders
 Maintain Business Records (Databases & Documentation)


 What do you need to succeed?

 Business analysis and workflow charting experience
 University Degree or 3+ years of relevant experience
 Bilingualism (French, English) required in Quebec to support tasks and training for an English-speaking team outside Quebec 
Technical writing experience
 Excellent analytical skills (planning, quantitative skills, attention to detail and quality standards)
 Ability to apply technical knowledge to business concerns
 Excellent research and problem solving skills
 Ability to facilitate creative thinking, and drive decision making to closure
 Experience building a business case
 Ability to source and interpret regulatory requirements and related industry standards


 What's in it for you?

 15 vacation days per year
 Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family
 Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
 The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

Job Summary:
Leading provider of travel insurance in Canada, offering a comprehensive line of travel insurance products to serve Canadians. We are recognized in the marketplace for our innovative products and excellent travel partner’s support.
The Sales Support Specialist plays a key role by supporting the Travel Sales team to provide partners, Client Managers and Business Development Managers with a national scope and presence to service a business producing more than $150,000,000 annually and 3,000 agency locations.
In addition, the Sales Support Specialist is responsible to identify back-end office workflows and process improvements to allow the Sales Support Coordinators to support to both internal and external partners, and effectively and efficiently by working closely with sales team to deliver on key initiatives, in view of meeting established sales and service targets.
As part of her/his role, the individual will support the more intricate and involved duties and tasks that an agent would support without the responsibility of providing advice, processing of insurance transactions or direction to clients.

Similarly, if agency locations are cancelled, closed, or transferred.- Act as Finance liaison to coordinate and follow up with agency locations as required (rejected payments, update EFT information, follow up on accounts payable…)- Handle reporting and policy modifications requests- Analyze data and work with management to develop creative solutions- Identify and recommend staff training needs in response to process changes or new product/system implementations- Work as directed by management team to research and document business issues, including workflow procedures, employee pain points, customer pain points and operational processes- Advocate of the Agile mindset and process- Curiosity towards data and desire to build creative solutions to find meaningful insights- Exceptional customer/ client service focus- Get it done attitude- Passion to learn new things and understand the business- Flexible & adaptable to change- Enthusiastic & collaborative team player

- Ability to work in an extremely fast paced environment- Able to handle fluctuating workloads and multiple priorities- Experience/knowledge in financial services- Intermediate to Advanced knowledge of Excel (i.e. mastery of excel formulas, pivot tables and VBA is a plus)- Proficient in MS Office suite including Outlook, Word, Power Point, Excel....- Attention to detail and ability to review all work for quality assurance purposes- Demonstrated ability to thrive in a multi-tasking environment- Proven analytical skills, combined with creative and effective communication, organizational skills, and planning ability- Demonstrate analytical capabilities with respect to process improvements, problem solving, etc.- Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills- Bi-lingual would be preferred but not required

Title: Capital Markets - Business Analyst
Description:
Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated to delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.
We are currently seeking competent individuals to fulfill the role of Capital Markets- Business Analyst to join our dynamic team for our client, one of the major banks.
Contract Duration: 6 monthsExtension: PossibleFTE: Possible
Responsibilities: 

Research, formulate, and perform data-driven analytics using SQL and/or other tools such as Elastic Search, Postman, and Kibana.
Regular deliverables include creation of source to target mapping
Assist in resolving complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the system needs of the Institutional Equity Trading Desks and their internal and external customers, by applying your business and technological knowledge to perform analysis, reconciliations, defining user requirements, design and implementation of system enhancements/solutions.
Support, liaison, and gather requirements from senior stakeholders and clearly articulate business requirements to technical teams.
Building relationships with vendors to allow for regular communication for needs and adequate time to implement changes
Working with technology and business partners and stakeholders to do data mapping, data analysis, order and trade data mapping from federated systems (TT and Tradebook data is being mapped into a consolidated data model).
Test, validate, and deploy solution to production environment
Create artifacts required for deployments
Working with data platform team and connect with other teams from data governance, etc. to deploy solution from one environment to another.
Work with raw data from developers to reroute data to different topics (understanding of NiFi is required)
Working primarily with institutional equities
Analysis of business needs (trading, regulatory, etc.) resulting in the creation of requirement
Build relationships and work with key stakeholders to quickly deliver value added solutions.
Produce conceptual interface designs through iterative wireframes, mock-ups, user flows, conceptual diagrams and provide detailed specifications to the development team
Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, perform under pressure, and change priorities as needed.

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills: 

5+ years’ experience in a relevant capacity as a technical BA
2+ years’ experience within capital markets data (trade lifecycle, securities, doing reconciliations, vendor management, equities post-trade processes, institutional equities, etc)

o in-depth knowledge of Capital Markets data analysis, data mapping, data publication/consumption and business

Understanding of how FIX Protocols work, professional experience in this realm
Strong data driven analysis knowledge, ability to write SQL queries
Seeking candidate with strong hands-on experience in at least two of the following (in order of preference): Kafka, NiFi, Elastic Search, and/or Kibana
SDLC, data/business analysis experience
Documentation skills (ability to produce conceptual interface designs through iterative wireframes, mock-ups, user flows, conceptual diagrams and provide detailed specifications to the development team)

Nice-To-Have Skills: 

Experience with other ETL tools to understand how flows work
Ability to work with third-party APIs, Postman, and other API/data tools.
Knowledge/experience with reporting tools/platforms such as Business Objects, Power BI, Excel Macros/Pivots, and other similar tools.
Hadoop/Big Data experience to analyze and help develop solutions
Vendor application and federated trading platforms experience with products such as Duco, Fidessa, Bloomberg, etc
Prior experience with Jira, Confluence, and ServiceNow.

Soft Skills: 

Great communication (verbal and written) required
Ability to prioritize, produce plans, and deliver on deadlines

Best vs Average: Ideal candidate would have in-depth data driven analysis experience and ability to communicate with stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. A candidate with previous Scotia experience within capital markets or middle office reconciliation experience would be able to adapt to the role quickest. Experience with the full lifecycle is useful (front/middle/back office). Understanding of stream processing is required to adapt to this role.
Degrees or certifications: 

Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required
Financial education (relevant courses, CSC, CFA…) will be considered as an asset.

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $80.00-$110.00 per hour

Title: Senior ITAM Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 154519  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Job Purpose

 This role is to support the Software Procurement & Asset Management team

 Key Accountabilities


 Assess, analyze, and report on software compliance
Track software compliance issue remediation & assist with the resolution
Maintain software license inventories & ensure all records are updated and complete
Review and analyze deployment/usage data to drive license cleanup & re-harvesting activities
Identify savings opportunities when managing renewals, software licensing, and services. Follow through with vendors to obtain identified savings.

Help drive & identify SAM initiatives and process improvements within the organization

Perform product rationalization analysis
Review and assess new/incremental software demand
Review acquisition requests & procure software licenses if required

Facilitate the business’ needs for ongoing technical support and upgrade protection by ensuring that all maintenance contracts are managed/handled/renewed in advance of their expiration
Manage software license financial treatments & work closely with internal teams to support internal charge backs & allocation processes
Assist with the maintenance of the software catalogue, ensuring completeness & accuracy
Understand & maintain software contract inventory and other relevant artifacts from suppliers
Assist in software contract negotiations by providing necessary data analytics around use cases, organizational demands, cost and licensing metrics
Collect and aggregate forecast data for the Bank to help drive financial planning and budgeting exercises
Manage relationships with external vendors & internal stakeholders to maximize value creation when managing software licensing, maintenance, and service offerings.
Review vendor proposals for accuracy and prepare analysis of findings and recommendations
Assist in the development, communication and presentation of ad hoc executive reports related to Bank’s software landscape


 Functional Competencies

Experience in Software or Hardware (Infrastructure, Servers, Machines) Asset Management
Advanced Knowledge of Information Technology
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical, research and problem-solving skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, or a related field Role Desirables
IT Asset Management and Discovery Tools experience
Experience interpreting licensing terms and conditions
Proficiency with excel and database software

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer- Analyst
Description:
JOB SUMMARY: Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics and Reporting, the BI Developer-Analyst is responsible for developing and maintaining BI solutions, including Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), reports, dashboards, and analytical solutions to support effective use of data by PHC clinical and non-clinical programs, Senior Leadership Team (SLT) and other key stakeholders. Responsibilities include dashboard development, database development and monitoring, data modeling, data dictionary development and maintenance, application development, documentation, maintenance of users and user permission, performing routine periodic processing activities related to key decision support applications, participating in the design, writing, production, and documentation of standard and ad hoc queries and reports, problem identification, analyzing healthcare data and communicating the findings through the use of data visualization and storytelling. The BI Developer-Analyst works closely with colleagues to audit, identify and follow-up on issues related to data quality, metric definitions or process deficiencies. The BI Developer-Analyst acts as a key interface between Data Analytics Leads, Solutions Architect and the Data Analytics (Decision Support) teams at our partner organizations, as well as the Information Management, Information Technology (IM/IT) departments to ensure the solutions meet the business requirements and the technical specifications and adhere to team standards. This role requires a strong foundation in analytical methods, data warehousing, data visualization and statistics. The position requires access to detailed and confidential information of all types (clinical, financial, payroll, etc.).
QUALIFICATIONS**: Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or related field plus a minimum of five (5) years’ recent, related experience with data modeling, data visualization and reporting tools (specifically, Tableau, SAP Crystal Reports, SSRS and Power BI), ETL, Microsoft BI tools (SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS), advanced T-SQL (Microsoft Transact SQL) and analyzing business requirements or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Significant recent experience is also required in the following:

business analysis and project management;
coordinating and documenting the change management process for complex information systems;
upgrading/migrating to SQL Server Platforms - SQL Server 2019;
writing T-SQL;
programming experience in C#, VB.net, Java, etc.

Skills & Abilities: 

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS.
Expert proficiency in Tableau and other Analytical and Reporting tools. Strong analytical/modeling skills with the ability to convert raw data into actionable business insights.
Demonstrated knowledge of OLAP technologies and dimensional modeling.
Strong background in data architecture, data quality, data mapping, and data structures.
Strong understanding of database and business intelligence concepts.
Proven ability to interpret data files and record layouts to map fields between multiple systems and database tables.
Work effectively in an ETL framework driven environment with proven ability to prepare, maintain and publish ETL documentation, including source-to-target mappings and business-driven transformation rules.
Strong understanding of business processes and transactional systems within the business domain.
Demonstrated ability to understand and prioritize user and business requirements, and to conceptualize information processing solutions in response to them, including analyze, scope and define work effort required to correct program deficiencies and problems.
Strong interpersonal relationship management skills, a team player with a client/user orientation.
Excellent oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex ideas/processes in simple terminology to internal and external stakeholders, including all levels of management.
Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills.
Demonstrated attention to detail and maintaining high quality standards.
Excellent organizational skills with proven ability to plan and execute complex projects.
Ability to work to independently, meeting deadlines under pressure, with minimal supervision and frequent interruptions.
Ability to teach, coach and mentor others.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.

Title: Fleet Analyst
Description:
The Fleet Analyst is responsible for the effective business operations within the Fleet & Equipment group. Responsibilities include: project management & coordination, drafting & updating of SOPs, vendor oversight, data gathering, data analysis, identifying gap/variance/trend, and reporting oversight. Additionally the role provides support to leaders in the day-to-day operations of the fleet services and wider OSS group as required.
· Knowledge of process re-engineering techniques
· Awareness of project management processes, principles and methodologies
· Fully proficient in use of MS Office, MS Project, Visio and other PM tools
· Creative, innovative, forward thinking, takes initiative
· Good understanding of business issues and challenges, specifically in a customer service environment
· Excellent analytical and business solution development skills, including the proven ability to function effectively in a dynamic environment
· Ability to develop statistical tracking methodologies to track performance and measurement against set standards of quality.
· Ability to develop dependable feedback systems and tracking
- Capital and/or Operations Planning. Assist in the management and coordination of the Fleet Asset program, supporting: the preparation of the annual fleet capital and/or operating budgets and long-range planning, gathering requirements for capital assets, external services, and associated programs, processing RFPs (submission, evaluation & selection), and ensuring on-time delivery. Respond to adjustments to capital and/or operational budgets by identifying departmental priorities and organizational needs. Coordinate fleet certification and fleet legislative compliance requirements; warranty and licensing of vehicles. Monitor and analyze the asset lifecycle process, including performance and maintenance of assets and systems.
- Program Management. Identify variances to plan and provide timely and accurate financial reporting associated with OSS programs and KPIs. Gather data to track & monitor program success and/or achievement of KPIs; identify and analyze variances to plan. Identify opportunities for improvement and provide recommendations to support management decision making. Develop business cases for improvement initiatives, supported by cost/benefit analysis, and research solutions in support of sustainable, efficient business practices. Assist in the preparation of annual budgets, provide qualitative & quantitative feedback to support annual estimates and forecasts.
- Process & Data Management. Assist in the identification, drafting, and revision of business processes. Manage the data related to capital planning and reporting and ensure department processes related to data, planning, and reporting are adhered to with rigor. Suggest and implement process & procedure enhancements to support the overall efficiency of the department.
Ad-hoc Support. Provide support in the effective daily operation of the OSS group.

Title: Logistics Analyst
Description:
LOGISTICS ANALYST

 Midland Transport Limited has become a leader in the transportation industry by providing superior quality service to our customers. Our services include LTL, T/L, Courier Services, and Third-Party Logistics/ Brokerage which provide the convenience of one-stop shipping. 
Working with the Systems and Innovations team, the Logistics Analyst will be responsible for delivering insights through a data-driven approach. Through the creation of dashboards and reports, you will help to identify areas for improvement and automate low-value manual tasks.

 An ideal candidate will:

Be inquisitive and believe in empowering colleagues to find new insights and solve interesting challenges.
Love data, analytics, and helping to create clarity for the business
Understand that tools and solutions must be designed to be intuitive and easy.
Have a strong sense of the potential for software automation to simplify manual processes, reduce error rates, and free up time for more high-value tasks.
Have a deep understanding of the software systems that supports supply chain, logistics, and BI


 
Qualifications:

Post-Secondary Education is required
Experience with Tableau, Power BI, or other visualization tools is an asset
Experience with TMS systems (Mercury Gate) considered an asset
Experience with SQL is considered an asset
Experience with MS Power platform, Teams, and Sharepoint and asset
Experience with Alteryx is an asset
Knowledge of the transportation industry is an asset


 
Key Responsibilities:

Maintain, Update, and Create tableau dashboards required by the business
Perform analysis, collaborate with operations teams, and offer suggestions for improvement.
Create process maps and documentation.
Identify process improvement opportunities and support the team through implementation.
